text: Many local Argentinians have recommended this place to me and said that it is the best in the city. It also just so happened that on the way to Jeni's, our uber driver also recommended it to us. I went in with friends, as a group of four.  We ordered the Medio Pollo al Limon and Lomo Relleno. The amount of food we anticipated was not even close to the amount that we got. We thought what we ordered would be a good amount of the four of us. The amount that we got could feed a small village. The Medio Pollo al Limon could have fed at least me and 2 other girlfriends. The lemon and chicken combination was delicious. It had just the right amount of tangyness that was present but still enjoyable. The Lomo Relleno was a tad overwhelming. The meat was cooked so perfectly. It was tender and flavor was present wherever your teeth sunk in. However, I must say that it was a bit too salty, and the mushrooms that were included in were extremely salty. We only finished half of the Lomo Relleno, and I took about a quarter of it home and ended up splitting it into 4 meals (I could only eat so much of it each meal).  This is definitely somewhere I would refer to as romantic. The lights are extremely dim and for the most part don't light your table. Candles brighten up your table, but can be sensitive for some eyes. At Tango Sur, the amount of food definitely matches up with the price you pay, if not more. Make sure you're super hungry, or that you're coming with a big group!

Was recommended here by our Uber driver, who's Argentinian. I came with a group of four, and we ordered the Medio Pollo al Limon and the Lomo Relleno. I'm not sure if it was because we weren't super hungry, or if we had just ate early, but these two plates were MORE than enough for the four of us. First off, the atmosphere in Tango Sur is ideal for dates, as it is very dark and each table has only one light provided by a candle. My friend and I blew out the candles because our eyes were starting to water, but the girls in our party were oddly not affected by it. When the food arrived, we had to use our phone's flashlights because we couldn't see what we we're eating, it just looked like a big steaming pile of darkness LOL.  The Lomo Relleno (42 dollars) is for two people, but it can honestly feed 3-4 people. The meat is very tender and chewy, and has enough juice to make it very flavorful. The only downside is that eating such a big portion as this dish can be tiring, and also gets to become too salty. There are strips of portobello mushroom on top, that make for a good side dish when your mouth is tired from chewing the meat. This dish is HUGE. The four of us only ended up eating half of it, and my girlfriend and I split the rest to take home. I had enough meat for two dinners!! The Medio Pollo al Limon (18 dollars) is also a pretty big dish, and could satisfy two people. I really like lemon/sour food so the chicken was very good. in my opinion. It also came with a side of potatoes that were also tasty and very soft.  For the price you pay, you get a tooooon of food, so be sure to really gauge how hungry you are before you and your friends each order an individual dish. Also, bring some goggles with you if your eyes be sensitive to things such as onions..and candle flames hehe.

This place was awesome!! Food was delicious! We had two appetizers which included an eggplant and the other was a provolone cheese dish. Both tasted amazing!! The bread was also great and nice and warm. For dinner I had the filet and it was cooked to perfection and the mashed potatoes included a nice flavor to then. Overall my family and I were very happy with this place and hope to return again before going back to NY. Our waiter Alfredo was great and provided suggestions and never made us wait always checking to see if we were okay.

I came on a Tuesday night with 2 friends. We had a reservation but it didn't seem necessary to be able to sit inside immediately. Our server was very nice and quick. We brought our own bottles of wine since it's BYOB. We started the meal with corn and ham and cheese empanadas and a provoleta. Both we very good. Only issue was the provoleta didn't come with more bread so we had to flag someone down to get more. We all shared the parrillada para dos which was steak, short ribs, chorizo, sausage, fried sweetbread and blood sausage. I am usually not a fan of blood sausage, but this one was very nice. The steak was great, as was the short ribs. The chorizo was fine. I'm not a fan of sweetbreads because of the chewy texture, but I heard they were good too. It came with salads on the side which were also nice. We all left very full and still had some leftover to take home, so our whole meal probably could have fed 4 adults. Pricing is reasonable for a steak place. Location is good too. It's very dark so it's a good place for a date.

First time try an argentinian grill and they didnt disappoint us. Service were nice we got EL Filet that very tender and juicy but too bad we were very full so we didnt try the ribeye but will try next time  TIPS : they also do BYOB
Terrible service, steaks were not cooked how we ordered them. The restaurant is overhyped, quality of meats is actually very average.
Seriously great food, HUGE portions, and great service. Love that its BYOB! only downfall is the wait...But that is to be expected when you have great food and great staff!
Large Portions, good service and it's BYOB. I would much rather skip a fancy steakhouse downtown and dine here instead. I had a great first time experience!

Omg!! I'd have to say easily one of my top 5 favorite restaurants in the city! The ambiance is dim, lively, and fun- perfect for a romantic date but also w a group of friends (ya, kinda contradicting statement but it works?!) I've ordered pretty much everything on the menu, the red meats are great, but my all time favorite are the sweet breads, all empanadas, and the pechuga de pollo! The portions are huge here and it's BYOB. I feel like for a steak house, it's very reasonable in terms of price, and the food quality is a 5/5. I can't wait to go back!!

I am from out of town and this place was recommended by a friend who used to live here as his favorite place in town by far. The empanadas are a must. The big filet and churrascuro were phenomenal as well.

Whether it is their amazing steaks, the atmosphere or that you BYOB Tango Sur is popular for a reason. They do not allow call aheads. Someone else mentioned a reservation, though I was not aware they accepted them. So either try a reservation or make sure you have the time to wait (and we wanted two hours on a Saturday night) because it is worth it. The staff is not good at estimating how long the wait will be. I suspect that this is due to diners lingering after the meal after having succeeded in scoring a table. The staff does not rush diners out the door either. There are several bars in the immediate area that are good so as long as you plan ahead and are not immediately hungry. You can also go buy a bottle of wine at their sister restaurant next door.  The patio is pleasant and the interior is dark, lite primarily by candles. It's a romantic and cozy atmosphere, though it can get a bit loud. The service is friendly, though a bit slow (again, make sure you have enough time as to not feel rushed). While Tango is a steak place they do offer other options. One in our group was not a red meat eater and ordered the half chicken. I was impressed how well they did chicken. Perfectly roasted and seasoned. My steak was amazing and cooked exactly to order. It came with mashed potatoes, and this is where I was disappointed. If you are going to do a great steak do not ignore the side. Others ordered sweet potatoes, steak fries and asparagus and all of these sides were very good. So stay away from the mashed and you'll be satisfied.

Talk about ruining a perfectly good Saturday night, as this was one of the worst dining experiences this foodie has endured. Arrived at 8 pm and left at 12:30 am. The host took our names down at 8 pm and informed us it would be close to 10pm but they were sure to get us in sooner. At 10:10 we inquired about the wait and were then told it would be 15 more minutes. We were eventually seated at 11pm. We had the antipasto for an appetizer and weren't totally impressed, but hard to screw up deli items. Then we had the Pariladas for Two (possibly misspelled). It came with a house salad, which resembled the ingredients & presentation of the toppings of a burger. The meats eventually came out and the presentation was outstanding, but unfortunately that was it. The sausage (chorizo) was fine but the rest was very fatty and chewy. It was so rough, I chipped a tooth while chewing. We did proceed cautiously to order dessert and ordered the cheesecake. It was actually very very good. If you want a dark cozy spot with a great vibe that is BYOB and you can hang out and clog tables however long you desire and could careless about food, then this is your place. The best part of the experience: going down to Grasslands and eating their breadstick appetizers as we were filling time during our long wait. Never again will we attempt to have another birthday meal or meal in general at this establishment.

Don't try to go here if you have any food allergies or sensitivities. I called ahead trying to make arrangements and they wouldn't consider making accommodations. Very disappointing that the chef wouldn't even offer a different solutions and the person on the phone really didn't seem to care to help accommodate.

Great date spot. All tables are candle lit and very romantic. Plus you will not leave this place hungry, all the steaks are massive and they even have dishes you can share. The chimichurri  is soooo dank as well. Also, BYOB which is a huge plus. Love this place have been multiple times and will keep coming back.

I love Argentinian steakhouses so one of the Restaurants i had bookmarked and coincidently my classmate and his wife also love so dinner it was. BYOB so thats cool. I was going to order the para dos, but changed my mind and did the uno what comes with it at least what came wth mine were pork sausage, grilled short ribs, flap meat, beef sweet bread, and blood sausage. Wait i just described the para dos maybe they were confused but thats what i got.  Verdict by meat category. They did put a small tin cup of chimchurri which i thought was pathetic i love gallons of chimichurri on my meat. Pork sausage-delicious Grilled Short ribs-Fatty and poor cut Flap meat- It was delicious  beef sweet bread- it was okay one of those things you will love it if you grew up eating it. Blood Sausage- Weird consistency, first time trying it (see my description of beef sweet bread).  Salad-after thought not good.  Service-non existent at least waiter.  Make reservations because it does get packed. I wont say i will run back here again, but i will try other Argentinian and Colombian steakhouses in Chicago before coming back. And no i wont order the para uno or dos again.

This place is so flippin great. Great price for the amount of food you get and the quality. BYOB so don't forget to bring a nice Marbec or other red! Waiters were all charming and a great mix between European and American style waiting! Very romantic for a 1st or 50th date!

I had many friends and family members recommend this place to me. I was taking my friends out for a birthday celebration and wanted to go to dinner before the show we were going to. I made the reservation 3 weeks in advance because I know it's busy. We waited 35 minutes to be seated for our reservation even though we told them we were on a time crunch. When we were seated I asked to see the manager and no one came by. Instead they sent us a complimentary appetizer but still no one said anything about our long wait. The best part of the restaurant was the food. We had the vacio which was delicious. Overall I was just very disappointed in the service and long wait and wish it would have been better. If it had better service then I would give it 5 stars.

Came here for dinner on a Tuesday night and it was packed! The ambience in this place is very loud, but date night at the same time. I had the boneless strip steak w potatoes. The steak was very large, but good flavor. The potatoes had a weird vinegar flavor that threw me off. The best part about this place is that is BYOB, so bring your wine and they'll open and pour it at the table for you. Overall a good dinner for a date night spot.
The food is delicious, the portions are huge and the service is fantastic.  Go! You'll love it.  If you don't love it, you don't have any taste buds.

Everything was Delicious and Juicy. I was able to taste every bit of my meal. My husband and I arrived and we had no trouble getting a table. Our server made us feel very comfortable with very good suggestions. Of course we will be back, and dont forget another awesome thing:  it is BYOB.

El filet was delicious. And HUGE. BYOB is great as well.  The ambience is reminiscent of my house after losing power in a hurricane or snow storm. That is to say it is dark and they use candles on the tables for light. Not a big fan of that. Also the AC appeared to be broken. Sweltering

I have been wanting to visit Tango Sur for so long, so I used my birthday as an opportunity to dine here. I was so sad that we didn't have such a great experience though. Upon arriving, we had to wait about 15 minutes even though we had a reservation. After finally seating, we ordered some appetizers and opened our bottle of wine that we brought- love the BYOB option!  We tried a spinach and cheese empanada and eggplant empanada, which were both delicious. We also shared the seafood salad, which was very light and refreshing. Our main course, however, took FOREVER....we had to ask the waiter where our food was it took over an hour! Finally when the food came, I immediately regretted getting the Lomo rare. It was basically like eating raw chewy beef. The other steak dishes were very deliciously cooked and seasoned though. We also brought an ice cream cake for my birthday that we had the restaurant store in the freezer. However, the waiter brought it out and left it sitting at the counter without giving it to us. By the time he brought it over, my cake had melted! I was devastated. We ate whatever ice cream soup was left and couldn't take it home. When the check arrived, we were also appalled that we were given a sharing fee! We were never warned of this, nor did the waiter even split our dishes or anything. Luckily, the manager took this charge off after we complained, but nevertheless I was left with a bad taste in my mouth...

This place has the best rib eye for the right price  Only down side is the darkness inside the room but the steak makes this place the best  Recently went there again with a reservation and the host was so rude and treated us with no respect even with a reservation Reserve for 6 @ 9:15 and got seats neatly around 9:50 pm  Others came late with the same time and they seated them first  Even so  I had a newborn with me and the host  didn't even care and let the group with girls go in first
I eat at Tang Sur at least once a month and I just love it.. the food and service are always great..  would give them more stars if I could. keep up the great food and service!!!

This is one of my favorite places to go in Chicago. It is a cool little rustic steakhouse without the outrageous bill at the end. BYOB!!!! Let's you splurge either the food. Entrees are shareable, but make for great leftovers. The steaks and meat are great AND the appetizers are fantastic too. I suggest starting with empanadas or the provaleta And then getting El Filet to split between 2.

The food: 4/5. We tried empanadas and half a chicken. Empanadas were good, not too heavy although the dough was a little thick for my taste. The chicken was a little dry, but the sauce was delicious.  The service: 4/5. The service was very friendly, but a little slow.  Overall: 4/5. Come to get your meat fix.

I wanted to show a close friend visiting from out of town a good time and boy did we have a good time at Tango Sur. We left the lady friends at home, loaded up a couple of bottles of wine and prayed that we wouldn't have gout flare ups after the awesome dinner we had here. It only took 15 minutes to grab a table on a Saturday night and the vibe was exactly to my liking. Crowds were feasting and dining over dim lit tables to the backdrop of Latin music and clinking of wine glasses. We started off with empanadas and went straight to the meats from there.  From the various proteins ordered that night the stars were the parrillada and lomo relleno. They were all cooked perfectly to our liking, and coincidentally paired very well with the wine we brought. It was actually this restaurant that inspired us to learn how to make chimichurri sauce at home. The filets with spinach mashed potatoes were also very delicious. I'm a big fan of Brazilian steakhouses but some of the AYCE establishments can be a bit overwhelming at times. Tango Sur allows you to order just the right amount for very reasonable prices, in a fantastic atmosphere perfect for a summer night out in the city.

Heavenly steak. I had such a taste for great steak, and of course thought of Tango Sur. Chicago has some big name places for steak...but if you want to have amazing steak, great quality, and service...go here. It is very romantic as well. We highly recommend the bife de chorizo. Super tender and flavorful. As a matter of fact, everything there is superb. A place that you must go to if you want amazing steak!

Romantic, dim but loud. I love it!  Reasonable prices, good portions and great atmosphere.  Food is amazing.  Be prepared to sit very close to other parties. The candlelit room is nice and cozy. Try not to be seated at the entrance part. See if they have any seats all the way inside.  2 thumbs up

My man brought me here on a most beautiful date!! He wouldn't let me know where we were going. He just advices me to get dressed. We had been shopping earlier today but i didn't think the outfits were for anything specifics. We parked about a block away. It wasent hard to find parking(but I think we got lucky). Arriving at the restaurant the ambiance is so beautiful! We were greeted by a waiter at the door. Who promptly seated us when he found out we had reservations. There was a wait outside the restaurant so please reserve a table! Day and a half ahead of schedule. I'm sure they ended up gettin seated but the wait was a little over a hour. CANDLE LIT DINNER!!! Dinner was amazing..... I'll finish my review in the morning getting a little distracted

This was a big disappointment. We went there for my boyfriend's birthday, with high expectations based on what we heard. First off, his seat was wet when we first sat down , we didn't notice because of the dark atmosphere so he had to sit through dinner with his pants soaked.  Server took 10-15mins to get back to us to take our order. That was still fine considering we weren't ready when he first came over. My bf got the fillet mignon, medium, and it "tasted like bubblegum", according to him. I tried a piece and it was indeed chewy like rubber. It looks like it's done right, medium like requested, but we just got a really subpar meat. I don't remember having a fillet mignon this bad. My Tbone veal was at least decent. I liked the spicy sauce that came with it. AFTER the busboy cleared our plates, we waited at least 20 minutes and the server never came back to offer us desserts or the check. We had to flag him down.  I thought it'll be a real treat for us to finally try this place on his birthday, but now we know it's not worth the hype. Sounds like the byob is what this place is known for which unfortunately we didn't utilize. Food was bad and service was bad
This is the best place for the summer. Great outdoor byob. Bring your favorite bottle of wine and friends and enjoy great reasonably priced steaks. A must try!

The place is really nice, very authentic. The food is delicious! The dishes are pretty big so is great for sharing! Not very expensive and you can bring your own alcohol which is great! Downside: we had to wait for an hour to get a table.

I love this place. Have been there quite a few times and it never disappoints. The food is amazing. Seriously good. And they aren't stingy with the portions either. I love that its BYOB, I usually take some wine. Its a very romantic restaurant and candlelit lighting is a plus. I have had birthday dinners here and special occasion dates. I will keep coming back, make sure to call and make a reservation. You will not be disappointed!

Amazing! You get so much bang for your buck here. When you order the El Filet you get 2 8 oz filets - enough for two. We always order a side of grilled asparagus and this time we got the French fries. Amazing!!!

Officially found my new favorite restaurant in Chicago! Went here for my brothers birthday due to recommendations by friends and it did not disappoint. I got the Pez - salmon in a mushroom cream sauce with asparagus. The best meal I've had in a very long time. My brother got the filet with spinach mashed potatoes and it was the best steak I've ever tried. It sliced like butter. Max was a great server! Will be returning soon!

A great place for great steaks with Argentine flavour and very reasonably priced, the portions are large and along with excellent taste are value for money, we did not have a reservation but managed to get a table although prior reservation is advisable.
This is my favorite Steakhouse in Chicago! If you want a great quality night out but do not want to spend a fortune, Tango Sur is for you. Also, BYOB is great for large groups :)
We had a group of 9 people for dinner. It was a wonderful meal for everyone. The food and the service were excellent with great ambiance. I will definitely return.

Overall: Despite its flaws, Tango Sur is a great option for a smaller steakhouse with some Argentinian flavor. The good: The steak is phenomenal, I loved every bite and couldn't finish the large portions. The steak was tender and the potatoes were seasoned perfectly. The empanadas and antipasto apps were also delicious. I tasted everyone else's meals as well, and they were all great. The vibe is rustic, casual, and welcoming. And, of course, BYOB. The bad: The service was not up to expectations. Our waiter didn't really have app recommendations. After ordering apps, he took a long time to come back to take our main order, and then our bill took a considerable amount of time. Live guitar music was a good idea, but it was far too loud (electronic hookup) and the guy wasn't fantastic. Atmosphere: 8/10 Service: 7/10 Food: 9/10

Ambience: We were seated outside which was nice on a sunny day in Chicago.  Food: Provoleta - 3.5/5 Beef Empanada - 5/5 Chicken Empanada - 2/5 Vacio - 3/5 Asado de Tira - 3/5 Both meat dishes were really chewy. Also, didn't care much for the vesuvio potatoes. El Filet - 5/5 Worth coming back for every time! Huge meat portions, barely touched the mashed potatoes. Flan with Dulce de Leche- 5/5 Amazing! Service: Sounded like they only do reservations for 6 or more people so ended up doing a walk in which was fine for early dinner around 6PM. It does start to pack up really fast after that, especially with large groups. Service was good overall. Verdict: 4 star restaurant, would definitely go back just for the El Filet, Beef Empanadas and the Flan.
So good!! Started with empanadas, yum! Then we had filets, so good!! Can't wait to come back.

Byob is always great! The food is beyond delicious here and very reasonably priced!  If you are looking for a great steak this is the place to go!  The empanadas are a must. Dessert is also great! If you go on a Saturday there is a 2 hour wait usually so be prepared.

Hands down the best steak for your $$ in Chicago! El Filet is to die for with the chimichurri! I also love their salmon with the mushroom sauce! The atmosphere is perfect, candle lit and BYOB, first place I bring my friends and family to and never disappoints. Worth the wait! And now thy have Bodega next store where you can have a drink while you wait, which is also awesome. LOVE Tango!!

This restaurant is one of my go to favorites in Chicagoland. The ambiance and music create an amazing vibe to eat and drink, with BYOB being a huge plus. The food is outstanding!!!! The portions are very large and delicious. I recommend this place to everyone

Let's just say we are a group from Buenos Aires and Texas, so our standards are a smidgen high for red meat! We rate this place as surprisingly fantastic. The quality of meat, authentic cuts, and various options were delicious. We ordered the vacio, and lomo relleno. Both were buttery, juicy, and had a great wine or garlic butter marinade. The chimichurri was just right - not too thick, not too light. A plus was that the place was BYOB which allows you to bring your fav wine to pair with your dinner! Service was also good. I would fly here just to come here.

My husband picked Tango sur after yelp searching for the best reasonably priced steakhouse and boy did he hit the nail on the head.   We had the melted cheese appetizer which was amazing but how could it not be.    We then had the special with stuffed steak and chimichurri with roasted sweet potatoes.     It was amazing.   Simple, delicious, fresh and great.     My only complaint is on a personal level and I would prefer bread with dinner and spreading bread on to dinner rolls.    The service was great and the mix of other diners was amazing.

I honestly do not understand how people could rate this anything besides a five star. This place is out of this world. I love you Tango Sur. My favorite dish to order here is the filet, and to split it. Nobody ever believes that it's enough food for two people with its $29 price tag. It is, I promise. If you're worried, try an appetizer, empanadas or antipasto. Yes, there will be a wait. Prepare yourself, delicious meats are waiting on the other end for you. It's also BYOB and they have an area in the back for waiting and it's stocked with wine glasses and bottle openers for you. The wait here does not bother me. I personally enjoy the atmosphere, I like it noisy. Everyone seems to be having a good time and enjoying the company of friends and family. It is dark, again I dig it, it adds to the whole experience. Also, I would bathe in the chimichurri. Everything 5 star. I also have to mention on time I was here, sitting next to a nice couple, seemed to be first date vibes by questions they were asking, slightly awkward vibes, etc. They were dressed very nicely, he was wearing a suit. All of a sudden I see my date looking at me and giving me the look over there look. As I look over the man has the full T-bone steak bone in his hands and is gnawing on this bone. So yeah, it's that good.

I have been to Tango Sur before but my experience last time was the best with Alfredo who made the best suggestions and was extremely attentive. I took my parents there for their anniversary. He suggested the Sweet Beef Empanadas which changed my life and the El Filet and the Costeleta and The T-bone steak. All of them were AMAZING!!!! Nothing tastes bad!! The music and atmosphere was really nice too. It's BYOB and there is a live guitarist that is ridiculously talented on Tuesday nights. Everyone is so friendly. I will definitely go back and bring friends!
This place was amazing! Best steak I've had and my uncle is a butcher! Everyone should come here to eat! But by the way it's byob!

It's been a while since last time being there, but the food is still delicious! Great service. Very accommodating despite being slam packed on Sunday. Byob. We were 6 people last Sunday and had a great time! Will return soon.
Best Churrasco I ever had! BYOB soma big plussss Service was really great and fast. Will comeback many times more def.

Hands down, Tango Sur has been one of my absolute favorites. The ambiance, the music, and on top of that, the food. It is a taste of heaven. The empanadas are so crispy outside and juicy inside. The El Filet was so tender and the spinach mashed potato was a great companion. Expect a ling wait though.

For the price, the food was simply amazing. It was like I was paying Olive Garden prices for Fogo de Chao food. Would even dare to say better! It was date night and the Mrs. Ordered the filet mignon and I had the salmon with a creamy white mushroom sauce atop grilled asparagus. The steak was cooked medium well - I am. It a fab if this- but wow it was great! So juicy! So tender! And the salmon was simply OMG!
Delicious every single time. Very reasonable priced and BYOB. Best bamg for your buck.  Great atmosphere and service! This place will not disappoint. Bone in ribeye is the best!

Don't bother with this steakhouse. There are far better ones out there with better customer service and experiences. Waiters are rude, impolite, and could care less about the quality of your experience at their restaurant.  They will purposely sit larger parties ahead of couples to boost their tips.  GO TO 90 MILES INSTEAD. 1,000X Better food and experience than this poor excuse for south american cuisine

Visted first time for bday dinner. Made reservations for 8 people.  Reservations are a good idea regardless of occasion. This place was a full house. They have outside seating which is cute during the warm season. All male staff with a vintage Argentine/Spanish feel to it. Happy medium place in terms of dress attire and price. You can either make this a dress date night or a more casual date night. No complaints for our waiter. We asked a couple questions regarding the food and he was helpful however I wish I would have asked more.  Tips:  1. It is VERY noisy.  2. Extreme dim lights. I'm a huge fan of dim lights but Tango Sur had them just a tad too dim.  3. BYOB - My guest were a little disappointed I didn't inform them. I basically didn't really clearly see this. Lacked advertisement of BYOB.   4. Depending on your plate and appetite make sure you ask or read menu carefully. I made the mistake of not ordering a "side" dish. We ordered an empanada which is a smaller empanada but tasted amazing! Our main meal was the parillada for 2 which is ONLY meat. Most plates come with a small side salad but I had an appetite and should have ordered a side of veggies or potatoes. The meat was great however It was a tad too salty. I am a pink Himalayan salt consumer and the meat left my lips/mouth tingly, dry & dehydrated, holding onto water for a couple day's (bodybuilder & health nut problems) lol. They also serve awesome bread that was nice & warm & fresh with butter!  5. When I called to make reservations I was a little bummed they didn't question an occasion for reservation. Many places will ask, and give a small dessert for certain occasions.

Great food! I'd suggest sitting outside. It's less noisy and brighter. I got the raviolo which I'd suggest but my friend's Medio Pollo con Limon was absolutely delicious and divine. I teared up when I ate some it was so beautiful.  However, the service was rather slow.

Loved everything about my experience at tango sur! Definitely was a highlight of my trip to Chicago! Came here for dinner cause my boyfriend and I were craving some steak and our meal did not disappoint. We had the empanadas to start and they were so perfect. So flavorful and not too salty! And the pastry encasing the fillings were the perfect crunchy texture. I wish we could've tried all the different kinds they had on the menu but the beef and chicken ones were delicious. We ordered the el filet and the costeleta for our main course and they are SUPER generous with their servings. I mean, we could have easily ordered just one of the dishes and we'd still leave with happy tummies! Tango sur knows how to cook their meats, I haven't had such a perfectly cooked steak in a looonngg time and the mashed potatoes that came as a side were on point. As delicious as the food was, there was no way we could've finished everything but that just meant we had leftovers to look forward to the next day :)  Not only did I love the food, but I loved how it was a candlelit dinner. Like the restaurant is basically only lit by the candles on everyone's table, so it was a very intimate setting. And the servers were all so nice and attentive! They made sure to go through the most popular items on the menu and really helped us narrow down our choices. Definitely returning during my next visit to Chicago!

After rudely being told by the manager that our table was needed (a.k.a, leave), I will never return to this restaurant.  After recently spending 2 weeks in Buenos Aires, this is not how a true Argentinian establishment would treat you.  Don Julio in the neighborhood of Palermo allowed FOUR of us to sit and dine for 4 hours with no issues.  We had a party of 12 at Tango Sur...big difference.  So if you are like me and plan ahead by making a reservation to enjoy your Friday evening without being rushed this is NOT the place dine.

Tango Sur feels super authentic--I felt like I was in a restaurant in Argentina. I walked in and was immediately in awe from the ambiance. The place is super dark because the only light comes from the candle on your table. You can really only see the person in front of you and the person next to you. It's incredibly cozy, intimate, and romantic.  The food was delicious. We started with the prosciutto wrapped hearts of palm and the melted cheese and peppers. All entrees are served with a small house salad. I had the filet as my entree... This baby was HUGE. I have never seen a filet that large--it was easily at least 12 ounces. It was a little undercooked, but I didn't even mind because it was that good. They serve it with some sort of garlic herb spread on the side. Use all of it! It adds so much flavor.
Great spot - service is friendly, steaks are massive (seriously the filet and the strips we ordered were all 3-4 inches thick) and its BYOB. Will definitely be back.

Bring your own wine! Got the parrillada para uno (i was alone).  Amazing atmosphere, lights were a little too dark but amazingly, nobody was on their phone. Refreshing.  Phenomenal quantity. Had a steak, a strip of short rib, blood sausage, pork sausage, chicken, pork. All this for 26$!!

This is a great little restaurant. I went here for a late lunch/ early dinner one day, so it wasn't too busy yet. The service was great and so was the food. It's a little pricey, but the servings were big enough to have leftovers. A big plus, is that it's byob!

This is hands down my favorite restaurant in the city. The filet is a giant portion, two huge filets and the spinach mashed potatoes are terrific with the red wine reduction. You'll have plenty of food to take home. The fact that this place is BYOB is amazing. There's a Jewel down the street which makes  it easy to stop in and pick up a bottle of wine on your way to Tango Sur. Great place, will be back soon.
Did not have a reservation but was able to get a table on a Saturday night.  Portions are enormous and prices are super reasonable. Will definitely return
Fantastic place, amazing service and menu.  Reservation is a must, fairly popular spot. Intimate for dates.

We made a reservation for 11 people last week Saturday. I ordered the El Filet which comes with 2 steaks. I ordered them medium and they were cooked perfectly. They come with spinach mashed potatoes which are also very good. I really like the warm bread they serve before your meal. The salad is nothing special. It is a big meal and had left overs the following day which was just as good. The place is a byob and you can drink in the waiting room which can get packed. As long as you can have a drink while waiting I am fine. We did not have to wait long and had plenty of time to enjoy our food and company. The service is outstanding every time we come here. The place is very busy and loud as a result. We come here once a year and usually with a bigger crowd. This is probably one of the best steak houses around! The parking is always difficult as it is a popular area so plan on arriving a little earlier.

First time here. Brought the kids too. Ordered beef empanada, baked provolone, bone in rib eye, filet mignon and gnocchi with alfredo. Food was spectacular! Service was excellent! 5 stars for food. Byob is a big plus. Took off 1 star for only having 1 shared restroom! But will still come back the next time we want a great steak dinner.

I really like this place. More for the experience than for the steak itself. It's dim, romantic and byob. It has amazing service. They don't rush you at all, even though it's always busy. The chimichurri sauce would make anything taste incredible. You get yummy bread and chimichurri upon arrival. The ham and cheese empanada is my favorite thing on the menu. The steak itself I find flavorful but chewy. I've had several different cuts and none were tender.

I love this place!  I usually go here for my birthday celebration with a group of friends and the staff and servers have always been great.  I usually get the el filet, which is seasoned nicely.  Other friends have gotten seafood and they really liked it too.  The place is dark, so make sure to bring the cell phone so you can read the menu.  The place can get noisy too, probably due to a lot of large parties and BYOB.  They only take reservations for larger groups, so I am not sure about wait times for walk ins.  My suggestion would make some plans with friends, get a reservation, bring some great red wine and enjoy!

Went on a Saturday night and the place was packed to the brim. Had we not had a reservation it would be a 2 1/2 hour wait  but they offer reservations for six or more only so maybe going with the gang is the move.  The empanadas were decent the salad was average in my opinion but when it came to the fillet I ate it was absolutely remarkable.  Cooked to perfection and add a sub $30 price point combined with the fact that we were drinking our own wine really made this an incredible experience. Quality of a $500 bill for 150 bucks for the table.

Make sure you call for reservations. This place gets packed. The food here is amazing. I always come here when I drop in to Chicago for a visit. It's byob. Bring lots of friends and wine and enjoy the great environment and the food! Depending on how much you eat, the para uno is usually good for 3 people :)

This is by far my favirite BYOB steak place in the city of chicago so it pains me to write this review.  I visited the restaurant tonight, and had a reservation for 7:30pm for my one year anniversary dinner.  I arrived to the restaurant at 7:15, and spoke with the doorman who told me it's going to be a "little bit" before we get our seat and i asked if we had time to get a drink at the bar next door.  The doorman said yes, so we go next door for a drink and come back at 7:45, 15 minutes after my reservation time.  We walk to the front of the line to ask how much longer it will be and we were told we likely won't be seated till 8:30, an hour after my actual reservation time.  Totally unacceptable from a customer service standpoint and I'm so disappointed.  I will unfortunately never be back.  :. (

Really disappointed with my last visit. I've been a client for over 5 years. Seen their business grow with time and as a Latina I was truly impress with their out come but my last visit was from begging to end bad. We arrived at 7:30, were told we would be called at 9:00. We visited other business in the area to kill time. At 8:30 we called to follow up, they said 9:30. Now is 9:35 and no call so we called them and  they told us to head back to the restaurant so we did. Get there, they sit us in the waiting area, still not ready for us. 9:50 we get a table on a corner completely trapped by a party of 10. Our waiter approach,we ask for a bucket to place our wine and he completely forgot  about us. We had to ask another waiter to see what's taking so long. At this time the put a bunch of obnoxious ladies next to our table and they served them first and a lot faster.  I could see the manager looking at us and never once check to see if we were ok. Once the  food came, we've has enough. I walked over to the manager/host and asked if he can locate our waiter so that he can wrap our food to go. Never once did he ask why or how was your dinner. I have to say the have really forgot the rule of this game keep customer happy. They have no way of tracking wait time and they tell you  one hour and it becomes 3. It was never like that.

Tango Sur, an Argentinian steak house in Chicago, came highly recommended by several people. Of course I had to check it out. Unfortunately, I am not a huge fan. If you're vegetarian don't bother. The only items worth trying are their selection of meats. I am a huge carnivore so I was very excited, then sadly disappointed. Too loud, too cramped, not friendly, rushed and  the meats were alright. The tripe was surprisingly good, very tender and buttery. Never thought I'd enjoy that. I will say that the dim lighting was nice and the music was excilent.

Yeah, you'll most likely wait beyond the reservation you made, but it's worth it.  Plenty of bars and shops around to take your attention until you have a fantastic candlelit dinner with a BYOB approach that doesn't add on a corking fee. I did the filet mignon and they know how to cook a steak.  Not only that, but you get TWO steaks.  The spinach mashed potatoes are delightful too.  You will not be able to finish this, and you'll just look forward to eating the leftovers at home.  Sadly, I could not since I was visiting out of town.   Enjoy!

I discovered this gem in 2006, I wish I'd find it sooner. The service, food and ambiance made this place magical. Busy as it can be the wait is irrelevant. Having to squeeze yourself around chairs jackets and people you finally walk up to your tiny little space. Candlelight setting is what my Dr. Recommended. We sit only to find ourselves in the most intimate bubble of spaces. The cosmos conspire to make sure every single morsel, drink and conversation never gets lost in translation. A must Appetizer:Provoleta Parrilla :vacío/ entraña/ Churrasco and finally  the famous decadent flan.
This place rocks. The food was delicious, definitely going beck. The service was excellent

I finally came here yesterday.  A couple friends have recommended this place for a while. I brought a friend for his birthday. we waited in the back for our table for approximately eight minutes,  meanwhile we waited we opened up our bottle, poured two glasses, we were seated promptly and ordered within five minutes. It's BYOB so we brought up Pinot Noir. We got the empanada's and a filet mignon as well as another cut but I don't remember which. Service was pretty good it's candle lit which made it perfect for my date. I kind of regret not having told that we were celebrating a birthday, maybe we could've gotten a slice of cake.

Great food. Huge streaks at an unbelievable price. Jose, our waiter was fantastic. Attentive, but not intrusive. Every member of the staff who dealt with us was polite and pleasant. The fact that it us BYO is a plus. Only downsides were that it's loud, tables are small and close together and if you don't get there early, you'll be waiting.  As far as noise level and small tables go, this isn't really a "linger all evening" kind of place. It's fun, energetic and you'll have a wonderful meal.

Intimate atmosphere, great music, and loved the food. The meal comes with a complimentary salad and bread. My reservation didn't get recorded, however, they still got us seated in less than 10 minutes. Definitely recommend getting dessert! Perfect date.

The filet is the best.  Its huge as well so plan on saving some for later.  The baked cheese is great for a starter.  the staff here is always real friendly and accommodating.  There is typically a wait, but if you are willing to eat early, before 5:30, or late you can probably avoid it.  It's also BYOB, so plan ahead.

This has to be one of The worst places that I have ever been to. This place is a living, breathing joke that has people fooled into thinking that its some place that has great service and great food. Two friends and I went around 7:30pm on a Friday night, was told it would be about an hour and a half wait and that we could grab drinks at the place next door (that they own as well). We came back and waited and we went inside as it started getting cold. The long-haired waiter with some low-grade Mary J. Blige bob-cut asked us--two African American males and one Middle Eastern male--to wait outside but didn't ask the three straight Caucasian patrons to wait outside. He remarked that if we didn't wait outside, he'd have to call his manager. However, when he finally did ask the other three to wait outside, they refused and he said to them that he didn't want to call the manager to cause a scene and ruin everyone else's experience. When I asked him why he didn't make the other three wait outside, he remarked again about not wanting to cause a scene. When I pointed out the perception that he asked us to wait outside vs. them (even though our names were on the last way before theirs were), he said he "understood" and apologized and and I said, "No, you don't understand. You're basically asking US, who were here first, to wait outside and you're letting THEM wait inside because you feel THEY would cause a scene vs. three who were here first and haven't said a word except say thank you when our phone numbers were taken." Minus the God-awful service given to customers at this restaurant, the food wasn't anything to write home about. The strip steak I had was huge but it wasn't like some heavenly moment where you close your eyes and say, "Omg." It. WAS. NOT. THAT. GREAT. So next to the racial discrimination by the host, the food was decent. There wasn't anything about the food or service inside that made any of us confirm why is this place so popular. There are TONS of restaurants in the city of Chicago. People are better off going to McDonald's, Chipotle, Wendy's or the Dairy Queen around the corner from this place and getting a better experience than this joke of a steakhouse. The really sad part is that they'll read this review and shrug it off because they're so popular (for whatever reason)--they would not give one flying f.... about how their customers are treated. I wouldn't send my worst enemy to this place. Save your time, save your money and go somewhere else; or better yet, have your own dinner party and cook yourself because it sure as hell will win Top Shelf over this poor joke of a crap house any day.

Absolutely amazing experience. Small joint with a lot of Latin flare. Very quaint and intimate setting. The lighting was a little too dim for my taste but it made it feel very romantic. Food was delicious. Will def be back when I'm in Chicago.

I have only been here twice but both times amazing experiences! Be aware it does get busy after 7. I went here at 6 and was seated right away and the service was great! I ordered the churrasco which comes with potatoes and a side salad. Amazing quality of steak for a really great price!

The 5 stars are for the food, mainly the steak. It's honestly one of my favorite steak houses, even though it's a pain making reservations and actually getting seated on time over there. I would come here more often, if they were less busy and they actually knew how to seat people. They just need to work on improving that, otherwise they're going to continue receding negative reviews for their seating method.

I'm really disappointed with Tango Sur. I had a reservation at 7pm for 15  and parking is a really big issue. We kept circulating the streets to find a nearby parking and nothing. We had to park in a public parking space and paid $16 for it. Valet parking would be convenient in this location. We ended up leaving because we did not feel welcome as we walked in. Don't know the person's name but he looked like the manager. He was standing in the host station and i believe he was Caucasian. He immediately scolded at my arrival and said that he needed my table at 9pm for another reservation. I let him know that parking is an issue and my guest would be here at any moment. He seemed flustered at said that they needed to be here in the next few minutes. He said to go stand in the corner by the door and wait. Not only i felt rushed but I felt unwelcomed. Disappointment is the word for this place. I wanted to celebrate my husband's birthday and this place went sour in 1 minute. It doesn't matter if the place has delicious food. Good service starts at the door and it ends when we leave. We will not be coming back.

We got there on Saturday  at 430pm and was almost empty no reservation. When we left at 6pm was getting busy. First of all it's BYOB we got two bottles of wine. We had empanadas as appetizer, good size and tasty. I had fillet mignon and my husband tbone streak. Hands down Tbone wins. Both meats very  tender and well spiced. Staff very Friendly and helpful. Had a very nice experience and food was delicious.

Tango Sur delivered again with good food and service. This is third time going and it was Presidents' Day and not too crowded. We tried the stuffed lomo which was delicious. We were seated right away. I still recommend this Argentinian steakhouse and please make reservations because it usually is busy.

Before I rave about the food, BE WARNED: This place is ALWAYS busy, and even if you make a reservation (as we did, weeks in advance for our Valentine's day reservation), you will likely have to wait for your table for upwards of 30 minutes to an hour.  If you are the kind of patron who can't stand this amount of waiting, this may not be the place for you. If you can stomach the waiting, IT IS WORTH IT.  Honestly, the wait time is the only reason this review is for 4 stars instead of 5 for me.  We ordered the fried cheese appetizer (excellent, if cheese is your thing, and it is absolutely my thing) and split the Para Dos as an entree, which is a collection of different sausages and other meats that arrives at your place still sizzling and smells as good as it tastes. For meat lovers, this dish is heaven. It is designed to be split between two people, and if you're moderately hungry, is the perfect amounts. There is a salad course that comes before the meat, which is nothing special, but you don't go to an Argentine steakhouse to eat salad. The restaurant is dark, candle lit, romantic, and has a distinct Argentine influence that is evident in the decor and music.  While getting into the restaurant and dealing with the front door staff could have been more pleasant, I will say that the wait staff inside the restaurant were all friendly, efficient, and professional.  My top three tips: 1) This place is BYOB, no corkage fee! If you're worried about not finishing what you bring, don't worry, they'll re-cork for you. 2) Be vigilant and patient when waiting for your table.  Continue to ask the host about your reservation/status of your table and make sure he remembers your name and the number in your party. You will eventually be seated, but you can expedite the process by keeping your party in the front of his mind. 3) Order beef, it's their specialty!

I have now been to this restaurant 3 times and it gets better and better every time. The ham and cheese empanadas are amazing and the fact that you can get them next store at the market is awesome! I love the fact that it's BYOB! El Filet is my favorite dish and those mashed potatoes are to die for. But my favorite thing has to be the atmosphere! Yes, it is loud, but you can't go wrong coming here for a first date or with close friends!

I had a very unfortunate experience here last week. We made reservations for 2/14/2017 on Valentine's Day about 3 weeks in advance for 9pm. When the 14th came, we called at 6pm to confirm the reservations and we were told everything was good to go. When we arrived at 9pm, it was a much different story. We were told by the host there were no available tables, and even if we had a reservation we would have to wait in line outside. We weren't the only ones who didn't have their reservation times honored, there were at least 20 other people waiting outside for their reserved tables. This would have been excusable considering the busy Valentine's Day evening, however, the host was very detached, unconcerned and rude when speaking with us and the other guests outside. We told him we had a reservation at 9pm and he said he would check on it for us, but then did nothing and continued staring at the line outside. When we asked him the approximate wait time, he said " We're dealing with a situation right now and we'll let you know."  For one of the most well known Argentinean restaurants of Chicago, this level of service is embarrassing and casts a very poor light on the rest of the staff and the restaurant as a whole. The host needs to have some serious training on working with guests, otherwise I'm sure there are other hosts who would love to have his job.
Amazing selection! The empanadas are beyond amazing and the atmosphere perfection! My waiter was extremely helpful and took very good care of us.
I loved the empanadas and meat, but avoid this place if it is too cold, they dont have place to wait in.

Second consecutive Valentine's Day they lost my debit card after running my check. And second consecutive Valentine's Day they acted like it was no big deal.  Of course I had to cancel it, they seemed to think it's ok for me to just wait it out crossing my fingers that no one found it and tried to use it. Both times they found it and called me back trying to have me pick it up or mail it to me. And that was about it. Such a huge inconvenience to me with not even an apology from them. How does this happen so often? Why is it treated so casually? I have been going here for 10 years and the food is great. But I will never be back.

They lie about how long it will take to get you seated. Literally got there when they told us to come (9PM) and we had to wait an extra half hour basically. They have some poor white dude making excuses why he can't let people in. My girlfriend called probably 5-10 times and we finally got seated. Keep calling you'll get seated. Chicken empanadas was bomb. Got the flat steak which was bomb as well. Could have used a little more seasoning but overall food was good. We brought a bottle of wine so that was clutch.

I'm very disappointed. I made a reservation for Valentine's day 4 weeks in advance and called to check the time of my reservation. After trying to find my reservation by my name or phone number I got told there was no reservation. I ask for a manager who checked again and after a while just told me the same and said if I would come at 6 pm I might eventually have a chance to get a table without waiting too long. I'm very unhappy. Very unprofessional response from the manager.

Love this place! One of the best Latin steak houses I've been to with very decent prices! Came here with my boyfriend and we both ordered our own steak dinners - I order the fillet dinner which actually came with 2 fillets! Not sure if that was an accident or not but I got that for the price of about $30 which was great especially since it was cooked exactly how I wanted. The chimichurri sauce is AMAZING - one of the best I've ever had! This place is also BYOB which is nice - they also have another place right next door called Bodega Sur which also has their own menu, but apparently you can go in there to grab a bottle of wine to bring into Tango Sur. We didn't do this because we were unaware, but next time we are going to make sure we bring in our own wine!  Only downside is that it is pretty tight inside so we were basically having dinner with other couples as they were only about inches from our table, and the only sources of light are candles which I guess is pretty cool and probably saves them money on the electric bill. Will definitely come back here!

I was able to check this place out a few weeks ago for dinner for a friend's bachelorette party. It was great because it was BYOB so we brought bottles of wine and some beer. I don't even think they have a corking fee! The place itself is super dark - intimate and romantic if you're on a date; but otherwise, it's kind of annoying. I had to use to flashlight on my phone to read the menu properly.  To start, we ordered some empanadas. I had the spinach and cheese one and it was delicious! I loved the chimichurri sauce that came with it! The people at the table that tried the other fillings also enjoyed theirs! I ordered the eggplant dish "with the delicious tomato sauce" - it literally says that on the menu. The dish did NOT disappoint- the sauce was AMAZING and the dish overall was delicious!  Apparently, we had the table for 2 hours? We were reminded of that a few times. However, by the time we ordered and got our food, there was no way we would be done by the time our table had to be emptied. Luckily, they didn't kick us out or anything and allowed us to finish our meals.  Our table had plates of butter on it and other tables had bread baskets so I asked if we could get some bread. One of the guys came and placed a basket of TWO rolls on our table... our table had 8 people. Overall, the food was great.. the atmosphere was intimate... the space was too dark for my liking.. and the service was ok. Love that it's BYOB!

Tango Sur is my favorite steak house in Chicago- realize not your traditional steak house, but so much better and less pretentious.  When we go is always a planned event- since they don't take reservations we make sure our days schedule allows for an early dinner.  If you're there before 6 there's rarely a wait- sorry everyone we're likely that couple taking our time when you want our table.   The food is always well prepared and i just can't get enough of the chimichurri sauce.  Also the empanadas are delish.  Added plus- they sell the empanadas next store at the market!

Went there last night.  Waited 3 hours and we had a reservation!   Staff was so rude and could care less that we had to wait.  Wish I had read the reviews before we wasted an evening.  Food was marginal.  Over cooked meat.  How can younot cook meat correctly when its your specialty.  But the worst part was the cockroach in the bathroom!!!! If its in the bathroom its in the kitchen.  I wanted to puke

The wait at this place is HORRIBLE. I've never been treated this way before, twice now. I have waited 2+ hours at this place, twice now; and I arrived at 5:30pm (when they told me to get there). I have never gotten a call from them and was guaranteed a call. I am disgusted and will never ever return. It is not worth the wait, no way!!!! Save yourself the stress.
Great food. Great meat platter. Like the candle light everrywhere. Lots of chatter especially in the back room. Romantic environment but noisy.

If I could give it 0 stars I would. This place is not worth the harassment. My friend made a reservation over week ago for 6 people. We went to the restaurant tonight and were told "we don't take reservations." ARE YOU KIDDING ME? How do you lie and say that to us after she talked to someone on the phone who took our reservations. The guy at the door was extremely rude and would not even let you into the building. He basically treated us like we were animals. When asked to talk to the manager , he came with a piece of paper and said your name is not on the list. WHAT? The manager was very arrogant and would not listen and honor our reservation. I have dined out at many restaurants around this wonderful city and have never been treated this way. This place is garbage! DO NOT GO HERE!
This is my favorite place in Chicago! Romantic atmosphere and delicious meat for unbelievable price! (:

GET THE FILET! I have always been a rib eye gal and ordered that, which was also amahzing but when I tried my friend's filet I immediately wished I had gotten that instead! That's ok because we are most definitely coming back so I will order that next. Also, ask for the oil with your bread. Our server, Daniel, made our evening special. After we introduced ourselves to him he continued to address us by our names and every other server/helper kept our waters filled and always checked on us. Service is impeccable. The prices to me were ok too. Not too expensive and the quality of food here is 100 stars. I'm glad that we were introduced to this restaurant by our close friends. BYOB too which I think makes it more reasonable in price. We brought over a few wine bottles and they happily opened them for us and provided the glassware. Daniel also treated us to their caramel flan and it was heavenly. Can't wait to go back!

The restaurant has great ambiance and live guitar music. It should be 5 star restaurant but they need to work on consistently delivering quality food. The menu is excellent and the food is excellent, however an entire dining experience can be impacted if even one entree fails to meet that standard.  Although the majority of the entrees were flawless the veal was very very dry and definitely did not meet the 5 star standard. For this restaurant to get a better than 3 star rating they need to ensure that all entrees meet a 5 star standard. Always strive to be exceptional and settle for nothing less.

We went to Tango Sur for my friend's 25th on a Saturday night. We got there at 6:20PM and was told there was a 2 hour wait. They did call us right at 8:20PM but lead us to the waiting room for us to wait another half an hour, at least. At the waiting room, they have wine glasses to start your wine (BYOB) but the additional wait was annoying.  BUUUUT the food was worth the wait. May be we were too hungry at that point. We ordered 3 empanadas (pork, chicken and spinach&cheese) as an appetizer. I definitely recommend the meat empanadas as it has more flavor as opposed to the spinach and cheese. We also ordered a salad and parrillada para dos. For three, the food was more than enough and we took the rest home.  The rooms are dark and feel small with tables crammed in. It is LOUD so I don't recommend children or babies (even infants who slept through everything -- there might not be as much space for car seat) Our server was very nice (he was adorable lol).  Otherwise I would definitely come again with my husband for a date night on a weekday to avoid the long wait.

This is our go-to place whenever we're looking for a night out of have out of town guests.  Everyone who we've ever taken there demands to go back!  Yes, the wait can be long but make a night out of it by going to Guthries nearby to play board games and have a few drinks while you wait.  Can't beat Tango's food, prices and BYOB!

I have been to Folklore prior to trying Tango Sur. (Both argentine steakhouses with same owners) so I did some comparing. Both have high quality steaks and give you more than you can eat. I end up taking a steak home for leftovers.  I love how it is dark and candle-lit- very romantic and feels like you are really in Argentina. Tango Sur is BYOB and is good for special occasions or dates. Another good menu item is the green potatoes which come with many of the steaks. I recommend trying if you love steak or have a big appetite. OR if you miss Argentina :)

To preface: we waited THREE HOURS after putting our name in at 7pm on Saturday. i have been to tango sur several times before and loved it but tonight i was so embarrassed to have suggested it. i loved it previously so much that i tell people who are visiting and/or have a special occasion that this should be what they choose. tonight i went and i, in addition to the 4 other repeat customers in attendance, were shocked at the poor quality of the meat. at first we thought the cooking directions were off,  but then we realized we were entirely mislead by the cuts of meat. the "filet" is an eye round at best, the rib eye was as tough as any standard rump roast. we had 3 napkins full of chewed and spit out meat. WE WAITED 3 HOURS! we were so hungry; we would not have chosen not to eat on principle. we were not brought our appetizer, we voiced our issue with the texture and temperature of what we ordered and were continually asked "well what do you want to do?" ultimately, we were given half off our meal, but it is already affordable, so that's not what we cared about. we wanted our time back; the buildup and anticipation of a great eatery that hugely underdelivered when we could have spent our time elsewhere that isn't complacent with their four stars or confusing being busy with being good. it will catch up with them if they are not careful.   Tango Sur- we are not stupid; a lot of people cook their own beef and know a filet when they see one. you are not serving premium cuts of beef to your after 10pm crowd on Saturday's. if i am misguided, your waitstaff had every chance to prove me wrong, but they just held a flashlight to my meat and debated me. i am genuinely disappointed to have lost my favorite 'special occasion' place.

Food is good but the service is terrible - my fiancee and I turned up a few hours early and put our name in, as it's the protocol at Tango Sur. We were told our table would be ready at 8:20 so grabbed a drink at a nearby bar and returned back on schedule. The host told us they were running "a few minutes late" and would seat us shortly. An hour later, we still weren't seated, despite multiple questions as to why they were running so far behind schedule. Every request for an update was met with "you're next in line, you'll be seated in 2 minutes". Eventually we were given our seats. Our entrees arrived at 10:30pm, 2 hours and 10 minutes after our initially reservation.  If you want decent food at BYOB prices, go here. But be prepared to wait a very a long time.

THIS PLACE.  My friends and I came here for a birthday and made a reservation for 8pm, I believe, needless to say we were not sat until around 10p, which was fine, we're all adults so we just went to a bar close by for a couple drinks.  They did not rush the service either even though they close at 11pm. Just as a tip. Our server was fun, extremely knowledgeable and made fantastic recommendations. The atmosphere is so quaint and romantic, really feels like a great urban restaurant the way you're packed into there getting bumped a little when people get up, so be ready for that, but that makes it more fun and much more intimate. The table next to us passed us a bottle of vodka that they had received from another table, and insisted we take a shot as they had, just to give you an idea of the friendly vibe.  Anyway, enough about that, on to the amazing food.  We had empanadas (I could eat 100 of them) and each got a different type of steak, I tried most of them and they were all the best steaks I've ever tasted. The medium rare was cooked perfectly and melted in your mouth.  All the sauces were rich and flavorful, the potatoes divine, and it's BYOB like COME ON, you can wake me up now! I recommend it to anyone looking for a great steak.
I love this place! Their new tapas place a couple doors down is equally good as well!

We were so excited to try this place out on Saturday night. We got there at 6pm and were told it would be a 1 hour wait. They take your phone number and call you when your table is ready.  We were willing to wait an hour so we walked down the street to grab a drink at Toons and watch some football. An hour goes by...two hours go by. Every time I went in to ask the host how much longer I was told it would be another 15 minutes. This game went on for the whole second hour we waited. Why not just tell us it would be a 2 hour wait when we first put our name? Let us make a decision on whether we want to wait or not.  Two hours and fifteen minutes later and we were finally seated at our table. The food we had was great. You get so much of it for the price too! The two of us shared empanadas and the fried cheese app. We then each got the el filet as our entree. BYOB was a nice touch as well. We were having a fabulous time until we got the check. We wanted to finish our bottle of wine and were told that we needed to leave so they could turnover the table. Never in my 10 years of Chicago dining experiences have I ever had or seen this happen.  This place obviously puts an effort into making the ambiance of this place special but what is the point if you don't let your guests enjoy it. While the food here is good, it's absolutely not worth a 2 hour wait. And then to rush us out of there after doing that to us is just wrong. There are too many good steakhouses in Chicago to treat people like this.

Tango sur has my heart for so many reasons. A. It is a BYOB place. B. Because it has yummy food. C. Because it is so damn romantic. I have been here a handful of times and I have never ever ever been disappointed. Last night we went for a friends birthday and we ordered soooo much food it turned out to be about 35 bucks per person and everything we hard was just fantastic. How can you beat that? We had empanadas, cheese plate, eggplant dish and their salmon. And I am sure when I say the salmon at Tango sur is probably the best salmon I have ever tasted in chicagoland. Seriously! Make reservations and prepare to wait because they get busy. Otherwise bring your bottle and your appetite and you will have a great experience.

I have to say I was a little let down by Tango. A large group of us was supposed to come here Friday night, but they couldn't accommodate us apparently, so the next night I dragged my boyfriend here for dinner before party bus shenanigans.  Walk in and the place is dark. Like you can barely see the face of your dining partner in front of you dark. I love that it's BYOB. Not only can you bring whatever you want to drink but it also majorly cuts down on your bill. They bring bread to your table, but strangely you get butter in little packets like ones you get at a diner with your pancakes. Our waiter was nice enough to bring us a bucket with ice to keep our beer cold before we ordered.  To start, we got the beef empanadas. They were good, but the meat was a little too sweet and greasy.  Next, they brought out salads that literally look like it's about to be put on a hamburger. Huge slices of tomatoes and onions on a bed of romaine with flavorless dressing options. For dinner, we shared the Para Dos. With it you get short ribs, flank steak, sweet breads, blood sausage and chorizo (I might be missing one or two items). Flank steak was incredibly hard to cut. Short ribs were salty and too fatty, but enjoyable. I LOVED the blood sausage as it had warm spices in it and was just the bomb. Sweet breads were not good at all as they were fried to death and battered too heavily. Chorizo was pretty good. Although the flavor of the meats were pretty good, they are too heavy handed with the salt.  Service was great here but if we come back I'll try something else and maybe ask if they can go easy on the sodium.

If you're looking for a great place for date night or to celebrate a special occasion, this needs to be your place. Do not, I repeat, do not, forget the wine. Bring more wine then needed, it's always better to take home then run out in my opinion. I once saw a table next to me and decided to give them an extra bottle I brought, they were celebrating an anniversary and didn't realize it was BYOB. Pay it forward.  As for the food, I've always been impressed with their steaks. I don't even bother touching the salad as I want to be able to finish as much of my dinner as possible. Service is always pretty decent, but plan on spending at least 1.5-2 hours while here.  Arrive early and put your name in then go to the pub down the road for a beer while you wait. They'll call your cell and then you can have a pre-drink to your dinner and everyone will be happy!

Horrible, pretentious service, bad cocktails, don't even know about the food.  We arrived at 7:30, were told it would be an hour.  At 8:30 the doorman told us it was not our turn yet (from scribbles in a notebook), eventually got shuffled to some back room, made to wait another hour, then left and ate leftovers at home.  Never an apology, never a look of understanding or empathy.  Lots of tables, very little food on them. We actually made the first hour wait at a bar with liquor license right next door that is also owned by them.  Despite the theatrics of the bartenders and their ridiculous overalls, the cocktails were mediocre at best and the wine had clearly been open for too long.

Decor was nice and romantic, all tables are candlelit.  If you love steak, this is not the place for you.  Steak was ok for price but not excellent.  Service is fine, the waiters are attentive.  It's BYOB, I really think that's the best part of the deal.

I came here about 6 months ago and just never wrote the review. A friend and I ordered the parilla & the filet w/spinach mashed potatoes. I'd never had them before until here and they were good. My steak was a little too well done. I wasn't a fan of the various sausage meats they served. Some were too well done, or not done enough. I just didn't  enjoy it as much as I hope. Then they're byob so we didn't have liquor. It kind of ruined our girls lunch. Oh well. Their service wasn't that grand either. Everyone was watching us like we were something they've never seen before. I felt uncomfortable w/them stalking my body parts.  I may give a 2nd chance 1 year. Lol

I'm afraid this quaint little Argentinian steakhouse is sadly overrated. The decor is lovely and my companion and I were enchanted by the lovely staff and actual candlelight. We started with the prosciutto and melon. Fairly good though I'll admit melon is out of season, so not the best choice for a January evening. My companion had the steak Vesuvio, stuffed with cheese and spinach. I had the bone-in ribeye with olive oil and garlic. Beautiful flavor in the Au jus on both steaks however regrettable this did not translate to the steak itself. Our primary concern was the apparently low grade of beef used - the tough, almost stringy texture suggested frozen meat that was thawed before being grilled to our request of medium. Extremely disappointing given the $30 price point for each steak. Both entrees came with potatoes - mine with mashed potatoes (very nice actually) and my companions with wedges - soggy from au jus. We also ordered a side of sautéed spinach so we had some green to round out the meal. The spinach again was clearly frozen - coagulated, dry, and overwrought. Perhaps we caught the kitchen staff on a bad night but I we won't be returning to Tango Sur. Friendly staff, BYOB and an intimate atmosphere didn't make up for substandard and inattentive approach to their food.

My fiancé took me here for my birthday dinner because she knows how much I love this style of restaurant. The fact that it is BYOB is a huge plus. The atmosphere was very intimate, with the restaurant being let by candles on every table. We enjoyed two bottles of wine with our meal.  The filet that we got was big enough for the two of us to share. The price was extremely reasonable for amount of food that you get (and the quality.) I would highly recommend Tango Sur, especially for a date night. You will not be disappointed.

I made a reservation for a group at Tango Sur and was overall happy with the experience.  The food was great and felt like they truly cared about the taste, texture and presentation for their food.  The server was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. He was genuinely interested in making the dining experience a memorable experience for his guests, and did a great job making the environment perfect.  The only issue with the experience was they sat us an easy 40 minutes after our reservation. Luckily for them we were in a good mood that evening and it didn't deter from the overall experience, but on a normal night that would have set me off. They were waiting for a large party to vacate the restaurant, which I understand, but the planning should have been more proactive here.

While a good experience in the last my last one at Tango Sur is amongst the worst restaurant experiences I have had in the world!  On Wednesday 12/28/16 I was part of a party of 6 with a reservation that was made several weeks earlier for 8:30pm.  On arrival, a most unhelpful host, asked us to wait next store at their new affiliated bar and restaurant as a table was clearing and we would be seated in 15 or 20 minutes. 30 minutes later neither the host nor anyone else contacted us regarding the status of our table.  After some back and forth and a lot of excuses another 30 minutes had past and still no available table regardless of our reservation.  The unhelpful host focused on other patrons and offered nothing to quell our growing frustration. 90 minutes (YES I SAID ONE AND A HALF HOURS) later we were seated with no apology, no explanation and no attention at all by the host.  The experience only got worse when several of us who had ordered ribs were served a dish that was completely uncooked.  This was now at 10:30pm--TWO HOURS AFTER OUR IGNORED RESERVATION.   Is this a restaurant that's become too big for its britches?  This abhorrent customer service is unacceptable and the fact that this group was basically ignored from the time we entered until the time we left is a failing of epic proportion.  For groups--beware.  For all--assure that your reservation will be honored.  This type of conduct for a once revered restaurant is what brings institutions to their end.  I hope they will correct their ways but this experience after many good ones, has soured me and my friends and colleagues.  We do not intend to go back anytime soon.
What amazing food. It's BYOB and even with reservations you may have to wait up to 30 min so definitely make reservations.  This was excellent food and a beautiful and intimate setting.

Table of 5 perspective on a Wednesday Night: PROS // Beautiful atmosphere, BYOB, Empanadas, Food Selection -- CONS // All meats were tough. Undercooked 3 of 5 Dishes (1) El Filet  (2) Churrasco (3) Bife Vesuvio. And They rushed us out. The host - not the manager - gave us a time limit, then eventually asked us to leave while we were enjoying our wine and dessert. After pointing this out, management didn't bother to apologize or give us any compensation for this unnecessary service. If you're looking for a quick in and out date night, check this place out for its atmosphere, empandas, and dessert. For dinner, be ready for tough meat (that is undercooked), loud music, and rushed service. "El Nandu", in my opinion, still remains as my favorite Argentinian Steak House in Chicago. Yelp That.

This place was amazing with a great vibe....HUGE steak enough for 3 meals.....however this place needs to do themselves a favor and get some real steak knives!!!!!!! What they give you is barely better than a butter knife.  I'll be back, packing my own knife.

I have heard amazing things about this place for years and my husband and I were finally able to go this past week. It did not disappoint! From the ambiance, to the server to the food, everything was incredible. We had the empanadas to start which were delicious, the chimichurri that they come with was awesome.  We will definitely be back.

We went there on a snowy Friday night and put our name in for 4 people around 7:25.
