The gentleman at the door told us they would call us in an hour, 8:40 at the latest.  Well, after no call by 9:00 we decided to check on our reservation and it took him 15 minutes to "check on" our reservation and tell us it would be another 20 minutes and that the back room was at capacity. The food is good but not worth a 2 hour and 10 minute wait! At this point we walked home, ordered a pizza (D'Agostino's), and never got a call for our reservation.  Awesome place when you get in but they need to be more realistic with their reservations. Or just take reservations like everywhere else does?
Absolutely amazing service, fantastic food, all around amazing place. Service over all is fan fricking tastic loved absolutely everything about this place! Adolpho is the best server ive ever had

What's not to love about this place?! Location, quality, fantastic prices, and it's BYOB! I got the filet , medium. It was perfect! Portion size was great , plenty to take home! I can not wait to go back!

They don't do reservations just a priority list. We went on a Sunday evening around 7 and waited  mins for a table of 4. Both the spinach empanadas and the corn empanadas were tasty.  Very hot - I burned my tongue in my first bite of the spinach one. We each ordered the filet mignon. Medium rare was cooked to perfection. The meat was very flavorful and the red wine sauce was delicious. Spinach mashed potatoes were alright...not particularly special. The place is BYOB, so a winner for me. I'd go back and I'd probably order the filet again. Next time I'll save some room for dessert!

Great customer service!  We went to dinner at 7pm and they did not make us wait more then 5 minutes for a table.  The dark lighting with a candle was very nice.  BYOB!! We had two bottles of wine with our meal and it was amazing!  I recommend ordering the mashed potatoes with your steak!

I came for a holiday party and had the empanadas, provoleta, ensalada Tango Sur, and bife de chorizo The empanadas were large, beefy, juicy and delicious on their own, but fantastic with the chimichurri sauce. From my limited experience of Argentina, the Chimichurri sauce at Tabgo Sur is much more garlicky  (pleasantly so) and less acidic than you would find in Buenos aires. I LOVE IT! The provoleta is as good as it sounds. If melted provolone on a plate doesn't sound good to you, don't get it. If it does, you won't be disappointed.  The Ensalada Tango Sur is nothing to cry home about. It's just crispy lettuce with a few large round pieces of sliced tomato and rings of onion. It's only $6 for a reason and I honestly think it should be provided for free or t lest half that. I came for the bife de chorizo. I have not yet had a bife de chorizo in Chicago that's as good as what I experienced as a student in Buenos Aires. This is close but not quite there. I ordered it medium well and they served it well and tough. Steak should be crispy outside and tender and juicy inside. Never tough. No matter how you order it. The healthy portion of fat around the edges made it worth a try but I won't be coming here for the steak. I prefer their empanadas.

This is place is great. We had our office Holiday Party over the weekend with a large party and they were great and very accommodating. (we did have to send some of our dinners back because they were too rare, but they were happy to take care of it and did it quickly). The food was great, good music so an overall great time here. Recommend when going with a large group to make reservations.

What a disappointment! When we first came in it took quiet sometime to get seated or even recognized by host to be seated. Afterwards after placing an order we had to wait for a long long time.  The tongue that we ordered must of cam from canned foods, it was cold and not tasty at all. It took at least another half an hour to 45 min to get our steaks.  When we got the steaks they were very undercooked. We asked for medium well and got rare.. the only good thing was the waiter took the steaks back to be cooked more. The only reason I give this place two stars was because it was cheap...

You've heard the allure.  You've thought about checking this spot out.  From the bottom of my heart, wait no longer to #treatyoself.   This is my second time and I have been pleased each time.  Do yourself a favor by calling at least a day ahead for a reservation.  If not, it's likely that there will be an extended wait, I went last Friday at 8:00 and had to wait 1:45 yes.. that's (an hour and forty-five minutes).  I wandered around the southport corridor, went to Jewel-Osco and grabbed Whiskey (yes BYOB includes hard liquor).   Once we received the "Table Ready" text we made our way back and entered into a romantic ambience.  As our table was prepared we were given glasses and escorted to the waiting room where we had a drink before heading to our table.  Normally, I would have been frustrated by the wait, but I knew what I was getting myself into.  Once seated, the candles, water and bread fill your table and a slight smile ensues as you look around and notice other's delectable assortments.  It took me a glance over the menu to pin point the "El Filet."  I ordered it medium as they tend to cook on the rare side.  Upon slicing into the cut of meat, my mouth begin to salivate as I dipped my steak in the Chimichurri Sauce and took my first bite.   You will more than likely have food to take home and what better to pair with eggs in the morning.
The steaks are to die for.  Very high quality meats in a romantic, candlelit setting!
Service: Waited Waited Waited Waited....very poor  Food: it was ok, felt like some of our food was really good and the other food was pre-made and just heated up Not impressed

Great date night spot but be prepared to wait!  It's byob and you can drink while you wait in their waiting room.  Salmon with orange glaze is my favorite and their spinach mashed potatoes are a must.  Service is quick once your seated and very friendly.  Romantic, dimly lite ambience.

Great BYOB spot that is always delicious and a deal! I came here on a Friday with a part of 6 so I made reservations in advance. The reservations were at 7 and we had to wait an hour to be seated but the food was worth the wait! Ordered the filet based on the yelp recommendations and split it with a friend. We also ordered several of the empanadas which I would recommend!

Tango Sur is a wonderful romantic spot to hit up if you are in the Lakeview area.  The first time I visited this restaurant was two years ago, and then I came back a month ago to celebrate my anniversary with my boyfriend.  Everything was just as fantastic as I remembered when I came back recently.  The restaurant is very dark inside, but I like this because it really sets the mood if you are on a date with someone special ; )  .   Saturday nights here can be very busy, so I highly suggest coming on the early side if you want to avoid a huge crowd. I believe they only take reservations by phone according to their website.  I've had good experiences with the service here, and the waiters are always willing to give food recommendations.   I'm a little obsessed with their empanadas.  Sometimes it's hard to find the perfect empanada in a city full of so-so empanadas, but this place makes exceptional empanadas.  The empanadas are baked to the right crispiness, and the ingredients inside are seasoned well.  They are also only $2.50, and they are totally worth the price. In regards to main entrees, I've only had their steak meals.  During my most recent visit I tried the steak that was stuffed with spinach and cheese (I forgot the name of this dish), and it was a really good meal.  The portion sizes for the steak are on the larger side, and it would be possible to share a steak meal with 1 other person.  Leftovers from this place aren't bad either though.

I'm a huge planner and normally take care of reservations, picking out restaurants, etc. However, I decided to be on the other end this time. Yes, my friend dropped the ball by not calling ahead of time to make reservations for Saturday night. However, that does not excuse this restaurant's completely unorganized, antiquated reservation system. Our party of three arrived on a Saturday night a little before 8:30pm, and my friend put his name down for us. It's essentially one man holding a tiny black notepad that you probably get at the dollar store. He scribbled my friend's name in there and quoted 9:45pm. Not ideal, but we decided to wait. We're all chatting and drinking while we wait to be called. When 9:45pm finally rolls around, my friend noticed that various party sizes (including those who waited after we arrived and parties of three) kept being seated throughout the time we waited. My friend went to the host to inquire about our position in line and get the approximate remaining wait time to which the host replies that they're busy. Another 20 minutes roll by, and we decided to leave and dine at Machu Picchu where there was zero wait. It's apparent that he didn't go in order and just flipped back and forth through his scribbles to find the next party of his choosing. I can see how parties can be easily missed using this method, especially when it's dark. If I wanted to deal with the pretentious attitude of a club, I'd go to a club. When that behavior is exhibited at a supposedly nice steakhouse, peace out!

I love this place. The food is amazing. A-mazing. The chimichurri is to die for. The steaks even well done are juicy and flavorful. It's byob. Usually a 45 minute wait but WORTH IT. best steakhouse I have ever been too. The empanadas  (spinach) are finger licking good.

The food is amazing and so is the service. This is definitely a date like scene as they keep their entire restaurant very dark with candle lights at the tables, which sometimes is bothersome but I guess it's a smart way to save electricity. Their churrasco is delicious, very juicy and tender and cooked perfectly. Also, their spinach mashed potatoes are to die for!

By far, favorite place for dinner. The food is always on point and delicious. The only detractor I can think of is that they are always super packed. Come prepared to wait in their waiting area while you drink your own BYOB!

Unbelievably affordable for the experience. The meals are VERY generous. My girlfriend and I were able to split one Filet and still have leftovers. That is saying something as I love steak. Speaking of the steak, the cuts are good, but not great. Furthermore, you can only make reservations if you have a party of 6 or more, so be prepared to wait if you're going out for date night. Overall, a really great spot for an intimate dinner!

Great place for a date, or for a group.  I like the dark ambience with the candles and the live music.  Great place to bring a bottle of red wine and break bread with friends.   The food is good, but not great; reason for the four stars.  The service is good, and usually very friendly.  I do recommend a reservation, as they do get crowded.   We usually always order a couple flavors of their empanadas, which are delicious.  We then share the beef flap steak with sweet potatoes served table side, yum.  I do recommend this dish over the filet served the same way.  The filet is a cheaper one, lower USDA grade, Select or No Roll grade.  It is noticeable, as the filet s tough, and less flavor than the flap meat.   I just learned from my son, who went the other night with his girl, that the Salmon with Portobello Mushroom sauce was solid.  I think this was a special, but he really liked it.

It's easy to see why this place has been in business for so long, and has remained a neighborhood staple for so many. It's not super exciting food, but that's the point: these are dishes whose only surprise should be the generous portions and ultra-fair prices. Tango Sur takes pride in their menu, which is just the right size: your options aren't at all limited, but there's few enough items that diners can rest assured they're being given a meal that has been prepared with care and expertise. BYOB makes the whole experience even more affordable and versatile. Great place to go with a small group of friends.

Almost four stars.  The stakes are very big and tasty however Chicago chi town a city of  a lot of great steakhouses. The only reason why I give them four stars and not less was the ambience,  place has a  Cool vibe with lowlights very romantic BYOB is a good thing I can bring my own bottle of wine and enjoy a good time with great food not the best steak in the city but overall four stars is pretty well deserved for this establishment

The food here is perfect every single time I go. You must order the costeletta! They are bread comes out fresh and hot all of the time. The desserts are made from scratch and there is no fee for bringing your own wine. I enjoy the outdoor and indoor seating and the service is unbeatable.

Excellent food! I don't leave many reviews but this is def a place worth checking out! Perfect for date night! I had the filet mignon and spinach potatoes, absolutely delicious...oh and the empanadas were great as well. BYOB so make sure to bring a bottle of your favorite wine or you can run across the street (like we did) to grab a bottle!
Great food at a great price. The only problem is service is slow at times but understandable for such a busy restaurant. One of my favorite places to go eat.

I would like to give them 4 stars but we had some strange request yesterday that my husband & I find it inappropriate for lack of a better word.  The food, if you are into red meat, is very good, we always get leftovers and that makes it a good value for your money.  Yesterday we were four people. We order two appetizers which as typical Argentinians one eats them with bread -- provoleta and matambre (melted cheese & a type of cold cut), followed by salad and lots of red juicy meat which also deserves bread to soak it up. At this point we had 2 small little loaf of bread each. When we asked for more bread we were told by the waiter "I am going to have to charge you for it". What? Our meals are over $140 and you are going to charge us extra for bread?  Seriously you Tango Sur 2 stars for being cheap and 3 stars because you serve good meat.
Love love love this place. Usually get El Filet, which is on point. But switched it up and got the pez... amazing! BYOB. Reservations for 6+.

Believe the hype. This place is great. Stopped in for dinner and drinks (BYOB) and everything was terrific. We tried the empanadas (eggplant with cheese and chicken) and both of which we delicious, but I preferred the chicken. For my main course I had the Bief Vieveita (sp??) which was also very good. Our table also had the filet and another beef dish which were also super tasty. As many mentioned, the portions are very big. Two entrees could easily serve a table of 3 or 4 hungry people.

This is a date-night type of place only if your partner shares the same love for red meat. The lighting is low, the music is hip, and the servers have a sexy accent.  What are the must-haves? The empanadas and meat platter. I finished my empanadas and complimentary salad before our platter arrived and that was a horrible idea. Our platter for two came with the grilled short ribs, flap meat, sausage, beef sweetbread, and black sausage. In hindsight, I wished I had saved the salad to go along with the meat for a nicer balance. The meats were mostly medium-rare with lots of juice and oil. The lettuce and tomatoes would have done a nice job of soaking up that essence.

This place was a bit tricky to find because the door was hidden and connected to another restaurant.  The restaurant itself had very dim lighting. The tables had candles and that was basically the lights for the tables. The servers were all very nice and made sure everything was good.  I ordered the El Filet with the beef medium rare and it was delicious! The steak was so juicy and had the perfect tenderness. The sauce complimented it well too. Along with the steak, it came with a side of spinach mashed potatoes. Never had it before but it was not bad either. They give a big portion so sharing can be an option. Before the main course came out, they have bread and salads.  Will definitely be coming back to this place again and will try the empanadas people are raving about.

Awesome date night spot. I couldn't decide what to order. Every single dish sounded amazing. My boyfriend and I went with the lomo relleño which is portioned for two (maybe 3) and took a little home. The meat was cooked to a perfect medium rare. Great seasoning. We had just one beef empanada to start so we wouldn't spoil our appetite - it was delicious ! Over all a great dining experience. Very reasonably priced for the portions plus it's BYOB!! Best thing ever. And the servers (there are a LOT of them) are all very nice. I'm sure I'll be back soon to try more dishes

The atmosphere was lovely, staff were amazing and so nice, bread was warm and tasty, the main course was immaculate especially the T-bone steak, even though it was the most expensive meal on the menu but it is definitely worth it! I would give it more than 5 stars if I am allowed :)
Amazing amazing amazing Food and ambiance was superb. Great for date night. A plus that it is BYOB

The atmosphere is great. You can only make reservations for parties of 6 or more and it gets pretty busy.  The food is great. There were 5 of us at dinner and we had been recommended the empenadas! Each order comes with 2. They are very good, strong recommendation.  For dinner, I got the eggplant (something I usually do not go for) but it was really, really good.  Others at my table got the HUGE steak and they loved it. They all were raving about the steak being amazing. the steak also came with these delicious mashed potatoes.  The waiters are very friendly! Good times!
The empanadas and the eggplant lasagna (berenjena) are fantastic! And is BYOB! Make a reservation early as it gets packed Thurs-Sat.
I hadn't been back in years and I have to say it's gone down in a bit. It's SO dark in there.  It's basically just meat...

We frequent this Place all the time..we love the Food and the Ambience of the Place...I came back last Friday..and it was the longest I have waited for our table...and heres why I think we waited so long...I stood in front watching the Guy taking in reservations..and watched the going ins and out of the costumers....now as I waited patiently...I noticed at least 4-5 different groups of Hispanics who just came out of there car..on different occasions..and I can guess they are friend of this guy in the front because they exchanged pleasantries and hugs ...without even giving there names for reservations they got there sits ahead of us..while we patiently waited...the guy obviously noticed me afterwards and gave me a quick and shy smile saying...your next..that comment came when he notice me watching him letting in these "friends" of his get in ahead of anyone who has been ahead.....Hope the management of this restaurant notice this....

Been here a couple of times now. The food is delicious and the atmosphere romantic and cozy. Portions are huge so don't go crazy on the fresh bread or apatite or you may not be able to finish your meal :) it is BYOB, so plan accordingly. Also, due to no reservations for smaller parties, plan to wait at least an hour before getting a seat. Also also, while it may be contradictory to say in the summer, grab a seat inside instead of the patio. Nothing wrong with the patio but the ambiance inside is a lot more cozy.  *when they are busy, sometimes you may get a feeling that you are being rushed to leave after you finish your meal but that's understandable when there are people waiting in line to get in for 1+ hours.

Came in on Friday evening after work around 6:30pm. As a party of two, we were immediately seated in a dark room with one candle at our table. While the candle was meant to stir romanticism, we felt it was a little too dark. We brought our own wine, and appreciated the bread and butter while we waited for our steaks. We both ordered the bife ancho, medium done. The dipping sauce that came with the steak was pretty good. While I thought my steak was flavorful and good, my partners steak was not cooked well. Her steak was burned on the outside and left not too well cooked on the inside. My steak did not have a burned or bitter taste to it. Unfortunately she couldn't eat much of her steak. I wished the steaks were as good as people who recommended the place said it was. We don't regret trying it though. Once they turned on the Argentinian music the place got loud. The atmosphere was different. I'd go back and try other items on the menu.

The empanadas and flan were fantastic. The BYOB was also a plus. However, my party and I were very disappointed with the entrees. The Bife Vesuvio was labeled "prime steak," but tasted like an extremely low quality cut. The flavor was great, but the texture was extremely tough and gamey for a $30 steak, despite ordering medium, which we were told was the chef's recommendation. This dish was nearly impossible to eat, and I would strongly advise you choose something else. Five members of my party ordered this dish and shared similar feelings. Upon complaining to our waiter, we were treated with disrespect and condescension. We were told that we "should have known" this was a tougher cut, altough it did not state that on the menu. I would not return to Tango Sur.

THE GOOD: Empanadas and Bife Ancho were delicious!! Flavor profile was good, chimichurri sauce was a little on the oily side in ratio to the herbs. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND the empanadas, all of them. You could order one of each and it'll fill you up for low cost. I'll try the different desserts next time.  THE BAD: Everyone on my table ordered different entrees that consisted of veal, stuffed prime steaks, and so on. They were pretty low quality... Even though each one was cooked to medium. SKIP THE ENTREES, much regrets. Waiters needs to be trained in customer service; too much attitude and not enough problem solving.

Empanadas and flan are tasty and authentic. However, the entres are composed of cheap meat with tendons and vast amount of fat running throught it. If i were to come back, I would order the empanadas only!!!

LOVE this place - never disappointed by the service and delicious food. There eggplant appetizer is mouthwatering. Truly one of our favorite places to go. Go early as they don't take reservations unless you are a larger party.

Aside from the wait time to get a table here, I really enjoyed the ambiance and food here. The interior is VERY dimly lit and they have each table lit with real candles that seem to burn way too quickly and spew wax over the candle holder and onto the table. Not really a big deal, but I could imagine some people having issues with a constant flow of wax onto the table. To be honest, I can't say that I've been to an Argentine BBQ place before, so here we go! Anyways, first thing is first... BYOB. Yep. You read that right, this place is BYOB. So feel free to bring a bottle of wine or two to enjoy with your meal, or if you're like my friends a bottle of wine per person. *SMH*  I came in knowing that we would go for a meat platter or two here, so we did start with two orders of salad to share for the table. I don't recall which salad we had ordered, but I do remember it having mixed greens, tomatoes, & onions. Nothing fancy really but overall fresh. We did start with some empanadas (Beef, chicken, and spinach & cheese to be exact) and of the three, for sure the spinach & cheese was my favorite. The beef and chicken empanadas were enjoyable not to take anything away from them, but I just preferred the spinach & cheese is all. Be sure to lather those empanadas up with the provided chimichurri sauce! For a table of four, we ordered one order of the Para Uno (short ribs, sausage, beef sweetbread, and black sausage) and one order of the Para Dos (short ribs, flap meat, sausage, beef sweetbread, and black sausage). Food was good for three people, but this was definitely more than enough food for the four of us. Meats were all tender and juicy and as I recall the black sausage being somewhat on the sweet side. Overall really enjoyable meal in my opinion, just be prepared to EAT. I would come back again. For now that's all I got on this one, 'til next time cheers!

Great prices for a good steak.  There's almost too much steak to eat in a still walk home.   Great outdoor patio: worth the wait.  Sometimes they have authentic, love Argentinian music too.  I wouldn't go in expecting a Gibsons steak, but you can expect double the meat for $30 and a good taste. Enjoy!

Went here for an anniversary. Good food. Husband got a steak and I got the pasta. Definitely would recommend the Provoleta (cheese cooked on the grill with olive oil and roasted red peppers).  We were there on a Friday night and it was a tiny bit noisy and service was a tad slow (they did have two tables of 10+ people) but the food definitely made up for it and I would definitely return.

I've been here three times.  The first two times were good, but this past visit was a complete disappointment. I love that this place is BYOB and has reasonably priced steaks.  But my steak was just not good.  I had a bone-in rib eye.  It was excessively fatty and, while I asked for medium, was waaay overcooked to well done.  I could barely eat half of it.  Two other people in my party were also very disappointed with their steaks.   Service was also subpar.  One person's order was screwed up. It happens, not a big deal, just fix it.  But our waiter handled it very poorly.  He offered no apology and was very resistant to taking it back to fix it despite the fact that it was wrong.  We also made it clear how we wanted our check split and he just put it all on one anyway. Overall, I don't think that Tango Sur is worth it like I once did.  Next time I'll be spending the extra money to go to a steakhouse in River North or the West Loop where I can get a quality steak and good service.

I've been here a couple of times and have always had an incredible experience. Wonderful service, the cozy European vibe, the food is always insanely delicious and it's byob! One thing I must note is that the portions are unlike most trendy Chicago restaurants that leave you feeling like a hungry vacuum. The portions here are perfect, it's a real meal and a total bang for your buck! I most recently tried their eggplant dish- if you've never tried it, it's a must. I dream/scream about that eggplant. It's art.

I have been to this restaurant so many times, they have the best stakes I had ever had, staff is very friendly, and the most important thing you can bring your own wine overall I love this place is very small but the food is very good. The wait it may be a little long but if you around 6pm there is not many people there so you get a table right away if you go later like 8pm you will be waiting for like hour or so.
Tango Sur never disappoints and is one of our favorite spots to celebrate milestones in our family.  Keep up the good work guys, I wouldn't change a thing.

This is truly unique place. It has its own, very strong character. Be careful: this place is not for everyone. It may be extremely noisy, and it is not so fancy, and sometimes can be very annoying (long lines), and everything inside show the signs of prolonged use, however - we love it. It is very stable - since my first visit in 2005 this place has nothing new: same menu, same taste, same music (Gotan!), same parilladas, berenjenas and empanadas and everything else - all the same. (except the waiters - sometimes they have to leave just to open their own restaurants) Don't even try Tango Sur if you don't like real meat with blood on your table and the people with the real emotions around. ;)

Maybe I had overhyped this in my mind, but I was sincerely a little disappointed with Tango Sur. First impressions were bad. They don't take reservations for parties fewer than 6, so we showed up about 20 minutes after opening on a Friday. We got there, and they told us the wait would be about 75 minutes, but that they are guessing they would seat us at 7:15. No big...except we'd been lugging around a bunch of booze. So we went down to the Italian restaurant next door, that also happened to be BYOB, and ordered an appetizer while we waited (plus, it gave us a chance to prevent our beers from getting warm)! About 6:35 (more than half an hour before they told us the table would be ready), I got a phone call from the host, telling us our table was ready. We were still mid-appetizer at the place next door, so I told the host that we were next door but would finish our appetizers and would be there in 10 minutes. I got an audible sigh on the other end, and "um..okay." As others have remarked, the ambience is dark, sexy, and..a bit cramped?! The restaurant wasn't huge, but it seated a good amount of people. I had a party of 4 so we ordered 3 empanadas, a numero uno, a numero dos, and spinach mashed potatoes. The food was OK. Not great, and the meat was extremely tough. The portions were large, and with tip, we were looking at a mere $27 a person. Not bad pricewise, but the quality of food could use a little work as it seemed to be quantity over quality here.

Great place to go with a big group.  We were able to make a reservation but everyone was required to get a fixed price menu.  This was a great deal- $38 for an entree, shared appetizers (empanada and fried cheese), dinner salad and flan for dessert.  The empanadas were perfectly flakey.  For my entree I had the El Filet that was on the rarer end of medium rare, which is just how I like it. The chimichurri sauce was so delicious with the steak and this dish was decadent and huge.   BYOB is a huge perk, I greatly enjoyed the red I brought from home with the steak (and appreciated saving the money!).   The service for a huge group was on point.  The atmosphere is very dark with candles, would be kind of romantic if it wasn't so loud and a bit hectic.   Overall highly recommend.

So good! I don't even know where to start. First, order the filet. Good enough to feed two people seriously. Second, it's BYOB! and finally everything else there is really bomb especially the steak combos etc. Definitely, bang for your bucks! Go with your friends, family, and date!
What the service lacks, the food makes up for tenfold.  A favourite spot on this side of town.  Keep up the good work!
This place is sooo good!  We treated ourselves to Tango Sur on the last night of our Chicago vacation this summer and it was perfect.  ..If only we had made it out of there with our leftovers  D:

Love this place! Food is great, service is amazing, very romantic. Great place to take your date. We always come here for our celebrations because they take reservations for big parties. It's also BYOB! Only bad part is parking but who cares when the food is good.

Tango Sur is BYOB! There is also a sharing fee if you do not order enough entrees for the amount of people dining in. LOMO RELLENO - Serves 2 people ~$40 (ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS, highly recommend) This entree is a gigantic piece of filet mignon with mushrooms PROVOLETA - huge plate of melted cheese with peppers. You spread it on bread and it's a great appetizer option for cheese lovers. The setting here is very dark candle-lit giving it that truly romantic feel. The service is great as well, I would definitely recommend this place for a more up-scale dinner with your parents or a date. Bring a bottle of wine and you have a great meal.

DE-LIC-IOUS! Great food, romantic atmosphere, even better prices, and the flavors are amazing!  I've been to Tango Sur a few times now, and each time it gets better!  The wait: There are no reservations, walk-ins only, but if you call ahead they will write down your name. The food: The empanadas - Best I have ever had in Chicago! There are 4 other restaurants that sell empanadas on the block, but they area all competing against these amazing creations!  BYOB: Bring your own means no spending $ on a bottle of wine, and no cork fee.  The atmosphere: Candle lit, romantic, ambient! Tables are close together, but the atmosphere is fun, you can talk to the table next to you and see what they ordered while still feeling cozy, and intimate.  Absolute gem!! Food is amazing! Servers are authentic and great!!
Here right now and this place is positively MEH.  Not great at all. Service is lacking and food is salty and just not that good. Sitting outside and being harassed by bees and flies.

We have been wanting to try this place for a while, after hearing about it from multiple friends. We first came here ~6 pm on a Saturday night after being told that they only take reservation for group size 6 and above. As you can imagine the wait was more than one hour, so we decided to try another time. We finally got to visit this place again this Tuesday night around 6:30pm. There was no wait and we got to choose whether to sit on their patio or candle-lit indoor. I was glad we chose the patio because later an artist was playing guitar right next to the table behind ours. The food was amazing if you are a meat-lover. My boyfriend and I ordered the para uno and ribeye steak, the waiter seemed to know that we are sharing so he put all the meat on one large plate. We loved every single bite! The food were in large portions too. We ended up taking home almost half of what we ordered and that made another dinner (yay~). The price was very reasonable too. The total including taxes was 62ish. Definitely would visit here often!

Love LoVe Love this place yes you're going to wait a little bit, yes it's small and you'll be seating close to other tables, yes it's a romantic ambience but this is just a small price to pay for their amazing mouth watering food and home baked bread . Can't wait to go back!
I love this place! Such good food and a really cool intamate

Tango Sur is a Chicago BYOB institution. We first visited around 2002 and back then me no meatatarian. Boo.  But now, don't mind the occasional bone in me mouf. :p This time the staff worked a packed patio and restaurant with ease... and our own group was about 30 strong. We ordered an assortment of different steaks, cuts, the wine flowed, lots of laughs. Be sure to check out that melted cheese app.. woo! And to be on the safe side, ask for your steak rare if you want traditional medium rare. Tasty.

Nice spot near Wrigleyville in Chicago. My first recommendation is if you want to see your food try to get a table outside. We had a party of 8 and did the call ahead and had no trouble getting a table outside. The appetizers we had were awesome! I would go back for just the empanadas and the melted cheese dip!  I got the filet and shared it with another person. Believe me, unless you are ravenous, you can share it too and be completely happy. The filet comes with TWO filets and a side of their spinach mashed potatoes. The mashed potatoes were tasty and the steak was cooked perfectly! Very satisfying meal.  I do have two gripes about the place. 1. They require you to do a splitting cost if you are going to split the entree (I hate that). and 2. They touted the splitting cost by saying it added another side salad to meal for the person you were splitting with. Talk about a letdown when those salads hit the table. I wouldn't even call it a salad. It was basically the topping you put on a hamburger. Couple leafs of lettuce, couple tomato slices and a couple onion slices. If that was your first impression of the restaurant it would not be a good start. Lucky for us we had the delicious apps to begin and just set the crappy salads aside. Work on those and this place easily gets a 5 star.  One huge plus about this place is that it's BYOB. No corking fee, nothing. That is one helluva perk. I really liked the place and I would go back in a heart beat. My two pieces of advice are to skip the salad, and have one person order the filet as their meal and the other person order the appetizers as their meal.

AMAZING. Everytime. This is by far my favorite restaurant in the city. Where else can you get a great appetizer, filet, and pasta for 2 for under $50??! It's BYOB so you can save a lot there. They don't take reservation for parties of 2 so my boyfriend & I have a ritual of putting our name in and then going to grab wine and then either going to the bar next door or sitting in the back room to start drinking our wine. The service is always great. I have never seen this place not busy! I have brought many friends here from out of town and they have all loved it!

Absolutely delicious - this place was great! We have friends that live in Chicago and recommended this place, and it exceeded our highest expectations. From start to finish, the experience was wonderful. This place is BYOB which was an obvious perk, and it was nice that we were able to pair wine we brought with the El Filet. There were 8 of us (4 couples) and each pair ordered the El Filet, which is definitely shareable. The meal comes with two filets and a heaping amount of their spinach mashed potatoes. I highly, highly recommend this restaurant. We didn't spend any time inside the restaurant, because we were able to grab a table outside, but the inside seemed nice as well.
El Fillet hit the spot and was really well prepared. Spinach potatoes were also a treat.

2 hrs to get our food. And if you think this is good meat boy you have to get out more. This is low grade beef. 9 out of 10 steaks i eat are grass fed so when i eat low grade i can tell right away.  O and they gave me burger topping for a salad...WTF.

I've been here several times before and enjoyed the food and service very much. Today was quite the opposite experience. I called around 2PM to see if they would take a reservation for two of us this evening sometime (I know they don't take reservations for small groups on the weekends, but i wasn't sure if Sundays were included in that). The host said "sure, you can come in anytime. What time do you want to come in?" We agreed on 6:30PM. Great.  My husband and I walked in with no others waiting and stood near the door to wait for the host (who was nowhere to be found)... And that's when the problem started. Two other groups came in behind us. The host (who said his name was Shawn) approached them first and moved them to the waiting room while we kept waiting. When he finally came back to help us, I gave him my name and told him that we had a reservation for 6:30 (it was 6:35 or so) He looked at his watch and said "it'll be 15-20 minutes."  I said "what's the point of a reservation then?" He quickly shot back with a "well other people wait an hour so you're doing well".  We had waited for about 15 minutes when he came to seat us, but at that point we'd had enough of his snarky attitude so we left. I really loved this place in the past, but the service is subpar and the host has an attitude from hell. I don't know if we'll be back.
Simply amazing food. A bit loud for my liking but the environment is very casual and lively.  I had their steak with spinach mashed potatoes! Will go again!

Love that this place is BYOB. The food is fabulous and portions are enormous; filet mignon comes with TWO 7-oz filets. The waiter warned us that the steaks are typically cooked on the rarer side depending on preference (i.e. a medium rare steak here is probably a bit rarer than at other steakhouses) - this was accurate, we loved it and appreciated his warning. The steak is of high quality, and prices are VERY VERY reasonable for what you get! The one issue I have had with Tango Sur is that certain tables (inside and outside) are much better than others - I do not believe you can reserve a specific table, so we ended up waiting a bit longer than our reserved time so that we could sit at a decent table. Overall, I definitely recommend this restaurant and we will be back. FYI noise level is very high unless you are seated outside.

My boyfriend and I never got a chance to even try the food because we couldn't get a table. We arrived at 7:30 pm on a Saturday and was told by the little doorman that it would be about an hour to hour fifteen wait and to come back around 8:45 pm to 9:00 pm. We said ok, in which he wrote  down my name and phone number and said they'd give us a call when they have a table available for us (obviously a lie, they will not call). We came back at 8:45 to check in with the doorman, and he snobbishly told me he said 9:00 or 9:15 pm. We waited around out front until 9:15 and then decided to go elsewhere to eat. I think basically you have to smooth talk the doorman and persuade him to like you in order to get seated, there actually is no first come first serve guideline that the restaurant follows. It's like trying to get into Studio 54; "you're hot, you can come in". I'm sure the food is just fantastic though. ...

The place doesn't seem to take reservations-go there keeping in mind you will have to wait 45min to be seated on a weekend night. The food is all delicious, we split a provoleta, a cheese and ham empanada, and we each ordered el filet. Each portion of el filet comes with two filets and mashed potatoes so we had a lot of leftovers. Quality of the steak was excellent; comparable to a high end steakhouse downtown. Service was generally slow but the place is small and packed so that's understandable.  bonus: It's BYOB with no corking fee.

Want to feel like you stepped abroad for an evening out head to Tango. Food is authentic, very well prepared and will not disappoint but this place is more about atmosphere and wether that is a dark romantic night for two or a table of friends sharing wine (BYO) and conversation.

My favorite steakhouse in Chicago! I studied abroad in Argentina for a year and lived with a local family - this place is the real deal. My boyfriend and I have been here several times with friends and family from out of town and everything we've had has been delicious. Some of our favorites include: the pork chop (I normally don't like pork because I think it's dry but this is the best one I've ever had), lomo, el filet and all of their empanadas are amazing. We also have had the lomo for two and it's a huge plate! Depending on how hungry your table is, you could arguably split this between three.  I was hesitant to check it out at first because they don't take reservations for parties under 6 but they have this great waiting room in the back where you can open up your wine and get your night started while you wait for your table.  It's affordable, a great vibe and the best part? It's BYOB so this is an awesome place if you're looking for a fun night out with lots of good food and your own choice of wine or beer.

I love Tango sur!  BYOB Argentina steak house, great for groups parties and date night. Very reasonable price for what you get. Their spinach mash potato is always my favorite! Reservation is only for group of six or more, if you are planning on going there in Friday and Saturday, make sure you bring two bottles. They have a back waiting area where you can enjoy your drinks while waiting.

I'm an Argentine-American and I go here when Argentines come to town and miss the old country...unless of course I'm making an asado at home lol. I've traveled this country sampling many of the Argentine restaurants in various cities and the encased meats from tango sur are up there with the best.  The morcilla may even be the best in my opinion. The Chorizo (sausage) and Morcilla (blood sausage) recipes are brought from the old country via the owner's father (R.I,P.) who is a butcher that migrated here from Rosario, ARG in the 60s.  The meats you get in the restaurant are all the same meats from the butcher shop next door and they are DELICIOUS. I have purchased many a meat from their meat case and they are always spot on. Yes, that little 'mercado' to the left of Tango Sur is a full-fledged Argentine butcher shop (pro-tip: cash only). That's how the whole thing got started...as a butcher shop. Not bad lol. The Parrillada para dos (mixed grill plate) is an excellent and classic way to sample all the different parts of an Argentine bbq.  Sure there are many more things you could add to it but the staples are there.  I saw a post about the sweetbreads being chewy...I have never had that problem.  Mojellas (Sweetbreads) are hard to grill because they require a longer cook time.  In order to make them crispy many cultures fry them, in Argentina however grill is king.  Everytime I've had them at Tango Sur they are super crispy and delicious. Same goes for the chinchulines (small intestine) which I saw someone write about. SIDE NOTE: You have to ask for them, they are not on the menu.  Chinchulines are by nature a little more rubbery than a lot of offal but I have to say prepared excellently at Tango Sur, crispy, greasy, delicious. As for the ambience, I see people complaining on Yelp about the lighting and general chaos lol. What they don't realize is that for better-or-for-worse you really couldn't get a more Argentine environment then what you get when you go to Tango Sur.  The candle lit vibe is something that got popular in trendy argentine bars, the over-abundance of people is part of that charm, think big cities like Buenos Aires and NYC. It should also be mentioned that the often longer wait times for your meats is also an Argentine STANDARD lol. Hence the famous term 'latin time.' I get it, this is America and we are used to what we know, but if you want authentic...this restaurant spares none.  Not to mention that most of the people that work on the floor and are from Argentina. In conclusion, this is one Argentine-American's perspective  (who grill's authentic Argentine asado/bbq literally weekly), and maybe some will disagree but I have brought quite a few 'argies' through here and they all seem to agree with me that when it comes to meats and vibe, few places are more true to argentine form then Tango Sur.  It's not a fluke that there are 2 hour waits almost daily.  The place is delectable, insanely affordable for meat...and BYOB. DONE.

Absolute crap customer service. Really frustrating to be told our table is ready (and that people are getting up and paying) and then wait another 25 minutes with nothing in sight. Just tell the truth. Don't waste our time. If our table's not ready, don't say it is.

Always amazing. BYOB, get there early and be prepared to wait; they will take your number and text you when table ready, fun music box bar next door. One of my favorite steak houses in Chicago without the hype of places like Chicago Cut. Great staff. Small cozy tables. Reservations of parties four or more.

. I came because everyone raves about this place . My first time yesterday was not so good of a experience. We aimlessly walked in both sides looking for the maitre d to see about a table , to no avail didn't see anyone but waiters running like headless chickens. We then stood outside hoping someone will come out. Pretty soon the hostess was outside and sat us. That's when the experience went down HILL. We sat for 15 minutes BEFORE we got water and a bread bowl. 20 minutes LATER no waiter, no menu. We sat 35 minutes never meeting our waiter, no menu to order from. The bus boy gave us a menu finally. I had enough and went to the assistant manager i believe . I kindly told him we have been sitting for 30 minutes and have yet to see a waiter. It was so bad the table next to us noticed that the vacancy of service to us and offered some of their food that they have not eaten . It was a birthday party so that was sweet, of course we declined. But very sweet of them. The manager apologized and when I came back from the bathroom there was a man finally at our table. We ordered 2 filet mignons and a salad. Maybe 15 minutes later our mozzarella salad came. The kicker. Dry. No olive oil. No red, sherry vinaigrette. I only know because after we finished our salad he gave us 2 free ones "on the house" ! And he gave us olive oil and and another dressing. I'm thinking, if we ordered a salad shouldn't that have been on the house ???why in the hell do we want to eat two salads? And the one that we paid for??? you forgot to give us the dressing ???so we ate dry lettuce with mozzarella cheese. I was done. By that time when the food came I could not have been appreciative , we were sat at 7:13 pm....I looked at my clock it was 8:25pm. Still no entree meal! LOL just dry salad and water. That is unacceptable , I don't care how busy the establishment is. The service was Unacceptable. I would never , ever come back here again. Or recommend it. We barely saw our our waiter however when the check came he stayed at our table and waited for the checkbook . I gave him this crazy look and he looked and saw that both of our water glasses were empty , yes we didn't even get our water filled during our meal. so he went to go fill up  our water  glasses at the end of the meal When my food is already wrapped in a doggy bag by the busboy?? HORRIBLE. Manager was nice. The food I can't speak for, I was to pissed to enjoy. I took it home.

Our total was a hair under $300.  Our server (19) was not attentive, and I had to fish out others for service. An orange/salmon shirt guy seemed to be a step above the servers and yet did nothing to make any of my requests come true. I had to ask 4 different servers including orange shirt, about our birthday celebrant, because our server never came back to us.  The one time he did check in on us, after taking our orders, was to abruptly ask how our food was, told him the lomos was very tough, otherwise everything is fine. His response? Well that's because it's a big piece of meat... Huh, pretty sure he should take this kind critique to the chef; being a big piece of meat doesn't permit it to be super tough.  Food: - Empanadas were faulty, but if you really want to try, I'd recommend the beef.  - Lomo (for 2) again was very tough, like they hurried just enough to scotch the outside. The sauce was good, but none of the flavors seeped in the meat.  - spinach(?) mash? Good, tastes the same as mashed potatoes. - el filet was very tender and just the perfect salting (unlike lomo) and really the only thing that carries most of the 2 stars given.  - chicken was alright, not bad not mind blowing. -  We came Thursday evening so it was super packed, but I was annoyed to see other tables being attended to more often than ours, and just unacceptable.
One of my favorites restaurants in the city!!! Always amazing food and even better service! Great atmosphere and the best part is that it's BYOB!!

I came here on a Tuesday night with my friend at 7:15 pm. We were able to sit inside right away. Inside it is very dark and romantic, which can be weird if you are going with a friend but nice if you are on a date.  It is BYOB which is awesome.  The dishes are definitely great to share. We had the provoleta cheese dish. It was basically melted cheese and red pepper, it was a lot for 2 people but would be perfect for 4 as an appetizer.  Next we split the steak filet, which costs $29. That is a really good price just for one person, even better if you split it! You get 2 large steaks and a large side of spinach mashed potatoes. It was the perfect dish to split, it would be a lot if you ate it on your own. I was really impressed with the quality of the food. I am craving those mashed potatoes, I could eat a whole bowl of them!  The staff was very friendly.  My only compliant is that it took 40 minutes to get our steak dish after the cheese  came out. It was two large pieces of steak and I ordered it well done, so that could have been the reason, I'm not sure how long it takes to cook steak. The waiter should have at least stopped by to update us but he did not.  Overall, the food is great and I would definitely come back!

Go and order the Filet w/ Spinach mashed potatoes. Share with 1 other person. Start w Empanadas. Amazing meal, amazing price. That is all you need and you will be a happy person for the rest of your life ;)

I am totally down to get on the dance floor and Tango Sur it up! I definitely came in hungry and left feeling like delicious Argentine meat juices were flowing through me. Being a foodie (aka one that likes to shove things down my mouth), my supervisor recommended I try Tango Sur. She insisted that it was her favorite steakhouse in Chicago, so I was thrilled to finally try this with my friend from out of town. First things first, be sure to make a dinner reservation. On a weeknight, reservations seem to end at 18:00, but we were able to get a table for two outside in the patio for 18:30 with no problems. The interior was very ambient and looked like it was made for date nights. Sitting outside, you get the nice summer breeze and people watching opportunities. Now, for the food. Between the two of us, we ordered three empanadas (Corn, Spinach & Cheese, and Sweet Beef), and the Para Dos- a large grilled meat stand of short ribs, filet, chorizo, blood sausage, and more. The empanadas were BOMB. Each was baked to perfection, and the fillings inside had so much flavor. We loved trying each of the different options and appreciated the effort they put in to making it delicious. Next, the Para Dos meat fest ($40) was amazing. The spare ribs and filet was juicy and tender, while the chorizo gave it a nice fried kick to our meal. Our food did get cold pretty quickly given the low heat of the grill, but if you consume it when it's fresh, it is amazing. Everything we ate, we dipped it with their amazing chimichurri sauce. Seriously, it was so addicting, and one of the best I've had in Chicago. I wish I had a bottle of that for home! Not to mention the BYOB service is great! Our water was incredibly friendly and helped us uncork our reds and poured the first glass. We ended up eating so much food, and for the price we pay, it was definitely worth it. Cheers to Tango Sur! I'll be continuing to dance with you as long as you remain meaty and delicious.

BYOB and some of the best steak in the city.  The place can be pretty packed and there's not a lot of room sometimes but the value of your meal is some of the highest in the city.  Usually, I go to a steakhouse and expect at least $125 tab and I think we usually only pay $70-$80 since we cons bring our own wine.  The only better Argentinian steakhouse I've been to is el gaucho in Aruba.
Love this place ! The steak is awesome and BYOB is a plus! Hard to get a table on the weekends , so reservation is a must ...

The food is mouthwatering. We started with the empanadas and they were the most delicious. Our entrees were huge, and well worth it. My only complaint is how our server saw us twice-only to take our order and we had to beg for the check.

The food was good - the venue is a mess. I don't know if they pay their electric bill or they are trying to hide something, but it is very very dark in here Some people in our party commented that they are trying to make it romantic, but this is the least romantic spot I've ever been to in the city. It is so loud and so cramped, and they have salsa dance music pumping in the background - you have to yell at the person sitting across the table from you. I was ready to leave after 30 minutes, but we were in the restaurant for almost three hours waiting on our food.  The food was fine. It was what I would expect from a $29 steak.
This restaurant is awesome! Been here plenty of times delicious steaks...also BYOB nice comfy spot

Love!!! This place is delicious. And the price is amazing, probably largely because it's byob. We got there around 5pm on a Sunday, and there was no wait. It's great sitting outside when the weather is nice. The portions are huge though, I would recommend a two person portion between 3 people with appetizers and salad etc unless you really love your meat! The ribs in the para dos was amazing, although the flank steak was a little bit dry after we let it sit on the hot plate for too long.

I can't say it enough that this place is always always always always being crowded and packed ! Came here for a date a long time ago. Very dark and mysterious ambiance super romantic! It's very small and tables are tight along each other so it's often common that you are arm and arm with the next party. A lot of people often times come in large groups so if you're not a fan of drunk obnoxious people in your ear might not be the best place for you.  I was told they do not accept reservations and it's first come first serve. Looking at Yelp and the other reviews they apparently do take them but I would request several days or even a few weeks ahead of time. We waited over an hour when we arrived but it's BYOB and I couldn't complain too much at all. Food was outstanding. Meat is very succulent and I have 0 complaints across the board when it comes to their food. Service is excellent and he staff is friendly from what I remember. This is the first place I've tried Argentinean and it didn't disappoint!   Ps parking blows.

I thought I posted a review for this place oops. Anyway I came here my birthday weekend last year september. There was a really long line which I expected from reading reviews. We gave our name and number and went next door for cocktails (which were great !!) We waited awhile not sure how long but lobg enough to drink a couple things next door. This place is romantic because of the candle light but the noise level took much of that away. Very small tables close together. As for the food empanadas were delishes . I ordered the ribeye with the spinach mashed instead of whatever comes with it . I was very happy they were or with substitutions . My date had the grilled chicken with cheese and spinach . ALL  of the food was delicious and well prepared although my dish was better which was to be expected since its a steakhouse. For dessert the waiter gave me compd me the flan not even sure I mentioned it was my bday. The service was great , delicious food and some of the best creamy flan ive had in a looong time . Planning a trip back soon

Came here to celebrate my birthday and my friend's birthday. Absolutely delicious steak for just the right price. The only draw back was the wait time, our hostess informed me anywhere from 1 hour to 1 year. It took about 2 hours before our party of 3 was finally seated. We started with the empanadas, chicken, beef, ham n cheese. Those were cooked to a light but hearty doughy heaven. I ordered the flap meat and it was seasoned perfectly.

Tango sur is delicious!   We started with the empanadas (sweet beef, corn, and spinach). The sweet beef was good, but it was a bit messy when we tried to half it. The corn - probably my favorite. Sweet, but with the chimichurri sauce which came with everything was amazing.   We also ordered the para dos which was so much meat. Sausage was decent. Filet was great. Short ribs was my favorite. Chimichurri sauce was great! Drench everything in it.  Protip: chimichurri sauce. Short rib was amazing. BYOB (or more like wine!)

Great customer service - filled water, consistent check-ins. El Filet was delicious with the garlic sauce and spinach mashed potatoes. Great ambiance with dimmed lighting and candles. The staff was patient as we waited for another guest to arrive and it's BYOB!

Came here cause of the reviews but left completely dissatisfied. I had pretty high expectations of this place however my experience was subpar.  I ordered the strip steak which came with two complimentary salads. My girlfriend found a fly in her first salad and when brought back a replacement, found a second fly. The waiter saw the fly on the second salad and did not care to mention it until my girlfriend pointed it out. The steak was mediocre as well. To be honest I've cooked better steaks at home. Overall, a poor experience and I will not be returning  I understand that my experience may have been a one off but if you're reading this, do yourself a favor and go to the purple pig.

Was so excited to try this place out because I'm Argentinean. Went with my mother and two siblings on a Friday night and it was really great. Very loud and hard to have conversations but that's what you get with such a hopping atmosphere.  Wait staff was very nice. I love the whole byob concept. They opened bottles for us and served us our wine. Chimichurri was great!!! Also had asado para dos and shared it with my mother. Ate so much food with a ton of warm bread. Chorizo was great, the morcilla wasn't as good as I had hoped and expected.  Also tried the vacío with sweet potatoes.  Vacío was great...sweet potatoes not as flavorful as I have had sweet potatoes before.  Would Def recommend and return

Went for a birthday fully expecting to wait, which we did. Unfortunately 2 of the 4 steaks were severely under cooked and the 3 bone in ribeyes that were on special were so tough they were inedible. We were compensated for the bad steaks but realize now it is not worth waiting an hour and forty minutes for and will not be returning.

This was my first visit to Tango Sur. The service was available. The portions were good sized and the food was not heavy. Everyone commented on the great flavors of the food and I was grateful for a positive experience.

By far one of the best latin american restaurants you will find in Chicago. The food is amazing! I recommend trying the "Churrasco" it is authentic argentine meat, lean and juicy and savory!! Great place to enjoy!

A "must-go" for any couple wanting a lovely date night. While you cannot make reservations, the usual wait of ~1 hour is worth it. Head over to the Music Box for pre-evening drinks or Julius Meinl for some coffee down the street. The aroma of red wine impregnating the warm air radiating from the slowly melting candles makes for a perfectly romantic evening. Definitely order the empanadas to start. You can practically hear the street vendor yell out "Che Boludo!" if you pass skimp out on these. The para dos sampler is an excellent choice for the evening as it gives you a wide spectrum of flavors. Pairing it with a full-bodied Merlot is a good idea. Finishing off the meal with their fresh flan is a must. Hands down the best date restaurant for a hopeless romantic.

During a recent trip to Chicago, a friend insisted that we dedicate a night to Tango Sur. Who are we to disagree when promised with BYOB and steaks the size of your face? Dim lighting, shabby chic decor, perfect for our double date. We came armed with two bottles of wine and two bottles of sour beers, God bless Tango Sur for no corking fee. The El Filets for our lovebird companions, ribeyes for BF and me, provoleta to whet our appetites. Provoleta was good but then again all melty cheese is good. The real pieces de resistance were our steaks. Imagine a collective gasp around the table as our servers set down our plates. Count two filets for each order, a total of 4 to split between my friend and his girl, BF and my ribeyes were, without exaggeration, the size of tennis rackets. What you get in quantity, Tango Sur matches in quality. Our steaks, cooked to our exact tastes, ribeyes with a beautiful char on the outside, added crunch from large grain salt. The only one to finish his/her platter? My overeager, ravenous BF, I watched him devour his entree with a mix of disgust and pride.  Best part? The bill. Tango Sur is a GREAT value for your dollar. High quality, large quantity of meat, for a stupid price. If you're trying to impress a date and want to leave with your wallet intact, come here. BF and I will be back when the carnivore inside calls to us.

My boyfriend took me here for dinner as a surprise one night and we LOVED it. Delicious food and if I remember correctly it is byob which is awesome. At the end of our dinner we were brought out a plate of flan which we hadn't ordered and weren't charged for and it was just a really nice way to end the night. It is a little noisy but personally that's not something that bothers me. Aside from that the atmosphere in the restaurant is great. Can't wait to come back!

We have eaten here a few times now and every time we have enjoyed it. Their empanadas are very flavorful and the chimichurri is so good. My favorite is El Filet but everything we have tried has been cooked perfectly and tasted very good.  The service is friendly and very efficient.  The place is very dimly lit (candles only) and it is BYOB with no cork fees.  The wait times are long on the weekend.
My favorite steak ever! Love this place so much. Great atmosphere and fantastic food at reasonable prices. BYOB too which makes it even better value

One of my favorite date night spots, but getting in the door is not always simple. They do not take reservations for parties less than 6, and you're almost guaranteed there will be a line to get in.  But, with that said, the steaks are delicious and most entrees are large enough to feed a small army. Favorite menu item is the Vacio, which is intended for 2 people, but can easily feed 3-4. The portions, along with their BYOB policy, makes this place an absolute steal. Tables are candlelit and they often have a live acoustic guitar playing. So grab that nice bottle of Argentinian Malbec you've been saving for a special occasion and check it out for yourself.

The first time i went here was on valentine's, I felt the food was good enough for me to go back. Today 4 of us ordered churrasco all 4 where cold and dry. We ordered medium well. There service was awesome but the food wasn't all that.

Maybe order carry out. Not sure if that is even possible. Hostess stated an hour and a half wait. We decided to leave at two and a half hours when he came back for the tenth time and said it was still 15-30 minutes longer of a wait. Won't ever try and return here.  Location allows large groups to reserve. We saw many 6+ tables seated right away. Makes those out with 2 or 4 feel like second class citizens. Just stay home and avoid this place!!

Amazing atmosphere! It was a little too dark, we could barely see our food. And it was very loud. But the food was great!! We got the "para dos" I enjoyed everything except the ribs, which I thought were fatty.

terrible check-in process, small waiting room in the back - packed like sardines. restaurant is hard to walk around in, capacity definitely exceeds safety-codes. After a long wait 3x longer than estimated time, we ordered. Ordered Filet and Ribeye, both were chewy and had strings and chunks of fat inside. terrible meat quality.  The Bread was delicious.
Loved this place!! Took coworker for dinner on her birthday, must say it was the best filet i have ever had. Service was awesome!!

It's my birthday and to celebrate I had the worst dinner of my life. We had a reservation for 9:15. We got there at 9:00 and was told "we have no space for you, go in the back room and wait". So we did, along with 50 other people crammed like cattle, that will soon be improperly cooked. It took them 30 minutes to call us. By that time, the beer that we brought for our meal was already warm. This one star is only for the chimichurri sauce that goes along with the meat. Deelish I ordered the churrasco, medium rare. It came out medium well. Chewy AF.  Spinach mash potatoes. Sounds good right? Buttery AF. No spinach flavor whatsoever. Also tastes identical to the regular mash potatoes. It makes me wonder if they just added some green #5 to inflate the price. As far as ambiance goes, I don't know what they were trying to go for. If it was romantic, it was way too loud. If it was for groups, it was waaay too dark. We had one long Roman Candle to light up our whole table. It was so dark, I forgot who I came with. Not only was it my birthday, but my friends came from out of town to surprise me. They weren't too impressed with the restaurant, so they're leaving earlier than expected back to South Africa.

I have been to Tango Sur a handful of times over the past 5 years or so, and I will say after going there last week, it has gone sharply downhill.  Both my wife and my steaks were flavorless.  Her filet was very tough, and my bone-in ribeye was 1 of the worst steaks I've ever had.  It also took almost an hour from the time we put in our food order to when we received the food, and it was just the 2 of us.  The 1 saving grace was the empanadas, which remain delicious.  I used to recommend this place to friends, but I won't be doing so anymore.

Not impressed by the food. We went for my friends 30th birthday.  Called in advance. Place doesn't take RSVP. OK no problem.  Told us the wait was 45m. No street or valet parking so the school across the street rents out the lot. $16 for 12 hours.  Then we get there add our name to the list. The guy at the door say it's an hour fifteen.  But that we could go in the waiting area and begin drinking. (It's byob)  Everyone before us was already being called. They guy kept saying we're next. 3 hours later as we were walking out they say our table is ready. Right under the AC. candles already burnt out. Super dark are mash potatoes was cold before they came out. I won't be dining at this establishment again. The manager Daniel gave us a discount.  But even still. The service was poor the food was average and the wait was ridiculous

My boyfriend and I traveled to Chicago all the way from our hometown, San Francisco, CA and were recommended this restaurant by our Uber driver! Needless to say, this was one of the most memorable experiences of our trip! The food, atmosphere, ambiance, and service were all phenomenal... and to top it off, the two of us spent less than half of what we would've spent at a steakhouse for an amazing meal! (Steak, dessert, the works!) We've promised ourselves that every time we come back to Chicago we HAVE to stop here for the filet and spinach mashed potatoes. Make sure to bring your own wine and/or liquor as there is no corkage fee! It's BYOB  so they don't serve alcohol, but extremely convenient and cost effective! Absolutely the perfect place for a romantic dinner for two. We will most definitely be coming back!

Extra star for BYOB only. Melted cheese thing was good, empanadas just okay, but my god... ribeye and fillet were awful, salad and mashed potatoes were tasteless. I gave this place three chances over the past few years and disappointment never did disappoint. So unless you're taking out a date on the cheap and are afraid of making eye contact or making a good conversation due to the place being dark and loud, or you're accustomed to TGIF or chain type quality you have no business being here. I'm positive most these 5 star reviewers never had a proper cooked meat and/or prefer price over quality. Romantic date... huh? Such subjective term if you catch my drift. Stop dating cause you seem to be doing it wrong.  Ambiance is also pretty awful for groups of more than 4. It is very dark and patrons are crammed in a tight space... claustrophobia galore. It is loud and I was never seated in timely fashion. Showed up on time and had to sit in the back and wait for another 45 minutes.

Great service and food was excellent!!! Must try the empanadas and the huge portion of beef that can be shared with 4 other.. I've been a returning customer for years and it's always the same "FANTASTIC"
One of the best places for a romantic date.  Sucks waiting for your table during winter. A little loud with a bunch of people but great food and byob!

We came here on a weekday with reservations. We had a group of 8 and the restaurant was very accomodating. Maybe this isn't the best place to bring a table of 8 for an informal company outing, but we were all eager to try the food here & had fun nevertheless. I say this because this quite a romantic spot. I'd say 85% of the patrons were there on dates and then there was our table of unromantic singles who were there for the food and the food only. The ambiance is lovely as the place is only illuminated by candles. The only downside to the seating is that there is no privacy - it's an open layout and tables are very, very close to each other. We had to gag through a few overly adamant PDAs and listen to first dates describe their families and another woman who wouldn't stop talking about her ex while on a date (bad move, girl. You'll probably end up being an old crazy cat lady if you continue like this). Point of the matter is: you can hear nearly every conversation around you whether you like it or not.  A great remedy to the aforementioned is the fact that this place is BYOB. We didn't know ahead of time so while we waited for our appetizers we sent a few of the guys from our group to a nearby liquor store for wine and beer. No corkage fee!   The service was impeccable and I've never felt so doted on in my life. Our server was very attentive & pleasant. The bussers and runners were almost too attentive. They would hover over you to snatch up a plate as soon as you put the last bite in your mouth. I know I would be crucified if I were a man writing this, but I am a woman ("socially acceptable" double standards) --- the staff here was almost entirely male and received quite a bit of attention from the females in our group. I dare say, we had eye candy all night. I'm almost sure they weren't used to the attention because  - again - most of the patrons here are on dates. I think it's safe to say that if you are here on a date, you shouldn't be eying the handsome wait staff. Tall, dark, & handsome - all of them with appealing accents & excellent customer service.  Food wise, everything we ordered was amazing. We opted to order three apps (provoleta, jamon crudo con melon, and jamon crudo con palmito ) and then six entrees (all meat) and split everything on shared plates. We all ate well & even had leftovers. All the meat entrees were melt in your mouth fantastic. The seasonings were different and much more potent that what you would get at an American steakhouse. Delicious.  None of us ordered any of the pasta entrees or desserts so I cannot rate them. The sirloin, short ribs, and strip steak were all cooked to perfection. Maybe not the best place to bring a vegan.  The only thing that put me off was their butter. They had delicious house made bread and served it with that butter that comes in square plastic containers with the foil top. The same kind of crappy butter you'd get at ihop or Denny's. Considering the ambiance and overall menu, it was a stark contrast. They could possibly serve their butter as a whipped dollop on a butter plate or even carved off a butter block. It's all in the details.  However, I don't think this warrants taking off an entire star. Definitely recommend for the impeccable service and delicious food.
If you want real argentine style food then this your place!! Love it and glad I live so close

Very romantic setting. The menu had a lot of options and I don't know what half of it is. BYOB is really popular here. The staff was friendly and explained the menu well. I loved the tango music playing during dinner. Check this place out!

One of the best meals in Chicago! Had Empanadas and Parilla. It's BYOB for free, there's a wine store few feet away. Gotta make a reservation or be there early as the wait can be 30mins. The servers are efficient, food came really quick and stuffed us up. Meal for 2 was more like for 3. Great place!!

The place was BYOB and I enjoyed having a bottle of wine with out meal. The bife chorizo was juicy and perfectly cooked. The outside is a little less crispy compared to steaks in American steakhouses. It was very good for a strip steak. The potatoes that came with the dish was also quite good. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said about the sweatbreads and the intestines. Both were chewy and hard to bite. I would stick with the beef dishes if I come again. Overall, I enjoyed my dinner.

My husband surprised me by bringing me here for dinner on a weekend trip to Chicago. We had reservations for 7 on a Sunday night and when we arrived the place was PACKED but we were seated promptly. We started with a chorizo appetizer which was flavored amazingly and came with this excellent olive oil dipping sauce. For dinner I chose the Churrasco which came with salad and grilled garlic potato. Hubby got the T-Bone steak with mashed. Both plates had very big portions and the flavor was on point. Had a very hard time choosing an entree as they have a pretty large selection. They also had a great assortment of desserts which they bring by a sampler dessert cart for you to pick from. BYOB. Definitely worth checking out. Can get pretty noisy.

If you're looking for the best steak in the city, this place is it. The food literally melts in your mouth! El filet is to die for. Whether it's a date night table for two type of thing or a larger gathering like a birthday dinner or a Mother's Day lunch; the staff has always been attentive and able to accommodate special requests. This place is cute and intimate. Memory worthy. Desert menu is also worth the hype.

There is a lot of hype around this place, and its honestly deserved.  My fiance and I split the para dos, and it was great.  This place is definitely for meat lovers because the plates are huge, but comparatively not expensive.  Its also pretty great that its BYOB, and they have a little room with a corkscrew and glasses to drink your BYOB stuff while you wait for your table.  We will be back for sure.

The meat platter for two was massive and we took home a lot of nice meat to eat for a couple days.  We ordered the fries and a couple empenadas to go with all that meat.   Keep in mind that the food is a good deal and even better deal when you consider the BYOB aspect of this place.  We saw the usual beer and wine at tables but also hard liquor.  Some patrons were abusing this and sitting at tables drinking long after they finished eating.  There are two sessions the early bird crowd around 6 - 9 and the 9-11 crowd.  Come early or late but if you come in the middle be prepared to wait.  We waited 2 hours when we got there at 7:30.  The place gets rowdy and the staff does it's best to be accommodating.  That said this is more of a group place than a romantic quiet date spot at least on the weekends.e

Definitely not a family friendly place.The host there is actually rude and disrespectful.Initially we were told the wait was 30-45 mins.After waiting for a little bit more than an hour we were told very rudely without any apologize that since we have babies it's going to take longer.When asked how long again very rudely he told us he doesn't know.I felt like we were an inconvenience and should leave.I've been a client of theirs for a while now so I have to say the food is great but the host shouldn't work there or anywhere in the service industry.
Worst ribeye I have ever had. Couldn't find an eatable bite. Very disappointing because I had only heard great things about this spot. Won't ever go back.
Love this place. Love everything about it! The filet is delicious, the ambiance is nice and the servers are all friendly and knowledgeable!

I've visited this establishment before on a 1st date with my husband. We were very impressed. I thought it would be a nice surprise to take my husband since we hadnt been recently. I made a reservation this past Saturday on Open Table as I normally do. The reservation was at 7. We get to the door & there is a gentleman there with a list taking & asking for names.
