I gave him my name & he stated "not on the list". He asked when I called I told him that Open Table took my reaervation. He then advised me that they don't accept reservations for 2 people only for 6 or more and if we wanted to dine there, it would be an hour and half wait. Ridiculous!  I tried to explain to him again about my Open Table reservation but he wasn't trying to hear me. So we ended up down the street at Coal Fire settling for Pizza instead !!!
What an amazing place!! Service is truly spectacular and the food is great! We have come here three times and each time has been fantastic!

We came at 5:30 hoping to get a table before the dinner rush on a Saturday night since we didn't have reservations. They were able to seat us right away. Our sever was helpful and very friendly, the decor is cool and makes you feel like you're in South America and loved the BYOB. Our food was very good, the steak was big and nicely cooked. The filet was a little rare but still delicious. The prosciutto appetizer could have had more prosciutto but the melon was fresh.  I would definitely go back with a big group of friends or another date night. A great neighborhood gem.

I had originally given this establishment 5 stars due to the wonderful service I received the first time I dined here.  However, I was here for my birthday 2 weeks ago  and the waiter was not polite at all. He was awkward and didn't make an effort to be attentive. When I asked if they had any hot sauce he looked at me like I was crazy and said "Argentine food isn't supposed to be spicy" . I politely said, I know that,but I also know you have tobasco sauce because I've been here before. He then replied, "oh yes,  we do have that". Wth??  I know this review makes me sound crazy and petty but whatevs. I really hope I don't get this waiter ever again.

The hot eggplant is out of this world delicious & the sauce is amazing! The steak dinner with the spinach potatoes is fantastically priced for a large portion of great tasting meat! Dimmed lights & candle lit dinner but still in a very laid back atmosphere is very relaxing! BYOB so you can bring what you'd like to drink is also nice!

I chose to come to Tango Sur because it was in the neighborhood that I would be going out in later that night and due to the abundance of positive reviews. My experience at Tango Sur (and I kid you not) was one of the highlights of my trip to Chicago. The ambiance of the restaurant was intimate and romantic, perfect for a date night with your significant other or wining&dining with your close friends. The candle-lit table and soft music created a cozy vibe perfect after a day of shenanigans in the city. The restaurant has a BYOB policy, allowing you to bring your alcohol of choice to the restaurant sans corkage fee. The best part is that the dishes are so affordable! Living in SF, a steak dinner can cost at least $50/dish, so I was pleasantly surprised to see that prices for the dishes started from as little as $25! I ordered El Filet, which was cooked to perfection. DID I MENTION THAT THE PORTIONS ARE HUGE?? My dish literally came out with 2 pieces of steak filets and a generous heaping of spinach mashed potatoes. All of this for $29! The restaurant definitely was a great choice, allowing me to enjoy the company of my friends. The food, the wine, and the general ambiance of the restaurant brought positive energy and good cheer to us all. I would definitely recommend to anyone coming to Chicago!

These people are masters of the grill. All of the meats and sausages off the grill are delicious, especially with the chimichurri sauce. BYOB is a plus, but long waits are not. If you think the line is too long here then head on over to their other sister restaurants n, Folklore (both have full bars). Folklore is the bigger of the three. I highly recommend all three. Prices are cheap compared to the typical Chicago steakhouse. I love the fruit wrapped in prosciutto. This is simple and simply delicious. This is rare on most menus in the city?

I LOVE this place, minus the wait time which is why I took off a star.  Everything about this place is phenomenal.  Definitely a cute date night spot and the food is amazing.  Staff is attentive and friendly, portions are huge, prices are reasonable, and its  BYOB.  What more could you want in a steakhouse? I mean yes, Gibson's is a Chicago staple for steak, but I'll take this anyday to be honest.

I came here last night to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and considering the reputation, I had high expectations. I could not have been more impressed with Tango Sur. From the ambiance to the service to the food- 5 stars across the board!  The owner, Sergio, is a true restaurateur and I'll be sure to be trying his other spots in Chicago like Folklore. We ordered the provoleta to start and it was amazing with the bread. I order d the El Filet with spinach mashed potatoes and they were divine! We will definitely be back and o cannot say enough good things about this place!!

Food was phenomenal. Ordered the Para Uno. Huge portions. Better than several other Steakhouses I've been to in town that were almost triple the price. Also we had a really good waiter (he even offered to call a cab for us) and great atmosphere for dinner.

One star for the fast and kind service, another for the excellent El Fillet & Ensalata en Huevo appetizer, a third for the Ocean's 11 ambience, a fourth for the BYOB policy, & a fifth because I heard back about my left-behind credit card in less than a day!

The front door worker there really needs a lesson how to make guests feel welcome, instead we felt like a burden. He just had an overall slightly pompous disposition... PARKING IS HORRIBLE. be prepared to look for at least half an hour, and make sure you pay for an extra hour on your meter bc the wait time at the restauraunt was 45 minutes (went on sat around 540pm) beware of the permit parking also. El filet was good.....but i wouldnt crave it again in the future. Overall, its good food. Just nothing special. I was kind of disappointed bc of all the rave reviews on the el filet lol  The chicken empanadas are very flavorful. You dont taste the spinache in the spinache mashed potatoes though....(was it just food coloring?)  Super cramped. I had to move out of a ton of waiters way on my to and from the only 1 unisex bathroom they had. For an upscale place, the waiters need to learn the "customers first" rule... i dont care, but im sure some people would.  Luckily, our waiter was cordial and had overall good timing. Really nice guy.  Its almost a little too dark in there. Very loud. Need to implement valet parking or validated parking with a nearby jewel or something. Figure it out, you are probably losing a ton of customers bc of parking alone. I even overheard a party of 8 complain about the same thing.

The delicious food at Tango Sur will have your tongue singing. It's so good you can almost forgive the 1-3 hour wait for dinner. We showed up at 6, and the wait was 60-90 minutes. They took down our number, but never called. We came back over 90 minutes later and he could not locate our name. Luckily, he remembered us and took us to the waiting room. He was telling a couple arriving at that time that the wait was 2.5-3 hours.  We waiting in the waiting room about 20 minutes. It was about 8:15 by the time we were shown a table. Once you are seated, the service is great--very attentive. My fiancé ordered the filet minon and I ordered Bife de Chorizo. Mine was delicious, but I was jealous of the filet minon which was out of this world.  The decor is lovely with romanic candles, tasteful art, and exposed brick walls. The staff's Al Capone themed Tango Sur tshirts did not match stylistically. The place was quite loud and everyone was laughing and having a good time. That may have something to do with the BYOB. I really wish they took reservations. This place would be perfect without the wait.

Every time I go to this place I have a great experience. The food is fantastic, the service is really good and the atmosphere is amazing. The place gets very warm with a lot of people so make sure you have a t-shirt under your sweater and don't forget to bring a bottle, it's BYOB!

Great food!  Been here a few times and everything I've tried was awesome, so you can't go wrong.  BYOB, so don't forget to hit up the Jewel down the block.  There's always a wait, so come early and put your name down.
My favorite place in Chicago. The best steak I have ever had. They have such large portions AND its byob. Make sure you get the spinach mashed potatoes with your steak
Reservation was made for 4 at 830 on a Thursday. Didn't get sat for over an hour. Dinner was rushed. Food was great.

Good place for a candle lit dinner with a significant other.  BYOB.  If you like meat, everything on the menu is great.  This place can get busy, even on a weekday night it gets a bit crowded.  Street parking is a little tough in this area, but we'd definitely come here again.

Last time I came here was in the summertime,  we ate in the outside patio section. ..byob..churrasco was great. ..nice breeze, had I been actively yelping at that point. .. they would've gotten 5 stars.  The environment is nice. ..candle lit. The seating is too crammed... I mean could you please remove at least one small table so that we could all spread out at least a little?  Maybe that way I wouldn't have to eat with my elbows touching my body to avoid elbowing the person next to me.  This time around i ordered the churrasco again since I loved it the last time.  However since the last time I've tasted the churrasco at carnivale and Las Tablas ... now my eyes have been opened. .. this churrasco pales in comparison.  I mean. .if you've never had churrasco you'll probably love it.  My wife had the Lemon chicken. ..omg. The flavor was amazing in its juicy greatness.. this earned them a star.. this dish is what should be ordered at this restaurant. The potatoes were good too. Overall a nice place. ..and byob...did I mention that it's byob? I'll be back for the chicken.

I am addicted to steak. It is very hard for me to find a place that not only has a good portion size but is also cooked well (and for a good price)! Tango sur has it all.. So amazing and the outdoor seating in the summer is great. The empanadas are HEAVEN, and the steaks are all just fantastic.. I have tried most of them lol! My favorite place to get a steak in Chicago, and believe me I've tried most places in the city! Nothing compares!

Not worth it! If you are not part of a large party, don't waste your time!!! Seriously, take my advice. My husband and I went out for a date night and waited over 2 hours. When we were finally placed in the "waiting room," we noticed it was filthy. There were empty bottles everywhere. There were no clean glasses, even though it was set up to be a place where people could relax. When we first showed up, they told us the wait was an hour.  Two and a half hours later, we were finally seated. The food was okay, not worth the wait. If you cannot accommodate a party of two, let us know. I'll take my money elsewhere, thank you!

This place is perfect for a date, the atmosphere is very romantic. The food and service is great! We got beef and chicken empanadas, poached tongue and Para dos. It was a lot of food and definitely worth the money. I went around 6PM and didn't have to wait for a table. When 7 came it was packed!! So go early if you want to beat the line.

Favorite restaurant in the city - bar none. Worth the wait and consistently lives up to the hype. I've been treated like royalty each time I've been. It's as though each waiter (particularly Billy) treats the table as if it's a special occasion, even if it's not - which is what has made dining at Tango Sur its very own special occasion. Come here for a birthday, or on Valentine's Day or any random Tuesday.... It doesn't matter - you'll leave feeling full and warm from the wine you've no doubt brought three bottles of, and undeniably happy.  Yes try the el filet, and yes try the empanadas (which aren't even my favorite, but dat chimichurri doe). But please don't overlook the poached tongue or the things that sound, errrrr, interesting. Each menu item is as delicious as the last and I get the sweats trying decide what I'll enjoy this time around.  Strolling guitarist some nights in this dark, cozy, candlelit venue makes for an exquisite evening with the ladies, family, or your main squeeze.

Okay I swear this place has been on my bookmarked list forever and I'm sooo happy that we finally ventured out over here for my friends birthday. We had a party of 12 so we definitely had to make reservations in advance. I've been to Argentina so I had high expectations of a good Argentinian steakhouse. Upon arrival, it's dark, intimate, exposed brick walls, great music playing, seriously a great atmosphere. However, the only reason I don't give them 5 stars is because it's fully jam packed in there, I wish they spaced the tables out more and took less people in since you kind of feel like a bunch of sardines in a tight can. That's the only downfall I can think of as everything else is pure positivity. The service is pretty good and it's byob so what can be better than relaxing with your friends, catching up over a few bottles of red to go with your steak. The food is phenomenal, the portions are huge and so worth it for the money. Let's start with the empanadas, they are fantastic. We tried, the beef ones as I our server said those are his favorite, we also had the chicken and the spinach and ham. All of them were fantastic but I have to say that the beef ones truly were the best, they had a kick and lots of good flavor. These empanadas did remind me of what I ate in South America. Now onto the meat, we shared the filet plate with the spinach mashed potatoes and so glad I did because it is a LOT of food. I mean there's no way I could have finished it by myself and for $30 for that plate, I truly thought it was an exceptional deal. And who knew that I could like spinach mashed potatoes. Divine I tell ya. Now, I was already full after my appetizers and perfectly cooked steak, but I knew I had to try their dessert. I ordered the dolce de leche flan and it was amazing, super finishing touch after an amazing meal, and I could bathe in dolce de leche I love it so much. I would absolutely recommend getting their flan because it's light and flavorful and doesn't make you feel like "why did I get this after I was already so full." Overall, such a great experience, drinking malbec with my friends and eating delicious food. It literally transported me back to a bistro in Buenos Aires and I can't wait to have an excuse to go back here. Oh, and some people complain that it's loud here, which it is, but if you get a table towards a wall, it isn't so bad and you can literally here your party.

Have been wanting to try this place out for a while, but each time time there seems to be a huge wait. Let me start off by saying I am not a huge fan of steak but their food is amazing! The portions are huge and enough to feed two people! The customer service is also friendly, even though our waiter did not seem to speak English fluently. Will be back.

Yum! I split empanadas and a parillada with my date, and everything was so, so delicious. I would highly recommend this place, particularly on a budget--it's BYOB and the food is reasonably priced without sacrificing quality.  The only reason that I am not throwing in all 5 stars is that the space was a little dark, cramped and quite loud. I had fun with a date, but I wouldn't want to go with a bigger group since it would be hard to hear people. Still, I would absolutely go back for the food.

Mediocre food and pretentious reservation system.  They like to make you wait for an hour or two.  Sometimes no reservations for under four people, sometimes not over four people.  It's just not worth the BS to get a table.  Underwhelming and BYOB.  I'll spend my 50-60 a person elsewhere in the city.

Before we even got our drinks, the waiter materialized out of the shadows like a poem. He was tall and heavily muscled, with a shock of rich, black hair. Like a Spaniard's hair. Right away I wondered aloud why I trusted this man that I had just met so much, but he mollified me with a series of strange, nonverbal gestures and I surrendered to the beckoning of the natural world. I pictured myself under an apple green primordial sky, filling my lungs with the heavily oxygenated air and watching the first trilobites set foot on land. I then entered a cave where I saw a man, and with dream logic recognized him to be the Proto-Man.  I was all but wearing a buffalo pelt and swinging a tomahawk around a ceremonial fire. Like a Native American, my rite of passage upon me, I crossed the veil from adolescence into adulthood.   This was a real treat. Exceptional steaks and BYOB, so it's very affordable.
Warning, there will always be an hour wait if you go on the weekend. Its good but I like FOGO better. Very good but not great like FOGO.

Well to start things off my reservation was at 10:00 p.m. and by the time I was seated it was technically closing time. The server knew we were annoyed after a while and gave us all complimentary appetizers! that was nice of him, the atmosphere is nice,  the food was okay(I had pasta), nothing big. I did try the steak though, very soft and juicy!  If you do love steak come here just know you'll be waiting a long time.
Screw it, I'm going to add one more star to my review, and bring it up to 4 stars. I ordered the El Filet again when I came here over the holidays, and it's still amazing how good it is!

Wonderful Dinner! Although the wait was a little long, it was worth every minute. We already knew it would be a wait, so we weren't surprised. The customer service was very polite and prompt. It's amazing how loud and tight spaced it looks in there, but nobody bumps into anybody, and we can all hear who we're talking it. And the service is fast once you get seated... It's really great and applauded- you know those restaurants that have less than 5 tables and you Have to beg for some water! Our server Jose was a delight to have. Service at its' best. He recommended the empanadas which were amaaaaaaaazing, to say the least. It had one of everything, and I got the corn and oooooozzing cheese... Wow. The chimichurri sauce made everything that much better too.  The Para Dos was our entree and it was perfect. Still too much for us THREE, but don't worry.  A little bit of everything on the platter- chorizo, spare ribs, filet and blood sausage (I was a little scared to try).  The dessert was SO good! Carrot cake AND chocolate cake... Triple layer... And a little secret, the leftovers were AMAZING the next day, in the oven for 20 minutes. Thank You!!!!  Overall the service was excellent and the food even better!!!

Grew up in Argentina and I can say that this place is legit! Been here several times and I prefer coming during off-peak hours (on weekdays, or early weekend dinner) for the best dining experience, as it can get crowded later on. Nice candle-light dinner, great ambiance. BYOB, which is awesome! Their yummy empanadas are baked rather than fried, and the minimalistic salad is in true Argentinian style. The "El Filet" is one of my favorite dishes--juicy, tender, nice sauce, and not as greasy as some of the other cuts. The spinach mashed potatoes are creamy and delicious. Fantastic dessert selection, love their alfajores and flan. Great value for a multi-course steak dinner!

Does your ideal meal consist of MEAT?  Do you want a beefy meal?  Do you want to eat steaks that hang off the place?  Bring your own beer/wine!  Red wine, of course, to accommodate the MEAT!  Meat! Meat...meat.  Anyways, if you want proper steak, head to Tango sur.  It's a bit away from DT Chicago, but worth the trip.  Meat.
Amazing food, ambience, and service!! And I love the BYOB option, we brought a Ciroc coconut and they helped with mixers! Wish we had this restaurant in the Bay Area. Will definitely visit again!
Most favorite steak house in the city. Craving steaks? Here is where it's at. Candle lit dinner, quality meats, and BYOB?! Can't go wrong.

I've been here 5 years ago and again just recently. It is interesting how this place never seems to change. Recently I came here with some friends for an early dinner. Luckily,  we were seated not far from the window so we had some light. Remember that episode of Seinfeld where Jerry dates a woman who looks like 2 totally different people due to lighting?? Yes, this place would be it. There are no lights except for the candles on your table...so either bust out the flashlight on your phone to read the menu or read the menu at home prior to coming.  The menu is pretty basic...meat and potatoes just different cuts. I chose the filet, which could feed 2 people easily. People come here since is it BYOB and you get a boat load of meat. Quanity vs quality here.  I ordered the filets rare, but after a bite or 2 I realized this was blue rare not rare. The lighting is so dark that it was a lost cause trying to see the center of the filet. Was the steak amazing? It was alright...nothing life changing.   However, the service is another was on that day. The waiters were quick to refill waters, open our beers and wine bottles. It is a nice place if you're looking for BYOB for steak, but not something I would make another trek to.

A neat place for a cozy dinner with a couple good friends.  The steaks are great, but could be better, given all the hype this place has.  Love the BYOB and the desserts - their milhojas was particularly delicious.  The place has a very neat atmosphere - it's candle-lit, busy, but friendly, very down-to-earth.  The music, mainly tango, adds nicely to the atmosphere.

BUZZ - Empenadas (7/10) - Lomo Relleno (9.9/10) - Vacio (10/10) - El Filet I'm not entirely sure how I ended up giving this place only 3 stars way back when. I suppose I used to include "atmosphere" when I first started writing reviews. I remember really liking the food, but maybe I just wasn't attuned enough or something.  I will say, though, the thought of going back to Tango Sur is met with both excitement and dread. It's like saying, "Hey! Let's get a burger at Au Cheval!" The wait is stupid. We got there at 7pm on a Saturday, yes, I know, that's just asking for it, but I hear it almost doesn't matter when you go. There was a 1.5 hour wait for 4 of us. We actually had a 5th, but they said to seat her, it'd be 2.5 hours, and she didn't have that kind of time. So we ended up waiting at the sushi place next door for drinks and a roll each as an appetizer. Although the wait sucks, what's nice is that you can give your cell phone number, and they'll text you when your table's ready.  The other amazing thing about this is that it's BYOB. It's an upscale restaurant, but if you cut out the cost of ordering a decent bottle of wine at the restaurant, that's saving $100! EMPENADAS Because there was a buzz about this, we got 'em too. They were decent, but nothing I'd go out of my way nor wait in line for hours for. VACIO When it comes to steak, I'm a purist. Only salt and pepper for me (unless the steak sucks, in which case, loads of A1!). I don't enjoy Filet Oscars, blue cheese crumbles, bernaise sauce, or any of that stuff. I mean, I enjoy those things, but definitely not on my steak. Technically, Vacio is not really a steak. It's more of a slab of beef, but I have never enjoyed beef smothered in anything nearly as much as this. I don't even have to dress up the description, because listen to this: half slab of range grown flap meat, sliced and filled with olive oil, garlic, parsley sauce, then cooked and served on a grill with roasted sweet potatoes. ideal for two That, and it's basically drenched in it! OMG I seriously can't believe that something this good exists! It's a thick cut of beef, and it's seasoned oh so perfectly! There wasn't a single bland moment nor a moment where I thought anything was too salty. The garlic and parsley fused so well with the beef, and the balance was perfect. The garlic was so good and tasted so fresh! This isn't weak, yet buttery, roasted garlic. This is fresh 'n' strong garlic (cooked for texture though)! The parsley has its own flavor of course, but it even intensified the garlic and even olive oil flavors too! WOW!  Because it was so thick, the saucy stuff was only on the outside of the cut (well, more so if you drenched it further like me), but you still have a lot of beef on the inside, so while you get all those crazy intense flavors (and seasoning), you still also get a hint of pure beef flavor underneath, and the beef was so tender too! Never wrestling with cartilage or with a "too tough" bite. Also since it's drenched in the sauce, every bite was super moist too! And if you're still not salivating, just google Tango Sur Vacio and check out the pictures, because a picture is worth a thousand words, and I don't think Yelp gives me that much space. This, folks, is why you wait in line! LOMO RELLENO This was the more popular item between the two, according to our server. Since we had 4, we got both this and the Vacio. This was very similar; it also was a slab of meat, but it's cooked on a grill with portabela marsala. It's filled with chimichurri sauce, which is basically the same as the Vacio minus garlic.  This was amazing in its own right too. If we hadn't gotten the Vacio, I probably would have given this 10/10, but because I had to compare it, I was missing the garlic on this one. This one also had a little bit of a more bold and peppery flavor than the Vacio. Even though it's a different cut, all the praises I gave for seasoning, texture, moistness, etc. for the Vacio apply here too. If you like bold & peppery, Lomo. If you like garlic, Vacio. 1, 2, OR 20 TO TANGO You all need to free up your Saturday evening and put your name on the waiting list. This is worth it! Oh, did I mention BYOB...with no corkage fee? We ate a lot, but still ended up with leftovers, and splitting the check 3 ways, it was about $35/person + tip! We brought 3 bottles of wine. Imagine going to a steakhouse and ordering 3 bottles of wine, do you have any idea how much that'd cost? So on top of being some of the best food in the world, it's also some of the cheapest! So, hurry up, go here, bring a friend, or 20, or none, just go to Tango Sur!

We went here for my wife's birthday and had a pretty good time. First, the negatives: 1. There's no reservations; 2. The service is attentive but could benefit from having the servers bring serving spoons/knives for the shared dishes and also cutting the first serving off shared dishes. That said, the food was fantasic. The price was very reasonable and would've been even better if our eyes weren't bigger than our stomachs (probably a common thing here - order less!). The flank steak for two was just delightful. The empanadas were amazing (I would come back and order ten empanadas for dinner). The cheese appetizer was underwhelming so I'll skip that next time. Anyway, plan to visit a local bar after putting your name in. Toons is fun and the Ten Cat has a fireplace. Otherwise enjoy this place!

I tried this place twice now and both times I've been disappointed. Everything besides the food was great. Ambience, waitstaff, floor managers...etc. I got the prime rib and couldn't even tear down the meat to swallow it. My friend got the seafood salad and it was so rubbery, and fishy.. so bland. You'd think for a southern American steakhouse, there would be flavor but it was awful. The only people in a group of 13 were the ones that got the filet. I get it, that's their speciality. But just because my meal was a few dollars less and my friends was only $14, does not mean we should be short-shafted. Really a disappointment..

I must say one of the corner stones of lake view you must come in a try some steaks this is the best in the area I have been here about 10 times every time is better than  the next I had the churasco and it was delicious
Best Steak in Chicago. Great atmosphere. Huge portions that are always prepared well. BYOB

This is a must go place with your loved one. The food was delicious, the place was soooo romantic, low light and just candles in your table, enjoyable music. Just perfect for a date or just a special dinner with your loved one. Dont forget to take your own wine to enjoy your dinner. Love it! Ill be back again!

Fantastic flavorful perfect steak, as always. The prosciutto wrapped melon is such a yummy way to start a meal. Our 16 mo old drank all her milk. We asked for more and our waiter brought warm milk for us. So kind and thoughtful!

Terrible.  Called ahead.  Lady said I wouldn't need a reservation.   Showed up at 7.  Door guy said an hour.  Fine. We went down the street for a drink.  Called an hour later at 8 said another 30-45 mins.     Showed up at 845. Said 15 minutes.    Came back at 9.   Told us another half hour.  Kept letting others in in front of us.   Felt like the fat kid at the middle school lunch room who was not allowed to sit with the "cool kids".

My favorite steakhouse in Chicago!  Never have had a bad meal here - I've been here probably 4 or 5 times.  This is not a cheap place, but considering you will most certainly be going home with a doggie bag and that it is BYOB, I actually find the prices somewhat reasonable. Highly recommended.

Looove it! Went here for our anniversary and we got two appetizers, the provaleta and the empanadas - both were great but you NEED to get those empanadas. Wow. We then shared a pasta dish, I believe it was an alfredo-type and it was very creamy but we saved room for the other entree, the lomo relleno. Once we saw this thing, we realized we should've never gotten the pasta dish - it's huge, could be shared with three. I would go back again to have exactly that dish with that chimichurri sauce. So, so good. Nice ambiance. Great for a date and the bill was like $75. Oh, and the BYOB is a really nice touch. Seemingly all nice clientele and the service was wonderful.

Dark lit room full of people. It had a rustic feel to it. Me and a friend shared the Lomo Relleno. We had to wait close to an hour to get it but it was worth the wait imo. There are a lot of flavors in the Lomo, from herbs to mushrooms. Very well cooked meat that you can't stop eating. I recommend the Empanadas too, the chimichurri dip alone is worth it.

we really liked the environment there, cozy with candlelight, not too quiet where it feels intimidating. good for dates or hang out with a group of friends as it is moderately loud so you don't need to feel bad for shouting across the table make sure you make a reservation, or it'd be an hour wait The meat portions are huge and quite flavorful, really liked the beef tongue and the argentina ham appetizer, also, try to get the table grill for two, the meat is so tender and the sausages are quite tasty; we also got the fillet mignon, which is very juicy and the mashed potato is awesome too

I love eating out.  And I do it a lot.  So imagine the delight of one of my friends when he suggests a restaurant in his neighborhood, assuming I have already been there, and when I say I haven't his face lights up like he's won the lottery!  Score! How this lovely restaurant has been on my list for all these years, quietly slipping off my radar screen is unknown to me.  But boy am I glad my friends are looking out for me! It's BYOB so grab your favorite beverage and head over.  There may be a short wait but they will take your number and text/call you when your table is ready.  In the Summer, people mill out on the street, meeting neighbors and friends and catching up.  In the cooler months, just head down the street to DeLeece or another bar and wait it out.   Given I was the novice, I let my friend and the server decide on the menu.  Empanadas?  Sure.  We had the ham and cheese and the spinach and they were delicious with a wonderful pastry.  We also had the provoleta with peppers (melted cheese basically) which is delicious with the fresh bread that comes to the table.  And the steak was delicious served with chimichurri sauce and perfectly cooked. And don't forget to save room for the caramel flan at your meal's end.  It's the perfect sweet ending. It's dark, intimate, and simple with flickering candles that make you look your best.  And my favorite part?  There is also live music.  The guitar player on the night I was there was stellar and entertained us all night long. But what pushed it over the edge for me was the wonderful staff.  No question went unanswered, no request not met.  And this was no small feat as we were there at the end of what looked like a long evening.  And the staff was still pleasant and personable.  That's amazing. Tango Sur got my vote for a delicious choice in the neighborhood.  But what I really loved was that my friend who suggested it took such great pleasure in knowing I liked it as much as he did.  Now that's a perfect evening!

The food here was good. I ordered the "Flap Steak", as per a recommendation from our waiter. I ordered it medium-rare and it came rare, which I didn't really mind, but it was impossible for me to cut through. They did cook it a little further for me, but then it came out well-done. The steak was pretty good, but didn't have as much flavor as I was hoping for. The sauce they served it with was delicious! Definitely the star of the evening. Portions are very generous. Empanadas were amazing. Live music was great!

Food is pretty great, however the fact they do not take reservations is very frustrating. I just left after waiting for 2 hours at another establishment close by, and our table was still not ready. I give up. Good luck everyone - go on a Tuesday night and maybe you will wait less than 2.5 hours for your table. Again, the food is quite delish but not worth a 3 hour wait... Update: Great food cannot combat poor service - we put our name in at 7pm. It is 10pm and no one ever called to tell us our table was ready, WE had to call them. Honestly we are eating at another place and happy as clams. If you're not a party of 6-8 or more, you will wait 3+ hours on a Saturday night. Not. Worth. It. Start taking reservations or improve your food.

I've been here twice and it was phenomenal on both occasions.  First time I came I had the filet which is delicious. They give you TWO filets and a heaping pile of potatoes. Amazing! The second time I split the lomo relleno with my brother. It was a huge portion even for two people! Beautiful restaurant with geeT food. I'll be back again soon!

Pretty pumped I finally got to try Tango Sur! Scared by long wait times on the weekends, I was eagerly anticipating our visit as so many friends said I "HAD to go" to Tango Sur. We arrived on a Monday night with a group of four and had no issue getting a table. However, the restaurant was by no means empty! The atmosphere is pretty awesome at Tango Sur, definitely dark and romantic. The candlelight makes it a little difficult to see the menu, but the ambiance totally fits the restaurant. The BYOB element is key and very unique for a restaurant featuring steak! We brought a couple bottles of wine to accompany our meal. I don't care how hungry you and your dining companions are, keep in mind that Tango Sur serves up serious portions. We started with the empanadas, which I think are a must order. My favorite was the spinach and cheese, but all were enjoyed by the whole table. We also started with the pravaleta, very delicious and melty provolone. The spices on this were super tasty, but it was definitely a filling appetizer for four! I wasn't even hungry when our entrees came...which were gigantic! The boyfriend and I shared el filet and the beef vesuvio. Both were fantastic, el filet comes with two full pieces of filet and enough spinach mashed potatoes to feed an army. The beef vesuvio was tender and moist, we loved the potatoes on the side and how flavorful the dish was. We ended up taking home enough food for at least two additional meals.  Overall, highly recommend Tango Sur! Very unique atmosphere and concept. With multiple appetizers and two entrees, total came to about $70 for two people. While slightly pricey for a BYOB, the quality of the food is fantastic and you're not getting a steak dinner anywhere else for that price. Additionally, next time we go, definitely splitting one entree!

My next favorite place. The restaurant is very clean and is great for a candle lit date. The place is BYOB so bring a bottle of great wine and enjoy the food. I ordered the 12 oz. sirloin cooked on the grill and served with salad and versuvio potatoes, and BABY! it was amazing. The portions are great and the prices are reasonable. The waiter was very friendly and I would recommend checking out this place. Already planning my next sit down.

Incredible food in a lively atmosphere. Perfect for group gatherings such as birthdays, anniversaries, etc. We bring several bottles of wine and stay all evening; get an array of dishes and it will surprisingly be around $30 per person. So far my favorites are the papas frites and lasagna for appetizer and filet or dish for two with the mushroom sauce. Both are shareable and equally unbelievable.

Best food, great service, desserts are to die for and BYOB!  What more can you ask for! Honestly it's amazing, I've been here for two birthdays and brought friends and family from out of town here, everyone has always loved it. Anyone who says this place isn't 5 stars is crazy and doesn't like nice things!

Such a romantic place with amazing food.  My steak was large, cooked just the way I like it and served promptly.  Amazing place for a date or special occasion.  its BYOB but they will give you an ice bucket and open wine or beer free of charge.  Great service.

I have to preface this review with the disclaimer that it is simply not for everyone. When you agree to go to Tango Sur, you have to understand it is a bustling, generally loud, sometimes over packed, chaotic mess, and to add to the fire, its BYOB, which causes some rude people to sit there far longer than they should. You have to accept that this is what you signed up for, and If these things upset you, you should go elsewhere.  For the rest of us, this place is awesome. What you get is reasonably priced large portions of excellent steaks and (if you're smart) some empanadas and the provoletta appetizer (it's seriously just a big plate of melted provolone with bread!!!!). You may have to wait for your table, that's why you bring an extra bottle of wine, or give them your phone number and walk down to Toons for some beer. This is by no means a prime steakhouse, but the steaks are always tasty and well trimmed, and the selection is great.  Quit whining and go eat some steak.
If your just looking for a big piece of meat, this might be ideal for you. If you want a little more out of your plate then you might get disappointed.

I absolutely LOVE this place. My husband and I come here when friends are in town, when we're having a good day, bad day, long day, short day- basically all the time! Their ribeye is super succulent and seasoned to perfection. The lemon chicken is to die for and is my husband's favorite dish. Sometimes there can be quite a wait so make sure you plan for that, but the food here never disappoints!!

I'm really saddened that today is Tuesday and there aren't any reservations available for Saturday left. That's ok. I understand. It's a popular restaurant. The judgement is purely on how the phone call was handled. Not only was I told it's fully booked, I was also just told that if my group of friends and I just showed up without reservations, we would be turned away.  LOL. I don't know whether to laugh or yell.  I chose to hang up instead.  Only reason they didn't get only one star is because I've been here for my birthday in prior years and I know the potential it has.  Maybe they should hire someone else to answer the phone.  I'll take my birthday dinner elsewhere. Oh wait! I have no choice but to do so!

We had dinner here one night after a play. I was a little nervous that my expectations would be too high because I had been looking forward to it. It met every single one though.  The ambience is perfect for a date. We split a nice bottle of red wine and ordered one of each flavor of empanada. Then we split the filet with the spinach mashed potatoes. Everything was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing! We shared dessert but for some reason did not order flan. That's what I really wanted. I think the waiter talked us into something else. I would not hesitate to go back!

The popularity of this place is kind of a mystery to me. Aside from the dark and loud atmosphere which is not very conducive for relaxed dining experience, the food was just not good.  We ordered Mezcla del mar which was described as fresh seafood salad but it was just the opposite. I can tell the seafood was the poor quality frozen kinds you get that the Asian grocery store.  What was more disappointing was the steak portion of our dinner. We ordered Vacio, that came with a recommendation from our waiter.  It was well flavored and smelled amazing but just so tough!! I couldn't believe that a restaurant that specializes in steak can serve such a poor quality meat and still be that popular. Empanadas were ok but again, nothing out of the ordinary. I will not be returning to Tango Sur.

Friday night at 8:30pm. My first experience at Tango Sur started with a phone call, asking them what the wait was for two. They answered 45 mins to an hour. With that knowledge my friend and I decided we could wait under an hour for what's supposed to be really good steak.  After driving 15 mins to get there, paid for street parking, we walk in and the wait has now jumped to 1.5 hours. Fine, we're already there and have paid for parking, so we put our name in then walked over to nearby Music Box's lounge to wait it out. 1.5 hrs come and go and still no call from them so we walked back over (in the freezing cold) to check on the status. Guy at the door looks at his little notepad - I think they must've skipped past me or lost the tiny piece of notepad paper that my name was on because he couldn't find my name. He told me that we'd have to wait another 20 mins but that we could go into the small back room and join the other people waiting. Having already invested 1.5 hours waiting what's 20 more mins? At least now we can drink the wine we brought in the back room. (Mind you, my h-anger is starting to surface at this point)  So we waited, finished our entire bottle of wine later (1 hr in small waiting room now) and still my name wasn't called. I go check with the dude and he apologized and said there were 2 more tables ahead of us. By this time, all the other restaurants were closed, I had started to yelp for diners nearby because the wait had gone past 2.5 hours. Right when we were finally going to give up he calls my name, at this point I was already fuming, if not for my friend who insisted on waiting I would've already left. It was ridiculous. I honestly think that they somehow lost my name and had to put me back to the start of the wait line. If I had known the total wait was more than 2.5 hours I would've been able to make a better decision but they strung me along from 45 mins to 1.5 hours to 2 hours and 2.5 hrs. Had I known at an earlier point in the night I would not have gone there or at least looked for a better way to kill time, it was the stringing along that pissed me off. I'll just touch briefly on the food. They gave us a complimentary plate of $10 melted cheese which was yummy but not enough to quench the h-anger. I ordered a ribeye and it looked amazing but when I cut into it, the  steak just did not have good texture. It felt like I got a cut that had tendons in it (weird for a ribeye) - hard to chew on and not tasting the greatest. The chimichurri was tasty but it wasn't enough to balance out the terrible cut of meat I had. We finished out w an order of flan, that was probably the best thing all night and the only reason I'm giving this place two stars instead of one. I'm definitely not coming back anytime soon - what a disappointment.

OMG words can't say enough!!! The food is F^%$#@! amazing!!! Now as for getting a seat... good luck. The only way we got in was because we decided to brave the cold and sit outside. They are booked far out for reservations, but that does not stop anyone. There were over 50 people in line at 10pm when we left. I just can't imagine why this place has not expanded. OHH and it's BYOB... Just give it a try and see for yourself!!!

Had to wait over an hour and a half to get seated on a Friday evening (you cannot make reservations for two people). The wait was worth it. We order the empanadas (they were ok) and the Parrillada for two (excellent quality and quantity of the meal and the price was even better) we could not finish the meal and took the leftovers home (they lasted about two more meals) I'll definetley be back (with more than four people to be able to make a reservation). The place is BYOB and you will have the friendliest and most courteous waiters. A must place in Chicago !

So much meat... I ordered platter for one...enough to feed one family. Good prices, date night ambience with heavy meat bro like sizes! Byob too. Could I be happier? No. If you love meat, this is where to go! Also very close to jewel osco to kill time before your reservation and buy booze.

I first came to Tango Sur when they were first hot on the scene 15 years or so ago, but I didn't really appreciate it or enjoy the vibe until my husband and I began dating. I've always loved it's romantic setting: low lights, candlelight, great beats (house or techno is not necessarily romantic, but it really just goes with the vibe of the place...sultry South American).  I thought it would be a perfect date spot. He fell in love with the place, and we've used this as our go-to special-night-out place for 8 years.  Let me start by saying we are NOT creatures of habit and absolutely love trying new restaurants and dishes, but this place has become sentimentally "ours". We always order the antipasto appetizer and the provoleta (both huge, and perfect with your favorite wine and the warm bread they keep bringing you - it's such a Latin American feel; sit, chill out with apps, good wine and good convesation). Sometimes we'll order a couple of different empanadas, and then we share the Lomo Relleno (my husband would kill for the chimichurri sauce that comes on the side - ask for it when you get your warm bread...incredible!). I'm more medium-well, and my husband is all about getting meat as close to rare as possible, so they always cook this piece of meat perfectly for us...I take the edges, he takes the middle.  And the mushroom sauce - good god, I could almost just eat that as an entree! Obviously, with all the food we order, we take almost all of the meat home (and they happily pack up extra chimichurri sauce)...'cuz mama needs her flan!! It is THE BEST flan, with a caramel topping....and my abuela used to make crazy good flan.  No matter how ridiculously busy they are, we have never felt rushed (nor are we ever in a rush, and we just soak in the laid back vibe). We've always had great, charming waiters, and the busboys are so thoughtful (as much bread as you want!) and engaged with their customers as well. Our dessert or coffee has been randomly comped at times, which is a nice gesture.  We have brought others here and their food is always top notch as well. The only reason I am taking away one star is because it is obvious they try to pack in as many tables as possible....the wait is going to always be a long one anyway, so if they would just take away a couple of the 2-tops, it would be a slightly more intimate space. Yet, even with all the noise and people around, my husband and I always feel like it's just the two of us. Love this place, and they can never close. Ever. Hints for the long wait (they don't take reservations unless you're a big group): if you live in the area, come down, put your name in and then go back home; they will call and let you know when your table is ready (we've seen this happen a few times)...if you're far, like we are, bring an extra bottle of wine and happily wait in the sitting area in back; they keep it stocked with wine glasses.

Disclaimer: I am giving Tango Sur 1 star on the basis of my most recent visit.  I have frequented this restaurant many many times and have had pleasant experiences for the most part. My most recent visit, however, was disastrous. I went with a friend for dinner one Sunday evening and we both ordered the filet mignon. The meat was severely undercooked and we both sent it back after eating about 6 bites. The next morning, I could not hold down any food or water and a day later, I boarded a 4-hour flight to California (you can imagine that this was super uncomfortable!) I was really ill for about 3 days and was told that I had food poisoning. After learning that the possible source of this poisoning was Tango Sur, I decided to give them a call.  I called Tango Sur because, as I mentioned, I've been a long time customer. I spoke with a gentlemen and calmly explained that I had gotten ill from their undercooked meat and I just wanted to call to let them make sure to tell their cooks to be extra careful (everyone makes mistakes!). To say the least, it was a very awkward conversation. The man on the other end of the line was silent until he finally let out an "ookkkaayyyyy." No apology. No acknowledgement. At the very least, I would have expected a "Lo siento mucho!" type of response. I was just trying to call attention to a serious issue, it's not like I was yelling and threatening. Perhaps it had to do with the fact that I sound quite young on the phone, but I was really shocked that the gentleman I spoke with had absolutely zero compassion and didn't take my call seriously.  If this is how Tango Sur treats their customers, I have no desire to go back. It's a shame because, as a Latina, I love to support Latina/o-owned businesses. But I made sure to tell all my friends and colleagues of this experience. It will no longer be our go-to place for big parties.

Great spot, ambiance, and food in a good location. 4 of us went, we split 2 of the dishes for 2, massive portions. The Vacio had amazing flavor and the sauce was out of this world. Make sure you bring your own wine. I would go again in a heart beat. Service was good. We also tried one of each empanada, they were good, and filling, so go easy on them if you want to save room for steak. Go with no more than 4 people, it's a tight place.

The food was good but the service was terrible.  They sat us in a corner against the wall, then it was 15 minutes before they brought us so much as water and menus.  Then it was another ten minutes before someone came back to get our order. Two other tables were seated after us, had both their appetizers and entrees before we got our appetizers. Several times, the server came back to check on the two ladies seated beside us. But continued to ignore us. We weren't rude, we did ask for another candle (the only light in the entire restaurant) because ours had nearly burned out.  But other than that, I can't think of what we had done to offend them. I'd finally had it with not being able to see what I was eating (because of where we were sitting in relation to the ventilation system, our single candle flame kept dancing wildly around and guttering, making it very hard to see anything on the table) and I asked to have our food boxed up to eat it back at our hotel where I could actually see what I was eating. The steaks were decent enough, but we really felt unwelcome and unwanted. It doesn't matter how delicious a meal is if you're not treated well.   Never again.
Best value steakhouse in Chicago. If you ask, they will give you a bowl of chimichurri... trust me, worth it. BYOB and the perfect spot for a date (candlelite) or a celebration dinner.

I had been here once before and didn't think much of it, but decided to give it another try, especially since others seem to enjoy it so much.  I came here with some family for an early dinner on a Saturday (~5pm) and were able to get a table right away, which was nice.  The staff was busy, but the service was very good nonetheless.  I was not impressed with the food, overall.  The empanadas were yummy and you could put the chimichurri sauce on an old shoe and I'd eat it - so good. The antipasto, however, was average. The salads that came with our meals were disappointing: 2 slices of tomato and raw onion on some lettuce.  Looked more like burger fixings than a salad.  The steak I received had a lot of gristle and was tough to eat, but luckily was covered in the chimichurri sauce so it tasted great, just more like garlic than steak. The food would have been slightly more bearable if either of these things were not also true:  1) It was so dark in there I could hardly see my food.  If I'm going to eat a steak with fat and gristle, at least turn up the lights so I can see enough to be able cut around it. 2) The air conditioning turned on in the middle of our meal and was blowing up on me from a grate in the floor.  Between the door opening every few minutes when people came/left letting cold air in (it is October afterall) and the constant stream of air from under my chair, I was a popsicle by the time dinner was done. Tldr; empanadas were good, but not good enough to make up for the rest of the average food and poor atmosphere. Will likely not return. Do not recommend.

I heard only good things about this restaurant and I finally went there recently. Food is Ok. I had the t bone steak and my wife had filet mignon. They were above average. Can't complain but it wasn't the best steak I had. It was a little too fatty and a little too salty for my taste. We had empanadas for appetizers. They were really good. Both the empanadas and and the steaks are served with a garlic-olive sauce which was the best part of the visit. The restaurant is not small but it's tight on space. Tables and seats are placed pretty close to each other. You have the option to sit inside or outside weather permitting. They have gas heaters outside which work fine unless it's below 60. Music played on background is nice and easy on the ears. It's pretty dark inside. You can't really see what you're eating. Overall I cannot discourage anyone to go if you're close by but I wouldn't travel a long way to go there specifically.

If you're a carnivore this is the place to go! I had the el filet and it was cooked to perfection(medium rare). Two thick filet's nestled on a plate with a rich beef pan sauce, spinach mashed potatoes and a little Chimichurri sauce for dipping. It was excellent! Although this place is known for its steaks, the salmon which my wife had was juicy and delicately flavored with a orange citrus sauce. Although I'm not big on desserts, the flan was one of the best I've ever had, rich, creamy and not overly sweet. The portions are humongous so bring an appetite! We will definitely be returning!  BTW it gets pretty busy so go early or be prepared to wait for a table. It's also BYOB.

With Corridor, Coalfire, and other super-delicious and trendy places lining up on Southport for attention, there was something almost transgressive about ending up at dinner here -- an old-school, BYOB Argentinian steakhouse.  But it was a Friday night and those super-delicious and trendy places don't take reservations and so plenty of other people were in line ahead of us clamoring to get in.  Tango Sur had a few spots left on the patio, where a nest of heaters were fighting off the October chill. And you know what?  Transgression aside, everything was remarkably good.  Yes, the portions were overwhelming: The $12 eggplant dish I assumed was an appetizer turned out to be basically a giant piece of lasagna without noodles. The steaks were so huge that collectively we ate less than half of them.  But the meat was tasty and well-cooked, everything was rich, flavorful, and unpretentious, and there's a wine store across the street and a few shops down that will sell you a beautiful Argentinian malbec. And despite there being virtually nothing trendy about this place, I couldn't help but notice that it was still packed with happy people, on dates and in groups, chattering happily and laughing loudly, eagerly devouring delicious steaks and drinking yummy wine, and for us on the patio, trying for a night to deny the inevitable fact that Winter Is Coming.
Excellent food.  BYOB.  Atmosphere is fun, but loud.  Long wait, but show up, put your name on the list, and they'll call you.  Definitely worth the wait.

Great food along with vibes from Argentina. No lights only candles and great music. The steak and chicken is authentic. However, the host in the entrance tends to be rude all the time. Long waits and no reservations taken.

The food is spectacular and the candlelight dining is ever so romantic. I picked this place for a business dinner but thoroughly enjoyed myself AND my leftovers. Very impressed with the service and the entire experience.  Much more appropriate for a romantic date.

I went to this restaurant recently after not dining here for several years, and am satisfied to say that it is still just as delicious as always.  This place is BYOB which really saves on the bill and allows me to bring a nicer bottle of wine.  I brought a cabernet since we would pretty much strictly be eating red meat.  They have fish on the menu, but really the Argentinian style of preparing meat a la parillada is what you are going here for.  My dining companion and I split the Parrallada para dos, consisting of grilled short ribs, flap meat, sausage,  beef sweetbread and black sausage.  Everything was delicious.  I suggest you get the meat cooked medium since it is fattier.  I am not as huge of a fan of fatty cuts of beef, but coming here so infrequently it is a time to indulge. The parrallada is served on a grill that keeps the meat warm and looks cool on your table, and includes a fresh salad beforehand which is nice to prepare you for all of the meat you are about to eat.   For dessert we ordered the Thousand Layer cake, which was also very good.  Almost like a tiramisu, except instead of espresso it was more marshmellow-y.  But in a good way.   Sit outside if it is a nice day, and try to go a little earlier or make a reservation to avoid a long wait.

Three of us waited 1 hour, 45 minutes for a table.Then, it took us two more ours to order, get our food and eat. Guy who greets you at the door (probably a part of the family who owns it because he was Argentinean, was bossy, and was dressed more formal than all employees) was not very friendly and and first seated the big group that arrived after us. Food was good, decent price. The waiter was really nice. I

We were seated immediately on a sunday evening which was the only good thing about this place. Service was insanely slow. We had to flag down a waiter each and every time. We placed our order all at once, a pickled tongue app, empanadas and a parrillada to share. The lengua was a little chewy and smothered in olive oil. Not my favorite tongue dish, I like mine soft and tender. I do not recommend. We waited forever at which point we flagged down a waiter to ask about the rest of our food. Finally we got our parrillada but no empanadas and no salad which was supposed to come with the parrillada. Our parrillada was lukewarm bordering on cold and the meats sinewy and chewy. I spat half the meat out because I couldn't chew it down. We had asked for medium rare and what we got was practically well done. At that point we called it quits and gave up on the salad and empanadas. The server offered us a free dessert but at that point we were  just done with the whole experience. Bring two bottles of wine to pass the time if you dare eat here. You'll need them.

I don't really love red meat or steak, but the filet is to die for.  Medium rare with the sauce.  Absolute perfection.  Wasn't in love with the empanadas. Went on a Sunday evening during Columbus Day weekend at 6pm for a party of four and there wasn't a wait.  Parking around there was easy at that time as well.

I went with my family last night and we found the food was amazing, especially the filet, grilled chicken, milanesa, and the steak. The restaurant was comfortable and everyone was friendly, especially our waiter, Alfredo, who was the the best waiter we've ever had (and we travel and eat a lot!). Overall, and amazing experience with great food, decor, and service.
Love this place! Great vibe, good service, and the filet was amazing. BYOB so that pretty much explains the rest. Must try

One of my favorite restaurants. Amazing food and byob! The staff is super friendly and attentive. I highly recommend the bife vesuvio and mezcla del mar mmmmm! They take reservations for parties of 6 and more if you don't want to wait long for a table.

The steak is wonderful, and the mashed potatoes set a new standard. I had the El Filet and I was really impressed with the tenderness of the meat and the overall meal. The atmosphere is up scale yet laid back. Dimmed lights and candles lighting up the room. Really beautiful restaurant and I've heard good things about their patio. It's also BYOB!
It's amazing. Always busy, so make a reservation. The spinach mashed potatoes with the steak are something. So flavorful and soft. The wines are beaux.
Good food here but I'm always put off by horrible and bad attitude dudes that take reservation in front. I only put up when I'm not in hurry other wise go elsewhere for steak.

Everything was great. Intimate atmosphere, great food and great service. El filet is highly recommended. There are some people on here complaining about the "authenticity" of this place; noting that some of the servers are Mexican and the salad came out first. To that I say: stop getting hung up on the logistics. It's always going to be a little different in another country. (And why is it so concerning that your server is Mexican?) as an Argentinean, I have to point out that this meal was better than many of the restaurants in buenos aires. I highly recommend this place.

One of my go to places for great food!  Absolutely love the empanadas!  I've had their Para Uno as an appetizer as well and it's a great selection to share among a big group.  I've had their Vacio, Costeleta, and Filet...all served up with their yummy mashed potatoes and chimichurri sauce....the service is also awesome and it's BYOB!  My more recent visit, I tried some of my friends' selections including their Bife Vesuvio and their Pork Chop.  Both were also very excellent choices.  Great atmosphere, albeit a bit dark and loud, but otherwise a fantastic place to get together with friends for a birthday celebration or a date!

My first review only gave 2 stars.. I have been back twice since so figured I owed an update.  You really have to know what to get off the menu.... I hesitantly went back a 3rd time after my last review.  This time the service was great - it was busy but we waited maybe 5 minutes for a table.  We had the empanadas and both of us got the E filet... that was the first time I ordered it.  We both were just amazed... it was delicious.  Perfectly cooked and huge portion.  like 2 meals in 1.  I went back with a large group the next time and again ordered the filet however another girl at the table went with the salmon and gave me a taste... I think I will be ordering that next time I don't want steak.

Honestly... THE BEST STEAK I'VE EVER HAD. Whenever I have friends going out to Chicago, I highly recommend them going out to Tango Sur. We ordered the El Filet and the Bife Vesuvio. EL FILET Comes with a side of spinach mashed potatoes, which were my all time favorite. I don't think I can go back to a plain mash potato anymore, but no other restaurants make that, so I'm going to have to deal. The steak was beautifully cooked and seasoned. I don't know what else to say... But that I could've died and gone to heaven right after this meal. BIFE VESUVIO The boyfriend ordered this plate. I tried a bite and I liked it; I was just too busy with mine. I asked if he liked his, and he did. Just another recommendation for this place! Cheese in the center. BYOB We came with a group of friends, and we all brought a bottle of wine and a six pack of beer. No extra fee. Just bring your drinks!  ATMOSPHERE Beautifully dim and candle lit. Perfect for a date or a nice dinner! Small and quaint.  LOCATION Located on the side of the street. We didn't see a parking lot. Good thing we took public transportation!
What great service and food!   Had dinner reservations for a group of friends.  Taken right to table.  Waitstaff very knowledgable of menu. Don't miss the grilled short ribs.

I was literally in carnivore heaven!  Don't be discouraged by the wait time.  Just go two doors down to Jolly's and have Topps the bartender, mix up a cocktail while you wait.   Make sure you try the appetizers.  The tongue was a huge hit this visit as well as the tortilla de papa.    The Vacio is not to be missed!  Their chimichurri sauce is the best I've ever had.  I would seriously bathe in it! Great value.  Quality food that won't break the bank.

Best Argentinian grill in USA! Just like back home!! I had the parrillada para uno, and I couldn't finish it! It was so much meat... I did tried, since it was delicious. Especial mention to the server Daniel, who, after I told him that I was a bit homesick, he gave me a dessert (the most awesome Flan that I ever had!) and a expresso for free, as a gift!!! Great place! Definitely coming back to it before I head back home.

Came for dinner with four friends, after hearing nothing but the best about this place. The meal turned out awful and I had such a bad experience. The service was bad and the food was not up to par. Only two positives were that we were seated right away outside, even though we arrived 15 minutes early for our reservation and BYOB.  The service was awful. The waiter would disappear for long periods of time. We asked for a few minutes to talk and figure out what to order and he didn't come back for about 20 minutes. We ordered one of each kind of empanadas, except the ham and cheese, only to get all ham and cheese. When the waiter finally reappeared, he looked at us like we were the ones who ordered it wrong. Once our correct order came, they were good. One friend ordered the proveleta appetizer, which she enjoyed. Guess the appetizers are the only edible things here.  Our table decided to split the filet and the chicken Milanese. We ordered the filet medium and came out basically raw. It had maybe been cooked for 2 minutes a side. The chicken was okay; nothing special and a little bland. We asked for the filet to be cooked again and still came back very rare and tasted charred. For the $30-40 for steak, I was very disappointed. I would have asked for it to be sent back again and taken off the bill, but as it was we were running late for an event. Won't be coming back here ever again.

I'm giving it 3 stars because my first experience wasn't the best but I see potential within the restaurant. The wait staff was personable but we waited over an hour (at 10:00 at night) for 2 steaks after waiting an hour and a half to even get a table. Our steak was undercooked and might have still been moving but the empanadas were to die for and the atmosphere is one of a kind. I will be coming back earlier in the night before making a final decision on tango sur.

Groups of 2 can't make reservations so we put our name on the list. And went to find a bottle of wine. We were called (via cell) when our table was ready. We walked there in 5 minutes and were told to wait as they were cleaning our table off. Took 5 more minutes of waiting, so I'd have to say the table was NOT ready when they called. We'll call that minor for now... We sat down at the same time another couple was seated. Their waiter came immediately and we had to wait 5-7 minutes for service at our table. That's not very good. I ordered El Filet- MEDIUM. Before we finished the salad, our food was brought to the table. My filet? Rare/medium rare. I had them take it back. They brought it out again and it was NO DIFFERENT! Now I get the manager. I tell him the situation and he asks what he can do. HOW ABOUT COOK MY STEAK MEDIUM? I let him know it was done twice incorrectly- that's two strikes in my book. The atmosphere was loud and employees were constantly turning the music up & down. I won't give this place another chance. No. Thank. You.

I took my fiancé on a friday night to enjoy my favorite Argentinian steak house. But I was tremendously disappointed by their service. I've been here few times before with friends but had really great time. However, the most recent visit, they told us there will be a 30 minute wait for a table for two only to wait an additional 10 minutes after they called us that our table is ready. The music was so loud on top of a very noisy dining area. We requested to turn volume down but the manager turned it back up. My fiance's steak came undercooked 2x. My costeleta was not as great as I remembered it even their chimichurri tasted bland. Overall, it was not the best dinner I remembered and so proud of years ago. Huge letdown!

Long, endless waits. No call-ahead reservations accepted. Impossible parking. One bite of the vacio makes it all seem like a small price to pay for authentic Argentinian steaks of the highest quality. This food is ridiculously good, hence the constant demand. From the steaks to the empanadas, it's all outstanding. My wife is from Argentina and swears by the authenticity of their food. It's the real deal, prepared in the true Argentinian tradition. We don't go here often, but when we do, it's well worth it. The service tends to be just enough to get your food, not necessarily drink refills (the restaurant is so busy). The ambiance can be noisy depending on proximity to large tables of drunken guests; it can also be intimate and romantic, just depends. Restaurant is BYOB, though we've never done that. Other options are N (enye) and Folklore, also restaurants in the Tango Sur family with lesser waits and also lesser locations. Get your vacio there and save your frustration?

So good I forgot to write the fucking review. No joke I'm surprised I didn't crash on my way home from the restaurant from the food coma this place put me in. Been there twice and excellent food/service both times. I've tried the steak and the pork chop both were the bomb. Would definitely go again, highly recommended. O and its Byob, you don't lose with place.

The bf and I came here for our anniversary date night and it was wonderful! We're both servers who previously worked at a steakhouse, and this is some of the best steak we've ever had! Our server Rios gave us excellent suggestions and great service. Get the fillet. You won't regret it.

In my opinion, for the quality vs. price this is one of the best steak houses in the city. The portions are very generous, the cuts of meat are very flavorable and its BYOB! The only reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because the wait to be seated is always a minimum of 45 minutes and they do not allow small party reservations, which usually makes for a very late dinner. However, if you do not mind waiting and are more flexible this is an amazing place for a high quality steak dinner.

Tango Sur came highly recommended from a few friends who live in the area. Visiting from New York with girlfriends, we made a reservation for 4 people at 9pm. We arrived a few minutes early and were seated aoat immediately at a corner table.  The food was some of the best I've had. The provoleta appetizer & empanadas do not dissapoint. Our steaks were cooked to perfection and the flan dessert was to die for.    Our server Max was great. Very attentive but let us enjoy our meals. Hands down one of the best meals I've eaten in Chicago

I came here on a couple occasions when I was living in Lakeview a few years ago. The line can get very long, so make sure that you have a reservation in place or get your name on the list as soon as you can if coming without one. The food was consistently delicious, getting the filet on my first visit and the New York strip on my second. Wait staff was excellent, food came out in the right amount of time for a medium rare steak, and the ambience was suitable for a romantic / intimate ocassion. BYOB was an added bonus, as our 2005 merlot bottle went well with the meal. Looking forward to returning -  Best, Charlie

Last night, we lucked out getting a table outside without reservation. We read that it takes awhile to get the food so we came knowing what we wanted to order. We set the menus aside, assuming that it's the universal sign that we are ready to order but the waiter didn't look at us or acknowledge us. After 15 mintues, we placed our order but had to wait another 45 minutes to get our food. The el filet was good but the pork was over cooked. If it wasn't for the wait and lack of customer service, we would've like this place.

Last night, after all the waiting (2+ hours) we were actually given a table. But the waiter never asked if we wanted water, apps, etc.  After ~20 mins of no service we got up and left, not without stopping at the host stand and. What's funny is the manger who I clearly over heard saying he was the manager when another couple asked if he was, said no he wasn't when I asked directly.  It seems no one was the manager. No one wanted to make this right. Frankly, it seemed no one gave a shit. Maybe they don't have to care.  But hopefully someday, if they piss off enough people, they will go out of business. I don't know what the food tastes like because I never got the chance to eat it, but I could care less.  I would rather eat out of a fucking dumpster then go back to this place. My only regret is that I can't give this terrible place negative stars on here.

Probably one of the best steakhouse in Chicago.  The potions and taste compare with price are really really good! I ordered ham&cheese empanada, and El Filet. The empanada was okay nothing special. They serve bread and salad before the steak comes out. And two pieces of Filet comes out with spinach mashed potatoes and chimichurri sauce(it was garlicky and has little bit of spicy. I loved it!!!) I got my Filet Mignon and only middle part was perfectly cooked in medium. The edge of steak was well-done. The steak was good and mashed potato with steak sauce was amazing!!!  If you want to eat delicious Filet Mignon until you get tired eating? i really recommend this place!

Tango Sur is amazing! I almost don't want to review it because it will get even busier. We sat outside on their wonderful patio and the service was impeccable. I ordered their regular-menu Filet. It was cooked perfectly, and it seems as though I was served two 8-ounce filets--for $27! This place is a steal, especially since it's BYOB. I can't wait to go back.

An all time favorite has been disappointing as of late. For a group birthday party last week the experience took four hours. Loving it so much we went back tonight for a private dinner. A friend across the way paid for the entire table but the server still tried to charge us. Thankfully, the friend told us otherwise that would be been a disappointing present from him. He was made aware of how his gift was handled. Things aren't going right lately at Tango Sur to motivate the regular monthly visits.

Just ate here Friday night... Oh I mean we tried to. Actually we went at 7:20 and put our names down knowing that since it's a Friday it would be a long wait and we couldn't make a reservation with only 4 people. They told me it would be an hour and they would call me when the table was ready. We accepted and went to get some drinks nearby. An hour later... I called and asked about our status and they told me it should be 15 minutes. We closed our tab and walked over. Then we checked in again and were assured we were next on the list.  Then the host looked me (as we were waiting right in front of him) and said "I'm sorry we are a little behind tonight would you like to sit in our waiting room and open your wine?" this sounded nice so we said sure. When we went back there we were led to a tiny room where there were people waiting and drinking wine which seemed like hours....like purgatory. We decided not to open our wine and waste our lives there and walked back to the host stand. We checked in again and asked again (this was about an hour and 20 minutes later) and they said "in a couple minutes." we kept waiting and finally I asked again and they asked "would you like to sit outside even though it might rain," we said we would and then they wouldn't even let us since they said if it rained they would have to relocate us and there were too many people in front of us. They said "I don't know if you saw the lightning but it's there" in a very condescending way. I will admit it rained horribly tonight. They were correct about that. But their customer service and way they dealt with us was absolutely disrespectful. They do not care about their customer satisfaction because they don't need to. If you don't mind this by all means go. I value hospitality and respect and was not offered it at Tango Sur. And will not be going back.
Good food but in this world of 'food deserts' they should be ashamed of themselves.  The portions are crazy big!  That could be a good thing or a bad habit...

Super upset. Wait time was 45 minutes, that's great, I live local... it took over 2 hours to be sat, they obviously lost our reservation. The staff was hostile and un kind. Very discerning for a local resident. I will never be back.

I had high expectations for this restaurant, many friends had been here before and claimed it was wonderful. Well here is why I would not recommend this restaurant. 1. We where there on a monday night, it was packed with college students. Super loud they where passing a bag of wine around and drinking from it like you would do in a sorority party. If you want quite intimate dinner, not the place! 2. Food took forever! we waited to be served our meal for 45 minutes. 3. We got the Lomo for two at $40, ok it came with no side dishes, plus the lomo was not that great. Their salad is pathetic! a couple of leaves of lettuce, two slices of tomatoes and two ring of onions. Fast food restaurants have better salads. I am very disappointed, We came with another couple. Date night out hoping to get some nice quite dinner away from our toddlers and it was the loudest dinner i have ever had!  The only great thing about it was the BYOB part, and the decoration of the place.

Honestly I was in awe. There is a huge wait even on a Monday or Tuesday. I understand the complaints about having to wait but let's be real, there is obviously a reason for that wait. The food was phenomenal. The atmosphere divine. The people were friendly and I felt like I was back in Argentina, where also you will find yourself waiting eternities to get seated or served as well.   The BYOB drew me in initially. A steak place where I can bring my own bottle of Malbec and save me $35 off the bat is a plus. But the prices here are already affordable on their own.
