We started with a few empanadas which I highly suggest. They also sell them in their adjoined mercado next door as well in case you just need to pick up some Argentina to bring home. But we then split the lomo relleno which was nothing short of a gift from the gods. It was stuffed with chimmichuri and obviously I put even more on. I could have died then and there and been a happy man.  We were waiting for the check and the super nice waiter brought out a complimentary flan with dulce de leche and apologized for the wait. Honesty I cannot wait to go back and get the steak vesuvio. And then come back again for everything else on the menu.

There is nothing bad that I can say about this place. Food, service, atmosphere, food, food food... all amazing. The free corking fee is also an amazing bonus. Three of us were beyond stuffed with delicious food for less than $100! We ordered the sweet breads which my friends had never tried before. The waiter explained it patiently to them and served them deep fried so that they would be easier to swallow (literally). We also ordered three Empanadas which he asked if we were okay with the three most popular - they were declicious! for our main, we shared the Berenjena (oven baked eggplant) and Vacio with grilled veggies. My mouth is watering just remember the meal. A must visit!

What I would give to have something like those in Orange County, CA. Kinda upper scale, casual atmosphere with din lights, long tables, and a chill ambiance. Appetizers are great, service was commendable. But the shining moment were the steaks. Filet mignons melted in my mouth, cooked to perfection. Ribeye was marbled and one of the best steaks I have ever had. Both were seasoned just right, not taking away from the flavor of the cut. Served with a side, your plates will only run you $25-30. Top everything off with BYOB with no corkage fee and you'll be safe to call this place heaven!

I never in my life have had this type of steak ever in my life . All the the other people writing negative reviews are just sad people who even judge their life and just wanna talk since they have no else to talk to you . I am auditoria and I give this place an A+++++ . Thank you for an awesome customer services .

Great steaks, so-so desserts.  There's a reason Tango has 1500 reviews. I Went because of the hype. We Ordered 2 empanadas; one spinach and one corn. Skip the spinach, dull flavor but the corn was spot on. The meal came with rolls that quickly turned cold and stale, so don't waste your calories ladies. We also recieved a salad plate with oil and vinegar, that was also Mehhh. We paid $7 to share the El Filet, which is 2 nice size pieces of filet mignon and from the looks of the plates coming out the kitchen, everyone else got the memo as well as it seemed that 80% of the the patrons ordered the El Filet. It was simply delicious. The steak, cooked to a perfect medium rare, cut like butter. It was an enjoyable meal but WARNING stop at the entrées. The desserts are lackluster and at $6 a piece save your money for the Dairy Queen a half block up the street. We ordered the flan and the thousand layer cake. Not good at all. I would go back to Tango Sur but only for a great steak.

came here for a couple of my friends birthday..we made reservations since we were a big group... it was crowded and busy in there.. it is very dim in there with candles on every table.. the service there was good.. friendly and nice staffs.. ive tried.. empanadas - we order a few different kinds and they all were good.. nice and soft with a little crisp on the outside.. must have when coming here.. it has a good amount of fillings in there too.. Provoleta (Argentine provolone cheese cooked on the grill with olive oil and roasted peppers) - yooo this right here taste good.. dont know the correct way to eat this but if you put some of this cheese between the complimentary bread they give u.. it makes a bomb ass appetizer !! Costeleta (Bone In Rib Eye w/ mash potatoes) - asked for medium rare but it was more like well done.. other then that it was very good.. it was well seasoned and every bite was flavorful and delicious.. the mash potatoes sure balances out the meal by giving your taste bud a little break from the heavy flavored rib eye.
My fave restaurant in Chicago! The filet mignon is to die for. The mashed potatoes that come with are even better. I have a great experience every single time!

I've walked past Tango Sur many times, but never dined there until a recent weekday evening. We were able to sit outdoors (a big plus, since the candlelit interior would be too dark for me), and that was pleasant. The server was very helpful in describing differences between the various dishes, and all the staffers were courteous. Prices are reasonable, and the BYOB policy keeps the check in check if you wish to imbibe. We were there for beef -- I mean, it's an Argentine place, right? We settled on Lomo Relleno, billed as a grilled filet filled with chimichurri and ham sauce, served with portabella marsala. The dish included two small salads, which were fresh & welcome. The meat had good, rich flavor, if a bit salty, and was quite a sizable portion for two. The filet was not notably tender, and there was a fair amount of chewy (but not swallowable) connective tissue. There was a dessert tray, but nothing appealed to us (as if we could have tackled dessert after that beef blowout). I'm glad I finally tried Tango Sur, but it just isn't my thing -- I'm not into this kind of major meat. If you're looking for a Paleo fix, though, this could be your dream come true!

I'm writing this review because I'm craving Tango tonight. Chose Tango Sur as my birthday dinner destination & glad I did. Yummy empanadas, decor was romantic yet chill & felt like I was enjoying a night with friends in Spain. Hoping to dine again very soon & the BYOB perk was definitely a plus!

It's the restaurant I do love to go when every time I go back to chicago:) I can't have any good Argentina restaurants besides tango sur, their meat is so juicy and full of spicy, the staff are nice too. Only waiting line is always too long, but it's worthy waiting:)

I've been to most of the "best" steakhouses in Chicago, and let me tell you, Tango Sur's impeccable service, aesthetic, and cuisine really give them all a run for their money... and it's BYOB?! A 16 oz grass fed filet cooked perfectly with spinach mashed potatoes for $28?! Garlic shrimp with spinach and mushroom? What is going on here?! I was in heaven last night. Tango Sur is a hidden gem.
This place used to be great, but the quality has gone way down in the past year or two.

This is easily my favorite steakhouse in Chicago. I have been several times, for a couple birthdays and other special occasion and would love to keep it as my go to place when I am celebrating something special with food. I always find myself more than satisfied, no matter what I try. Also, can't forget the guitar player sitting playing in the background has been a nice touch on occasion.

I first came here after going to their sister restaurant Ñ (at least that is what I was told by several people) which had been recommended by a friend .  I stopped in and really liked the place.  The bartender told us about Tango Sur so I decided to try it a few weeks later after my friend also recommended it.   My first visit was great and every other time the food and service has been great.  Nice place to go with a date.  I have visited Argentina several times and the food is close to what you will find there with some Americanized twist.  I stop in several times a year and have never had a bad experience.  I personally find the food to be better than what I experience in Argentina but I am sure this is because of my Americanized taste.  I highly recommend the Vacio (flank steak).  It is BYOB so bring a bottle and have a great meal.
Unusual, very interesting selections, great tastes, uncommon combinations. A unique and delightful experience. But BYOB. And the staff was friendly, extra helpful, and very attentive.
This place was so good I have had a breaded chicken breast and the steak. Both amazing. Very fun atmosphere.
great byob spot with unreal ambiance. EL Filet is one of my favorites and the steak is cooked perfectly. However they undercook it a slight so if you like it more done make sure to say that.

It's very very good, I loved my steak, I love my wine, this place does not disappoint. Date night here was the best idea, we had the steak, empanadas:  1. Chicken 2. Spinch & Cheese they were delicious. We both had steaks, they were juicy and huge, great quality and big portion sizes. Prices were reasonable, I would go back again for sure.

If I am ever back in Chicago I am so coming here again. I was super hung over so couldn't enjoy the BYOB my friends had brought champagne and orange juice so cool that you could do that. This is a place where you need to share and do family style because the portions are huge. Can't wait to come back here less hung over hopefully lol

Poor service. The only thing good about the place were the empanadas. Although my husband found two chicken bones in his empanada. So gross. Our steak was supposed to be medium done and was definitely well done. So the steak was dry and overly salty. Gross. The food took about two hours to get and then the check took forever. Not sure why a friend recommended this place. Seating is nice, but to spend that much on food is ridiculous to me especially when we can go somewhere else for better quality food.

I have visited Argentina a few times and this place is authentic. Byob is a huge plus. Great food and excellent service.  The servers are all so polite regardless if they are from Argentina or not. The place is always packed.

Pretty good steakhouse with great outdoor experience. I came here for dinner and had the steak order on a grill, which can easily satisfy two hungry souls. The steak was really juicy and tasty. Definitely worth a try!

Tango Sur never fails me when I'm in search of some tasty red meat. I love the steak vesuvio with the potatoes. MMMmmm. I always go here at night, so, it's alwasys crowded, pretty loud and very dark. The aforementioned things all seem to make this place very unique. Since, it's BYOB, I always make sure I have a nice bottle of merlot in tow. The meat platters that serve parties of 2 or more are delicious and contains a wide assortment of meats including blood sausage - I tried this for the first time here after watching Anthony Bourdain swoon over it countless times - I love it!! This is a great pick for DAte Night. I wouldn't suggest it as a first date location, as it can get pretty noisey. There is street parking, but be careful, some of the surrounding areas require a permit.

Anytime I see morcilla in a menu, I go for it. This one was good, but not spanish-good, nor Argentina-good.  Their meets were decent but well cooked, and the fries were really nice. Ambiance is welcoming and warm, with an extensive wall of wines and three separate dining rooms.. The place is big, but I haven't seen it full. Prepare to pay steakhouse-meets-hotel-meets-Chicago kind of prices

Best filet mignon I have ever had!  I know, sounds crazy, as I have been fortunate and eaten at some of the great steak houses, so wasn't necessarily expecting to be wowed, yet I was.  The spinach and mashers had a wonderful light texture, not too heavy. AND there was enough to bring home. So had it the second day, and still as good, so I did a happy dance!  Yes, am very enthusiastic!   The sauce was amazing, and then added a little of the chimichurri sauce, magnificent!  And love that it was BYOB.  Nice to have such a great meal, first class, without the add on alcohol. The service was great, the food just excellent.  My husband had chicken and he loved it.  The fries, were top notch, too!   It is lit by candles, so a romantic place, or just a wonderful night out with friends.   I could go on and on.  Will be back!

Not much I can add that hasn't already been said about Tango Sur. for sure my favorite restaurant in Chicago. It's BYOB so definitely bring wine. The inside is cute and cozy with light only from candles.  Definitely order the steak with spinach mashed potatoes, you won't be disappointed! I missed this meal even as I was still eating it. The filet minion melts in your mouth, it's perfectly cooked and great quality. So so soooo good. Can't wait to go back

YES PLEASE. Went here for the first time a week ago and couldn't get enough.  Yes, you will have to wait. We put in our name for reservations, were told it would be an hour, so we went to a local bar for a few drinks. Came back after an hour and ended up waiting another 20 minutes. Again, this place is PACKED. Expect a wait.  The food... oh my. I ordered a filet expecting the normal 8 ounces or whatever places usually serve. TRY TWO. YOU GET TWO. It was insane. My boyfriend got some steak as well, and his was marvelous. They were cooked to perfection with tons of flavor... Will definitely be going back for that. Not to mention... BYOB. So awesome.  This is on another level: I felt like I had to write a review mainly because of the waitstaff. It was packed on a Thursday night, and it was clear our server was running his ass off. He was still competent, sweet and very nice every time he came to our table. When we were finishing up our meal, a girl at a table behind us began to choke. Her friends (this is a whole different story, but they were jerks, basically) stood up and calmly said, "uhhhhh I think our friend is choking." Didn't do anything to help her. Our server was the first to run over and help give her the heimlich. OUR SERVER. He didn't even hesitate to help her and saved her life. Seriously.  Wouldn't mind coming back to a place that can save me if I'm dying. Just saying. Love this place. Recommend it to everyone (if you don't mind waiting).

This is hands down my favorite steak place in Chicago.  The filet mignon ( yes 2) are perfectly cooked every time.  I've been a diner for about 5 years and it's BYOB.  I have yet to find any other steak place that makes perfect steak for 20.00 less than your overrated weak houses and you can bring your own alcohol.  can't beat it!

This is the best place in chicago for steak! Hands down. I have been here many times and the food is out of this world. Its also BYOB, which is amazing. Only drawback is they do not take RSVP for small parties. But some things are worth the wait.

A friend of mine that resides in Chicago recommended this place to my wife and I as a "must-visit" restaurant. I'm not sure if it's because I had such great expectations of this place when I visited, but I was pretty disappointed with my experience. We went for dinner: When you first walk in, it's so dark in there you aren't even sure who you're talking to or where you're going. There is no lighting inside (all off) and the only lighting is a candle stick on each table. Sounds quite romantic but when you aren't sure if the steak is going in your mouth or your nose, I'd say it's quite a dealbreaker -- I also wouldn't recommend bringing a first-date here unless you're ugly and don't want them to see your face. I couldn't see my food.  My wife and I came with another couple and we were recommended by the waiter their 2 specials on their new menu (sorry... cannot remember the name of the dish). The food was OK.. nothing too crazy to write home about. The portion sizes are quite large though so we ended up all sharing the 2 entrees and even packed some to-go. Sadly, the best and most memorable part was the bread that came before the main dish came out. Pricing wasn't so bad though. Not sure if it's because I am originally from the land of BBQ (Texas) or because I had expectations comparable to other steakhouses being from NYC (e.g. Peter Lugers, Mortons). Unfortunately, I can't say whether or not I would be willing to give it another shot next time we visit.

Candle-lit...BYOB...steak...a perfect spot to bring a date!  Tango Sur is awesome!  I come here often with my husband or as a double date with our best friends.  We have tried nearly everything on the menu, but our go-to meal is the El Filet (2 filet mignons and spinach mashed potatoes) with a large bowl of chimichurri on the side!  Their chimichurri is amazing and may be hard to duplicate unless you know their secret!   The downside of Tango Sur is the inconsistency of whether or not they take reservations.  I've come here before when a large group of 15 had reservations and then another time with 9 people and was told I can't make reservations.  Either way Tango Sur is always busy especially on the weekends.   Also be prepared to sit very close to others as it is a small restaurant, but I guess that's what makes it a little more intimate (with others and not your date).  Tango Sur is on the top of my list for steakhouses!

Raised in Buenos Aires and lived there over 35 years so I plan my review to get somehow higlighted and the managers will take my feedback to improve the place as it has very high potential. I visited Tango Sur with my best friends recently moved to Chicago from New York willing to show them a little about how the food is like in Argentina, however I was very disappointed. The first thing to note when you visit this place is that they have pictures hanging in the walls, Probably somebody told them they were all related to Argentina but they are not. You will find Lola Flores and Tito Puente next to Gardel :) You may also notice that all the servers (at least the one I was able to interact with) were Mexicans, not Argentinians. Also as soon as you try to place the order you will realize thi is a BYOB place (if you are not a local you may not be used to stakehouses where they don't sell wine). It would be nice if the server was kind enough to show us that there was a wine store just a block away, but he didn't. Well, let me start with the food... 1) We ordered emapanadas as a starter. My friends thought they were amazing, for me they were just OK. They were large, fried, gound meat stuffing, mild taste. There are probably as many different kind of meat emapnadas as provinces in Argentina, These ones did not seem like any ones I had there before and definitey Empanadas + Chimichurri is not a combination you wil find anywhere in Argentina.  5/10 2) We ordered Parrillada for 2 + Chinchulines  + Bife de Chorizo  1st huge mistake is that they brougt the salad first, as if it was a starter. Everywhere in Argentina you eat the meat WITH the salad as a side dish.  The parrillada included Vacio (flank steak), asado (short ribs), mollejas (sweetbread), chorizo (argentinian sausage), morcilla (blood pudding / black sausage) The meat quality was good, but it seemed as it was cooked to order, which opposed to what you may think it is actually NOT a good thing when you talk about a meal that is supposed to be slow cooked (at least 1hr for a medium rare flank steak) . My friend liked it bc i was pretty similar to what they are used to eat in other stakehouses, but nothing to do with Argentinian style. 3/10 The chorizo was nothing like I ever had before in Argentina, it was just ground meat in a sausage shape. Not tasty at all, Real argentian chorizo is small pieces of (usually pork, or pork/beef) fatty meat  and spices. This was more like lean ground beef.  3/10 The morcilla was super tasteless. Real morcilla has blood, fat, and scallion, and sometimes also small bites of meat. This was uniform and bland 2/10 Sweatbreads were really good. the same or better to what you may find in Argentina 10/10 Chinchilines were ok. Not small pieces as we use to grill them , and the order was huge (I asked them to make half an order not to be cheap but so we were not wasting food) 5/10 Price was really cheap compared to most steakhouses. This place can be easily tuned into a GREAT place, but just now it is neither authentic Argentinian nor great.

Took my daughter for a dinner after we purchased her first car.  The amount of food that comes to you can't be stressed enough.  We started with the empanada and the beef tongue appetizers.   There must have been over a pound of thinly sliced tongue with a vinegar dressing.  The empanadas were yummy too.  She had the chicken (half a chicken) and I had the skirt steak (others may call it s strip steak).  Both dinners were huge and yummy and you can't finish it all.  Well not the two of us.  We sat inside which is a little loud but we were against a wall so we could hear one another.  And yes you can bring your own wine.  They are very quick to take care of it for you.  Service was prompt but not over bearing.  Someone spilled and they had that cleaned up in an instant.  I will go back again when my wife comes with me.  There are so many good restaurants in the city but this one deserves another trip.
We really enjoyed the dinner for two.  The meat was a big serving and tasted great.  I would however skip the anti pasta next time.

Tango Sur is hands down one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.   I am biased, because ever since spending a summer in Buenos Aires I will do anything to experience nostalgia for that city.  Tango Sur is extremely hard to get into, especially on weekends, because it is a popular spot that doesn't take reservations.  I was annoyed by this my first visit, not eating until 11pm, but I learned to embrace this, remembering that when I was living in Argentina I rarely ate dinner before 9 or 10pm.  With all the bars on Southport, it's easy to go sit somewhere and have a drink while you wait.  The restaurant is BYOB and I always get a bottle of Malbec to go with the amazing empanadas, which are a must.  They are satisfying and filling enough to even make that the whole meal.  I've also had the chicken milanesa which was perfect and had enough for leftovers.  My favorite dish is the estofado which is a very rich braised beef meat sauce, which I get with fideos (wide noodles like tagliatelle). It is the most amazing comfort food, perfect for a winter evening in freezing Chicago.  I have always experienced friendly and attentive service at Tango Sur and the ambiance is perfect.  Every time I have been there I've had waiters check in frequently to ask how everything is. Once I was provided complimentary dessert just because I mentioned my summer in Argentina! The warm glow of the dimly lit interior makes it a great spot for a date night.  I highly recommend this restaurant--it's worth the wait!

Tango sur is simply amazing. The cuts of steak are always tender and bursting with flavor.  The staff has always been pleasant and the service great.  Only drawback is they don't take reservations so due to the popularity expect to wait at least an hour 1/2 to 2-3 hours.  However, the wait is worth it!
Outstanding authentic Argentine cuisine. Tonight was particularly nice. They had a tango guitarist.

My family loves this place. Personally, it didn't do anything for me. The service wasn't that great, the bread was meh, the sausage appetizer was gross & undercooked, the salad was pathetic, the steak flavoring was meh, the atmosphere was meh, & the music was too loud. I felt like I needed to turn on the flashlight on my phone to eat my food & we came in on a Sunday afternoon at like 3pm. I would never come back unless my family forced me to. I just had an overall bad experience..

I have been coming here for about three years now. I discovered this spot while just walking around the neighborhoods trying to get to know Chicago! I saw this place in the summer and didn't get to come until fall.  Now that I have eaten here  I keep coming back because our friends request it!!! They love the food the ambiance and the service. We take anyone that is not from Chicago here. It's one of the best in Chicago! If I could give more than 5 stars I would.  Highly recommended and refer people here!

I've been to this restaurant about 5 times and I've only lived in Chicago for 2 month. It's THAT GOOD. Parillada for 2-3 is amazing, the empanadas and queso.... LORD ... Delicious, did I mention it's BYOB. HEAVEN .. Perfect place for a romantic dinner, or bday party..... LOVE IT
We loved this place! Don't let the BYOB scare you off. There's a nice wine store one block away. Empanadas were excellent as was the roasted filet for 2 with portobello mushrooms. Great service too.

I am so obsessed with this place! The steaks are honestly better than some of the top steakhouses in Chicago (David Burke, I'm looking at you). The steaks are incredibly tender and juicy and flavorful! I've never regretted coming here, even though there's generally a long wait. I think my favorite steak on the menu is El Filet. It's always perfectly cooked and the chimichurri sauce is to die for. Each steak also comes with a small salad and a side (El Filet comes with spinach mashed potatoes -- yum!), which is more than you can say for pretty much every other steakhouse in Chicago, as those are pretty much a la carte. The prices are also incredibly reasonable (~$40) for what you're getting. Oh! And don't forget their desserts! I'm drooling right now just thinking about the flan. This place is also BYOB, which is cool. There's no corkage fee, so bring as much to drink as you would like! If you forgot the wine at home, there's also a grocery store down the block. The service is always good even though they're constantly busy, which is another addition to why I love Tango Sur. There are just small things that the waiters do that really make this an enjoyable place to eat. The ambiance is pretty dark and it can get kind of loud as it's a very crowded place, but I'd highly suggest this for a date night or a special occasion. They don't take reservations for groups smaller than six though, so come early (or really late) or make a reservation if you have a large group. Seriously, come check it out and you won't be disappointed!
Recommended by a friend, this was wonderful. Lomo Rellano was so tender; large enough for two. Somehow I have never had empanadas before. They were excellent. Highly recommend this restaurant!

The place made me fall in love with chimichurri! I have ordered multiple steak-type menu items over the course of my visits and the meat is always super good. When adding the chimichurri to it, a different level of bliss is reached. They don't take reservations and are usually quite busy in their little space, so plan accordingly. I agree that it is a bit dark and bass-filled, but that makes it the perfect place to take a date...sets the mood quite well! The servers are all super helpful in terms of explaining the different type of vocabulary on the menu (different words for items we would normally see at a steakhouse). If anything, I'd say the roasted potatoes are not the greatest, but you can be the judge of that. Definitely try this place out!

Best spot in Chicago, BYOB, empanadas are amazing. Nice spot for date or best friend date. The wait is sometimes long but it's totally worth it, the food is priced pretty good and portion sizes for dinner are really big, enjoy!

Here's the deal. You're going to get a damn delicious meal. But you're going to have to wait a while. Plan for it and put your name in two hours early on the weekend, hour on week nights. Start drinking wine and look forward to a garlicky and decadent meal. You won't be disappointed. Ditto to everyone else: the el filet is superb and enough for three meals.  Steak dinner for less than $30? I'll take it.

The service was weak. We waited 45 min for our entree. When we finally got it, it was lukewarm:/ We asked for it be reheated. The bread was aight. The salad was meh, don't waste your time.  Spinach empanada? No. Corn and cheese empanada? Pretty effen delicious. The berenjena: eggplant, mozzarella, spinach, and creamy tomato sauce was blow-your-mind-good. I have never had eggplant that good. 5 stars. I forgave them for the bad service, mediocre bread, and meh salad, after having a bite of this goodness.

I ate a fantastic steak here. Very comparable to Gibson's for less than half the price.  I'd come here again and again if the wait wasn't so long. Very interesting ambiance, delicious food and reasonable prices.

This easily could have been 4 stars if the service wasn't so poor.  After we ordered our food, there was a 45 minute gap between when we finished our appetizers and the entrees came out, and that was only after we flagged down our waiter who had been MIA during that entire time.  When the entrees came out, they were cold -meaning they had been ready but sitting for quite a while.  We had them reheated, which took away a bit from the flavor (you don't want to reheat a medium rare steak, even a bit because it turned into a medium one). It's a shame because the filet mignon was otherwise really good, and so was my wife's eggplant dish with spinach, mozzarella, and creamy tomato sauce.  The empanadas were so-so overall:  the corn one was delicious, the beef one mediocre and the spinach one inedible.  The salads were amateurish, nothing to consider.  The best dishes were the entrees, which were spoiled by the delay. I would say pass, I think there are better options with equally good food or better but with much better & predictable service.
Wonderful food, ambiance, BYOB AND prices. Not to be missed. Get the Lomo Relleno for two.

Very pleased with this spot. Obviously as others posted your gonna wait. But if you want to eat at say 7 go there early and put your name in. Then you can take a walk on the great southport corridor. Anyways the food was awesome, we had the empanadas. Then the foley and flan for dessert. All of which was very good. The byob helped keep the price down, and the ambiance was very nice. Highly recommend this place.

I love the vibe this place gives off. Very romantic setting. El lomo relleno is amazing! The reason I give this place 4 stars and not 5 is because the churrasco isn't all that good which disappointed me quite a bit.

Empanadas were average- spinach was boring. Beef was good. Love that it is byob. No corkage fee. Liquor store is a 1/2 block away. Fun to sit outside. They don't take reservations but u can give ur name and they call u when ur table is ready. We sat at a bar down the street while we waited. House salad is a little boring- lettuce with 2 slices of tomato and some onion. Oil and vinegar is given- no choices offered for dressing. Service is slow- took 45 minutes to get meal after it was ordered. U can tell that better service is given to the "regulars ". I ordered the salmons with cream sauce and asparagus. It was quite good. My husband ordered the tbone medium rare. It came over cooked. He had to re-order a new slice of meat (filet) that they could cook medium rare. Excellent. Get the filet!! The flan is amazing.

Celebrated my nephews birthday last night... As we always pick a steak place his favorite. This place was great & service was excellent! I hadn't been there in 4 yes as last time it was just ok...I will definitely not wait that long to bk again :-)
El Filet is amazing!!!! Atmosphere, food and service is always on point!!! Never disappointed.
The food here? Freakin' AMAZING!!! That is all I have to say. The food speaks for itself. Highly recommended.

Tango Sur has a special place in my heart, as it was one of the first places my wife and I went to dinner at when we first got together over 4 years ago. The ambiance is "date night" like; dim, candles, tables close to one another; which we love the feel of.  The portion sizes are huge. Let me repeat, the portion sizes are huge! Go with El Filet or the standard ribeye and you will not be disappointed.  While I've had better steaks in my life, you also pay three times as much, so the value for the money is fantastic, especially considering it's BYOB.  Will continue to speak highly of this place and check out Folklore on Division which essentially has the same menu.

A friend brought me here for dinner. She raved about the spinach mashed potatoes and the filet. The idea of mixing spinach and potatoes didn't exactly sound appealing. And when the potatoes came to the table, I was even more unsure, merely based on the color. But one bite, amazzzzzing. The filet? Incredible as well. Can't beat the price, two filets for like $30? What a bargain. Highly recommend!

We went here on the Sunday of MLK Jr. weekend this year to celebrate our anniversary, and also as a back to school dinner for his sister. This was our first time here and looking at previous reviews we were excited to give this place a try. We made reservations well in advance and showed up a few minutes early to find the restaurant packed. We were told it would be a 10-15 minute wait, which was fine, but we ended up waiting at least an hour before we were finally seated. Granted we might have had to wait a little longer for our table because it was busy, but for the time we waited we might as well have not made a reservation at all. What was most upsetting was that a couple that showed up after us without reservations got seated within 10 minutes of arrival. In addition, we had to ask three different times and spoke with a manager before we finally got to our table. Overall, this left a sour taste throughout the rest of the meal and we were not able to fully enjoy our experience here, which was highly disappointing. Moving on to the food - we ordered the Vacio as well as the Bife Vesuvio. The portions were well sized, and I liked the meat here better than Las Tablas. The chimichurri sauce was also bomb. Overall, the food was good. Tango Sur, I really want to like you, but the poor service we received does not make me want to return. If not for the ruined experience, this would probably be a 4 star review.

Came here for dinner on a Sunday night around 5:30pm. Didn't have a wait but due to a dinner party at the table next to us. The restaurant is extremely dark; definitely thought that it needed better lighting. It felt like we were eating by candlelight. I ordered the pork chop which was decent but I felt that it could've been done better given the shiitake mushrooms and wine sauce. I guess the portion size is big for the price but for some reason the meal didn't seem worth the price tag. The service wasn't great; my friend and I waited for our food for quite awhile and waited again for them to give us the check and bring it back. Probably won't come back again because I can satisfy my meat cravings elsewhere.

We had a long wait but Alex insured we were seated right away. We were able to have some delicious appetizers and our meal was awesome. Martin did a great job waiting on us. Thank you for an excellent visit. The wait was worth it.

This is my favorite little spot! It is so cute and the food is amazing! If you are impatient on waiting for a table, this is not your place to visit! Since it such a small restaurant, waiting time could be long, but it is totally worth it! It's BYOB, so grab your favorite whine, and enjoy this amazing Argentinian cuisine!

BYOB, Argentinian Steak House. Great for a first date or date night. Great menu and the portions are enormous! The ambiance is warm and inviting. The music was just right and up to date. Be sure to make a reservation! Attentive servers and bussers. This is a meat lovers paradise!

I spent my time with my friends just fantastic. The atmosphere was awesome. I felt like in my beloved city Cracow. This place puts me in a good mood. I will recommend this restaurant anyone. Viva Tango Sur ! Izabella

So, full disclosure: I'm a vegetarian. So you might be asking yourself why a vegetarian is reviewing an Argentinian Steakhouse, but I promise I have value to add here. Tango Sur is awesome. The food is great (well, the veggie empanadas, but my friends loved their carnivorous meals), but more importantly, the ambiance is AWESOME. I love walking into a restaurant and feeling immediately warm, invited, and comfortable. I loved the dim lights, I loved the dark colors, and I loved the feeling like I was in a room with just some of my closest friends talking over candlelight and wine. Speaking of wine, this place IS BYOB. Like WHAT. An amazing BYOB restaurant? These exist??!!!!! They are so chill about bringing whatever you want and accommodating whatever glass scenario you need, it's ridiculous. And speaking of the people, the people that work here are so incredibly nice and helpful.  Seriously, you can't go wrong with going to Tango Sur. It is a great date place / besties dinner place / frenemies meeting place, you name it.

I tried to make a reservation for Saturday to celebrate my birthday. I called to see if it was too late to make a reservation, the guy I was talking to was so rude. He said yes it's super late with an attitude. I used to work at a restaurant and I made reservations too, to the rude person that I talked to, you're suppose to reply like this, "sorry but yes it's too late to make reservations". I haven't ate there but after this I don't think I'm going to ever go eat there. Too bad for them I was taking 10 people with me. Guess where we going Saturday, we are going to the nandu!. Screw this place.

I went with about 5 co workers where we had 1000 to spend on whatever we wanted. For appetizers we tried 5 and my favorite would have to be the shrimp. I'm not a seafood fanatic but this was amazing. I also enjoyed the tongue. Yes, lol I tried tongue for the first time and it's rather delicious and tender. Be aware the tongue is served cold but very flavorful. For dinner I order the filet migon  with the spinach mash potatoes. When he brought out two steaks I was shocked lol I kept asking him if this was mine and he said that's how it's served. Be prepared to have a ton of left overs. The spinach potatoes are tasty the next day rather than the day of.. And they could have added more spinach to taste. Overall this place is all about the experience! And it's beautiful inside with candle light lit dinner and beautiful live music.

I have dined here twice, both times with dozen+ men.  The food and service were good both times. The place is loud and not built for larger groups but I'd be happy to go back and recreate those banquets.

Went in last night for my birthday dinner. My boyfriend made reservations earlier in the week  for 6:30 and when we got there we were seated right away. I ordered the filet that came with spinach mashed potatoes, my boyfriend ordered the short ribs. The food was good, however I was disappointed in the service. Our waiter never came to ask how our food was and no one came to refill our water glasses. I had to call a waiter over to refill my glass which was completely empty for some time. At the end of the meal we were not offered a dessert menu.  The portions were large and overall a decent experience just lacking in service!

This spot might be off the beaten path for those who don't live in the are or haven't been taken there by friends who know about it. This is a hidden gem for a weeknight date night or group dinner on the weekend. It's always really busy, and last I was there they didn't take reservations; but you can stop by one of the other bars in the area while you wait. They're known for their Argentinian steaks, and the portions are pretty huge--definitely enough for a couple of hungry people; however, one person could probably finish a single entree. The steaks aren't like your typical Chicago steakhouse steaks, so it's a nice change if you're looking for something different. The scallops, when they're on the menu, are also a good choice; and it's nice that they'll put real burning candle sticks on your table and allow for BYO.

A fantastic experience, but definitely try to get a reservation as trying to walk in during peak times will almost guarantee a significant wait outside (as they don't have an indoor waiting room - understandable given the fact that they can get more tables in)  We had a large party so they were able to give us essentially a pre-fixe cost that gave each of us an empanada, share of the cheese appetizer, an entree and flan. The cheese appetizer might just sound completely normal, but it is pretty phenomenal... the gooey, rich goodness may be bad for you, but it is quite divine. We were presented with a beef empanada which I think was just fair, but not terrible. As a ribeye fan, I ordered that and thought it was fairly decent with good marbling and grilled to order.  The ambiance of this restaurant is quite dark... almost unsettlingly so. While candlelight may be romantic... having trouble seeing your food can be a bit disturbing.  I will say the service, especially given that we were a huge table with a pre-fixed menu, was quite attentive with bottles my glass always kept full. Especially being a BYOB place without corkage fees, the servers were quick to produce wine keys, bottle openers and chillers... not something I always see at BYOB restaurants.  Definitely a solid restaurant and a place I will return to again.

What a quality restaurant and an impeccable meal!  I came here with some friends to celebrate a birthday and enjoyed every moment of it.  They are also BYOB so we came with two bottles vino.  If you're a meat-lover, Tango Sur is for you.  There are options for vegetarians, but their Argentine grilled meat here is divine. On Sunday, the wait was about 45 minutes after you put your name on the list, but it is well worth it.  You have to come in-person to put down your name, but there are plenty of local spots to check out as your stroll around on Southport Ave. Plus they'll take down a number and call you when your table's ready. (Once it's warm, there is outdoor seating available). The setting inside is very intimate - a single white candlestick burning to illuminate our table of four.  It was dim, you might squint to read the menu, but your eyes will eventually adjust to the ambiance.  All of the staff and servers were kind and attentive. They for sure know how to handle a bustling dinner crowd with ease.   Once we set our Malbec on the table, our server immediately brought glasses and helped us open it so the wine could start flowing.  The restaurant is clearly a favorite destination for celebrations, we sat between two big parties also clinking glasses to a life milestone... one table complete with a custom cake and champagne. Where's what we ordered for four: APPETIZERS: Empanadas: 1) Chicken 2) Spinch & Cheese; served with garlic/parsley sauce Provoleta: provolone cheese with olive oil and roasted peppers ENTREES: "El Filet": filet mignon with spinach mashed potatoes "Costoleta": bone-in ribeye with mashed potatoes A cold seafood salad platter with mussels, squid, heart of palm, olives, tomatoes. We got freshly baked rolls to start us off and each of us also got a simple side salad of lettuce, tomatoes and onion.  (Olive oil and vinegar will be placed on the table to dress the greens to your liking). One thing to note, we were planning to order 2 entrees to share (the el filet and the seafood salad) but our server told us he'd have to charge $7.00/person for the other two people as a sharing charge.  We reconsidered and then ordered a third entree, opting for the Costeleta (bone-in ribeye).  So glad we did becuase it was phenomenal. A handful of appetizers and three entrees between four people was the perfect amount of food.  The empanadas were great (you can also satisfy your empanada fix at Cafe Tola further south on Southport) and those two meat dishes were cooked and flavored to perfection.  The red onion wine sauce for the El Filet (you get two pieces of filet mignon) was delicious, but the ribeye had the best seasonings and was more tender (we ordered both cooked medium). I'd highly recommend Tango Sur and would love to come back for another special occassion.  Everything is reasonably priced but even beyond cost, the quality of their food and fun ambiance made my meal here top notch.  Next time I'd try their Lomo Relleno, which is a half slab of fillet served on a grill ideal for two (but I have a hunch would easily feed four).  Portion sizes were generous. For the carnivores out there, you can't go wrong with their Argentine steak.

I have visited Tango Sur 3 times over the last few months.  I was first referred to the restaurant by my brother who has a background in the restaurant field and lived near the restaurant. Let's talk about wait times.  The first time I visited, my boyfriend and I arrived around 7:30 PM.  We were told to return at 9:30 (it was packed).  We went a few doors down to a bar and returned at 9:30.  We were seated in the back room for about a half hour and were finally seated at 10.  Some may think we were a little crazy to wait so long, however, it's BYOB...obviously people are more than willing to hang out and finish the drinks they brought.  The second time I visited, we were a bit smarter.  We arrived at 4:30 thinking we would be seated closer to 6.  When we arrived, they said they could seat us immediately, or whenever we returned, we would be at the top of the list to be seated.  I HIGHLY recommend this method.  When we returned to the restaurant at 6:30, we were seated within 15 minutes.  This last time, I took my mom who has wanted to visit since the first time I visited.  We made a reservation (who knew that was an option!) for 8:30 on a Wednesday.  As I mentioned earlier, I'm sure its tough to predict how long customers will stick around but we were seated by 9.  Think of a reservation as more of a call ahead.  Then you will not be disappointed by the wait. Service is always great here.  My last visit, they had a little mix up and we did not have a server come to our table for 25 minutes after being seated.  They were very apologetic and provided complimentary appetizers and dessert. I have ordered El Filet all 3 times I have visited and have split the meal each time.  It is perfect for 2!  The spinach mashed potatoes that come with it are amazing.  I have also tried the eggplant, empanadas (omg corn one is so good) and the proveleta.  I loved all of these items.  I do not think there is anything on the menu that would be a bad choice.  In splitting an entree and an appetizer, our bill is usually under $40 (score!). I am a huge fan of this place and I highly recommend it to anyone who wants to have a pleasant night out without breaking the bank!
Great food and service.  Reasonable prices.  Empanadas are a must order item.  Just know it's BYOB.

Okay so in a nutshell - loved the ambiance (dark, cozy and intimate - a great date setting), loved the BYOB part (no corkage fees) but the food was less than okay - especially for the price.  I'm not much of a red meat eater anyway but I can appreciate a well cooked filet - and this wasn't even close. The starter salad was basically a plate of burger fixings from a Fuddruckers salad bar.  I ordered the salmon which was the only fish on the menu (but what do expect at an Argentinean restaurant anyway?) and it actually wasn't bad, but not great either. One plus I'd say is the incredibly large portions- for those of you that like to share plates like me- this is def a place to do so. Would not come back tho.

I wanted to like this place so much.. Unfortunately it did not live up to the expectations. The empanadas were ok. The jamon and melon ok. ( melon needed a little more time) the rib eye was chewy. Did not come close to finishing. The potatoes were super salty. The wait service was average. It must have been an off day bc we have 2k positive reviews. But unfortunately I won't be coming back to see if my hypotheses is true.

Came over for a great Steak Birthday dinner mid-week!  Wait wasn't too bad with reservations for a large group. The churrasco was my favorite! So juicy and tender!  This is a steak lovers dream place!  The only gripe I have is that seating was a bit tight!

What can I say that hasn't already been said? This place is phenomenal. The service is spectacular, the ambience is warm and inviting, the food is transcendent, and the byob is just the icing on the cake. If you're in the mood for a succulent, juicy steak accompanied with your own favorite red, this is THE place. Happy Dining!

My friend and I went to a  movie at the Music Box on Tuesday night. We decided to have dinner afterwards and randomly popped into Tango Sur. Neither of us had ever been there nor did we know anything about it. We walk in and are told there is going to be a ten minute wait. Ok. The host or whoever, comes back after 10-15 minutes and seats us. The tables were a tad close together and the lighting may have been a bit too dark but overall, the ambiance is romantic and I get what they're going for. We decide what we want, place our order with who we think is our waiter, and wait.....and wait....and wait. We are given refills of our water ONLY because I flagged down a busboy and other waiters as our waiter was nowhere to be found. We waited 45 minutes for a simple seafood salad and a grilled sirloin steak. Not once did our waiter check on us or give us an eta on the food. The waiters were generally just running around in a rush and what should have felt like a relaxing dinner felt more anxious than not. I feel that for a Tuesday night, they should have held it together a bit more. I would hate to see what the place looks like on a weekend.  When our food finally arrived, it was another waiter who brought it with not a word about the 45 minute wait, when a couple next to us had clearly received their food within 10 minutes of being seated. Granted, I will say that the food is delicious but not worth the wait. We finally finish eating and at this point, its an hour and a half, most of which we've been kept waiting. We try to flag someone, ANYONE, down to ask for the check and what was once a room full of anxious, running waiters, had suddenly none. Another random person brings us our check and frustrated, we get up and take it to the front to pay. The cashier does not ask us how our dinner was or why we are the ones bringing our own check. My friend had left a portion of her steak and was not even asked if she wanted it boxed up. Overall, I would give the restaurant a one star. The service was atrocious and the wait staff seemed inexperienced and slow. The waiters do NOT check on you, there is not a single person assigned to you and it's difficult to get even the simplest thing like a glass of water. Yes the food was good, but I think next time I go to the Music Box, I'll make my way over to Dairy Queen next door. Sure it'll kill my stomach but I won't have to wait over an hour to do it.

After receiving raving reviews from coworkers, I decided to take my boyfriend here for his birthday. We didn't make reservatons, as it was a Tuesday and we didn't think we needed to. We were wrong! We arrived around 7:30pm and were told it would be a 2 hour wait. I felt this was kind of ridiculous at first. Anyways, once we finally sat down, the atmosphere was great. I liked how the only light in the restaurant was from the table's candelight. We got one spinach and cheese empenada and one beef. They were served with this olive oil, parsley, and garlic dip. These were amazingly good! Then he ordered the ribeye with the same sauce on top and I got "El Filet". These steaks were perfectly done and tasted great. Even the mashed potaoes that came with them were really good! I also like the fact that this place is BYOB. We were able to bring some of our own beers to save money. Overall, we definitely thought the wait was worth it and will of course be back!

On Saturday night, my wife and I put our names on the waiting list at 7pm for four people.  The other couple was running late, so when we were told it was a 90 minute wait, I thought it would give the other couple plenty of time.  But I was a bit concerned about the waiting time. We went a couple doors down to the Music Box Theater Lounge and had a couple drinks.  I have to say, the service and atmosphere were excellent.  Their popcorn is the best I've ever had. The other couple arrived a half hour later and we had a few more drinks.  At 8:30pm, when our table was supposed to be ready, we walked back to the restaurant.  The guy at the door gave me a fake smile, and said it would be another 15 minutes.  45 minutes later, they called and said our table was ready.  Wow.  That was 2 hours and 15 minutes of waiting time.  They must be a great restaurant, but I will never know.  We walked a couple doors down to a small Italian restaurant called Pasta Al Gusto.  It was also BYOB, and had plenty of tables.  The service and food were excellent!  So i guess having a bad experience at Tango Sur led to us finding a great, new place.  Thanks Tango Sur!

I cannot say enough good things about Tango Sur. The food is fantastic. The portions are huge. The atmosphere is romantic. The servers are pleasant, attentive and knowledgable.  The boyfriend's food of choice is the filet mignon with spinach mashed potatoes. I always tend to go for the churrasco with potatoes. The cheese appetizer is phenomenal. It always seems a bit pricey, but you can take the leftovers home and eat a second meal almost every time!  We love this place and it's a go-to for all of our special occasions- birthdays, anniversaries, just because you had a crappy day and need some Tango Sur in your life, you name it! A few tips: BYOB There is usually a long wait on the weekends. We always put our name and number in and then take a walk to the grocery store down the way to grab a bottle of wine for our dining pleasure... that way we have something to do during the wait.
Got the El Filet special with the spinach mashed potatoes!!  Yummmm!  Great portions, and really reasonable.

Great place to go with friends and enjoy a good argentine meat. Their chinchulines are fantastic, and their parrillada reminded me from Argentina. It's BYOB, which is a huge plus. Try to make a reservation, otherwise you might need to wait for a while...

Best filet mignon I've had in the city. I can't say I've visited every upscale steak house around but Tango Sur hit a home run. Darkly lit, BYOB, and they take reservations. If you entertaining folks from out of town and introducing them to a BYOB joint this a safe bet. Empanadas and the cheese appetizer are both I'm familiar with. I'd say go easy on the bread and starters to save yourself for the main event. Either way you won't leave hungry with the portion sizes. The only gripe I had was the salad that comes with an entree seems like fixings for a burger. I was waiting for a nice beef patty to arrive next. But you didn't come for the salad anyway, am I right? Two portions for the filet. I'd guess around 4-6 ounces each. Please order medium rare otherwise it should be considered a foodie crime. I tried the bone-in rib eye as well but the filet outshines all competitors. Accompanied by spinach mash potatoes and that addicting chimichurri sauce put me in a zen like state. Our server knew the menu front to back guiding several people in our group to the right choice.   Lately I've found myself comparing dining experiences and they come up short. "Think of what we could have got a Tango Sur". Perhaps its ruined by outlook in the short term but I think I have a found my steak spot without question.

Meat. So. Good.  Steak lovers high and low will enjoy this place. Their meals are unpretentious and made perfectly juicy and just the way you want it. We tried the short ribs and the flap meat meal.  It seems like their steak is made pretty naturally with maybe just a sprinkle of salt and pepper(though it was hard to see in the low romantic lighting), but it also comes with a side of herb sauce that is pretty damn tasty. I have had this place bookmarked for the longest time and now I cannot fathom why it has taken me so long to get here.  The meal was more than enough to satisfy even a hungry man with a generous portion of meat and potatoes. Bring your dates, friends, parents, and whoever else you can use for an excuse to come out for a delicious meal!

Steak.  Steak. Steak.  Steak. Steak. Their steak. Holy crap, their steak. Seasoned perfectly, medium-well, wow.  I almost choked 'cause I bit into a big piece.  Not even kidding. I know, it would only happen to me. But it was so damn good, that I bit off more than I could chew. I learned my lesson now. Seriously, get that f****ing steak, you will not regret it. It's juicy, meaty heaven. Hahahaha. Juicy meat.  Anyway. The flan, man, the flan. It's possibly the best flan I had in my life. Yes. Jesus approves.

Never thought I could down so much meat in one sitting! The Bife Vesuvio, I found out later, was good for two. It was just so good I devoured everything! Can't wait to try the other items on the menu!

The place has a real cool ambience, the minute you walk in the dim lights and the live music pulls you in. Tango Sur was so good I had to go back twice before returning to NYC. I had the paridalla for two which has grilled short ribs, flap meat, sausage, beef sweetbread and black sausage. the following day I had the Milanesa A Caballo beef, breaded and topped with two fried eggs...........Delicious......I cant wait for my next business trip to chicago.

The food is incredible! The meat is terrific quality and the prices are very reasonable especially considering how much food you get. The only major qualm (and the only reason Tango Sur doesn't get 5 stars from me) is the wait time. Be prepared to wait! My friend and I waited over two and a half hours for a table!!! Get there early so you can avoid the wait and you will enjoy your experience even more!

Went here for a friend's birthday and it definitely lived up to its reputation. My filet was excellent, as were the empanadas (we tried one of each kind) for appetizers. Also the portion of the filet was enormous, which was a nice change from the River North/Loop steak joints, which typically give you a 6-8 oz. cut for $40+. This was much larger than that for $28, so great value. The service was really great -  there were always waiters around to uncork the bottles of wine and open the craft beer (we forgot to bring a bottle opener) that we had brought.  The place has a nice intimate atmosphere as well. I definitely recommend this place and already want to go back.

If you're looking for a romantic restaurant look no further. Tango Sur is awesome. The lighting is very dim but candles provide a nice ambience at each table. I used to live in Argentina so I had high expectations for the food and I was not disappointed. For beginners, I would recommend getting the empanadas to start. I liked being able to bring my own bottle of Malbec. Many people who worked there are Argentinian so it was nice that the experience felt authentic. My boyfriend thought that the service was a little slow. I had to agree but I reassured him that in Argentina things are not as rushed as they are here. For my birthday they brought me out a piece of delicious dulce de leche flan. I am definitely planning on returning.

My family and friends recently celebrated my birthday at Tango Sur. I have never been there before but heard great things from everyone. We had a table waiting for us as the 5 of us got there. We brought 2 wine bottles and champagne to celebrate and got a chiller for the whites right away. The table was small for 5 of us, (it was two little tables put together) I was sitting in between my friend and my boyfriend. Felt squished between those two and would have liked more space to enjoy the experience fully. We ordered the provoleta and empanadas to start. Delicious. My mom doesn't eat meat and the server joked about that with us. since this is a steakhouse. Over all the server was great and I forgave him for the inappropriate joke. For dinner I had el filet, which was done perfectly and you get two filets. The portion was huge! My boyfriend had the t-bone. He loved it. Everyone else enjoyed their dinner as well and for dessert I got flan and we shared a few of them for the table. Very good. I liked this restaurant a lot, except for it was really really loud and it was hard to carry on a conversation. The atmosphere with the candles is a beautiful concept, just hard to see what you're eating. I will be back and try it again.

I've been to Argentina, had the grilled meats there, and this place is legit! There is a large variety of meats prepared in different ways and surprisingly different flavors (we got a tasty mushroom-wine sauce filet mignon). To try the most things, share the mixed grill with several cuts of beef and two kinds of sausage.  NOTE: the best, most specifically Argentinian item is actually the oily, herby green sauce that comes with most dishes. Runner up is the excellent selection of empanadas.  NOTE2: this is a date spot environment. It's quite dark and most of the light is from candles.

The food is absolutely amazing, but the wait is very long. I went on Valentine's Day knowing there was going to be a long wait (I was prepared to wait 2 hours). We arrived early and put are name down since they don't take reservations. The host wrote our name down on a notepad and said about 1 1/2-2 hours and that they would give us a call. They never did and lost are name somehow so finally after 3 hours we got seated. It is such a romantic place very dim and dinner is eaten by candlelight. I got the Salmon and my date got the filet both absolutely amazing. I would definitely go back, but I need to prepare myself for the wait!

Came here for my brother's birthday about a year back.  I remember the service being really great...and food was even more amazing.  I had the stuffed filet...I cannot remember the name but damn!  So good.  Also, the empanadas with the chimichurri sauce was great!  Make sure you have a reservation because if not, the wait can be a while.  We had a reservation and we still had to wait about 10 mins for a table to be setup.  All in all, great atmosphere to come have a good meal and a bottle of wine (BYOB).

Great food! Came in last minute with no reservations on Valentine's and was seated right away (I guess it was just our lucky night). The location is nice and quint with candle lite tables. They have tango music playing am just at the right volume. The food is delusions. My date had an amazing Churrasco steak for a great price. Cooked just right with a great juice. I order a salmon with a nice flavor and delicious sauce. The best bar it was byob. We defiantly will be coming again !!

This restaurant is unpretentious. It has a rustic, intimate, casual and lively vibe. There was no music playing on Thursday evening, Feb. 12, 2015. We arrived at 6:15 pm and were quickly seated. I ordered the grilled filet mignon which was served with a white wine sauce (very dark brown, thin broth, but light). This sauce provided a prodigious explosion of sabor which was the perfect amalgamation. The meat was tender, but dense, and similar in texture to venison, but without its gaminess. The meat alone receives 4-stars, but the side dish was "Meh" and receives 2-stars. The filet had the perfect amount of marble-ization with a creamy bold sabor. I had a pretty dull steak knife, but my butter knife worked beautifully! . There were four of us. By the time 7 pm rolled around every table was occupied. Tango Sur (which means Tango South) has a BYOB policy. Sweet baby Jesus let's drink the evening away, and so we did!    The plating was nothing exciting and not a beautiful presentation. It was two large pieces of tender filet mignon served with a large portion of green-colored spinach mashed potatoes. I was feasting copiously and thought, "This is going to require a wine with some depth!" The spinach is pureed and added into the potatoes giving them a green color. They definitely lacked flavor. I used the wine sauce and the chimichurri sauce to give them some sabor, pero nada trabajo. In the end, I left them on my plate. I took the second filet mignon home.  Our server, Ermanual, was hospitable, attentive and professional. He made sure we had water refills, and stopped by several times to ask "how is everything" which we all appreciated. The only negative: The wine glasses are very small and narrow preventing the wine from breathing and making it difficult to swirl the wine. They need to invest in larger wine glasses. We brought a bottle of red wine from Argentina. The name is Diseño, which means "Design." This wine has thrived in Argentina since the 1800's and is now considered among the world's most distinguished red wines. No, this is not a $200 bottle of wine (between $10 to $12). It has dark berry fruit medley, melted English licorice, bittersweet dark chocolate and almost minty bursts of blackberry jam. The mid-palate features a ripe tannin as it hits the back of your throat with a nice balance and finishing with a juicy kick of cherries. This wine pairs perfectly with any red meat! For appetizers, we ordered several kinds of empanadas (beef, ham and cheese and chicken). I had the chicken, which was very salty but I still ate it because I was fairly hungry. I rate the chicken Empanada with 3-stars. Crispy and flaky, yet light, is how I describe the empanadas' exterior. Complimentary bread rolls were served warm with a fluffy interior and a crispy, crunchy exterior. We were also served boring salads which consisted of lettuce, tomatoes and raw onions. Vinegar and oil was placed on the table. My husband had the rib eye (massively huge) which was served with wedged Vesuvio potatoes. He said the potatoes were dry and not very flavorful. This dish is fantastic for huge appetites!  His final rating, 4-stars.  My friends tried the rib tips with Vesuvio potatoes (huge meat portions). They  didn't care for the potatoes. She said it was a "big miss" and she was hoping it would come with something else. When I asked her "what"  she answered plantains or Spanish yellow rice. Their final ratings, 4-stars. They really enjoyed  the rib tips and took the other half home. Our total was $126 and change (excluding tip). We ordered one dessert and shared it between 3-people. I didn't have any, because I don't "do" sweets. However, they said they really enjoyed the dessert (a cake with several layers drizzled with caramel).  SOME TIPS/Recommendations to keep in mind........ 1) Wine recommendations (Red) -- Diseño Malbec (from Argentina) -- OR Bardolino -- a light wine from the Veneto region of Italy and blended from several grapes. It is garnet in color, dry and slightly bitter, sometimes lightly sparkling OR Barolo -- Italian made from Nebbiolo grapes. It is dark, smooth and full-bodied. 2) This is a "Pay to Park" neighborhood, and parking can be challenging. 3) Great spot for a "date" night with your spouse or significant other (geared toward adults -- not children). 5) RESERVATIONS are only accepted for parties of six or more.  6) All Major Credit cards are accepted (including American Express Gift Cards) 7) Bring a pocket-size flashlight to read the menu (very dark place)

This is by far my favorite restaurant in Chicago. I have gone here with my fiancé, with family and with friends. It is absolutely delicious and a BYOB! The BYOB makes it even more worth paying the price for the food. They do not charge a corking fee and will keep your wine chilled, refilling your glasses as needed. I have seen people bring beer and hard liquor as well.  Obviously the steak is highly recommended, however I am a pescatarian and order either the salmon dish or the eggplant. They are both delicious! I also recommend the empanadas. The chimichurri sauce is very good!  The environment is very intimate. It sometimes feels dark and is a little tight which can make it hard to hear your company. They have a little drinking room while you wait for your table. I highly recommend making a reservation far in advance, especially for a larger group.  We went here for Valentines Day one year and they gave each table a rose which was very sweet.  If anyone is looking for a restaurant in Chicago, I will without a doubt always recommend Tango Sur!

Exceptional vday dinner. My boyfriend and I came here for the first time for valentines and were absolutely stunned starting with the corn cheese and spinach cheese empanadas. These were so fresh that they literally melted in your mouth - def a must try!  For the main dish, we ordered the pork chop as well as the bife angosto. Both were delicious. In particular, the pork chop was served with a creamy mushroom sauce which was heaven. To end, we got the flan which was to die for! In regards to the overall restaurant experience I would say an a+. The staff were cordial and pleasant and the ambiance was romantic and quaint.  Another plus about tango sur is the large quantity of food, you won't be hungry when you leave haha. Oh, also dont forget that it is BYOB!!  Definitely a perfect date spot!
My favorite place ever!! Have been here a handful of times and I'm never disappointed!! Amazing steaks and drinks!!

I'm going to get kicked out of Chicago for saying this, but everybody I know and their Dad back home in Wisconsin can make a much better steak than Tango Sur. That being said, the ambience is awesome. Don't waste your money unless you're going on a date here.

A nice neighborhood alternative to Chicago's many "capital-S" Steakhouses, with lots of options including grass-fed, grass-finished beef that will bring a special smile to the face of Paleo diners. Great options for salads, sides and desserts (though we didn't indulges). My ribeye was marbled perfection and the heart of palm and jamon serrano salad was a great starter. If you have a solid wine collection, BYOB makes this an even better value. You don't get quite the level of romance of one of the high roller joints, but you also aren't paying for it and the service is perfectly nice. It does get pretty loud when full but table by table falls silent when the steaks come sizzling to the table!

Romantic yet casual setting, can be pretty loud. Warm bread, best spinach and cheese empanada I've ever had, delicious steak with spinach mash potato, and amazing eggplant lasagna! Was not a big fan of the mix grill pate though. More importantly byob so bring a few bottles of wine! Average wait time is 1-1.5 hours so best if you put your name on the list and they call you 10 minutes before seating!

Put your big boy pants on kids because TS doesn't mess around when it comes to their steak. From start to finish this place was excellent. A. We had a reservation and they had our table ready when we arrived  B. The ambiance was casual, dark, yet cozy and they even had a live guitar player so party was super thrilled.  C. Appetizers were killer. That cheese plate will give you a heart attack but the hospital visit will be worth it. D. The steaks were perfect yet not over priced. This isn't some downtown chain trying to tell you who they are. TS just tries to give you great food and you can tell. F. BOYB - need I say more. Bring rich reds. G. Service was outstanding and not overbearing. I will be back. No question.

Somehow I live right around the corner from here and I'm not 300 lbs. This place is one of the better "steak houses" in Chicago and it's BYOB with no corking fee. I don't really consider it a steak house because it doesn't have that feel. It's traditional Argentinian meats, or at least I think it is, considering I've never even been to Mexico (HA!). The food is fantastic, I always get the Filet on their specialty menu. I'm not sure what the difference is between the cuts of meat, but they always tell me to get that one, so I do. We've also tried the Vacio, and it's not bad, but I'd definitely recommend getting your own plate rather than something that's built for two.  I only give it 4-stars because sometimes the service is less than impressive. Their strategy to taking names and phone numbers is absolutely awful and you could find yourself waiting a very long time.

This restaurant is great! It is BYOB and I always go with a big group of friends and they have no problem accommodating us. The service is great and the food is even better. The cooked cheese appetizer is one of my favorites and you can't go wrong with the filet. I have also tried the gnocchi and enjoyed that as well. I like the white wine sauce better than the red sauce. Much more flavorful.

Can I be honest? This place was pretty disappointing. My friend and I came in for dinner around 5:30 on a Sunday night and it was very busy - we were seated immediately but by the time we left, pretty much every table was full. Things started off well: the waiter filled our water glasses, brought menus, and gave us a bread basket, for which we requested butter. The bread was actually my favorite part of the meal - great, since it means the bread was good, but bad, because the rest of the meal was not that good. The bread was freshly baked (or at least tasted convincingly hot and crusty) and wonderful. For the entrees, I ordered the churrasco - a 12 oz sirloin steak, served with potatoes and salad. The salad was pretty boring - lettuce leaves, raw tomato and onion slices, oil and vinegar for dressing - but unlikely to offend. The actual steak was enormous. I was only able to finish half of it, plus a few potato slices. This may have been owing to the portion size, but more likely it was the fact that the meat was pretty tough and laden with fat/tendons/other unappetizing components. I asked for it medium rare. Conveniently, it is too dark in the restaurant to see the color of the steak, so visually it's difficult to tell whether or not they achieved the correct temperature, but the mouthfeel of the steak was definitely not medium rare. It was so tough I had to saw and tug at it with the knife and fork, and even then I was only having minimal success. Actual flavor was meh, I've had better in the dining room of my own house. Add all this to the slow service (there was some sort of dinner party happening next to us, which I presume contributed to the long wait times before food came out, before we were offered a dessert menu, before the check given to us and collected, you name it) and you end up with an experience that just wasn't worth the $55 price tag on dinner for two people. I left feeling like my twenty-something dollar share of the bill could've bought me three Chipotle bowls that would've been far tastier and fed me for three meals. I don't know, man. At a four star average rating after over 1400 reviews, I just expected more.

Loved this little BYOB restaurant! The price point was surprisingly accessible, the ambiance was warm and inviting and the service was friendly and attentive without being too high touch. As it was my first visit,  we opted to split the Para dos so that I could try as many things as possible. I was not disappointed! Everything was prepared well and had distinctive grilled flavors. I did start out with the spinach empanadas which, while good, were a bit overcooked. The only con to my experience was the candlelight. It was definitely romantic but made the room a bit too dark to see the food on my plate, let alone my dinner mate.

Yummy! This place gets it right on so many levels.  They definitely brought authentic Argentinean food to Chicago but made it their own. First off, they offer BYOB without a corkage fee. Second, the ambiance is inviting and enticing. Call me a sucker for candlelight but I adore it. The staff & servers are great at their jobs. Third, the food is absolutely delicious.  And for those who prefer vegetarian options try their homemade gnocchi! Do yourself a solid and try this place out.

We came with the boy's family and some ex-roomates for a Saturday candlelight dinner a few months ago. When they mean candlelight, they mean candlelight. It was pretty difficult to read the menu and see who was sitting behind you. Since we were a large group, we were able to make reservations. There were so many delicious looking options. We ordered the melted cheese appetizer (tasty, but kind of need to devour it asap because it gets hard), shrimp appetizer and I forgot the name of the entree. The food was good and BYOB is always a plus. But overall, I wouldn't go out of my way to come back. Lots of meat! But it felt more like quantity than quality.

Came around 8pm and it was packed. We had to wait for about an hour at their waiting room. Ambiance: Crowded restaurant with tight walk ways so it gets a bit loud. Candle lit tables with dim lighting helps with the mood.  Service: Staff was friendly and attentive. Food: Had the Filet with spinach mashed potato and veal t-bone with vesuvio potatoes. The food was great but I wouldn't want to always wait that long every time I want to come eat here.

I came here expecting this to be a small hole-in-the-wall restaurant ran by an Argentine family, but I was surprised to find it to be quite a popular restaurant in Lakeview. The food is very good, if a bit Americanized. Nonetheless, definitely worth the visit. It's about as close to "real" Argentinian food as you can get in the U.S. Empanadas, chorizo, steak, they've got it all.   Atmosphere is definitely on the loud side, as the space is small. It's a great atmosphere for parties or a date and candle-lit dinner. It is BYOB, so it's unfortunate they don't serve any classic Argentinian drinks like Fernet and coke or wine from Mendoza. That was a disappointment, but the only true complaint I have (if a bit snobby haha).

Plain and simply, this is one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at, if not the absolute best.  Until a couple of months ago I had never heard of this little hidden gem in the Lakeview neighborhood of Chicago!  I had asked one of my co-workers about a unique place to eat for my birthday and he had suggested Tango Sur since he had gone there for his birthday the previous year.  With that said, it is a fantastic place to celebrate a birthday or any other special event!   My boyfriend and I went to Tango Sur on a Saturday night around 6 pm and it was absolutely packed in there; granted, it is a fairly small restaurant but every table was filled.  We had made reservations and so we only had to wait for a short period of time, but I had no problem waiting to be seated because apart from everything else, it smelled amazing!  It was dark in the restaurant, lit primarily by candles on each of the tables but this made for a great atmosphere.  If you're having a date night then believe me, this setting is perfect!  It will make for a date night you will always remember (just don't drink too much wine).  Speaking of wine, this restaurant is a BYOB so you may bring a bottle of wine of your choosing and not even have to worry about a corking fee!!!  Can you say awesome?
