  Anyways, let's get to the good part - the food!  For appetizers we got the queso and the empanadas - one of each the chicken, beef and spinach & cheese.  The queso was this to-die-for melted cheese that you tore apart to eat on this bread...it literally just melts in your mouth!  And those empanadas...just stop.  They come with this chimichurri sauce and oh my goodness - you don't want to stop eating them because it is so delicious.  Then my boyfriend and I both ordered the dish that had twin filet minons and spinach mashed potatoes (that were green - I thought it was awesome that mashed potatoes were green).  I had never had any steak that was so tender and had so much flavor!  Sure, there are many great steak joints in the Chicago land area but this one, in my possibly biased opinion, is the best.  The steaks are so juicy and these also melt in your mouth, almost literally.  Although this is a nicer restaurant that correlates with a little higher prices, you get so much food for your money and I guarantee you will be satisfied with your meal.   But wait - I also have to tell you about our dessert; we got the flan and it had salted caramel glaze dripping all over it!  It was so rich and so good that although I was practically stuffed to the brim from my appetizers and entree I couldn't help but eat all the flan.   Last but not least the service was very good and our waiter was extremely attentive and efficient.  I could not have asked for a better dining experience because all around it was top-notch.  Without a doubt, I would go back there and most likely order the same thing because it was a-mazing!

This place was amazing.   We came here right when they opened because with the rating/amount of reviews we figured a long wait.  Thankfully it wasn't crowded at all right at the opening (which was a little strange but oh well can't complain).   A few of us ordered the Filet Mignon and it was definitely worth the 28$ price tag.  While you wait you can munch on salad and bread.  But it was the steak that really stood out.  There were TWO large pieces on the plate along with some strange green mashed potatoes (Tasted no different from regular mashed potatoes in my opinion).  The meat was tender, juicy and almost melted in my mouth.  It was a little strange that it was byob but we got over it and grabbed some wine nearby to accompany the steak.  Service wasn't perfect but for myself personally service isn't a big factor unless they're spitting in the food.  The food was what I came for and it was amazing.  Would come here again if I'm ever in Chicago.

If you love steak as much as I do, then you will truly enjoy Tango Sur.  You won't find your typical American steaks here, but some wonderful Argentine flavors.  This place gets pretty busy, so make sure you call ahead to reserve a table.  As you walk in, you will notice this place is pretty dark and your only light source are the candles on the tables.  This makes a perfect atmosphere for an intimate night out with a loved one or even with a group of your friends.   Definitely start off with their empanadas which are accompanied with their housemade chimichurri sauce.  They offer beef, chicken, ham and cheese, and spinach and cheese.  You can't go wrong with any of the empanadas because they are all divine, but the beef and the ham and cheese are my favorite.  Oh, their chimichurri sauce is also amazing; probably the best I have ever tasted. My favorite entrees are the el filet (two decent sized filet mignon served with spinach mashed potatoes) and the lomo relleno (half slab of Argentine fillet served with portabella marsala topped with chimichurri and ham sauce.)  The el filet is always cooked perfectly at a medium rare and the spinach mashed potatoes is light and buttery.  The lomo relleno is more than enough for two people.  Surprisingly with this huge slab of filet, it's cooked evenly throughout while still being tender and juicy.  The sauce they drown the meat in is also delicious. (Note: if you don't enjoy mushrooms like I do, it can be overwhelming for some people.  But to me I really enjoy the mushrooms).  The only complaint I have is sometimes the meat isn't sliced really well so you have to spend the extra time cutting it apart instead of digging right in.   I haven't even mentioned the best part yet, Tango Sur is BYOB with no corkage fee.  You guys can definitely get your drink on without hurting the wallet.  Overall, they offer great food at decent prices, a romantic atmosphere, and good service.  If you haven't tried this place yet then what are you waiting for?

This is my new favorite restaurant in the city. I went here last night for my birthday dinner and everything was incredible, start to finish. The atmosphere was wonderful, with lively music that was not too loud so we could all still talk. It's BYOB which was great! I really can't think of one bad thing to say about my experience there. We started with the provoleta -- basically a plate of cheese. Yum. My brother and dad had the Chef's Special, El Filet, and raved about it. I had the Suprema a la Napolitana, or chicken breast breaded and topped with ham/cheese/tomato sauce. Probably the best thing I've eaten in awhile. They even gave us complimentary flan for dessert for my birthday. The waiter was very kind and knowledgeable. I'm definitely glad we got there early, though, because I've heard if you come any later than 5:30 you have to wait a long time to get a table.  Thank goodness I live so close -- I'll definitely be back!

Love this joint. Great for dates or celebrations. Dark and right amount of noise to create a "cool atmosphere". Food is ok in my opinion but love the BYOB.  Totally recommend this place. Make reservations and for faster service tip the door guys $50. Been here many times.
Always a great place to go for red meat and great side dishes and apps!

Best place in the city for a decent priced steak. Empanadas are out of this world. My wife and I go at least once a week, and it's byob. Put your name down go to jewel grab a bottle of wine come back and have steaks and appetizers and leave with a $50 bill. You can't beat that.
My son took me to this place, and I really loved it. Has very tasty meat and love that you can bring your favorite wine with you. Thumbs up

I came here on a Monday night at 8 pm and waited about 20 minutes for a table for two. It wasn't a long wait given they have a waiting room where you can start drinking your wine.. ( oh yeah .. It's a BYOB!!! ).  As we were seated it was a cozy table for 2 with a candle in the middle. The place is lit by candles, so it's very romantic!  So my boyfriend is from Argentina and given that fact we traveled to the country before we were tough critics on the food.    We ordered the corn, ham and beef empanadas. The empanadas were good but I have had better. The beef one was my favorite. I did not like the ham& cheese.  For our entrees. We had the short rib, chorizo, churrasco and filet. The portion were huge! We had a lot of left overs! The meat was cooked perfectly! It wasn't overcooked or undercooked.. It was a perfect medium!  A lot of restaurants do not have an authentic  chimichurri sauce but tango sur does!!! If I could I would buy a jar from them! A for location.. Perfect spot in Lakeview! I just wish they would take reservations! Perfect place for a date night or group party! I believe they do take reservation on weekends for parties 6 or more.

Tango Sur has incredible food, a romantic atmosphere, and very fair prices; however, the serve is comparable to that of a fast food restaurant: poor.  I have dined at Tango Sur last year and remember having a similar issue with the serve, but decided to give it another try. Upon entering the restaurant, you can't help but notice the lovely decor and ambience set with pillar candles at each table. This place bleeds romance! Upon entering, my party and the one ahead of us had to wait for the host to materialize...this was the start of the bad service. We waited a good 5 minutes before being approached by the host. They claimed the wait would be 30-45 minutes, but my party and I decided to behave through their claimed wait time and relax in the back waiting area. This restaurant is BYOB (corking fee though), and you can start drinking in the adorable waiting area, which is pretty freaking neat!  My party and I waited maybe waited 15 minutes to be sat down at our table. Now this is where our experience went extremely sour. We waited another 15 minutes to be approached by our waiter. Due to the delay, I notified the host of the dilemma. He gave us an excuse that no one should really use in the restaurant industry: we have quite a few party's tonight and were very busy. What he really meant is that the restaurants doesn't have the resource capacity to serve every table like they should. I was very disappointed.  After meeting our waiter, who seemed very rushed, we gave him our full order. We order a beef and ham/cheese empanada and the Vacio. Although the empanadas were highly recommended, I think there are better places in the city. The Vacio on the other hand was YUMMMMMMMMM. You can easily feed two people and have left overs, or even three people with no leftovers. Their entrees are simply delectable. If the restaurant were to add more staff to be more attentive, this place would make it to my 'list' of places I would take visitors from out of town. I hope this restaurant thinks about ways to improve their customers experience. It maybe be nearly a year until I decide to dine there again.

I really don't know what to do with myself this place is so good. First let's get out the elephant in the room-the prices are fairly reasonable for what it is. Empanadas, ribeye, and a bottle of wine with tax and tip was about $80 for 2 people. Which brings me to the second great thing about this place: BYOB. The steak was amazing. Very comparable to other great steaks around the city. And I love a good steak.  I went for an early Sunday dinner, around 5, and there was no wait. I highly recommend getting there early if you're hungry. There was a wait by the time we left.

A group of us went to Tango on a Saturday night and we really enjoyed the whole service.  What is a plus is that they are BYOB and do not charge a cork fee at all.  We brought a bottle of wine and some craft beef.  The waiters immediately brought a bucket of ice, glasses, and opened the wine for us.  Speaking of the service, it was top-notch.   The food is delicious and is also fairly priced.  I ordered the El Filet, which somes with two filets, a tasty sauce, and spinich mashed potatoes.  They were cooked to perfection and the sauce was a treat, although it did slightly overpower the taste of the filet.   I highly reccommend this restaurant for a date night, or an intimate evening with other couples.

I dined here last Saturday for a friend's birthday although I've been here a lot over the years my last visit was not at all pleasant. Our server was Billy and he was horrible! My steak was over cooked when I asked him if he could please have them make me a new one that I had wanted it to be medium not medium well he said okay but then two minutes later he came up to me and said no you wanted it to be medium well that's what you said and then I said no I said I wanted it medium and he continued to argue with me and was basically calling me a liar. So then I just got so aggravated I told him I didn't want anything anymore. And then when our bill came he tried to con our table of 11 people for a hundred more dollars then what was owed! He continued to argue with my friend over the hundred dollars she finally explained it enough times where he understood or I guess he figured he was caught and he ended up giving us some money back I called and left a message for a manager but nobody has gotten back to me that was a week ago! I guess they don't care about customer service here or if their servers try to con people out of their money. With all the good places you can go for steak in Chicago I will never be coming back here.
We LOVE this restaurant! Good food and service. Yes, it's dim. Yes, it's cramped. But overall, it's lovely.

Its been years since I left Chicago, but I still dream about this place.  Lets get to it:  Step 1) BYOB and make sure its the best damn malbec you can find.   Step 2) Start with the empanada and the berenjena en escabeche (eggplant).   Step 3) For the entree order El Filet and split with your date.  It is excellent, well-cooked, and just as good as Gene and Georgetti's I kid you not.  Excellent, savory, decadent.   Step 4) Don't forget the spinach mashed potatoes! Step 5) Tip well, then go out and enjoy your evening, ponder just exactly how truly good your life really is.

Tango Sur is the best steak you can get in the city + it's BYOB. Chicago is well known for its steak and because I had family visiting from overseas, I had to take them out for steak. While contemplating the usual famous spots for steak, one of my friends told me about Tango Sur and said that it beat all of the other steakhouses in the city.  We decided to order empanadas for an appetizer and they exceeded any expectations that we had. Everything inside was seasoned so well and the chimichurri sauce that came with it was out of this world. I ordered the filet mignon medium and it was cooked to perfection. Many steakhouses I go to end up cooking the steak more medium-well so it was nice to order a steak and get it the way I ordered it. The chimichurri sauce went very well with the steak and my relatives enjoyed themselves as well. Definitely will be back soon!

The only steak restaurant I know that is BYOB!! what what!! And they have a waiting room where you can drink your wine while you wait...so it's awesome! Their servings are HUGE!! and the candles at the table is so sweet :)  Great for date night!

Tango Sur's shtick is taking low quality ingredients and fooling your senses with dim lighting, loud music, and food deprivation while waiting for a table/BYOB drinking so that you don't notice how poor the food actually is one you are finally served. Food: 1.5 stars 1.  The empanadas were good! 2.  Two of us got the "El Filet". We both ordered medium and they both came out medium rare. I had to spit out a chunk of grizzle, which is unheard of for a $30 filet. No crust, which you would expect from a "paradilla" steak. Look, there is a reason why they give you two filets. Who does that??  3.  One of us ordered the ribeye. Yeah, I know ribeye isn't the leanest cut, but this was like 12 oz. of fat on a plate.  Jon looked like he was playing a game of Operation trying to extract an edible piece. I think he would have rather eaten the paper Operation money. 4.  The "salad" is a joke 5.  Extra 1/2 star for BYOB  Ambiance: 4 stars 1.  Lounge style.  Like the dark lighting, candle light, music. 2.  Know that the music is loud, and the atmosphere gets a little rowdy. There were a lot of large groups who had all been drinking steadily for 2-3 hours because it takes that long to get a table.  I don't know how people consider this a date spot, unless you don't want to have to talk to your date. Service: 1 star 1.  Expect the bare minimum and hope they don't get something wrong. 2.  Server didn't come back once after food was served. 3.  Asked for extra chimchurri, never received it. Steaks not cooked to order.

I was in the mood for something special for my last night on my 2nd trip into Chicago. And I wanted a steak. So a little Yelping and a trip on the Red line from my office to Addison took me here, and it was probably the best decision I made.  Yes, Tango Sur is a little on the datey side but if you have no dining companion, don't let that deter you. Here's why: It's BYOB - bring your own libations. Most people brought wine, I walked in with a 4-pack of Bells IPA in a lululemon bag. It's a great conversation starter as well. The steaks are excellent - I ordered the Bife Ancho. Medium rare. It was cooked to perfection(I hate tossing that term around), so meaty, so umami-y. It was like a flavor explosion. I kid you not. It came with chimichurri sauce, potatoes and a salad I wished could be better.  The empanadas are excellent - I ordered a corn one to start off - the shell was rich and decadent, The corn filling was pretty delicious.  I waited for a little while, I talked to a few people about California while I waited and talked to a couple and their friend who was sitting besides me. And they hooked it up with a flan on the house, I'm assuming because I waited for a while or asked repeatedly for a dessert menu but heck, the flan was hella(I'm from NorCal) good. And I ended up having the steak for a pre-flight salad before I left Chicago. And the price ain't bad at all - $32 with the empanada and the rib eye - it's a bargain for a excellent steak - especially when the same thing over in downtown or the Magnificent Mile will set you back at least $50. I'm coming back here if I ever find myself in Chicago again.

I was told about Tango Sur nearly 10 years ago, tried to go a few times, but the wait times never worked for me.  Yesterday, I had a chance to drop in and try the steak.  I had a T-Bone and it was delicious.  My wife had the El Filet and she really liked it, plus she only ate one of the filets and brought the other one home. I was raised Italian so I wasn't a fan of the salad, but it was a simple presentation and not bad. The warm bread was great for starting the meal, mopping up the vinaigrette dressing from the salad and the sauce from my steak. I liked the BYOB aspect of this restaurant, no corkage fee. I will remind you that the wait can be relatively ridiculous on busy nights.  It is a city restaurant and the spacing is rather tight, but all things considered it is well worth a visit if you are in the area!

This place is good.  I think the steaks are very reasonably priced, prepared very well and quite flavorful.  The BYOB aspect is huge as always.  However, I am not a huge fan of waiting around inside the restaurant for an additional 60 minutes after we waited 1.5 hours at another bar.  If its going to be 2 hrs, tell me 2 hours and I will come back in 2 hours, rather than standing in a pitch dark restaurant getting slammed into by waiters moving at the speed of sound and drinking wine out of glass that I can't even see into.   This is also the downside of a BYOB spot because it was a Friday night and patrons were definitely lounging at their tables drinking well after they finished their dinners (which I can completely understand).  Anyway, if we do go back, it probably wont be on a weekend night.

Has anyone told you that you HAD to go to Tango Sur? Well, now someone has: if you like steak, you HAVE to go.  I was lucky enough to stumble into this place soon after moving to Chicago. It is the best "bang for your buck" steakhouse that I have ever heard of. In addition, it is just one of the best steakhouses I have ever been to.  I recommend "El Filet", where you get two 6 oz filets, spinach mashed potatoes, bread and a salad that consists of tomato, lettuce and onions. If you get nothing else, this will run you around $35-$40. Seriously. Best steaks of your life for $40.  It is also BYOB. Grab a wine from Que Syrah, only 3 doors down across the street, and call it date night.  WARNING: Tango Sur does not take reservations and the wait can get long. The wait gets longer the later that you go. If you want to wait 30 minutes, go at 5 and be seated immediately or wait only 30 minutes. If you plan on eating at 9, get your name in at 7. They will call you when you are next on the list, so you can wander off as long as you can be back within 10 minutes of the phone call.

This place is PERFECT! Great vibe, great music, great food! I order the T bone and for $28 I thought it was unbelievable! A delicious warm basket of bread, a true Argentinian salad (with olive oil, vinegar salt and pepper) and a beautiful perfect medium rare T bone with a side of mashed potatoes. Great birthday with great people and for a great price. Not to mention it's byob! I will be back.  P.s our reso was at 9 and we were seated at 9:10... You're not always going to wait "an hour to hour and a half" our food came out in a good time too!

My meal was bad enough to warrant a review. First, let me start by saying that I have been to this restaurant before and had a 3.0-4 star experience. But this time wasn't that great. Honestly, I feel pretty let down.  The first time that I went to Tango Sur, I sat outside. I think that  during the warm months, this restaurant is better because it can accommodate more people. Anyway, after deciding that I wanted to go there for dinner, I called the restaurant and asked for a reservation. They said that there were no more reservations tonight. I asked how long was the wait. They said if you come right now, there is no wait.  I quickly jumped in a cab and arrived at the restaraunt. When I got there, I was told that I have to wait 1-1.5 hours for a seat. I decided to go have a drink at the bar next door. They told me that they would give me a call. After not receiving a call in the allotted time, I showed up at the restaurant where I complained until I was finally seated 20 min later.  Now when I actually got into the restaurant I thought the ambience inside was pretty nice and everyone who was already eating looked pretty happy. As soon as the waiter came, I told him my order. The hour and 45 minute wait gave me enough time to figure out what I wanted. Even though I ordered right away, I feel like my food took a really long time to come out.  This is where the major let down was. After receiving my steak, which I ordered medium-rare, I cut into the steak (el filet) and it was purple...raw...not cooked! I was so hungry, I couldn't wait any longer. I started eating the nasty raw, undercooked steak which lacked salt and seasoning. My girlfriend ordered the para uno which included spare ribs. I have had spare ribs before, in fact, I love them, but these spare ribs were super fatty and lacked any flavoring. By the end of the meal, I just felt super disappointed. I feel like this place has gotten too popular and as a result, the food and service has decreased in quality. I would never wait more than 20 min for this lack luster meal. I would never pay for the experience which I had ever again. Having had been there before, when it was less crowded, I know that they are capable of providing a better meal and service. But this last meal, left me so disappointed that I will not return. Chicago is a big city, and I think that there are many better places to go than Tango Sur.

Prepare to wait--forever. And whatever time they give you for a table, double it. This is the third time we have tried to eat at tango sur. in fairness, the food is great and it is byob. But the food isn't THAT great. Not great enough to justify waiting for up to three hours. Take last night for example-- we put our name in at 7 and were told it would be an hour to an hour and a half. We checked in quite a few times and each time the estimate went up. In short, they called us for a table at 10. By then, we were eating somewhere else. If you're ok with eating after 10 and don't mind being lied to about the wait time by all means, eat here. My advice is to check out art tango in ravens wood-- same great food without the ridiculous wait and false promises.

Worst restaurant in the city - which has 20,000+ restaurants.  Zero stars; the be k with that, make it negative 5 stars.  I have come here 3 times - not by my choice and once actually by the force of others. Always told 1-1.5 hour wait, but never get in before 2.5 hours.  Twice we had to eat elsewhere. Arrogant host  who can't estimate wait times; if you get in, arrogant wait staff; and, if you get in, mediocre food.  I'd rather eat a hot dog at Fatso's Last Stand in Ukrainian Village any day before I ever come to this pretentious hole ever again.  I have been to Argentina - BA, Mendoza, Rosario, Cordoba,  etc - and Argentines would be embarrassed by this poser joint and their BS.  Here's a unique idea - take reservations!!!

If you're in the mood for cheap, solid meat, Tango Sur is the place to go. I recommend starting off with their empanadas which I think is the best I've had in Chicago thus far. The pastry is super flaky but not heavy at all and the inside is filled with a delicious stuffing from which there are 4-5 choices to select from - my favorite is corn - just throwing it out there!  If you're a party of 2, definitely split the Para dos which legitly comes with a boatload of meats - short ribs, flap meat, sausages, etc. It will be extremely filling and well worth it. It's also a good way of trying a little bit of everything, especially if you're like me and will get sick of eating a single piece of steak.  Dropping a star because service was just so-so and the salad that comes before the meal is rather unimpressive. I'm not sure whether to truly call it a salad but I guess I will since there are greens on a plate. It doesn't come with dressing so maybe you can sneak a packet of ranch in or something?

Went on a weeknight. Wait was very short . Very dark but romantic. Perfect for a date which I was on. Love the candlelight. Spinach & cheese empanadas & my date had chicken. They were good. I had the Arrachera. Big portion. The seasoned potatoes were good as well. BYOB is always a hit!! Chocolate cake with rasberry was yummy. It was packed & they considered it a slow night. Don't want to come here on a weekend. I always wanted to try it out here. I did but I wasn't blown away either.

Unfortunately, my boyfriend and I were pretty disappointed about this place. We started off with one of our favorite appetizers, empanadas....we ordered 2 beef and 2 chicken. At first we thought they were pretty good until my boyfriend bit into his chicken one and almost broke his tooth..he found 3 very sharp bones in his. I thought this was pretty unusual since typically the meat in empanadas is minced.  After that, we had high hopes for our entree the flap steak seasoned with garlic, parsley and onion, which sounded delicious on the menu, however we were again very disappointed ....the meat was tough and not flavorful... Definitely not going back...

This place was better 5 years ago. Now the service went down, the taste is not the same and the cost went up. The detail for taste is no longer there. It might be that they are concentrating in their sister restaurant. Wont be coming here again.

Awesome service and delicious food! The restaurant has such a fun yet elegant atmosphere and it's perfect for large groups who are looking for a good byob place. The servers are so nice and really accommodating. They do a great job of being patient, especially with all the large groups scattered throughout the restaurant! The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because there is always an INSANELY long wait, even with a reservation we have never waited less than 45 minutes. Overall great experiences every time though, even with the long wait!

4:15 on s Sunday afternoon, after nursing yourself through a mild hangover, what's a fitness foodie to do?  Pick up her fellow crossfiter and head out to a place renowned for its protein dights. Tango Sur is so much more than it's rather dark and crowded rooms lead on. At just about any other time, you can expect a line out the door, and a waiting area packed sardine tight with patrons salivating over the aromatic entrees at the tables.  It's dark, and cozy. You'll get to know your neighbor, whether you care to or not, and if you're smart, you'll pack a luscious bottle (or two) of Red and make friends. We were promptly seated, a table for two, complete with a single tall candlestick. Paper menus stained with the beverages of past patrons list a complete page of Argentinian entrees, each with their own flare. They come with a side salad, which is nothing to rave about, but it was fresh.  Before I detail the dinner, I must mention the Empenadas. $2.50 each, we shared the beef and the spinach with cheese. They were worth every cent, the spinach being our clear favorite.  Dinner for us? One ribeye, one T-bone, two heaping sides of homemade mashed potatoes (real, rich, creamy, dreamy, want to swim in them, amazing mashed potatoes). The steaks were perfectly cooked, tender cuts, and seasoned. Ribeye had a garlic rub that brought out the hearty marble of the cut. The T-bone: drizzled in a red wine reduction sauce, with sautéed portobello mushrooms. Tender, delicious..and protein dense happiness. One minor caveat. The knives they give you could barely be classified as butter knives, much less the steak knives they're impersonating. Until they reinvest in new cutlery, perhaps BYOK should be in order? (Bring Your Own Knife) It is Chicago, after all. For dinner for two, including the appetizers and tax, was just under $67.00. By far, the best BYOB Lakeview has to offer!

This place is adorable! The candlelit and the cozy ambience. Unfornutely we felt like we didn't order the right things so were a little disappointed since we have heard so many awesome things. Next time, we will try other things. As other stated, the service is meh. They usually don't really check on you much but it's probably because it's so busy. Weeknights are not too bad to get a reservation. Another plus--BYOB! What we got: - Chicken empanada- my favorite thing we ordered, perfect..yum! -  Lomo Relleno- It was just way too saucy and not sliced so very difficult to cut. It is meant to be shared which it was a huge portion but wasn't a big fan - Philo dough pastry- The dessert presentation looked amazing but I unfornutely ordered the wrong thing. Everything else looked so good but this ended up being really dry and just sad I have hope since so many people I know love this place so going to give it another go!

Absolutely love this place. I get the filets (comes with TWO!) almost every time, and they're always cooked perfectly with plenty of flavor and juices. BYOB and an ideal spot for a date night. Very friendly and accommodating staff, too. If I could give them 10 stars, I would.

Delicious and reasonably priced. Got a skirted steak for 22$ and a seafood salad for 12$. The skirted steak was bursting with flavor and very tender. The seafood plate was also well seasoned and very juicy. Its also BYOB. It was definatly worth the 1.5 hour wait.

I'm personally surprised that I'm not blowing this restaurant up with 5 stars right now, because I definitely wanted to. The food is really that amazing. Sadly, the service was bad enough to knock my rating down a couple pegs.  I tried multiple times during the day to call and make a reservation only to be met with voicemail. So I didn't/couldn't.  We expected a wait and got one, which wasn't a problem...except it was super long. My boyfriend had a show at 10 we got there at 7 and he wasn't able to eat because we were seated so late he wouldn't have had time to eat his meal.  That seems a bit overkill to me for a Thursday...after trying unsuccessfully to make a reservation. Not that it mattered much, people in line with us HAD made reservations and their tables weren't prepared and were waiting even longer than us.  I'll definitely return...the overall package of pricing, location, and quality of food are incredible. But the service could and should be better than it is.

Oh Tango Sur, how I hate and love you. I have been eating here since 2011. The food is always incredible! The service is impeccable, and the prices are much better than most places. I dont eat steak, I dont like steak...not because Im vegetarian but because it always tastes the same for a higher price. I eat steak at Tango Sur, I eat everything at Tango Sur. Yes it's a bit dark and yes the line can be long but you go to a restaurant for the food. You have ruined me, every time I eat somewhere else that's "on par" with your level of food, Im always disappointed. I have been at a few business dinners recently and every time I leave I think, "we could have eaten at Tango." Thank you all for an excellent and a great place to show my friends and family.

Service was a worry having read some reviews...but we had excellent service. We love BYOB places...We love outdoor seating ...the steak dinner was enough to share plus we had leftovers. Tasty food - great prices - fun people watching - not sure what could have been bettter!
I'we been going to this place for quite some time now and all I can say I haven't been disappointed yet......everythink is just perfect form the service to the food!!!!just perfect!!!!

Absolutely awesome!  The pork chop was incredible.  My only complaint would be the level of noise inside, but we lucked out with an outdoor table.  BYOB is nice a well.  Highly recommend.  Looking forward to returning the next time we're in Chicago.

BYOB is always a big attraction for me but that was pretty much the only highlight though I did really like the empanadas. The place is crowded and noisy. The steaks are very reasonably priced but seem to reflect that they were tough. My wife's steak came out well done after being ordered medium rare and they did comp us which was the right thing to do but then again no one ate it either. If you are part of a big group and want to be able to say you had a great price on steaks and that you found a place that was BYOD then this is a good spot.  I would not come back

Love this place, hate that it gets crowded but the food is so great I dont care. Get the churrasco with the chimmichurri sauce, ahh its heaven. The vesuvio potatoes have so much flavor.. Best part about tango is its BYOB and reasonably priced! Great outdoor seating area when the weather is nice and very intimate and romantic candle lit dinner if seated inside. Cant go wrong with Tango Sur, I've made all my friends try it and its their favorite restaurant now too!

Nice restaurant. Went in a Friday night and it was packed. The food was flavorful and great. We had appetizers, entrees and delicious deserts. It was vey noisy. The service was good and they have bring your own bottle. Overall I would return again but in a different night where I could hear the people across from me without yelling.

I always write a review based on what I'm expecting for the place I'm going. That said tango sur was a pleasant surprise.   I've gone to a few Argentinian restaurants in the city and this one has been the best by far. Though it's a little cramped the atmosphere still remains intimate and the outer skirt steak I ordered tasted wonderful.  I work at a steakhouse downtown and I would have paid twice what they charged, and that says a lot.  Staff was friendly and efficient,  they seemed to be stretched a little thin but service didn't suffer at all, you could just tell they were BUSY
As advertised-great food, and byob is a bonus. We had to wait for a patio table, but the host was friendly and accomodating. I'd heard this place can get noisy, but it was fine on the patio.

My bf and I came here on a Saturday night around 5 and we were able to get seated right away  I ordered the para uno and my bf ordered the El filet Para uno- i don't recommend.. The dish comes on a grill with a variety of meat..2 pieces of sausage, beef and chicken pieces Wasn't too fond of the dish since my beef was so chewy I actually had to spit it out and secretly throw it away bc I felt bad lol El filet- my bf ordered this and I was so regretful I didn't order it. It was sooo juicy and  tender.so  delicious..and I loved the spinach mashed potatoes it went really well with the filet.  Service- it wasn't too great..we had to flag someone each time to order and we had to ask 3 times for a bucket of ice for our wine. But the staff was super friendly so I didn't mind as much. it's BYOB so don't forget to bring some drinks!

We had a disappointing experience at Tango Sur.  I had called shortly after they opened on Saturday and inquired about a reservation for 5:30.  They replied that they only accepted reservations for parties of 6 or more on weekends, but thought a party of two would be seated right away at that time.  We arrived shortly after 5;30, and were told there would be a 30 minute wait and were asked for our phone number.  Apparently, they don't have anywhere in the restaurant for waiting diners to sit.  It was chilly out (mid-50's) - so, we sat across the street for awhile and then walked around so we could stay warm.  Finally - at 6:30, we got a call saying our table was ready.  They seated us outdoors - which would have been lovely if the temps were above 70's, but, I didn't envision eating with my jacket zipped up and being chilled during the entire meal (despite the heat lamp).  I asked about an indoor table but was told that would be a longer wait, which we weren't willing to do at that point.  The service was o.k. - although, the promised ice bucket for our wine never appeared and the waiter didn't ask how our meal was or if we needed anything else shortly after being served.  The bread everyone raves about in the reviews was good - but, nothing to get excited about.  The dinner we had - pork chop and grilled chicken, were both very tasty.  I won't return on the weekend unless we're with a larger party and have a reservation.  I think our experience would have been much different if we got a table inside.

Perfect candlelight dinner. Delicious juicy steaks and really good Chimmichurri I smother that shit on everything lol but seriously I highly recommend this place for a date or even small parties. I love me some tango! It's also BYOB.

Tango Sur Ratings 1-5 1= Swimming at the Milwaukee Yacht Club 5= Driving the Zamboni at the United Center Atmosphere: Average rating - 4.3 Service: Average rating: 4.3 Food: Average rating: 4.6 Price: Average rating: 5 - who doesn't love a byob! Would you come again or recommend? -Of course "Nice"Remarks please: Great time-Great price Loved the waiter! Whatever his name was... Crowded, but cozy Very attentive service Good stuff Can't beat the byob Can't remember sure it was good I was really hoping Walter would pick up the bill-ha  ha Love Tango Sur Nice to be with Walter and Sharon Great time-good food and very patient and hard working staff Hard to get into, but if you can-how can you beat a byo with good food?

Tango is one of the few (only?) styles of music that can tastefully turn the accordion into a romantic, symphonic and melodic delight. And the dancing that surrounds it: sexy, confident and precise. My first meal at Tango Sur reflected all of this. Let's start with the music: the food. Top quality bread and butter. The empanadas? I tried the ham and cheese: perfect crust, as flaky as a good pie. ¡Estupendo! All the better to spread with that chimichurri sauce that I can never get enough of. (If you're like me, and you eat enough of it, I think you can tick-off one of your five vegetables for the day.) I splurged a bit more for "El Filet," the thick, range-grown fillet mignon with the red onion wine sauce. ¡Magnifica! I think it's one of the top 10 or 12 steaks that I've had in my life, the beef was buttery and cooked perfectly medium rare like I like it. Tango Sur had been on my list for a long time, but I had never tried to go, hearing such stories about the long waits. This night, however, I was with an uber-sized group of about 20 with a reservation, and the dance here was waiters working their "nalgas" off to give us great service. They served us from one end to the other, allowing those who had received their food to start without feeling impolite as their food got cold. I once spent a couple weeks in Buenos Aires, taking Spanish lessons in the morning and Tango lessons in the evening. Tango Sur took me back there, to the sidewalk restaurantes parillas (grills), the Sunday market in San Telmo (with a couple of professional tango dancers performing on the street), and one of the many wonderful milongos (tango dance nights), where the gentlemen still simply nod their heads to ask for a dance. Little wonder that when I arrived there by plane on a weekday morning, there were guys in suits and ladies in gowns, all slightly rumpled, clearly heading home to change before they went to work.

Recently went on a date to Tango Sur and sat outside in the street cafe. The food was amazing and the prices very fair for the portion sizes.  I ordered the Vacio and all I can say is well prepared, flavorful, and great portion. I love the the beef comes from grass fed cows and is organic. I highly recommend Tango Sit to anyone craving authentic Argentinian food!

The Rating: Service = 4 Decor = 4 Food = 3 Overall = 3.5 The Tab: 1.  Grill Combo (Steak / Sausage / Ribs) for Two = $40 2.  Four Empanada (1 ham and cheese, 1 chicken, 2 beef) = $10. 3.  Wine BYOB Total  = $55 + tip I haven't been to Tango in about 3 years, the place hasn't really changed.  The service is good, decor is nice.  The bread was freshly made, Empanada's were delicious.  The beef version of the Empanada was the best, don't order the ham cheese one, chicken was ok. The meats were plentiful and could of fed 3 people even though it said 2.  Unfortunately, most of the meat was fatty and the quality poor.  I could not eat it and doggy bag most of the dish, and ordered another Empanada to fill me up.  You would of found a better quality of meat at Jewel -- to give you a comparison. If you like lots of fat in your meat, like Ribeye fatty..... then this is the place to go.  If you like lean means like Sirloin, Filet Mignon, NY Strip......don't go here.  If you order a chicken dish, you're ok.

Love me some tango sur..  But with that being said, last time we went we waited for 45+ minutes for our food (party of 2, 7 pm on a Saturday). Both our steaks were also super undercooked but since we waited so long we didn't want to send them back.  Pros: awesome vibe, great food, byob, good staff. Cons: almost too loud, expect to wait for table and food

Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place - I've been here half a dozen times and have brought all of my friends with me!  This is my favorite place to get steak.  I now live in LA and still dream about this place. They take reservations and have a waiting room in the back where you can open your wine and enjoy while you wait (cause they're BYOB!).  When you sit down, they give you fresh mini loaves of french bread and butter - I need serious control to stop myself from filling up on this delicious bread before my entree comes. The steak is always perfectly cooked and incredibly reasonably priced - the El Filet has two pieces of filet mignon and it's around $28 bucks (that's my favorite, btw).  They do charge a $10 sharing fee...but if you just buy a small plate or appetizer and use it as your "meal" then you're not just paying up and getting nothing back. The mashed potatoes are creamy and perfect - I love the spinach one. They also have a meet and cheese plate that's great for an appetizer.  Get the empanadas! The beef  and ham and cheese are my go-to. OH AND their chimichurri is to die for, I put that magical stuff on everything. And finally...get the flan for dessert.  It's very RICH, but if you're going to eat flan then you should just indulge.  They put a giant dollop of caramel on top which is too sweet for me, so I just eat the flan by itself.  They also give you free flan if it's your birthday! Perfect for any occasion in my opinion, whether it's an intimate date or a group outing.  They have taken my reservations for 5-20 people and have always accommodated (I've gotten a reservation on the weekend...so it's worth calling and checking).  We sometimes end up waiting when we get there but they're just a really busy restaurant, so have patience and you will be rewarded.  It can get a little loud though, but that doesn't bother me. I don't know why there are bad reviews for this place - it's hands down one of my favorites!

The food is really excellent. I ordered the El Filet which had two medium sized steaks cooked to perfection with delicious spinach mashed potatoes ($28). The provoleta appetizer was also amazing, although a bit large even for two people. Try it with the hot bread they bring you. It's a shame then that the restaurant suffers greatly in the atmosphere and convenience departments. They don't take reservations except if you are in a large group. We waited an hour just to be seated and subsequently 30 minutes each between being served appetizers and entrees. From the moment we arrived until we left was 2.5 hours total. The waiters seemed to be doing their best but the restaurant is such a dark, hot, claustrophobic mess that it's not really their fault. Our table was an arm's length from the one next to us and the only lighting is a single candle on each table. It was tough to read the menu. Twice, I heard waiters drop glasses as they stumbled around the cramped layout. Being BYOB, there were several large groups of fratbros bringing cheap beer and being loud and obnoxious, often screaming and chanting like they were at a party. If that's your scene, you might enjoy eating here but all I wanted to do was take this delicious food home and eat it in peace.

We arrived in a timely manner for our weekday evening reservation. I found metered street parking out front despite our friend's warning. The host greeted us amicably and gave us the choice of a table indoors or one on the covered section of the sidewalk in front of the restaurant. There were flower baskets along the railing that hedged the area where we sat. Later in the evening a man with a guitar meandered the restaurant (inside and out) gracing us with pleasant sounds. Tango Sur is bustling. If the weather is agreeable I'd recommend sitting outside where there is more room to breathe in the expansive fresh air. The interior is lit seductively (practically dark) and cozy. We ordered empanadas and antipasto to start. The empanadas were good; however, not up to par for our friend who has tasted fresh ones from someone's home in Argentina. I'd pass on the antipasto next time as it was nothing special in regards to both quality and presentation. I enjoyed el filet where the spinach mashed potatoes were king. They were spectacular and definitely stole the spotlight of my evening. M and our friend both got skirt steak - something that they said was superior to my el filet. Service was wonderful. Our server was actually from Argentina! He provided us with an ice bucket for our wine (BYOB) and proper wine glasses for our beverages. Near the end he gave us a free dessert which went along wonderfully with our amaretto. He didn't rush us even though they were very busy that evening and people were waiting patiently on the sidewalk nearby. Our bill came to $98 for a protein heavy dinner for three people. We were delighted by our satisfying meal and are fans of Tango Sur.
Gross!  If you sent stringy steak in a dead neighborhood from a restaurant that only offers BYOB then this is your place. Disappointed that I gave this place two +  hours of my life. Bad!!!

Went Saturday evening and had a GREAT dinner! Except for large parties, they do not take reservations on the weekend. Expect to wait, but they will take your cell phone number and call you when your table is ready. It is definitely worth the wait!  They have outdoor seating, but we sat inside. It is very dimly lit and quite noisy, but it still has an intimate vibe.  We started with the empanadas- 1 chicken, 1 beef and 1 ham & cheese. The chicken and beef were just okay, but the ham & cheese I enjoyed. The chimichurri sauce and bread were so good I could've filled up on that alone. I ordered the Costeleta (rib-eye) and had the vesuvio potatoes instead of mashed potatoes. The steak was DE-LISH!!! It was cooked to perfection (medium), the au jus was plentiful and the vesuvio potatoes were divine.  My friend had the El Filet, which he devoured! Both entrees came with a salad.  Attentive service, excellent price point, great food, AND it's BYOB, enough said...

Tango Sur is one of those restaurants you don't forget about. My husband says their filet is the best he's ever had, and I thoroughly enjoyed the suprema a la napolitana, a breaded chicken breast topped with ham, mozzarella and tomato sauce. The atmosphere was nice and romantic, though the tables are a little close to each other and the music could have been a little quieter. That said, the food and service were great and I highly recommend this place for a date or any time you're in the mood for some fantastic Argentinian fare!

We came here for a bachelorette party since it was close to a salon we were at earlier in the day. It's BYOB and they serve steak so we wanted to fill our bellies to fuel up for the night. We were running an hour late, 3:30pm reservations on a Saturday, and called ahead no problem. We were greeted with smiles and seated right away. I've been here before so I knew the ambiance was more of a romantic setting but figured it would be fine. We were attended by a friendly, informative staff who lit up the candles at our request and iced our champagne and vodka right away. Everyone loved their food, I shared El filet (steak medium well with spinach mashed potatoes, yum!) and also had two empanadas as an appetizer (spinach w/cheese & beef). Everything was hot, fresh and full of just enough flavor. I was worried about the bill since we couldn't do separate checks but I was prepared and took extra cash. For a party of seven it wasn't too bad - $155. I will definitely return! Most likely with my hubby.

How have I not written a review of this Chicago gem yet? This is one of the first places I fell in love with in Chicago. This Argentinean steakhouse has afforded me nothing but amazing dining experiences. The decor is not swanky or fancy, but the atmosphere is cozy, warm and great a variety of events (family dinners, group dining, dates, etc.). The lighting is dim but the darkness and flickering flames from the candles make it romantic and relaxed. It's really busy so there's a wait and a solid crowd on the inside. The servers and waiters are extremely attentive so there's a bit of traffic all over the restaurant. It's BYOB, so a drink or two will drown out the movement and ambiance noise a bit. My go to is the Filet. An amazing, generous meal that is packed with flavor. Everything on the menu is great and I suggest you try something new every time you dine there. Other than the amazing food, I have to give this establishment 5-stars because of one particular server. Danielo has made my last couple of trips to Tango Sur an awesome experience. I've been gone from Chicago for a year an some change now, and he still provided me with the courtesy and friendliness that you would expect after going to the same restaurant for years. He's the greatest. Phenomenal food, great value, intimate atmosphere and top class service. Who can ask for more?

I had their empanada, which was tasty but drenched in way too much oil (the oil dripped and oozed out of it). I also had their Milanesa De Ternera, which is veal breaded and seasoned, and I had diarrhea for the entire day afterwards. Overall, this place is overpriced though I admit the portion sizes are good.

》HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!《 Let me start off with the fact that it was a TWO HOUR wait since you can't make reservations for any party smaller than 6. We checked in at 7:45 p.m and called in at just under 10 p.m. The server we had was the only good part. He was very nice and patient, but very young and almost scared.  The environment of this place was unbelievable. The music was super loud, which made all the customers louder. I could not even hear anyone at my table, who were literally about 2 feet away.  We ordered our food. 30 minutes later.. we got our "salad"-- iceberg lettuce with two pieces of tomatoes and onions. Another 30 minutes later.. we get our food. I got the Churrasco and it was literally a piece of steak with mashed potatoes thrown on a plate. My mashed potatoes were cold and my steak was beyond well done. I couldn't even eat it so I told the server that I didn't want it nor did I want to pay for it. He tells the manager and for about 5 different messages, he played messenger between the manager and me. I had asked him to bring the manager or cook out and they would not face me-- a young lady. Not only did they not come out, but the "cook" tried to justify that my steak was exactly what I asked for, but then later saying that it's a thin steak and harder to pay attention to flipping it or whatever-- or so the server said. WHAT?! How does LONE STAR make my thin steaks perfectly?! I will definitely NOT be coming to this place again and I advise anyone and everyone not to waste their time here either. I will definitely stick with Lone Star for the excellent steaks and superb service. Poor Management Bad food Mediocre Service

Best price for a filet! Salad is a little crappy before since its plain lettuce with tomato and onion BUT you can add olive oil and some salt if your into that.  FILET is AMAZING & mash potatoes are HOLY! I love when my bf and I come here. Love the staff, ambiance and BYOB. You can't reserve a table unless you have 8 people or more BUT you can give them your cell phone number and go to local bars in the area. Wait time isn't that bad if it is before 7 pm.  STRONGLY recommend. Great service, food, everything! I ave been here 5+ times and I have never had a bad experience. Love ya Tango Sur!!

Not much to say about this place but WOW. All the steaks are great. I get always get the el filet.  Goodluck getting seated fast for dinner because this place is always swamped.  I go on Sundays right when they open at noon.

Best steak in town!!!.  Friendly service and BYOB! The portions are huge and since i went went with a large group i got to taste pretty much everything on the menu and each dish was better then the next.
All I can say is WOW!! A friend organized a Birthday dinner for me with 10 guests. We were seated right away for a 6pm reservation. FOOD WAS AMAZING!!!

If you are looking for an intimate (in space), noisier (in music volume) with unbelievable food.  It's here! I really liked to vibes inside and I wasn't bothered by the louder music at all.  Everyone is talking, laughing, and having a good time so it just adds to the electric energy.  I went with three girlfriends and we decided to get a few different things to share.  The portions aren't overwhelming but it definitely is not a tapas place.   I highly recommend the appetizer cheese and prosciutto with melon.  We also go the Pez which is the salmon entree with mashed potatoes and like my friend said "these aren't potatoes they are like clouds."  Very delicious and very quick service.   One more thing- IT IS BYOB!!!!

We were in town and my husband wanted to come here for dinner (he lived in Chicago a few years ago and had always raved about this place).  They don't take reservations for parties less than 6, so we rolled the dice and got here at 6:45pm last Saturday hoping the wait wouldn't be too painful.  The host told us it was a 1-1.5 hour wait and took down our name and #. This restaurant seems like it is in the middle of a residential area with not much around but uckily we found a bar nearby and decided to have a drink while we waited.  When we called an hour later to see where we were on the list, the host told us we would be seated "soon" so we paid our bar tab and headed back. Well "soon" ended up being another 1.5 hour wait!!! Despite us being at the top of the list, we noticed that they kept seating larger parties ahead of us - some with reservations and some without! The tables were pre-designated by party size. So if a party of 6 got up, they would seat only another party of 6 rather than put 4 or 5 people there. So parties of 4 would end up waiting a lot longer since most of the tables were larger. Then the table they told us was ours next was an older group of people who had already paid their check, but ended up staying ANOTHER HOUR to just hang around. The waitstaff couldn't have cared less that there was an angry mob growing outside and continued to pour them water and wait on them. No effort was made at all to turn the tables to seat the people waiting outside for 2+ hours.  As a  NYer, i have no qualms about speaking my mind so on my 5th trip up to the host, I told him that he couldn't keep telling people that they'd get seated "soon" but not do anything about trying to clear tables.  To which he replied verbatim:  "I'm sorry you feel that way but in the restaurant business, we call it good customer service to let us customers stay as long as they like". Um what? To which I shot back "ok dude, I'm from NY and have friends in the restaurant biz so please don't lecture me about how it's done.  And if customer service to you means catering to rude customers overstaying their welcome and pissing off the ones who have yet to get seated...then you're in the wrong business" Anyway, a total of 2.5 hours later, we get seated and we decide to make the best of it.  Wait staff were friendly and nice.  We ordered the spinach and cheese empanadas (amazing). and shared the vacio and vesuvio steaks.  The flavor on both were great.  We asked for medium and got medium.  However, the quality of the meat is not the best...it's a bit stringy.  But given the reasonable prices, you're really not going to get premium steaks.  We were also comped a cheese appetizer for our wait...it was a good effort but really would've preferred better restaurant management. So to sum up, come here on a weeknight, really early on a weekend or make a ressie for 6 and grab some strangers to join you for a good meal. Otherwise, be prepared for an insane wait due to the manager's inability to grow a pair and run his restaurant efficiently.

Had a terrible experience, the service was very poor sraff not well trained and the manager (Alex) has no work ethic or professionalism.  My story is to long to post but wouldn't ever go to this place again.

Great place, but I question their meat/cut selection - mine was way too fatty. 3rd try in 3 years.  Staff is great, service is A++. Maybe I'm ordering bad?  Go, try it, tell me  I'm wrong...please! I love TS.
Best BYOB steakhouse I've found in Chicago.  It is quite dark and loud inside but the patio was really nice when the weather permits.   The empanadas were delicious as was the filet.  We'll be back.

This place lived up to the hype and then some. My boyfriend and I have tried to go the last few weeks and kept being met by 1 hour and up wait times. We stopped in at 8 on a Tuesday and finally got a table right away. The food and atmosphere were amazing. Very dark and hidden feeling, but you're surrounded by a packed room of people. We ordered the provolenta which was delicious. A great appetizer for 2 or 3 people. We then ordered off the chefs specials menu which included meat, salad, and potatoes. The Bife Vesuvio was perfection and enough for a second meal the next day. Prices were reasonable for the quality and portion size. Service was a bit slow and robotic, but everything came out just right.

To start - the steaks here are AMAZING. No exaggeration. It's not rare to see people take a bite and close their eyes. It's part of why there is often still a long wait at 10pm on a Sat night. It's worth it. Prices are more than reasonable, plus it's BYO and no corking fee. We've eaten here before but this last visit made an impression on us. We were back in town for a wedding this weekend, so we got a group together and made a reservation last week. Everyone likes this place, so our reservation ended up being for 15. They had us in for 930. Trouble was, people at the tables before us decided to linger and the restaurant wasn't able to seat us until well after 10. I had a lot of very hungry, not very happy people on my hands.  But the host team and servers - especially  our server Max - made it up to everyone. They apologized profusely and almost as soon as we sat down, they had the wine uncorked, brought out that amazing melted cheese appetizer (on the house) and got our order taken in record time. They also fit in an extra chair for one of our group that showed up very late - every group has "that guy" right? They even threw in flan at the end, which was a hit. And of course, all of the food was excellent. Sincere thanks to the Tango Sur staff for the top notch customer service, and for turning around an unfortunate start into a great dinner. Their efforts were extremely appreciated. Looking forward to the next time we come back - though we will probably try to keep our reservation under 10 people next time, as a favor to everyone. :)

My experience at Tango Sur was very "eh" overall. They don't take reservations on weekends. We were told by a not-so-nice host that our wait would be at least an hour, probably more. But they take your phone number and you can go to the bar next door while you wait.  Once we were called, we were seated outside. The waiter came over immediately after we were seated, which was obviously not enough time to figure out what we wanted. Then he didn't come back for over 20 minutes. Between the host and the waiter, who was pretty indifferent to us, I certainly didn't think much of the service. There are only three good things I can say about Tango Sur. 1. It's BYOB and who doesn't love that? 2. The beef empanadas were absolutely delicious. 3. I did like the atmosphere. The outside seating was really very nice.  However, the steaks were pretty awful. Based on the overall 4 star rating on Yelp, maybe my experience was unique (however I do see a few other reviews that seem to match mine).  I ordered the short ribs which were incredibly fatty and tough. Absolutely do not order this. My friend ordered the Churrasco, which is one of their specialties. It was bland and tough.  And I have to give a special shout out to the worst salad in the history of salads. iceberg lettuce and a couple of thick slices of tomato. When it was served, I actually laughed. It looked like the toppings for a hamburger. I don't really understand the appeal of this place.
A fun evening out! We were a group of 10 and had a great time. The food is decadent & delish, the service was on point and overall the place has a comfortable and cozy vibe. Definitely worth a visit.

As for me to give a little bit of credibility, I have eaten at almost all of the finest and hit restaurants in Chicago, have traveled to many countries trying hundreds if not thousands of famous restaurants and raved mom & pop rests. I was privileged to have a professional cook growing up. Despite all this, I'd say I had the best pork chop in my life last night.  My bf and I decided to go there as a last minute decision; had never been nor heard of it. He's Cuban and this was the closest thing to Cuban food still open and close to where we were. We called for reservation and was sat immediately upon arrival. To my delight, the atmosphere was quaint and enchanting despite how loud it was. Felt as a true date and unintentionally gave my bf and I a romantic night. Our waiter looked like a mix between Orlando Bloom and Antonio Banderas, with even a voice similar to A.B.'s ... From a girls perspective I liked it lol.  The service was so great, my bf gave him over 30% tip. He ordered the 12oz. sirloin with fries and I got the Pork Chop that was covered in a sauce I can't stop thinking about and a bounty of vegetable medley that complements the dish. I don't eat steak, but tried my bfs and it was very tasty. Only complaint there is that he ordered it Medium-rare and it came out medium. He thought it taste so good though that he didn't even notice until I pointed it out. Wish we had room for desert as they look incredibly good in the pictures on here. Overall, 2 THUMBS UP! DEF exceeded our expectations.

If you love meat, this is the place for you! The Argentinians know their meat. You barely need a knife to cut the filet, and it still that juicy & tender the next day. The service is just at the right pace. I recommend the spinach & cheese empanadas. And the garlic olive dipping sauce is heavenly, dip your bread and enjoy! The only draw back is that this place is popular and their not in a rush to get you out that you should plan on waiting, even with a reservation, but in the end it's worth it!

byob =) One of the best steakhouses I've been in Chicago. The atmosphere was dim/romantic. The noise level was pretty loud. It gets crowded pretty quick too. I started with the empanadas as appetizers. The chimichurri sauce that came with it complemented really well. I loved the chimichurri so much that I asked for a side of it with my steak entree (and I suggest you do the same cuz it's DELICIOUS). I got the filet. It was my first time getting it cooked bleu. I actually enjoyed it. Chewy... beefy... raw... Mmm! They basically just sear both sides of the filet and serve it to you. Be bold my friends, and try it! At least once in you life! The steak comes with a side of broccoli mashed potatoes.  It looks like Shrek's boogers, but don't be fooled by its appearance. It is well balanced. Not too starchy. And most importantly, IT TASTES GOOD. If I ever get a chance to come back, I will definitely try the other steaks.

My wife & I went here on a Monday night with our son, based on his getting very good reviews from friends. It was definitely a mixed experience. We arrived just before our 8PM reservation & were immediately seated outside, as requested, at the table farthest from the door (north end). We received water & bread fairly quickly, but then were basically ignored for 20 minutes until we asked for our waiter. He finally appeared & we placed our order for an appetizer & 3 entrees. It took at least 15 minutes to receive our appetizer, which was just cold prosciutto (fatty) & lettuce. Our dinner salads came shortly thereafter, & were almost entirely iceberg lettuce. Our entrees, when they were served, looked very good. In fact, both my wife & son said theirs, eggplant & beef fillets, were excellent & very good, respectively. Mine, on the other hand, the beef short ribs, while tasty, was quite possibly the worst piece of meat I've ever been served. From the 1st bite it was tough & chewy, & consisted of at least as much if not more fat than meat. I regret not complaining on the spot, but didn't want to embarrass my son. Based on the overall 4star rating of this place my experience may have been a fluke, but I can't in good conscience recommend it.

Worst restaurant experience of my life! Waited 40 min to be seated for reservation and 2.5 hours to receive food. We almost walked out. Food/Meat was hauntingly terrible. Tough, tasteless, mystery meat. I literally cannot think of a worse meal. I am still gagging the next day.
Bone in rib eye was good. Seasoned well. Very tight fit & not enough space but food was good. If you drink you have to byob

Amazing place, outstanding food and very attentive service.  I have dined at tango sur a few times with large groups (10+)  and they have never failed to accommodate us. their empanadas are exquisite, steaks are definitely their forte, bife Vesuvio is my personal fave. They do have fish options however. . I am and will continue to be a loyal customer to tango sur.

I thought this place was very average. Don't get me wrong, the ambiance was impeccable and I have never been seated at a table completely lit by candles. It was very romantic and cozy, which I love. But the food...eh: 1) The empanadas - the breading was too condense and some parts were overcooked. The filling was pretty delicious, however. We tried the spinach and the beef. I would rate this 3/5 stars. 2) The chorizo - overcooked and not that special. I felt like we were eating a plain brat with chimichurri, so I would not suggest this. 2/5 stars 3) The steak - we ordered the Lomo Relleno, which is meant for 2 people, which is an argentine filet filled with chimichurri, ham sauce, and served on a grill with portabella marsala. The filet was a huge piece of meat but it wasn't sliced and it was cooked unevenly. I thought the actual quality of the meat was average. We were really excited for the ham sauce but the marsala overpowered the entire dish. Also, because it was so dark in the room it was hard to see if I was eating steak or a mushroom. I would give this 3/5 stars 4) Spinach Mashed Potatoes - I thought this was very average. Not a whole lot of taste or creamy buttery deliciousness found in most mashed potatoes. I would pass on these if I were to come back.I would give this 3/5 stars. If it weren't for the romantic ambiance, I don't think this place would be as popular. We really came here to re-live our Argentina experience, which would have failed miserably if we didn't bring our very own delicious bottle of Argentinean wine (byob), which saved the meal.

4.0 may be harsh. 4.5 more like it. Great steaks - filets, ribeyes, sirloins, etc. - all served in massive, family-sized portions. A little pricey, but a great value. Service is a little slow, but that's sort of the style. Good alternatives for those not looking to gorge on red meat too - their eggplant and  gnocchi dishes are supposedly tasty. Lots of good appetizers, but wished I'd skipped that part when the waiter put down 3 lbs of sirloin in front of me, with a healthy helping of potatoes.

Since I can't go with 3.5 I'm going with a 3. Restaurant is incredibly dark and intimate, good for groups and dates.  It gets very loud in here.  Of course the meat is the centerpiece here which is what we ordered.  We had a filet something or other (that serves 2) with a mushroom sauce and mushrooms.  To start we had this gigantic melted cheese deal and that was served with their table rolls which I found to be pretty boring. BYOB so that's a big plus.  The steak is tasty (and chewy) but keep in mind it's smothered in sauce and seasonings and chimichurri so I wouldn't rank it along the same lines as the big Chicago steakhouses in terms of quality.
Food was delicious. Better than food was live guitar and overall atmosphere. Look forward to coming back.

This is a great place to dress up, look great, see and be seen while chopping down massive steak and guzzling wine!   A great atmosphere is created by the darken room (even on a sunny day outside) candlelit tables and a smoky atmosphere sans actual smoke.   I went with a mutli-ethnic group that all speak Spanish so bantering with the waiters in Spanish then back to English was a riot in itself.  Very good service! We started with empanadas, great choice!  Entrees were Lomo and Ribeye steak both were seasoned to perfection.  The Lomo seemed more fun to eat because it comes out on a table top grill.   After chilling with some strong coffee, we kicked back shouted our conversations like everyone else and enjoyed the experience.  Great fun this place.

My favorite intimate little treasure nestled close to the Music Box Theatre hasn't disappointed me yet. In the decades I've been bringing people, the same people that got engaged here now celebrate anniversaries, birthdays, etc here. Yes it's loud, always packed and always has a wait but that should clue you in as to how memorable and succulent the meals are. We always cover the table (and our faces) with empanadas, parilladas and churrascos. Factor in that it's now BYOB and let this become ground zero for the start of a fabulous and memorable night- you won't go wrong. You're welcome.

Went here for a bachelor party, and had a really good time. Would get 5 stars except when our party of 18 arrived for our reservation they told us we'd have to wait 30-45 mins as they had to move people inside due to rain. Would have been nice to get some free appetizers or something for the inconvenience.  Food is really good, although you can share any entree, the filet comes with 2 filets and when I commented to the waitress about how much food there is she said " Yea most entrees can be shared" Well it was a little late at that point as we all ordered our own entree. But this place is definitely worth a visit

Last night I had my first Tango Sur dining experience, and I can honestly say that I've got nothing but love for the hearty food, the intimate (yet lively) ambiance, and the friendly service! I will definitely be returning, and would recommend it to anyone who loves quality meats, delicious sweets, and a good ol' BYOB.  So what if we waited 15-20 minutes to be seated? The weather was lovely and I was in great company. Besides, I never mind waiting a little longer for good eats. Speaking of which... - We started with the seafood salad (Mezcla del Mar), which was delicious! Fresh and savory, with a tangy little pop of fresh squeezed lemon that created the perfect flavor balance. Simple and satisfying. I could stand to have more of this salad in my life.  - I got the filet mignon entree (El Filet) and have zero regrets. It actually comes with two fillets as well as a little cup of chimichurri sauce (I could've used two of those) and a healthy serving of spinach and garlic mashed potatoes. I wasn't a huge fan of the mash, but that's more because I'm simply not big on potatoes unless they are either in fry form or sweet/yam form. Not your fault, Tango Sur. That's an ongoing personal issue I'm working through. - My date got the Bife Ve Suvio, which he destroyed. It was an amazing feat to witness, since they really load each dish up with copious amounts of meat. He just got really quiet and Hoovered that thing. I was able to salvage a sample and it was HEAVENLY!  - Holy mother of flan! Now when I tell you that I'm the kind of gal who "likes" flan, I mean that I don't particularly "love" flan. Like, I never go out of my way to get my hands on the stuff and am usually pretty "meh" about it when I do. But that thick, rich (but not too rich!) dollop of dulce de leche on top makes Tango Sur's flan the only dessert I ever want to finish a meal with ever again. Real talk. I don't ever need to see another piece of chocolate anything if I can have this stuff instead. My date is even less of a fan of flan, but was fully converted as well. Seriously: try the flan, thank me later. And to top it all off, our waiter was a dream: super friendly, helpful, attentive and hospitable. He was tipped very well in return :) All in all, this was easily one of THE BEST meals I've had since I moved to Chicago almost two years ago. And that's coming from a gal who's really been eating her way around the city. I'll be back, Tango Sur... just you wait :)

Loved this place! The food was great. Service was nice and I never felt rushed. BYOB. I had a beef empanada. And then my friend and I shared the flank steak. I'm glad we shared because it was about a 12 oz steak and huge. Perfectly cooked, juicy, with deliciously seasoned potatoes and chimichurri sauce. We sat outside on the patio. The perfect place for my friend's birthday. For three of us we paid $45. Great deal. I'll be back.

A favorite of mine. The steak is always good no matter what. I've never tried anything besides the parrillada because everytime I go that's all I want. My fiancé and I always share one and that's sufficient.

This place was amazing. I visit the city about once a year and last year this made the "i have to try" list so when i made my travel plans this was the main place to go for me.  The food was amazing, i had the pork chop and it was creamy with the right kind of seasoning it was perfection. In fact everything ordered did not disappoint. The wait staff was on point we never needed to fag anyone down nor where they constantly at our table, just the right amount of attentiveness to make our night a pleasure.

My wife and I went there yesterday for our 18th anniversary. We went there back when we were dating. While my wife really enjoyed her flap steak, he vesuvio potatoes tasted old and gross. I ordered a veal t-bone and was insanely disappointed. It was filled with gristle/silver skin. My steak knife could get through it. I pointed it out the the waiter and he told me I was wrong and it was fat. When I pointed to the fat, that I could cut through and then the gristle that I couldn't cut through, he repeated that he was fat and that is what give veal it's flavor........ Really? Are you fucking kidding me? $28 for a scoop of mashed potatoes and an inedible steak. Also, it was very hot outside and they served us water with no ice.

Definitely a restaurant my boyfriend and I want to try again. I had the Bife Vesuvio, absolutely delish. We brought our own wine bottle and also loved that there was no corkage fee. Only bad thing was the wait, about an hour and 30 minutes.

Yup not 3 stars, should have reread my own review but I wanted steak and BYOB, hopefully outdoor seating. We sat outdoors this time and that was the best part of the meal, nice patio seating and a bottle of Champagne on a Monday night. Anyone who puts this is the "best steakhouse in Chicago" in their review really needs to clarify exactly WHICH other steakhouses they're comparing it to. They probably haven't been to any of the big boys Chicago is known for. Even at a lower price point, it's just not worth it. The meat was, meh, not at all the awesome steak of my memories. I got the El Filet. Cooked right, just bland and really dependent on the sauce. The spinach mashed potatoes were just awful, no potato flavor and watery as other reviewers have said. Yes, no potato flavor sounds odd, but it was a flavorless green paste. The rolls are just sad: tough, cold, chewy in a bad way. Their service is VERY "laid back," if you want something, like your check, you need to be assertive. Not a negative per say, just be aware and adjust your expectations accordingly. Follow the four star hype if you want, but Yelpers got this one wrong. This update is more for me anyway, so I remember that I don't want to waste a night out on steak I'm not going to enjoy. Take it or leave it. If you loved it, glad you had a good experience, but this place is just not for me.

The waiter was rude and placed the wrong order. We didn't like the food. The empanadas were OK, the provoleta cheese had no taste at all and we couldn't even finish the veal milanesa because it was too greasy and chewy.  The experience was very l disappointing and over-priced.

LOVE this PLACE!!! We eat here all the time because it's always fantastic! I love the spinach and beef empanadas (the ham was good but it's not my fav). Love the churrasco steak and the eggplant marinara dish is awesome.

What's not to love about this place? BYOB, red meat, empanadas, romantic.  My only hesitation is the lack of reservations, there is nothing worse than trying there for a Friday night date and waiting outside for an hour.  If I want red meat, and don't mind waiting, I'll be back.

I came back to tango Sur after 7 years (I used to be a regular before moving to the burbs) and it was a pleasant surprise. Food was great. The atmosphere is candle light. It is a nice (if not the best)second date restaurant and also cool enough to share with a group of friends! You must order their empanadas. they are fantastic! I order a "bife de chorizo". The steak was cooked to perfection. Their portions are super sized so, come hungry or be prepared for a doggy bag home. I really recommend it. Love that place
