One of my favorite places in town.  I could go on an on about the food, but the service and atmosphere need mentioning too.  Both are some of the best in town.  Great on Sunday's when less crowded.  I wish they took reservations, but they would be booked for months.   The empanadas are the best around and  the steaks with that chimichurri are fantastic.
Packed on Saturday eve,  but oh so worth waiting!   Loved the eggplants vinaigrette, warm bread and the Bife Ancho, to die for!  Excellent service,  nice job in the BYOB section as well.

One reviewer says "The best steakhouse in Chicago."  Really?!?!?!?!?!?!  I would suggest that you need to get out more.  A LOT more.  Understanding that opinions and tastes vary, I think the opinions of this place are significantly skewed by the BYOB policy and the likelihood that most people are drunk by the time their meat comes.  I have been here 4 times, and there are no less than 20 other steakhouses in the City I have been to multiple times that I would EASILY put ahead of Tango Sur.  IMO this is the most over-hyped place in Lakeview and one of the most over-hyped in the entire City.  Each time my meat was at least a full level of doneness away from what I requested.  The meat itself is nothing special.  Yeah, it's o.k. ambiance, yeah they can do bigger groups, but there just ain't nuthin' special.

I SO wanted to love this place! It was a disaster from the beginning. Our waiter was beyond creepy - so creepy that we didn't want to look at him. He placed the wrong order for both of us, only correcting my friends order and conVINCING me that what he brought me was steak when it was so clearly veal...or an albino cow. Nothing made this experience worth returning.
Food, delicious.  BYOB, great. The half hour turned one hour turned two hour wait even with reservations.... Not too nice.

So last night the wife and I went to Tango Sur in Chicago. We arrived just a few minutes before 8pm. I hand my keys to a valet  and he says, " Just so you know we close at 11pm." ( At the time I found it a bit odd considering it was not even 8pm yet.) I walked up and put my name in, the man there says, " hour to and hour and a half." I give him my telephone he will call when our table is ready.. my wife and I walk down to the irish pub about 2 doors down to kill the time. At roughly 9:45pm (about 15 minutes later than the latest time I was quoted) I got a call saying,"please come back your table is nearly ready".. we walk back the 200 ft to Tango Sur to claim our table and the guy says " please step to the left sir".. we got behind one couple who within minutes was moved right in, then 10 minutes go by and its 10pm, my wife asks the man, "how much longer do you think it will be?" He replies with some suave and predetermined answer," Terribly sorry for the wait but we have guests who have paid their bill, we are just waiting for them to leave their table and we will get you right in.".. just then a guy behind us walks up speaking in Spanish and suddenly after a few chuckles he and his date are swept right in. I had enough, I began telling the guy off, more than a few choice words were surely included, the manager comes out apologizes and takes us right in and offers to comp our appetizer.. it is now roughly 10:05ish.. we sit down and our waiter comes by.. he brings water and walks straight away.. 5 more minutes go by(I'm watching every minute at this point I have to grab my car by 11pm) he finally comes back and we say" Yes we are ready to oreder. Can you bring the appetizer out with the food, we've waited a very long time and have to pick up our car in less than an hour".. the waiter looks dead at me and says, " ah the kitchen is backed up it will be at least an hour til your food will come out." I said" but the valet closes at 11pm do they come in at least to give you your keys or basically am I losing my car potentially at 11?" He nonchalantly shrugs at me and says " hey were busy food will be an hour at least I dont know about valets" I stood up middle fingers in air and walked out.. Thank you Tango Sur for providing THE WORST SERVICE I have ever experienced at ANY PLACE AT ANY TIME, thank you for all acting like you run a big shot vegas night club instead of a quaint and humbled Chicago restaurant, thank you for setting the bar to an ALL TIME NEW LOW STANDARD of disrespectfulness, and most of all thank you for nothing, I essentially spent 45 minutes driving into the city, and hour and 45 minutes waiting for a call, another 15-20 minutes to be sat and waited on, all to find out I could lose my car foir the night while waiting yet again for another hour to see food much less eat it.. I will never be back and whenever I'm asked about my personal ALL TIME WORST EXPERIENCE IVE EVER HAD I WILL BE SURE TO TELL PEOPLE ALL ABOUT YOUR ESTABLISHMENT.
The BEST steak house in Chicago.  (Deliciousness + Service) to Price Ratio is Maximum at this place. You will not be sorry.

My husband and I came here for our anniversary and were very disappointed. I'll start with the positives, the ambiance is great for a date night, candlelit, very intimate. The empanadas were ordered for our appetizer were pretty good, they were cooked nicely and had a good crunch and flavorful filling. Unfortunately the positives stop there.  We were seated ridiculously close to another couple (I was much closer to the man at the other table than I was my husband. It took the intimate vibe to an awkward level). The bread we were served looked like day old rolls from Thanksgiving at Grandma's and tasted like it too. We waited over 30 minutes between our appetizer and entrees.  When the steaks did arrive the plates were swimming in juice from the meat. I ordered mine medium well and classifying what I got as rare would be generous. I requested that it be cooked more and when I got it back it was still under cooked, but I didn't feel like asking again. The meat was next to flavorless and the potatoes were runny.  Overall an awful experience and I can recommend staying away especially for a special occasion.
I love Tango Sur. Byob.. Romantic atmosphere.  Dark. I love the El filet.  There's a wait though, so plan ahead!

Awesome, awesome place. BYOB, steaks are delicious and huge portions. The heart of palms in gulf sauce is amazing. If you have a party over 6 definitely make a reservation for peak hours well in advance. If you don't have a big enough party you will wait a bit, but it's well worth it.

Best steak on the north side. The meat was seasoned well and cooked to perfection. Their empanadas were fantastic. The ambience is cozy and intimate. The service was very good. The best part is they are a BYOB. I would go here every week if I lived closer.

I literally came home and created a Yelp account just give this place a review. After reading all the great reviews and even seeing it on the show 190 North we were ecstatic about trying this place. It's really not all its hyped up to be we waited about 30 minutes to be seated....the restaurant is quite small. The service was not the best....we were only checked on once after we got our food. It took nus an HOUR to get our food!! The food wasn't out of this world. Seriously, the mashed potatoes tasted like a box mix and they were cold. The steak was average. Overall our experince was not very pleasant and we won't be back to Tango Sur!

Maybe they had a really (really) off night. But we had a terrible experience.  The good: empanadas and eggplants in vinegar both good.  The bad: the rest.  We got the mixed grill for two ($40). The meat in that combo was unchewable.  Flavor was ok -  just had to spit afterwards since there was no breaking apart the meat with our teeth and using water to swallow meat as if it were pills is probably not how it's supposed to be done.  Told the waiter, he offered fillet and some unintelligible excuse for the other meat.  They brought 2 large plates with fillet (4 large pieces total) to replace the $40 combo.  The cost was something like $56 for the 2 fillet portions.  I'm ok with paying extra but the server always needs to explain  what he will replace the original order with and if there will be a difference in price. I wasn't expecting 2 separate portions, either.   Last but not least - the fillet had no flavor. Yes it's not the most flavorful cut in general but the lack of flavor in this case was pretty epic even after liberal amounts of chimichurri and salt... Probably won't be coming back.

Amazing steakhouse!  We had a couple empanadas to start, and they were delicious. I was recommended the "El Filet", and I'm so glad I went with it. It was one of the best steaks I've ever had. The sauce it sits on top of is perfect with it. And the side of spinach mashed potatoes are great. The service there is very good and attentive. I highly recommend this place!

The filet for 2 was amazing and was a great deal! Had to wait a while to get in, but the food was worth it. We went late on a Saturday night and the service was pretty slow, but our waiter gave us a free dessert for our wait. Love that it's byob. We'll be back here for sure.

Tango sur exceeded my expectations. First off the service was phenomenal! We went there on a Tuesday it was packed, we opted yo sit on the patio so there was a wait, however there is this little back room called the drinking room where you can start drinking your byob! The room is dark but it makes you feel as if you left Chicago and are in Argentina. The steaks had great flavor!! I've been to many steaks house..maestros Ruth Chris... This was not the change your life steak but it was very good don't get me wrong! Great prices awesome staff, amazing atmosphere, byob, tasty steak makes me highly recommend this place ! Oh yea the empanadas are the bomb!!!!

This place is amazing! Went there with a big group for some friends who were in town and we couldn't have been happier. The service is phenomenal and they were very accommodating around our party size changing a couple of times. The food is delicious and all freshly made. Plus since it's BYOB the bill wont break the bank. It can get very loud and the lighting is mostly candles so just keep that in mind when considering this place. Overall a great find and I can't wait to go back!

The best steak and very affordable and it's BYOB!!!   This place is good for group or date night!!! Our server is excellent!!! We have a reservation but there is still a wait, waiting room is small and we are big group 9 ppl!!! Over all is good place, we will be coming back.

I absolutely love this place! The food is fantastic, the ambiance is cozy, and the wait staff is excellent! Although the seating is fairly tight, I did not feel rushed or cramped. I especially liked the candle lit dining. Our waiter had a great sense of humor and was attentive and very knowledgeable of the menu. If you don't know what to order, you can't go wrong with the para uno. It gives a good portion sample of their meats and generous sides as well. Because it's BYOB, it doesn't break your pocket and I'm able to bring my favorite bottle of Cabernet souvignon! My first time coming was in February and have been back twice since. Every time a great experience! I do, however, recommend coming early. This place gets packed quick and their is no waiting inside. They will take your cell phone number to call when your table is ready so you don't have to stand outside which is convenient, but if you can come early is best. Just writing this review is making me crave some more! :)

Tango Sur is an Argentine restaurant. Really special place, good price and good service. I have been there once and I will go back as soon as I can. The place is very typical: a rustic restaurant, not so fancy and the illumination is made by candlelight. The waiting room is small and do not have capacity for too many people, so I would recommend making a reservation. One thing that called my attention was the waiters; they were very gracious and one even tried to speak in Portuguese, which is the language I was speaking with my friends. When I arrived there, I was insecure because I have not eaten a good steak in a good price in the United States until that day. It is hard for me, from Brazil, to find places that I do not need to spend too much money to eat. Steak is something from our day-to-day and something that I miss a lot living here. This place made me feel at home and I did not have to spend a lot of money. For two or three hours, I thought I was in Brazil. Argentine restaurants in Brazil are very common and this one was as good as most of ones that I have been in Brazil. For me and most of Brazilians, a good steak is not only the way it is prepared, but also the cut of the meat. If you go to South America, you will find more cuts than here. The way you season your steak is important too and that is another thing that I liked a lot there. You could feel the quality of the beef and flavor of the steak mixed with garlic and salt. I was with five more people, all Brazilians. We started ordering empanadas, which is very similar to an appetizer that we have in Brazil called "pastel". It blew my mind and the price was amazing, $2 each! You could not taste the flavor of the oil because even being fried, it was very dry. The filling was amazing, it was a fluffy ground beef, not so dry and not do wet and well-seasoned with garlic, onion, salt and parsley. There was other types of filling available, but beef is always my first choice. Then we went direct to the point: the meat. We ordered four plates because they are large enough for two people. Two bife de chorizo, one vacio and one asado de tira. Everything was pretty good, but the bife de chorizo was so good that I almost cried of happiness, I could taste the medium rare flavor with the juicy pink center, the texture of the meat was like a butter and it was melting in the mouth. They all came with salad that was an example of "less is more," it was simple and good: lettuce, tomato, onions, olive oil and salt. It is admirable how they turn simple plates in something that you cannot stop eating. In addition, there was another thing about what the restaurant offers: Guaraná soda. Guaraná is a plant native to Brazil, which has a fruit that is used to make the soda. It is as common and as popular to drink Guaraná in Brazil, as it is to drink Dr. Pepper or Rout Beer here. If you go to Tango Sur, I strongly recommend ordering Guaraná to drink. At the end, the total was $25 for each person with the service included, which is not too expensive since the quality is exceptional and everything was delicious. I recommend this place if you are in Chicago and I can say that it turned into my favorite restaurant here.

**** Vegetarian Review This place certainly isn't lacking for good reviews, but I'm going to leave one anyway so that I can keep on on personal list of great dining experiences.   The corn empanada is incredible.  Just go ahead and order a mess of them.

Came here for an early dinner and enjoyed everything. We ordered empanadas for our appetizer and the parrillada for 2. The meats were juicy and cooked perfect. We also had our first sweetbread experience and it was so good. If you've never had it, don't be scared. You will love them. Can't wait to come back.

Love the cozy ambiance at this place - it's dark, only lit with candles, and at every table there's a young couple looking deep in one anther's eyes. That said - this is a good spot to bring your date for a tasty dinner, in casual setting. Food then? Must say I am not a huge steak eater. That said, I went for Norwegian salmon. It was a huuge portion with very creamy (yet delicious) sauce and mashed potatoes. Presentation, again very casual. Felt like something my mom would have put together a Tuesday night - in a good way. Our waiter was good, and as with this whole experience, his service felt very authentic. It's a BYOB which you can like or not - at this place it works really well and our waiter quickly came out with a cooler to keep our white bottle at good temperature, and gladly gave us an extra set of wine glasses since we had a red bottle too. Make sure you don't eat up everything on your plate cause you will most likely fall asleep - which does not make a good date!

Made a yelp account so I could write this. So it's saying a lot. This place is an absolute must go to! The beef, chicken, and spinach empanadas are flaky, light, and so delicious for $2 each!! The para uno is a great deal and a great way to try a couple things. Everything was so so yummy with generous portion sizes. If you're still hungry definitely get the French fries/papas fritas, perfectly fried and have a delicious kind of breading on them. The people working here were all adorable and great too.  In other words: GO HERE NOW STOP THINKING AND YELPING JUST GO .

If you want to eat an amazing steak then Tango Sur is the right place to go! It's usually very crowded but you can make reservations which is awesome! Prices are great and you get high quality meat. Love the service too!

This places is yummy.  The green looking mashed potatoes are tasty, and yes, the pictures are real, when you order a filet mignon, you actually get to pieces.  I shared a plate with my girl friend.  Given the portions and taste, the price is right.   I will come back here again. I look forward to trying the skirt steak next time =)

Tango Sur, you had me at BYOB with no corkage fee! You literally can start drinking as soon as you get there. I was waiting for my group to arrive, and I was seated in the back waiting room where there are tables, wine glasses, and a corkscrew ready to go! I mean, waiting sucks, but drinking while waiting makes things a-ok.  On to the food ... man are the portions generous! Let's start off with the empanadas. They really are what everyone claims them to be : amazing, delicious, tasty, mouthwatering, appetizing.. you name it. I ordered 2 empanadas for $2 each and they were really filling! My group had fun sharing our empanadas with each other. Also, where else can you get an appetizer for $2?!  So the steak ... again, believe what everyone tells you when they say the portions are huge. Thanks Tango Sur for not only cooking up a delicious steak, but for also being pretty generous with the portion. I ordered the Churrasco and it was like 3 servings worth of meat for me. I had plenty of leftovers for the next day! The prices for the steak do seem a bit on the pricier side (my entree was around $23-24), but think of it as 2 meals in one and it justifies the price. (Not to mention the quality of the meat! I believe our server said the meat they use is grass-fed).  I would have given this place five stars except for :  -the dim lighting : It's nice and intimate, but is kinda straining on your eyes  -our server was kinda touchy: every time he spoke to us he would touch someone's shoulder or arm.  Other than that, it was a great experience. This is the kind of place you would go for a romantic evening out or an intimate dinner with friends.  tl;dr: BYOB, large portions, and feel free to overload on empanadas. Also, bringing night vision goggles wouldn't hurt.

3 hours to eat on the sidewalk, and nothing about this place was worth it. I don't get why people flock to here, there are lots of great places to eat in the area that don't require such an outrageous wait. Don't get me wrong, the food isn't bad by any means, just avoid at all costs on the weekends.

YUMMMMM!  This place is so goooood!  The empanadas are amazing.  The steak portions are ridiculous!  It is such a little romantic, candle lit place.  I would recommend this place to anyone wanting to take a date to a nice dinner.

I went here on a date night with a guy a few months back.   The date wasn't so great but the food definitely was!  The filet mignon was excellent, not the best I ever had but definitely worth the money for what you get.  This restaurant had the best romantic atmosphere of any restaurant I've been to in Chicago; dim lighting, candles, etc. The great part about this place is it's BYOB so we brought our own red wine to go with the steak.  Also the green mashed potatoes are really tasty!   So gentlemen, if you need to plan a date night in chicago, take your significant other to this restaurant.  She'll feel like a queen and enjoy it.
This place is amazing !!!!!!!! BYOB  Great service and everything on the menu is so good.

This place is amazing - but be ready for a wait.  We knew we would be chancing it on a Saturday night so we put our names on the list and hung out at one of the local bars, though 2.5 hours is quite a long time!  We met up with some friends from our Argentinian and Chile trip this past fall and were not disappointed by the authentic menu.  My husband and I both ordered different steaks (both from Argentina).  They have both US and Argentinian meat on the menu - just make sure to ask your waiter which is which (if you care) Though the long wait is a bit of a deterent, the food is so good that I know we'll be back again soon!

Awful bad service after we finally got seated the steaks took an hour to come out and were under cooked. Is there broiler section really that small? Choice meat at a choice restaurant you pay for what you get. If you want a decent steak stick to down town this is the minor league.

I have been here 5 times in 4 years. My birthday, girl gatherings, family get togethers etc. I'd say it's a wonderful place to hang, have a couple bottles of wine and eat some empanadas.  I work on "meat station" at work. My job is to ensure the customer receives their steak, chop and so on; cooked to their liking. I've ordered 4 steaks out of the 5 times I've been there. Not once was it cooked to my liking.  1.Filet MR- came out black and blue (I can handle it, I refused to send food back so I dealt with it) $28ish 2. Skirt steak MR- it was well done. Inedible  $20ish 3. El filet MR- comes with two filets, other person didn't want MR, I explained it's the only way to eat it. Came out raw. $28ish 4. Bone in ribeye Medium- came out rare as rare can be. $27ish I love food. I love meat. I LOVE byob. But I can't spend the money on something (with a cooks bank account) on food I need to send back.  Sent back the rib eye tonight- came back well done (microwave job I could tell).  All in all. Go on a first date, eat some empanadas and cheese. Go home (chew some gum) and make out.

The food is great, but the service is even better.  I planned a birthday dinner for my boyfriend last night.  There were 8 of us and the restaurant was so helpful about 1. scheduling the reservation, which I had to change the party size for a few times 2. suggesting menu items appropriate for sharing  3. getting the cake I brought ready  4. taking group photos  5. bill-splitting These sound like small things but having all of them done right made the birthday party a stress-free time for the planner (me) and lots of fun for the guests.   Lastly, I will definitely come back here because the food itself is THAT good.  the melted cheese app and rib-eye were amazing.

Went to Tango Sur last night, party of three. When we walked in we noticed that the restaurant is very welcoming, cute decor, candlelit, dark, and romantic looking. That's one star right there!  The second star comes from the server being a genuinely nice guy with our needs on his mind and very attentive. And also because the chorizo app. was really good. However, here's where the problem with Tango Sur begins: 1. No alcohol, zero, zilch. You MUST byob if you want vino. No choice.  2. We ordered two filets which are purportedly the best choices on the menu. The meat came out extremely chewy, RARE (even though we had ordered medium), and not seasoned at all. I am a veteran at Argentinian style steak. Unfortunately, this meat was very bland & much less appealing to our Spanish tastebuds than say...Outback Steakhouse.  The experience was very lackluster and disappointing. I had heard great things and was uber excited to try this place out. Sad Katy, sad. :(

My boyfriend and I were looking for somewhere different to go and a friend recommended this place. We went on a Friday night (in June 2013) around 6 PM, and we were able to be seated right away. There were also a lot of empty tables around us. By the time our empanada appetizers came out, all of the tables had filled up and there was a line out the door. The wait staff was attentive and able to recommended some shareable options for us.  We ordered the filet with spinach mashed potatoes. Our waiter told us that this was a popular dish. It came with 2 salads, 2 seven oz pieces of filet, and a large portion of spinach mashed potatoes (which are GREEN!). The salads were nothing special. I had a few bites then passed the rest to my BF. The steak was juicy and tasty. My medium ordered steak came out on more of the medium rare side, but it was still good. The potatoes were pretty good once I put some of the steak juice on top of it. We also ordered some carrot cake to finish the night, which was good. Our check was $46 without a tip.  All in all, it was a romantic location with good food and a great location!

Eh. Could have done without. Would have been 2 stars if it wasn't BYOB and we didn't polish off an entire bottle of Chianti and a bomber of beer.  We were really excited to go here because what's better than decently priced steak and BYOB in Chicago on a Friday night? The fact that it was BYOB was truly one of the only saving graces of this place. It has lots of hype and great yelp reviews, but our experience was different. We got there at 6:30 on a Friday night and the restaurant wasn't busy yet, which was nice thinking we were going to have to wait a few hours. That being said, there were plenty of open tables, but we got seated at the table right next to the kitchen which was not an enjoyable atmosphere and kind of a bummer since there were plenty of open two tops.  For starters we got one of each empanada which were all really good. For dinner, my husband got the bone in ribeye which he literally couldn't cut without shaking the table and I got a filet that was good and flavorful, but again SO TOUGH. We both took portions home, me because I was stuffed after 1/2 of the filet (which was the normal portion of a filet meal....not complaining though) and my husband because he was getting self conscious of knocking the table over trying to cut his ribeye. I mean, it's BYOB...and steaks were around $25. You get what you pay for...

After years of having this place on our "Must Try" list the boyfriend and I can finally cross it off.  As the restaurant is BYOB we brought a nice red wine to enjoy with our red meat. Our server, Martín, was wonderful and very attentive. We started off with the beef empanada and the antipasto. I would order the empanadas again to try some of their other options, but we would probably skip the antipasto. The antipasto wasn't bad, but for $10 we would prefer to just load up on empanadas.   For our main course we split the Lomo Relleno which is a large filet stuffed with ham sauce and chimichurri and topped with a portobella marsala. It was AMAZING. One of the best steaks I have had in a long time.  Typically we like our steaks medium rare, but Martín recommended that we get it served medium and he was right on the money.  Great food, romantic atmosphere, and decently priced. Can't wait to go back!
Amazing Byob! This is my go to place when I have out of town visitors or want a special night out with friends.

Went here for the first time a few weeks ago and didn't realize it was BYOB, what a shame...but on to the food and ambience. Empanadas was DELICIOUS, main entrees, not so much.  Was not in the mood for red meat and went with their breaded chicken topped with ham, cheese and sauce, it was too salty to even take more than 2 bites, would have mentioned this to our server, but he did not check back with us, until the very end, when we were given our check.  I would totally understand if the place was busy, but with only two occupied tables, should have been more attentive.

My friend and I came here for an early dinner.  We started off with the Empanadas (Argentine turnover with beef; this came with a side of chimichurri sauce; the exterior pastry shell was okay, but it was a little soggy due to the filling inside with the diced meat and the potatoes; I thought it was slightly bland).  For my entree, I had the Entrana, which was the outer skirt that was cooked on the grill, served with a side salad.  The steak itself was very large and was literally hanging off the plate.  It came with baked diced unseasoned potatoes and a side of chimichurri sauce.  The steak itself smelled really good, but I was a little disappointed as it was all mostly fat rather than meat. It was a cute restaurant and the place seemed to get packed to the gills, even though it was an early dinner time.  I'm glad I was able to check this place out! +fatty steak T___T

Best steak in Lakeview!!  This place is amazing! A carnevor's dream!! Phenomenal food, fantastic service and its BYOB. Go with an appetite as everything is generously portioned and you will definitely need a box at the end.  The waiters are extremely knowledgeable and can provide great recommendations and insight as to what you are in the mood for.  Make a reservation or dont, its up to you. If you get there early enough just put your name on the list and the host will call you while you pop into the other bars for a drink prior to dinner. We sat outside which was great however the atmosphere inside looked equally amazing.  Definitely the date night spot in the neighborhood. You wont be disappointed.

Absurdly delicious... Best filet I've ever had. Bring your own wine which is a winos dream... The spinach mashed potatoes were to die for as well-- I tried to replicate the recipe at home but unfortunately it wasn't as good. I will definitely return!

Finally made it to this great restaurant. The four of us took the suggested entrees-the flank steak and filet; shareable by the whole table. Very tasty! Love the BYOB option at $0! A bit on the noisy side, but heck, it was Friday nite at 7. Would definitely return.

I've been meaning to try this place for years! I thought they never took reservations, but I was wrong and my husband and I took an earlier reservation on Friday night. We got the pollo empanada which was delicious, as well was the provolone appetizer (which was huge, but super tasty). I had the el fillet which was tasty, the potatoes could have perhaps been a bit better. Our table had some shelf next to it which cramped my space a little bit more than to be desired, but overall this was a great experience and a lot more budget-friendly than I thought. BYOB is a major plus. Huge portions that could be split instead of individually ordering!

I give this place 5 stars because the food is amazing and  it's byob. It's the perfect place if you want a cool date or you just want to have a great dinner with friends. The service is also great! Amazing atmosphere! Grab a great bottle of red wine and a date, and come here for dinner! You won't regret it!
Everything was great food and service. We had veal t bones, and ride eye. Byob is alway nice as well.

We went here for my birthday bc we heard and read nothing but great things. I've never been more disappointed with a meal in my life. I've had better meat at Chili's. The only food we could agree on that was decent, were the empanadas. They were delicious. I would never go back.
One of my favorite places in Chicago. Great food and staff. Byob option makes for a great meal and solid wine for a price.
Very good steak house, reasonably priced and byob. Each time we came we did have to wait but we found that if we get there at 5pm, right when they open is the only time we can get a table right away.

Amazing! They've got great steaks. Went here for an anniversary with my girlfriend. Everyone says that there's a really long wait, but if you call ahead, you'll have no problems getting a table. The restaurant really does get crowded pretty quickly, even on weeknights.  We brought a bottle of wine, because they're BYOB with no corkage fee. We were sat at a nice, candlelit table at the window. We started off with some empanadas, which were good (but there are better ones elsewhere). Both of us got steak (which is what they're known for), and they came out cooked perfectly. The spinach mashed potatoes were great. The portions were massive, we both had leftovers. The prices were really reasonable for a steakhouse and for how intimate the place was. Service was attentive and friendly. Tango Sur is a great date night place.
Byob, delicious steak,  live music, unique romantic atmosphere,, & very fast staff. Everything was excellent. Great job , guys!

My cousin and I had a great experience at Tango. Our waiter was really nice, and had some good suggestions for us. We ordered a strip steak a bone in ribeye and two chorizo sausages. The meat was cooked perfectly, you can tell its high quality. My only complaint would be to turn down the base a little, the sound system has to much base.

Food was great, but especially the empanadas which were one of the best I've had (almost like my mami use to make). However, I think the lighting and layout of seating could se some improvement. Not enough space to have a drill st the bar while you wait for your table when there's a wait.  I would go again just try to make reservations ahead of time otherwise you'll be waiting... Awhile. Also is BYOB.

Love this place. Friendly staff, great atmosphere, delicious food for a great price....plus BYOB ... the only bad thing is that its always packed and they dont take reservations...but its worth the wait! Hands down one of my favorite restaurants in chicago

My friends and I enjoyed a good night here tonight. This was my first visit and I have to say I would return again the service was great and food as advertised. It fills up fast on Fridays so I recommend reservations. I had the churasco (Steak & Potatoes) and recommend it. The portion size is large, so make sure your hungry if you order it.

Had a wonderful evening at Tango Sur. The Argentinian music was exceptional and set the mood. The darker atmosphere with the candles was romantic.  Brought two bottles of Pinot noir and enjoyed the saganaki cheese appetizer and two empanadas. The ham and cheese was terrific. I would skip the spinach one and try the beef one next time. I ordered the filet entree and it was enough food for two. Easily the best entree at the table. Cooked medium rare and served with spinach mashed potatoes. Loved the chimichurri sauce. Just a touch of that took the steak to the next level. Enjoyed the cheesecake dessert and it was great as well. Was hoping for chocolate but this didn't disappoint.  Spent two hours at Tango Sur and the service was on point. We never felt rushed and it was truly a great "hole in the wall" here in Chicago. Worth the wait!
Great food 4 stars for service and my steak was rare! I asked for medium but man what an awesome atmosphere!!!

This is probably one of the very few places I will wait for more than an hour to get seated. The ambience is romantic and relaxing, lit by candles and intimate seating...intimate as you are probably more than likely to rub elbows with the person next to you! Typically this would bother me, but the food is too amazing for that to be an issue. I love the feel of the place, I imagine this is what a small intimate restaurant would be like in Argentina. My husband and I normally start out with ordering one of each of the five empanadas on the menu. Firstly, they are a steal at $2 and secondly, it would be wrong not to indulge in all of the equally delicious empanadas :)  I have tried most of their steak entrees and my favorites are Bife Vesuvio and El Fillet. Amazing dishes that can't be touched by any other steakhouses in the city. The ambiance, food, coupled with a zero corkage fee..Yep ya can't beat it!

I've been here a few times now and have always had great food.   The music they play helps you a feel you're being immersed in true Argentinian culture   There has even been live musicians playing.  It's usually pretty crowded which makes it pretty loud and lively.  A lot of my friends really like that it is BYOB.  And, even my friends from out of town have really enjoyed the place overall.  I really liked the empanadas,  the steak,  and the lemon chicken dish.  Great food, great atmosphere what more can I ask for?

This is my favorite restaurant... numero uno! Amazing steaks and I love the byob option.  I only wish they take reservations because there is always a terrible wait. It's so stupid... i have to go there put my name down and wait for them to call my cell phone!! we usually go to a bar down the street and drink and wait for the call which  usually takes 1.5 to 2 hours! if the foods wasnt soooo good i would never waste that kind of time.i hope they don't raise their prices or eliminate the byob otherwise it's not the the long wait for a table.

Ambiance is great , dark and moody. The meat is over seasoned , a little tough, but all plentiful. For the true carnivore experience, order combination platters for 2 or more. Also order the better grade of meat which is offered.  Of course the BYOB makes the overall experience even better.

Maybe it is my age, but at just over 50, there are few places I think are good enough to wait an hour and a half to eat at.  But neither my wife or I could come up with a better idea, or were really motivated to go elsewhere, PLUS the Yelp! reviews were strong and a friend who is a suos-chef recommended the place.  So we decided to wait.  Turn off number one, the waiting room was full, what is your phone number we will call you at whatever bar you'd like to go to when we have a table for you.   The place is dark, loud and jam packed.  It is only because it is so noisy overall, that you can't hear the conversations in the tables all around you.  And this is fine, we were up for that scene, but know this before you wait 60-150 minutes for a table if you think you are about to have a romantic, quiet, meal.   The food was good, but it is probably not something I would wait this long for again.  Glad they are doing this well, but no dedicated foodie (which I am not) would wait this long for a meal that was only this good.   We began our meal with the Provoleta, an "Argentine provolone cheese cooked on the grill with olive oil and roasted peppers."  Fine, I was hungry, I like cheese, it filled the stomach.  Note, it was actually better with the very simple, and frankly bland, lettuce and tomato salad they begin your meal with.   My wife, a pesce-vegie, ordered their highly recommended Berenjena, or "oven baked eggplant layered with spinach, provolone, parmesan and ricotta, served with a delicious tomato cream sauce" and found it delightful, but also good, not great.  I thought the flavors were interesting, and was enthusiastic to share a few bites.  I had a happy stomach of Bife Ancho, ribeye from the grill, done just a bit more than rare.  Not sure why I have to feel this way, but I was just impressed that it was simply done as I had asked, this is so rarely the case ANYWHERE one orders steak.  But here is the simple truth, I can make a steak as good as their's at home.  Glad to have someone else cook, steak was good, but not a WOW Argentinean delight or anything. The wait staff was warm and friendly, but rushed, the door person was also kind and gracious as he basically told us to take our six pack of Revolution Anti-Hero IPA to a bar and wait for 90 minutes.  If you were not aware, this is a BYOB restaurant.  It was a fine dining out meal, and yes, I would even go back with only a nudge (as long as it was no more than a 45 minute wait), but if you are expecting a blow your hair back Argentinian meal, well you won't' find that here.  Just a typical Chicago neighborhood place with an Argentinean theme where you can BYOB and be lost and get drunk in the crowded and noisy chaos while enjoying a good meal.

Amazing date night restaurant! The atmosphere is more catered to mid 20s, the service was probably the best part, and the Para Dos was phenomenal. BYOB is definitely a plus being about to bring your own wine for the different meats made the experience that much better. Definately recommend this to others out there looking for good food and service.

This is one of those places everyone and their whole family has been to....except me of course. I have a very good friend that is from Argentina and she swears by this place when it comes to authentic Argentinian food We met up there on a Fri evening and of course they do not take reservations for parties of 2 so we had a bit of a wait. Its byob, so I brought 2 bottles of wine for our enjoyment. They have a very intimate waiting area that is very dim and candlelit. After about 25 mins our seat was ready and we were hungry. I followed her lead on food as she has been here numerous times. We started out with the empanadas (spinach, chicken & beef) which were all good. For the main course we wound up sharing the Para Dos which includes grilled short rib, black sausage, beef shortbread, sausage & flap meat. Basically meat overload! Everything was delicious and packed with awesome flavor. More than anything I enjoyed the hell out of the grilled short rib. For dessert we had a caramel flan type dish and it was very good....it was huge so we shared with our dining neighbors. Service was really nice and they definitely made sure we had everything we needed. Very crowded but intimate setting which is one of the reasons the place is appealing...the other being he food..lol...I really dig this joint Definitely will return for the chilean salmon!

The place is candlelit, smells delicious, and is byob. Other viewers deduct points for loudness, and mediocre service, but I have to fend for this place. Think about it, on a business standpoint, if a restaurant only needs to be open a few hours a day to be successful, it's got to be good. Therefore it will be busy, there may be a wait to be seated even with a reservation. We waited 10min past ours. But hands down the best meal I've ever had.  Ordered the Prosciutto wrapped Melon and Chicken & Spinach & Cheese Empandas for our App. The Empanadas were flavorful and piping hot, the melon was delicious and refreshing. For our entree we asked a recommendation from the waiter, between the Lomo relleno or the Vacio. Both are huge hunks of meat marinated a little differently, and served on a casted roaster, that serves two. We went with his recommendation, the Vacio. The meat was succulent and tender, with carmelized edges here and there. The roasted sweet potatoes were simply seasoned and soft, almost to a mashed consistency.  Though the place was packed front to back including the waiting area, the staff was very very attentive. Our waiter visited us a total of 6 times, once to bring us a bucket of ice for our wine and beer and take our app order, once for our dinner selection & to serve, followed by the dessert selection and return, and last for our check. In between that the busser was there to take care of the apps, remove our plates and refresh the table.  Any wait we had was not long enough to notice. The great chat, wine, atmosphere, and delicious food made up for it.

Ive been to Tango Sur three times. Out of the three times I have actually ate here once. When it comes to the food I have no complaints BUT I feel that they think of themselves very highly. I have been to better steak houses where you actually are treated better. They aren't very accommodating to theirs customers. I went recently without a reservation and was told that the wait was 2 1/2 hours. I understand that I didn't have a reservation but even the times that I did have reservation I still had to wait very long to get seated and quite frankly the way they treat you here is not friendly. The doormen have dry piss poor demeanor. The food is good but I do think that it is overrated. Ive been Capital grill and Ruth Chris steakhouses and never been treated how I was here. Their customer service skills and whomever schedules reservations need to definitely improve.

This place is SO overrated! I was really excited to check it out after seeing the great reviews. Maybe I just got unlucky here? But the food was really nothing special and wasn't very tasty. I got the churrasco and thought it was really bland and fatty. My mom got the porkchop and it was super dry and again, very bland. My brother and dad got some steaks which were just also very sub-par. (My dad can make a WAY better steak). On top of that, the service was awful. I had to get up and ask a bus boy for our check because that's how MIA our server was. We didn't even bother trying to ask what was on the dessert menu. Very disappointed.
Definitely one of my favorite steak places in Chicago with great prices, you definitely get a lot more then what you pay for!!

Really good food.  Dark atmosphere, loud music but could still talk to eachother. BYOB...stop at CVS before going. Hubby had steak, I had Limon chicken. Sauces were great compliment to entrees.  Terrific services, Martin was awesome! Would recommend!

The food here is good, not great, you can definitely cook these cuts of meat better at home. The bread are those previously frozen white roles and the salad looks like it should be on a burger. The ambiance is dark, cheerful and drunk.  The service here is usually good to start but they don't check back much after that- especially not to inform them our filet was essentially raw (ordered medium rare). I have a theory that people always end up liking byobs that make you wait forever because your pretty sauced by the time you finally eat.

Simply terrible. The only place where you will make reservations and show up with other guests in your seats. This place gets a zero for customer service, and the front door guys scratch piece of paper for the guest list looks like a 3rd graders homework.

This was easily my favorite dining experience of 2013. The food, service and overall vibe were all 5 stars. Combine that with the Company of my lovely Wife and my two of my closet friends and you have an evening to remember.   The four of us were a hungry group. We started out with a couple of orders of Empanadas and the Provoleta. The Empanadas were delicious, but the Provoleta stole my heart. This is a dish of hot cheese served with Olive Oil and roasted Peppers. It was amazing.    For my entree, I decided to go with the Bife Vesuvio. It was a delicious cut of Steak stuffed with Cheese and Spinach. It was served with slices of Aregntine style Potatoes. It is one of the best Steak dishes I've ever tasted. And Yes...I even ate the Spinach.    Here's the delicious bottom line: Ive been to many places that serve delicious food, but Tango Sur has one commodity most eateries lack. That commodity is the staff. The staff at Tango Sur bend over backwards to make you feel at home. It seemed there was nothing they wouldn't do to enhance our dining experience. That my friends, is what makes Tango Sur great. If you haven't tried this place, you should put it at the top of your list of places to dine. Yes folks...Its that good.

This place was absolutely delicious, but not the best place for talking.  I went here with a group of friends for my friend's birthday dinner. Not having seen each other in a while, we were looking forward to catching up, but it was not very plausible with the loud music and everyone trying to talk over the music. I could barely hear what my friend across the table was saying to me. However, the food just blew everything out of the water. I had yelp'ed this place before, which is why we chose to go, but I was so delighted about the food. We had a few of their empanadas and they were delicious. We devoured them because we were hungry and we couldn't get enough. For main entrees, the majority of us had Bife Vesuvio and one had a chicken dish from the Chef Specials but I don't remember which. The beef was divine. I was in meat heaven if that exists. It had a lot of moisture, and the flavor wasn't overpowering. After a few months, I can still taste it in my mouth... It was that memorable. I recommend it! Be sure to have an empty stomach though because most of us took the rest home. For dessert, we had flan, but all of us were so full that we took tiny bites out of it. The flan didn't let us down either because it was delicious. It was just creamy enough.  Overall, I really liked Tango Sur because of the food, but it was far too loud. I may go back just to return to meat heaven.

I lived nearby and there is always an incredible wait/line. My boyfriend and I wanted to go on our Anniversary, but showing up at 7 means we didn't get a call until 9:30 for an available table. The second time we attempted it we were lucky, one spot left, but it was outside on a rather cold day and the heaters kept being blown out. Oh well, no big deal.  The food was okay. For all the work to go to the place, it ended up not really being worth it. The potatoes served with the Filet Mignon were delicious, I mean, they were great and they were the favorite part of my meal -- but the steak. Oh gosh. It wasn't good at all -- I ordered it Rare, but the meat lacked flavor and was incredibly chewy. I'm used to having melt in your mouth kind of steak. I mean, if you catch them when they aren't busy, I'd say it's worth trying. Otherwise, don't bother with such a long wait.

It was my first stop on my Chicago trip.  We shared the chorizo and empanadas (spinach and cheese).  Honestly I didn't feel like there was anything special with those two.  I ended up ordering the consteleta.  Ordered it medium and I was pleasantly surprised.  I had no complaints, perfectly cooked and seasoned exactly how I wanted it.

Tried coming here tonite, actually JUST left after walking in and being told by some guy (I hope he was the host, even tho he was dressed like some college student) that the wait was an hr long. When he heard the bf and I thinking out loud about the wait, he somehow "realized" that it was now "an hour and a half". Funny, since there were open tables that were very visible, with no reserved sign or anything. Was it bc I looked a certain way/Hispanic/middle eastern? I don't know. Guess we won't find out, bc I will take my business elsewhere!!!

Went with the daughter and son in law.  The shrimp were a reasonable choice for me as an entree but the bed of spinach upon which they were served was far too salty and oily for me to eat.  I let the others enjoy it. Pork, beef and chicken dominated the menu.  Lamb also was available as well as one veal dish. My meat eating fellow diners were very happy with their huge portions and enjoyed their meals. I enjoyed the company of my fellow diners. The service was attentive, unobtrusive and took good care of us. Street parking was difficult, but not impossible.  Just allow plenty of time and pounce on the first available spot!  You may not find another. The washrooms were clean. The ambience was very dark, crowded, and I was unable to see much more.  The crowded room was very noisy, but we enjoyed ourselves. Just be prepared for a meat-centric, crowded, noisy atmosphere.

im not gonna lie, i have dreams about the filet mignon from this place. but before i get to that, lets talk about the restaurant: Restaurant notes: -BYOB!! (yes this deserves 1 star in itself) -friendly and attentive service -cute setting and ambiance -prices are fair food: -i love love love the filet mignon and the spinach mash potato that it came with. each bite left me feeling like i was in heaven. this is the dish that i would come back here for -tongue: most people would be scared to try this, but i bet if you did, you'd love it. they served thick slices of the tongue but it was very tender. not chewy or tough at all.  -empanadas were delicious, i tried all of the flavors - the meat plater: it's a lot of meat! i didn't fall in love with this plater. probably because i was already in a meat coma from the filet. if i come back, i'd just eat the filter and not worry about any other meats.  4 stars instead of 5 because not everything was amazing, most things were. maybe a 4.5 stars if i could.

This was our third year visiting this place. Also the last. The base of the music was so loud it made the experience unenjoyably. The food was OK but not amazing as I had remembered it. The wait and the noise level was extra-ordinarily loud. This place is expensive, and in my opinion not worth it. We will be trying another place next year.

I have loved this place since it has opened. Always a great experience with good service and good food. Now having said this I was very disappointing with my last time here. I booked a table a couple of weeks in advance for my birthday. I ranted and raved about thisplace to my family and everyone was really looking forward to it. The service was good as we he had a friendly and helpful waiter. We all had a variety of the empanadas for an appetizer than we all got steaks. The empenadas were delicious but the steaks were sub par. I don't know if their supplier didn't come through but my steak in particular was terrible. I got the bone in rib-eye which had no bone; was about a half inch thick and cooked all the way through even though I asked for the steak medium rare. Besides the cut of the meat, the quality was terrible, most of it was fat and grizzle. For my birthday dinner I was really let down which completely took me by surprise. Most everyone with me had a similar experience with the quality of their steaks and I don't think I would give another chance even though I had so many good experiences there before. What really kills me is all the backlash I got for recommending this place.

It would be 5 stars if the wait wAsnt always so long just bc I'm so impatient but the long wait proves how good it is. Love this place its awesome that it is byob. I had a bday dinner here not long ago that we were able to reserve a table and the service is always great. The food is so great and if you're in the mood for a good steak come here. I lived in argentina for a few months and this place does a great job of incorporating the authentic argentine cuisine and culture

I've been eating here at least twice a year for 10 years, and I'm from the far West suburbs.   I just love this place so much.  Aside from BYOB which usually alone gets a couple more stars from me, the food is so unique.  I would've never considered myself the kind of person to go out of their way for Flap meat, sweet breads, and blood sausage, but you gotta respect good nose-to-tail cuisine.  In my book their Chimichurri is the best I've ever had; heavy on the Oregano. Even though I love fried empanadas their baked ones are still heavy on the butter (think pie crust.) so they're full of flavor.  The Ham and Cheese are the best in my opinion.; usually overlooked by most people. The provoletta with roasted red peppers is great, but can fill you up pretty quick so I would only order that with 4 or more people if you're also going to get Empanadas which are a must. I always get the Parrillada para dos and if getting a few appetizers is enough even for 4 people. For Dessert definitively get the Flan.  I'm not a flan fan typically, but this isn't your normal, dainty, light, bland, jello-like flan like you'd get at a Mexican restaurant...oh no, it's a dense, rich, creamy, full flavored custard topped with Cajete (goat milk carmel) that is soooo delicious. Just expect a wait.  I see bad reviews based solely on the bad taste left in the mouths of people who couldn't get past it to focus on the food.  Get there early, or expect to go to Cullen's for some drinks beforehand.

the food was delicious, for sure, but i'm not sure it justified the 1.5 to 2 hour wait (no reservations allowed for a party of 2) my friend and i endured for it. we ended up going to cullen's for a drink, went to jewel osco to get bottle of wine, and still sat in the waiting room in the back with other possibly slightly disgruntled customers. by the time we got to the table, however, our server was really en pointe and the food came relatively quickly. got the bone in ribeye, the flavor was amazing but i'm not sure if i'm cool with the medium temperature the server suggested (i'm normally a medium rare person). slathered the delicious chimichurri sauce on everything, including the still-warm bread at the beginning (hack tip: ask for chimichurri sauce instead of the butter they give you).  if it weren't for the loooooooooong wait, it would have been 4 stars.

Favorite place so far.  Steaks are amazing. Cooked so well.  Their entrees are great. The atmosphere is romantic perfect for dinner dates. Brought my family here for my moms birthday dinner. They gave us a complimentary cake. Thanks! You have gotta order their empanadas Everytime you come here, It is so delicous! Service was great. It was hard to find the waiters at times when you need something. But other than that I love love love this place. And it is in my neighborhood which totally rocks!

I came here with a group of 12 for a friend's birthday. We made a reservation well in advance, but still had to wait for a table for over a half an hour, in the smallest waiting area I have ever seen...by the only 1 person bathroom the whole place has.... Clearly the start wasn't the greatest, and some aspects as well, but the food and the service make up the 4 stars. After we were seated the service was speedy, and good. Our food orders were taken in a timely manner and we got our food pretty fast too.. My boyfriend and I got the empanadas to share, 1 spinach and cheese and 1 beef. I wasn't crazy about the beef one, just not my taste, but I did enjoy the spinach and cheese one. We also ordered the filet sharing dish, and subbed the mushrooms for mashed potatoes... We got the meat cooked medium, and it was cooked exactly how we asked.. pink on the inside, and oh so tender. I do wish that we would have ordered the filet for 1 person and shared because there was so much meat that it lasted us for lunch the following day, and I still have a piece left in the fridge. The BYOB aspect is great, bring whatever alcohol you want and joy it with your meal. This is NOT a place for a large crowd, and I have to say a group of 12 is too large for this place. It is soooo loud inside that you have to yell when you speak, so it would be much easier if there were 2 or 4 people together, not a big group trying to celebrate a birthday. Also, it is extremely dark here. I mean, beyond it being romantic. The main light supply is the candles that they place on the tables.... and a candle lit dinner is only awesome in movies, in real life you need to use your phone's flashlight setting to see the menu.. I would recommend for people to try this place, just expect to have a long wait even if you make a reservation, prepare to have to speak loudly, come in a small group, expect great service and prepare to eat so much delicious meat that you will roll out of the restaurant :-)

Lovely atmosphere. Generous portions. I love the small rooms, dark lighting, and candlelit tables. While I have gone with friends mostly, this is also a romantic spot. The prices are steep but two people could easily share one entree - particularly the chicken on the bone. The steak dish comes with two sizeable medallions and a generous portion of green mashed potatoes - yum! Definitely enough for two girls to split. Empanadas are tasty as is the Eggplant entree for vegetarians - delectable orange tomatoe sauce. Everyone took food home for meal #2! Also, the BYOB option is great.
Watery spinach mash potato, probably powder... Filet minion not fresh cut - tasted terrible. Been there before - same dish tasted great, don't know what happened this time

We were told an hour and half wait. After waiting 2 1/2 hours for a steak the waiter stated, "we prepare this well done, is that ok?" The steak was still breathing when it was served... It was soaking in oil!!! I would prefer Outback.  Never again!!

This was a meat fest. I've never seen so many cuts of beef on one table.  With BYOB/no corkage fee, it was easy to think it'd be a tipsy evening for our team dinner. No. Never. There was so much food that there wasn't even a chance. We really went for it and ordered appetizers, then each had an individual dish. Was it intended for us to share? Of course. We did it wrong. It was more like: "I'll order this and you order this and we'll share bites." Seriously, there was so much food on our table and somehow we ate nearly all of it. I was full off the appetizers. My entree - the filet mignon - came with TWO huge cuts of filet mignon. Last time I checked, you order a filet and you get one. This was overkill, but in the best way (oh. so. good.) All in all, sharing is the recommended approach to dining at Tango Sur. I'll list off some of my favorites as there was so much to be enjoyed that evening: - BYO-wine, always a plus. - The spinach mashed potatoes are spectacular. Thick and textured and really green. The spinach and garlic add a lot to this traditional side dish. - Ham and cheese empanadas with chimicurri sauce; I preferred this pairing to the spinach and cheese. It was like a fancy homemade version of a hot pocket. No arguments when there's flaky crispy dough involved. - Filet mignon - as I mentioned above the dish comes with 2 large cuts of filet. There's a tasty red wine sauce that's drizzled a top the steak that just enhances the melt-in-your-mouth tastiness. - Order the provoleta. It's melty cheese and superbly savory. I love the addition of the roasted reds. I haven't seen that elsewhere. I will replicate at home. If you love steak, please come here because it will be heaven for you.

This place was not good. Maybe its because my friends and I have never tried Argentine food. But goodness gracious, how can five people (including myself) not like their dish.  For appetizers: We got the lengua a la vinagrette which was okay. They gave a generous portion of tongue, about 7-8 thick slices. The Jamon crudo con melon on the other hand was delicious. i really liked this. The Proscuitto & the melon went very well with one another. For entree: I got an El petite, medium rare. it was raw, it looked like i just bought it out from the store, and not only that it was chewy. It came with spinach mash potatos that were cold as well. (not good)  I tried the Costeleta my friend ordered and that was chewy and a tad bit salty. The para uno, a dish that came on a grill with several different meats, sounds cool right? but it was too salty and the food was cold. the only thing that was okay was the sausage. My friend ended up spitting a piece of meat out. It was so dimly lit because the candle was so low that we werent able to make out what food was on the grill. Dessert: Flan. Now that was good. it was not too sweet but decadent. i enjoyed that immensely.

Empanadas (tried all except the ham & cheese) were the big surprise here; while not as strong as 5411 Empanadas, the Tango Sur versions were pretty solid.  That and my beef-steak-in-mushroom-laden sauce were both incredible...the token salad and the desserts were pretty underwhelming.  But low prices and BYO have me set for a return visit in 2014!

My wife is Chilean so she loves her some South America fare with Latin flare. (Too much?) We came here for a date night last Friday. The sole reason I'm not giving this place four outta five is based on one person - the door/patronage guy. Mr. Leather Jacket with his black rimmed glasses and slightly balding hairline whose ego and presumptuous nature were enough to fill the entire empty restaurant.  Cause I got there at 6 p.m., yanno, before the place was even 1/8 full. "Party of two, please," I said. "Is the other person here?" he quipped. "No, she's about ten minutes behind me." Instead of seating me (really. it's not a party of six. or a party of four. OR a party of three. just me and one other person), he takes me to their 'waiting area' which is a dark room with four benches and a table in the center. Fine. I'll sit here alone and pop the wine I brought, alone. And twiddle my thumbs while I wait for my other half. When she arrived - five minutes earlier than I predicted - we were immediately seated, but come on! Thank you for wielding your awesome power, Mr. Leather Jacket, but you're all I pretty much 'recall' from the restaurant. Sure, my chicken was tasty and my wife said her steak was some of the best she's had in a while, but can you curb your self-imposed cool for a while, Leather Jacket, and be more down-to-Earth? No? Well, you stuck out like a sore thumb and instead of the mood lighting and nice service from our waiter, no corkage fee and amazing dessert.... I wrote this entire review about you. Crap, I probably just made his day by doing so.
The best GNO w/ BYOB :) Be ready for meat.. Lots of meats!! Delish & cute ambience perfect for date night.
If I could give it a 0 I would. The guy at the door is a d-BAG, he feels like he is SUPER Door Man!!! Give a loser a little power and look what happens.. terrible!!

Holy meat in your face.  No--but really. The portions are family-style.. wait. Was this a family-style restaurant and no one knows it? Maybe. But by the time we finished our feast, I couldn't move. I needed my bed. I needed to be still and digest. Oh. My. God.  They made a great first impression with the no corkage BYOB-ness. But I think the music could have been turned down a notch. It was a little too bass-y/cluby for me and I found it difficult to have a conversation with my friend across from me. There are two dinning areas and the one we weren't in seemed like a full-blown party. It's like everyone just wanted to have a red meat fiesta and with a BYOB mentality, the dranks were definitely a'flowin.  Definitely get the mashed tators and any steak is good steak--just keep in mind they are the size of your head, plus some. I got a steak stuffed with all sorts of yummy things. I made it through maybe 5 bites before my body almost exploded. Did I mention we got apps? Yes--they were all delicious, but just don't. Trust me--it's too.much.food.  Yes, I know there are so many restaurants in Chicago, but this one I'd definitely come back to. And don't forget to bring some wine!

This was one of the sexiest restaurants I have ever been to.  We came here for a Yelp team dinner and when we walked in I think everyone felt like we were in a little mom and pop restaurant in Havanna.  The ambiance is dim lit with a single tall standing candle on each table. The music is strange and very sexual with heavy bass. Honestly though,  I think this is what I liked most about the place. It was so different, and I know between the music, atmosphere and it being BYOB there are some babies being made after a night out here.  Now on to the food. Jiminy Christmas! To start we had a few meat and cheese platters which hey, how can you go wrong there. Then we had the empanadas, which I was not very excited about until I took one bite and almost orgasmed. I guess I have never had a really stellar empanda but trust me out of everything we had these were my favorite. Especially drenched in that home made chimichurri (rolls eyes in back of head and sighs--SO GOOD!) We also had a few other apps that were great. By time my filet came, I was sad to say I only could stomach like 5 bites, but dayyyyum. P.S. some good advice: Split the steak. This thing was gigantic and took up an entire entree plate and it was only around $30 bucks. I just kept thinking you could come here with you hunny and have a night out for under $50 when you BYOB.  At the end of this meal, I was more than satisfied and the service was fantastic. Seriously if you are looking for a date night, look no further, this is your place!!!

I love Tango Sur.  It's my favorite restaurant in Chicago.  The food is plentiful, delicious and it's BYOB.  What more can you ask for?  The only drawback is the wait.  But, there are plenty of places nearby to grab a drink.  Give yourself an hour wait and you won't be upset.   Try any of the empanadas.  They are all delicious.  I usually get the El Filet, and it is incredible.  The spinach mashed potatoes are a must get, no matter what you order.  Any of their steak or meat dishes will make you happy.  At Tango Sur, sit back, relax and enjoy the atmosphere and bring a bottle or two of wine.  It will be a night well spent.
Loveeeee this place! I've had almost every steak and the spinach empanadas are amazing!

Excellent. Go here, you will love it. Sergio is the owner and made my party really feel welcome. It was my homey's 30th bday and we got crazy with some large bottles of beer from Half Acre, amazing steaks and dude time. Great atmosphere, service and food.

Maybe I've heard too much about this place, but I wasn't overly impressed. There are a lot of small details that tell me about the quality of food at a place, so I start at the top.  Butter and rolls at the table. The butter came in little foil packets, that industrial restaurant stuff. The rolls were slightly warm, but cheap white bread. I don't eat bread anyways, so I just let them sit there.  We were sitting outside on an early fall night that required the heat lamps to ultimately come on. The water guy was obsessive about constantly filling out our glasses with ice water even though I'd ordered a cup of hot water with lemon.  The "salad" was a joke. It looked more like the toppings for a burger. Two big pieces of lettuce (that was really bitter!) and two slices of mushy grocery store tomato and a big slice of raw onion. What kind of date joint serves raw onion at the top of a meal. The "olive" oil in they served on the side of the "salad" looked like that over processed half olive/half canola crap that comes in big jugs and the red wine vinegar didn't really add much to the already pathetic salad.  We ordered the "Para Dos" grill thing for the two of us. I've had better blood sausage. The chorizo was good, well formed but not actually spicy. The sweetbreads were alright. I haven't had a lot to compare to, but I ate a few. The flank steak was alright, but between the flank (flapmeat, as they call it on the menu) and the short ribs, I wouldn't confused "range fed" with "grass fed." This meat is most certainly grain finished. It's heavily marbled, gristly and fatty. We ordered a side of sweet potatoes. Looks like they cook-em just like I do at home, but I'd say they were slightly under-done. Throwing a sweet potato in an oven and peeling the skin off is pretty damn easy. I can do it. Preparing it in an interesting way would have made it worth the $5. It was not worth $5. I grilled mine on the little grill to give it some added flavor. The waiter was over attentive at the beginning of the meal, offering us wine glasses after we said we weren't drinking and didn't bring wine. Came back and offered to make suggestions on the menu. I usually accept suggestions and often request them, but I could tell that he was going to drive me nuts by talking excessively.  At the end of our meal as it got colder and colder, we waited a long time to be brought the check. Even after another waiter packed up our food for us, we sat there with a packed up meal and no check. My partner went to the bathroom and asked for the check. We received it, but then that sat there too. I walked the check into the restaurant and told them that we'd like to finish paying.  Honestly, for what I can produce on a grill, AND have my choice of cuts and preparation, I'd save the money and grill at home. Nothing special happening here.

Sorry folks, but I really don't understand the hype about this place. Food: Eh.  Ordered the "para dos" and shared it with the bf and everything seemed like it was something we could've done ourselves on the grill at home.  EXCEPT for the sweetbreads...good God those sweetbreads.  I've had sweetbreads before but these were bombdotcom.  They had a nice, almost char taste to them and they didn't have too strong of an earthy taste as other places' sweetbreads.  Other than that (and the BYOB aspect with no corkage fee!), everything else was just "meh." Service: I understand this place is insanely busy, but after we got our food, we didn't see any servers once.  We had to flag someone down every time we needed a refill of waters or the check. The icing on the cake: Made reservations for a friend's birthday for a party of 10 on a bustling Saturday night.  Now, I'm more than understanding that it may take longer than expected to seat such a large group, but damnit, if we make a reservation for 7:30, don't have us waiting until close to 9pm!  When we asked the host multiple times, each answer we got was, "it should be 10 minutes."  Dude..you told us "10 minutes" 45 minutes ago.  We were told that there was a "waiting room" inside and as we went in, we noticed a large table being cleared.  As soon as new place settings were set, we immediately sat down without even asking if the table was ours.  Dick move on our part?  Yes.  But, if we've been waiting for more than an hour, then I think we deserve to sit more than the couple that's been waiting for 5 minutes. Meh.

I heard many great things about this place, and had a bottle of wine that I've been wanting to pop open, so I thought it would be a great night to check it out.  I went on a Sat evening which was very busy. The host took down my name and phone number on his little note pad.  He didn't really let us know about how long the wait was, but recommended us to go to the bar down the block and wait. I asked how long was the wait.  He said 2 hours. I was like, "What?! - Two hours, " I gave him a hard time about quoting that to me.  We stood there waiting for 5 minutes, and then they seated us outside.  Clearly he didn't know what he was talking about.  The food was amazing. I ordered the Churrasco and it was real flavorful. I am not a huge steak person, but enjoyed it very much.  The food is average to high price depending on what you order. My friend had the empanada as an appetizer and  loved it.  I would definitely come back, and recommend it. Have to go back with a date next time!

This is the perfect date night spot! The room is dark and candle-lit. It's BYOB so you know it'll be affordable! They even have nice waiting rooms where you can drink your wine or beer at while you wait. My bf and I had the blood sausage, marinaded tongue, and steaks. All were tasty. We both like our meat medium rare and they were perfectly cooked. My spinach mashed potatoes were a little lacking in flavor, but all in all it was a nice evening.

I'm still recovering from what seems like an IV line of red meat, iron and protein at this Argentine Steakhouse. I'm not quite sure what an Argentine Steakhouse entails, but if it's huge slabs of meat, sexy lighting with candlelit tables and decor that practically does all the work for you if you're coming here on a date ;), consider me a fan. My coworkers and I came with some wine (BYOB!) and indulged ourselves with delightful appetizers and a main course fit for royal feasts. You better come here hungry and anticipate leaving stuffed because the portions are huuuge and the meat bleeds delicious flavors. Being born in St. Petersburg, Russia, I grew up with stories of the WWII siege on the city and my grandparents successfully instilled me in a fear of wasting food. After all, who knows when I'll have to kill a man for that last potato?  So when my main course of Filet Mignon came out with 2 ~8oz pieces of filet and a slew of mashed potatoes, I knew what had to be done. Those stuffed empanadas and melted cheese appetizers made the job of finishing off this steak that much harder, but I pushed forth; full will ahead. The steak was delicious and cooked medium rare (and was even more on the rare side which I loved). I savored every bite with its delicious flavor and eating both pieces was a joy. I saw some of my coworkers covered with meat sweats after devouring their meal and I stood proud. Job well done; plate cleaned. This place is busy and the prices are really reasonable for the portions received ($15-30 per entree). If you're a meat lover, this is definitely the place for you. The only thing that could have improved the entire experience was having the restaurant source their meat from local farms or at least having some menu options for those seeking humane-quality sourced meat.

1-star only because our server was top notch...but I've been here 3 times over the past 15 years, and three things have not changed: 1)  The staff (except for the servers) is cocky, condescending, and thinks they are the shee-tos.  They run their wait line like a club, and could care less about their patrons waiting 2-3 hours. The only reason my date and I got seated right away during my first visit to this place was because my date happened to know the owner.  Thanks, but  uuummm....no. 2)  My dad was a butcher, and I grew up eating meat regularly.  Does that make me a meat expert?  No.  But I can sure tell the difference between meat and rubber, and the meat here qualifies as rubber. Over or undercooked, or just right... it's all the same....tough, chewy, and .....just wrong.  These fools have you convinced that this is good meat because it's presumably from ....well...Argentina...ho-hum. 3) The place is dark and loud.  So, you have to yell all night to have an understandable conversation with your friends and/or date.  I think they do this to distract you from the #1 and #2 above.  Throughout the night you have to be so focused on trying to listen and be heard that you forget about the long wait and the bad food.  I couldn't even tell you what the place looks like inside because that is how uninteresting it really is.  So, why have I a gone back after the 1st and 2nd bad experience?  I was being accommodating to my friends.  But believe me, last night was the last time.  Never ever again... "Don't cry for me Argentina..."  because I know I won't, and I'm sure neither will you.

I went here on a date and the Staff was very knowledgeable about the food and how it should be cooked best.  They have a great selection of Steaks and the El Filet was incredible!  It was also large enough to save some for lunch the next day, a rarity imo with filet mignon!  Prices a little steep but it is a steak house so you get what you pay for.  Make up the saving on the fact is byob!

Tango Sur is a place I want to like more but it underwhelmed me. After hearing great things about this place I was glad to finally try it. We had 845 reservation but we're not seated till after 9, not a big deal.  Our service was so so at best, food was the same. The empanadas were great but my steak which I order medium rare came our medium to medium well and was tough.  For all the hype I was disappointed, not a bad place but not worth the long wait.

This restaurant screams sex. I'm talking heavy bass music, candlelit tables, big chunks of meat, BYOB with no corking fee and, in case if you missed it the first time, heavy and hot bass.  It's quite the wait- even on a Monday- but well worth it. Indoor and outdoor seating available with meal price point ranging between $17 and $30 - extremely fair given the serving sizes.  We started our feast off with a few recommendations from the waiter: a variety of empanadas and melted provolone served with red peppers.
