The beef was Argentinian beef, which was cooked well (juicy and full of taste). It came with a side of mashed potatoes. At the end of the meal we were so full we couldn't order desserts but the waiter was so kind and gave us a flan on the house. The flan had caramel on top of it and it hit the spot!  This was a very fun experience. The noise level is loud-you have to talk loud to hear each other but it's fun! Not a place to go on a first date but great for friends night outs!

Great food, great prices and BYOB. If you have not tried the chicken you are missing out. Best chicken I have had, with great dipping sauce for the bread. You can't go wrong with ordering a steak, and my wife was impressed with the eggplant. Long lines are a negative, however that is a sign for great food when people willing to wait. Recommend getting there early to miss lines. Excellent restaurant where the owner is present and takes pride in his food. Outdoor seating in summer which is a plus.

This is by far my favorite Steak place in the city.  The quality, quantity, and price of their steak is second to none... don't waste your time at those overpriced Michigan Ave. tourist steak houses come here.  Great place to take a date with the candlelit atmosphere BYOB... seriously....  Service has also been great whenever I have been there not sure why others have had a different experience. Also, this place can have quite the long wait on the weekends I would recommend either getting a reservation or going with 4 or less people to minimize the wait.

We booked a table for 20 on Sat evening to celebrate a special occasion. We have visited many times in the past , usually in large groups and have always been thrilled with the quality and taste of  the  food. I was so very excited to visit again as it has been a few years since I last dined here. I must tell you that we asked our waiter for suggestions and he recommended  a sirloin and a bone in ribeye. Honestly, I am not one to complain but my steak,  was one of the toughest cuts of meat I have ever eaten. I took a few bites but could not finish. My friend  ordered the bone in ribeye, very tough and he sent it back. My sister had the short ribs. Very tough also. It was disappointing to say the least especially when we mentioned this to our waiter and he replied,' well that is how we cook the meat here'. After hearing that response we felt we should say no more as we did not want to disturb your other guests or cause embarrassment. I have never had a bad meal here so this experience was shocking. This is the second time in a month we have experienced this. Tough steaks, rude  staff . Overall it was very disappointing .   One of my old favorites has taken a nosedive.

Really great food and service.  It gets crowded and there tends to be a wait.  The food is amazing, I wasn't very familiar with the menu items and ended up ordering essentially a massive plate of meat which was really good, and I learned what sweet bread is...not so good (in my opinion).  Really great place for a date night, the atmosphere is great.
El Filet is El FANTASTICO! muy muy bueno!  Absolutely love this place. Definitely worth the wait. Prices are amazing for the quality of food that is served. Big portions!

I came here for dinner with my boyfriend and left very satisfied and impressed with both the food and the business. I went on a Saturday night but made sure to get there early to avoid too long of a wait. We put our name down at 5:15 and were told it would be an hour to 90 minutes. However, after taking a short walk around the neighborhood and sitting down at a bar for a drink, we got a call at 6 saying that they would have a table ready for us - and we were seated before an hour had passed. The atmosphere is nice. I was impressed by how efficient everything seemed. We sat down and a server brought water and bread immediately. Then another server quickly came with wine glasses and opened our wine. After we ordered, the wait for the food wasn't too long either, and my water glass was always promptly refilled. It's a small place but they really do make the most of it, I felt that it's a well-oiled machine.  The atmosphere is classy and romantic - low lighting with candles at every table. A great place for a date (for people who like meat especially, though they do have some delicious looking veggie options) I ordered the bife vesuvio and my boyfriend got a t-bone steak. They were both delicious and HUGE. Came with a small salad and some potatoes yum! Will definitely return in the future, it was one of the most satisfying meals that I've had in a while.

So...I've been here several times before. I thought I knew what I was getting into again, and I was okay with that. Great food, shitty service. Well, this time the food was horrible and the service was even worse. My date and I waited almost three hours to be served (we finished a six-pack and my date had time to go buy more alcohol and come back before we were seated), and then we had to sit outside at night in October...they claimed it would be fine because we were next to the heater but I was freezing the whole time (and the chairs are metal...). Our food came out tough and chewy. So long, Tango Sur, it's been mediocre knowing you.

Ahhhh Tango Sur...  This restaurant has been a favorite of mine for a few years.  I used to live almost literally behind it, so I have frequented it.  The very intimate, dark, candle lit atmosphere is just about as romantic as it gets!  The BYOB makes the delicious dinner so affordable for a night out.  The steak is amazing.  The entire experience is a seduction of the senses!  I just love it. Tips:  1.  Be prepared for a noisy atmosphere, 2.  Be prepared for 1-2 hour long waits.  (Both of these are very worth it!)  3.  Don't forget your wine (if you do, there is a lovely little wine shop nearly across the street--I highly recommend it)

Amazing!!! We came here on a Tuesday night after reading the reviews and saw that there is typically a long wait. We arrived at 5:30 and were sat immediately. They let us choose between a few tables and we chose a table for four (even tho there were only two of us) and they were perfectly fine with that. The service was OUTSTANDING. When I say outstanding I mean one of the top three experiences in Chicago. Attentive, knowledgeable, helpful, funny and organic. The food matched the service. We ordered three empanadas to start, beef, chicken and ham & cheese. All amazing flavor as well as they come with a a garlic, oil dipping sauce. They also give you bread and butter. For dinner we both ordered el filet. This is a filet with spinach mashed potatoes, a red wine sauce and two separate filets ( in addition to a dinner salad, nothing special but greens, tomatoes and onions). After eating the empanadas, we each had a filet and mp leftover so we probably could have shared a plate, but what's the fun in that? For dessert we ordered the caramel cheesecake..... Wow. On top of the great service and outstanding food, they are byob and do not charge a fee. Definitely a must try if you haven't been there already. You will absolutely not be disappointed!

5 stars for the food. 1 star for the wait. I am writing this review, about a month after the bad experience. 2+ hours for a table for two?? Really??? The food is great. I've been here a few times over the years. Just great! The empanadas, the meat, the fact that it's BOYB, service is good too. My favorite is the vacio...just awesome. The parrilla is also great. Just mouthwatering. Prices are great too.  I think the problem with the wait is that the restaurant tends to cater more to large groups. Just my view of things. Saw very few couples (maybe 3) on my last night there. Went on a Saturday night, at 6:30 p.m., anticipating the long wait. Signed in, was told the wait was about one hour or so...fine, went to have coffee at the corner...came back at 7:30 pm, waited outside for about 45 minutes, was taken to the back room/waiting room, waited there for another 45 minutes approx. it was almost 9 pm. (the other couple who was also there got fed up and left); I had opened my bottle of merlot, to make the wait a little easier, but still....The staff has to find a way to get customers to get moving, politely of course...I mean, a large table was just wasting time after they had already paid their bill, laughing, taking pictures, checking their fb status, etc...sure, you're having a great time, but c'mon! there are other folks waiting, for hours, literally! So, if you don't mind waiting for over 2 hours...go for it! The wait is "easier" if you open your booze in the back room and if you're a large group.

I absolutely love this place!! I always get the Argentinian churrasco. Oh and the flan is to die for!!! Four stars because of the 2+ hours of waiting on Fridays/Saturdays. But if you go in on a weekday around 5/6, there's no waiting. Can't wait to go back!

With all the great reviews out there, there's really not much more insight to offer. Just some notes from my visits: - Posted a pic of the entree menu with prices in case you're wondering if this is gonna cost you an arm and a leg. Spoiler: It won't! - They only accept reservations of parties 6+ on Fri/Sat. So if you're going with a smaller party, make a reservation to go on a weekday or Sunday and avoid the 2 hour wait I experienced on Sat evening  (yep, it's literally 2 hours!). - El Filet was probably the best steak I ever had but my friends enjoyed the Costeleta (bone in rib-eye) more since it was fattier and, of course, more tender. The Lomo Relleno came out a little overdone but the yummy portabella marsala sauce made up for it. If you manage to save room for dessert, which you probably won't :D, the flan is amazing!

I had never heard of this place before (forgive me as I am relatively new to the city). My friend decided to make reservations here on a whim Sunday night and the place was busy (good sign!). Certainly a "happening place." There were at least 3 large parties there.  We seemed like we were stuck in a corner against the wall where we may be forgotten among the crowds and the dim....very dim lighting. however, the service was very attentive and helpful.  I wasn't even hungry after my Easter lunch but the strip steak...BIFE ANGOSTO... was flavorful. It came with roasted potatoes and a very unimpressive green salad with a tomato and a few onion slices and a vinegar and oil dressing. Besides the salad, everything else was great. The green garlic sauce (forget the name...chimichurri?) was tasty but oily. the added bonus is the BYOB with no fee as we did bring in a bottle of red wine. Priced well for flavorful steaks. Would certainly go back.

A ridiculous place. Only try to eat here if you have no self-respect. The two of us arrived on a Saturday at 6:15. We were told the wait would be 1.5-2 hours. Like fools we waited. At 8:15 the unfriendly, uncharming host informed us it would be another 15-20 minutes. Please. Even if God himself were cooking, there was no way. We had a very nice meal next door at Deleece....and found at the bar (which, of course, the dry Tango Sur does not bother to have) where we were sitting a bottle of Argentine wine in a bag left some poor schmucks before us who had illusions of eating at Tango Sur. But what can you say? The place obviously has a following and the hype and doesn't care about its customers, who, gluttons for punishment, keep coming back.
My girlfriend and I go here once a month or so.  No corking fee.  Great steaks, great value.  All the waiters are very knowledgeable and friendly.  I'll continue to be a regular here.

I had a great time here with my boyfriend. Definitely coming back another day. Everything we ordered was very good. Apps: Melon with the prosciutto-good, fresh melon, and although I did enjoy the prosciutto, I've had better elsewhere. We also had the empanadas (chicken and spinage/cheese) both very good. The chimichurri sauce that came with it was the best I've ever had.  Main courses: I had the "El Filet", was cooked perfectly and the wine sauce that it was lightly swimming in was delicioso! Spinach mashed potatoes were decent. I enjoyed my BF's seasoned wedged potatoes a bit more though. He also had a steak (though the name escapes me) that he loved as well.  Dessert: First off, they present you a whole tray full of their goodies so you can eat with your eyes first.  They all looked delicious. We ended up getting the Flan which was very tasty but unfortunately we only had a couple of bites because we were so full.  Last but not least, the service. The guys there were very nice and helped us out with recommendations. Thumbs up Tango Sur!

Perfect place in lakeview! Just walking by you can smell how delicious Tango Sur is! I am a veggie and this is a steakhouse but I don't care. Everything about this place is amazing. It has a romantic candle lit ambiance, great steaks ( according to friends ) that smell delicious, and they also have pasta dishes for non meat eaters . Give it a try, you wont regret it!

I know I like to give out 5 stars, but you really have to earn it with me!  This time, Tango Sur gets 4 stars. I have given them 5 stars before, I'm sure I will again, but this time they didn't deserve it. Sorry! I like you guys so much, I love the atmosphere, but this last visit wasn't as great as my previous experiences. I think the main thing that was off was the steak. I don't know, usually your steak blows me and my guests away. This time it was just okay. And, you know what? Your prices are so reasonable, I don't even care! I will definitely come back. Without a doubt.

This place was wonderful. My boyfriend took me here after I begged him to. We had the empanadas, cheese appetizer and split a filet. That was plenty for us. We plan on taking our friends in the next few weeks! And we will definately bring a bottle of wine next time!

Over a year later, we finally came back to Tango Sur. It is such a deal for your money, I can't believe we don't come more often.  In this go around, I discovered that their eggplant parmasean is amazing - a blob of cheesy and smooth perfection.  I also found that I always order my steaks medium-rare, but at Tango Sur, where they are serious about their meats, I should order medium. As to which, I now attribute myself not a true steak eater :)

My sister and I yelped this place before coming on our trip to Chicago and are very happy we did- it was the best thing we ate during our trip! We got a chicken and beef empanadas, which were delicious, especially with the chimichurri sauce. I got the bife vesuvio, which really lived up to its name! The steak was sitting on a plate full of the garlic and white wine sauce- it really looked like there was a lava explosion. The steak was stuffed with a white mar del plata cheese and spinach. Every bite was so flavorful. It also comes with that awesome chimichurri! I can't get enough of it! I had to give up on the potatoes so that I could finish my steak. It was my sister's birthday and they gave her a birthday flan with a little candle in it, which was very yummy too and not too sweet.  I wish we had brought some wine, but we didn't because my sister doesn't drink wine. But EVERYONE had a bottle or two, so definitely bring a bottle or you will feel out of place! lol!  Its super dark inside and all the tables are lit with candles. There were a lot of couples on dates as well as some huge birthday parties. The servers are really friendly and efficient. I can't think of any other steakhouse or restaurant that is SO worth it for the price! I would definitely recommend this to anyone coming to this area!

The cuts of meat are the best in Chicago and they have a staff that is top notch. The music, vibe and top notch staff makes this one of my favorite places to eat out. There are no reservations so you may have to wait your turn.

Tango Sur was delicious and the perfect place for a surprise birthday party with a big group. The empanadas, provoleta, and salad were a wonderful beginning to our dinner. Our entrees were huge and the steaks were savory. I had the filet with a side of spinach mashed potatoes, which was fantastic. All for about $40, you can't get any better than this popular BYOB.
Went there 10/1 for my anniversary and the place is amazing. The staff is very attentive and my filet was great. There is not a better steak for the money anywhere in the city.

Salad is meh, bread is hit or miss, steaks are awesome.  BYOB and no res required for a couple. Solid date night spot. Can be busy during peak times, but the steaks are worth suffering through the wait, salad, and bread.

I came here last week for my birthday and of course everything was amazing.  Lucky for me, there was no wait.  In fact, we arrived to a practically empty restaurant and were seated immediately.  I've been here once before and had to wait awhile then.  Maybe it was my birthday luck!   Anyhow, this place has great quality food and great atmosphere.

BYOB w/ no corkage fee! Yes, Please! Got my bottle of wine in hand! So my boyfriend and I wanted to try a non traditional steakhouse for his birthday and this seem to fit the bill. For the both of us it was about $60 with tip for 2 steaks! We went there on a Friday night and got there at 5:45 and were seated right away. Parking also wasn't bad because we got there early. My boyfriend got the Bife vesuvio steak filled with spinach and cheese, I grabbed a bite and it was pretty yummy. I got the vacio, which was the flap meat steak. It had good flavor but a little to chewy for my liking. I didn't care to much for the potatoes that came with the meals. I saw someone else get french fries and I wish I had known cause I would have preferred french fries or even mashed. It is a little to dark in there and the menu is kind of confusing, the waiter did his best trying to explain the menu to us.

My recommendation for this place is to bring an Argentinian with you. According to her, probably the best Argentine restaurant in Chicago. Caveat: the long wait. No joke, 3 hours, but if you bring an Argentinian they will at least get sassy enough with the host to move your wait along. The place is cramped with a closet-sized "waiting room" or do what we did and run next door to the pub. The food is good, really good. Skip out on the fluff and head straight for the meat. The empanadas are amazing. They come with a chimichurri sauce, which I loved but was scolded that it really doesn't go with empanadas. Who cares if you love it, drown your food in it. We shared a charcoal grill of different meats and beef parts (sweetbreads, blood sausage, flank, skirt). All delicious and mind you very heavy. You could feel the heartburn. The restaurant is BYOB which is a plus for you alcoholics on a budget.  I haven't been here enough to figure out the best method for avoiding await but it appears that if you travel in groups larger than 8 you can make reservations, but please don't be the obnoxious party of 20 on Saturday (you know who you are, and yes death glares were directed at you!)
We came on V-Day and our waiter Martin was very kind and attentive.  I even got a rose. Thanks Martin.

Tango Sur is our annual valentine day spot. It is very dark and intimate inside. Both the food and service are phenomenal. For appetizer we always get the empanadas (all the flavors taste good). This time I got a seasoned chicken breast with a side of mashed potatoes. The chicken was delicious and the mashed potatoes were made from scratch and absolutely amazing. Also, the filet is of very high quality and we get it every time we are there. The only downside is the wait. If you have a party of 6 or more you can make a reservation otherwise you have to wait in this small cute room where you can drink your byob while you wait.

This BYOB restaurant was the perfect venue for a date this week.  Atmosphere: I loved the darker setting of the place and how everything was pretty much just left to candle light to set the mood (oh la la).  There's two separate rooms and then a back area were you can sit and wait for your table. We had a reservation and our table was ready right when we were so there was no wait, but I can see the back area as a good place to be able to start drinking your wine if you're waiting for your table and you're not in the way of everyone else that is dining.    Staff: Our server Daniel was great, he was incredible patient with us since we took a long time to order. (too busy talking) He was attentive during the entire meal, as were the other staff that was quick to make sure our water glasses were full the entire time. (both worse than an empty water glass when you're thirsty).  Food: The food like everyone else says is beyond amazing! The portion sides are huge (yay for left-overs for lunch, which had co-workers drooling).  We both ordered the filet (med rare) and it came out perfection.  They use the perfect amount of seasoning and the meat is just so great.  Exactly what I wanted. Ask at Tango Sur, and you shall receive.  We decided to pass on dessert, but Daniel surprised us with some amazing flan.  Unreal.   The littlest things can add OR take away from a good experience. To me adding in a dessert was just the cherry on top!  We were one of the last people in the restaurant that night, and never once did I feel pressure that we needed to hurry up and leave, but left us to our own time, which I feel was much appreciated.   This is definitely is a place I will return to again, and again, and again.

I've been at Tango Sur few times, and always enjoy their food. It is delicious!!!! Always fresh-cooked and  flavored. BYOB also helps to keep your bill at decent level. I love their empanadas and a grilled meat. I can not give them 5 stars only for the reason that I can not make a reservation ahead of time for the party of less than 6 people, and the waiting time is unbelievable long, especially on the weekend. I love this place, and I hope that they can change their reservation policy.

Let me start off by saying the chimchurri (spelling?) sauce is AMAZING! The wait here is a little long but there is a nice intimate area in the back to wait instead of being out in the cold. Amazing grilled chicken, steak, and veggies, loved it all. The only issue I had was the music, pretty loud so I had to scream across the table for my boyfriend to hear me, left with a sore throat at the end of the night.

Oh my.. What an amazing restaurant! We went in a group of four, everyone bu me had gone there numerous times and raved on and on about how great this place is. I thought I should try it and boy am I glad I did! We went on a Sunday afternoon and there wasn't a wait. We were seated right away. We had the most amazing waiter (wish I can remember his name..sigh). He was so attentive and caring of our dining experience. He suggested entrees and checked in with us quite often. The food was magnificent! Their meats are to die for! Taking a single bite, I now understood the hype. All in all, perfection in every way! A must-try!!!

This place was good.  As I mentioned before, I'm a former steak eater so my review isn't gonna be head over heels based on the fact that I was at a parilla.  However, I did used to live in Argentina so I could appreciate how authentic it did present itself with the items on the menu.  The proveleta wasn't as baked and thick as I'd had in AR.  The cheese was thin and reminded me a small pizza.  The blood sausage and sweetbreads were good - I typically don't like sweetbreads but these were delightful.  Must have been because they were deep fried.  I ordered the bife de lomo - it was a huge portion!  It was cooked spot on, medium rare.  The quality of the meat didn't particularly blow me away.   I liked that it was BYOB and had a very comfy, cozy feeling.  There are no reservations so we had to wait in a small back room.  You can open your bottles of wine back there while you wait for your name to be called.  Only thing was that the floor was wet and my friend and I both slipped. I probably wouldn't go back for the food but the ambiance was nice for a cold Friday evening.

Estaba muy rico!!!! Tango Sur has become one of my favorite restaurants since my then-boyfriend-now husband took me there for our 2nd date. My husband really knows what is good Argentinian food because he is from South America and enjoys good food! The empanadas are amazing and I love the fact that they serve a simple delicious salad before the main course. The CHURRASCO PARRILLA with chimi-churri is fantastic!  The waitstaff are courteous. The decor is pleasant with a very dated wall map of South America that my hubby always finds fascinating.  The only down-fall is that it gets quite busy on Saturday nights with wait time for about 30-40 minutes. We prefer to go for lunch on Sundays when it is nice and quiet and we can talk.  Definitely a great steak restaurant to check out! You won't be disappointed!

Tango Sur is the perfect date night restaurant. In fact, it's nearly flawless in all aspects. I love that it's BYOB, and the entrees I sampled here were generous and rich. We had enough left over to create a second meal that was just as filling as the first. When we dined here last November, we started with two empanadas: the spinach & cheese and the beef. We followed these up with two entrees: el filet (fillet mignon topped with a red onion wine sauce and served with spinach mashed potatoes) and bife vesuvio (prime steak filed with spinach and mar del plata cheese and garlic). Although I knew the servings were going to be heaping, I was still stunned to see that my fillet mignon was actually two perfectly prepared steaks, well complimented by the spinach mashed potatoes. The green lump on my plate was a little odd-looking but tasted heavenly. The bife vesuvio was also delicious, although, quite honestly, we felt it was even better the second day. Tango Sur is a bit noisy - my boyfriend initially thought that his parents would enjoy the restaurant but decided it was a bad idea since his father would not be able to hear a word anyone was saying. We even struggled a bit, and this was on a Monday night. Still, I liked this aspect of the experience. Even on that snowy Monday night, the room was alive with conversation, as diners enjoyed their exquisite food and wine . My time at Tango Sur was so wonderful that I cannot wait to go back. I am hesitant, though, to do so on a weekend. I wish they took reservations, as I can see from other reviews that this seems to be one of their failings. I can only speak for my own experience, though, which was perfectly fine. Fortunately, our anniversary fell on a Monday, so we had no problem getting a table. The restaurant did fill up, though, so if you're planning to go at a peak time, be prepared to wait. From my experience, though, it's definitely worth it.

We ate this restaurant for my future sister in laws birthday & it was pretty interesting. Great atmosphere with low lighting.   I don't know if I have ever been to a restaurant that had a BYOB policy. It's awesome. We got to bring our own liquor and drink it at the restaurant & they didn't charge any kind of fee. Saved us a lot of money on the bill. The food was delicious & a bit different. The free bread was warm & soft. The chicken empanadas were delicious. Also, I had "el filet" w/ spinach mashed potatoes. The filet was tender & had a nice onion sauce.  I gave this place a 4 star because of the service. I felt like I had to constantly repeat what I wanted. Also, we were there & had a party of 10 & they were rushing us stating that we had to be done with the table by 9. I thought it was a bit rude especially because we were there for a birthday party, but the BYOB made up for it.

The food, ambiance and service was great once we were finally seated. I called a week in advance to make a reservation as we had a party of six and had never been there before. Upon arrival (5 mins. early for our 8:30 reservation) we were told there is a 30 min wait regardless of reservation. This was annoying, wants the point in making a reservation? Others were complaining and waiting as well but we quickly discovered that they put their names in just that evening. We grabbed drinks down the street and came back at 9, table still wasn't ready. Waited another 15 mins and were finally seated about 45 mins late. Not a good process so be prepared to patron the neighboring bars...

Food: Really good steaks for a good value.  Plus, a non-sushi BYOB is always a nice change. BUT:  My party of 2 waited THREE HOURS and 11 minutes for a table...to be honest the food was quite good but not worth the wait.  Come on, you can't squeeze in two people?!?  The doorman was not accommodating (and kind of rude) and the estimated 1.5 hour wait dragged out even after we went back twice to ask what was up.  If he had said three hours from the beginning we would not have waited.

Went on date with husband last weekend to Tango Sur and I cannot stop thinking about how delicious our dinner was! We started by sampling the empanadas. We had the spinach/cheese, beef, and chicken. The spinach/cheese and beef are amazing, the chicken I could live without.  My husband and I split the El Filet (two 7oz fillets served with spinach mashed potatoes). There was plenty of food for us both to share, we both left stuffed! Tango Sur has the best chimichurri sauce...there wasn't a drop left on my plate. I can't wait to go back again. Great plate to take out-of-towners.

This place is absolutely incredible. It's has such a cool, local Chicago feel. Group dinners are money here. The food is delicious, the portions are huge and it is not very expensive (2 filets, mashed potatoes, and a salad is like $27). BYOB adds that much more to the experience.  With that said you must go in knowing a few things:  1. They can be a little rude 2. You will always wait, even if you have a reservation 3. This isnt a prime steakhouse, they under/over cook the steaks slightly sometimes

Woohooo! If you're looking for an amazing steak for a good price look no further. This place is one of my favorite restaurants of all time. The atmosphere is very romantic and friendly. It's BYOB so you can bring a couple bottles of wine in and get a little tipsy before you have an amazing steak. The only downside is that I always spill steak all over my shirt because I eat it so ferociously.

I'm very disappointed to write this review because I've been wanting to try this place for a while and, unfortunately, don't have many good things to say.  I made a reservation for my birthday, so we had a decent size party.  Service was ok at first.  It's the food that killed it.  My mother orderered a steak that was half burned & half pink.  She's a very nice lady, so she struggled through it until the waiter came back.  After she told him, he did nothing.  We also told management; they did nothig.  As a matter of  fact, we sensed some arrogance as the manager said "ok" and walked away.  We paid the bill and left.  I don't think I'll be back.

I adore this place. Very authentic. I loved the parrilada, sweet breads, the empanadas, etc... I feel back in Buenos Aires. I would just suggest you to go during quite hours as it is incredibly noisy during peak hours.

This past weekend was the first time I'd gone to Tango Sur. Two of my friends suggested this place from other friends and read the raving reviews about this place. I thought, what the heck, I enjoy going to different places. In my opinion, the best part of this place is BYOB. Our reservations for 12 ppl were at 9pm,  a few arrived on time, & was told to wait outside for 15 min (the host sat us less than the 15 min).  Ambiance is tight, dark, & loud. By the time everyone from my group arrived it was 9:30. Our waiter took our orders for appetizers for those who arrived on time & later went back for the rest. The salad was what everyone described to be. As for the main course, our order was taken about 10:20 (I was on my 5th glass of wine). I was craving the churrasco steak and the waiter recommended the Argentinean churrasco ($5 difference). I got what he suggested because "it was better quality meat." When food arrived (11pm), I found the 12 oz steak to be extremely dry, the chimichurri helped a little with flavor. Took 3 bites of it and ate the vesuvio potatoes. The skirt steak was juicy and people in my group raved about the ham & cheese empanadas. Others who didn't have the steak, liked the chicken and ravioli. I would recommend this place if you're looking for a place to drink, mingle with friends, and not crave a steak. For the manager, staff needs a more welcoming & warmer approach, and needs to be reminded about sanitary issues. I saw a cook walk out of the bathroom wearing his apron and back into the kitchen, a big no no.

Horrible experience with the worst server I've ever experienced with. Food: 3/5 Decor/atmosphere:3.5/5 (dark, trendy, but too loud music for a date) service: 1/5 (explains below) So I went this place with my bf, we were on a date and I liked the idea of BYOB, and great reviews about steak. We ordered the EMPANADAS, which many reviewers recommend, and as an entree my bf ordered the COSTELETA, which is bone-in ribeye and I ordered the El Fillet which is the fillet mignon. I first ordered something else and then I changed my order because the fillet looked better to me. Why I gave it 1/5 for the service: The first reason I gave this place a 2 star is that the server took my order wrong and was being very rude and unprofessional. I could tell that his first language is not English, and I had nothing against that (I speak other than English at my house too), but if you made me wait for 30 minutes and gave me something that I did not order, he should have at least apologized me whether he would give me what i order or not later. Instead, he was giving me this sloppy look and pointed his finger at the menu   and said  "Look, this is what you ordered and changed. So I;ve brought this to you." I was like no, that's not what I ordered, I ordered the fillet mignon. But he kept insisting that I ordered what he had brought me, and after arguing for about 5 minutes, my bf was almost getting up and ready to leave the restaurant and that's when, finally, the server said, "ok, I'll bring you the fillet mignon. It's gonna take like 20 minutes if that's ok." I honestly wanted to get up and ask for the manager and speak to him/her. But it was a beautiful weeknight and there were people around us enjoying their beautiful weather, so I just decided not to go there. Food: But the thing that made me mad the most was the fact that the food WAS SOOO below my expectation.  the rib-eye was full of fat, we could literally see a chunk of white fat. He's the guy who would eat everything if it's red meat, but even he said it's too greasy and fatty. Mine was no different than his. It wasn't like OMG-it's-so-bad-that-I-can't-eat, but it wasn't something I expected since I read so much positive reveiws on Yelp. Overall: One word. DISAPPOINTING. If you like loud, trendy, dark dinner place and BYOB, maybe you can give it a try. But I wouldn't pay over 50 dollars to get that quality of meat and POOR SERVICE from a very rude server.

BYOB is great, fantastic atmosphere, nice waiter, good food. They started off on wrong foot with us (group of 6). We called at 6:45pm, they told us to come around 8ish. We got there at 8:15ish. The name wasn't on the list. So the doorman (yes, they have a doorman who even told us to not mess with him since he has the power) went inside to check if our number was on their caller ID. If it wouldn't be, we needed to leave, he told us. It was cold outside but he didn't allow us to wait in his little booth in front of the restaurant. Our number was on their caller ID so he send us to have drinks somewhere else, they'd call when the table is ready (ca. 30 min). 60 min later, no one had called yet, we called and they didn't have us on their list. Went back and had to wait another 15 min in the cold while the doorman was trying to figure things out. Waiter was very nice, food was good, but the start just destroyed the experience. We had a good time, but I don't think anyone of us is going back to a place where service and friendliness outside of the eating-part is sub-mediocre.

Today I went to celebrate my early birthday with my husband and it was our first time at Tango Sur. I left the restaurant speechless, the food was AMAZING, the service was outstanding. I thought I was gonna get a $100 bill for the quality of dinner we had, and we spent less than $50 with service. I totally recommend and I can't wait to let all my friends know about this place and come back very soon!! Our waiter was Martin, he was an excellent server and made sure our experience was the best possible, congratulations for the amazing staff you guys have!!!

Came here for New Years Eve dinner with a party of 11 and had an amazing dinner!   The BF and I got there first and we were shown to a back waiting room that had corkscrews and empty glasses waiting - win!  We were seated on time although the position of our table wasn't the best (right in front of the door that kept opening in the freezing cold).  It was a bit tight fitting everyone but we're all friends anyways. The server was helpful and didn't make us feel rushed.  We started with empanadas and the spinach and cheese one was definitely my favorite item of the night.  I could have eaten about 5 of them for my dinner. The salads that came before our entrees were underwhelming and looked like they belonged as burger toppings.  But the entrees were delicious!  I got the Bife de Chorizo which came with amazing potatoes.  I'm sad I lost the leftovers box somewhere along the night during the New Years festivities.  BF got some sort of chicken with baked ham and cheese on top which was yummy. Love that it is BYOB and prices are definitely reasonable.  I'm putting it on my list for when my family comes to town next.

This is one of Chicago's gems! Always a treat to go to Tango Sur because the Argentinian food here is truly fabulous. It is located in a beautiful location with lots of boutique shopping and the Music Box theater. The outdoor patio is a perfect setting for a date. And NOBODY does chimichurri better than Tango Sur!!!!  Went here last night on a whim (I visit a couple of times a year) and was not disappointed. Do try the El Filet.....where, I ask you, can you get two filet mignon steaks cooked to perfection for under $30? And they have a share option! The spinach potatoes that come with the dish are great and have something in them I can't put my finger on. Also had the empanadas, tomato and egg salad, and the flan for dessert. All were delicious but, the flan is simply the best mouth-gasm I've ever had.  The ambience is sexy and provides the perfect backdrop an intimate evening. The candlelight is something more restaurants need to get back to doing. Word of advice, unless you show up before 6pm, THERE WILL BE A WAIT! Plan accordingly, and if you are hosting a dinner here, perhaps you should go early to make the reservation and allow for them to accomodate your group size. I also would not advise taking the little ones to this particular restaurant, it is not child friendly. It is BYOB (what is better than that!) so feel free to tote in your beverage choice, I've even seen tequila bottles and tecate cans on tables so, there ya go! The service is warm and efficient. This place is run like a well oiled machine and has never disappointed. Go to Tango Sur, they have some of the best steaks in Chicago!

I love Tango Sur, so much that its steaks visit me in my dreams. I can't say much that others haven't already, but I would like to put in my highest recommendation for the lomo relleno if you're ready to go into a mushroom and saucy-meat coma (serves two...for about a week). Their empanadas are also awesome.  I always head to tango sur at about 5:30... this is right before the gets too long and I'm able to open my wine and sip it in their nice wait room. Definitely plan to head there early, or be prepared to wait!

Tango Surrrr....yumm....thinking about this place makes me drool again; that being said, unfortunately none of my other dining companions seems to share the same sentiments,,so let me just give some advice on how to enjoy this place to the max!!! 1) this is NOT a prime steakhouse,so don't expect to get meats that melts in your mouth a la wagyu beefs...their beef can get a bit grainy, but my steak came out fine and my wife's veal was pretty good. 2) they are NOT known as a salad joint either,so if they say the foods comes with salad, and all they bring is a small plate of lettuce,onions, and tomato slices with not even a dressing; that's probably because they probably expects you to be carnivores and the salads are just there to make your wife....or your teenage daughters happy. 3) Be adventerous. When you see tounges served as appetizers and sweetbreads as a sidedish...Go for it!!!! I never had sweetbreads before and I'm not sure I really want to know what it is..but I thought they were pretty good. 4) Bring your own wines!!! They don't sell wines, but they allow you to bring your own,so next time I'm here..I'll be bringing bottles...heck, if you see me in the restaurant, I might be selling one of my wines for a hefty profit..gotta find a way to pay for the meal somehow!!! So overall...the place has a nice ambience, excellent for big crowds..service was pretty good, they did spill some meat juice on my lap at the end of my meal, but I was so high on meat that I didn't really care by then...and the foods were more than edible...good in my opinion, not as much according to my wife and friends.. but I was more than happy to finish their foods, even after I got done with my Lomo Relleno, which was meant for 2 people...what can i say? I have a huge appetite for life!!!!

I'm rather critical of my dining experiences, I enjoy being this way, and I'm thrilled when a business meets my expectations.  If you're like me, then Tango Sur is not the place for you. Overall, the entire experience is of a lower quality; especially for the price-point.  The music was an overly loud loop of bass-heavy pseudo-latino dance music befitting of the byob vodka and red bulls at the table next to us, but clashing with the candlelight.  The service was mediocre.  I had to ask for another plate and 2 more sets of silverware for our party of 5.  The waiter was sufficient, but disinterested. The food was okay.  The salads are horendous.  They look like a plate of condiments for a cheeseburger: bagged iceberg, two circular tomato slices, and a handful of onion rings, undressed.  The lengua lacked flavor, the empanadas were rather plain, and our steaks were unimpressive in flavor, cut, and internal temperature.  A medium rare fillet mignon had to be sent back, as it was cold in the center; but all of the entrees were decidedly underdone. All things considered, I definitely won't return.

WOW..  So I was in no mood for a wait.  I called the restaurant before donning my coat, gloves, scarf, and jacket (its 30 degrees out) and made sure there was availability for a table of one.  I was told "come on in, there's no wait"  So I walk the 8 blocks to the restaurant.  When I arrive I'm greeted by someone who's clearly not a hostess and am told there's a 45 min wait.  "excuse me?"  I say..  I explain to him the phone call and he puts his finger in the air and grabs a running by waiter(not a manager) I can hear the conversation and In Spanish the waiter says.. I don't give a shit, tell him he has to wait.  sorry bro, I may be white, but yo habla espanol..  The kid walked up to me and repeats the 45 min line and tells me he's sorry it's first come first serve.  FIRST of all, I'm industry there's no way you go from wide open to a 45 min wait in less than 20 min.  Second, there's a single man at a 10 top seated without his party, and next to that table is an open four top, when I told the guy to kick rocks and walked out  into the street I saw through  the window that the back room had 3 more open 4 top tables.. So where's the beef?  IDK and I don't plan to ever find out.  I don't need to try your food to give you guys one star; and frankly I never will.  I'll take my money to another decent steak house that actually cares about their costumers regard.  It's sad with service this terrible you average out to be a 4 star restaurant, I guess that's what happens when you have 300 mixed reviews.  I really enjoyed the mile walk back to my house hungry and carrying a stupid bottle of wine.  kick rocks Tango Sur...

Came here 2 times and the service has always been good. First time we came with a huge party and they were able to seat us right away with a reservation. Not bad from a place that is always packed. Empanadas - they have a few choices, but so far I have tried most of them. My favorite is the chicken and the ham and cheese, but you cant go wrong with any of them. They are really good and I love coming here for them. Absolutely the best! Jamon Crudo Con Melon - thin slice of ham served with a cantaloupe. This was good, but I could pass on this next time. Berenjena - oven baked eggplant with spinach mixed with a delicious cream sauce. This is my second favorite thing here. El Filet - fillet mignon topped with red onions. This was pretty good and the fillet was juicy and perfect. Lomo Relleno - fillet mignon that had a lot of fat and tendon to it. Definitely not what I was expecting from a fillet. This was a huge serving that could easily serve 2 people. I was disappointed in the quality of this steak and I wouldn't get this again. Overall, this place gets packed and they only take reservations for bigger parties, but they were nice enough to squeeze me a reservation for 2 on a Monday. Another reason I will come back is because it is byob. This place is good for groups and it does get loud inside.

My first time here and it was really good! We had a reservation at 7pm and got there @ 6:50 this evening and were immediately seated. I ordered the rib eye with garlic, olive oil and some other spices with a side of mash potatoes. It was really good. I ordered it medium and it was cooked to perfection. Juicy and tender. The bread the serve before dinner was also good, fresh out of the oven. The salad, not so great. Just lettuce and tomatoes with olive oil and vinegar. There were 3 of us, we all had steaks, 2 sodas and a dessert, $100. Not bad at all. The portions are huge! My only complaint is the music is really loud, so it's hard to have a conversation. Also, it's way to dark in there. They were very busy but our server was attentive. Can't wait to go back and try something else.

Came here for our Christmas party this year..There was over 25 of us and everything ran so smooth! Great ambiance, attentive servers, and delicious food. Everyone was raving about what they had. For a place known for their red meat, their salmon was a huge hit. I heard the terms, "to die for", "incredible", and a few others. Super huge portions, almost everyone had to wrap up their entrees.  Overall, it was a really amazing experience and I'd like to thank them for being so accommodating for such a large group. I think everyone who went will be going back.  Highly recommended!

I went to Tango Sur on Saturday for an early dinner. I was starving. So much so that I didn't want to stop to pick up some wine since I knew Tango was BYOB. Oh well, that didn't matter to me. I had gone to Tango Sur for my birthday some years back and I had never been able to shake the thought of going again. So, again I went to an early dinner with a friend of mine and I was impressed again. The atmosphere and the courteous way everyone treats you makes the experience a lot better. I ordered the Bife Vesuvio which is Grilled Prime steak stuffed with Spinach and Cheese while my friend ordered the El Filet which was filet Mignon with Spinach Mashed Potatoes. They served bread w/butter along with salad. We didn't order any appetizers because I wanted to save my stomach for the real meal. It took a while for the server to serve us our meal, but it was worth the wait. I loved my dish.....especially the spinach and the Argentine potatoes that were served with my steak. The seasoning was good but just a tad bit salty for my taste. It didn't stop me from enjoying my meal though.....believe me. My friend's filet was cooked to perfection and by that I mean it had the right amount of redness (Medium Well) not to mention it was so juicy and it just melted in my mouth when he let me try a piece. I finally had to stop eating my dinner because there was no way I would leave without trying a dessert. I loved the little tray the server brought around to help us decide what dessert to get. I ended up getting the a light cake with peaches and my friend got cheesecake.....They were both superb and I'm glad I saved room for  them. All in all I love Tango Sur and I would definitely go again. And I like going there early because there isn't a wait. But next time I will be sure to have my wine in tow.....Great Place. :)

I've never had a very pleasant experience at Tango Sur. (disclaimer: I gave it 3 tries) I find the food to be lacking in flavor and I honestly cant quite get over the lack of lighting or space. It's never a good idea to try and make a reservation as you will still wait only to be cramped into a table section meant for a few people less than your party. Overall the staff is always friendly so props to you guys for doing a great job. Its ok to have a little electricity every once in awhile ;)

Boy do I love this place!! The food is great and the prices are actually pretty good for a steakhouse.  The only problem is that there are way too many tables and the place is congested, but this also shows how busy and great they are!  4 stars because it needs more lighting, sometimes can be noisy and hard to talk, byob, and super congested.

I was a little disappointed with Tango Sur. I had the filet mignon. It wasn't as good as i thought it would be. It wasn't as tender as it should be. On the other hand, the flap meat for two people was very good. I didn't expect the flap meat to be even more tender than my filet mignon. I was disappointed. Portions were HUGE. By the time i finished my steak, i was so full that i couldn't eat my spinach mash potato. The spinach mash potato was so good thou~ Empanadas were yummy too~ Baked eggplant was a bit too cheesy. It was overall a nice experience.
Good food. Okay atmosphere.  Most of the food on the menu was heavy. Go here hungry and in the mood for something hearty. Service was not the best - not our servers fault. Just seemed under staffed.

The food is great, but the service is quite awful.  I think they are just so busy that they don't feel the need to give good service.  We had a large party, and I had to literally get up and find our server to get everything we wanted/needed for our food.  It's really frustrating that you can't focus on your dinner party because you have to constantly look for the server, which takes time and interruption.  Then they act like they're doing you a favor by getting you anything at all. I'm not pleased, the stars are for the food only.

Came here with a party of 7 and it was on! Definitely a great place if you want to have a good dinner. It's true that you have to wait but what good restaurant doesn't make you wait? Turn down your snob and have some wine.  Now, let's turn to the food. The followings are what I had: 1) Empanadas - Beef, Chicken, Ham and cheese, Spinach & cheese 2) Prosciutto & Melon 3) Provoleta 4) El Filet The food overall is pretty good. my filet was a bit undercooked (I ordered medium rare and it came out more rare than medium rare). But the flavor and seasoning is there. I'd definitely come back for more rounds of BYOB. My table's service is actually pretty decent, so I understand the fuss that other people complained about. I think as long as you come here with the intention to drink some wine, have some good meat, enjoy a few great conversation and laughter, this is the place to be. Snobs...please save it and spend you snobby $$ at stuffy tie places.

Best Argentinian in the city. Comfortably chaotic and candlelit. Always get the empanadas for a starter. But be prepared for a wait. I recommend having a drink and waiting at one of the bars down the way.

5 stars knowing that you're going to wait.  Do what everyone else does, get a Mickey's 40oz to chill on the corner and shoot a little dice up against the wall while you wait. Or you can just go down the street to Cullens to have a few drinks to kill the time with your company.   This is one of those places I always want to go on my birthday. Where else on earth are you going to get that much meat, at that price, can bring your own wine, and they have delicious empenadas? Get out of here. This is a GREAT place to go, but you should know, it will be your night. Don't make any other plans except for eating, drinking, and taking home leftovers of meat! What do I order - At least 1 of every empenada depending on the size of the group. Try them all! Then it's automatic double filet every time! Once they looked it up with a Flan for desert, I don't like FLan, but this was awesome! EAT HERE EXCEPT FOR THE NIGHTS WHEN I'M GOING.

I love this restaurant. It is dark, romantic, and delicious! I have eaten there multiple times and I always find the service to be friendly and the food to be tasty! Yes it is dimly lit and a lit cozy, but that's the beauty of it. It is an Argentinian steak house, I don't go there because I want to sit in a booth at Applebee's.

I'm really just not a fan of this place.  It seems to me that everyone in Chicago who is fairly new to the city or is younger has heard of this place and lists it as one of their favorite restaurants in the city.  I disagree, and here's why. Wait: This place is always super crowded and I think they only take reservations for large groups.  Even when my group has had a reservation, we still wait, and not just for a short time.  I'm talking 30 minutes to an hour, with reservation.  Further, the doorman was not friendly or helpful regarding wait time and whether any of my party had arrived and was in the waiting room.  He also said the wait room was crowded and full, so I had to wait outside, despite that the rest of my party was inside waiting. Atmosphere: Even when I have been seated, the place is dark and crowded.  We had a reservation for 14.  But they gave us a table for 10, which makes for an unpleasant dinner.  My hips were in one spot, but my shoulders were twisted to be able to fit everyone.  Every table is crowded together, and the room is far too dark. Service: I'm underwhelmed.  They aren't friendly or helpful.  And the service here is slooooow.  Expect to wait longer after ordering. Food: If I want my breath to taste like garlic for the next five days, then yeah.  The food is generally good, but it is also not overpriced.  The food is not really my issue with this place.  It's fine, I think people find the concept of a steak for $20 or less to be awesome, but you're not getting a Joe's quality steak.   I think people like this because you can get a tasty steak for a very low price.  You pay for this however in the form of poor service, crowded room, and wait time.  I'd honestly rather pay three times the price, get a top quality steak, be seated at the time of my reservation, and have friendly service.  Not to mention actually having my own space and the ability to move my arms to eat!

This is my favorite, favorite place to dine in the world. I started coming here 8 years ago when I lived in Wrigleyville and we were celebrating a special occasion. I've since moved away but every time I come back to Chicago it's a must. Great food. Love the b.y.o.b. great service and its highly recommended to call ahead and make reservations. Winter is hardest to get a table. I've accidentally drank a bottle of wine before even eating. Strange that there are no ladies working. The chimichui sauce is heavenly an. Dip everything in it. Empanadas are yummy but I only fancy the spinach and cheese. I've recently discovered the meat ones have eggs in them. Not for me. My only qualm is I wish they sold their T-shirts. Tango Sur will always be my special place I like to share with loved ones.

I've had two very satisfying meals here. Both were on a Friday night - if you get there around 8, be prepared for a long wait, but on your most recent visit we went early (around 6) and there was no wait at all. if you do have to wait, there are a few bars down the block where you can go grab a drink. Tango Sur will call you when your table's ready. The food was delicious both times, the meat perfectly cooked and I think it's a steal considering the portion and the quality. Service has been polite, if rushed, and I appreciated our server's recommendations - he did not steer us wrong.
This place is amazing! BYOB! Huge portions! Great food! I will definitely be back soon. Loved the mashed potatoes.

Once in a while my craving for red meat becomes so bad I don't mind the tremendously long waits at Tango Sur. Where else can you get high quality steaks at a fraction of the price in a typical steakhouse? Whatever spices they use on the steaks must have crack in it because I keep on coming back for more. Or it could be in the flavorful chimichurri sauce. The vesuvio potatoes are probably really bad for my heart and arteries but I can't stop eating them anyways. It's super loud, but the lighting is low and romantic.

A must try when in Chi-Town!! We came in on a very cold Tuesday night and this place was still super busy. I hear they don't take reservations so first come first serve basis and you could wait up to 2 hours. Though I must comment that they keep the place pretty damn dark! I like to see what I'm eating. Aside from that the food is pretty good. We had 2 different types of steak on the table and both were amazing!! Empanadas were sooooooo freakin YUMMY Bread must have had crack in it. It was that addicting I'm drooling just thinking about this place

The food is OK.  Good but not great.  Since it's BYOB the meal ends up not being too expensive.  It has a nice ambiance but is pretty loud.  It's hard to carry on a conversation.  Glad I went after all the hype.  I would go back but I would not wait more than 30 minutes for a table.

This place has been reviewed a million times.  So I don't have much to add but I'll try. The place is crazy busy on weekends.  They don't take reservations and after 630pm or so, expect a 1 to 2 hour wait.  I went recently on a Monday and there was no wait. There are two excellent cuts of steaks, I'd avoid the rest.  The two best are the filet and skirts.  AVOID THE RIBEYES. The salads are meh, so skip them unless you love iceberg. The starters are very good.  Recently I had the prociutto with melon which was fresh and excellent.  The grilled provolone and the sliced eggplant are also excellent.  The one item I find to be very average are the empanadas. Service is always good and the people are nice.  Gotta love the byo.  And don't forget to tip well, as it is byob (so the bill is way lighter than a typical restaurant) and these guys work hard!

This place is great. The atmosphere is really nice and romantic, the food is fantastic,  its BYOB and it is extremely reasonably priced! What more could you ask for?  I had the entrana and it was awesome - as I'm sure all of their steaks are. The vesuvio potatoes that come with are great also. The empanadas were amazing, I tried the ham & cheese and chicken, and at $2 each and very close to my apartment, I'm going to have to come back and try all of them. By the way, portions are ENORMOUS - my leftovers were enough for two meals the next day. $19 for three meals? Hell yes.
Horrible place horrible service and looks like genuine attempt to screw up some good steak.

Omg amazing! Went with a party of 20 and the service and food were great. Highly recommend the filet. The only reason I'm deducting a star is because the hostess was a little rude. They were busy but  when I asked where to wait he had a lot of tude

Tango Sur and I are breaking up.  I've brushed some questionable service issues off my shoulder over the years, but last night was the final straw.  Just your standard case of unrequited love.   I loved you Tango Sur...for nearly a decade.  But you never appreciated me - I know this now.   Nearly nine years ago when I moved to Chicago Tango Sur was recommended to me by a co-worker and after experiencing their amazingly inexpensive yet divine cuisine, and adorable setting, I was head over heels in love (or as I would come to find out - blinded by love).  I was so in love I continued to frequent the venue for celebratory gatherings (birthdays, engagement parties, etc.) and anytime I had an out of town guest, Tango Sur was the first place I would take them.  While working retail on Michigan Avenue  I even recommended Tango Sur to tourists assuring them it would be worth the $20 cab ride to and fro.   Honestly, Tango Sur should have been paying me - I was a  referral/advertiser/supporter and never asked for anything back in return but average (often times less than average) service and meat - delicious, perfectly executed meat - and lots of it!  But looking back I should have seen the warning signs.  I mean, once a server argued with me when I politely informed him the empanadas he delivered to the table were cheese and spinach when we had actually ordered chicken.  "No, you ordered spinach and cheese."  Um.  What.  So I guess I shouldn't be surprised about the actions of the staff last night.... I arrived with my parents, a couple of friends, and one Tango Sur virgin at 7:55PM for our 8:00PM reservation.  We were told we were the next table to be seated once a six top left so we were kindly escorted to the waiting area where we were told we could pop our wine while we waited - standard practice.  We waited several minutes for glasses and when none came, I sought out the host and asked if we could have a few glasses for our beverages.  I was told they were short on glasses but that some should be available shortly.  I won't go into too much detail about what transpired over the next hour of waiting in that room but let's just say, an hour wait when you supposedly have a reservation is made tolerable by drinking wine...however, because over that hour no glasses were ever made available to us, we sat staring at our full bottles of wine...and at each other...agitation growing by the minute.  I politely checked on the status of the glasses a few times while we waited always being told they were coming.  And when checking on our status in line - "you're next."  But once the clock struck 9PM, my frustration could no longer be contained.  My guests were yawning, and I was hungry.  So I approached a server and asked if we could get ANY glasses - whether that be a coffee mug, water glass, just something so we could ease our frustrations of waiting an hour with some wine.   His response... "PLEASE!!!  Can you have some glasses, PLEASE!!  As you can see we don't have any and NO we won't give you ANY glass.  We'll give you WINE glasses when they are available but we don't have any."    As if the hour we had already waited for our RESERVATION wasn't bad enough, tears welled up in my eyes from being berated in front of fellow patrons.  And with that, we packed up our belongings and headed for the door.  As we approached the host he pointed to our table thinking we were coming to sit, but we continued on, letting him know we would be dining elsewhere.  Management followed behind to find out why we were unhappy but the apology didn't feel sincere, nor did they make much of an attempt to convince us to stay and make things right - after all, they probably had another pissed off party of six they could seat once they wiped their hands clean of us.  All the while I was wiping tears away, completely embarrassed as diners observed our exchange. Honestly, my feelings are hurt.  After all this time, and so much loyalty to this business, in the end I found out I'm just another customer to them...really less than that.  Ironically, my server from my very first visit in 2004 happened to be the very same gentleman who followed us out to issue an apology.  I'm sure he sees so many people in and out, he probably didn't make the connection - perhaps if he had, he would have tried harder to save the relationship. Break ups are hard.  But there are plenty of fish in the sea.  Or in this case, steaks in the city.  And I intend to find one served with a side of customer appreciation.

Great spot.  Tango Sur can get very crowded on the weekends and the wait can be close to 2 hours but it's worth the wait.  You can easily get a table right away during the week, however.  It's all about the filet. Two 7oz filets with a side of spinach mashed potatoes.  It comes with a salad and it's easily plenty of food to split with a date, if you add 2 apps (i recommend proveleta). Bring a nice bottle of wine and you're looking at a great dinner for around $50. Tango Sur can get busy and loud and the seating is tight but thats what i like about it.  Everyone minds their business and the wait staff helps you out with anything you need.  In other words, it is exactly like being in Argentina.

Great food. Terrible people. Went there a couple months ago for my birthday and enjoyed the food and had a wonderful time.  However came with my mother for her birthday and the story really is terrible. Said it would be 2 hours unless I wanted to spend $40. When I elected to wait the 2 hours. 2 very quickly became 3. Tried again on a week night when they opened - they happily sat me outside without any wait.  Pick your time - don't feel bad about calling and making a reservation for 6 and bringing 4.

Me and the bf were craving steaks and found this lil joint. The food was delicious, we both had steaks and they were cooked to perfection! I also love that its byob! Only thing I didn't like was that it was only lit by candlelight and when there's no sunlight coming in through the windows its a bit hard to see. This also isn't a place for a first date! Gets quite loud in the evening. But loved the atmosphere and they have a waiting area where you can view the menu before you get seated.

Jesus Christ. What a delight this restaurant is! First of all, it is located in a very beautiful neighborhood. Secondly, the patio is very appealing. Lastly, the food is rich and mouth-watering. Never have I had better-tasting potatoes anywhere else. The steak is very nicely cooked.  I do have a suggestion: can you add waitresses instead of an all-male service? This restaurant is BYOB. It is compelling if you are looking for a mid-scale restaurant to take a date to or simply to treat your mother to delicious Argentine steak.

The atmosphere and BYOB ability earned an otherwise unimpressive restaurant it's 3rd star.  The filet and meat sampler (parrillada) were very average and generally tough and chewy.  The wait staff was good, and the candlelit atmosphere was nice. It's packed with lots of people and long waits, but my group and I were left wondering what all the fuss was about. I wouldn't say it was bad, I would just be hard pressed to say what was good besides the atmosphere.

I had been here once before (years ago), but went again recently for a friends birthday.  Everything was solidly good, but not great. The ambiance is fantastic, and the byob aspect instantly give this a major pump up, but I wasn't as impressed by our steak. We opted for some empanadas as starters- which were, in fact, delicioso, however the main entree (the Bife Vesuvio) was not evenly cooked.  The middle was practically still moo-ing, and not the medium we had asked for.  I did try a bite of my friend's steak (el filet), and realized that the boy and me chose the wrong menu item! The filet was prepared well, and tasteeeee! Our overall experience was average, and while  I don't think I'll be back anytime soon, I definitely wouldn't hesitate to try it again!

Okay, first I will say there generally will be a wait, but it's worth it! Put your reservation in and go down the street to a local watering hole or stroll southport. Southport is a great street to shop and sightsee for an early evening. Skip all the tourist spots downtown and hop in a cab to Tango Sur! I'll be jealous, I miss it!

We were in a rush so we did take-out. Yes, Tango Sur does take-out. They even gave us breadsticks with our meal. I ordered ham and cheese empanadas. I think it was swiss cheese, but they were yummy so I guess I had two appetizers then. Also, my mom got milanesa del pollo (breaded chicken breast with potatoes and salad) and I got the suprema a la napolitana, which is the same only the chicken has baked ham, mozarella and tomato sauce on top for only $2 extra. I couldn't eat it all at once. I also got a mate because I learned about it in class. They give you sugars to sweeten it. It's the best tea I've ever tasted.

Most amazing (and largest) cut of red meat I have Ever had the Pleasure of devouring!! My friend and I ordered the Filet for Two with a chimichurri sauce that was big enough to feed the table of 6! The atmosphere was fun and dark and could be romantic if you found yourself in a dark corner. Reservations were not available for our party of 6 but we arrived at 7:45pm on a Wednesday and was sat immediately.. The food was amazing and now anyone starts talking about someplace with an amazing steak, I bust out my picture of the mound of filet that immediately brings tears to your eyes and drool to your lips!
Omg!! Where should I start... The empanadas are delicious, the filet mignon is humongous, mashed potatoes are orgasmic, and it's BYOB!!

As much as I'd like to rate Tango higher, I do not appreciate how they treat their patrons. Tango gets great business (every time we go it's at least a 2 hour wait), so I think they take their patrons for granted and don't treat them as respectfully as I'd like. I always feel rushed and not appreciated.  That being said, the food is pretty good - especially for the price. And the atmosphere is what keeps us coming back. It's very romantic - only candle light, great music, and BYOB! It's definitely worth going here at least once.

I love this spot! It's best if you can get there early because there is always a wait.  Recently I ordered El Filet and it was wonderful.  I love the way they prepare and season their steaks.  The portions are huge and it all delicious!  This is the best BYOB spot in Chicago!

If you like flash-thawed steaks with not a lot of flavor, then this is the place for you. The empanadas were delicious, however. Especially the ham and cheese. And the BYOB, yes please. Other than that, not very memorable
Eh. Really. Not good at all. For $27 I would expect a bone in rib eye to be really good.  This was tough and but for the garlic and sauce, it would have sucked.  We won't be back.

This place serves AMAZING food. The steaks and the fish dishes are just plain delicious. It is also BYOB, so bring your favorite bottle(s), and fully enjoy your culinary experience. The place is definitely not for the claustrophobic, as you will be in a dimly lit place with your elbows possibly touching the next table. If you're on a date remember that you will have to get close to each other to hear, so it may add to the dining experience. This place has never disappointed, and I recommend it to everyone. Be aware that parking in that area is rough, so plan on coming early or taking a cab. Note that they do not take reservations, and it is always crowded.

the candlelit atmosphere is conducive for all sorts of gatherings--romantic dates, intimate reunions for friends, and even big group dinners (though i'd suggest you plan those for after 9pm since you may feel like you're imposing on the quieter tables around you if it's during regular dinner hrs) I ordered the BERENJENA (oven baked eggplant layered with spinach, provolone, parmesan, ricotta, & tomato cream sauce) and it was absolutely delicious - SO FLAVORFUL - & only $10! my other friends who got steaks even admitted that my eggplant may be better than their dish. i had to agree.  waiters were A+! they came around regularly to fill up the water & bread, accommodate extra people/chairs without fuss, and generally left us alone otherwise :)  minus 1 for making our group wait 30 minutes even though we had a 9pm reservation all set....i mean, isn't that what reservations are for? you can tell this place is very confident of their cool factor, which probably explains why they can brush off (in a rather cavalier way) that they're running behind. the waiting wouldn't necessarily be an issue except there's nothing to do except block the sidewalk in the meantime.. then again, when i got inside and started settling into the Argentinian ambiance, I could see why people would want to linger....

This place is my favorite restaurant in Chicago, hands down! Looking for a great place to bring a first date? Tango Sur is your best bet. It's dark and romantic inside-- great for an intimate conversation. But also the atmosphere is fun and young-- great for a small birthday gathering (as long as you're not obnoxiously loud). The food is to die for (bife vesuvio is my favorite). It's a BYOB which makes any date 100x better. There can be a long wait so be patient!
Good value, fair priced, above average food. Good filet. Gets crowded, reservations recommended.
Love Tango Sur! BYOB and no corkage fee! Meals are big enough for 2 ! The spinach mashed potatoes rock! Very friendly servers.

I have been going to Tango Sur for years.  I cant say I am a regular but I definitely go a few times a year and the consistency of the outstanding quality of the food has NOT changed!  Over the past several years many restaurants cut costs and in turn let their menu and food go down the crapper.  Tango Sur ALWAYS offers the best meat, and appetizers!!!  Ambiance is romantic, but also good for a girls night since they are still BYOB!  I try to avoid them on Weekend evenings since the wait is usually lengthy, but If you really want to go its worth the wait!

Went as a group of 6 on a Saturday night. Extremely busy as expected, but were able to get seated after only an hour wait (originally, estimated to be 2 hours).  Once we were seated, not a thing went as expected for a restaurant so consistently praised: * Waiter was completely listless and uncharismatic- likely because no effort was needed to earn his tip (party of 6) *No bread was provided- had to ask *Only 4 of us had place settings- had to ask for 2 more *Food was served warm *Mashed potatoes tasted like instant mixed with real potato chunks *Salad was pointless, as it seemed better suited on a hamburger condiment tray  Overall, unimpressed with the service and food, considering this place comes highly recommended.

Oh Tango Sur, how your meaty smells taunt my hungry belly every day as I walk home from work! I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. This is one of my favorite BYOB places in the city. The food is amazing and affordable. The menu has plenty of non-beef options for those who aren't into that. I've had chicken, eggplant and fish dishes that were delicious. Definitely get the hearts of palm wrapped in prosciutto or the provoleta for an appetizer!  I've seen insane amounts of people waiting during the weekend, so go during the week or before the dinner rush. There are plenty of places nearby to pick up a bottle of wine, too. The only drawbacks are not being able to make reservations, spotty service and cramped tables....but that doesn't stop me from coming back to feast on a plate of melted cheese!

Reasonable price (great for Bday celebration) and BYOB is awesome. The dark lit restaurant and the usually overdone meat is blah. It's soo dim inside, that sometimes i really wonder what the heck I'm eating. NO kidding. But the flavor is good, just the chef needs to work the meat (usually overdone when i order medium rare)

If there's any advice I can give about this place, it's just this: do not come here. My party of 13 had a reservation for 8:30, and we didn't sit down until 9:45. During that time, they kept telling us that they either didn't know when the table will be available (but isn't having a reservation GUARANTEEING availability?!), or it'll be "just 5 more minutes." Meanwhile, we had to stand out on the sidewalk around a heap of drunk people who were stumbling in the street. The music is so loud and obnoxious you can't hear yourself think. The place is lit almost entirely by candlelight (there are a few VERY dim chandeliers that hang from the ceiling..very high up, mainly for decoration) - it's just stupid. You can't see the menu, you can't see the food. I had to hold up the candle while people got the food from the plate because it's so dark in there. It's also terribly cramped. And there's only one bathroom, so there was always a line. Our party ordered a few steak plates for two. Most of it was bone, and inedible. Definitely not worth the price. I ordered a chicken empanada on the side and it was ok at best. I'd say the best part of the meal was the bread. It was warm and soft (at least on the inside). They also served it with a plate of cheese to go with the bread so it tasted like pizza. So in the end, I regretted the night entirely. Do not go here if you want to see and hear and actually enjoy a well-portioned meal.

No, they don't take reservations.  Yes, you will have to wait a long time to be seated.  And yes, it's worth it!!  This is one of my favorite BYOB places.  While you wait they allow you to go to their waiting room, which is a small room in the back corner, where they will open your bottle of wine (or whatever alcohol you have) and allow you to have cocktails while you wait.  Whenever I've gone here it is very loud (there always seems to be some big birthday or bachelorette party), and you may have to wait a while for your food to come out. Oooo but when the food comes out, you will be SO HAPPY you waited!  The portions here are HUGE and all of the steaks are delicious! There were four of us last time we came here and we had a TON of leftovers, even though we ate and ate and ate and ate!  Our dinners (4) could have easily served 8 or 9 people. OH! And don't forget to order Chimichurra with your meal.  It's delicious. :)  If you ever want to recreate this meal at home, simply go to the store they have just to the left of the restaurant and buy your steak there (with the chimichurra).  It's the same place they buy their meat and it is CHEAP.  Yum!!

I am so impressed with what they do here.  They were spot on with every detail from there excellent service from Sky and the cooked to perfection filet.  Sky brought us the broiled argentian cheese with e.v.o.o. to try before our meal.  Simple salad which was nice with meal.  Flan to die for.  yummy yummy.  Prices are excellent.  $40.00 for two and you get enough food for four.  Look at posted pictures on their site.

A complete disappointment  , I planned to celebrate my husbands 30 th birthday here and we all had a very bad customer experience . they messed up the orders  to being with we never got what we wanted infact we got what we never ordered for  , i had made reservations for all my guests two weeks in advance and yet my guests had to wait for a long time to be seated .
