The lighting is poor and its hard to see what you are eating . The management was poor and then they charged us way more money than the bill was.. I was very sad that my husbands 30 th birthday did not go well.. When I spoke to the manager in charge he seemed to care less and was not even sorry for the poor management .. never recommending this place  .

For some reason people get all jazzed up for this place when I don't see the season.  Yes, this place COULD be a cozy and romantic place if it wasn't for the small, crowded, cramped and noisy setting.  Once I came here and our table was backed up against another table so that the back of my chair was against the older gentleman's chair at the other table.  When he got up to leave, taking his coat, he took my scarf as well, since they were touching.  The last time, we were sat next to a party of 7 with 3 buckets of empty beer bottles.  They were loud, obnoxious and obviously not there for a fine dining experience.  That was also the night while sitting on the sidewalk, being harassed by a bum for leftovers while the staff did nothing to protect its patrons.  The service is a bit surly and overwhelmed.  They are not very patient with the customer and pretty much want you in and out.  Their recommendations were weak and not convincing.  As for the food, it is a good price point but just ok.  The sweetbreads were the worst I have had in my entire life.  In the past, the steaks have been hit or miss on whether they were completely chewable due to the amount of tendons in it.  The boy claims he has never had a bad steak here, which I claim he has been very lucky.  This place isn't bad, but it isn't "oohh and awww" worthy.  I prefer the steaks at Las Tablas much more to Tango Sur's.
Worth the wait. The food is the bomb!  in your face!

Tango Sur - how I worry when I bring folks here! This weekend you were great again - maybe our last visit was just an off night?  Empanadas are delicious and the el filet is hands down your best dish ever followed closely by the bife vesuvio. Thank you for a lovely experience! Oh and props to the wonderful guy when I called in who actually offered to hold us a table for 4 if we were going to be in within the hour (we were right down the street in a cab en route) - the service is improving I hope! Waiters still need to work on their table side dialogue as they can't give much if any descriptions but glad to see the improvement - for the first time ever our waiter actually told us what he would recommend! :)  When in doubt, go with the el filet and start with the empanadas. You don't really need to know much more than that to enjoy this place.

The first time I went to Tango Sur - everything was decent.   The food was good, but I would not call the staff very "inviting" - I would've given it about a 3 1/2.  Mainly because the service is touch and go and they don't take reservations. My latest visit is the reason for my 1 star review: We got there around 4:00 on a Saturday - this is not a "rush" period for this place, so we were seated within a few minutes.  Our server was not friendly at all.  He offered no greeting, no menu recommendations - he barely spoke.  His tone turned to more annoyed when we told him we only wanted to order a few appetizers and one entree (again, it was late afternoon).  The appetizers came out as ordered, but after that our already cold service went from annoyingly tolerable to horrible.   Our server would disappear for 20 mins at a time and even when he was around he never checked on us or brought out the entree.  People around us that came much later were already eating the exact same thing we ordered.  When we inquired he said "well done items take longer" like we were idiots (and for the record, well done adds like 3 minutes, not 30) rather than the obvious which was that he forgot to put in our order.  Another 20 minutes passed before we had to ask another waiter to find our waiter and another 10 mins passed before he came over - without the entree.  When we inquired about the entree again he said "I'll let you know when its done." We finally asked to take the entree to go and to get the check, which of course, took him another 100 years to give to us and then even more time passed after that before we got the entree. I used to be a server and I don't take zero tipping lightly, but this guy was arrogant and incompetent and I wasn't about to let him squeeze 20% out of me on a very unpleasant dining experience (that he caused).  This is only the 2nd time in my life I haven't tipped someone. Here's the best part...when he saw that I stiffed him he actually had the balls to chase me down the street to get in my face about it.  Yes, a grown man chased three women (one of which was 63) down the street to get in my face.  I told him flat out why his service was horrible and what was his reply "You must not be from around here." I responded, "I live two blocks away, what's your point? I should know better?"  Comfortable with the fact that I really did think he just sucked and I wasn't a clueless tourist his last words to me were "I hope you choke on that steak." And that will be the last time I ever go to Tango Sur.  There's a lot of steak houses in Chicago.  I don't need to waste my time on a place with service that is tolerable at best and threatening at worst.
Ummm can you say great place for a girls night out!  Yes this place is a great girls night spot!  The food was amazing, its BYOB, and all cute male servers.  Coming back very soon :)

I went there on a weekend evening and we were seated outside about 10 minutes after we came in. The waiter was friendly and service was prompt. The food was delicious. We had steak (amazing and definitely enough for two people), the antipasto, a few other sides and brought our own wine. The price was right considering the location and BYOB, but the corking fee was about $7 which was a tiny downfall because that's about a third of what the wine cost from Que Syrah across the street. Overall, I would return at a non peak time for some steak and wine. Great date location!

Came here on a Monday night for a friend's birthday.  Our party of 8 arrived at 5 PM exactly (a little early for dinner, but had other plans after).  No one else was in the restaurant yet when we arrived, though it was filling up at 7 when we left.  Everything was great.  We tried 3 varieties of the empanadas-the spinach and cheese, the chicken, and the beef.  All three were sooo good, especially with the sauce.  For dinner, my husband and I split the el Filet, per the waiter's recommendation.  I'm glad we did, it was excellent.  Perfect to split, as the filet is already split into 2 portions (approx 8 oz each I would say).  We ordered it medium and it came out cooked perfectly.  They were very good about us being in a bit of a hurry, and the service was excellent the whole time.  We had many bottles of wine and there was always a waiter on hand to open a new one when need be.  For no corkage fee, definitely can't complain!  I would definitely come back!

My boyfriend and I had the Vacio which came with a salad . Amazing flank steak with sweet potatoes and chimichurri sauce on the side. I would recommend to arrive at the restaurant before 7:30pm to be seated right away. The setting is romantic, definitely wear something to impress your date but don't come overdressed. Anyway, thank youTangu Sur for BYOB and great food. We will definitely come back.

Arrived at 7:30 on a Thursday night. Seated immediately- didn't see a waiter for 15 minutes. Thought about walking out. Server comes over. We place full order. Get our apps. Greasy and lukewarm. Seriously think about walking out. 20 minutes later get "salads" (skimpy iceberg, white onion and tomato slices). Wait AN HOUR AND 15 MINUTES before getting the "manager" who was chilling out in his unbrushed hair and cargo pants. He got the waiter instead of handling it himself. We told our waiter we would pay for what we ate, but did not want anything else. The manager told us to sit back down. The waiter said we could leave. What a horribly run place. Never again.

LOVE the steaks! Great date spot.  It's appropriately dark (with candles on the table) and who can complain about a BYOB.  The service is intentionally slower, reflective of the atmosphere and Argentinian culture, so dinner can be extremely relaxing.  If you haven't dined here, you haven't enjoyed one of the best steak houses in Chicago. (expect to wait to get in, however.  It's my only knock).

Came to Tango Sur on a Friday night at about 7.45pm despite the fact that the place is notorious for wait times and doesn't take reservations. Got to the door, the host said the wait time would be about 30 mins for inside, longer for outside. Not too bad at all as you should do a couple of things while you wait 1) Go to the wine store down the street (a few mins) and pick out a decent bottle of Malbec to drink as the restaurant is BYOB (will come back to that later) and 2) kill the rest of the time sitting at any number of bars down the street. After picking out a wine and sitting down at the bar, I got a phone call as they had had some sort of cancellation and we only ended waiting 15 miutes for a table for two. The food is just volumous. We orded a steak for two that came with portabella mushrooms and the thing was no less than 2 lbs. It was $40. Tip and tax meant $50 for a pretty decent meal. Have I had better cuts of steak? Yes. Have I had better value steak? Probably only in Argentina itself.
Simply amazing  one of my favorite places in Chicago.  The food and service is great! and it's BYOB. :)  I highly recommend Tango Sur

I always leave Tango Sur happy. The wait can be long at times but being BYOB and designated seating in the back with wine glasses provided it really is never an issue. All the food is delicious but my favorite is definitely the corn and cheese empanadas and the 'el filet' which is such a great price for 2 filets! Perfect for sharing. Spinach mashed potatoes ... Mmm. The atmosphere is lively & loud.. Perfect for groups. Looking around the dining room whenever I come here, everybody is ALWAYS having a great time.

This is a quaint little steak house with a hip, yet romantic dining room, and ample outdoor setting.  The noise level was very bearable, and decor was laid back.  This was my first time dining at an Argentinian steakhouse, so I had many questions, as well as a pesky dairy allergy. Our server was friendly, attentive, and more than will to recommend, and cater to my allergy. I find that many servers become irritated at my allergy, which is ridiculous, because I'm am NOT a fussy eater.  My friends started with the antipasto, which was nothing special.  It was good, but neither the presentation nor the quality was to write home about.  I was torn between two allergy acceptable items, and our server helped me choose lengua a la vinagreta.  The beef tongue was braised nicely, and the texture and flavor of the tongue was to die for.  I have never been served cold tongue, and it's something I will try again.  My friends who were resident in trying it- LOVED IT.  Prior to dinner, we all received a complimentary salad- plain, but I can't complain, it was free.  Now to my main Chef's specials entree- costeleta which is a bone in rib-eye, which is then grilled, topped with olive oil,  and a garlic and parsley sauce, served with mashed potatoes.  Due to my allergy, they kindly substituted the potatoes with a allergy friendly potato side.  When my food arrived, my server was kind (this doesn't happen very often) and reassured that my entire entree was dairy-free, which includes butter.  He went one step further, and told me all the ingredients, and prep.  I shouldn't be worried when dining out, but too many times I do worry about my allergy. The best part of the meal was how the steak was seasoned and cooked.  It was a perfect mid-rare throughout, the cut was great, and it was seasoned absolutely perfectly.  I usually either want to, or go ahead and have my steaks returned to the kitchen, however this one was perfect :)  I'm very grateful of this, since I don't eat much red meat, this is a bi-monthly occurrence, so it was nice that it will be memorable.  Oh, onto the BEST part. It's BYOB, and corking services are FREE!!! The servers were always attentive of the bottles, either opening the next bottle in line at your table, or filling your glasses.  From what I could see, everyone around us also had great service.  This place is worth trying out, especially if you are not familiar with Argentinian cuisine.  Was it my best ever dining experience, or was the quality top notch? Well, no, but there are many things that they could teach to some top notch restaurants.  That's why they get a four-star. Maybe I'll change my rating when I return :)
the food here is really good. BYOB makes it feel like you get your meal for cheap which is nice. you get a lotta food for your $$

Tango Sur is one of the best values in the city!  Where else can you have such amazing food and no corkage fee for your BYOB!  Yes there is usually a wait but it is worth it.  I am a stickler for service but forgive Tango Sur because they are usually packed.  As long as my food gets to me hot I am a happy camper!   I am totally obsessed with the Vacio and would literally drink their chimichurri if that wasn't weird.   My advice for dining at Tango Sur is to first check in (the wait on a Friday or Saturday is at least 30 minutes)- and then head to Jewel on Southport to pick up some bottles of wine.  They will call you on your cell phone when your table is about to be ready.

It is true, and I have to rant about this for just the first part of my review: waiting/getting reservations here is a joke. Not only do they not abide by the time you reserve- but you can't reserve unless you have a large enough party. Reservations for 8:30? Well we sat down at 9:30 -so don't make any evening plans after dinner. Just plan accordingly.  BYOB is a great option , but you will get the corking fee, which is fine and if you have a birthday - its also $1.75 a plate for any cake that you bring. Just worth noting. Pricing seems on par with what you receive. My filet was pretty fatty and not terribly delicious compared to other places in the city. Coupled with some pretty good spinach mash potatoes though. The empanadas were good but not great.  The salad was just simple greens as well; no special dressing to note. Your rolls at dinner are maybe warm, depending on the basket, and are on par with a 24 hour diner-this was probably the most disappointing.  Nothing unique that would push me to come back. I think the hype surrounding this place has gotten the best of it. I assume at one point in time this was a great place - but now it seems all the little details that make a restaurant charming are absent. The staff is not very friendly or helpful in ordering. I'm not asking for a new friend when I meet a waiter, but maybe a "have you been here before? Might I suggest XZY" Just a "what do you want?" followed with a "What?". Atmosphere is extremely dark- to the point I used my phone to light portions of the menu. The candlelight is nice, but seems a little out of place for the menu/staff/decor.  For a place that is so pushy on no reservations, and long lines I see all the time outside - this is most definitely not worth it to me at this point. I will probably try again, and order a different selection off the menu. If the wait and reservations wasn't such a circus, and the staff was just a little more inviting - I'd think about coming back to try again. But I can't help but feel like this is all just a way to generate hype and make it seem more exclusive and unique that what it really is. If you have some time to go here, give it a shot, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here or make special arrangements. Plenty of other nice places are close enough for a much better dining experience.
Shared the Para Dos with my girlfriend.  If you want to relive your Atkins days look no further.

I seriously need a new dining partner here. I've only came here with an ex, and well, ex's are ex's for a reason... I don't like to stay close to them.  I like the empanadas here. It's a lot better than other empanadas I've had in the city. We ordered a spinach one and a beef one. I liked them both. The beef one was especially juicy, and I like that a lot.  We also ordered the jamon crudo con melon, which is Prociutto served with cantaloupe. It was delicious. I never knew that Prociutto paired so well with cantaloupe before! Salty meets semi-sweet. Perfection. The first time we came here, the ex-girlfriend ordered us a huge 16 or 32 oz. T-bone steak covered in red chimichurri sauce. I'm not a big fan of steaks or of meat in general, so I thought it was way too much meat. I prefer something closer to 8 oz or less. Needless to say, I ended up boxing it up to go. So the second and last time we came here, I specifically asked her if we can split a smaller meal. We ended up ordering el filet, which was topped with a red onion wine sauce and served with spinach mashed potatoes. I loved this selection way more than the first. I also liked that it was not covered in sauce. Don't get me wrong, I like sauce... but not too much.  Tango Sur is a BYOB place. It also looks like they've expanded in the two years difference that I've visited it. They now have a waiting room in the back, but it's so dimly lit that it'd make for awkward conversations if you don't like your companion. The restaurant is best for dates... by yourselves or on double dates. I wouldn't come here with a group larger than six. You'd have a hard time hearing one another as it tends to be very loud here. They do take reservations so make yours before you go. The wait can be extremely long.
best date spot in chicago, byob, get the el filet.

There are a couple of pluses to this place - being a BYO joint is a huge plus.  The ambiance, being dim and having candlelights definitely add to the romantic vibe.   The chimichurri sauce is to die for - honestly, I think you can put that sauce on wood and it will taste fabulous.  The prices are quite reasonable especially if you order the steak that serves 2 people.   We ordered some empanadas, the eggplant, and the prosciutto with hearts of palm for appetizers.  All of those were good; the empanadas were a tad salty but good. However, the steak was just ok.  We had a group of 6 and just about everyone ordered something that was highly recommended - el filet, vacio, lomo, the ribeye, etc. and the steak, while tasty, was just ok.  The vacio, which I ordered with a friend, actually came out tough.  So yeah, this place was ok but I can't say I'll be running back anytime soon.

Best steaks I've had outside Argentina. Food is great - I always make a point to come here when I'm in town. It's BYOB so you can bring your own bottle of wine (I actually appreciate this as it can be cheaper this way). Atmosphere is very nice and a great place to bring a date. It gets packed so it's a good idea to make a reservation or show up early. One time I showed up just after 5pm and the place was empty. By 6pm it was completely packed.

This is place is MONEY.  First off, the food. Unbelievable, just as everyone says it is. Portions are massive for what you pay for, especially as it is often meat. As to everything else, just read others' reviews.  The wait can often be a deterrent, but at least when my date and I went on New Years Eve around 10pm, they took our cell phone number and we just walked down the street and enjoyed Southport until they gave us a ring (it was about an hour later). The setting is definitely a bit on the crowded side, but I feel like that's just how it's going to be. Tables are very close and it often gets pretty loud. If you want to feel like you're in a bustling city restaurant with lots going on, you will feel right at home. If you are looking for a calm and quiet dinner, I would try and go during off hours. And the BYOB is a massive plus, although we didn't take advantage of it. The New Years celebration was especially fantastic/hilarious. The waiters cracked open bottles of champagne and gave a free glass to everyone, handed out buzzers, hats, and decorations, put on some music and had a dance line go throughout the restaurant that I (and other diners) gladly hopped into. Good times.

The wait for a table can be really long (upwards to an hour after 7pm any night of the week).  This place is a 5-minute walk from my place but I only go a few times a year so that I cherish it.   Delicious, generously-sized Argentinian meats!  Reasonable prices for the quality.  We brought a bottle of burgundy and started with the procciutto with baby artichokes for an appetizer.  Then came the "starter" salad - couple leaves of lettuce with tomato.  Then we split the Vacio- half a slab of medium rare slab beef with sweet potatoes, it could've served 4 people!  The chimichurri sauce is a-mazing.  Bill for 2 for everything was about $50.  And remember, it's BYOB! The tables need to be bigger and the service a bit more consistent but overall - a great date spot and fun for groups too.  Go if you're any kind of carnivore!

A MUST GO! Great food, exciting and obscure ambience , and attentive service. This is one of the only places I would actually order a steak (what would be the point in going if you didn't). However, I have had the poultry and the fish and it is just as good. The empanadas are buttery, flakey and delicious. And it's BYOB. I would give this place 5 stars, however the wait can be exhausting... bring someone you can talk to because you might be in line for a bit!

This is one of those places you hate to love. So frustrating to get a table sometimes, yet their food is so delicious you just can't hate it. It's like that ex gf that you just can't stop drunk dialing. Came on a Monday night at 8pm, beautiful weather so their patio was full. Host said 15-20 minutes for a table outside. Just as we thought it was our turn when we saw a table open up, he gave it to another couple. I swear we had been there longer, but I' wasn't going to complain. Just our luck, no one was leaving at that time and we ended up waiting an hour for a table. So incredibly frustrating, additionally because they had a table for 6 empty but they wouldn't seat us, a party of 2, at it.  However, you just can't argue with the food. The menu is a bit overwhelming so just go with the recs from Yelp.  Empanadas are brilliantly good. Flaky crust and oozing fillings, and very reasonably priced at $2 apiece. We got the ham and cheese and the spinach and cheese. I easily could have eaten all 5 varieties.  We wanted to get the Provoleta, Argentine provolone cheese cooked on the grill with olive oil and roasted peppers... sounds and looked amazing. Oozing when it came out to the table next to us, but after eating the entire basket of bread, there was no way we would have room. Next time, but how will I pass on the empanadas??  As usual, the el filet did not disappoint. A perfect medium rare, this range grown fillet mignon, cooked on the grill then topped with a red onion wine sauce is simply delectable. The meat almost melts in your mouth. Two big cuts of filet, one for dinner and another for tomorrow's lunch. At $27, you think this may be expensive but trust me, it's incredibly reasonable for their portion sizes. The sauce and chimachurri sauce on the side is delicious. The Bife Vesuvio, another one of their most popular dishes, was also a winner. Slightly tougher since it is only cooked to one temperature. This grilled prime steak silced and filled with spinach, mar del plata cheese and garlic in a white wine sauce is not flattering on your breath so beware if you're on a date. I recommend the filet in that instance.  I was able to bring ALL the leftovers to work with me today, so half of the el filet and half of the vesuvio. I must say, the filet holds up better overnight and is still unbelievably tender and succulent even when reheated. The Vesuvio was a little more oily but still very good as leftovers.  Great date spot that you won't have to drop a fortune to go to. The entrees seem steep at $27 apiece, but with no corkage fee at this byob spot, our bill came out to $64.  Even with the poor service (our waiter was slow and unattentive), the food speaks for itself here and will keep me coming back.

Holding steady at two stars after another experience let me down on the service but filled me up with excellent food. We went from an expected 30 minute wait to a 2 minute wait when a table miraculously opened up. Good thing; our bottles of wine did not include a screw-top and none of us had a corkscrew handy. Teeth, broken stemware, and various physics experiments were being considered to get into the juice before sitting down. The usual applies: great food. Just eat whatever you think looks appetizing and you'll be fine. Seriously, I think you'd have to try to find something truly "bad" on the menu. The not so usual also applies: we had two tabletop grill things delivered. One successfully landed with the skill and grace of Apollo 11. The second landed with all the grace of North Korea's last missile test, which is to say it splashed all over the table, my clothes, leg, sock, and shoe. Also the floor, but the floor feels no pain. Though the server quickly said "sorry", he didn't help wipe up the mess he made on the table. He didn't offer another napkin to clean up my clothes nor ask if the really-freaking-hot sauce had burned my leg. Though it did hurt like hell, multiple bottles of wine were had: our doctor-in-a-bottle performed beautifully. The food was good so I didn't mind the fact I was eating on a table swimming with spilled deliciousness.  P.S. to the server: yeah, that's right, you took a bottle off our table that still had a glass worth of wine in it. Red card for you, sir. You just don't DO that kind of thing.

I have been here three times and I always want to come back!  Last night, we went to celebrate my husband's birthday with his family.  We had a party of 6 so luckily we could make a reservation.   They only take reservations for big parties.  We sat outside because it was perfect out.   Our waiter was very friendly.   We had emphanadas to start with.  We tried the beef and spinach and cheese.  Both delicious!   Next, everyone had salad.  The salad was very bare bones but still good.   I had a bone in ribeye with mashed potatoes.    Yum, yum, yum!   Everything was cooked perfectly and was delicious.  Perfect place for groups or date night.   The waiters are nice eye candy.  A couple of cons are 1. The wait for smaller parties, 2. One bathroom, 3. Very dark and loud inside.
awesome!!! i love it!!! delish delish  delish!!! churrasco estilo argentino !!! delish! desert flan, peach crumble, yum!!! servers ...too cute

I absolutely love this place! Discovered it about a year ago and have been a regular there since. Talk about bang for your buck!! Only problem I have with this place is that they take FOREVER to bring the food out. Not a good place to go when you are starving and want food right away. Expect at least a 45 minute wait for your entree's even on a slow day!

This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in the city. Great food and HUGE portions! You really can't go wrong with anything you order. If you're looking for a quiet night out with your lover, don't go here. It's SUPER DUPER loud and chances are you'll be sitting on top of someone at the table next to you. They only take reservations for tables of six or more. Expect long wait times if you are going during peak hours and don't have the required number of people to make a reservation. I mean VERY long wait times. Still worth the noise and wait though!

food excellent...good for meat consumers environment is very romantic...good for romantics service was excellent...good for housewives/stay at home dads clientele was classy...good for classy people BYOB...good for cheap people VERY NICE YUM YUM

We tried all the empanadas but my favorite was the ham and cheese, a bit small but it was a nice little appetizer before their huge portioned entree.  I can't remember exactly what entree I had but I can say that my whole party of 6 were satisfied with their meal and nobody had any complaints.  A huge plus is that they are a BYOB establishment (always a plus!).  Their flan desert and waffle cake were absolutely delicious and were devoured in minutes.

This is not a traditional steakhouse, which is why I think it's so good. The food is delicious. The berenjena appetizer - it's sort of like eggplant lasagna - and the provoleta, which is essentially baked cheese - have become our appetizer mainstays. Yum! The spinach mashed potatoes are also delicious. They aren't overwhelmingly spinach-y, so friends who don't like spinach still think they're wonderful. In my opinion, the lomo relleno (a thick steak smothered with mushrooms and a chimichurri sauce) and bife vesuvio (steak stuffed with cheese and spinach) are the best entrees. The servers I've had (and I've been here at least 8-10 times in the last four years) are always friendly and efficient. This might be mistaken by some as brusque, but I appreciate a waiter who gets to the point and doesn't waste time with chit-chat. I don't come to Tango Sur to talk. I come to eat steak. Delicious, mouthwatering, melt-in-your-mouth steak. And so much steak, too. Seriously, wear your eating pants, folks!  Pro Tip: When you go to this restaurant, you need to go early (at 5:30 or 6) or be prepared to wait. They will take down your phone number and give you a call when your table is ready. It's not so bad if you live close by or want to spend an hour or two drinking. We always put our names in and walk back home. I understand how someone might get frustrated by a long wait, but that's why you read Yelp reviews!

I went here with my gf and other friends for dinner on May 11th. We had BIFE VESUVIO and EL FILET. The food was great but the waiting time is a little bit long(2 hrs?) if you don't have much to talk about. Oh, I have to say the candle-lit environment was really awesome and made it so cozy! Had a very great time!

Cozy, romantic, great steaks and empanadas...and to top it off, BYOB!  It would be 5 stars in my book, but I just can't get around the wait. I had a 90 min wait at 6:30 on a Saturday night for 2 people. They said they would call when my table opened up but never did. And when we went back 90 min later, they seated us immediately but didn't make any reference to why they hadn't called. I've gotten around the long wait by going with a large group (they took a reservation for that), but we were SO crammed at our table that it was a bit ridiculous, really. If you can put up with a wait, the food is excellent and reasonably priced. And did I mention it was BYOB?!

The food was good but it was a miserable experience.  Their system of seating is just awful and then when we finally got to our table we were about 1 foot away from the people next to us, so don't go unless you want strangers in your face while out to dinner.

The guys on the door could not have been ruder. We knew we couldn't make a reservation. We arrived at 7pm, were told 90mins wait and they would call us. At 8.45pm we went back and asked if we would be seated soon.  We were told 15mins.  We went back at 9.10pm and the guys were just rude. They walked away and ignored us when we asked how much longer we would have to wait.  Eventually, we asked again and they just said, 20mins and we walked away. Dreadful customer experience.

The evil little imps on the door have the kind of superiority complex that comes from being, I would imagine, really unpopular at school. Thus the false feeling of power they feel with the responsibility of getting people seated has unfortunately gone to their head. I would love to write a review about the food but unfortunately I never got in there. I was expecting to wait. I happily agreed with the 1.5 hour wait first mentioned. 2.5 hours later - for just a group of three, we admitted defeat and left. I don't care how good the food apparently is, the guys on the door are smug, rude little men with not a brain cell between them. Seriously folks, gives this place a miss and go live your lives - waiting in line is for people with nothing better to do.

Amazing steak done perfectly medium rare, or medio rojo as they say. I had the costeleta, rib-eye, and a bite of the fillet mignon. Buenissimo! The appetizers are also delicious, we had: jamon crudo con melon (Prosciutto and melon!), lengua a la venegreta (tongue!) y matambre (veal) . We were a party of 7 and celebrating a bachelorette and received 2 flans on the house. The staff is extremely nice and attentive, pouring our BYOB wine. I especially enjoyed conversing with Martín. Would definitelg go again if I'm ever in Chicago. Great ambience for a date or a group. Last note is that we got there early and had no problems with seats. Otherwise, it gets super crowded.

This is a place that I had herd a lot about, and I am a sucker for a great steak so I decided to check it out.  Wow, was I impressed!  Although its not a big place, and you might feel a little l "cozy" while dining, the food is KNOCK YOUR SOCKS OFF good.  The steak was made perfectly, and the chimichuri sauce is something you DO NOT want to pass on.  I am normally an A1 fanatic and will not eat a steak without it, but the chimichuri sauce made me forget A1 even existed!  I went for my birthday and had a good group of 8 or so with me, which was probably the max Id be able to fit in the space.  Great people, great ambiance and great food, I will definitely be back again and again and again.

I took my boyfriend here for his birthday a few weeks ago. I hadn't been in years mainly due to the fact that the wait is always so long and they don't take reservations. We arrived at around 8:30 and were told it was about a 90 minute wait. I was ready for this and so was my bf. But then, the host looked at us and said, "Hold on. I'm going to be able to help you." He shuffles us to a back waiting area and opens our bottle of wine for us and says it'll only be about 30 minutes now. I have no idea why, but wasn't about to question it! I do believe that there were so many larger groups there that night that the turnover for a two top was just faster. Yay! We were seated outside, which I love, as the inside can be crowded and very loud. If you want to hear your date/eating partners, I'd recommend outdoors. The waiter was amazing. In fact, I wish I had gotten his name. I also love to compliment the waitstaff to the manager. Unfortunately, I just forgot.  We ordered one beef and one chicken empanada. I don't know what the green sauce is they serve with it, but it just really bumps up the flavor. We also had the melted cheese plate. What's not to love? Melty cheese, bread. yes please. For our entree we split one of the steaks for two. The one with the chimichurri. It was fantastic. My bf was a bit skeptical on getting it medium rare (he wanted medium), but both I and the waiter said it was the right way for this. Medium rare was definitely the way. And there was the fantastic green sauce again! We didn't even finish half of the steak. It was so big. We did take it home and the next morning made some steak and eggs for breakfast. Cooked up quite nicely.  For dessert, the waiter brought out a caramel flan that he gave us for my bf's birthday. Awesome I love that this place is byob. Really cuts down on the cost. For all of what we ate, it was 54 bucks. Seriously, why are you not going right now?  Anyhow, I can't wait to go back, sooner rather than later. Just be prepared to wait a bit. It is worth it.

Be warned this place takes forever to get seated.  No "reservations" are accepted. There's a guy with a list and a pen at the front with whom you check in with, and check n with, and check in with and then after  about 3 hours you might get a table. Luckily, my group of 5 actually did (after 3 hours). To be honest, I was not very impressed. Not worth the wait. Granted the night before, my group went to Ruxbin's and had a glorious experience. So I had extremely high expectations. I really tried not to, but after that long of a wait, you expect something amazing. I suppose if you were a steak lover, then you might find this place appealing, but I guess I'm not that much of a carnivore or I have really high standards for meat. This place is for the steak purist. This is a no fuss, BYOB, potato tortilla ( hint this is not a traditional tortilla), BYOB, wait for 3 hours for a hunk-a-chunka piece of red meat kind of place. I shared a rib eye with a friend along with the potato tortilla, and some empanadas and I was stuffed beyond stuffed. I definitely didn't finish my food, partly because I was full but partly because I didn't find my food very appealing. The meat was way too fatty. The potato tortilla was not what I expected. It was more like a frittata and not so much a tortilla the way I know of tortillas. The salad was very atypical of what you would expect for a salad - it was 2 large lettuce leaves, a slice of tomato and a slice of red onion with a DIY dressing of oil and red wine vinegar. I think the true test of a restaurant comes to this, would you come to this place again? To that I would answer, no. Maybe if I lived in the Chicago area, but since I don't, I'm more inclined to try other restaurants, vs. coming to this establishment again. So, my advice, go here once, if you are in the area and try it for yourself. But, come here knowing that you might have to wait an hour or more for a table, and that you shouldn't expect a fancy 5 star steakhouse.

How has it taken me so long to review one of my go-to places in the city?? Tango Sur has some of the best steak you will find in the city... and at reasonable prices to boot.  Did I mention it's BYOB, too? The warm eggplant appetizer (berenjena) is mandatory. Oh, and you're gonna need a second bread basket because you simply can't let any of that luscious sauce go to waste. I almost always go for El Filet because seriously, you get not 1 but 2 filets!  The portions here are VERY generous.  So not only do I get to enjoy my steak here; I get to take one home to enjoy the next day!  The steak is always cooked to perfection, and just thinking of the red wine sauce that goes with El Filet makes my mouth water. Oh, and that chimichurri sauce -- don't be bashful with it.  Dip the empanadas in it.  Bathe your mashed potatoes with it.  Just make sure to savor garlicky herby deliciousness. One tip: Call ahead for a reservation if you have a big group, but expect to wait otherwise.  They don't take reservations for just a few people.

What a great find. Well-stocked wine shop only a block down and BYOB -  it's bound to be a merry matrimony. The price, like everyone said, is unbelievable. Despite being BYOB and affordable, Tango Sur still manages to keep it classy with a moody ambiance. The meat itself can be a little on the saltier and greasier side. However, when has that ever stopped you from enjoying your food, O Hypertensive America? For a change, I highly recommend the Berenjena.

Filet mignon was quite good. Not the very BEST I've ever had, but very good (I'm spoiled). There were TWO filets! Kinda loud and raucous at 11pm, extremely long wait, but how you can blame a place for being incredibly popular? Things cooled off by 11:30. Ambience for our 5th anniversary? Delightful. Go late, get seated around 11pm, then sit back with a bottle of wine, some steaks, and with the candle-lit table you can have yourself a 5-star evening. We'll be back; I can't wait.

Was really looking forward to checking this place out.  We didn't get past the doorman.  Apparently this place is so busy on a Friday night that they have someone at the door not allowing you to go in and adding you to their "hour and a half" waiting list.  To top it off, I asked where we can wait and we were referred to check out the surrounding bars.  Really? Because based on some reviews, there's a waiting room in the back.  When I asked about it, the host said we had to wait to be able to go in there. Wait to get into the waiting lounge?  Needless to say we took our name off the list and headed to a nearby restaurant where we were treated like our business was appreciated.   Unfortunately my review is not geared towards the food  as I never got to taste the food.  However, based on many other reviews the food is good.  So if you're looking for good food, with a side of arrogance,  well this is your place.

Woot! What a manly meal.  Lots of meat and its quite delicious (not healthy but delicious).  The atmosphere is awesome and they have a patio, plus BYOB is always a winner.  Great place to enjoy a bottle of wine on a date. The weekends its packed and is a little louder, so if that bothers you I'd suggest a weekday.

After hearing so many good things about this place, I added Tango Sur to my "most wanted to try" restaurant list. It had been on there a while until i finally made it for dinner last night. Dinner was a "Grub With Us" meal with a group of six others (it was booked for a group of eight. Simple math: two people don't show up=more food for us!). The place looked great from the inside: map of Argentina on the wall, various paintings on other walls. Plus there was a "roving" guitarist playing various salsa and other types of Spanish music. (I think a Gypsy Kings tune was played once during the night). The waiter was very pleasant as well. Now of the food. The special menu that we had included chicken empanadas (I'm a big fan of empanadas, whether it be here or any other Spanish restaurant), spinach ravioli (yum), berejena (eggplant w/spinach, cheese, and tomato sauce), and three meat dishes(short ribs, skirt steak, and flap steak). The flan that we had for dessert was nice and creamy.  The only bad part about the experience (and the reason for the two star deduction) was the noise level. I hated screaming across the table to my dinner companions. The live music was nice, but to me it added to the noise that drowned out the conversation.  Considering that this was a weekday night, I can only imagine how weekends at this place can be. My sister went to this place on a Saturday a few months ago, and she had the same review as me: great food, but uncomfortable noise level. I'd go back for the food; but I know how the conversations during the night would turn out.

As we walked down the street towards Tango Sur for our Saturday Night, 7:45PM reservation for 7, we walked through a group standing in front of The Music Box at which point my pants instantly became tighter... no, not from the excitement and anticipation of eating at Tango Sur, but from the ambiance of hipsters in the area. Yes, you can get a "contact hipster" just by walking through a group of them. Thankfully we survived, but we should have noted the omen as we got to the restaurant.  Tango Sur only takes "reservations" for groups of 6 or more, we had 7, perfect. We had called almost a week prior to dining and expected to wait no more than 15-20 minutes. I'm not unrealistic, I know that even with a larger group and a reservation, you're not going to get seated right on time. However, what I was not expecting was to be told it would be 45 minutes.... which then turned into 90 minutes. But don't worry, at about the hour mark we were lead into a back "waiting room" which felt like an old Chinese opium den, but instead of opium it was wine and instead of toothless, chinese tweakers, it was disgruntled people waiting for tables at a mediocre restaurant. Definitely not a place a woman would want to be alone... 2 bottles of wine and 30 minutes later our shackles were finally broken and we were liberated to our table. We started by cracking 2 more bottles of wine to try and wash the opium flavor out of our mouths and then ordered chicken and beef empanadas as well as some sort of cheese plate. The beef empanadas were actually really good and brought me back into the spirit of the food. I almost just ordered 2 more plates of those for my entre, but sadly I did not and regretted it later. The waiter eventually made his way back to us and took our orders... everyone ordered El Filet. I was actually going to order something else, but the waiter successfully up-sold me to the filet-medium.  The salads came out and I was a little disappointed. As my fiance pointed out, the lettuce and tomato looked like what you would get on the side when you order a cheeseburger. Literally 3-5 pieces of lettuce flat on a plate with 2 slices of tomato on top of it; oil and vinegar are your only dressing options.  Not too long after the salads our filets came out. If I had known that each filet order was 2, 8-10 oz filets more of us would have shared, especially since mine was definitely medium rare and not medium. The medium rare steaks at the table were still breathing. The filet sat in a pool of sauce, which to me usually means they are trying to mask the flavor. The steak wasn't bad, the sauce was good and the spinach mashed potatoes were ok... needless to say I wasn't impressed with the food we waited almost 2 hours for (with a reservation).  As you can tell I was quite disappointed with Tango Sur in almost every aspect. Sure it had a nice intimate, candle-lit feel to it, but when the restaurant is louder than the bar watching the Blackhawks game that night, you lose all that intimate appeal. Mediocre food and a 90 minute wait, 30 of which was spent fearing for my life, is not the way to get me to come back. Sorry guys, unless you're really dying to try this, I would pass.
A local recommended us this place, and we loved it. The meat is outstanding.... Even the coffee.  Marce

I am in love with Tango Sur. I don't know what took me so long to get here, and that is my only regret with this place. Yes, there's a wait, and no- no reservations. So grab wine and head to that cozy little dark room and wait to be called. Order some empanadas. Take your time with the menu. My favorite is el filet, but everyone has their own. The spinach potatoes...everything about this dish makes my mouth water. But I've tried other (people's) dishes, and they're all fantastic. Juicy, flavorful, everything dinner should be and more. And yes, you should try and share otherwise you'll fall into a food coma because the plates are not small. It's so reasonably priced, but I'd go here even if they bumped it up (knock on wood). It's great for dates, or for large parties.  Service is just what I like...not too attentive or talkative, but there when you need them. They never rush you out and let you truly enjoy your meal. ...and now I just talked myself into going back this week.

I added Tango Sur to my bookmarks in 2009 and I finally made it over there just a short three years later in 2012. I think it was the no reservations/long wait that kept me away for so long. But that was then, now I had a connection, and it pays to have connections at places like this....so my friend and I were celebrating her birthday and I decided to drop some names and get us seated in 20 minutes rather than the hour and a half that we were quoted. Tango Sur is every bit as dark, romantic and incredibly cramped as others have told you.  But the meat is worth it. Just thinking about the "el filet" makes me drool. Very juicy and tender and goes perfectly with the spinach mashed potatoes it is served with. The Argentine provolone cheese was unbelievable. The caramel flan for dessert was so good I had to restrain myself from licking the plate. I've never tasted pure caramel like that---oh so good. The only thing I was disappointed with was their famous empanadas. They were just too big, the crust was too much and too fried and the fillings were too much. Tried the trio, did not like the ones with meat in it, the plain was the best. I'd say skip the empanadas and save room for your entree, the portions are huge. Love that it is BYOB. Service was fantastic. Glad I made it here at least once.

Can't believe people still go here! Look at all the one stars and you'll see a common theme: Long wait, rude host, others that arrived after you being seated before you, night club bouncer treatment, and poor service. Talk about consistency. Experienced all of that last night. I have a low tolerance for BS. I feel sorry for those that wait for over two hours and decide to leave. My wait was 20 minutes too long and I was out. Went here three times and only ate once. The food was good the first time I went, but not worth any of the BS I experienced last night and a few months ago. I work hard for my money and refuse to hand it over to arrogant and snobbish people. The really bad thing is that I had a plan B before even arriving to this place. I didn't expect to be treated like crap, but I knew they were capable of it.  Long story short, horrible service and attitude warrants a boycott of this place. Went to Wildfire downtown. Always a pleasant experience and I'd rather pay more for great service than to give a single penny to Tango Sur. Wasted $1.60 on the damn parking meter! Never again!

Wow!! This place is amazing great food and atmosphere! Candle lit very romantic! We went to a friends birthday on Thursday night but even though we had a reservation we waited an hour and a half! Even though our reservation was pushed back. But it was well worth the wait we got some free appetizers! N it was delicious! The server was amazing and very attentive he was Chilean because his accent was amazing!! The parillada for two is good for meat lovers! And the best part its BYOB!!! Yeah what else can you ask for? It's 4 stars because we had to wait! other thank that I will knock it up with  5!!

My beau thinks I am crazy because I love love love their black sausage. This place definitely has a romantic date atmosphere. It's dark, and loud. BYOB is nice, people usually bring a pre-dinner bottle just in case there's a long wait- the place gets packed during weekends. Service is definitely slower during rush times, but that is to be expected. Yummy food. Empanadas, black sausage, flank steak---yummy.

This is my favorite restaurant in the entire world.  Ultra romantic and BYOB...and there's a great wine store across the street (Que Syrah). Last time I visited, there was a Spanish guitar player which was incredibly sexy.  You need a reservation and even if you get one, you'll have to wait a bit and you will be pissed off...just go next door and grab a drink. The filet is worth it. And you will get sexified.

Of the many restaurants I've been to after having lived in Chicago for nearly 3 years, Tango Sur is by far my favorite of them all! It's the closest thing to heaven on earth for meat eaters. With attentive servers and bus boys, you are sure to get what you need even on a busy evening.  My boyfriend and I went on a Tuesday evening at around 7pm before the dinner rush. Thankfully we were seated right away. Another time we went was on a Friday, with a reservation time of 9 pm, we were seated at 11pm. A busy restaurant is always a good sign to me. This place is *always* busy.  The BYOB is a great added feature. My recommended dish is the 'Para Dos' which is an array of meats (though it's meant for 2, it can really feed 3 to 4). I have never had a bad dish. Buen provecho!

Warning - this is a vegetarian's review of a steak house. Took the boyfriend for his bday dinner at Tango Sur a few weeks ago.  It was top of his list of Chicago steak houses to try. I called a few weeks ahead of time, and while they don't do formal reservations for parties less than 6, they put me on the "wait list" which basically means you get priority to people who walk in and put their name on the list.   We made a "reservation" for 7:30pm, got there around 7:15pm and were seated right at 7:30pm.  While waiting, we sat in the back room, and since Tango Sur is brilliantly BYO, we cracked our first bottle of wine to enjoy a glass before being seated. The ambiance of the place is fantastic - very small with exposed brick walls.  However the other reviews were dead-on in terms of noise - the place is incredibly noisy!  Not a huge detractor, but it just doesn't really fit wtih the cozy ambiance of the place overall. For appetizers, we shared the corn and spinach empanadsas - AMAZING.  I'd go back just to order those!  The fried provolone plate was fantastic - literally just a plate of fried provolone cheese, which we devoured at an alarmingly fast rate. The meat-eater boyfriend ordered El Filet, which he deemed "very good."  He said it was covered in a delicious sauce, but that usually points to a lower quality cut of meat when they drench it in sauce.  His assessment was that it was excellent for the price, but fundamentally not the best steak he's ever had - more similar in food quality to the steak houses you'd see in Vegas. As a (pesca) vegetarian I ordered the salmon.  Not so wonderful.  Not bad, but just not good either.  I won't complain as I don't think most people go to Tango Sur for the fish, and I knew my meal was secondary to the birthday boy's dinner. Overall - you can't beat the price and service at Tango Sur.  With the BYO option, it's probably the best deal in town for a steak dinner.  Absolutely worth checking out... but I think we'll continue to try other local steak houses before returning.

Consistent with most other reviews, this place is romantic, delicious, and awesome.  BYOB, completely candle-lit, and always busy. We came here on a double date with my roommate and her bf. They put their names in around 5PM and by about 6:45 they were ready for us. They took our phone number so that we would  be called when ready, so it was easy to walk down the street to another bar and grab some drinks beforehand.  Seating is a bit tight, but it kind of adds to the experience of Tango Sur. We ordered the chicken empanadas and melon with prociutto as appetizers. The empanadas were absolutely the way to go! I ordered the bife vesuvio (prime steak filled with spinach, cheese, and garlic) and was not able to finish the whole thing. A couple of tough spots in the meat, but delicious nonetheless. When I reheated the food the next day, it was almost better than it was when it was fresh! Not sure how that works out... The spinach mashed potatoes were to die for. They come out looking like bright green mashed potatoes, but taste SO GOOD. By the end of the night, our table was filled with bottles of wine, tons of meat, bread...it was a very indulgent night, for sure.  NOTE: you get two filets when you order the filet. There is certainly enough food for 2 on that entree!  I will most certainly be back here and can't wait for that time to come!

There's a wait pretty much all the time. Even 10:30 on a Friday night. But it's a byob with top notch meat. All the food I've tried is delicious. The service is just okay, but they open your wine, take your order, then leave you alone, which I'm fine with.  I've got to say the filet is wonderful and so is the morcilla. Also, the decor is chill, the music isn't too loud, and the lighting is low so you can go there with a date and she might not realize you're wasted. Hooray!

One of my favorite places for a laid back, romantic dinner with my husband.  Wait time is usually about an hour to an hour and a half if you arrive before 7 (it's easy to kill time by boutique shopping or hanging out at a nearby bar).  Can't go wrong with a couple of empanadas - we always order 1 beef and 1 chicken - and the filet dinner which we also share.  Waiters are always friendly, and the best part is being able to bring our selection of red wine.  Easily less than $50 for a fantastic meal for two!
Good deal, although the wait is a pain in the ass.  Get there early or late.

Im a huge fan of BYO, huge. BUt when I told the guy I wanted a vegan option, he looked at me like I was an idiot. Ok, ok....I was dining at f*ing Tango Sur, but it was for a work outing. I had ordered the eggplant appetizer, where they proceeded to give me their eggplant parmesan. Uh, no cheese please! They were quick at changing my order, but they looked like it didnt go over well. Everyone else loved their food, but I was kinda eh about the whole thing. I like the atmosohere and the BYO, but give me some more options at least!!

The last time we went to Tango Sur, we were made to wait an extra 2 hours past our reservation time.  The front door guy was very rude and lied to us a couple times.  The food was just OK.....nothing great.  Also, seating was a bit cramped.  I would rather not have someone be rude to me, sit in tight quarters and eat just OK food after waiting 2+ hours.  Thanks, but no thanks.
The LOMO RELLENO I ordered was only OK - it was fatty and didn't seem like it was a fillet. I will get a different item next time.  The Chimichurri sauce, however, was very good.

I was very disappointed the other night as I called ahead and was told we would be sat at 8. My boyfriend and I finally were sat at around 9:15. (mind you, this is a Tuesday). We ordered right away and still didn't get our app till 30 min, and it was COLD. Finally got our steaks around 1030- at this point I wasn't even hungry any more. Steak was very tough, not very tasty. The only thing I enjoyed was the live music. However, not sure if I'll ever go back.

Spinach and Cheese empanada- They are small, but we split with 3 people and it was about the size of one bite each. Very good!!  We decided to start with a seafood salad. I couldn't find it on the menu, but it was a fresh salad topped with grilled seafood (calamari, squid, shrimp, mussels/ oysters, crab). It was very tasty. It's served cold with lemon wedges and topped with sun dried red peppers (at least that's what I think it was).  We ordered the Lomo Relleno and the Milanesa a Caballo. The Lomo Rellano was huge. Even sharing between 2 of us, we had about half left over. I guess it depends on how big of an eater you are, but it was more than enough for two. The meat was tender and the sauce was sooo good. I guess being asian, it would have tasted perfect with a side of rice. Their Milanesa was ok. Nothing special. It was a beef breaded and fried and topped with 2 eggs. If you come here, I would recommend trying their grilled steaks! We arrived at 7pm on a Monday night and the place only had people sitting at one other table. By the time we left (around 9pm), the place was completely packed. Very romantic ambiance with candles lit. I hope to come back here in the future and try their Bife Vesuvio!

I love this place!  I went with my family last night for my brother's birthday dinner. Thankfully, there were 6 in our party so we were able to make a reservation.  Definitely aim to get 6 in your party just for this reason alone!  As big fans of red wine, we very much appreciate that this fine restaurant is BYOB.  The food is amazing and I like that its a bit unique from your average steakhouse.  My mom and I split a filet made for two, and it probably could have fed 4 of us!  They brought us the most delish caramel flan for the bday boy and we inhaled it.  Not to mention the carrot cake and some sort of fabulous waffle pie thing we also ordered.  Get your friends and go to Tango Sur, you will wonder why it took you so long!

OMFG! I am disgusted by the by the by the way that my group (not to mention several other groups and couples) were treated by the staff of Tango Sur.  We were told that there was a 2 hr wait to get in and while I would have said forget it, my boyfriend really wanted to wait and the two others we were with had never been so ...fine... we went to a bar down the street for two hours and waited and had fun and figured ok its prob a good idea to walk back to the restaurant and see whats going on bc we didn't receive any phone call that our table was ready.  I should have known things were going to end badly when some other group asked where they were in the wait bc they had been waiting for a number of hours already and ended up leaving because the man at the door was so rude to them.  So there are two guys at the door and I don't understand how they have no communication and obviously no idea what they are doing... one guy takes the names and one guy calls them, which is sad if you are not able to perform both functions yourself,  Anyways we were told it would be another half an hour... so we waited... ahhh why does a group of 16 get to go ahead of us.... then when other people who had only waited 45 min total were let in .... finally our party, who they had written down as a party of 2 NOT 4 mind u (so the name taker can't even do his one job).... gets called....oh NO not to actually sit down and dine ... but to go in the WAITING ROOM they have inside.  The height of the night was when 4 chicks were seated who literally just arrived ... my bf asked the guy who calls the names why they were seated when they just arrived and the caller said "go ask the guy at the door" ,,,, seriously? Isn't it your job to take the name hes written on his 50cent mini note pad and call them in ORDER ...as the patron I am supposed to go figure out ur issues?.... so the name caller can't do his job right either.  Needless to say we left ... and as we are walking out, name taker and name caller are like "oooo why are you leaving, your table is next" hahahahaha I'm soooooo sure that it is.  The food is great there is no doubt, but I will never go here again because the foods not that good.... my boyfriend can make the same if not better chimichurri sauce and can grill a steak awesomely ... so screw you Tango Sur.

Frequent diner here - in the past. Came in with a group of 4 on a Saturday at 7:30 and was quoted a two hour wait time. Normally I'd go someplace else since as a personal rule, I don't wait 2 hours for any kind of food; but the couple we were with hadn't been here before and I raved about the place so we decided to put our names down. We went down the street and had appetizers and drinks then came back two hours later ... only to find out that we need to wait longer. Half an hour later we are ushered inside - not to sit, mind you but to wait in the "waiting room." The waiting room basically looks like an antechamber to a David Lynch crackhouse or whorehouse ... dim, bleak and dungeonesque. Another half hour later we are still waiting and looking around while groups of 4 that just walked in are being seated. So after a 3 hour wait, I swear at the seating attendant, I swear at the "host" and walk out. We ended up going down to street to Sushi Mura which was fantastic - as usual. TL;DR version: food & BYOB good but not 3 hours wait good. Service & hospitality is awful. But given that the place is always on a wait AND it averages 4 stars on Yelp with 1000+ reviews I'm sure it will continue to do just fine ...

OMG!!! I have eaten at Tango Sur several times during my two years of eating at restaurants other than McDonald's.  Tango Sur is one of the best places I have ever eaten at in Chicago.  First of all, it is a BYOB place and they do not have a corking fee.  Since this is an Agentinian meat joint, you must have a red wine with you.  They will provide the bucket of ice.  They have a great selection of food, but you have to have the empanadas as an appetizer ($2 each).  Get one of each and if they don't have the corn empanadas, then ask for one of those too.  They are the best.  I almost always order the Filet Mignon as my main dish.  It comes with two nice sized filets and spinach mashed potatoes and a salad ($30 something)... IT IS AMAZING AND COOKED PERFECT EVERY TIME!!! Yum my mouth is watering as I type and I just ate dinner... =P  There is always enough to take home for lunch or dinner the next day.  When I microwave it the next day (I know... destroyed it right), it tastes great and is so juicy still.   Only issues I would have with the place and the reason I took a star away is due to the fact they don't take reservations so you have to get there early or wait for over an hour to two hours. BUT, it is so worth.  Get there by 5pm to get in faster.  Also, the music tends to be too loud at times... BUT, it is a great date place or for special events.  If you have a group of 6 then you can make a reservation but you only get two time slots to chose from each night, so call early. Tango Sur - I love you!!! And as always.... Have Fun!!!

Let me set the scene: Cold March evening, group of six, armed with wine, and ready to chow down on some serious food...and we were not disappointed. Our server, Peter, was attentive, polite, and had great recommendations for appetizers - he definitely did not steer us wrong with the empanadas (one each of the five different types), provoleta, and lengua. Most of us were full after the appetizers! Then for dinner we collectively ordered the pez (salmon), two churrascas (12-oz sirloins), the berenjena (eggplant), and the vacio relleno (not sure exactly, but some sort of flank steak with great flavor).  Everyone was impressed. I cannot wait to reheat my berenjena; it was like a vegetarian lasagna but with 10x more flavor than you would ever expect. I also had multiple bites of the vacio relleno and it had such a flavorful yet tender bite, that I was truly impressed!  Food and table service aside, I was a bit disappointed with the cramped table situation and the noise. When I saw that it was "intimate" on Yelp, I kind of expected a quiet and subdued place, but it was just packed, loud, and dimly lit. Just not exactly what I had pictured in my mind's eye - but that only knocks off a star. I'm saving this for the last because I don't think it's quite as important as the fact that we had a delicious meal, but the front of house service was not my favorite. I made the reservation two weeks in advance and got a confirmation call the day of; great, right? But we got there three minutes late for our reservation and only then did they tell us that they were 15-20 minutes behind with their reservations - and on top of that, there was no room to wait in the restaurant! They had my number, so why didn't they call? I'm sure a large percentage of their patrons are within walking or a 15 minute drive range, so why wouldn't they let us know beforehand? That's really my only complaint. I love the fact that it's byob (I'm new to this whole byob-in-chicago thing) and we saved a ton of money but still had a great meal. Definitely add it to your list of places to try.
For straight up great grilled meat at a reasonable price!  The chimichurri is great.  BYOB makes it even more worthwhile.  La parrillada is the best bet for couples or groups. Keep it going!
Best affordable dinner date for the meat lovers. Romantic candle lit atmosphere. BYOB. Make reservations 5-10 days early if you are going for dinner rush hours on weekends.

Lackluster service and poor quality of food--save you're time and money and go elsewhere. I went this evening by myself. After being seated, I waited 20 minutes for a server to realize I hadn't been helped. I ordered the beef empanada and the "famed" El Filet. The empanada was good, I would certainly return and just have these. Next, I was brought a measly plate with two leaves of lettuce, two tomatoes, and some onions. The veggies were nothing special, and I could have done a better job with the presentation. After waiting another 20 minutes, my entree was served. True to other reviews, I received two "filets" of beef, mashed potatoes, and a wine reduction. Honestly, the potatoes and reduction were common and nothing to write home about. Worse, the steak was chewy and bland.

From the second the thug of a "doorman" stopped us outside, THE EVENING WENT DOWNHILL LIKE A DRUNK ON A STOLEN RADIO FLYER WAGON. I give this place zero stars. If it were possible I would give it negative stars. The service was lousy...the place was so dark you needed a cell phone to read the menu. Loud? I could have had a better time on a runway at O'hare airport it would have been quieter. When we arrived two of our party were already there with four more coming, the waiter never did ask me if I wanted something to drink nor the rest of our party for the entire meal. Did I mention the service at this place is lousy? The best piece of advice I can tell anyone that is considering going to this place is DON'T! Parking? Give me a break, had to walk 5 blocks uphill both ways to get to this dump. Let's see, what else does this "restaurant" have not to offer? Oh, not to mention the fact that they pack diners in so tight there's barely room to blow a fart. Upon arrival I pulled my chair out and thought to myself "holy crap I'm going to need the jaws of life to get out of this". The menu I firmly believe was written in a combination of Greek hieroglyphics and Chinese algebra and maybe pig Latin I'm not sure about the pig Latin. In conclusion the only way I would recommend this dump is if you enjoy lousy service, terrible atmosphere, mediocre food, and need plenty of exercise getting there then by all means go. Otherwise, avoid this place like the plague, war zones, and personal injuries. If the purpose of this place is to provide you with a miserable evening then all I can is "MISSION ACCOMPLISHED". These people would be better off opening a dry cleaning business.

The only downfall is the wait for a table, other than that Tango Sur is always a great time.  The empanadas are amazing, steak is fantastic and the atmosphere is romantic and fun - a little too crowded but worth it.  Love this place.

Best empanadas I have ever eaten.  The fillet could feed an army - and those spinach mashed potatoes are unreal. Yeah - a great place that isn't insanely pricey is gonna be packed on a Friday night.  They'll grab your phone number and you can head to a bar like Dag's or the Blue Bayou for a beer while you wait.  Chill out.  The outdoor seating is the way to go in the summer. This is my favorite date night restaurant, it is amazing.  Oh and did I mention BYOB - classy.  Pop in that CVS and grab yourself a bottle of something.

As an original Nebraskan pre transplanting to Chicago, I am a connoisseur of beef (get your mind out of the gutter). And I can to you, Tango Sur: well played. Honestly, the fact that you can go somewhere in this city and get an appetizer and two steaks for around $60 is amazing to me. I don't even mind the wait--cozied up in the dark back room, drinking wine opened for us by a muscled server...no, it's not a dream, it's just Tango Sur's usual. I've been to this spot only twice, but I still think of it as my own, my special place that no one knows about, although it's packed nearly every night. I've gotten a rib eye and El Filet, and I will definitely be sticking the filet. I'm sure everything else is good, but the filet is just too good to be true. The empanadas are also delicious and very tempting, but you really won't need them as soon as your steak comes. Honestly, don't focus on anything except the meat and the way it tastes in your mouth. I guess you just can't win when it comes to reviewing steak places.

It get's 5 stars for the food, undoubtedly! it would get 3 stars for everything else, if I could separate the categories. be prepared to wait, park far away and its loud inside!  Went there on a Friday night with 7p "reservations" or on a wait list, and sat down at 7:45p. We were allowed to "pop the bottle" we brought in the waiting area inside (BYOB is the shit!). I parked almost 5 blocks away for this place! We sat down and ordered Empanadas, they were prepared well and come with a delicious dipping sauce. I then moved onto the "BIFE VESUVIO"; HOLY F! it was great, but be aware you cannot order this as medium rare. I was told the spinach inside needed to cook and be prepared at medium or higher, no biggie. And it also came with this amazing garlic dipping sauce. The music inside was loud and we had to lean across our 2 person table and speak loudly to hear one another. That sucked the most about it, I thought I was to be enjoying a more intimate atmosphere.   Go to enjoy the food; but be prepared to walk from the car and wait a while for a loud atmosphere.

I can see clearly now that...I've tried Tango Sur steak. Two words: Bife Vesuvio. It's hard not to fall head over heels in love with this baby. Grilled prime steak, stuffed with three of my favorite things: spinach, cheese & garlic. Served with potato wedges drowning in this to-die-for sauce of some sort. One of those things...where it doesn't even matter what's in it because it's THAT damn good.  So the answer is...YES, I do smell what THE ROCK is cooking...BIFE VESUVIO!!! Very intimate & romantic setting (so yes, it is very small)-- suitable for both a steak date, dinner with the girlfriends/homeboys, or even a small family gathering. And it wasn't as loud as you'd think it'd be...I had no problem listening to my girlfriends yakkity-yak about this-or-that ;).  And come prepared. BYOB, no cork fee. So prepare wine pairings appropriately. But wait, there are cons.  -Hard to find parking (and no, there is no valet).  -Even harder to get a table on a Saturday night. I advise going as early as 6pm if you don't want to have to wait for a table for 1.5-2hr (and nope, they do not take reservations). -Very awkward way of seating people. I was asked for my number but since there wasn't much space in the "waiting room", we had to leave the restaurant and come back. Sort of feels like...being at a dance club sober.  Given what I have learned my first experience there, I would come back...and dodge the aforementioned cons Matrix-style.

good food, great time, long waits to get in.  be prepared to put your name in and go next door to grab a drink, but they will call you when your table is ready so as long as you're not in a rush, you'll be fine.  The place is dark, only lights are a single candle on the tables and the music is loud.  For me, it is one of the best places I've been to for dinner with a date.  There's a reason why there is a wait and people are busting down the door to get in.

For food, ambiance and price you can't beat it.   El filet is a must get if you're thinking about getting steak. 2 huge portions of filet with spinach mashed potatoes. Provaleta and empanadas are awesome appetizers- Highly recommend. In the summer the patio is awesome but when it's cold the inside is nice and cozy.

Fabulous- First time in Chicago and my boyfriend and I decided to try this place our since a friend recommended. The wait was very long (about 2 hours at 7 on a saturday). But we put out name in and just drank at the local bars until the restaurant called to let us know our table was ready. The food was great, the atmosphere was fun and unique. The portion sizes were huge (couldn't even eat half of our meals after we got our salads and app), and the prices were very nicely priced for what we got. Also, being out of town we didn't have any booze on us, but its BYOB which is always great.

First off, BYOB spots already get a step above most other places. Off to a good start.  They have two rooms but the area is still a little crowded so don't worry if the people next to you are laughing at your funny story as well.  It's pretty low-lit but they do have candles to brighten up the mood.  Watch out! They're real haha! The beef empanadas with the chimichurri are a good starter and pretty cheap at $2 a piece.  As usual, don't eat too much bread.  Save that appetite!  I went with the Costeleta, bone-in rib-eye, and it was amazing.  It was just so juicy!  Nothing really special about the mashed potatoes but they were good.  I had some of what I think was salmon from the GF's dish and that was really good too. For the prices we paid, I thought the value was there.  The carmel covered cheesecake is a must-have.  Just don't make the mistake of getting one all for yourself after your large meal.  Sharing is caring. The service was not bad either.  The waiter was quick to answer any & all question we had on the menu.  He even made suggestions that did not disappoint.  And my glass of water never reached the bottom.

Arguably top ten in steaks.  BYOB.  Good vibe, always busy and always a good time.  I have never in my life had to share a steak, but almost always have to here.  Amazed on how little I spend when I walk out considering the experience.

I wish I could give this place 5 stars...but the wait time knocks it down a star. I love the atmosphere and idea of Tango Sur, and it helps that it is BYOB. We waited for nearly 3 hours before our RESERVED table was given to us. Not to worry, we went down the street to a bar to have a few drinks while waiting.  Once we actually were seated, our table was extremely close to the table next to us. Understandable for a busy restaurant, and my friends and I didn't mind. However, I don't think the couple next to us was too thrilled to have made their intimate date into a group thing with us. Oh well!  We started with the empanadas and the Provoleta (Argentine provolone cheese cooked on the grill with olive oil and roasted peppers). Holy smokes was that cheese amazing! Maybe we were just starved at this point, but we devoured it almost instantly.  I can't remember what my friends had ordered for entrees, but I had Pechuga de Pollo. It's a grilled chicken breast with vegetables and served with a chimichurri sauce. SO GOOD!  Overall, I love this place and I can't wait to go back. I just wish the wait wasn't as long and that they were better about reservations. Thank goodness it's BYOB!

This is a great place for groups.  I usually come here with a group of 12 or more.  We order 3 of the parillada para dos -shared grills, 2 orders of Vacio, and an assortment of empanadas.. We also bring about 8 bottles of wine.  it is great that they take reservations for large groups.

Tango Sur is one of the best values in Chicago!  A BYOB Argentine steakhouse, you can get in and out for less than $50 a couple.  In fact, if you're not a huge eater, I recommend splitting an appetizer and entree between two people, and you could probably eat dinner (with wine) for less than $30!  The fillet dinner is actually two 8-9 ounces tenderloins, which are easily shareable.  Other cuts of meat are also large though not necessarily already split in two. Be prepared to wait if you arrive after 6pm on weekend night!  It's no secret that Tango Sur is such a great value.  There is a small room in the back where you can start imbibing while waiting to be seated.  Also, the restaurant is loud, which makes it challenging with a large group and/or older dining companions.

A weird sexy bizarre place that helps itself bigtime by being BYO. Walked in on a Sunday night after the premiere of Urbanized at Music Box and didn't have to wait. The empanada was underwhelming and these salads, though traditional, serve an empty purpose for me... so I was meh. But my steak was really good. I think it was flatiron. GIANT piece of grilled meat that I loaded up with their chimichurri, which I love (it is garlicky - that's chimichurri). Mostly very tender. My date for this had the meat parillada and loved it all except the blood sausage.  Atmosphere here was great when we came here. There's a little outdoor section but inside it has that small dark South American feel... hiding away, being intimate. I bet a number of children are conceived after coming here.
