Everything about it is sexy and people seem to get very intense with each other while they are on dates - I know, because this is a great place to people watch, and the close-together tables make it very easy to hear their personal conversations.  In my head this is a 3.5-4 but really, the BYO changes things. After a bottle of wine, I think everyone feels warm and fuzzy about this place, and I bet it's why the reviews are so great. It's also nice to be able to just choose something you like, pay at-value for it, and get pretty plastered by the time the meat arrives.

I was pleasantly surprised by Tango Sur!  We had our friends birthday there, so their were about 10 of us.  We had reservations and we got sat right away.  There was a couple behind us without a reservation and they said it was going to be a 2 hour wait for a table..  Thank god we had a reservation.  I love that is a BYOB restaurant without a corkage fee.  The empanada's were so delicious.  The plates are huge.  My two friends split a steak and it was definetly enough for two.  I ordered the tilapia (I am not a big meat eater), I have to say it was the best I have ever had eaten.  The sauce was amazing.  The size of the fish was so big.  The servers served our wine to us, so you kind od forget that you brought the wine.  If I was to complain about anything it would be their dinner salads could of used a little more to it.  And we brought a birthday cake for our friend and they charged us a $10 dessert charge.  if you split entrees they also charge you $6, but each person does get a salad.  I loved that the had a musician playing the guitar and walking around.  The atmosphere was warm and inviting, but fun at the same time.

Oh yes, I love red meat & Tengo Sur delivers! Despite the loud noise level and close proximity of the tables, this spot has an amazing selection of dinner entres which are fit for two. The BYOB aspect is never too exciting for me personally, but how could one not understand the appeal. Four stars, great food, great ambiance.

Just ate here for the third time, and every time has been a great experience. It is a beef lovers paradise. We shared the Lomo Relleno which they state is enough for two, but after feasting as much as we could, we took almost half of it home. Their chimichurri sauce is wonderful. I do wish that it had come with vegetables - in addition to the portobello mushrooms. The service was great and byob makes it very affordable. Be sure and arrive before 6 unless you want to wait for a table.

One of my best friends from New York flew in last week so a group of friends went here for a large group dinner.  They charge a corkage fee for the BYOB but its definitely a win win.  The food here blew me away actually.  We had the provolone cheese/roasted red pepper appetizer and it seriously kicked ass.  Cheese so thick you can have to cut it with a knife.  Look at my headline people....I LIKE CHEESE!  What do I like more than cheese you ask?  Meat and Tango Sur delivers on all levels.  I had the Veal T-bone cooked medium and it was the best piece of veal I have ever had the pleasure of eating.  It was cooked perfectly and was huge.  My friends had the fillet medium rare which I have tosay was better than the Veal.  It was two HUGE fillets with some kind of reduction.  It was so good I ate it for breakfast the next morning.  My other friend had the New York Strip and it was just as good as the rest.  I love those dinners where everyone is passing bites around the table.  And I forgot to mention, my friend is a vegetarian and still ate here.  Its that damn good.

I really enjoyed this place and would love to go back.  Definitely try to make a reservation if you can as it does fill up. Luckily they took a reservation for 5 people when we went- if I had to wait hours for a table not sure I would have had the same opinion. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, and entirely lit by candles. The tables are close to one another but it didn't feel crowded. The table is given rolls and salads came with all of our dishes. We ordered a sampling of empanadas for an appetizer which were awesome and came with this amazing herb olive oil for dipping.  My friend and I each ordered the flank steak and were surprised to see them come out as 2 inches thick which was weird.  It was still very good and came with Vesuvio potatoes. Other entrees included the steak breaded with ham and cheese and eggplant parmeson which were both great.  Because it was my friend's birthday they gave us a complimentary caramel flan dessert which was one of the best desserts I have ever had.  The service is attentive and they're always asking if you need your wine opened, etc. BYOB is a nice feature and the meals are very reasonable for the quality.  I saw our waiter coming out of the women's bathroom which I thought was weird. Overall though great place.

We received a gift card, so we did go back, despite my earlier vow not to do so. I am still just MEH on Tango Sur.  I just don't get waiting for nearly 2 hours for a mediocre steak.  The service is good, and BYO is nice, but I just can't get amped about the food...or waiting that long to eat it.

Tango Sur has a great reputation, one is does not deserve. I planned my birthday party for 18 people at Tango Sur. I called every night the week of the party to ask about birthday cake ($1.75 charge per person if you bring your own cake), valet parking (none available) and lots of other random questions that arise when you plan a party for 18 people.  Yet, they managed to "give away" my reservation. The doormen (yes, there was more than just one guy working the door) were total jerks and lied about having called my cell phone to confirm the reservations. I called EVERY night that week - why would they even need to confirm?! The doormen were totally emotionless and didn't care that they were potentially ruining my birthday. They said that they could get us in 45 minutes later. Nearly TWO HOURS LATER was when they called us with a table. At that point, we had already gone to MACHU PICCHU on IRVING PARK and ASHLAND and were having a great time.  Bottom Line: go to Tango Sur if JERKS are your thing. Go to Machu Picchu if FUN TIMES and GOOD FOOD are more your style. :)

Great dinner spot...very difficult to get into though.  The portions were unbelievable and the quality of the meat was fantastic.  The meat was a little undercooked for medium rare and the restaurant is rather loud and crowded but overall a great experience.  Amazingly, no corking fee which is always a plus...byob!

Ok my 1st ever review let's get sum basic ish out da way  Fux ur spell check  Lil things dnt bother me i keep it real And I do this 4 fun not cus I care what u think  Tango sur 1st thing I like about it is how dark it was candle lit all over negative iam 6'3 310 so I bumped into every thing. Plus there was a waiting room were u can wait (duh) verse da damn cold outside. This place is small like dodge ball court small it's loud and dares 1 shitter in da whole joint (that I no of). Whn put in da waiting room if he says 20 mins he really means "1 hour and 20 mins"  I went on a monday MLK DAY (black power) it was still packed by 6 If ur a douche go here wit all ur friends 4 a birthday and take up 7 tables cus that's wat Mandy party of 10 did ( i will never 4get u Mandy)  Once seated my waiter seemed confused whn I said I dnt drink so I like water he kept asking me am I sure as if I was lost? The waiters are nice fast but hard of hearing and I found my self asking for things da weren't  accustom to doing eg can I get a straw, ice, etc... But he will explain da shit out of dat menu haha take dare advise on everything TRUST ME Bread salad pretty plain for this to b such a nice spot doe My meal I order el filet Mignon AS GOD AS MY WHITENESS I NEARLY CRIED on da first bite then da second 1 I str8 up nutted yea I said it. Great size mind u doe if ur a xxl u better get half way full wit da other ish cus dat meat want do it. I wanted to kiss da waiter and bang da chef for this masterpiece am I over reacting maybe will I fight sum1 who said da dis agree that the piece of angel food isnt in da top 5 best hell yes. I also  had sum crappy side order of chicken good wit da green sauce understand crappy not for it's taste but it's size if u big order two mayb 3 Price fair 59.97 for two el filet Mignon and sum sides give or take my under wear  Date note If u Wana wow her go her but not a great 1st date place if u are not well spoken cus of da time intervals hard work keeping her eyes on u and not her phone. Also gets loud so the phrase (say wat) (cum again) (mofo speak up ) will b used. Also note u may see ur mom friends there 25 is abd up joint But great place to get close and really gaze into her eyes wit sum wine. Damn my date was beautiful shout to Gem Summary  Great place nice feel horrible wait great food fair price the food saved this star ranking but I give it a 8.5/10 alone for the food

I give the food a 5, but the process to actually get seated is a 1, so an overall 3 it is.  The food here is amazing.  I love the empanadas, and I've had the Filet and the Vesuvio, both giant pieces of wonderfully seasoned meat, the vesuvio oozes creamy cheesy, spinach stuffing.  I like the seasoned potatoes better than the spinach mashed potatoes, and the side salad adds a nice bit of greens.  Once seated the service was very good. The process of getting seated is a joke.  The doormen give the runaround about reservation rules, act like they've lost your reservation, then tell you you have to wait 40 minutes, then magically find a table.  I get that they can do this because everyone knows that it's BYOB (and you can crack your bottle of wine in the waiting room), combined with the deliciousness of the food makes it worth the wait.  Thing is, there are lots of great places to eat in the city where there won't be wishy-washy business to get seated, so I won't being going back to Tango Sur as often as my taste buds would like.

I'm drooling as I dream back to my experience at Tango Sur. I often go through their pictures and find myself crying as wish to be back in front of a plate of their delicious meat. I could see a tyranasoraus rex geting a table for one here. It was January and there were people eating outside with coats on. Thats dome devoted fooddies right there.  Jokes aside, tango sur is no joke. Let's get this out of the way, you're gonna wait. So what? The food is worth waiting 3 days for. Plus, the placei is BYOB.  We started with their Spinach and Cheese Empenadas and their Provoleta. Both were great, especially the empenadas. I'd say it's a must get.  For dinner we did the Lomo Relleno and Para Dos. My oh my. The Lomo is huge, bursting with flavor, incredibly tender, expertly cooked (mid-rare), and a sauce that's unlike any other.The para dos is so fun to eat with friends. I love sweetbreads, so it's a personal treat that they include this with all the other meat. The short ribs, flap meat, and sausage are all really good too. Dont remember what we had for dessert, but  I think they change it up infrequently. It's going to be difficult going back and not ordering the same thing. The menu is full of awesome items I'd love to try. Their steaks look fantastic and I'm willing to bet their chicken is phenomenal too.  Long wait, really nice lighting, suprisingly intimate setting and warm decor, and some of the best grilled meat you sink your teeth into.  Bravo Tang Sur, BRAVO!

Although I rate Tango Sur 5 stars on food and service (once you're seated), I must say that as a frequent diner here, we were extremely disappointed with our last visit.  We were heading to a early concert and I called at 5pm to see if there was a table available for 4 and to say we'd be there within 20 minutes. The gentleman who answered the phone was very nice (per usual) and said we would have no problem at all, yet he didn't take my name or anything.  We got there and while one of us parked the car, the rest of us came in and said we had just called. The gentleman said as soon as our 4th diner came in, we'd be seated right away. 5 to 10 mins later, all 4 of us are accounted for and head over to the host to get our table. He then tells us that there are no tables available and the wait is now an hour.  For a landmark neighborhood restaurant in Lakeview who's customer loyalty far exceeds any other's, we were extremely disappointed to be treated that way. While I understand that they don't take reservations for more than 6 people (which doesn't quite make sense anyway), the entire restaurant was pretty much empty with tables for 10-12 set up. While I understand that they do cater to large parties, dismissing a group of four, who has dined at the restaurant 20+ times, is just bad business and bad customer service.  In the past, I have raved about Tango Sur... and I'm afraid to say that this last experience will have me not coming back.

Because I have a meat head badge I feel obligated to write a post. Candle Light only. Best Argentinian food around. Plenty of meals easily shared by two people. Juicy cuts of grass fed steaks. First date? Awesome choice.

Amazing value, great place, BYOB.... Not going to be your standard American cuts and flavors.  Open your mind and enjoy a taste of Argentina.  Love the steaks, great Flan, dark and cozy atmosphere.  Great place to split a bigger steak dish on a date.  Never had a bad meal here.  Can get busy so get there early.

About once a month, me and the bestie get together for a new restaurant to try out.  It seems that lately we've been on the Japanese and Korean bbq train, so we decided to try out some Argentinean fare based on an article that was recently released on Chicago's best restaurants for Foreign Cuisine.   The place is sexy in ambience; abundant in steaks (make sure your date thinks you chewing on a 40 ounce of steak is sexy) and the waiters are SEXY.  Ummm hmmmm....come here on girls' night out   Now this is one steak place that anyone can go to and load up on appetizers alone.  The cheesy appetizer is hot oozy provolone cheese  with warm break and chimichuri sauce.  Simple, non-elegant, but all pleasing. Empanadas are small but flavorful, my favorite being the spinach filled pocket.   Yes, order the spinach mashed potatoes, it'll make your meal seem somewhat healthy.  The steaks are juicy, but my Entrana steak in particular was on the chewier side even though I ordered it medium rare.   Skyler was our waiter and he was helpful with our choices since we were newbies.  I won't hold it against him that my steak was chewy, because he did warn me.  I'll just have to order type on my next visit.  He gave us a complimentary flan and it was polished off by me and dinner mate #2.  I'll agree with Skyler on the flan....very light and delicious  This place is a great steakhouse, but has great options of entrees other than red meat

My girlfriend loves this place and most people do. But, I don't care to come here. The wait is always really long. What restaurant doesn't take reservations? The place itself is crazy crowded with tiny tables. The food is average overall. I have had a few really awful steaks and a couple good ones. Empanadas are good at least, real hard to screw something like that up. I do like that it is BYOB, and the prices are fair. Overall, I only come here when someone doesn't give me a choice and I usually don't hate it. Update... Just waited over two and a half hours and wasn't seated. Walked down to my local burrito place and will NEVER come to Tango Sur again. Bad service, bad ambience, average food= not worth a 2.5 hour wait. I wouldn't even wait 30 minutes for this place. AVOID!!!!!

I heard mixed opinions about this place, some were bad and I can't understand why!  After coming here for the first time this week, we were pleasantly surprised. Tango Sur was such a relaxing & romantic evening. I consider myself to be very picky when it comes to service and their service was spot on. Our waiter was there the moment we walked in to uncork our bottle of wine (No corkage fee). Nice plus! He came back right away to take our order and within minutes our salad was in front of us. About ten minutes after we finished, our food arrived; my wife had the EL FILET range grown fillet mignon, cooked on the grill then topped with a red onion wine sauce and served with spinach mashed potatoes. I had the T. BONE, range grown veal t. bone cooked on the grill, served with mashed potatoes and red chimichurri. We tried both and could not stop smiling at each other. Both were perfectly cooked and totally satisfying. Our waiter (Ever Rios) was always smiling and asked every few minutes if we needed anything, which is always nice, very attentive and friendly. A total thumbs up and will return monthly! Not only is the place affordable and serve amazing, unbelievable, good food, but also it's a BYOB. AS IF IT COULD GET ANY BETTER, so make a reservation for the larger parties (6 or more) and come early or during the week for a date. BRAVO!!!

Romantic - What?? I can believe people wrote this. It is very noisy and really is best for groups of people. We had a reservation (made some weeks earlier) but it did not appear on their books when we arrived. The staff were very rude (door man and M'D). There attitude was as though we were lucky to be eating there. I also overheard them suggesting to another small party that whilst they had a reservation at 7 (and were kept waiting...it was  now 7.30) they HAD TO BE OUT BY 9. The steaks are nice, so if your happy to be treated this way, I say make a reservation and take the abuse!
Twelve years later still delivers. The grills are awesome. Sweetbread, blood sausage, ribs..wonderful. Bring your own wine and have it uncorked for no charge. Flan is a must.

Argentinian steakhouse with a very romantic/dark atmosphere. Came here for New Years Eve dinner at around 5:30. It wasn't that busy although I heard a staff member say there would probably be a long wait later on. I would avoid coming here around 6-7ish for this is a popular place and is only open for dinner time. I ordered the El Filet ($24) and bf ordered the short ribs ($19). Both very good! My filet came in 2 and with a side order of spinach mashed potatoes. So good! It's BYOB with no cork fee. They open the bottle for you and they even asked if we wanted an ice bucket! Awesomee. I would come back!

I hate to write this review because I have been here there 3 or 4 times prior to last night and never had an issue. I went with my girlfriend, who had never been there before. She loved the atmosphere and who could hate BYOB. She ordered the stuffed steak, a meal that I have actually ordered before, and asked for it medium-rare. The waiter told her it would have to be medium because otherwise the cheese and spinach would be cold. She was fine with that. The steak came out well done. She said something to the waiter and he basically said that he told her so. He told her it was going to have to be cooked more well than rare. I think he should have asked her if he could get her something else instead or offer to put in another order of the same thing. We are aware that it was not the waiter that overcooked it but he did not rectify the situation. He brought us a free dessert - flan - which neither of us wanted or would have chosen. We spoke to the manager on our way out. We had already paid and were not looking for a free meal, The manager made excuses and did not make us feel any better about the situation.
Love this place! I always though as the BYOB places as somewhat subpar, but this place proved me wrong...  Walk down the street pick your fav bottle on wine before dinner..

Such an incredibly intimate setting.  It was like having 50 of your best friends sit in your living room for incredible steak.  I was a little thrown by how close the tables were at first, but once we sat down - loved the closeness and candle lit tables.  Hubby and I split one of the huge filets and let me tell you...it was delish!   Fun atmosphere with friends!

Love this place. Great food and atmosphere (romantic). I also like the fact its B.Y.O.B. A great place to take a date or meet a group of friends for dinner, especially if you're hungry for some meat.  Only negatives is parking and that it can get pretty packed with people.

Wow.  This review is based on a single Tango Sur's employee that I came into contact with during my five minutes at the restaurant.  Though it may seem unfair for me to even write this (since I didn't even eat at this place), maybe the management will think twice about who they have working here after reading this.  I had been looking forward to eating here for quite sometime now and am somewhat disappointed that I will never experience Tango Sur's food due to the experience I had tonight.   My boyfriend and I decided to try this place out and even though today is Tuesday, I tried to call to see if I could make a reservation because the place always seems busy and it is holiday season after all.  I tried the number several times but each time I got sent directly to voicemail.  We decided to give it a shot anyways.  While my date looked for parking I went ahead in to see if I could get a table.  The host stand was not by the door but oddly placed in back of the restaurant.  I walked towards the back of the room and got stopped by a man telling me I needed to wait outside. OK...  I went back out and waited with another gentleman that seemed to also be waiting.  The man from the restaurant came out.  The gentleman asked for a table for 7 at which time the man from the restaurant informed him that it would be at least an hour and that he should have called since they make reservations for parties 6+.  I then asked about the wait for a party of 2. He told me it would be at least an hour and that he could take my number down and give me a call when something opened up.  I stepped away to call my bf to pick me up since the wait was so long while 2 girls came up and asked for a table.  The man said 20 minutes. 20 minutes!? I went back up to him and asked why the wait was all of a sudden so much shorter and he said they had called ahead and made reservations.  (Even though he had just said they only take reservations for parties of 6+.) I shared with him that I tried calling several times and couldn't get through.  He then said I was a LIAR and asked me to TAKE OUT MY PHONE, SHOW HIM MY CALL LOG and PROVE to him that I tried calling.  WT??!?!  It was completely unprofessional and uncalled for.  I'm absolutely disgusted with how I was treated and will not attempt to eat at this restaurant ever again.

Wife was jonesing for steak. Reviews here seemed to warrant a visit. In a word: eh. We started with a selection of empanadas. The pastries were overcooked, and the fillings too paltry to compete with the overwhelming crusts, cooked to too dark a brown. The chimichurri, served with every dish we ordered, had so much raw garlic that nothing else in it was discernible, and further made the fillings just so much hot, flavorless goo. Next was the house salad, which came with the meal. I fair iceberg lettuce salad. Whatever. The steaks, ordered medium rare, were cooked perfectly. No complaints there. I had skirt, wife had flank - which they peculiarly call "flap" on the menu, though luckily the waiter called it what it really is - flank (flap is a totally different cut: a thin, low sirloin. This steak was 3" thick, and clearly a flank.)  One bite of the chimichurri (which I pile on when prepared well) wiped out tastebuds for a number of bites. It actually burnt my mouth - and I like garlic. Mushy boiled then baked potatoes (the only side) were likewise slathered in garlic and too much salt. Relentless! Place was ridiculously dark - I appreciate low lighting, but this was like a dungeon. Luckily we arrived early and got a good table by the window, but by the time we left, a line stretched out into the cold night. Service was passable, but you can tell they basically just turn and burn. Prices were moderate ($20-25 per entreee) - would be hard to beat even cooking at home. But with plenty of choices to be had, I won't be back any time soon. Certainly no place to stand in line or brave crowds for.

Simply the best - and what a deal.  Better than a downtown steakhouse and much more fun. Start with empanadas.  Mmmm. Get the "El Filet" - an amazing value that gives you literally 2 filets, perfectly cooked, for under 30 bucks.  Be ready to share or take one home. PS - Don't forget to bring a bottle of Malbec.  And it gets busy, so put your name in and enjoy a drink at the bar across the street.

Everybody loves this place, I was NOT a fan.  I wish I had take advantage of the BYOB during the 45 minute wait, it possibly would have made the night better.  I got a "prime" steak that was stuffed with cheese.  This was no way near a prime steak.  I ordered it per recommendation from a friend who loves it and I ordered it at the temperature the chef recommended - Medium.  Typically I order my steak Medium-Rare but I went with their recommendation.  AWFUL. It tasted like well done skirt steak.  It was so tough by the end of the meal my jaw was sore from all the chewing. It is very dark, loud, and close quarters to the other guests.  The darkness didn't bother me so much but all the tables are within an arms reach of another so you can hear your neighbors conversations loud and clear.  I didn't mind this so much, but its good for you to know ahead of time.  Maybe during the weekday as opposed to a friday night would be better. Lastly the service was terrible.  It took 15-20 minutes to order after we sat down, the server never checked on us once, and another 15-20 minute wait to get our check after we were done.  Clearly it wasn't my favorite place.

Great place! Came here to celebrate my dads birthday with 7other people on a Sunday afternoon. We got seated right away. we all tried different shared plates and they were all amazing. The empandas were great, my fav was chicken. You can't beat the prices! My husband and my shared plate was 40 bucks!!!! We all were stuffed and still had food lefts over to take home. We had not problems street par king either.

My best friend and I, who enjoy trying new trendy places, arrived at Tango Sur for late dinner after we both got out of work about 9 pm. We walked up on the outdoor patio open with a guitarist performing and acoustic session. We were sat right away on the patio and we brought our own bottle of wine (if you are in need of another bottle there's a Jewel about a block away).  We always share so we get our top choices from the menu. Our waiter, Saul, was well informed on the menu and gave us some great suggestions. We took his advice on our appetizer and entrees. We had two different types of empanadas which came with an awesome chimichuri sauce! For dinner we had the El Filet and Bife Vesuvio. Both entrees came with salads and we had plenty to share!  Of the two entrees the filet was my favorite. The filet was PERFECTLY cooked (medium) and the spinach mashed potatoes were fantastic!! As dinner came to an end and the restaurant came a close at 11, we were encouraged to take our time finishing dinner and offered dessert and espresso!  Overall the experience was more than I could have asked for. Definitely one of my new favorite Lakeview culinary detonations!!

I'm giving Tango Sur two stars: One for my experience on Saturday night (I can't give it less, though I'd like to) and one for the benefit of the doubt because I never actually got to eat here. However. Pretty much the ONLY reason to wait more than two hours for a meal is if you are in a refugee camp.  I'm convinced that people are so enthusiastic about this place because they are suffering from Stockholm Syndrome. After hours of waiting -- hungry, cold -- at the mercy of the snoot-tastic maître de, one surely begins to "express empathy and have positive feelings towards their captors, sometimes to the point of defending them."  I couldn't have said it better myself, Wikipedia. And it's cheap, you say? Well, we put down about $50 for appetizers at Deelice and went through 5 bottles of wine, a few pints of beer, and some whiskey during our three hour wait. (Which was spent at a number of bars up and down Southport, because naturally there was no room at Lame-o Sur itself.) How much did YOU spend during YOUR wait?? By about 10:30pm, my group had only made it as far as the tiny, dark, cramped, weird backroom. Where I finally cracked and decided "F*ck it, I'm going to McDonald's." And I tangoed on out of there. Naturally, my friends were seated exactly three minutes after I left.  But I don't regret leaving at all.
One of my favorite places in Chicago. Great food, great prices and BYOB.

Love this place. Try the empanadas, chimichuri sauce and the Filet Mignon with Spinach potatoes. Amazing. This place is BYOB, how can you go wrong with it? If like me you like dessert try the Flan. I'm not even a fan of Flan but this is one not to be missed. Enjoy.

My friends made reservations at 7pm for 6 people.  I got there at 7 and my friends were on their way by foot about a block away.  The doorman, "Rodrigo", asked if I had reservations.  I said yes at 7 o'clock and I gave him the name.  He says, No, you're not on the list and dismissed me.  I gave the name again and he repeated no.  I called my friend and asked what name the reservation was under and I gave the wrong name.  Ok!  So, I tell him the correct name and he says, Yes skeptically and told me I would have to wait outside until they arrived.  Now, its frickin freezing outside and I know they have a waiting room in the back.  He then tells me to go to a bar or something until everyone is here.  What?!  I asked him can I wait inside until they come.  He gives me this look.  I asked him what his name was and then he asks is there a complaint?  I told him I don't have a complaint yet - but I do. By now, I'm pissed because I'm getting hassled when I'm the one with the reservation.  He didn't direct me to the back room so I'm standing there and then the other host guy comes and asks me did I have a reservation.  Again, I said yes and  then he gives me a hard time.  Finally, he says you can wait in the back until your party arrives.  DUH asshole, that's what you should have said to me in the beginning instead of having Rodrigo direct people back into the cold or go to a bar.  Finally, my friends get there within 5 minutes.  I grab my friend who had the reservation and I go to the host guy and tell/show him that INDEED I had a reservation and this is the person that made it.  Oh, I failed to mention that he told me that I was on some waiting list, when in fact we were NOT and it was CONFIRMED earlier!   Where's the apology?  NADA!  I asked him who the manager was because at this point no one should be treated this way and if there is any confusion, it should be his professional duty to clarify things and offer an apology for any confusion whether it is my or his fault.  NOTHING! So, we get through dinner and we're ready to go.  i asked our server who the manager was and he tells me its some guy with a pony tail?  What?  So, I find pony tail and tell him the situation and wanted an apology.  While he's half listening to me he offers a card and if I come in again, he'll take care of me.  I don't want that!  I want host guy to apologize.  So, pony tail goes over to host guy and they talk.  Pony tail tells me that he is not going to apologize.  I said, so this is how you treat your customers and you support his poor hosting abilities?  I was steamed.  I may be overreacting just a little but I do know that I will not be going back and I WILL get an apology because I will not put up with poor behavior and be dismissed as if I was a bum off the street.   Food was good.  Dessert was dry.

Tang Sur.... mmmmmm.... You'll never leave me, will you.... Wonderful empanada's and steak.  Ohhh the steak.  I was drunk on beef. Nay, crunk on beef! Truly a magical experience.  Vacio - Dios mio!  Very romantic vibe - not that I care one way or another.  Make reservations cause the place gets packed.   One thing that I might add as a warning is:  The steaks and empanadas were simply heavenly but don't go in there thinking "Oh hmmm I've decided to be NUTRITIONALLY CONSCIOUS all of a sudden."  A man I was sitting nearby at another table was griping about how it wasn't as lean as he wanted it.  We were both eating the Vacio.  The Vacio was my best friend in that moment and I felt defensive.  I wanted to tell him:  dude you're at a steakhouse where the steaks are dripping in oil.  If you want lean eat chicken or turkey alone at home.  You know what you signed up for. This place is very reasonably priced in my opinion considering the portions of food provided.  I'm sure this restaurant can't exactly afford to hire butchers or nutritionalists to wait your table and give you the actual lean ratio or the amount of fat that is going to be in the steak your eating.  They're hiring people of Hispanic heritage (probably Mexican) and that's the prerequisite.  If you ask your waiter "what is the leanest you have?"  He'll tell you.  He isn't going to give you lab analysis.  He's a waiter who is clearly not a master of the english language let alone the cows origins and exercise regiment.  He's supposed to know what tastes good and he does that very well.   Bottom line:  If you want great steak and empanadas with a great atmosphere and par service eat at Tango Sur.  Wasn't pricey either. P.S:  I normally don't mess with empanadas but these were like no other empanadas I've ever had before.  GET THEM!!!
My favorite restaurant in Chicago.  HUGE portions, BYOB with no corking fee, and the best ribeye i've ever had.

If you have given this place a bad review, there is simply something wrong with you - and I don't even like red meat! After coming here for the first time last year, I consider myself a changed woman. This is the only place that I have EVER (literally, ever) ordered a steak for an entree and the only place where I have shoved so much of said red meat into my belly that I nearly exploded. I consider myself to be among the pickiest of picky eaters and I look for any excuse to return to Tango Sur (so long as I have nothing important to accomplish afterward and can fall into a pleasant meat coma).  Not only is the place affordable and serve amazing, unbelievable, finger-lickin-good food, but it's a BYOB. AS IF IT COULD GET ANY BETTER. And yes, as with all good things there is normally a bit of a wait, so make a reservation for the larger parties and come early or during the week for a date.

HOLD THE PHONE BATMAN. riddle me this - if you're a slick chicagoan lookin' to get in the pants of some naive hotty from podunk, iowa, this is your place. the filet is bloody, you can bring your own wine, they have records on the wall. but after months of serious introspection coupled with a healthy diet of couch sitting and food network television shows, the intelligentsia (me) have started to discover flaws in tango sur's business model.  we had planned on going to the eric copeland show at schubas. however, as a result of THC-induced signifcant short-term memory loss, i forgot to get the tickets and it sold out.  there was barely anybody in there, and still the doorman wouldnt let us in just to check out eric copeland. f'ing lincoln park man. hey eric - PLAY AT ENEMY SOUND NEXT TIME. you're from new york, we know you'd dig it.  so anyway, we said "hey, we're in lincoln park, we might as well get some good food if we're down here. there is that nice little steakhouse place just north of schubas.  its very romantic inside, and you get huge cuts of meat." BULL-HORN NOISE.  server's taking too long because they're smoking cigarettes and having sex in the alley. a confusing menu. prosciutto with artichoke hearts and thousand island dressing? nice try, but i havent smoked THAT much weed.  so we're thinking "ok, the beef will make up for these flaws."  the strip was inconsitently cooked. and you know what? cooking steak with cheese and spinach stuffed inside doesn't work. the spinach ends up tasting all gross with the fat of the cheese.  the filet was well cooked, but not well-seasoned. sorry tango, but i agree with zackharian on this one. give me some salt.   40 minutes later we get the slice of chocolate cake. not fresh. kinda sloppy.  sorry tango, but i'd rather waltz right out of your restaurant.

HOLD THE PHONE BATMAN. riddle me this - if you're a slick chicagoan lookin' to get in the pants of some naive hotty from podunk, iowa, this is your place. the filet is bloody, you can bring your own wine, they have records on the wall. but after months of serious introspection coupled with a healthy diet of couch sitting and food network television shows, the intelligentsia (me) have started to discover flaws in tango sur's business model.  we had planned on going to the eric copeland show at schubas. however, as a result of THC-induced signifcant short-term memory loss, i forgot to get the tickets and it sold out.  there was barely anybody in there, and still the doorman wouldnt let us in just to check out eric copeland. f'ing lincoln park man. hey eric - PLAY AT ENEMY SOUND NEXT TIME. you're from new york, we know you'd dig it.  so anyway, we said "hey, we're in lincoln park, we might as well get some good food if we're down here. there is that nice little steakhouse place just north of schubas.  its very romantic inside, and you get huge cuts of meat." BULL-HORN NOISE.  server's taking too long because they're smoking cigarettes and having sex in the alley. a confusing menu. prosciutto with artichoke hearts and thousand island dressing? nice try, but i havent smoked THAT much weed.  so we're thinking "ok, the beef will make up for these flaws."  the strip was inconsitently cooked. and you know what? cooking steak with cheese and spinach stuffed inside doesn't work. the spinach ends up tasting all gross with the fat of the cheese.  the filet was well cooked, but not well-seasoned. sorry tango, but i agree with zackharian on this one. give me some salt.   40 minutes later we get the slice of chocolate cake. not fresh. kinda sloppy.  sorry tango, but i'd rather waltz right out of your restaurant.

Oh tango sur I wanted to love you I really did but I was very disappointed. First the service is horrible, we had wait 20 minutes just to see our waiter and second I clearly had a bug in my food some sort of roach looking creature and when I tried to talk to the manager who may have been the rudest man known to earth he could care less and told me that they are clearly popular enough without our business

BYOB and it has amazing food. Every time I travel to Chicago, I try to get into this place if I can since reservations are highly recommended. Be prepared as the interior can be very loud during peak times but I feel the food more than makes up for that. My favorite restaurant in Chicago, especially for the price.

I have been coming here for almost nine years now and it is has routinely been the place to go for a special occasion at a not-so special occasion price.  In college, we came all of the time, often in massive groups.  But since then, the prices have gone up (although they are still quite reasonable), you no longer have the option of Argentine beef (at least I haven't been offered the option in a few years), and the waits have gotten to be prohibitively long, sometimes 3 hours on a Saturday.   I also might add that despite the candlelit tables and dark atmosphere, this is probably not the place for a date night.  The chimmichurri will leave your breath rancid.  You will wait...and wait...and wait for a table.  And then you will wait...and wait...and wait for your meal.  But all of these negatives aside, I have never regretted a single trip to Tango.  I always eat my heart out, I always drink glass after glass of wine, and, most importantly, I always enjoy myself. The meal and experience make all of the quirks of this restaurant worth it.  I have fond memories of this place, and will keep coming back for years to come.
When I have money to spend, I'm here. Amazing filet. Empanadas hit the spot.

The food at Tango Sur is amazing.  I have been told by many people to check it out and I'm so glad I did.  Just like everyone else mentioned - the empanadas are great.  I had the churrasco with that fantastic chimichurri sauce that I couldn't have enough of.  I do agree that the wait time is kind of long, but it was definitely worth the wait.  I cannot wait to go back!

Yummy .. This place is amazing!  Food was great and service was awesome. My boyfriend and I celebrated our one year anniversary here on Monday night and there were a lot of people but we had less then a 5 min wait. I definitely recommend this place. I liked it so much I plan on having my birthday party here in Jan =)   You can also place reservations if you don't like waiting.
Very great tasty steak. Very nice, polite waitersa. The doorman who gets your name is rude, but if you ignore it, the food is worth it.

Last night was my first visit to Tango Sur...and it will also be my last.  Over the years I had heard great things about this place and I was really excited to check it out, but I was completely disappointed in the entire experience.   Dinner was at 8pm for 4 people and right from the beginning things got off to a rocky start.  3 out of the 4 of us were in the entrance way "checking in" while my sister paid for the cab and we were quite rudely pushed outside by the doorman who told us that we would have to wait outside until our full party arrived.  And yes, we had told him that she was 15 feet away paying for the cab.  So there we stood outside on a cold night waiting to be let in to what now seemed more like an exclusive club and not a BYOB restaurant.  In the meantime, another party of two arrived and the "doorman" allowed them to wait in the heated entrance way.  That put me off immediately.   After 5/6 minutes of waiting outside the doorman came out and welcomed us back to the "waiting room" where we would sit for the next 15 minutes.  So now it's about 8:20pm and we are still sitting in this small back cramped "waiting room" without any idea of when we'll be seated.  Next we were sat down at a very cramped table with one small candle.  Nice touch, but in the darkness you couldn't even see the menus.  A look around the room and more than one table was passing around their smart phones to give extra light for their menu reading efforts.  No introduction to the menu was made by our waiter, no description of the special Argentinian steaks was offered and we were left sitting there.  After a few minutes our waiter came back and offered to open the 2 bottles of wine we brought.  My brother ordered a Coke that wouldn't come for a half an hour.  And then the waiter disappeared again.   When the waiter returned we asked for suggestions about appetizers and he halfheartedly gave us confirmation that the two we had initially chosen would indeed be good options.  Thanks.  We had the fried provolone and the empanadas (beef, spinach, and ham) and both actually were great.  We ate the appetizers, but all throughout busboys kept coming by trying to clean our not-yet-finished plates.  "Yes, I am still working on this not even half-eaten appetizer plate thank you." Now it was time to order dinner...and we had some questions.  There are a few different kinds of steaks on the menu so we wanted to know what was the difference between them.  Our waiter immediately took a rude/snobby attitude with us and he sure didn't have any interest in wasting his time answering our questions.  2 of us initially ordered "domestic" meat and 2 of us ordered "Argentinian" meat.  Specifically domestic sirloin, Argentinian filet, Argentinian meat griddle medley, and domestic filet.  Immediately the waiter began to say how the domestic meat was not good at all and both of my dining partners should change their orders to the Argentinian sirloin and filet respectively.  My brother caved and switched to the Argentinian sirloin, but my girlfriend stuck with the domestic filet.  Even after she refused to switch the first time, the waiter tried again to tell her that the domestic meat was not that good and coerce her to change.  I'm being completely serious.  It was a bit ridiculous.   So dinner came and we started eating and of course we now wanted to see what the difference was with the steaks.  While I can admit that myself and the rest of my dining party don't have professional eaters' palettes, I can still tell if a steak is good or not and if it tastes similar to another.  Sure enough, there was no grand difference in the taste between the domestic and Argentinian filets - the only thing different was the price tag.  What a shame.  Additionally, all the meats had been doused in sauces and in my mind the meat's original flavor was truly covered up.  Totally disappointing.   The night wrapped up without anymore issues, but all in all I can honestly say that it was a really disappointing evening.  The waitstaff was rude and the doorman was also rude.  The food wasn't anything to write home about and the table was too dimly lit and extremely cramped.  Absolutely not worth the hype.

This place. is. awesome. I'd heard good things so my expectations were high, and they exceeded my expectations.  The ambiance is just so cute.  Dim lighting, tango music playing, one long candlestick at your table.  Great for a date but definitely also can see it being ok for a group of friends.  Our waiter was awesome and the food was even better.  You could definitely split some of these dishes (especially the filet - there are 2 included), bringing the cost down even more.

i have been visiting Tango Sur for a year now.  My girlfriend and I came here, the first time, for a steak-date and it became an instant favorite. We have sampled much of the menu.  We have never had a bad meal.  The filet, the ribeye, the marinated eggplant and the grilled provolone plate are some of our favorites.  Our unquestioned number one is the filet for two.  For around $30 an enormous filet is presented on a table-top grill.  A portobella mushroom wine/garlic (I think) sauce is bubbling around the outside of the steak.  It is big enough to feed two and enjoy leftovers the next day.  As if that weren't enough, a small house salad is included beforehand.   The service is always at the top of their game.  We've never waited too long for anything.  The wait staff is always polite and prompt.  They do everything that they can to make their guests satisfied.  Since there isn't ever liquor on the bill (being a BYOB joint), I think it's important to remember to tip accordingly.  They deserve it. There is almost always a wait for a table.  Give the gentleman at the door your name and number and he will call you when your table is ready.  Go a few blocks West to a great Irish pub for a beer while you wait or a couple blocks South to a number of other bars (namely a cajun place with a big red sign).  If you haven't tried Tango Sur yet, it's time.  You will be so happy that you did.

I went here with a friend back in September.  We sat outside as it was a nice day.   The empanadas were very good.  I ordered the media pollo al jamon and my friend ordered Bife de Chorizo.  They both had the exact same sauce on them.  My chicken was very dry.  My friend was not thrilled with her steak.   Service was good, but the food was very disappointing.

Tied for 1st as my favorite restaurant in Chicago. I love this place, and it's cheap if you compare it to going out to many other similar places.  The BYOB and affordable entres help keep the tab low, yet, it's hard to find an over all better dining experience in Chicago. The dimly lit, small rooms; all male wait staff; and welcoming ambiance give this place charm.  The long waits (no reservations) during prime hours simply gives my wife, family, friends, and I more time to spend together as we have a pre-dinner cocktail at a local bar--they call your cell when your table is ready, you just trot over. We've also popped a bottle of wine in the waiting room when I took my parents.  We enjoyed good wine and great surroundings as we spent time together waiting for our table. If you've never been, go!!!  Just don't expect a high class experience.  Expect a gem of an establishment tucked away in a great Chicago neighborhood.  Oh yeah, plan your night around this, it's not going to be a quick eat.

I am generally a fan of latin american restaurants.  So, when my foodie friend and I decided to go out, we wanted to go to a place that was new to both of us and has good eats (lots of meat). The is a very intimate, well designed, not loud, great place to eat. Since there were three of us, we started off with the: EMPANADAS Argentine turnover in chicken,spinach & cheese, and corn. Then for the main dish we ordered: Pork Chop, Steak, and grilled Chicken. Everyone loved their food choices thus far!! We really weren't sure on dessert so the waiter brought out a free flan.  I don't like flan so my evening was dessert free.  I was totally ok with that.  However, the other two thought it was delicious!! I would go back and try a few other options!!
Forkin' love the steak here. Byob too!  Fun restaurant for a date, good entertaining atmosphere.

If your looking to experience a different ambiance to eat that is relaxing and enjoyable either as a cute date or with friends this is the place. if you love food and are willing to wait by all mean this place will be well worth it. TIPS: But... you must plan this dinner ahead of time by that I mean a whole day ahead. Parking is ridiculous, we had to park 6 blocks away and that was after an hr of looking for parking, side streets are no help they are permit parking only. AND the wait... The wait was 2 hrs for a party of 6 and that's that we called to check up on our wait, we got "lucky" with that .  FOOD: The "Empanadas De Pollo" are really really good , you must try them if you go and also the "Tortilla De Papa"! For dinner I had "The Fillet" which was ok but the meat was a little dry and to much meat for a girl, best idea would be to split the plate because they give you two pieces.  Happy eating :)

So this place is pretty hyped up, from all of the yelp reviews to the 2 hour wait in the evening. To be honest I'm not sure why this is the case. The ambiance is definitely the winner here, the food was OK, nothing special. The prices weren't bad, and compared to an upscale steakhouse you'll pay half, however the quality of the meat is proportionate to the price... This is a great place for a date, however I don't see myself coming back anytime soon. Next time I want an amazing slab of meat I'll shell out the additional dough for capital grille...
Food is above average especially the steaks. Problems occur when dealing with the service and wait times. Worth a try

i don't like to waste the reader time..... all what you have to know that their steak with spinach and cheese is the best nation wide I went many places in California and east cost.......I think that u r missing a lot by not try it even for once ;) ask for beef vesuvio with garlic oil.....hmmmmmmm

I came here for the first time on my birthday this year. I listened to my friends recommendations and made the reservation for myself and company I had in town- all of whom are from Missouri and Kansas-aka tough meat critics. I can honestly say we all loved this place! Sure it was crowded on a Sat night, but let's be honest you can't trust a restaurant that is empty...  A few of our favorites were the grilled half chicken, strip steak and sirloin steak. All of which were amazing- so flavorful and tender! Not to mention this is a BYOB so you can make sure your favorite bottle of wine will always be there. This ia a wonderful place to entertain a group or go on a date.  This is one of my new favorites for sure!

Ate here for a surprise Birthday party. The place is super busy, so the table that we had booked was under threat for most of the night as there was supposed to be 11 of us, ended up at only 8. We had been told to be there for before 7pm and that we'd have to be gone by 9pm. Given the service in this place there was little chance that we'd have been gone by 9pm! The place is pretty cramped in that tables are just far too close to one another. The empanadas were amazing, especially the spinach one. They certainly curbed our hunger while we waited for a very long time for our mains. We waited far too long for these that it almost felt as though we should have been leaving. The steak did not disappoint however, and the servings are really big but I found the lighting a little too dark. I like to trim the fat off my meat and so had problems seeing it. It's BYOB which is good, it helps keep the cost down.  We didn't have dessert as we were being ushered out by 10pm, which was fine. We were supposed to be gone by 9 as I've already mentioned but that would have been impossible. There is only one toilet in the restaurant which I thought was a bit ridiculous, the place was so busy that it really calls for another. The queue for it was quite long too that when people left our table to go they were gone for quite some time.  I wouldn't be rushing back here, the staff aren't too attentive and so it was hard to get their attention. Saturday nights are clearly very busy so if you are going I would recommend booking as at 6:30 there was a queue outside where people were being told they'd have to wait for over an hour for a table for two.

The food was about what I expected, great big hunks of meat. Yum. Most of it was pretty good, but then, if you start with good meat, it's hard to mess it up. Some of the beef at our table looked over-cooked, but then, it's hard to tell in the candellight. The appetizers we had were also OK, although nothing really stood out. I can't believe they sell a bowl of melted cheese and call it an appetizer. What I did not like here was the service and atmosphere. They have jam-packed so many tables and people in that I felt like I couldn't breathe. When I went to the bathroom, I had to take baby steps and say "excuse me" to about 15 other people due to the crowds. The servers were really rude. My chair/elbow/head was bumped into several times and no one apologized. I tried to scoot my chair in but it wouldn't budge due to the positioning of the table. I'm not a large person and I wasn't hanging out in the walk-way, but I just kept getting knocked around, so ended up crouching and leaning over the table for the rest of the night. In addition, the servers did something that really annoys me, which is agressively bus plates that they think are empty. I was asked 4 different times if I was done with my salad, and my fork was still in my hand! My dinner plate was taken from me without even being asked, and I was definitely not done with that. Tasty meat is no excuse for the service. I'm never going back.
I've now been back 3 more times, and not had a single bad experience.  The prices, the service, and most importantly, the food, is amazing.

I was taken here for my birthday dinner on our trip to Chicago. It was delicious. However - those empanadas in that picture look like they are enormous, they are in reality little two bit suckers, don't be fooled! Anyway, skip the appetizers and go straight for the beef. Holy hell was this a lot of food.. and DELICIOUS food. My only complaint is that everything was sooooo oily.  Try it though, you will not be disapoitned!

I loooove Tango Sur! The byob factor and the food are great! The only issue is the wait!  Me and my friends come here and always have a reservation.  We always still end up having to wait 30 mins-an hour when we have a reservation, which gets annoying! But the food is worth it!!
By far the BEST steak I have ever had in Chicago. Steaks were perfectly cooked and the dipping sauce it comes with is the deal breaker! Had to wait an hour and half but was worth it!

The best part were the empanadas and that its byob.   i ordered the $25 bife vesuvio and it was an overcooked piece of meat drenched in sauce.   we waited 2 hours for the worst steak i've ever paid for.    there is no way i would recommend this place to anyone.

I made my husband take me here last weekend on a Sunday night since we were going to see his friend's band play at the Elbo Room and its pretty close (not walking distance mind you, but only a short 5 minute drive).  We got there around 7:45pm and were concerned about finding parking in the area. There is no parking lots in the area so you're left to find street parking in the surrounding neighborhood. Fortunately, we found something at the next block.  We put our name in and the host informed us it would be a 30 minute wait. We could leave a cell phone with him and he'd call us or we could wait on the bench outside. Since it was fairly nice outside, we chose to wait. 30 minutes wait doesn't really seem so bad considering stories of people having to wait to 2 hours to get in.  Beware if you are a "party of 2". This is a very popular date place and there are lots of "party of 2's" Since this place is very small, they do not have very many tables for just 2 people so you will have to wait for a table of 4 to open up. And they do not take reservations for any party under 6 so keep than in mind as well. You will most likely have at least 3 or more "party of 2's" waiting ahead of you. Be prepared for Tango Sur first timers to pull the old "but I'm leaving for Iraq tomorrow", "its my girlfriend's birthday today", "we are celebrating an anniversary", "we called earlier and were told we could get in right away" type of utter BS that people pull to get the host to bump them up in the queue.  We were seated at around 8:45 pm and by this time were really starving. It would really be nice if the restaurant perhaps offered bread or even chips to patrons waiting. It certainly  would not cost them a whole bunch and might soften the blow of having to wait so long.  Our server gave me a visual hello to let me know he saw us sit down but it seemed like a good 10 minutes passed before someone came over to cork our bottle of wine and get our order. We were sat at a table meant for 4 people dead center in the middle of the dining room. Tables are spaced very very close together. You really feel like you are on top of everyone. Since this place is so popular, I'm sure they want to squeeze as many tables in as they can, but honestly, they could do with removing some of the tables and just having people suck it up and wait longer.  As others have mentioned, there is no cork fee so bring yer own. Be forewarned though that they do not leave the cork with you so if you are not planned to drink it all, you might not be able to take your remaining wine with you when you leave. I drank all but a half glass so I have no idea if I could have taken the remaining bottle or not. Bring your own cork or wine stopper with you if you foresee this happening.  As to the ambience of the place, its very nice but with that many people in tight quarters, it can get a bit loud. The music is played at a reasonable level and the tables are all candle lit and the lights are down fairly low. I guess if you like that sort of thing, but honestly, I would rather see my food a bit better. I'm a bit of a picky eater, see, and I'd like to see what's on my plate a bit better.  The bread was pretty standard. The butter at the table, to my chagrin, was not whipped butter but just regular butter packets that they bought in bulk. The problem with this is the butter packets tend to be a little hard and not easy to spread. But seeing as they were sat close to the candle, they were a bit softer. Still, nice whipped butter would bring it up a bit.  My husband and I got the Provoleta appetizer which was delicious but definately a lot of cheese to eat for 2 people especially if you are also eating bread, drinking wine and having salads and your entree.  It took quite a long time to receive our salads, which was questionable considering its really nothing more than some leaf lettuce, tomato slices and some red onion with oil on a plate. Not really a "salad" in my book. I ended up giving the husband the majority of what was on my plate.  My husband ordered the Pez which was fish and potatos. And I ordered the Vacio which was flat steak and potatos. The Vacio comes with sweet potatos but if you prefer mashed, they will get that for you instead. The Vacio is meant for 2 people but since I like my meat and want left overs (which was enough for 2 more meals). The serving of meat was huge; definately much more than 2 peoples worth (unless those 2 people are really big eaters). Three people could easily have enough of meat but the potato portions might be slim. It was blood red rare just as I like it. Chimichurri sauce was abundant and I ordered extra to take with me.  Our total plus tip was around $90, which is pretty steep. But I got 2 more meals out of it so its not that bad. Go here for the food, but suggest going on a week night to save yourself the wait.

I love everything about Tango Sur....the food amazing, byob great, dark lighting sexy and friendly and attentive staff makes it perfect for me!!! Only thing I will say is the wait can get kinda long on the weekends and they don't take reservations, they do take your number and call you when a table is ready.  I usually end up waiting at a near by bar and getting kinda buzzed since I have an empty stomach.  So my suggestion would be to go on a weekday....I've been seated right away on a Monday or Tuesday night.  Enjoy!

I have been dining at Tango Sur for 10 years.  I just had a terrible experience there and will not ever be returning, which is sad given my history with this place.  I have experienced spotty food and the service in the past, but tonight just put me over the edge.  Our waiter was a space cadet and borderline rude.  I received the wrong entree.  Plus, my entree was raw on one part of it (really wierd) and hopefully will not be getting me sick after eating a couple bites of it. My husband received a steak that only my dog could have loved.  It was a tough, chewy steak that was of poor quality that had been cooked inappropriately and was $25.  We told management and while they did offer to give us something else, I had zero confidence in anything else.  There must be a new cook (chef is way too kind) and different cuts of meat being offered.  Pathetic.

Being a steak fanatic,  I have to say, this is one of the best places to get Steak in Chicago.  The prices are REASONABLE for the amount of meat one gets.  I would highly recommend taking any Texans here.    I've never had such delicious steak since I was in venezuela as a pup.   This place seriously went to one of my top 5 best places in chicago.  I pretty much bring anyone that comes to visit to this place, as its one of the finest places to eat.  Its quite dark and romantic, (seeing their italian is embedded in argentinian culture)  The place is always packed, and you should expect to wait even if you did make a reservation.   The plate for two really will stuff 2 people to death.  This is highly recommended!

If you're a meat and potatoes type of person, you must try the Churrasco.  This place offers a great cut of meat and the chimichurri is such a great compliment to the steak.  The potatoes are so delicious. The dining area offers a great date setting and BYOB is a plus. Be sure to make a reservation on the weekend or be prepared to wait up to an hour.

I am writing this review on the service ONLY. This is my first yelp review, and I wish it could be under happier circumstances.  My girlfriend and I, having moved to the Southport Corridor area a few months ago, have been excited to try out Tango Sur for a long time, and finally decided to indulge for a nice date Saturday night. I had read reviews and new to expect a long wait. We got there at 8:30, gave our names, and were told it could be up to an hour and half. No problem, we just went to a bar down the street, had a few drinks, stopped at Jewel for a bottle of wine to have with dinner, and then wandered back to Tango Sur at 10:00 to wait to be called. After 10:15 rolled by, my girlfriend decided to ask the host how many people were in front of us, just to get an idea. The host couldn't find our names until he pulled a list out of a cabinet, after which he assured us there were only four tables in front of us. At this point it seemed like we had been forgotten, but it didn't really matter. Like I said we were expecting a decent wait. Maybe ten minutes later we were led back to the waiting room where we could open our bottle of wine while we were on deck for a table. After that point, we watched seven (count em, seven) tables get called. The clock was getting awfully close to 11:00. Finally, we asked the host once again where we were on his list. He pulled out the list, found his spot, and then flipped back through three pages of names to find our name way higher on the list. At this point, we had clearly been forgotten about again, but he assured us we were next. However, merely five minutes later, he comes back into the room, and calls another name. Before he could leave the room, I quickly (yet politely) asked why we weren't next, and he quickly changed the name and said "oh right, you guys are up." Here's where it gets really good. I was slightly frustrated at this point (it was now 11:15, a full two hours and 45 minutes after their 1 1/2 hour TOPS quote) but just kind of wanted to make a point, so I asked him if he had forgotten about us or something. To which he replied "whatever" turned around and walked away.  Needless to say, both my girlfriend and I were both pretty upset with this treatment. However, after we sat down, we decided to let it go, and enjoy the night, rather than taking it out on our servers (we have both worked at restaurants and know how it goes) over one employee with an attitude. Unfortunately, things kept going downhill. We ordered two empanadas, on recommendation from the waiter, and were brought the entirely wrong selections. At this point, we felt we had to say something, and asked to speak to a manager.  Lo and behold, the unruly host approaches our table. I started to explain the situation before I realized in the dim lighting that it was the same person I was complaining about, at which point I asked again to speak to a manager, and here's the biggest thing...he WAS the manager!! I was shocked, and told him so, that a MANAGER at a reputable place like Tango Sur, could look at a guest, after skipping him and forgetting him for over two and half hours (which he admitted to) and say "Whatever," and walk away (which he also admitted to doing). He apologized once or twice, and then just started to walk away, nothing done! I had to call him back to ask if he was going to do anything to fix it, at which point he told us he "guessed he could get us some complimentary desserts after the meal." Fine. We just wanted to have a nice date, so we said OK, and ate our meal (which was delicious, but besides the point). Finally, the waiter came to clear our plates and we told him the manager had said we could enjoy some complimentary desserts. The waiter said OK, but instead of returning with a menu, came back with one piece of flan. And our bill. Regardless of the fact that my girlfriend doesn't even like flan, I think this is well beyond an unacceptable way to make up for the MANAGER of a restaurant treating us like that (a dessert each of our own choice would have been the BARE MINIMUM, in my eyes). Knowing I wouldn't get any farther with that manager, we left, angry and disappointed. I have been trying to get in touch with a general manager or owner since then in order to better resolve this, and my phone calls and e-mails have all gone unanswered. I will keep trying to contact someone in hopes that this will be made right, as the food was delicious and I am dying to love this restaurant, but right now my blood boils every time I think of the place.
This will be my shortest review ever. BYOB, great meat, great service and above all, great price. If you haven't tried this place, give it a try today!
Aawesome food awesome service definitely will be back. Also great place to take a date... BYOB Rocks!

I actually lived in Argentina for a while, and was craving a little taste of home... so! I decided to try out this Argentine place.  It definitely reminded me of Buenos Aires.  The empanadas are highly recommendable, especially the corn.  I love me a jumita empanada and this was just right.   The bife de chorizo was ginormous.  I went with a teenage boy, and he wasn't able to eat it all.  That is saying something.  The meat is actually from Argentina and therefore is grass-fed and just tastes different.  Like it should.  I don't eat meat except for very rare occasions, and this was worth it. Afterwards we ordered the alfajores with dulce de leche.  Truly authentic wonderment of the mouth.  Yumz.  BYO. Come here.  Split entrees.  Feel like you're in BA, and go for a little tango afterwards.

I LOVE this restaurant. First, the food is FANTASTIC.  I had a serving friend of mine recommend it, and he was totally right.  One of the best meals I've ever had (and for a great price).  Second, it's BYOB with NO corkage fee!  How awesome is that?  You can pick your own bottle of wine to pair with dinner AND it's easy on the wallet. I've now been there twice and my personal favorites are the Vacio and the Lomo.  BE CAREFUL - though the prices at first may be a little high, you get a TON of food!  I was expecting the Lomo to be one little filet, but it was TWO.  I couldn't even finish the other one.  When we ordered the Vacio the second time, we shared that, the Para Dos (sausages and flank steak combo), and two appetizers, and it was plenty of food.  I highly recommend ordering a stead with the chimichurri sauce.  It is so tasty! The ambiance is very romantic - all candle lit with dark walls, nice decor, and close-together tables.  I like that the music stays with the latin theme and isn't too loud - great for dates. The service is great and prompt.  I recommend dining there EARLY - they do not take reservations, so it tends to fill up fast.   I'm absolutely going to go again.

I'm not sure what Tango Sur these other reviewers have been to. It took 20 minutes before a waiter even stopped by our table. It took a full hour before our appetizers got there. The empanadas weren't bad. I would prefer McDonalds to everything else. The "salad" was two slices of tomato, three rings of onion and maybe a leaf of lettuce. The Vacio was a chewy slab of garbage.  Take your business anywhere else. I don't think I've ever been so disappointed at such a busy restaurant.

I haven't been here in years, but I do want to pay tribute. It's a really good deal. Great prices for quality meat, meat, and more tasty meat. I don't drink, but my friends like BYOB. Dimly lit place, very cute and cozy, definitely a great place to bring visiting friends or a date!

The potato & egg appetizer was execellent and almost as good a Cuban grandma :)  We didn't need the empanadas.  The rib eye steak was fabulous.  Only down side - no substituions.  I wanted all veggies instead of potatos (which was delicious) so I ordered a side of excellent veggies.  Very busy for a Tuesday night.  Tables are a little close together so don't expect a private conversation.

I went back and had the eggplant entree (kind of like eggplant lasagna for lack of a better description). The sauce tasted a lot like vodka sauce and I ate the whole thing in about 2minutes. The birthday girl was kind enough to share her flan and it is even better than I remembered. Magical, even.

Amazing. The most romantic restaurant I've ever been too. Went there on a first date and when we came back it was just as amazing. First- it's BYOB- no cork fee, which is surprising because it's a high end place. Second all the food is impressive, empanadas are a must, steak was perfect, mashed potatoes mind blowing. Last time we were there they gave us a dessert for free, for no reason. Oh and it's only candle light, just like the movies when the fast forward to the end where of the date where the candle has melted to nothing- great place to impress a girl :)

On a corridor that severely lacks any other worthwhile food establishments, Tango Sur really stands out. The wait can be a bit long, but, the host takes your phone number so you can belly up to a local bar. BYOB is a huge plus and keeps the bill reasonable. The food is the star. The beef is unreal delicious and the two preparations I've had have both been amazing. The empanadas appetizer are a must as well. If you're in Wrigleyville and want an upscale meal, this is your place.

Last night: Monday night. Four of us at 5pm. Outside seating, inside big with two separate diniing rooms. Very nice decor, bit romantic, candles, nice tango slow music. The two men ordered the beef steak and ribeye at $19 and $24. The women: salmon $24 pork chops $25. No corkage fee. Big portions, mashed potatoes were eh. All entrees came with salad (romaine, red onion, tomato) but only dressing they have was oil and vinegar.  Warm bread at table too- HEY!! its all about the free bread to some people!  Everything else was VERY tasty. Waiter was great except our busboy was better. He kept cheking on us and opening our beers/wine bottles. Think its time for them to promote him. If they are reading: his name was Sandro. Plenty of meter pay parking. Desserts were all great, especially the Dulce de Leche cheescake and at $5 each. Bill was $135. Forgot, each of 5 empanadas were ordered too and they were all very good.  Will definitely come back.  I think I invited my friend to go to NY that night - always do that, too much wine. Woke up and said...CRRRAAAAPPPP!!!!!

Went there for the first time Sunday October 9th. The place was hopping. It was the day of the Chicago marathon, and the weather was awesome. We had a party of four. We waited a few minutes and we were sat.  The place is byob and does not charge a corkage fee, nice! I ended up having the Argentinian BBQ. Four different types of meats. Served on a little grill type trail. It was awesome. I was not a b ig fan of the black sausage. It wasn't my taste. The steak and smaller sausage were wonderful. The sweetbreads were unreal!  I was hesitant at first but wow! My wife and daughter split the el filet. Great price for a big portion of perfectly cooked filet.  The waiter was very helpful and patient, as it took us some time to decided. I had actually ordered something else and when I saw the BBQ come out at the next table I asked if I could switch. He ran to the kitchen, asked the chef, and returned to tell me it was no trouble.  Ask for extra chimichura sauce. Use it in any of the meats, awfully good.  We did not try the deserts We will return. This was a grt experience! Mucho gracias!

After hearing multiple people rave about this restaurant and reading the amazing reviews about Tango Sur, I was dying to get there and see for myself.  Two words capture my experience: EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED.   Luckily, I was there at 6:00 pm on a Sunday and was seated right away.  The waiter immediately seemed quite confused.  He kept stopping by the table and promising to open my wine, bring glasses, etc., but didn't.  It took him probably 15 minutes to open my wine and bring two glasses.  Even the host/manager stopped by and promised glasses, but didn't deliver.  By the time he was ready to take our order, I had already consumed an entire mini loaf of bread and had scoured the huge menu thoroughly.  The bread was delicious-- probably the best part of the meal. Upon reviewers' suggestions, I tried both the spinach and the corn empanadas.  They were good, but not great. The 5411 Empanada food truck makes Tango Sur's taste like a hot pocket.   45 minutes after ordering, our meal finally arrives.  My guest and I split the El Filet and the ribeye.  On the plus side, the spinach mashed potatoes were pretty good.  The plain mashed potatoes were ok--they tasted like a huge lump of butter with a potato in it.  The steaks?  AWFUL.  Both of them were so full of gristle that they were nearly impossible to eat.  The meat quality was terrible, more like grade C or D.  I could have purchased a better quality steak at Aldi for an eighth of the price.  The wonderful beef flavor was missing--all of the flavor came from the sauce they covered it in.  I picked around at my steak, trying desperately to cut out the fat and finally gave up.   We had to ask for the check twice, and thankfully could pay in cash.  I see why there is always such a wait--dinner for two took nearly two hours, most of it sitting and waiting. I'm not sure why everyone thinks this place is so cheap--maybe because the bill is missing the huge alcohol portion?  The steaks were $25-$35.  For a few bucks more, you could have a melt-in-your-mouth, non-gristly ribeye at Shula's.  And they take reservations.  Sorry Tango Sur, I was excited to add another delicious and fun restaurant to my list of favorite restaurants, but sadly, you are neither.  I will not be patronizing your restaurant again.

How have I not written a review for Tango Sur yet?? I've been here about a million times, and it's by far my favorite steak place. Sure I could say Morton's or Ruth Chris or some other renowned steak house in Chicago... but Tango Sur is different. First of all, it's BYOB, and secondly it's Argentinian (not to be confused with Brazilian). They don't take reservations for parties of 6 or less, but they will take your phone number and you can grab a drink down the street while you wait (yes, I have waited up to 2 hours for a table!) You just have to go early, like before 6, if you don't want to wait.  I always get the same thing... the Vacio for 2, so I always end up having to convince one of my dining companions that there's nothing else on the menu I could possibly comprehend eating and they must share with me! I think I tried one other thing before and didn't love it, so I keep going back to the Vacio. It's filled with with olive oil, garlic, parsley sauce and served with sweet potatoes that soak up all the delicious juices, and their chimichurri sauce is to die. Their empanadas are also amazing, and can be purchased at the bodega next door any time.  Now that I'm not living in Chicago anymore, it will be one of the places on my list every time I go back because nothing compares!
