What a disappointment.  We wanted to love this place, but from start to finish, it just didn't live up to the hype.   Our first concern came when my partner put our name in while I parked the car.  We were told 20-30 minutes; however, if we wanted an outside table it "could be 2 hours or more".  Really?  And who is going to fill those tables?  No one had arrived yet, and when I called to get a reservation earlier in the evening, he said it was "first come first serve".  So, what's the story?  So...we stand outside for 15 minutes or so with no one around and then all of a sudden a man and woman come up to the host and say "two".  He says "inside or out?" and then ushers them to a prime table right outside.  Are you kidding me?!  So, I approach him and say, "excuse me, but we have been waiting and these people were just seated in front of us".  He interrupts me to say, "they came an hour ago".  You gotta be kidding me.  Not a minute after, he says to us, "this way", and proceeds to usher us to this table at the end of the outdoor area in front of a 7-eleven type store that lights up the tables in this area in a trashy sort of way.  So much for a romantic outside table.   So, we think...we're out of the woods.  Not so.  We sit for another 10 minutes, watching everyone around us who comes after us get served before our waiter finally comes up after 15 minutes.  That would be the 1st of 4 times the entire 2 1/2 hour meal that we see him.  So, we order...and wait. 20 minutes later, our appetizer arrives. The empanadas were decent, although nothing amazing.  The salad arrives 20 minutes later (consisting of plain salad with two tomatoes and two onions on top - vinegar and oil containers, should you want dressing).  So, we finish this and wait.  And wait.  And wait.  And wait some more.  After about an hour (and one trip by him to say, "food should be here shortly"), our food arrives.  The steaks/grill, although it did have some flavor, was WAY overcooked on the grill, and the meat, as a whole, was extremely grizzly and hard to chew.  What a disappointment.  For a place that specializes in steaks, this place was a huge let-down.   After sitting another 45 minutes with no return of our waiter, I finally had to go find him inside the restaurant to let him know we were ready to leave.  What a joke.   While the prices weren't terrible for a steakhouse, what difference does it make when the food is disappointing and the service is terrible?  We won't be returning to this place.  If you decide to try this place (as we had been excited to do), be warned.  You're unlikely to have this raving experience people have been reporting on here (and I really wanted to like this place and the atmosphere - however, there are plenty of other places that can live up to the hype).  My advice, avoid this pretentious place and eat at one of the other restaurants along this strip.  You will never miss it.

Although this is the same as folklore, I absolutely prefer dining here. I still get the same thing every time, the filet with spinach mashed potatoes, it's just so good I can't stray! my boyfriend also loves the beef vesuvio every time. Call it predictable, but we say it's delicious. The great thing about tango sur is that it is byob, and when there is a  wait, they have a great waiting room with wine glasses to begin enjoying your wine. Something about this restaurant lends itself to the most intimate and amazing dates.  Since my move to chicago a year and a half ago, this remains my favorite restaurant.

Here's what I had: Spinach & Cheese Empanada (B+) $2 Medio Pollo al Limon - Half Chicken  (A-) $15 The atmosphere is terrific, the prices are appropriate for the food, and the food is very good. It is BYOB; I was not charged a corking fee. It was a slow Monday night and the waiting staff was super friendly and efficient.  The area is very chill with other neighboring restaurants, shops, and movie theatres. I sat at in the patio area which is nice and has heaters available for chilly nights.  Really good experience.
Great food. Worth the wait. No wonder Argentineans take pride on their meat.

Hidden gem, for a sexy night! Priced just right- the food was so good! Wound up here one Tuesday night- skeptical of the BYOB and live music!  This place is not stuffy or pretentious at all. The ambiance was so perfect- Steamy! I always pick where we go for dinner, but this time I decided to fall back and let my date pick...We did have a reservation, but still hd to wait 15 minutes o_O. The place as jam packed! To me that's a good sign of GOOD food!  On the night I went it was raining outside, there was someone playing a Spanish guitar- playing amazing music- dinner was by candlelight...We sat right in the window- watching the rain fall, giggling from all the wine we injested and becoming hypnotized by the rifts escaping from the Spanish guitar.  The food was so good! I had steak stuffed with cheese and spinach- with halves of sliced potato's... sooooooo good... Don't recall what my date had- we sampled some sort of tuna appetizer- the bread was too hard, but other than that it was good. There was a birthday dinner going on- there were seriously 20 or more people at this one long table on the side together- they were BEYOND loud, drunk, and obnoxious! I was having such a good time with my date- I didn't even mind! We started whooping it up with them too! I usually don't hit many $$ price point spots for dinner dates- but this place, that my date picked out was the exception! I had a ball- I'm def going back- hopefully on another rainy night!  A relaxing dinner with, hearty comfort food! Winning!    2 steak dinners, one appetizer and 3 bottles of wine (BYOB): $70 plus tip...A good ole time!  Go check it out :)
Worth every minute having to wait! Phenomenal steaks! Great prices! Best deal in town.

So much in doubt if i should give this place all 5 stars. There is really no reason not to as this was a SUPER experience. The food was so good - and by 'food' i mean the Steaks. Don't come there for the appetizers, the bread, the fancy servers / service or the interior but please go there for the steaks! On a Friday at 6.30 we (2 people) walked right in for a great experience! We might have been the last to make it before the line started forming outside - and when we left there was a huge line - so be prepared. I can 100% recommend this place for the food (seriously, the stakes are up there with Gibson's - which in my book is all you can ask for), but do me a favor and use this BYOB to bring a good bottle of wine (feel free to ask the dealer if you don't have a clue) - it makes me sad when the people next to me had Light beer with that meal...

I don't think there are words. I'm still stunned. Argentinean steakhouse. Always crowded with people lined up outside trying to get in.  Worst parking ever, and there is no valet. But they tell you to use next door's valet service.  Inside is super dark and loud.  Friendly service (with the exception of the manager/owner). Salad is not impressive. Very simple. Main course:  Parillada Para uno/Para dos: Heaven is really a place on earth.  Steaks are huge, chicken dishes the size of your head...it is a must go. BYOB...how much better can it get?? And the cost is super reasonable: $22 for the Para Uno.  The only downside is that if you bring in your own cake (as my friend did for her husband's birthday, they charge you $1.75 per person to serve it). So why five stars? Because the meat is just out of this world.

i decided to spend my birthday here with my bf, early dinner to avoid waiting, and it was a great idea. 5:15 on a thursday night is when you wanna come here. no wait.   we started off with the ham and cheese empanada, effing tasty. spinach and cheese, is far out tasty as well.  we decided to go with the para dos, because of the variety of meats to try. while we waited, we sipped our bubbly, and watched the table of guys next to us, cut into their big juicy steaks. yep, salivating does occur. when our meat did arrive, it looked glorious. i ordered the meat to my liking which is medium rare, and i will be honest. it was a little rarer than i'd like it to be, so next time i'll have to be specific. but i still did enjoy every bite. the fried sweetbreads were heavenly. black sausage i could do without, or maybe i just needed it wrapped in a bun for me to be able to eat. but it was the flap meat and short ribs that stole the show. god, i'm totally salivating as i think about it.  and for dessert, they all looked good, but we went with the vanilla cake with dulce de leche and coconut. so tasty.  a trip to tango sur is definitely in my near future again.

My fiance kept hyping up this place..and it def delivered.  I'm one of the very few non-vegetarians in this world that does not like steak, but this place is SO good.  For appetizers , I liked to provoletta much more than the empanadas..as it was your run of the mill empanada. Our table had the rib-eye, para uno, filet mignon and the strip steak.  I'd say I liked the rib-eye the most however the fiance loved his para uno but I don't like sweet bread.

My roommates and I finally went here after three years of wanting to try it.  Based on other reviews, I was expecting delicious unicorn meat with rainbows shooting out of it, and I was slightly disappointed.  Don't get me wrong, everything was quite tasty and came out much faster than I expected, but I was expecting fireworks and got sparklers. Cons: we had to ask a passing waiter if someone could take our order after sitting there for almost half an hour with no one acknowledging us, and it wasn't even that busy (we went on a Sunday evening).  Some of the tables are, indeed, smooshed up next to each other so you get to know the strangers beside you whether you like it or not. Pros: really warm atmosphere inside and the outdoor seating is lovely.  Also: MEAT!!!!

Very intimate setting, a great place to go on a date or just catch up with friends. The food was superb, one of the best vacios I've had in a long time, juicy and perfectly grilled. Appetizers were great and their morcillas we're the best I've ever had. Had a great time, plan on returning soon.

No frills service but an amazing menu that will never disappoint. No reservations are taken, so get there early or be prepared to wait. Tango Sur is BYOB and no one looks at you funny if you bring in a bottle per person, even around 3pm.

Lots of meat for not a lot of money. Provoleta (bubbly bowl of broiled Argentinian provolone) is a must-order appetizer. I've had most of the beef options on the menu and all are excellent; the parillada (a massive grill overflowing with cross-cut short ribs, blood sausage, and other delectable cuts) stands out for its size and variety. The chimichurri sauce that comes with everything is a perfect complement. Also, it's BYOB, which is always an amazing perk.  Service is not the fastest, but the place is small and constantly swamped. Still, Tango Sur doesn't handle the throng as efficiently as possible; we came here once with a massive party and they lost the reservation. Were it not for my extremely affable and convincing friend, we likely wouldn't have eaten here that night. Nevertheless, I had to search the recesses of my memory for this element of the experience; I hardly remembered it because the food was so good.  In short: when you're craving a lot of meat served in South American fashion, the Brazilian steakhouses aren't your best option. Tango Sur is way more authentic, and gives you 2-3 times as much bang for your buck.

Be prepared to wait......but....you will be very happy you did. Definitely eat inside. I love the ambiance they have going on; date night perfection. The food was to die for. My boyfriend literally dreamed about his steak for a week (he's weird). Writing this review makes me want to go back right now. Ps...it's BYOB. Uh...yes.

After years of wanting to eat at Tango Sur I finally got the chance.  Don't get me wrong I am persistent when it comes to eating but driving by and looking at that long line of hungry people waiting to get in is more than discouraging. My BF is more of a meat eater than I am so I thought he would love this place (if we ever got in).  So we walked over to Tango Sur and gave our name to the Host at about 8:30 pm on a Friday , he says it will be about 1 hour and 15 mniute wait and he takes my BF's cell number and says he will call him when the table is ready.  Well, an hour later we are still waiting and he tells my BF it will be another 30 minutes.  We walk down the street and wander into the cupcake shop to "browse" and check out the showings at the Music Box.  Thirty minutes later, still No call.  My boyfriend suggests I go and talk to him in Spanish.  Sure enough, the Spanish card gets us in.  He immediately calls someone out who takes us to a small table by the wall. Now this is a Hot summer Chicago night and there is absolutely no breeze in here.  The bus boys are zooming around filling glasses with ice cold water. The waiter takes a while to come by but when he does I use my Spanish again to get some quicker service. He quickly gets us a bucket of ice for our now warm wine.  This place is packed!  We order two empanadas, a corn one and a spinach/cheese empanada and tell the waiter we would like to put our order in for the entrees.  Both served with chimichurri sauce.  My BF is a fan.  I order the churrasco (sirloin steak) from the specials menu, 3/4 done.  My BF orders the Beef steak medium rare.  I loved my steak, I'm not a huge meat eater but was in the mood for some meat.  Delicious!  After we had had our fill I asked the waiter for some doggie bags and he was quick about it. It just took one glance to get him to our table with the check.  I read other yelper's reviews and waiting for the check and other service seem to go very slow.  I suggest learn some basic Spanish, this might help.  Anyway, I love you Tango Sur but because of the long wait and extreme heat and the loud noise inside I think this is more for the young and inexperienced diner.  It's a great place, very romantic but I'm going to try El Nandu after 10 years and see what they are up to.

My boyfriend might tell you differently, but I didn't love Tango Sur.  I didn't hate it, but I certainly didn't love it. We got there nice and early, so we easily got a table, but we had no idea it was BYOB (my fault for not Yelping beforehand!).  Thankfully, some lovely people who were sitting next to our table gave us half of a bottle of a lovely red that they didn't want to take home with them.  That's never happened to me before at a BYOB joint, and I loved it.  I'll definitely pay it forward someday, should I ever have leftover wine, which as an Italian American...not so sure if that'll ever happen.   The meat was....just ok.  The portions are huge and my boyfriend and I split....I can't remember the name right now.  It was a roulade-style steak, stuffed with diced shrooms and other veggies.  I didn't like the texture or the flavor of the stuffing, but that's a personal preference thing.  The meat itself was surprisingly tough for something that was also so juicy.  It came with roasted sweet potatoes which I could not stop eating, and I don't usually love sweet potatoes!  Very savory and delicious. I'd try Tango Sur again, but I'm definitely not letting my boyfriend order for the both of us again without me looking at the menu and I will DEFINITELY try the empanadas.  I feel like I did it all wrong by not bringing wine, ordering food that I don't like anyway, and not getting what they're known for, but I also feel like if I have to have that much inside knowledge to enjoy a restaurant, meh.  I wouldn't miss it.

For anyone looking for a real steakhouse this is not the place. Go to Morton's or Gibson's to get a real steak. Tango Sur provides large portions of low grade beef, the meat is not tender or very moist. OK for lunch or a weekday dinner but I would not waste of a weekend night to dine here.

I was looking forward to this place, after several friends had recommended it, and the four-star rating (8/27/11) from Yelp was encouraging.  Disappointed.  The first time I called to make a reservation for a large party that same week, the person on the other end actually giggled, and hung up on me! As if I did not realize how busy they were. So, I called next time 3 weeks in advance - no problem. We still had to wait over 15 minutes past our reservation. No problem, it gets busy. Understandable.  The problem was the whole package, including the food. Ambiance was lackluster. Closely packed together, noisy, and dimly lit (few candles on the table). I ordered the filet, and it was bland, and rubbery. Mash potatoes so-so.  The saving grace is that the place is BYOB. So, our bill was reasonable.  A good place to try for reasonable steakhouse. But, nothing to write home about.

After reading so many great reviews, I was so excited to try out Tango Sur. My husband and I took my mother there for birthday dinner, and to say the least, we were not pleased. We had to wait for over 45 minutes on the sidewalk, and it wasn't even worth the wait.  We started off with the 'provoleta' which is the melted cheese with roasted peppers. It was so oily and chewy, we didn't even finish half of it amongst the three of us. We also started off with the 'berenjena', which was the chefs special, and that was kind of an eggplant lasagna in a yummy tomato sauce, which was definitely the best of the night.  For entrees, my husband ordered the parrillada for one, which consisted of your own mini grill, served with grilled short ribs, sausage, beef sweetbread and black sausage. The meat was charred, overly cooked, and tasted like it had been ready for hours. I ordered the 'pechuga de pollo' a chicken breast served with vegetables and this oregany sauce on the side. The chicken was dry and did not have much flavor. My mother ordered a steak that was completely rare in the middle and we had to send it back to get cooked more. Each entree came with a salad, but I wouldn't go as far to even call it that - a small plate of shredded lettuce with slices of onion and tomatoes, and no dressing. It is overly priced and not worth the food. I did like the setting, very romantic, and the BYOB is a plus, but we will not be returning.

Love this place! Me and the bf went on a Sunday before the dinner rush and long waits. As soon as we got there we got a seat on the patio. Such a beautiful day to be on the patio and we brought our wine because its BYOB. We started off with the empanadas which are a must! We got the beef and spinach/cheese. For our entree we ordered the PARA DOS. It had an assortment of meat the beef short rib and steak were great. I tried the intestine? first which I thought was pork until my bf told me it was intestine then I stopped eating it :p. I wasn't a big fan of the sausages either. Its a great restaurant to get your bang for your buck.

There isn't much to say that hasn't been said -- but anyway, this is the place to go if your family or friends are in town, or if you have a date. Very romantic, looks classy, but has that neighborhood feel instead of that downtown feel. It's truly a unique restaurant (ambiance) with a diverse menu, quality food, and beautiful music.

Ordered the parrillada para dos (grilled meat for two) which is good (not fantastic), but service is subpar.  When asked to substitute the blood sausage (called black sausage on their menu) for anything else, even just another meat sausage, the response was a negative. No substitutions allowed for anything. They can hold the blood sausage, but the price will be the same. What if you're allergic or simply cannot consume blood for whatever reason?  Too bad. I've experienced this attitude before abroad but I don't expect this kind of service in the United States.  Thank goodness for the sites like this to write reviews. You've been informed. Now you make the decision.

I came here a while back, like last summer.  We went for dinner and it was very very cozy and dark inside with long white candlesticks lighting your table.  Very romantic atmosphere with great patio seating.  I remember I had the Matambre appetizer, an argentine specialty - veal rolled and cooked with vegetables served cold.  Then me and Bernice split the Lomo Relleno half slab argentine filet sliced and filled with a chimichurri, ham sauce then cooked and served on a grill with portabella marsala (ideal for two).  It was HUGE.  I think they served it with like some sort of sweet potato too.  The meat was juicy and delectable.  I would love to go again for dinner just for two.  Can't wait!

I'm taking a star away; our service was downright snotty the last time we were there. Apparently ordering an apetizer as a meal gets you condescending remarks. Note they still get 4 stars. I still love this place, regardless of the wait time, but I'm over the attitude. BYOB and great food. Enough for me.

Awesome food! Decided to have a friends birthday dinner here and could not have been more pleased. There was no wait when we got there, granted it was a Wednesday night, and we were seated right away. This is BYOB--so we brought 6 bottles of wine and there was no corkage fee, they opened up all our wine and even put them on ice in a bucket. The inside is larger than it looks and is only lit by candlelight. There is also no AC. I did read that in someone else's review and just thought I would confirm that. I was in a dress and was still rather warm.  The bread right out of the oven is Amazing! The menu has plenty to choose from and the empanadas are great to start with. The Vacio dish--flank steak--was cooked perfectly and the potatoes were good. The wait for the food was not very long and the food lasted the entire conversation. With the 4 of us it came out to be $34 a person with tip, which was not bad since we paid for the birthday girl as well. Great place for a date night or girls night :)

This place is awesome.  I have been a couple of times now, and it just keeps getting better each time I go. Last night we went with another couple (they were celebrating their 2 year anniversary).   We started several empanadas (chicken, beef, spinach and cheese, and ham and cheese), my favorite was the beef.  It was so delicately seasoned, mixed with a hot gooey core of melted cheese.  Our appetizer course was rounded out with the proveleta (a big bowl of melted provolone cheese with red peppers).  This dish was delish, so my only negative feedback comes from the fact that the bread on our table ran out and wasn't refilled. On to Entrees... My lady and I split the Vacio.  It is flap meat (flank steak i think) seasoned with their chimmiscurri sauce, and served on a miniature grill for two. O-M-GOD was it divine. We also replaced the sweet potatoes with the traditional mashed. The other couple got the Rejellanos... also served for two, it's filet mignon served with mushrooms in a ham sauce.  I'm not normally a mushroom fan, but in this dish, the mushrooms tasted like meat.  Unreal. On top of this kick-ass experience it's BYOB WITH NO CORKAGE FEE. That is  bomb.com  if I don't say so myself. I only wish it was a little brighter in there, but most people like the candlelit romantic atmosphere.

Love this place. Yeah the wait can be ridiculous, but the food is so good. And its byo, which is always a plus. Try the grilled provolone appetizers. Amazing value. I went with a friend and we split the app and each got an entree. The total was under forty dollars.

You really can't go wrong at this place.  I have been here a few times and I always leave with a smile on my face..and a doggy bag.  First off, BYOB and steak are a wonderful combination and a great way to enjoy a fantastic meal at an affordable price. I am not a huge steak eater but they really do it right here.  My friend and I ordered the El Filet and the Pork Chop to split.  I have ordered the El Filet here in the past and it is always tasty..and a TON of food (literally 2 steaks).  The Pork Chop was to die for.  It was perfectly cooked and the sauce was unbelievable.  The empanadas are always a solid choice and hard to pass up at $2 a pop.  The corn and cheese was surprisingly delish. This place is crawling with staff which makes me wonder why the service is so slow.  I wasn't in a rush but waiting 30 minutes for our check and then receiving it without an apology was a little much for me.  If they are able to improve on this, they deserve every inch of 5 stars. The atmosphere is very dark and romantic..literally candlelight only.  I am happy to come back here any night of the week...as soon as my body processes the protein overload.

Honestly this place is great. Came here with a group for a friends birthday, managed to get reservations which was great because there was a street fest going on on Southport and so this place was THE place to be! What a great setting, almost entirely lit by tall, long stemmed candles, felt like I was sitting somewhere established in the 1800's, amazing. Empanadas were delightful, heard rave reviews about prosciutto/melon and beef tongue appetizers but did not try either. Am dying to go back and try the grilled provolone (grilled cheese? sign me up, sadly I was the only taker for the evening). Boyfriend and I split the pork dish for two, way too much meat, but made delicioso left overs for dinner the next evening as well.  Waiter was delightful, albeit absent, but the place was mega crowded so I gave him a pass. Only complaint was that it was SO GD HOT! It felt like the air was off, I don't really understand that. But, it was super hot outside and people kept opening and closing the front door letting all the air out, so ok, I guess I CAN understand. Totally reasonably priced, for 4 couples (8 people) it was $60 a couple including a 20% tip (plus cost of the $10 bottle of wine we brought), was more than pleased to say the least! Am planning to come back with the man in the fall, good romantic atmosphere, BYOB (love love love BYOB) and food was delicious. i've got my eye on the giant filet mignon everyone was eating.

Contrary to popular belief, Emma Lazarus originally wrote The New Colossus with the lines, "Give me your hungry, your poor / Your huddled masses yearning for steak" while she was thinking about Tango Sur.   For no trip to the New World of the Southport Corridor is complete without the Parradillo Para Dos, an orgasmic journey through five distinct yet all deliciously flavorful meats.  You'll find yourself moaning through the juicy tenderness, and just when you thought you'll have to say good-bye, the server comes around with a hushed, "Would you like that wrapped, sir?"   And with that, the journey continues in your microwave.  You're welcome, America.

Went to this restaurant for a friends birthday on a Saturday night. We had a large group (12) but had made reservations ahead of time for 9:00. We showed up at 9:00 and were told we would not be seated right away because they were still waiting on a table and they offered for us to begin enjoying our BYOB in the waiting room in the back.  After waiting for more than an hour a couple of members of our group went to find someone to inquire about the wait. The manager was extremely rude to them and told them to just go back an sit in the waiting room.  About an hour and fifteen minutes after our reservation and after watch two other groups of similar size who arrived after us get seated we were finally given a table.  Service was extremely slow (we didn't leave until 12:30 after a 9:00 reservation) and the waiter made no effort to try to impress us.  Additionally, when the bill finally came two members of our group were surprised to find that their meal was $8 more than the menu indicated. The waiter had encouraged them to get it Argentinean-style over American style with no mention of the extra $8 by the waiter or on the menu.  While the empanadas were amazing and the filet mignon I got was decent (but nothing special). After the service we experienced here I will never return!

My boyfriend suggested we go to Tango Sur for my friend's birthday dinner because it's BYOB. The Yelp page says it takes reservations, but it seems otherwise. The only reason we got a reservation was because we told them we had a large group.  We started with an appetizer: Prosciutto with hearts of palm and Argentinian golf sauce - it was ok, didn't really stand out. The golf sauce tasted very similar to thousand island dressing My friend and I shared our entree: El Filet - the meat was cooked perfectly. The spinach mashed potato was really good. One order was enough to feed both of us at a very inexpensive price The restaurant gave my friend a flan on the house for her birthday, which was really nice! The flan was delicious. It had a layer of what tasted like dulce de leche on top. Pros: Good food, reasonable price, BYOB Cons: small tables (had to squeeze stuff onto the table), doesn't take reservations (?), entrees took a while to come out

Overall a good experience. We were worried about having to wait, but we got there at 630 on a Thursday evening and had no problem sitting down right away. We had our pick of the restaurant. No corkage fee which is a plus. Portions are HUGE. Could easily feed two people... everything came out delicious. Only problem with the place was the quality of their meat... not as great as people chalked it up to be. All in all, fun environment and a good experience.

I was driving with my boo, and we were wondering where to go.  We tried Toro sushi, but that place was busy as all hell and about to close, so on a whim, we came here.  We were immediately seated in a super romantic, dimly lit dining room, playing awesome Argentine music.  The server put our beers on ice, and was super cool from the very start.  I must state this again, but Chicago's BYOB policy is AWESOME!  We don't have anything like it in California, and I LOVE IT.  We asked the server for his opinion on an appetizer, and he told us to get this awesome melty cheese, roasted pepper dish, which went really good with their house bread.  We slammed the whole dish quickly, and we then asked his opinion on the main course, and he quickly said to get the fillet from argentina, for two.  This beast of a steak came out on a sizzling platter covered in an awesome brown reduction with mushrooms.  It was pure awesome.  Me and my boo ate the entire thing, and it was perfect.  The meat was ultra tender, and not the slightest imperfection in the quality. No stringiness, no gristle, and no tough spots.  It was awesome.  I went home and slept for 12 hours to process that behemoth meal.  It was a surprisingly awesome meal at a great price.

Tango Sur is a truly unique Argentine steakhouse where the cuisine is as affordable as it is delicious.  After spending time in Buenos Aires, Argentina, I returned to the states craving more of the dark cuisine of cured meats, oversized steaks and blood-red wine.  Having  tried a number of Argentine restaurants from Kansas City to New York, I realized just how hard it is to recreate the mood of an authentic Buenos Aires eatery.  Only Tango Sur comes close. Mood: 5/5 -- With an dimly, candle-lit interior, the place feels like a different world altogether.  As the Spanish guitarist strums sad melodies, it is impossible not to get lost in the enigmatic charm of the far South. Food: 4/5 -- Giant steaks and meat of all colors. Delicate sweetbreads.  Chimmichurri sauce that tastes as if the recipe is 100 years old.  The food is incredible, and cheap. BYOB makes the price unbeatable. Service: 3/5 -- Typical Argentine service.  Slow, not terribly helpful, but nothing to complain about.  Professional. Verdict -- Wow.  Try this place as soon as possible.  Just be prepared for a wait.  And don't forget to bring along several bottles of the native Argentine Malbec.

Berry Gooooooood!!!! We went there 3 times already, I believe. Very good food, environment, food, people, food...did I mention food? Meat...oh! Meat! I love you! The restaurant is a little too dark (basically only candlelight) but its all part of the charm.

The atmosphere at this little gem is very nice and intimate.  I took my friend there for her birthday and we really enjoyed it!  The waiter was very proper, yet pleasant.  If not for the reasonable price, I would have thought we were eating at a bona fide  5 star prim and proper elegant restaurant!  If you would like a wine accompaniment, make sure you bring your own since it's BYOB - just an FYI as it did not apply to us.  The portion size of the filet is more than enough for 2 people...very good flavor, even the potatoes were flavorful!  They almost tasted like greek potatoes, but obviously Argentine style!  we both ended up bringing home enough for another full meat portion of a meal!  It was my friend's birthday, and they were happy to oblige me by bringing her some caramel flan with a candle.  I have to hand it to them, we came in late, and they let us stay well past closing without as much as a raised eyebrow.  Very polite of them!

All-in-all a fantastic place (but always a wait which sucks!). I love BYOB, it saves so much money. But the steams are phenomenal. I did notice someone mentioning they are a little greasy, but that is what makes then taste so good. I love the salad they give at the start of the meal, it's so simple just lettuce onion and some balsamic vinegar and olive oil on the side, but it's really good. I love the atmosphere, although dark and giving an allusion of a romantic place, it's also really great for parties or even just a couple friends. But try to go early or on a weeknight because they wait is crazy long sometimes. In the summer the advantage is there space almost doubles with outdoor seating.

I was really excited to give Tango Sur a try.  I've heard the restaurant is amazing however I think amazing might be a little generous. We walked in on a Friday shortly after they opened - they open at 5pm and we walked in around 5:30pm.  There was already a 1 hour wait to sit inside so we opted to sit outdoors where there was no wait. It's BYOB - BONUS!  I love byob's! They start you off with warm bread that has a bit of a garlic taste - I liked it quite a bit. The salad I think they just shouldn't bother. It's a few leafy greens, a slice of onion, a slice of tomato, and no dressing. The main part which receives rave reviews is the meat. We ordered the filet for two and it was huge!  You definitely get your money's worth.  The mushrooms served with it were to die for.  BUT, it was marinated in a tomato base of some sort and while the meat was delish, it did seem a bit oily at the same time. I had to end the dinner with dessert which was a slice of carrot cake for me - I've definitely had better in that department. All in all, you definitely get your bang for your buck - portions are large which means you can share and it is BYOB so a steak dinner can be pretty reasonably priced. I'm glad we tried it but overall, I think it's only "ok."

With all of the hype for this place, I was excited to go.  We showed up early on a Friday night (around 5:30), and were immediately seated inside.  We were the only couple at the time, but by the time we left, the room had filled entirely. We started with the empanadas - one beef, one chicken, and one corn.  The beef, although a bit greasy, was very good.  The chicken lacked really any flavor.  The corn was good, but I wish it had a bit more flavor - the corn seemed a bit muted.   Then came the salad - a total throwaway.  Why even bother?  The bread they served with it was good enough, although it was pretty run of the mill (and I hate when butter is served in packets). Entrees - I ordered the El Filet and she ordered some sort of seafood salad (with calamari, octopus, and mussels).  She was not impressed - don't get me wrong - it was a ton of seafood for $10, but it was pretty one-dimensional.  My steak was great, although whoever butchers their meat needs more practice - these things looked like they'd been hacked with a, well, hacksaw.  Cooked perfectly, however, and very flavorful.  Enough steak to feed two, for sure, so the $25 price tag was pretty astonishing.  The side (spinach mashed potatoes) was another throwaway - watery, lifeless and lacking any seasoning whatsoever, was a bit disappointing. We finished with a caramel cheesecake, which surprised both my wife and me in being very good.  Another steal at $5 for a relatively large piece of cheesecake. Aside from the food, we weren't impressed.  It was a hot day outside, and you could tell that inside - warm and muggy.  The waiters were still setting tables 30 minutes after they opened and not doing it quietly.  The candle on our table didn't fit in the candleholder, so it tilted ever so dauntingly, threatening to fall into our food or into our glasses of wine - we blew it out and moved it to the side (a good move, might I add, as there was little to no room on our table for our food, much less a candleholder).  Service was brash and surly. Honestly, I don't know if they had a bad night or if this is the norm and people give it a pass based on preconceived notions, but with all of the gems in this city, I wouldn't return.

My first experience here was in the middle of winter, I knew absolutely nothing about the place and waited in the freezing cold for at least 25 minutes before making it to their waiting room in the back! in was a little heated about not being let in since it was too crowded but from what I'd heard, it was well worth it. Starting off with appetizers and drinks from the closest liquor store (yes, it's byob!), I knew it was going to be a great meal. The staff was very friendly and hand picked 3-4 different starters to get us off on the right foot. For dinner I had the El Filet, which was tender and juicy and enough food for two to share. Not sure what everyone else ordered but when it was passed around there wasn't anything I didn't like. I've returned several times since then and plan on going back in the next few weeks... HIGHLY recommended!!

I went here for the first time with my boyfriend. It was our first dinner out in a while and we couldn't have been happier! We both got great meals (had the fillet Mignon) which were cooked perfectly and tasted exquisite. The ambiance of the restaurant was dark and smoky without being pretentious and snobby (which often happens in nicer restaurants). The only drawback to our experience was the level of noise in the restaurant. It can get a bit loud but wasn't unbearable. We loved that it was BYOB as well. No paying triple just to have a few cocktails with din-din. I'd definitely go again and look forward to our next night out there. If you love steak, then give this place a try. It may just end up being your favorite after your first visit!

The service at Tango Sur was good. The host seated us pretty quickly (outdoor seating so I'm not sure what the decor/ vibe is like inside) It was a great evening to be outside so I was happy about that, but the tables were a little too close for comfort- started to free like we were talking over the table behind us. The waiter gave us his recommendations (we ordered both recommendations).  It might seem silly to mention but the bread was really good. The salad was a complete dissappointment. Our meals came out looking and tasting pretty good. Our server kept checking in on us from the moment we were seated which was nice, but we were starting to feel a little rushed. I yelped Tango Sur before I went there and I have to say it got my expectations up.. sad to say it was a little overrated. I would consider coming back here to check out the inside.

We've been going here for years & I wish I could still say I love this place.  But the service seems to be consistently bad and I've had issues with my food the last couple of times.   Today, I was enjoying my meal until my steak came out & it was over-cooked.  After about 10 minutes, the waiter came by to ask how we were doing.  I mentioned that my steak was over-cooked & he agreed.  He offered to get me another steak but that would have meant I would have to wait for another meal while the rest of my party already had their food. And anyone who has dined at Tango Sur know how long it takes to a customer to receive their food.  The waiter brought me flan (without asking) & offered coffee free of charge.  This was nice, except I don't like flan or coffee, so it didn't really make up for the bad steak.  I would have prefered to have received a discount on my meal.   This place is OK, but keep don't expect too much.  I still think it's expensive for what you actually end up getting.

This place will always hold a special place in my heart. It's served as the backdrop for my first nice meal in Chicago ever as well as the first date spot for the Manfriend and I. Now, I'm not going to talk about how I also almost burnt this place down thanks to a to go bag and candle fiasco but, the food is always good, the atmosphere always intimate and the BYOB factor is always a plus. Where else in the city can you order two of the best filets you'll ever have for $26? You will leave here full, with leftovers, and perhaps even smitten with someone.

-Appies:  Beef and spinash empanadas with chimichurri -Bread & Salad: Come with the meal -Entree: My wife and I split the El Filet...this is enough beef for 2 people! -Finish the meal with an espresso With the bread, empanadas, salad, splitting the filet, and BYOB wine we can eat out at a great place in Chicago for $30!
Best steakhouse in Chicago, hands down.  Also the singular influence in me wanting to visit Argentina.

On our way to Shuba's we decided that a little something something (aka Dinner) was in order... having walked by Tango Sur a few days before (on my way to the Mercury) and seen lines down the street waiting to get in to this little spot, I was pretty sure we were not going to be dining Argentina style... But my companion was adamant that we try , so we bought a bottle of nice champagne and off we optimistically tromped.  As luck would have it, we were able to walk right in.  Now let me first say my friend and dinner companion, has been to Argentina several times and the restaurant interior caused a jones to go back. there.. dimly lit with candles, everyone looked fabulous - completed the Argentina romance theme along with some fabulous music.  The service was competent and handsome (always a good thing in my book) our bottle of champagne was opened and poured in blink of an eye , menus dispensed, suggestions made - we were well on our way to a lovely experience.  The server suggested that we split the tenderloin - we agreed. First we received a totally uninspired green salad with a tomato and a few onion slices and a vinegar and oil dressing, b. o. r. i. n.g. Then we were served up the most enormous hunk of sizzling hot beef flesh I have ever seen. It was perfectly cooked and we just had to saw off the hunks we wanted. here is my problem, bad chimichurri sauce, favor-less and oily was unable to cut through the well, "meatiness" of the hunk o meat. Worse, by this time it was so dark in our little corner of the restaurant - I couldn't tell whether I was eating a piece of mushroom or a piece of meat until it was in my mouth. Color me old lady fussy - but I found this disconcerting.  Now I was thrilled with the price - which was low for the quality of meat alone. But I have to say I have concluded that a hunk of meat is not my gig... I am sure Tango Sur brings the magic for meat lovers, but not for me.
Great place and Great steaks. Its also BYOB as well..The food and service were good..make sure to set a reservation cause you mite wait a while since so many people go..

Sigh....the irony is that the more you love a restaurant, the more loveable it is, and then it becomes annoyingly crowded, which makes you love it less.  Hence, the 4 (and not 5 stars). I took my meat-loving husband here for his birthday, and we got here early to avoid the wait.  However, the longer we stayed, the less personal space we had.  This did not detract horribly from the awesome and huge slabs of flavorful, perfectly cooked meat that graced our plates.   Just stick your elbows out, turn your utensils in, forego the dinner conversation, and get to it!

The food is always good at Tango, but service could use a lot of help.  I would never go here on the weekend because you WILL wait 2+ hours.  The filet is bomb, and PLENTY to feed two people.  But when you pay $22 for a filet and bring your own booze you have to expect the service to be sub-par.  You get what you pay for...

I went to Tango Sur this weekend with a group of 7, and it was good. Not great, but good. It definitely served it's purpose, which was accommodating a big loud group that wants to get extremely drunk off BYOB wine, and enjoy some good food while doing it.  We had no reservation, so our wait was about an hour and a half, but that's not bad for a group of 7 on a Saturday, plus we waited at a bar down the street - hardly painful. We split a bunch of appetizers, with the only standout being the marinated eggplant, which was very flavorful. Provolone cheese dish and empanadas were just ok.  On to entrees. When it comes down to it, I guess I'm just not that into huge slabs of meat. I'm really picky with steak and generally only order it at top notch steakhouses, so I played it safe here and split the Para Dos with the bf. For me the highlight was the fried sweetbreads, which were super addicting dipped in chimichuri sauce. It's so dark in the restaurant that it was kind of hard to differentiate the meats on the platter, but I think my bf's favorite was the flap meat.  Overall, go with a group, but don't go out of your way.

went here a couple weeks ago and it was awesome. i forget what we got, the one thats made for two people and it came out on its own little stand. HUGE slab of meat. im pretty sure 3 people can share. its byob too. i brought an Argentinian malbec blend, which happened to be our second bottle at dinner. you can bet it was a pretty purple color when it came back up later that night...

I was seriously disappointed on my last trip to Tango Sur.  I loved this place, really great steak (good replacement for the steak in Argentina), BYOB, good prices.  It was my boyfriend's favorite place.  But then we went this winter and there was one guy who was beyond rude; incredibly rude.  There was a major wait (common occurence) but then when we were trying to figure out where we were going to go next before we went out into the below zero weather, the guy who took our name kicked us out.  I asked my bf, where are we going to go, and the TS guy said, not here, get out of here. Rude.  Disappointing.

Went there on a Wednesday night with a group of 10 diners.  Some food was good for some of the party.  However, I ordered the pan-fried veal, very similary to a Wiener Schnitzel.  What I received, however, was inedible.  Hard, dry, shoe leather.  So bad I wouldn't even take it home to feed to my dog.  No manager every stopped by my table to see the problem.  The waiter simply whisked away my plate, and I never saw the waiter again. The atmosphere in the room is completely inconducive to any kind of talking softer than yelling.  The loudest restaurant I've ever been to.   I could barely hear the person sitting next to me, much less the birthday honoree 3 seats away.   Never again.

This dimly lit gem is a perfect date destination! Although there is typically a wait for a table, their waiting area is just fine in the meantime.  It's a comfy waiting room where you are welcomed to begin enjoying your BYOB beverage. The service and food is always phenomenal.  I highly recommend 'el filet', the very reasonably priced entree consisting of two filet mignons! My girlfriend loves this place as much as I do.  A can't miss!

Attempted to have dinner here last Friday (June 24). I was treating a friend, who had never been to this restaurant, to dinner. We arrived at 6:55pm and were informed it was a 20 minute wait for our party of 2--Not too bad, given it gets crowded.  30 minutes later we were told we could move into the inside waiting area and we were the next party of 2. After 45 minutes, I checked and was again informed we were the next party of 2. After an hour and seeing 3 different parties of 2 being seated before us I again confronted the host. He stated he informed me upfront the wait was about 20 minutes and the parties being seated were in front of us. (I actually saw two of the couples get out of their cabs, about 15 minutes into our wait)  I unsure when about 20 minutes = an hour + but we decided to leave. Exceptionally disrespectful!!  Plenty of other great restaurants in Chicago.

I was excited to try tango but was shocked when I got my steak....not in a good way.  I couldn't even cut into it. Eating it was out of the question.  I never had a piece of steak even close to as bad.  I would have returned it but i had already ordered a piece.. medium rare and returned it because it was well done.  I should have just kept the first piece.  Reading the other reviews I wouldn't rule out the possibility that they purposely gave me an inedible piece because I returned my first piece?  They did take it off the bill but I'm still giving them 1 star... any person would have found this unacceptable.   .. I seldom return food at a restaurant.

Love love love this place. Classic Argentine flavors + BYOB + outdoor seating in the summer cannot be beat. Went with a party of 4 on a Monday night. Sat outside, kicked off with some wine and empanadas (my fav were the chicken ones). We also (stupidly) got the Para Uno app to split among the 4 of us and an entree each. Not sure what we were thinking as these portions are out of control. The Para Uno could easily have been eaten by 2 people. Anything with chimichurri is the way to go.

Wow.  After waiting 1 and a half hours to sit down... this place was worth the wait.  We started out with a variation of empanadas.  Yum YUM!  The crust was light and flaky and the chimichurri to dip was one of the best I've had.  We also had a plate of heaven.. I mean, the melted provolone dip.  Drip a little of the left over chimichurri and slap it on some bread... O.M.G.  I could have eaten just THAT.  I ordered the rib-eye and my other friends ordered filets.  The rib-eye had a caper, garlic and herb olive oil all over it nestled next to a large amount of whipped potatoes. Talk about getting your bang for your buck.  This was a TON of food!  Really liked the romantic, candle-lit ambiance, too.  Oh and this place was BYOB so that was kinda cool.  Although the wait was long, we were able to go to a bar down the street and wait for the call to come back to the restaurant.  Unfortunately when we got there for our reservation, we still had to wait another half hour in the waiting room.. however.. we were able to pop a bottle and start drinking to pass the time.
Huge portions, well-cooked steaks, great sides and starters. BYOB and a really nice patio. Outstanding value at about $30 a person.

This place was pretty cool! I went with a HUGE group for a birthday party and I must say the ambiance was amazing. It was BYOB and although the options were limited for a vegan, the food looked great!!! We all had a great time!

Mouthwatering Steak... Huge portions...BYOB..you can't go wrong if food and drinking are your focus.  My only caution to you is that it gets extremely loud in here so I wouldn't plan on a romantic date on a busy nigth.  This is a great place to enjoy on weekdays or early on weekends.  They only takes reservations for parties of six or more and even then we have had to wait a long time.   Highly recommend the red pepper cheese appetizer. Bring enough wine for the wait and you'll be just fine. Deal Tip:  Buy Wines at Costco or the Wine Discount Center

Overrated. I heard so many great thing about this place. Ambiance is nice. Meat is low quality except for the filet. Language barrier is used against you. First three times you go are good. After that, youre pushing your luck.  Bravo tango dude. You suckered me out of about two hundo, but due to your non English speaking waiter who made me order a salad I didn't eat or even want and then refused to do anything about it, I would rather make my own mouth watering steaks from here on out. My marinade is better anyway. +BYOB - It's like pulling teeth to try to get a bucket of ice for your beer or wine. + Filet size - Almost every other thing about this place. Get it together southport. Quit hiring fucking morons who can't do their jobs.

My favorite BYOB restaurant in the city - atleast for a nice dinner! This is a great place for an intimate dinner (great date spot guys!) or a fun night out with friends. They do not take reservations and the wait gets long!  (Unless you have a group, then you can call for a reservation).  They have a small room to wait and start your boozing =)   Empanadas = FANTASTIC!  mmm I want one now! The steaks are really high quality and so well seasoned they are just so tasty!  The chimichurri is AWESOME.  I want some right now.  Also try the provolone appetizer!   My family went for my law school graduation a few weeks ago, there were 9 of us, multiple appetizers and it was less than $300... not to mention a week's worth of lunch!  Now that is a great deal (well plus the price of booze at Jewel across the street!) This is a MUST TRY!

Steak lover heaven. Yes, the wait is just crazy here but once in a blue moon it is worth it.  You must come hungry which you are because you wait but at least it is BYOB.  Your meals comes with a light salad and some tasty hot bread.  The empanadas are pretty good. We usually order Vacio but sometimes we get the Lomo. The portion is costco size so I must warn you that it said for two but really it can feed 4.  The Flan is probably my favorite here.

I had the pleasure of living in San Martin, a small city in the Mendoza region of Argentina for a little while.  During my stay, I subsisted on fried empanadas, pastries with dulce de leche, amazing mate, Fanta Naranja, asado and simple salads that are representative of the German, Spanish and Italian heritages that form the Argentine culture and population.  My host father would man the grill for hours making asado in the form of chorizo, steaks and of course, morcilla.  My host mother made an amazing milanesa that I still salivate over when I think of it. So when I called up a few friends in Chicago that went to Argentina with me, I suggested we do a mini-Mendoza reunion and find an Argentine restaurant to do it at.  They both had one place in mind: Tango Sur. I gave them fair warning that living in Columbus, I had not had a decent empanada since we got back from Argentina.  Ruben's in SoHo NYC has great empanadas, but they are baked and don't have that same flavor and texture as fried Argentine empanadas.  We ordered four at Tango Sur.  Felt and tasted like home. I also gave them fair warning that I had every intention of ordering way too much and having leftovers.  I was not lying.  For the table, we ordered the four empanadas, their cheese and tomato dip, and under the parillada section, the para una.  The para una is a table top grill that has chorizo, sweet breads, two cuts of steak and a very impressive serving of morcilla (blood sausage.)   In addition to this, one person ordered the veal asado, another ordered the flank steak, the third ordered a chicken dish and I ordered the milanesa ternera (veal milanesa.)  Everything was delicious.  The only thing that disappointed me about the milanesa was that it was not smothered in the vegetable puree that my host mother always served with it.  This puree is something that I keep a batch of in the freezer at all times since it is a simple accompaniment made by simmering carrots, onions, potatoes, celery and tomatoes in water with just a little salt and water, pouring off some broth and then blending. Of course, after that meal (we all left with half of our entrees in to go boxes), they brought out the dessert tray.  What immediately caught our eyes were the mil hojas (layers of thin waffles and dulce de leche) and the pionono (vanilla cake rolled with a thick layer of dulce de leche.)  They.  Were.  Beautiful.  I could have sworn that I was back in Buenos Aires, enjoying a coffee in the Recoleta, watching the tourists try to find Evita's grave.  It was that perfect. We also ordered the mate, expecting and hoping that it would be served in the traditional cup with the silver straw.  Mate is a wonderfully communal drink because you pass it around the table to all your friends and enjoy it together. Unfortunately, it came in a tea bag, served in a regular tea cup.  So that was very disappointing.  However, we had plenty of our BYOB Malbec to enjoy instead.  No corkage fee at Tango Sur either, which is wonderful. All in all, it was a wonderful experience.  They lose one star because of the lack of vegetable puree (which I suppose is not traditional) but mostly because of the mate.  That may seem harsh, but an Argentine restaurant should really observe what is a integral part of serving mate. Definitely check it out.  And maybe bring your own mate.

The Deal:  Tango Sur is an Argentinean restaurant specializing in meat. This place is a Meat-ropolis. Meat-pocolypse. Meat-ageddon. You get the picture. (Vegetarians - they do have pasta. I spotted someones gnocchi and almost went that direction with dinner. But, I eat meat. If you eat meat and you come to Tango Sur, you order meat.)  The Yes:  First, it's BYOB. That always deserves a mention. Second, it's fairly romantic. The interior is dark and candlelit, and our table was tucked in a corner. Perfect for making goo-goo eyes at one another until we passed out from massive meat consumption.  The No:  Service is notably sub-par - slow and vaguely indifferent. Our appetizer (melty cheese intended to be eaten with bread) sat, uneaten, on our table for quite awhile as we struggled to get someones attention to get some bread. I aged considerably as we waited for our check. I'm a slow eater who does not like to have her meals rushed, but this was bad.

This lovely restaurant would've received 5 stars if it wasn't for the 2 1/2 hour wait. I called ahead as recommended, and was told that my table for 3 would be ready within 20 minutes. When we arrived 15 minutes later, we were asked to wait, which was fine. However, when more than 2 hours past, and other groups that arrived after us were being seated, I became angry. Not just one or two groups that arrived after us were seated first; five groups of people who arrived after us, were seated before us; groups of 3 as well. I waved the host down a couple of times to ask him what the deal was, and he kept telling me that our table would be ready soon. (In Spanish, or Portuguese) When we couldn't take it anymore, 2 1/2 hours later, I walked up to the host to tell him we were leaving, he said, "Your table is ready." I would've just left on principle, but was starving, so we stayed. The server was a very flirtatious man...too flirtatious. He was a close talker, and stared way too long into each of our eyes when talking to us. It was totally uncomfortable!  The food turned out to be very good, but in my opinion, not worth the wait. It wasn't just the wait, it was the dis, and the uncomfortable situation! The other problem was that the host did not speak to me in English. I told him each time we spoke, that I didn't understand him, he continued to do it. This was aggravating, and in my opinion, a bit passive aggressive. Honestly, I could go the rest of my life without going there again. To sum up...good food, terrible service!
A+++.  Quality steak  for a great price with leftovers to take home!  I love this little byob, and have made many trips back!

as long as you're comfortable with giving your name and going home (hopefully nearby) for an hour or 2 on a friday night...this is litreally one of the best friday night byob dinner experiences in chicago.  highly recommend the empanadas and the el vacio.

i am torn on how many stars to give. despite the truly excellent food, i can't bring myself to give them praise. so many things about our experience bothered me. read on, if you don't mind my rant. if you'd rather not, here's the quick & dirty: wait was long & frustrating, hosts unhelpful/unfriendly, room too dark. 1- no one answers the phone. yelp says they take reservations... i'm wondering how, when all we could get was a recording. 2- the waiting game. we are told 1 hr 15 min wait. we say we'll go to the bar down the street. they offer to call us when the table is ready. i think, "how nice!" then just as we sit down with a beer, we get a call. granted, normally this would be wonderful news- after only 20 minutes they have a table for us. but, umm... they said 1 hr 15 so we got a beer. so we chug chug chug and race back, only to find out they gave our table away and were not very nice about it. so now we wait on the sidewalk in the cold. then i have to pee. to my surprise i discover a waiting room in the back where people are lounging and sipping wine by candlelight. while waiting for their tables. hmmm... a waiting room. nice of the host to mention that. 3- ordering = stress. i had not even looked at everything on the menu and all of the sudden the server was waiting. our friends had ordered so we were pressured to decide. i wanted some kind of steak but they have a bajillion kinds, and i don't know what's what. my girlfriend & i asked the server for help & he guided us into ordering the filet mignon for two, which was cheaper than each of us ordering our own cuts of meat, so that was good. but after the stressful experience of ordering was over, i wasn't even sure what we were getting. and at the end of the meal, i still didn't know (see below). 4- the lighting. candlelight is romantic, sure, but this place is da-ark. call me crazy but i like to see what i'm putting in my mouth. i thought i was eating eggplant until my girlfriend delicately told me it was portobello mushrooms. seeing as i never eat mushrooms, i did not recognize the taste. and while i was enjoying it, the dish was totally not what we were expecting. no potatoes or nothin'. just a big slab of meat. with (what i found out were) mushrooms and sauce all over it. the darkness really affected my experience, since each time i put the fork to my mouth, i didn't know whether i was about to eat a piece of mushroom or a piece of meat. 5- this is not so much a complaint as something i found odd: the whole restaurant does it's best to be trendy & upscale, but then the servers' uniforms were essentially thin white t-shirts w/ the restaurant logo. sadly, based on the sights and smells on the plates around me, there were probably things i would have liked better and would sure like to try. but i don't think it's worth the trouble.

I love Tango Sur.  I have been coming for years.  It is good but it is not great.  Thus, 3 stars. Tango Sur is a BYOB steakhouse with excellent and large cuts of Argentine beef.  The service will be slow as it is in Latino America.  They do not accept reservations and it is small (very small), dark, loud and very cramped on the inside.   I ordered a breaded steak that was covered with cheese, a tomato sauce and served with potatoes.  It is a large cut of beef and I strongly recommend it.  Order each type of empanada to start and share while your food is prepared. People love Tango Sur, and do not get me wrong, I do too, its a solid dinner option but it is a restaurant where you love the food, but will have doubts about the extras (service, wait lines, small bathrooms, lighting, etc).  I am sure you understand what I am trying to say... Cheers.

The wait was pretty freakin long.. 2.5 hours but wow.. was it worth it.. the place is pretty small and verrry popular apparently so i can understand the wait... the guys taking ur name for the waiting list reminded me of bouncers lol.. its a shame they dont take reservations.  i think i got the filet mignon.. it was amazing. cooked PERFECTLY... def a pretty damn authentic argentinian place.. i used to live in naperville and i could never even compare this to Tango (their meat kinda sucked).  anyways, def wanna go back.. its just that long wait thats kinda annoying... esp when the surrounding stores have already closed!

I love this place.  I have been here more times than I can count because it's so good.  i recently went here on a Friday night with a group of 14.  I was very impressed with their ability to manage the group. I must admit, I lived in Buenos Aires for 1 year and a half and this place is the essence of a Steak Place in that city.  It really makes me feel like I'm back in Argentina.  The empanadas, the steak cuts, everything.  I think it makes me biased in my review so keep that in mind.    I must say, this place does a TON of business.  Friday night (and pretty much every other night of the week) is packed.  Waiters are busting their behind and it's definitely a fast paced environment.  I've noticed that with Tango Sur I have to go in expecting a loud, fast environment.  If you are looking for a quiet romantic dinner, this isn't the place.  Their are simply to  many tables, to close together and to much going on. As always, the food was fantastic.   I highly recommend the berenjena appetizer with the sauce and the cheese.  It's to die for.  I think it's technically on the special menu but every time I go they have it available.  i also love the empanadas.  My favorite is hands down the carne.   The steaks are HUGE.  You could share one with someone else and be fine.  I usually get one for myself cause I love left overs.  My favorite side is the spinach mashed potatoes.  I've never tried a dessert here because I'm always to stuffed.

Great good!  I'm knocking off a star for service.  It's always extremely slow.  One time a couple sitting next to my boyfriend and myself asked the server to help us because he ignored us for so long that they had bread, drinks, etc before he even took a look at us.

You come here for the food and byob option, not the service.  Nice sized portions for the price.  I either get the lomo(filet) or the lomo relleno(large steak stuffed with chimichurri) which is meant to be shared by 2 or more people.  Good place to go if you're craving a steak but don't wanna shell out $50 at a fancier place.  They don't take reservations and the place is crowded, but well worth a try.

If I go out to eat parking should not take 15 plus minutes. That being said  tango sur was a great experience. The posters, lighting, and color gave a  cozy feeling. Service was good. Now Tango Sur had great appetizers try them all if you can. The steak was real juicy and huge, price reasonable. Go to this place but beware they get real busy and tbls may take time to open up.

Very nice atmosphere with Candle lit tables.  BYOB is a plus.  Went here with a large group and enjoyed sharing the bottles of wine we all brought.   The filet was a little disappointing considering I have had the filet at the sister restaurant Folklore and thought it was amazing.  I ordered it medium and it looked like it was cooked how a medium should be cooked (red on the side but not bloody).  Not as tender as a good filet at a top steakhouse is.  I would recommend sharing the filet entree as they give two filets per order.  Also had the empanadas and the egg plant salad both of which were really good. Parking is difficult in the area and there is little room to wait for your table inside the restaurant so if it is raining or 100 degrees out u might be in trouble.

This review is based solely on service quality. For a place that charges 26 bucks for a steak- I expect more...much more.     After being seated by the host, my husband and I waited 15 minutes to receive water. We waited another 15 minutes to receive menus. We were only one of 4 occupied tables. The entire time we waited, the server stood in clear view of our table, doing nothing. Boo to that.

The first word that comes to my mind when I think about this place is DELICIOUS!  The second word is FUN!  First thing about this place is that the food is awesome!  Before I go any further let me first alert that VEGETARIANS BEWARE!  I love the empanadas here!  The crust is nice and crunchy, and the fillings are great!  However good the empanadas are, the real star here is the beef!  While I prefer the ancho or the churrasco, there are many other great options including the para uno (which has blood sausage!!!!).  Also, did I mentioned the tremendous portion size of the entrees, and the very affordable prices!  (More on the prices later) The next thing with this place is that its BYOB!  Nothing goes better with Argentine food than red wine, and you can drink plenty of it here and feel totally comfortable!  Be sure to bring an extra bottle though, as there might be a bit of a wait, the only downfall with the place.  However, you can pop open a bottle in the back room while you wait so it really works out well!  Lastly, the ambiance of this place is great!  Its dark, very romantic, and great for dates.  I love this place!  As I mentioned before the portion size is huge, and the price is very very reasonable, especially considering the quality of beef you get.  To add to this equation is the BYOB fact with no corkage fee really helps the total bill at the end.  Add all these things together, and you possibly get the best value in Chicago!

It was strongly recommend by a few co-workers that I visit tango sur. They said its BYOB, so bring a few friends, a few bottles of wine and enjoy. So I did just that.  The food takes a bit, but it's worth the wait. Order a few things, drink some of that wine with your friends and before you know it a bunch of perfectly cooked, delicious meat will arrive.  Overall, I will definitely go back. Reasonable prices, great food and BYOB with no corkage fee. One note: I would recommend saving this dinner for a night when you don't have any time restraints, as I said, the food takes a little bit.

Ok, so I have really high standards for beef/steak, and I'm talking really high.  So to me, the steak at Tango Sur is far from the best I've had.  But the prices are pretty much amazing, and the portions are ridiculously huge.  Even better, it's BYOB with NO corkage fee.  Great place for a date or celebration on a budget.  If you want great quality steak, then pay the price at a better steakhouse, but if all you want is some beef and lots of it at a cheap price, then come to Tango Sur.

Far and away one of the best meals I've ever had. The atmosphere: so intimate and cozy, I love the candle-only lighting. Beautiful decor. The service: all of the waiters are VERY attractive Latino men. Our server was super helpful and always seemed to pop up just when we needed him. The food: OUTSTANDING. The empanada appetizers were seasoned perfectly and weren't too big. I loved how simple the salad was, just oil and vinegar, as a palate cleanser. And the bone-in rib eye was the best piece of meat I've ever had in my life. Luckily we had reservations a week in advance but I would be so willing to wait an hour for a meal here. You have to try it.

I had heard great things about Tango Sur after a friend visited here and raved about it, but I had a truly mediocre, if not terrible experience! While the host who seated us was fine (even noticing that the table we first sat at was a little cramped for my long-legged boyfriend and I and moving us instantly), our server was genuinely terrible. At first I thought he was just a little busy, but by the end of the night it was like he was too busy or annoyed to talk to us! He never explained the menu and when we were choosing between the two "Ideal for two" items on the menu, didn't explain the differences at ALL. All he said was "This one is a filet, the other is a flank" and walked off. We chose the flank and I don't know what we were expecting but this was NOT it. The meat was stringy, fatty, difficult to cut, and even more difficult to chew. It was almost like stew meat, and while the seasonings were excellent, they couldn't save this cut from being just plain disappointing. No one wants to be stuck with a cut of meat that takes 5 minutes to chew every bite. I can't help but think that if only our server had bothered to take the time at all to describe that actual differences between the cut, we would have been a lot happier. So perhaps that's just how that bit of meat is supposed to taste, but it's the server's job to let you know what you're getting into! So disappointing. This place was too expensive and too underwhelming to be worth coming back to.

Made a reservation for party of 6 at 8:30pm, came only to find out it was not ready because they are packed. Ended up waiting for another 45 minutes before actually sitting down. Menu was confusing, ended up order the "Grill for 1" It was ok nothing too special, didn't know what was so "Argentinian" about it. Came here because we heard of the good reviews, but I think we left feeling BLAHHH. Maybe we just ordered the wrong food. The Grill for 1 was not all red meat. It was all part meat, part thyroid, part blood sausage. no thanks. Only ended up eating the 2 pieces that were meat. For what we paid, I didn't think the food plus long wait was worth it.

Need a place to bring a date? This is the place. Great steaks, great value, and great atmosphere. Make sure to come early or you will be waiting to get a table...but dont worry though. They have a back room where you can start drinking since it is BYOB! Also make sure you get the provolone cheese appetizer...soooo good!

This place is awesome for meat lovers!! Wide selection of meat so it might be daunting to pick something. The atmosphere would be really romantic except I had to listen to the horrible date next to us where the guy was trying very hard to impress his date with random stories of his exploits. Now the reason I mention this is because the tables are very close to one another and the noise level is really high. I love the fact they used actual candles, BYOB, and it was just dim enough to make any date look better. The service department was lacking. Waiters tried but weren't very attentive and they had a very brisk way of talking. On a good note you can't beat the price. I would recommend the empanadas (they don't look as big in the picture) as an appetizer. Great place for a group so each one of you can order something different to try out. We had the Argentinian filet for two. Huge piece of meat but unfortunately the size didn't make it as tasty as it would have been. Even though I mentioned a lot of negatives I do recommend the place for the price, the atmosphere (if you can handle the noise) and the meat. You just have to keep coming back to find your own favorites.  P.S. Try to get there there early as this place doesn't take reservation and after 7 the wait can be over 2hrs sometimes. I did like the fact that they call you 10 min before your table is ready so you can leave and not worry about missing your turn.

I used to love this place, maybe even be obsessed with it.  It seems like in the past 1.5-2 years, it has been on a gradual decline.  The quality of meat isn't as good, the meals I've ordered have been very fatty.  The service seems to be getting bad too.  When we went this weekend, our waiter was very inattentive and the busers took plates out from under us that we weren't even done with yet! What really turned me off to this place (yet, I have decided to return...go figure) is the poor management.  A friend was particularly disappointed with her meal when we went last summer.  She ordered chicken, which admittedly, I wouldn't order at a steakhouse, but that is besides the point.  She said it was undercooked, something that should be pretty important to the staff who were obviously annoyed by her complaint.  She sent her meal back and it was returned cold and rubbery.  She complained to the manager, and he told her that they were an extremely popular restaurant, and he didn't care if she was disappointed, they were going to continue to make a lot of money whether or not she was happy. Again, I'm not sure why I chose to come back, but from now on I will be going to Las Tablas instead.

I loved this restaurant and have been here a few times in the past year and the experience has always been wonderful. The steak is juicy and never overcooked and the wait staff is always courteous.  However, it is getting one star now because I have been waiting for more than an hour for a table for two. It is 11:14 p.m now, Saturday. While we knew that the line is usually long for a Saturday night, I am very unhappy now because the host is an ass! He had been telling us that  our table will be ready in the next 5-10min for the last half hour. After waiting for an hour, he seats a table of 6 - and those people came in way after us. While I understand the restaurant is doing it for money, I still think it is very rude to make customers wait only to let others jump the queue. If you, like us, prefer to be respected as paying patrons, then take your money elsewhere. I'm sure there are other great steak places in Chicago where you won't have to put up with dishonest and rude host. Nope, not one word of apology from that curly hair pasty face ass. Just a smirk smile. The least he could do was be honest so we could have gone somewhere else for dinner!!  I am never coming back again, but I thought others who are in parties less than 6 should know Tango Sur's seating policy.

Yet another Lakeview establishment that I should have visited much sooner.  I went here for a late dinner with one of my buds, although to most outsiders, it probably looked as if we were on a romantic date.  The place just exudes that kind of romantic vibe: dark, cozy, candle lit tables.  It's also BYOB, so it only makes sense to split a bottle of wine.  Anyways, onto the food. We started with the empanada's (one chicken and one ham and cheese).  You HAVE to try these--absolutely delicious.  I might even say these are the best appetizer's I've ever eaten.  We then split the "Vacio for 2".  Although I was a bit nervous about it being described as "slab meat", it was super good.  It was cooked well and best eaten slathered in their amazing chimichurri sauce.  The meat was delicious, but definitely not as tender as a nicer cut of beef would have been (filet, ribeye, etc).   I'm not going to take away any stars, but I gotta say, the service here was TERRIBLE.  We literally didn't see our waiter for the last 45 min of our meal--no exaggeration at all!  Never asked how we were doing, never offered dessert--I'm not even sure why we still tipped the guy 20%.  Either way, the food here was delicious enough to make up for it.

We decided to give it a try since it had a lot of good comments. What a disappointment!!! The place is nice, service is to but the food wasn't all that like people says. We order the Lomo Relleno for 2 the meat was flavorless and it had sauce mushrooms and a salad. I seriously didn't like the meat at all we will give a second chance some other day. But by now 3 stars is more than enough.
