Been here a number of times and never seems to fail me.  The wait can be over an hour depending on when you go.  BYOB is a plus and the amount of food you get is great for the price.  If you're a meat lover this is the place for you.  The fish and chicken dishes are pretty tasty as well.

I say go on Monday nights.... Its not crowded and they cook your steak properly that night. Ive had other issues with under or over cooked steaks. I feel bad sending it back, and when i have it came back again under or over cooked... but you cant complain about a delicious $15 steak salad and bread rolls and BYOB... so i just go on Mondays when i know they are going to have more time to get it prepared just right.

I can't even count how many times I've been here-as I said in my previous review, we always bring out of town guests here and they always ask to come back.  Their steaks are amazing-and massive.  We went with some friends this weekend and I ventured out and tried the Pork Chop.  Best. Pork Chop.  Ever.  Seriously, it is so easy to dry out a pork chop so I was worried but as soon as I cut into this beautiful piece of meat my worries were out the window.  Not only is the pork chop itself amazing, the sauce is ridiculous...RIDICULOUSLY AWESOME!!  This was the most delicious pork chop dish I've ever had, everyone in my group tried it as well and they all agreed-seriously, a must try! My recs:  Pork Chop, El Filet, Lomo Relleno, Bife Vesuvio

woohoo! NICE! My bf and I went there just to see what the fuss is about. we were there 5.10 / 5.15 pm. there was no wait we were seated right away.But in fifteen minutes the place was full. we had a very nice waiter who was Mexican - sorry forgot his name :( we had the grill for two and it was soooo nice. I liked that they serve salad before the main.  About the grill: It was really delicious. We love red meat and my bf is really snob when it comes to food.We were both like; yeah!!! BYOB is a nice thing for that place.It's definitely a plus. You don't have to drink what the menu offers.You have your own selection. Another reason I liked that place is it's casual: you don't have to dress up to have a good dinner.And there were people - Argentinian more than likely- that makes you feel you're in a real ethnic place not an American version of it. We also had desert which I cannot remember what.It was something with peach in it. That was delicious too. The only complaint I might have is the grill gets cold fast.They can leave some ember in the grill which might keep it warm and you can just enjoy it even at the last bite!! Greedy? yeah may be  Last word:Be prepared for leftovers Going there again? OH YES!!

2 things I like Tango Sur. 1. BYOB. & 2. Reasonable price for a good portion of steak. The quality of food is pretty good too, however not stable. I really like my Filet steak at my first visit, but the second time is mediocre. Service is good, enough attention to keep us happy.

Should come with the caveat, "Rated 5 stars by early 20 somethings who have yet to experience great food, great atmosphere, and superior service".  Based on reviews I expected superior steaks, an eclectic experience, and an overwhelming feeling of "I just had one of the best experiences in Chicago, if not my life".  Didn't happen that way, but good. Seriously, I don't know why this gets 4 to 5 stars other than the fact that it is packed with people who don't know any better.  The party next to us was drinking Barefoot wine.  Need I say more?  Let me explain the details: 1.  Appetizer -  We got the antipasto platter - It was basically two slices of tomato on a bed of lettuce surrounded by cold cuts and slices of cheese.  I could make that at home in 10 minutes. 2.  Salads - A bed of lettuce with tomato and onion slices.  Again, can be made in any kitchen with a knife and access to a grocery store.  Thanks for raiding my fridge. 3.  Steaks - Yes, tasty.  Not unique or superior to other restaurants. 4.  Desert - Again tasty, but not anything that most other average quality restaurants cannot produce. Based on reviews, I expected an atmosphere emphasizing the South American origins of the restaurant, superior steaks, a memorable experience.  Instead I received a platter with a steak and mashed potatoes, and a table with a candle on it...but BYOB. It is worth a visit, but don't let the ratings fool you.  It's popular with people who have yet to really experience a great dining experience and want to save a few bucks with BYOB (an honorable cause, but is bringing a $10 crap wine really worth the savings?).
This place is cute, BYOB, with pretty good food.  Crowded and a bit of a wait on a Friday night without a reservation.  Looking forward to outdoor seating when the weather gets warm.

AMAZING!  You must be joking if you give this less than 5 starts!  Or just mad you had to wait for an hour to eat (totally worth it).  Don't miss this gem if you like steak (or food in general).  And the chimichurri sauce is TO DIE FOR!  Did I mention it is BYOB?  Worth every penny and minute you spend drooling thinking about the food before you sit down.

Based on the reviews, I expected to wait at least an hour when my wife and I headed here on a Saturday evening.  We got there early (5:15 PM) and there was absolutely no wait - there were actually a handful of tables available.  This must have been perfect timing, because within 30 minutes there was a crowd forming outside of the restaurant.  The first good sign was that we were the only English speaking couple in our section (always a good indication at an ethnic restaurant.)  The second good sign was when I took a bite of my steak and blacked out for a few seconds.   Wow.   It was seriously that good.  I've had steaks $30 more expensive than this that didn't even come close.  I honestly can't remember ever having a steak this good in my life.  The flavor, the tenderness, the cut (Filet Mignon), the way it was cooked, and even the little side of spicy oil mix all made this thing perfect.  I don't think my wife and I really talked much once the steaks came out, we had work to do.

Really cute. Dimly lit, great food, very reasonably priced. My husband's rib eye was pretty fatty but my beef vesuvio was delicious. Like everyone else said, it does get loud so I probably couldn't make it a first date locale. We tried all of the empenadas and they were all lovely. We had this chocolate caramel layer cake thingy and it was pretty amazing. The quarters are pretty tight, they pack'em in there. Try going on an weeknight and earlier is better than later. Plenty of parking. Don't go without a ressie.

Changed the rules?...for 10 years we been coming to this place they didn't take reservations. Today they give attitude and bad service. My last day in Chicago and this is what you get....bad taste in my mouth and memory. Never again, and will not be recommending to my acquaintances in California. Did they changed ownership? And not even a sorry...bad, bad, bad.

Well my friends are obsessed with this place. For a group of 7 with no reservation on a Friday night we were seated at 11PM (got there before 7).  Yes, Yes, I know we didn't make reservations.... we waited at Hye bar down the street.   Bathrooms.... need work, I mean unless their staff has a private bathroom .... eeek! it was really cruddy and dark.   The place is dark in general - I almost couldn't really see what I was eating.  I'd prefer a bit more light so that I can see more clearly what I am eating and the person sitting across from me. The place is very small to every inch is used.   The food was okay - the service was very fast.  It was a good meal - maybe my expectations were too high from everyone always talking it up.   The food was good  - the price was great - BYOB -  I'd suggest checking it out.

I don't often have steak cravings, but when I do, Tango Sur is the top of my list for a restaurant to go to. I've been here twice now, both times on a Friday night. While the wait can be long (the last time they said 45 minutes) they have a waiting room in the back with tables where you can open up the bottles of wine/beer/liquor you brought, which makes the waiting time seem much much less. Both times our table ordered some empanadas to share. They're pretty good, I wouldn't order them myself (probably try something a little more interesting, there are some delicious sounding other appetizers) but in general everyone loves an emapanada. My favorite so far has been their spinach and cheese. I have tried two of the entrees: one of the "for two" entree specials (Lomo Relleno) and the last time I got the T-bone (veal steak). I fell in love with the T-bone. It was cooked perfectly (medium rare, please) and was about 3 inches thick, covered in some kind of delicious spice blend. I was the smallest person at the table and yet I was the only one who managed to finish my entire entree, buttery mashed potatoes included.  Other things I've had bites of: Vesuvio (filet stuffed with spinach and cheese, not really my thing, I like my meats straight up) and Filet Mignon (it's filet mignon, it tastes good). It's usually pretty busy and loud, so don't expect your waiter to be overly attentive. I was satisfied with the speed we ordered, and we didn't want for any water or a waiter to uncork our next bottle of wine. Best part about this place: leave stuffed for about $50 a couple. Plus whatever money you spent on BYOB wine. An affordable place for a steak dinner.

I. Love. This. Place. Seriously, it's not everyday that I get an awesome piece of steak.  Sure, there's tons of steakhouses in Chicago, but Tango Sur stands out to me.   I dined on a Tuesday night, and this place was packed.  Apparently, everyone else loves Tango Sur, too.  My group of 8 shared our entrees of flank steak, short ribs and skirt steak.  Loved them all. I'll admit the service wasn't outstanding.  The host was a bit rude to me when I walked in, and the servers were also a bit out of it at the table, but the meal definitely blocked most of that out of my memory. Get to Tango Sur now.

Love the steak here. I went here for my friend's birthday and had a table for about 10 so it's nice for bigger groups. Not much room, but it was doable. We found out it was BYOB so we walked to . Probably the darkest setting ever. The place is lit up with a candle. I guess this would be nice for a first date. But you need that candle to see your food, otherwise you might end up eating your napkin or utensil. Either way, I would definitely come back one day. I made a short video at Tango Sur that night to test out my new lens. Enjoy. vimeo.com/11453308  (password: byob)

Be prepared for a long wait, especially on weekend nights. My friend and I waited two hours on a Friday night. But the host takes your cell phone number and calls you, so at least we got to walk around and check out some of the places on Southport and Addison. To avoid the wait, I'd suggest getting there when it opens at 5 PM or getting a group of eight or more of your friends to go with you and making a reservation. It's bring your own beer and alcohol, but I don't think they charge a corkage fee.  The restaurant is dark and candle-lit. It's like the owners were trying to create a romantic setting. However, they fell short because the place is so loud that you have to yell so the person across the table can hear you. And the dining area is kind of cramped so your table is only a foot away from the tables next to you. You end up overhearing more of your neighbors' conversations than you would ever care to. As for the food, it was pretty good overall, except for el filet. But I didn't like how the waiters just assumed that my we wanted to share all of our food. In the waiter's words, "It's more romantic this way." Kind of awkward, to say the least.  The appetizers and dessert really made the meal. The chicken and cheese empanadas were really good. I originally ordered la berenjena (eggplant and cheese baked in the oven) as my entree, but as I said before, the waiter assumed we wanted to share it as an appetizer. It was my favorite part of the meal. The flan was a nice way to end the meal, and it made up for a lackluster el filet.  I'd steer clear of el filet.  It was way too tough.  Normally filet mignon is supposed to almost melt in your mouth, but it took me 90 seconds (I timed it) to force down a small bite of the steak.  Gross. I love steak but that hunk of meat was sick. It's kind of ironic that the steak was so horrible because Tango Sur is an Argentine steakhouse and is known for its steak. The spinach mashed potatoes were pretty good though. But, like I said before, it was pretty good overall.  I'd definitely go there again. Next time, however, I'll know to avoid el filet.

Love this place!  I remember going here about 4 years ago before they were on Check Please.  Went on a Saturday night, got a table right away, had an incredible meal, the bill was small and I was pretty excited.  Aside from being able to get a table right away, everything else good about this place continues to stand today, despite the incredible popularity. Went on Saturday night with a group of 4.  Put our name on the list at 6:45 and went for some drinks across the street with the hope that we would be seated around 8:15 (after the college bball game was over).  Lo and behold, phone rang at 8:14 that our table was ready and off we went.   We brought 3 bottles for two guys and two girls and were seated after about 20 minutes and one bottle of wine in the back room waiting area.  Given that we all had a long night ahead of us, we decided to go heavy on appetizers and split some entrees.  We started with the antipasta as well as a handful of empanadas.  The empanadas are superb, coming in chicken, beef, ham or spinich flavor with each being better than the last.  This was probably not the time or place for a cold antipasta dish but it was fine regardless. *Important note.  I was outvoted in terms of getting the Provoleta appetizer which is pretty much a plate full of hot melted cheese mixed with olive oil and roasted red peppers.  Somehow, it actually tastes better than it sounds so make sure to get this as putting the cheese on bread, empanadas or steak is just incredible. On to the entrees.  My girl and I split the El Filet while our two friends split the Bife Vesuvio.  I can honestly say I have been to this restaurant 30 times and never strayed from either of those two dishes.  The filet is actually a pair of filets in a red wine sauce over garlic mashed potatos.  It was cooked perfectly and we were both stuffed at the end.  The vesuvio is a thicker cut of meat stuffed with spinich and cheese and needless to say, all plates were fully clean by the time we were done. Atmosphere at this place is great with the dim, candlelit dining and noisy, but not too noisy ambiance that allows the soft latin beats to be heard over the voices in the crowded room. We topped it off with some chocolate cake and espressos and everyone left smiling. Despite the years of popularity, Tango Sur continues to hold up to the high standards placed on them and continues to excel.  Great place for dates, groups, events, or just to go have a great meal at a reasonable cost. Without a doubt, this is a top 3 place in Chicago for me. Only downside was when my two friends across the table started making out in the middle of the meal.  Really?  Was that necessary?

I love this place! However, I know it's not for everybody. It's incredibly noisy, the service is hit or miss (but mostly hit), and the wait times can be looooooong. But the steaks are good and affordable and it's BYOB. It's great for a fun night out with your really loud friends.

This is a great date place in the sense that it's dark, candle-lit and cozy, but I definitely wouldn't call it "romantic" - that is, unless you're turned on by the thought of shouting "So how was your day?" over all the noise in this very crowded, popular Lakeview steakhouse. That said.. I still give it the thumbs-up as a date spot for sure. The food is great regardless of what you order - I honestly don't even remember which steak dish I got, but it was large and delicious like every other item on the menu. This place is a carnivore's all-around safe bet. (And actually, even my vegan roommate finds things she likes here.) Like the zillons of other reviewers have already noted, it is BYOB, and they don't take reservations unless you're in a larger group. There were still a few tables for two open when my date and I got here at 7 p.m. on a weekday, though I'd definitely expect a wait on the weekend.

So we finally made it to Tango Sur this past Saturday. What can I say? This little gem is located in a great neighborhood and it is an amazing place! It was very crowded and now I understand why you definitely have to have reservations. I was a little nervous about the service since I came across a few reviews that were very negative but the service was superb. It is BYOB with NO corking fees so this contributed to an even better experience than I expected.  As for the quality of the food, my friend ordered this appetizer that I fell in love with. It was some sort of queso fundido which was creamy, gooey, and bad on so many levels but oh so good. The warm bread and butter they served at first wasn't far behind the quality of the queso. For dinner I ordered a filet mignon which was complimented by some rather large potatoes that resembled steak fries and to my surprise, there were TWO medallions of steak on the plate. Needless to say I had to take one home.  On another note, at times it got a little noisy but this was mainly due to the tacky singing of the birthday celebration behind us. For a second I thought I was at the Olive Garden. Also, bring a flash light with you so that you can see the menu because it is a romantically dark atmosphere and only a few candles shed light. Finally, there was only one restroom for the entire establishment and there was always a line formed outside. I apologize in advance to all the ladies because some guys have horrible aim and they don't clean up after themselves. All in all, it was a good experience and although I would return I can't see myself running back anytime soon. One other thing, they don't have a website so do your research.

Went there this past weekend for my sister's BDay! The Food was great & liked that it was BYOB :-) The pricing was reasonable too. My only complaint is the parking, everything is permit parking since it's near Wrigley...So I recommend to come early to find public parking & make reservations because it gets packed!

This will be my fourth time here. Many being special occasions. But this was one of my favorite crowds. First time was for a bachelor party the second was with a bunch of couples the third was for another bachelor party and this fourth time was the most fun. Anyway getting a reservation was as usual with the very blunt receptionist. But after deciding on a date based on everyones availability we got there and ended up waiting 25mins past our reservation time because the restaurant was behind schedule. Well it kinda worked out because 2 of our friends were running kind of late and the friends we came with took a while to find parking. The hosts treat the guests like were at a night club. Unless you have a reservation you are not allowed in the waiting room. Which kind of sucked because it was cold out and we had to wait about 15mins in the cold. But anyways we got in and only waited another 5mins until we were sat down. Everything after that was a pleasant experience. Everytime I go I order the Bife Ancho. That's the boneless rib eye. 3 out of 4 times I was in bovine heaven! Only once was the meat a little tough. This time it was simply divine. I'm not a bragger by nature but I thought my steak was the best choice out of everyone elses. Yes filet mignon is great for those that love tender lean meat but if you want a super juicy cut with tenderness while it's still mooing, order the Bife Ancho medium rare. Although I prefer baked empanadas my wifes ham and cheese empanadas were good. The bread they bring out also freshly baked. We also shared dessert with everyone. The flan was good except for the caramel being way too sweet. I should've had an espresso with it to balance the flavors. Overall it was a lovely evening. I understand it gets crowded but the customer service up front is a little to be desired. I'll be back but I don't know when.

If you can come a little earlier on a Saturday evening, say 4pm, you're going to have a much easier experience with Tango Sur. This place is great, no matter what your price point is, you can find something here that you'll enjoy, from $15 to $50.

my sweetie took me here on a date and it was so long ago but all i remember was candlelight, lots of tasty food, chimichurri sauce, a singer with a guitar, and a really nice waiter.  the waiter gave me the impression that he was the owner because he knew so much about the food and was passionate and proud about the menu.  they even got me hooked on sweetbreads (not a baked good)

When there are so many different, ethnic and American steakhouses in Chicago, you have to be special and unique to really separate yourself from the pack.  The food is truly special with generous portions, but when I weigh that with the inconvenience of parking in the neighborhood, the long wait to be seated, served and checked-out, over-crowding and the unfriendliest wait staff in town, I find myself chosing someplace else.  I'm hoping someday, they will move to a larger space with more parking options than street.  I can deal with the staff that won't say two words to me and pretend I'm dining in Europe where it takes three hours to get in and out for dinner in exchange for the splendid food.  Until then, I pass.

yummy. I had the skirt steak, in the past tried the Vesuvius. GF is vegetarian and had an eggplant and cheese kind of lasagna. Food is great, good value. It's BYOB, service is excellent. I tend not to go at busy times you will have to wait., I don't wait well.  Large servings

I LOVE Tango Sur! I was here for a LARGE party- only about 19 or so of us got together to celebrate my cousins engagement. BYOB definitely helps for large groups and I dont believe there is a corkage fee. The staff was quick and on top of it without any errors- impressive if you consider a party of our size.  The food was unreal- I had the filet- it was enough food to feed a small village, and the steak was among the best I have ever had. We also ordered the empanadas- very good, and the melted argentinian cheese, which was topped with roasted red peppers- it was amazing.  I was pleasantly surprised with this place. Prices were excellent, ambiance and decor of this place would imply that it was much pricier than it is. Great place to go out to a nice dinner.  FYI- we had reservations for 9pm, and didnt get seated until 930 or so.

Unlike anything I've every experienced. I'm convinced that bathing in their Chimichurri sauce may have rejuvenating qualities, similar to the fountain of youth, but for now I'm content with dipping my steak in it. Everything we ordered was delicious...everything. Order as much as you can and bring an extra stomach. The atmosphere is great, I love the fact that its BYOB, and the location rocks. Tango Sur is a MUST visit if you enjoy steak and live anywhere near Chicago...and by 'near' I mean anywhere in the United States...or Canada for that matter.

Truly, I must make a return visit to this fine establishment sometime when I haven't been to an open bar beforehand.  And not on a Friday during Lent, when I am trying to not eat meat.  That said, the empanadas were so completely out of this world.  My friend and I also split the Berenjena -  oven baked eggplant layered with spinach, provolone, parmesan and ricotta, served with a delicious tomato cream sauce.  Words cannot describe how fantastic it was.  I will say, be sure to get reservations if you want to come here because it gets PACKED.

There is a pretty long wait, even on week nights. Don't be discouraged, because it is well worth it, It is a small dining area, so even waiting room is limited, but once you are seated you are comfortable and ready to eat. It is BYOB, which makes it great to begin with but also the food is just superb. The prices a very reasonable for the portion sizes. I had the fillet and it came with not 1 but 2 fillets. The sauces and side dishes compliment the main dishes. The serenading gentleman let our friend play his guitar and join in on the entertainment.

another 5 star for tango.  although, im putting 5 star just to be a groupy with all the other yelpers.  people on yelp do need to get their own opinion and not be influenced by everything else that other yelpers say.  i live in lakeview, lived in lakeview for many years, and I have been to tango many many times, it is a great place.  but it is also not consistent, and  it is cheap and it is BYOB.  so, sometimes this place is a 2 star, then sometimes it is a 4 star, or maybe three star, and sometimes it is a 5 star.  i would not say that it is a 5 star all the time, i would say it misses 5 star most of the time.  but im going to read all these yelpers and be influenced by their reviews, so i had to put 5star!!!  go to this place once a week, and order the rib-eye; it will be different everytime you order it, and then go to yelp and give them 5 star.

Great place for a date or with a group- very cozy! Delicious food from appetizer thru dessert! Portions are so large I recommend sharing and if you do, you'll still leave satisfied. BYOB is also a plus.

This is a romantic place to have a date.  It's very dark inside but I certainly didn't mind it.  The price of the food is not bad at all give that they give big portions.  I had the El filet and it was cooked to my perfection.  I would definitely come back here again and service is great! The wait may be long but it is so worth the wait!

I mean, come on, as if this place really needs another rave review. But, I cannot help it. It is FANTASTIC! This is by far the best byob in the city. Vegetarians beware this is an Argentina meat place (they order their beef from there, free range not this factory farmed crap). The filet I ordered off the special list was simply divine. Best I have ever had. The sause was delicious and the spinach mashed potatoes-nice work never thought of combining the two. Thanks to the server that recommended it. My mom got the salmon and cleaned her plate. Best meal I have had in a while, and i go to a lot of very expensive and nice steakhouses. Ugh, I want to go back now!

To avoid the 2 hours wait as everyone says, we came here at 5:30 on the Sunday night. Brought 2 bottle of wines with us as well. One last table left, surprise surprise! Listen to the recommendations from waiters, people! They know what is good. We ordered 4 different steaks for each of us, and tasted around others... YUMMY! I'm not a meat person, so I even couldn't finish the half of the steak, which the size is about as big as my head. But everything tasted perfect! And the simple old fashioned candle make the whole experience even better. Anyway, a hint for everyone wants to try here: Only on Sunday they take RSVP for 4! If you don't want to wait.

I am a big fan of this place, crowded intimate setting and best of all BYOB with no corking fee... and the food is pretty good too ;-).  When my family visits from south carolina I plan on taking them here.

This is my favorite steak restaurant in the city. I would go there just to eat their empanadas, which have to be the best in the world. I don't know what they put in them, but those chicken empanadas combined with their chimichurri sauce are ridiculously good.  The last three times we've been here, my girlfriend and I have split the Vesuvius which is really good. There isn't much I can't say about this place that hasn't already been said. The wait can be long and they typically only take reservations for large parties. Regardless, grab a good bottle of Argentinian wine and head to the best BYOB restaurant in the city if you want an excellent dining experience.

One of my favorite restaurants in the city, Tango Sur is really the best and is always a go-to place for a meal that I know I will enjoy.  It is perfect for a date, special occasion, group party, whatever you're in the mood for.  The food is really amazing, and everything is a must-try.  I mean everything! I have been there so many times, I can't review all that I have eaten, but it's all been wonderful.  The portions can be large - so you might want to consider sharing, and the food can be filling, so don't plan on going to the club for dancing afterwards. Try things on this menu that you have never heard of, because you will not have them anywhere else. The restaurant is dark.  I think it is only lit by candles at each table.  They serve food late (11:30pm) on Saturdays.  They don't take reservations, and I have waited upwards of 3 hours on a Saturday night.  But you can go there, put your name in, give them your #, and they'll contact you 5-10 minutes before you will be seated.  You can leave during this time, or drink it up in the back room while you wait. The outdoor patio in the summer is one of the best!

Yum! If you're in the mood for a big juicy stake that no one can see you eating...you found your spot. Super cramped, super cute, candle lit meat eater heaven. Those candles on the pics you see are the only lighting....love that. Long waits, no reservations (thus 4 vs.5 stars) taken. Yummy epinadas and filet among other things. Hard to believe prices. BYOB makes it even more romantic.

Went here on a Saturday  night around 9pm. The place was totally packed. We waited about 30 minutes but that could be because we had reservations for 6 but 2 didn't show so we had to go to the wait list so we may have been bumped up. Most times you can expect 1-2 hour wait. Setting- This place is very small and always packed. Tables close together. there is a small waiting room in the back were you can drink what you have with you. (BYOB) No corkage fee. They will bring you buckets to chill your wine or beer. It is bustling and loud and cramped. Food- Vegetarians and Fish eaters need not apply. While there are a few items on the menu most of it is Meat. The Empanadas were awesome and each entree comes with a basic salad. We all had something different and it was all out of this world! The EL FILET might have been the best Filet I have ever had. 2 9oz Filets in a wine sauce (YES 2!) for $25..are you kidding?! Awesome. Others had the Flap meat (which was served on a table grill and was ginormous! Serves 2) Salmon and Ribeye (which looked like Fred Flinstone was carrying it) The portion sizes could feed 2 sometimes 3 people and the prices were reasonable for the amount of food you get. Also, everything was cooked to perfection. Drinks- BYOB. No corkage fee and the wait staff was more than happy to bring buckets to chill the wine and beer. Waitstaff- This place is super cramped and always busy so you can expect some problems. However we did not have any problems  whatsoever. They were attentive, the food came out in a reasonable time frame and we did not feel rushed at all. Could be it was after 9 but the place was still packed.  Bottom line - Its going to be busy and crowded and you may wait a really long time. So bring some drinks get some friends together and expect to have some of the best Steaks and Argentinian food you have ever had. Run don't walk to Tango Sur!!!

Great food, particularly the steaks. There is always a wait but in the back of the restaurant is a room where you can sit while you wait and uncork the first bottle of wine that you brought. The portion sizes are large and you may just need a nap after your meal. The music and candlelit tables create a comfortable atmosphere and a great date spot. I really like this place, except for one particular waiter. He offers no help with the menu, doesn't smile and generally seems pretty ticked off. So, other than that guy I really like the place.

I honestly debated here whether to give this place 3 stars or 4 stars as I feel Tango Sur is a mixed bag.  Yes the steak is amazing...particularly for the price.  Yes its a hip restaurant that everyone loves.  But the service is questionable at times.....I've had to send a couple steaks back because I'm the type of person that will never pay for a steak if it isn't cooked the way I like.  And getting into the restaurant is a nightmare as well as we all know and once you're inside, its not spacious at all.  The noise level borders on humerous and its very dark in there which might be an issue for some.  I often wonder if the place would be as popular if they got rid of their BYOB policy, but thankfully that remains intact.  And the food quality is excellent when they get it right....its truly one of those places people crave every few months or so.   Overall, its definitely a place everyone in Chicago should try and I do think you get good value for your money.  You just have to be willing to put up with some possible snags in your evening when it comes to getting in there.
I save red meat for special occasions, this was just that! It was a bit loud and darker than I'd normally attempt to dine in but very ideal for a romantic date.

This is the most authentic Argentinian restaurant my husband and I have been to other than in Argentina.  It's BYO for liquor,  but, amazingly enough, the CVS down the street has a decent selection of wine. Service is truly great and also,  authentic, because they are all Argentinian!  If you are in the area this place is a MUST!!!!!

Solid 4.5. Tango sur is the place my man and I go when ever we just want some delicious meat and savory chimmichurri, and we don't want to pay seriously inflated Chicago steakhouse prices. It's byob and right across the street is a wine shoppe called que syrah. They are extremely helpful and even offer recommendations if you tell them you are going to tango sur. Also, down the street, there is a huge, new jewel osco and a CVS, that has an impressively extensive wine selection. No corkage fee, so drink away. They have solid empanadas but I wanted to try something new (and a tad healthier), so I tried the Berenjena En Escabeche which is sliced eggplant marinated in vinegar, garlic and olive oil. It is a cold salad dish. It was refreshing and a perfect balance of savory and flavorful. I was surprised with how much I liked it. Next came the salad, which come with everything. Nothing special though...lettuce, two tomato slices, couple of raw red onion rings served with red wine vinegar and olive oil. I had the el filet cooked medium rare. It's 2 pieces of filet 7-8 ounces, a piece! For $24! Which means you get darn near a pound of delicious grilled premium meat, mid-winter for less than what it would cost at jewel...on sale. I can only get through one and I substitute  the spinach mash potatoes for roasted potato spears seasoned with garlic, rosemary, salt and pepper. I always have a meal for the following day and there chimmichurri is the best in the city.  I am aware they have dessert, but have never had the room for it. And believe you me, I can make room for dessert. Some day, some day. I have never had anything but stellar service and perfect pace of experience. My last time I sat in the front room, right next to the window, which I thought might have been chilly but I felt no drafts and the light from the street made it easy to read the menu (which if you are in the back room, you have only a single candle by which to read the menu). Overall, I love tango sur and never had to wait more than half an hour. Perfect!

Before meeting up with some college buddy's in Chicago, my wife and I decided to try Tango Sur after hearing some good reviews.  We arrived at 8:00 on the head and were told it would be a 45 minute wait.  No problem, we expected this and went belly-up a few doors down.  After 50 minutes and no call, we closed out our tab and decided to wait in the restaurants back waiting room.  On our way in the host informed us that we were 2nd on the waiting list and we should have a table shortly.  After 30 minutes of waiting and  seeing 4 groups get seated ahead of us, I kindly inquired once again where we were on the list and how long the wait would be.  Out of nowhere the host (Dressed up nicely is a grey hooded sweatshirt) throws a temper tantrum and tells me that we can leave if we are not willing to wait.  Nice service D-bag.  With no other options, we waited for another 15+ minutes before we were seated.  We ordered one of the meat entrees for two and were not very impressed with it.  I have a feeling it was slightly under cooked as the waiter knew we were in a rush and running very late.  In all reality the waiter did a great job to apologize for our wait and the actions of the host (Only reason they don't get 1 star), but it is kind of hard to give these guys a second chance after how we were treated.

What's one more review? Love the BYOB and no corkage fee. It's small in here, but if you're okay with that, it shouldn't be a problem. My only complaint is that the rib eye was fatty. I had to cut around a lot of fat to get to the promise land. I should have gone with the filet. Empanadas are delicious and filling. The check was very reasonable thanks to BYOB!

The food was excellent and the staff was friendly and will definitely go back as both  the quality of the food and the experience was beyond the average restaurant.  However, we didn't like the following; -our host was pushy, and seems to like "window dress the restaurant" as he was forcing us to sit right next to all other guests by the window to show the restaurant was full, despite us being more interested in sitting in private (no need for this, we got their 20 min after the opening and within 40 min the place was full!) -do something about the lighting, half of the time we couldn't even see our food and the lighting was so low that even the car lights from the street were bothering our eyes -we had to send back our meat as medium-well ended being medium-rare to bloody in the middle and even after that we ended up with a medium only.  But despite these we do like their food and will go back and hope for a better experience

My husband and I went her last weekend for our anniversary. We got there at 5:45 and waited for an hour to be seated as they only seat/take reservations for large parties! Urgh...I was starving and we were supposed to so to a show and we could not do that. So get there early. The food came pretty fast though. It's great to BYOB as you can bring your fav beverage. We tried the empanadas and they were delicious! Also loved the meat and cheese tray. It had really great tasting ham and prosciutto and cheese. For our entree my husband had the stuffed beef and he loved it. I had the filet Mignon for $24! with veggies and they were two big steaks and I could only eat half of one and I brought the other one home. It's def a lot of food for the money and the steaks were SO delicious and they just melt in your mouth. The ambiance? uhm..it's very dark and really loud and they should not play music in there as it's too much!  Next time I go there I think I'll get there when they open at 5:30.

Tango Sur is the (Mt.) Everest of Chicago restaurants.  Many will come, few will eat.  Luckily there's this little back room (think of it as the supplemental oxygen) where you can booze to you hearts content while waiting out the masses. I came at 10:00pm for a reservation for 8, they conveniently messed up my reservation and we weren't seated until 10:40... I'm not sure if it was the 10 prior drinks or the recent trip to Buenos Aires, but I thought Tango Sur was the SH*T.  Seriously, if I actually lived in this remote barren wasteland I would be there every night.  Alas, I live in the land of overpriced dates and can only dream of my next summit.   Go here once.  That's probably enough.

I could have given them five stars, but minus one star is for the time when I was waiting to get a seat.  Last time when I was there for my birthday dinner with my boyfriend, I waited for about an hour I think.   I understand since this place gets a lot of people.  I know that they have great food; BYOB does a lot to this place.     Whenever I go, I always have a great waiter.  You know, you feel great when you are treated as you were supposed to:) If you haven't gone to this restaurant, please go and try.  You will have a great time with awesome food.   Oh, I just remember getting free dessert after the waiter asked me if it was my birthday.  See, you should go and try great service.
My absolute favorite steakhouse on the planet- amazing food, prices and BYOB.  What else can you ask for?

Had no problem making reservations on the same day for 9 people.  Of course, I had to order the Para Dos again (asado, vacio, chorizo, molleja y morcilla con ensalada for two: grilled short ribs, flap meat sausage beef sweetbread and black sausage)...how could we not when it's only $27 for two people?  We also tried the "Jamon Crudo Con Palmito Y Salsa Golf Prosciutto served with hearts of palms accompanied with an argentine golf sauce" (just because I love prosciutto and hearts of palm).  And the chimichurri sauce is to die for. I still love it just as much as before...and even more so that we can get a big group together and share some wine without a long wait.
awesome steaks, awesome BYOB w/ no corkage fee. no reservations, expect to wait. Check in then walk to Jewel to pick up your drinks to make the most of your time

I'm"m not big on Argentinian food, but this place is something else. You pretty much get what you pay for. My friend and I decided to get the grill steak dinner for two. This amazing dish came with so much meat two of us would never have been able to finish it in one sitting. It came with a salad but who cares, we were here for the meat. The steaks and sausage came on a little tabletop grill and you got two skirt steaks, two short ribs and two Chorizo sausages. The steaks were cooked to perfection and very tasty. I also had their tongue appetizer and empanadas also very good. This would be a great place for a date and impress her/him but be warned the restaurant is dark and the atmosphere loud and make sure you get a reservation.

This is my second time at Tango Sur, and everything was wonderful and perfect, just like I hoped!  Perfectly cooked meat, wonderful price per portion ratio, water glass was never empty, friendly server, only one thing was off about our night... ... I came with a date and when we entered, a tall, thin man approached the doorway, staring at us. At first, I moved out of the way, thinking he was trying to exit. After a few moments of awkward pauses, my date finally asked if this man knew about our reservation.  "Go wait in the waiting room." Then he left. If my date didn't know where the waiting room was, I would have probably turned around and left. I have never felt so uncomfortable and unwelcomed by someone who is supposed to be a host. It changed the atmosphere and tone of the evening, I didn't feel like being there until I started eating. I'm glad I stuck around because, it's true what you hear about the food at Tango Sur.  EXCELLENT.  I also have to mention that we came in at 8:30 on a Sunday night right before Valentine's day, so it was definitely packed. Even still, there should be some patience and professionalism from the host of a busy restaurant.
Candle lights, deliciously prepared steaks, and you get to bring your own perfect wine!!

At locationally blessed Tango Sur, BYOB is the primary draw, resulting in crowds, lines, and a scene, which is the secondary draw.  Apparently that's good enough for yelpers.  Tango Sur slings heaps of low quality meat, so if you're going for the food, prepare to be disappointed.
Delicious food and lots of it, friendly and efficient service! One of the best BYOB I have been to in Chicago.

Probably the only "5 star" worthy restaurant I've ever been too....so far. I'm a HUGE fan of meat and potatoes and Tang Sur definitely fills my appetite. I just wish it wasn't so busy at times. It's all good though because there are some choice bars around the area in which you can grab a drink and just come back when they call your cell.  The BYOB touch is also what makes this place worthy of checking out. Enjoying your favorite glass of wine along with a tender filet of meat definitely goes without saying.

We had an appetizer, the grill for two and the lomo relleno and a desert and it came out to about 100 bucks - but it was totally worth it.  Leftovers were good for another meal too. The lomo relleno flavor is good, but it it alot of one thing, so I suggest ordering if you have at least 3 people at the table.  The mushroom sauce is tasty.  The best to me was the flank steak (close second were ribs) on the grill for two combined with the chimihurri sauce? yummmmmmm... no rice here though for those that might want some. recommend the brazilian soda guarana to wash this tasty meal all down!

I went to Tango Sur this past Saturday with 13 other girls for my sisters birthday and it was AMAZING in both food and atmosphere. Bottles of wine were flowing all around us in the warm, packed candle-lit room. I had the bife visuvio and it was soooo freaking good. They also bring out this sauce for everyone to dip their food in and it was the topic of conversation for the rest of the night (delicious but woah garlic). The servers are all a pleasure to look at and speak with as well.  WARNING: They are always super busy but only take reservations for parties of 6+ otherwise plan to wait in the "waiting area" in the back of the restaurant where you can drink too. Also, portions are very large so be prepared to have left overs if you don't share with someone.

Best value in the city.  One of my top 10 favorite restaurants in the city.  Wish is wasn't so popular though.  Only downside is the no reservations and wait time.  I always get the churrasco with chimichurri and mashed potatoes.  It is phenomenal.  I also always enjoy the rolls and fresh salad.  Wish I lived closer again.  When I lived down the street, we could call ahead, put our name in, and wait for them to call us when our table was ready.  So, if you live nearby - that is the way to go :-)

Tried Tango Sur for the first time last Sunday based on a friend's recommendation.  All of the negative parts of reviews I read on Yelp totally did not come true.  If you want a relatively quiet, relaxing dinner, try Tango Sur on a Sunday around 5-5:30.  That is not too early, and much to our delight, our party of 4 did not have to wait one minute for a table.  Granted, by about 6:30 it did seem to be mostly full.  The staff and our waiter were all very friendly, and the food was excellent.  I had the Bife Vesuvio which garners my only criticism, because, while it was very tasty, the meat was a bit inconsistent, meaning some parts of the meat were cooked rare, while others were nice and medium.  I am not too picky about my steaks, as long as they taste good, but I would have liked a medium cooked steak all the way through.   On a side note, two people in our party did not order steaks, one ordered the eggplant dish, which was like an eggplant lasagna, and the other ordered the Chilean sea bass.  Both LOVED the dishes.  Not a bite was left by everyone, I even finished off the HUGE portion of Bife Vesuvio that I ordered.  Overall, I would definitely go back.  They have a large menu with a lot of other cuts of meat I am dying to try!

I'd been wanting to try Tango Sur for quite a long time so my wife and I decided to take a friend there to celebrate his birthday. We arrived right on time and only had to wait a minute or two to be seated in the very loud and lively "second" dining room. Our server arrived immediately and scooped up our BYOB beer and wine to put on ice. We ordered a selection of empanadas (delish!) and the provoleta 'queso' that was unremarkable, but tasty when accompanied by the crusty bread already on the table. For entrees, the carnivores thoroughly enjoyed 'El Filet', a T-bone and the veal chop. The filet was huge (two pieces) and I was only able to finish half so the leftovers made for an extra-special lunch the next day. My wife isn't much of a meat-eater so she went for one of the ravioli dishes. She wasn't terribly impressed with Argentine pasta, but couldn't stop stealing bites of my huge filet so all was well with the world. Overall a very nice evening. My only gripe was that the acoustics are such that we found ourselves shouting across the table at each other. Worked out just fine for a wine-soaked evening, though. :)
This place is amazing. The portions are incredibly large,  food  for two days. The melted cheese app is to die for as are the empanadas. I have no problem waiting to eat a meal here.
If you go on a Friday or Saturday night expect to wait 2 hours, minimum.  I love the steaks, the byob, and the atmosphere, but 2 hours is ridiculous.   I"m never coming here on a weekend again.

I'm really disappointed with Tango Sur. I went last night around 9:30PM and a group of 5 ahead of me spoke to the waiter in Spanish to snag a table. Rather than pull out the same card (which I guess I regret now) I gave him my name and number after he told me it'd be a 45 min. wait. In the meantime, my friend and I went to get a cup of tea a couple blocks back. After 45 min we called only to hear that there'd be another 45 min wait and that my info had mysteriously disappeared. Listen, if you're too busy to take customers, then just be upfront! Don't make someone wait around, if you have no intention of giving them a table. In retrospect, I should've made a reservation, but I didn't think it would be necessary for a table for two.  What a bummer since this place seems to have gotten so many good reviews. Not to mention I traveled all the way from Hyde Park. It's a damn trek!

Came here with a few friends who were smart enough to BYOB - always a perk, especially when it's a great restaurant.  I got "El Filet" which is so, so good. Two thick pieces cooked to a perfect medium rare. Gorgeous. Generously top them with that herbed oil they send out and you've got a good 2-meals worth of greatness. I was not impressed by the spinach mashed potatoes, but they were a nice green color, so at least they looked pretty. I'm also not a fan of mashed potatoes in general, though. All in all, love it, but I will say that the same owners opened up Folklore in Wicker Park. The menu is really similar, if not identical, and I like the ambiance in Folklore more than here.

I joined yelp, ONLY because of my AWFUL experience with Tango Sur! And I am only giving one star, because they make you give at least one or else it would be -10..... My friend made a reservation more than a week before today (for another friend's birthday dinner). We arrived at Tango Sur at our reservation time and the owner/host faltered between two very different stories about why he didn't have a reservation noted for us... 1st, he said that we were supposed to confirm the reservation hours before our arrival and apparently we didn't so... no table (ok, that's fine if a restaurant wants to have this type of policy - but no one told my friend to do so when she made the original reservation).... and 2nd, he told us that the restaurant had tried calling my friend this AM to confirm, but she didn't answer (umm, ZERO missed calls on my friend's phone from today). OK, make up your mind and pick a story! Aside from the owner/host's fabricated stories.... he had an AWFUL attitude and was not very friendly. Since Tango Sur told us we would have to wait at least another hour to be seated, we moved down the street and found another fabulous BYOB that would accommodate our group of 7.... I highly recommend saving your time at Tango Sur. Go to Frida instead!!! It is BYOB and Mexican food... yummy. Plus, the host and wait staff were super nice/accommodating. Tango Sur might be delicious and cheap, but I will NEVER spend another $$$ there. Go to Frida!

Dear Tango Sur,  I love you. Yes, I have loved you for as long as I've been able to partake in your lovely BYOB policy.  But your rushed, surly waitstaff grate on my nerves. And how the Hell am I supposed to read the menu when it's so freakin' DARK inside?! We vowed to bring a flashlight next time so we can actually see what it is we're eating.  I used to complain about the noise level. However, now I enjoy it because my baby was screaming away and no one heard him over the deafining dining roar.  That being said, your chimchurri sauce is liquid heaven and I could drown in it and die a happy girl.  Invest in more candles,  Me

Great BYOB on Southport/lakeview! If you are a red meat lover, this is your place. The eggplant appetizer and the empanadas are my favorite dishes on the menu. I'm not a big red meat eater, but am always happy with their veal and chicken dishes. The portions are large enough to serve you and your dining partner. Anything with the Chimichurri sauce is delicious! It loses one star because the inside is a rather dark and noisy. Also...step into the grocer next store if you are in the mood for some of those empanadas or other meats from the deli!

This would probably be 3 stars, if it were not for the host.  Seriously, what is up with the @sshat of a host?  He was so off-putting when my party got there that we almost walked down the street. I digress. I have definitely had better steak in the city. I also am not one to complain about doneness of steak.  I know it's hard to get right in a large kitchen. That said, I was not asked how I wanted it prepared, and it came out medium-well.  Not ideal for me. My co-diner got the same dish, and his was probably medium.  And my friend who ordered her dish medium has a definitely RARE piece of meat.  When she talked to the waiter, he was gracious and took it back to the kitchen.  But, when it came back, it was as if the kitchen had nuked the plate, and the meat was inedible.

Candelit dinner... huge chunks of roasted meat.. BYOB! what's not to like? Sigh I really wanted to love this place...Unfortunately, the meat was rather chewy...which has been mentioned in other reviews.  I had the El filet (most popular dish) which is a filet mignon with side of spinach mashed potatoes. And it was not as tender as expected. Filet mignon is supposed to be like the butter of all steaks but this was not. Sad. Anyway everything smelled tantalizing and delicious, but at one point it became like overwhelming. It's like that feeling when you first walk into a Chinese buffet and you are like HOLY CRAP THAT SMELLS GOOD! and then you walk out never wanting to smell that chinese food again. It was something like that on a smaller scale.   And I had tried bites of my other friends' dishes which were all good but not mind-blowing. The presentation for the dishes for two looked like an amazing smorgasbord of meat meat meat. The flavors were great especially the chimichurri sauce which was like crack. Even though my dish didn't come with that sauce, I asked for some, and the waiter was great about accommodating (and brought me TWO!)  The service was excellent even though it was very hectic inside.  They do charge a plating fee if you bring a dessert/cake for a birthday etc. ($1.75/person). They also take reservations for larger groups (but not for smaller ones! so beware).  Overall, not particularly enthused one way or the other. Love the BYOB of course, but the meal felt really heavy. And the salad was probably the worst salad concocted that I've seen at a restaurant (lettuce+tomatoes+onions--- no dressing-- just vinegar and oil on table). Maybe I just don't get it? Is this an Argentinian thing? Overall great, fun ambiance just sorta disappointed in quality of meat.

The lady friend took me here last night for my birthday. It is labeled as an Argentine grill. She called and got reservation for 8 pm, but on a Tuesday, it wasn't really necessary. I will preempt by saying I have only lived in Chicago for a couple months. I had been to BYOBs, but I didn't realize that really nice restaurants do this as well as your local burger place. Now, we sat in the backroom. Very romantic, if you're into that sort of thing. There was a guy playing a guitar throughout the night. Lighting is almost strictly candlelight. Fun stuff. I spent a month this past Spring in Argentina. Spent time traveling, so I had meals from Mendoza to Buenos Aires. I had some of the best steak and wine I had ever enjoyed in my life, and typically for less than $10 combined. So when she surprised me with this place, I was excited to see how it compared. Let's just say I was surprised. The lady is a vegetarian and lactose intolerant, which means going out to eat doesn't involve a lot of sharing. She ordered Pez, a salmon dish. I had about 5 things on the menu I was interested in, so I asked our server what he suggested. He said to get El Filet. he said "It would single-handedly make me come back for more" Ok. Challenge accepted. I also ordered a single Spinach & Cheese Empanada. We had brought a Merlot and a Malbec to drink with the meal. Popped the Merlot for pre-dinner so I could save the Malbec for the steak. The Empanada was very good. Extremely fresh and flavorful. It came with what I assume was an olive oil & pesto side for dipping. Also good, though not much is necessary due to the strong oil. Now, main course. The Filet came with a side of green potatoes (I looked and laughed a little to myself). I always get my steak rare, and typically this can make or break the meal. Too often the post-grill cooking within the meat is not accounted for and it is simply just bloody rather than cooked right. I give kudos to the chef because this was cooked expertly. Seared on the outside while extremely soft and chewy on the inside. And the flavor!! I am not lying when I say I had to put my fork and knife down after the first bite. It was PHENOMENAL! Perfect texture, taste, everything. I immediately told my date that it was hands down better than anything I had while in Argentina. The Malbec, though not the most expensive bottle, complimented it perfectly. The portion was enormous. I am a healthy eater, though I did not even finish half of my plate, of the filet or the potatoes. The potatoes were good. Very light and flavorful. The Pez was very good also. Obviously a fresh fish that wasn't just picked up at the local market. Our server told us it was fresh from Chile. It was served with a sauce of shiitake mushrooms, and as with the steak, cooked perfectly. I had a single bite, but acknowledge that it was a very good seafood option at an otherwise red meat-focused restaurant. I will be going back to Tango Sur as soon as my leftovers can be finished, which may take more than 1 attempt. Side note: Only open from 5-10/11 This is a fantastic date place as well as good for a small group of friends. The ambiance is great for a night that starts out quiet but after a few bottles of wine, turns into something a little bigger.

Went here for an after work dinner with coworkers. Staff was super professional, extremely helpful and attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu and preparations! Ambiance was nice, dark and candle lit. perfect for a date! Had appetizers which were darn good. Got to dinner and felt it was just OK. Had a steak and thought it had GREAT flavor, but the meats tended to be a bit chewy. HUGE PORTIONS! We also had an array of desserts, of which I am not a flan fan.... but wow, was the caramel flan terrific! Would love to go back and try a few other things! Over all a great experience, and we couldn't have been treated any better! BYOB is great too... No cork fee!

My favorite place for a great steak.  Excellent place and value!  The wait is well worth it and it's a BYOB!.   GAINED MY BUSINESS! trhey also have a lounge called "ñ"  which is a nice cozy place. perfect for taking dates  to a nite with friends.

This is a very romantic BYOB that has a tavernous steak restaurant feel. I ordered filet mignon with salad. The steak was perfectly cooked, flavored and cut like butter. Although the food was pricey, you have to keep in mind that you are getting two meals for the price of one. My dish had two 4 oz. filets with a hearty helping of herb roasted potatoes. I was yearning for something more with the salad. It was a bit of lettuce that was supposed to highlight a large slice of tomato. The tomato was kind of grainy, just wasn't great. It is not the season for tomatoes.  The meal would have been perfect if instead of surprise herb roasted potatoes (they were good), I got a nice salad with my steak. I really wanted steak with a bit of crispy lettuce, couple of onion rings, perhaps a cold boiled potato wedge, white raddish, and a high quality fresh tomato wedge or two with a light red wine vinaigrette.  Finished the meal off with the carrot cake which was delectable. Go here with a date.

not for the weak of heart.  Also, literally.  Huge slabs of argentinian beef, cooked to perfection.  BYOB without a corking fee.  Awesome.  The only concerning part was the drastic dimming of the lights as soon as our steaks arrived - pure coincidence, I am sure. Oh, and trust me on this - when Argentinians say: "this steak is perfect for two" - that means "four".

10,000 X's better than it's sister location folklore (holler at my review). Tango sur's menu is almost a mirror image with the difference of being BYOB versus folklore's full bar. The obvious alcohol thing aside the food preparation here is far and away better than folklore. Again see my review of folklore. Everything that went wrong food wise there was righted to near perfection here at tango sur. As with folklore, the value is incredible.

Tango Sur has become one of my favorite restaurants in the city. I went there recently and the waitstaff was very nice. It was not crowded, which was a nice because the area is not that. The steak I had was a good size and very reasonably priced. It came with potatoes that were cooked just right. Try the empanadas!

Tango Sur is phenomenal. A little gem amongst all the Southport burger pubs. A great place to take your significant other or a gathering of friends. The space is small and they don't take reservations for parties less than 6 so the wait, particularly in the summer, can be daunting, but have a drink at one of the bars across the street and please please please give it a chance. You will not be disappointed! I love the Bife Vesuvio! It's reasonably priced and you can eat on it for days! I've only been here twice and each time I've gotten it, but the rest of the menu looks awesome. Run, run, run to Tango Sur! They will have to roll you out I promise. Its that good!

Went to Tango Sur again recently and as always very good. Have been here now a number of times and they are always very consistant with their service and food. Though the servers arent as engaging as some other restaurants (probably due to the fact that they are busy) the food is always great. BYOB is also a plus. Never dissapointed when we come here!

This is by far the best value for a great meal in the city.  As you have read, they're a BYOB with no uncorking fee. The portions are HUGE! I quite literally order one dish with the understanding that I will be taking a whole other meal home for later. Also, no "A La Carte" menu with an $8 baked potato here. The dishes are served in their entirety and seasoned perfectly! The wait staff is very polite and helpful. They seem to take real pride in the restaurant.  Not only does Tengo Sur have great food and people, but the ambiance is something you won't find elsewhere. Each table has a candle lit for you. Bravo to saving energy and making it a part of the ambiance!! With the low lit setting, it's a perfect spot for an intimate dinner, whether that's the first date, a girls night out, or a 50th aniversary! I live and work in the southport corridor and constantly see a line down the block on the weekends and even sometimes on the week nights. In the winter,if you get there before 7 you're usually safe though. The summer's a whole different ball game. Calling ahead to see how busy it is may be your best bet.  No matter the occassion, Tengo Sur is at the top of the very long must experience list in Chicago! Enjoy!

My first time here for a friends birthday dinner.  I was very impressed.  We had about 15 people in our group and had made reservations.  We arrived and they seated us right away.  I like the atmosphere of this place, lit candles at every table, low lighting, very nice feel to the place.  The food I thought was excellent.  I was a little concerned I would not be able to find anything on the menu, considering I'm a vegetarian, but there was actually several options to pick from.  I ordered a corn and cheese empanada, which was fantastic.  They only have the spinach and a meat empanada listed on the menu, so you have to ask for the corn and cheese ones.  For the entree, I ordered the spinach ravioli with the tomato sauce.  Great flavor!  This place is also BYOB.  Definitely worth checking this place out if you are in the neighborhood.  Busy place though, so you may have a wait.

Dear Amigos at Tango Sur, You are such a charming restaurant!  You are so fantastically popular that you always have a waiting list going.  As your neighbors around the corner, we salute your thriving business when so many others on the block have shuttered. And yet, we ask, dear amigos, why?  Why the salads?  Even though we are neighbors, we do not understand your treatment of the uncooked vegetable.  Why are there hacked pieces of lowly iceberg lettuce and out-of- season,anemic, pink tomatoes?  Whatfore do you throw chunks of fresh mozarella onto these tired greens and call it a salad?  Why do you not imagine an actual vinaigrette instead of a contemptuous shaking of the oil and vinegar?  WHY? we ask. Now we know Argentina is a muy macho culture and meat is your thing.  But, dear amigos, is there not one shred of respect for the tradition of bounty in your beautiful land or even pride  in your Italian heritage that could lead you to serving salads that weren't well...so hostile to the idea of a salad? Perhaps you should ask yourselves these questions.  Maybe your answer would be to dispense with the salads altogether.  You would save yourselves the cost of the produce and the washing of the dishes.  Perhaps your diners could skip the ritual of the "salad course" and go directly to the meat.  I'm sure they would never notice.

Tango Sur makes me glad to be an carnivore. I've come here twice now,  and both times have been fantastic.  If it's summer time, I would recommend getting there early and snagging a seat outside for some great people watching.  Winter time, this is a lovely place to take your significant other.  The restaurant is split into two parts connected by a small hallway, and is lit only by a soft chandelier and candles.  Add some bottles of wine (no corkage!) and soft music, and you've got yourself an oxymoron -- a romantic steakhouse. I highly recommend the chicken empanada and the Parrillada (do Para Dos if you can!).  The meat is always flavorful and well-cooked, and we always end up taking half of it home (and we can eat A LOT OF MEAT).  The only thing I would advise against the Ensalada Paesana because it contains, literally, three huge balls of mozzarella, a small handful of cooked spinach and a few slices of red peppers.  Uh... not exactly the plate of veggies I expected. Server was helpful and friendly but never hovered, and best of all, he never tried to push a particular dish or dessert.   This has got to be one of my favorite places in Lakeview!
Great staff and best Grill platter and flan in town!

Suck it up people, you live in Chicago and you have to wait for a table here.  Go to another bar and leave your cell phone# - they will call when your table's ready.  If you want a quicker piece of meat, there's a Burger King up the road.   Get the El Filet

I've died and gone to meat heaven. Ok, maybe not but I came pretty darn close. Me and 13 of my meat loving pals decided to ring in the New Year (and the day of my birth) with lots and lots of meat (and booze). I'm going to keep my review short & sweet b/c I will not be telling you anything that has not already been said.  Tango Sur is MEAT heavy. The empanadas are delicious. The Parillada is a crazy delicious portion containing blood sausage, sweetbreads, chorizo, and two different cuts of MEAT! The sweet breads were some of the best I've ever had. The chimichurri sauce was the bomb and the flan (bought out for yours truly) was creamy and sublime. One of my fellow diners claimed it was almost as good as his grandma's - now THAT is something!  We ordered a couple other appetizers for the table along side the empanadas. Total with tip came out to $28/per person which was quite the deal considering the amount of food that was ordered...many people walked out with to-go boxes. Tango Sur is BYOB with NO corkage fee! Score!  I read about long waits at Tango Sur, while this might be true...that was not the case for us as we had a reservation. You thought they didn't take resos? Well they do...for parties of 8 or more. Knowledge is power. Stay hungry my friends!

Every once in a while, Tango Sur, you tarnish the esteem I hold for you.  Thursday was one such time.  We have learned through trial and error to go there when it's not terribly crowded (read: NOT Friday or Saturday), because the steaks tend to be better when your chefs aren't so busy.  Unfortunately, our logic didn't hold true this time around...my husband ordered the bone-in rib-eye and wrestled through dinner with a gristly, tough cut of meat.  Ordering error?  Maybe, since he usually orders the strip steak.  But in a steakhouse, all the cuts should be of good quality.  And the DULL steak knives sure didn't help the situation.  The other entrees our party ordered were well prepared, but we might hesitate ever so slightly when deciding whether or not to go back.  But we'll probably return, as the allure of BYOB is too strong to resist.  Perhaps we'll BYO steak knives as well?

Holy cow was that good.  We took our daughter here to celebrate her birthday.  I was apprehensive about trying something new for a birthday meal but boy were we happy we did.  The place is dark as its only lit but candles on the table.  Its kind of hard to read the menu but our awesome waiter Eduardo made suggestions that were right on the mark.  We started with a chilled seafood appetizer.  It was $10 and we got a huge plate of crab legs, octopus, mussels, shrimp and we also ordered 2 empenadas, 1 chicken and 1 beef.  After eating that alone we were pretty full and we only ate about 1/2 the seafood.  The Chimichurra sauce that came with the empanadas was awesome and we put in on everything served to us.   For our main course we ordered the La Filet which me and my daughter split, and my husband ordered prime strip steak that was a special for the evening.  The filet came with 2 steaks and was $24.  It was tender and seasoned perfectly.  The spinach mash potatoes that accompanied the steak was so good as well.  My husband loved his strip steak and the roasted potatoes that accompanied his dish.  For dessert we shared a Flan and had espresso with milk.  I have never ate Flan that tasted that good.  If I would have known how awesome dessert was I never would have eaten so much of my dinner!! The meal was amazing, the prices are extremely reasonable and our server Eduardo was perfect.   We went on a Sunday at 4:45 and it almost full when we got there and when we were leaving at 6:30, there was a wait for a table.   Also, its a BYO with no corkage fee.  Cant go wrong at this place!!!

Girls night dinner...check  Two bottles of wine...check  No corkage fee...AWESOME!  An awesome night with the ladies what better place to go to then Tango Sur. I've heard so much about this place and we decided to head over to TS for some dinner, wine and great convo.  We walked into this dark lit place and asked if we could be seated for a party of four. Lucky for us there was a table right by the window. We asked to have our 1st bottle of wine uncorked and we started to figure out what we wanted to order. We started off with an order of Spanish and chicken empanadas. I have to say that I've had better empanadas but I can't say that it wasn't good.  OK, dinner time. I ordered the breaded chicken with a side order of potato's. I didn't eat any of the potato's so I can't comment on how those tasted but I can say that the chicken was very delicious.  Over all I have to say that my first experience of Tango Sur was a wonderful time but I believe its because of the great company that I was with.

Tango Sur is definitely not for the weak-stomached, serving up generous portions of meat prepared in a uniquely Argentinian style. Also, it's affordable! Move over expensive South American steakhouses in Chicago!  My recommendations are to try some empanadas, the melted cheese appetizer, and then take half of your steak home, because you need to have the house flan, too (I hate flan...Hate it. But I couldn't help but eat all of the flan the server recommended...it was delicious).  My only complaint is that large groups tend to drown out conversations from smaller tables (The BYOB contributes to their rowdiness? Sure.). Also, the wait can be staggering and there isn't a lot of room to wait for an open table. Still, it's a very cool experience and worth checking out.

I have turned into a meatatarian....from a vegetarian....dont ask how it happened, but I love meat now. We went here with a party of 14....very large party...Tango Sur accommodated us well.  We were loud, obnoxious, inattentive to the servers and they were pretty good about keeping on top of us.  I had some chicken....I dont remember what it was because I was a couple of bottles in (BONUS to BYOB!!).  It was great...with some veggies and of course, more wine. The bill was so freaking cheap too...I think I paid like $20 for a huge meal, booze, a bite of dessert (it wasnt good, dont waste your time), tax and tip. FANTASTIC!

I don't get it. I've been twice now, and was severely underwhelmed both times. The idea is great: an affordable BYOB Argentinian Steakhouse. The problem: the steak ain't that great. The first problem is that the wait on weekends is off the charts. We got there around 9pm on a Saturday night and were told the wait was an hour and forty five minutes. The interior and the patio especially are cool, so I do like the overall feel of the place. The last time we went my wife and I shared the El Filet (for two). The presentation was great and my mouth was watering before diving in. The love affair ended there. I've never had a tougher filet mignon. Heck, I've barely had steak that was this tough before. My wife gave up on it at some point because it was literally so much work to chew. I hate that I don't like this place because I love steak more than any other food on this planet, but it's just not very good.

A large group of us came here for a birthday party. Fortuntaely, Tango Sur now takes reservations and it felt pretty BA that we just got to walk through when the couple ahead of us were held back. We ordered a bunch of appetizers since all of us can't seem to stay on schedule. We started with the prosciutto and melon, which would probably be best for no more than 4 people-not that the serving was small, quite the opposite, it's just with more than that number it's a pain to pass it around. The empandas were tasty with the chicken empanada in particular. We also split the eggplant which-was different from what I expected, served cold but still tasty-not crisp but with a little bite to it. Delicious. The chimichuri is simply AMAZING. The birthday guy and I decided to split the Vacio-because that was the only dish that came with sweet potatoes and he was the one I managed to get to split with me. Keep in mind there are a couple of dishes named Vacio-it not being the only one with multiple dishes under the same name. Our Vacio came on a grill which dominated our table and was got it rare-which it was and it was oh so good-the olive oil marinade really made the meat and the sweet potatoes stand out.

After reading the reviews of this place I was very excited to go.  Unfortunately, my New Years Eve meal was not very good.  We ordered the cold seafood salad to start and that was tasty.  I then ordered the Bone in Ribeye and it was really bad.  It basically had no flavor other than the garlic sauce and the meat itself was very stringy and seemed to be of poor quality.  It was also too tough for that cut of meat.  My husband had the filet and it had good flavor but was also tougher than it should be.  We both had the spinach mashed potatoes and they tasted watery.  Not my favorite meal but it didn't cost too much and it was BYOB so that's good.

I'd been dying to try this restaurant forever.  There always seems to be a wait outside, so must be good! However, I was pretty disappointed in my experience.  For one, it is SO dark in there.  As my company said, there's something to be said about seeing your food; about seeing the presentation.  Our table was pretty much only lit by candlelight (which made reading the menu difficult), but I didn't like that everyone's plate looked like a black silhouette of mystery meat. 2nd, my dish, plus a couple of others at my table was NOT very good.  I got the platter of several meats, but they were SO tough I ended up chewing what I could and having to spit out the rest. Based on this experience I probably wouldn't jump to go back there again.

Simply the best BYOBooze-a-mahol place in Chicago.  That is as long as you are aren't a vegan or vegetarian. No corkage fee, and just about any type of booze goes well with hefty chunks of cow.  And be prepared for cow, because I'd say about 85% of their menu is based on that hulking grass-eating beast of an animal. From my experiences here, you can come to expect not only a lot of beef, but also the following: - Very dark environment.  No, I'm not speaking metaphorically- but everything seems to be lit through these tiny candles.  Might be a good idea here considering the presentation tends to be a big chunk of grilled flesh on a plate, and maybe some sauce. - This will basically in no way be a quick meal.  Everything from being seated (unless you get a reservation), to the service, to the time it takes for that 8-pound fillet to arrive, and even the "recovery" time from your "meat coma" is going to take awhile. - Despite the servings being bovine-heavy, much like what you will find in not only Argentina, but throughout most of the world- you can be a bit adventurous and sample odds and ends of the cow.  Tongue organ meat, intestines, and right down to a sausage made from the blood of the beast is on offer- and definitely worth the try (especially that blood sausage, which is possibly the best I've ever had). - Did I mention a lot of meat?
