 Yes, it is true, but my point here necessitating a separate dash is that you aren't going to find much in terms of vegetables on offer.  They do have sides of potatoes (not REALLY a vegetable, right?) and some other things, and a very simple salad of lettuce, onions and tomatoes is brought to you before whichever cut of massive meat comes your way. - "Romantic" is maybe one way to describe a very dark restaurant, but I'd go ahead and say it isn't a very romantic place at all.  The volume gets very loud, and the place is always crowded.  They do a great job in their service and make things as comfortable as possible, but when you hear the sixth "Happy Birthday" ring out while you are trying to tell your date about that time you saved a puppy from a floating chunk of ice out in Lake Michigan on a frigid February day, you might have a hard time. - According to a few ladies at my table, and this became progressively obvious as more wine was drunk (and the meat coma was taking a firm grip on us all), the waiters are the best sweet thing on offer there (see: eye candy).  No matter though, as they ogled at Max the waiter, I drooled over my lomo relleno and sneaked more wine from under their aloof watch. - The best sweet thing there in my opinion though was the flan, with a chocolate caramel covering.  Very nice!

We came here with a party of 4 a couple weeks ago for the first time.  Damn was it dark in there. The tables were pretty close together. It's BYOB. There are taper candles lit  on every table without a guard. The owners must like to live dangerously!!  Onto the food. They start you off with bread and starter salads.  They also give you oil and vinegar to make your own dressing. We got 2 each of the beef and the ham and cheese empanadas for apps. Tasty!! I thought the beef tasted better and as a bonus added surprise they have a hard boiled egg inside. Yummy!! The ham and cheese empanadas were good too, with lots of gooey cheese but it reminded me of a more classy version of a ham and cheese hot pocket.  The chimichurri sauce that came with the empanadas was freaking delicious!!  We got the Lomo Relleno and the Para Dos. The menu said each dish served two people. Between 3 big guys and me, it was rough finishing all the meat... quantity is not an issue here! The Lomo was a large hunk of meat that was cooked with portabella marsala, whereas the Para Dos was a selection of meats, sausages and innards that are simply seasoned and grilled.  Everything tasted pretty good with the exception of the sweetbreads. They were way overcooked, super chewy and greasy, definitely the worst thing that night.  Total of apps and 2 entrees came out to about $88 without tax and tip.  Not bad!! I'd stop back again, but next time I'd definitely get a side or two to break up the meat fest.

Yet, another great meal from Tango Sur! The service was good, food was very tasty and atmosphere perfect for a nice dinner! I got in at 6p just before the rush so we got the last table and had no wait. It amazes me how packed they are every time I go here. I had the strip steak (med) cooked perfect, strong seasoning and hot. I could barely finish this meal, in fact, I brought a portion of the steak home.  I will say I prefer the mash vs. the potato wedges. The empanadas (beef) were okay but, the Chimchurri sauce was excellent! The salad is very small, shredded and needs some culinary work. I would agree on skipping this if you can. Overall, another great experience and a good price!

After reading the reviews on Yelp, I thought the only negatives were the long wait time despite having a reservation.  We showed up 10 minutes early for a 9:30pm reservation and we were seated within 15 minutes.  Great I thought... the rest of this night should be fantastic!   Service: one to two stars at best.  The water was rarely refilled.  After asking three times for more bread, none was provided.   Ambience: Cozy... if by cozy you mean, sitting on top of the next tables laps.  Come on, at least separate the tables by at least an inch between you and the next party. Food: 1/3 of the dishes were satisfactory.   For a restaurant that is supposed to know about meat, I was extremely disappointed.  I ordered the filet and the meat was fatty (filet?!? - when is filet EVER fatty), undercooked (i ordered medium), and difficult to cut.  My sister ordered the bacio (flat meat) medium rare and it was too dry because it was well done.  The boyfriend ordered the 12oz ribeye and that was decent.  Additionally, the "salads" are essentially hamburger toppings (lettuce, tomato, and onion)... yum... I did complain about the filet, but i always feel bad returning the food especially since it took so long to come out that I figured, this would be one establishment that I would not be coming back to and it wasn't worth spending more time there.   They did give a free flan (unfortunately, I'm not that big on flan)... what they really should have done was comped the meal.

Great place for South American steaks.  BYOB with no corkage fee.  Great food and you don't have to break the bank for a good bottle of wine.  You can sit outside along Soutport Ave. in the summer.  A little tight on the inside.  If your claustraphobic you may not like this place.

We received a very good review from a friend and decided to try the argentine place. We arrived at 6:15 pm on a wednesday evening. They took our name and number of guest and placed us in the holding room. While waiting they popped our corks and gave us glasses while we waited for our table. It was only 30 minutes. Alot quicker than we have heard in the past. The service was pretty good and the food was outstanding. I would definitely go back and make sure you get there early and bring your own supply of alcohol. Great Job!!! The Carmel Flan was outstanding. The Fondu appetizer was out of this world. El Filet was delicious with spinach mash potatoes.

Bad first impression. We called ahead to make a reservation, drove over in the snow, and actually lucked out with parking only to find the host telling us it was going to be a 45 minute wait. When we told him we called to make a reservation, he rudely told us that it was not him on the phone, one of the servers he insisted, and therefore he was not responsible (?!?!) Needless to say we swiftly left. I really hope their food overcompensates for the sub-par service.

Loved it here. Not terribly romantic because of the close proximity of tables. But 1 entree can feed two & same thing with the apps. So go in with your fave bottle and share an app & entree. Awesome food. And a waiting room!!!!

All I have to say is - Wow!  In terms of the quality and quantity of the food and the price, this is probably the best restaurant in the city. My wife and I ordered some cheese dish (which was amazing) and split the fillet.  We got two giant slabs of juicy meat, and were genuinely stuffed afterwards.  The final bill?  Only $40! The only negative was the noise.  The place was packed on a Saturday night, and it was hard to hear.

One of the best affordable, BYOB steak joint. I always order the fillet which always turned out juicy and it simply melts in your mouth. Enjoyed their empanadas and flan as well. Ambiance is great for a date or dinner with a group of friends. The wait might be frustrating so be patient. The staff might be less than attentive but remember you are there for the food.

Meat!  Glorious meat! Shared the Para Dos and stuffed my face.  I have a pretty *hefty* appetite and it was difficult for me to get through my half.  It was delicious though, so I managed. My recommendation: skip the salad.  You came for the meat and no corkage fee.  Tango Sur delivers.

I love this place.  I truly do.  However this past weekend I went there with some friends from out of town.  We check in with the guys at the door at 9:11pm and we were told it would be an hour and half wait.  We gave him our number and set out to kill some time.  Shortly after 10pm we stopped by to check on the progress of our wait.  The same guy at the door told us that it will be an hour and half from the current time.  We had him check where we were on the list and he had our check in time at 9:42pm.  When we tried to explain we were her earlier, he basically laughed at us and told us to go away and he would call.   We were disappointed, however my friends wanted to eat here badly.  We hung around for a bit longer then decided to go somewhere else.  We never received a called telling us our table was ready.   This it a great place - however not worth the time -especially on the weekends.  I have been during the week and you are able to get a table (with an hour wait).  But I would suggest not trying this place on the weekend.  Why they don't take reservations is beyond me.

I am a fan and thank all the review before me for the raving recommendations that helped a bit.... We ordered the Argentinian fillet steak, naturally reared and grass fed, these fillets are mouth wateringly tasty when they cook them with the amazing chimichurri sauce.  Get it medium rare not medium well...it is suppose to be red and delicious! 3 not 5 cuz....Better yet 5 for food and 1 for host! The atmosphere is dark, the place is crowded and extremely noisy.  The host is VERY rude...(as I am writing this I am reading some reviews...and boy the host is really a D@CK!)   I like that I read "if you can afford to be humiliated by Mr. Nobody at the door..." But all in all...we had a good time and where it is hard to cook on a grill in the winter in Chicago, we will enjoy the food here till summer if we want grilled meats!..

If not for the food, this would have been one, totally disappointing experience.  Instead, it was disappointing.  Thanks beef empanada and el filet steak.  Strike 1: rude host.  We walked in, and since there's no waiting area in front, the host both dismally and snarkily barked at us first about pulling the door behind us to keep the cold air out and then something about whether we had reservations.  Hello to you too.  Cold and rude. Strike 2: the waiting area was inconveniently way in the back corner room of the place.  It, and the whole establishment, is super dark and lit pretty much only by candlelight.  It's like dining in a bat cave.  A bat cave with loud music and highly energetic sound level.  The host or some staff member would randomly come back to bring wine glasses for parties, but we had to specifically hunt down someone to get said wine glasses... which we wanted especially because the wait was 45 minutes at 8:45 on a Thurs. night! Strike 3: dismal service.  The waiter only came to our table for the bare necessities (taking our order, checking if we wanted dessert, dropping off the check).  Each table had a huge tin of butter, but bread was nowhere to be found until I asked for it . P.S.  It's BYOB, but I'll be tango'ing with my B elsewhere in the future.

I made a reservation for 11 people, they had the table ready for us when we came in and they didn't do one of those "we can't sit you until your entire party is here" things because come on how can 11 people arrive at the same time. If you love meat then this is the place. Great service, amazing food and it's BYOB. I can't wait to go back!
Excellent meat in a great atmosphere. I've tried the entrana and also the bife ancho (ribeye steak), both outstanding. For dessert, the flan is perfect. Make reservations if possible.

When I think steakhouse, I normally think of big tables, fancy service, and relaxed dining.  This place definitely does not fit that mold. The atmosphere inside was dark, crowded, and bustling.  Not surprising for restaurants in Chicago that cater to young crowds, but I just prefer a little more breathing room if possible.  The tables were lit by candlelight, which was great for ambiance but terrible if you like to see what you are eating.   That being said, the food was fantastic.  My special Argentine fillet for two was outrageously large in portion size (enough for a dinner for 2 for leftovers), well cooked, flavorful, and a joy to eat.  The service was also good considering the size of my party (12) and how busy the restaurant was on a Saturday evening.  Thankfully we had reservations; if I came back with a smaller group I would try to hit a weeknight so we would not have to wait.  Because the food is worth coming back for. I will give it 4 stars for great food at a good price.

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago. The wait for a table can be long so make reservations. Everything that I have tried in my 3 visits had been exceptional. The atmosphere is a bit intimate because of the lighting. BYOB is a plus and outdoor seating is great in the summer. Last piece of advice, try the empanadas for an appetizer.

I'm in love.  Incredible food.  Fabulous, unpretentious service.  And prices that made me double-check my bill because I thought they must have missed an entree when the charged us.  We brought two other friends and as many bottles of wine with us on a Friday night and only waited about 20 minutes.  Just...awesome.

If you love meat, then this is heaven.  I went with a friend on a Wednesday night and we waited for a half hour. It was cool because we brought wine with us so the servers gave us some wine glasses while we waited. We started off with the empanadas...yummm! Then we ordered the Para Dos which is basically a sampler of all their meats. We didn't even got through half of the meal because it's ginormous. Oh well I made steak and eggs for my leftovers the next morning.  Overall, it's pretty noisy and crowded so it's not good for dates but if you love good food (esp. meat) then this is the place for you :)

This place is ridiculous. Went with another couple on a Friday night for dinner b/c we've always heard wondeful things. We arrive about 8:30 and expected to wait. We walk up to the host and he informs us it'll be an hour wait. Sure, no problem! The host just looks at us. I ask, "Is there a wait list we can put our name on so you can call us?" The host pulls out the infamous pocket notebook and starts looking at ths names on his list. I ask, "Do you need my name and number?". The host says, "yes" so I give him my name and number. He then says, "I hope I got your number correct" so I repeat it to him and he doesn't even look at me and says "Yup". I felt like I was in a scene of the movie Date Night. Our group seriously thought that we were not going to get a call. Lucky for us, they did after about 45mins.  Get seated, waiter showed up 15mins later, ordered appetizers. Waiter came back with appetizers 15mins later,  placed entree order. Served us salad (blah). Then the waiter brought our entrees. All our entrees were good. We were never checked up, constantly had to ask for waters to be refilled. One at our table ordered a diet coke- waiter "forgot" about it.  I read someone elses review about their waiter disappearing into a black hole i the back, and that's exactly  how we felt about our waiter. The only time we came back to our table within 5mins was when he dropped the check off.  All in all, stay away, there's much better places for steak (ex: Las Tablas)

On Saturday night, I went out with three girlfriends to Tango Sur, the famed Argentinean restaurant in Wrigleyville on Southport Ave. For steak lovers, it's like dying and going to heaven. However, before you can get into heaven, you're gonna have to wait more than 2 hours. I will only say this once...GO EARLY. If you have less than 8 people in your party, you cannot make reservations, and the restaurant fills up very quickly. This fact in itself accounts for my mixed review. We arrived at 7:30PM and put our names on the list. After being told that we would have to wait for 2 hours, we walked down the road to Hye Bar for some pre-dinner drinking. Tango Sur is BYOB so I wasn't really bothered by spending money down the street.  Once we were finally able to sit down and order, it was about 10PM and we were starving. Now, I don't know if it's because I was wearing over-the-knee black boots, but I seemed to get a lot of attention from the waiters at the restaurant, who are all male. I would also venture to say that 99% of them are from South America, which definitely adds to the authentic feeling of the place! Of course, I didn't mind the attention, and I might have even managed to get a date out of it! Saucy. Speaking of sauce, the first thing we ordered was a plate of empanadas on which we smeared delicious chimichurri sauce. It's a concoction of olive oil, parsley, salt, pepper, garlic, and probably a few other things. But Tango Sur is one of the few places that does not add any vinegar. It was to-die-for! We ordered two spinach and cheese empanadas and two chicken empanadas. They were the perfect appetizer.  For the main meal, the hit at the table was the birthday girl's Vacio for two (shown above the empanadas). A grilled steak with sweet potatoes and a tantalizing sauce, it was big and meaty and delicious. I ordered the Bife Vesuvio, a well-done steak stuffed with spinach and cheese, marinated in a white wine sauce. I will say here that it was delicious. But I'm a rare steak kind of girl and I found my meat a little hard to chew. I kept the leftovers, though, so I still enjoyed it! Jessica got the best thing of all, in my opinion: El Filet, filet mignon with a red onion wine sauce. I managed to snag half of hers to take home in my leftovers. It was perfectly cooked and sooooo tender. Although it was annoying to wait until 10PM to sit down and eat, the staff were efficient and fun. They gave us flan with delicious dulce de leche on top for my friend's birthday, and their flirtation added to the sexy ambience. I would for sure go back, but maybe I'd try getting there at 5:30 instead of 7:30.  Steaks tend to run about $20-$25 for one person, $35 for a two-person meal. Empanadas are $1.75 each. Run to the restaurant just to try the chimichurri sauce!!!
BYOB, great lighting, yummy food.. a place everyone should try!

Had a nice experience at this place. From the moment I walked in, I had to survey everyone else's' food and I knew I was going to like it. We had a reservation but had to wait for about 30 minutes in the back room. It was like a maze walking through a tightly cramped front room to get to a tiny back room where it felt like everyone was pre partying since it's BYOB. There is a lot of hustle and bustle in this place which gives it a good feel; like you're in a hot spot.  Celine and  I split one of the main dishes ( I can't remember the name but it is advertised as for "two") and there was a ton of flavor. The presentation is fun as it is on the tray/stand so it's on display for the world to see. Problem is the meat was really tough. I ordered it medium rare and they cooked it medium rare, so it brings me to the conclusion that the cut of steak just wasn't right. I wanted to really like it since the flavor was so good, but damn, my mouth was getting tired of chewing. The other group we were with order a similar plate but their meat was very tender. Take it under advisement that you should ask your waiter what dish is the most tender so you don't get stuck chewing some rubber. The main reason why I give this place 4 stars is my glass of water was filled 20 times and I'm not even exaggerating. I love when people pay attention to the little things, because in the end it's the little things that really count. I will definitely come back to this restaurant next time I come to Chicago and hope I have better luck

This place is just fantastic Everything from the layout, ambiance, BYOB and food was solid Everyone here is always having a great time and enjoying themselves I would highly recommend coming here if you are in the mood for a social night of boozing and meat eating

We went with a group of six on Saturday night around 9.  The wait was two hours but we decided to wait it out since we had brought alcohol with us to drink.  They take your cell phone number and call your phone when your table is ready so we just went to a bar down the street and had a few drinks while we were waiting for our table. THIS PLACE IS WORTH THE WAIT!  They finally called us around 11 and we got in right before the kitchen closed at 11:30.  We got our food and ate and drank there until they literally kicked us out at 2!  We ordered about three dishes to share at the table and it was more than enough food.  The salads are meant for sharing and the meat is amazing! I will definitely be going back!  BYOB steakhouse is the best idea ever!  Great for groups, dates or just about anything!  Just go knowing you will have to wait!

I. LOVE. TANGO. SUR!!!!! So, to be quite honest.. my mouth watered a little bit when I looked at the empanadas picture on the top right. Then I thought -The empanadas are delicious. The crust is not to flaky and just crisp. I thought I hated chimichurri until I visited Tango Sur. Now all I wish is to have a tub of it, all to myself. I have tried every flavor and the only one that was not extraordinary was the chicken which was overly salty. All the steaks are great. Service is Great. The ambiance is SEXY. My favorite non-steak dish here would be the spinach ravioli served piping hot!! Party bursts of flavors on your tongue!

We were told that if we arrived before 5:30, we would not have a problem obtaining a table for 6 within a short wait. Well unfortunately that was not the case, and we were quoted a 2 1/2 hour wait. We decided to stick it out and headed to Cullens for a drink and appetizers. After 2.5 hours, someone in our party checked back and we were told that our table was "ready." What this really meant was waiting 30 minutes more in their waiting area while starting on our wine. So, after 3 hours of waiting, we finally sat down (minus one star).  Food was very delicious of course. Loved the ham and cheese empanada and el filet. If you share, they charge $5 split plate charge, but definitely worth it because portions are huge.

This is one of my favorite (if not THE favorite) restaurants in Chicago. How much better could you get? Great service, DELICIOUS food (the empanadas, the provoleta, the chimichurri sauce, the steaks and potatoes...everything, and I mean everything I've had here is impeccable), BYOB, and no better romantic date atmosphere in the city. In the summer you can eat outside on lovely Southport - its fantastic. And the waiters are lovely as well.;) I highly, highly recommend this place for a date during the winter in the evening or for a fun dinner with friends in the summer outside. Fabulous for all occasions. And its walking distance to the Music Box and tons of great bars. Can't get better. Can. Not.

Hands down, MY FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN CHICAGO!  The empenadas are amazing and the steak is always perfectly seasoned and perfectly medium rare.  You can take your girl with a bottle or two of vino cuz its BYOB, get the filet which is actually TWO filets, its costs $24, split it for $5, and they bring out bread and salad for both of you.  Order a couple $2 empenadas for starters and BOOOM, you just went out on a date and impressed the lady, had one of the best steak dinners of your life, got legit stuffed, and pretty drunk for $33!!!  I'm a big eater and I can't count the times I've dropped $100 on dinner easy, had like 3 beers, she had 2 glasses of whatever, and walked away from dinner still hungry and barely tipsy, we all know what we want and its not that.   Don't get me wrong will wait for this amazing meal and you will wait for at least 1 hour, but it's worth every minute.

Reasons to love Tango Sur: 1.  Great Ambiance - perfect for a date. 2.  BYOB 3.  Generous portions 4.  Flavorful steaks. 5.  The chimichurri sauce 6.  Outdoor seating during the summer. That sauce is to die for, and the only restaurant that I know that prepares it without vinegar.   They do not take reservations so brace yourself when visiting during the winter.  Wait time can extend way over an hour for a part of over 2 on the weekends. The preparation and the texture of the steak is sometimes inconsistent, and 9/10 times I get the rib-eye.  Medium seems to be just right.  However, to me flavor is everything and this place is close to perfection.  I could have given it a 4 star due to this, but this is one of the few restaurants that I actually revisit several times a year - maybe even more.  Speaking of... I haven't been back in quite some time.  Think I'm due for a Tango Sur dinner soon.

This place is overrated. We had to wait outside in the cold for 40 minutes even though we had a reservation. Once we were inside, it was too loud, and the wait staff was a bit sub-par. The food was just okay- nothing special. Don't go there on a weekend- not worth the wait or the hectic atmosphere.

I've had better service and steak but for the size, it's just right. They need to cut their attitude and not make people wait an hour to eat. We were the first table there when they opened for goodness sake (after reading these reviews of course). But the biggest filet I've ever been served...two in fact..the El Filet...skip the spinach mashed potatoes (green unappatizing mush) that come with it and sub with the regular..not very firm but easier to eat...but the beef empanadas were DElish...we sent back the weird sweet bread (fried fat pieces) and got two more empanadas...don't expect nice employees but expect big meat...and that's what I like...

Dinner with sixteen or so in this place was a little tricky, but they did a great job keeping up with all of our orders and making sure everyone had just what they needed.  The food was fabulous and they even worked with us bringing in our own cake for the birthday girl.  Always crowded, but a great atmosphere and I love how they light the table candle when you sit down.

Short and simple. The food is amazing! I have tried several entrées (Churrasco, Vacio, Pechugga De Pollo) and all were delicious. you can't go wrong here. And to top it off, the prices are reasonable considering the quality and portion your are receiving and it is BYOB! During busy periods there is a long-wait, but, it is worth it. Plan ahead if you want to avoid long-lines and make sure to skip lunch if you want to have enough room to finish your gigantic slab of Argentinian beef.
I can't say much except they have out of this world's stakes . The price is so reasonable try Vacio with sweet potato. I would go to Chicago for having their stake!
I love this place.  It's warm, BYOB and reasonable.  The food is excellent, but the atmosphere is what sold me.

Last weeks date night we decided to go BYOB and get out of the neighborhood. A friend had suggested Tango Sur to us as a romantic steak house with Argentina twist to it.  The place was very tiny- and very squished. They have this awkward little "waiting room" in the back with a few chairs and benches, there were probably 15 people packed in here and we waited a lonnnnngggg time when we had a 7:30 reservation.  We were not impressed with the food, I had the ribeye (not much else to choose from but meat) and my husband had the veal. Steak was alright, not a great cut of meat. And my husbands veal was strangely cooked on top but raw on the bottom, it was a thick piece that was butterflied and stuffed. He was not a fan. For app we had this cheese thing.. yes it was a thing. It said baked cheese and thats exactly what we got. a sizzling piece of melted cheese. strange.  Service was ok, not great not bad, average.  The best part and only good part was that it was BYOB.

tons of people recommended me to go to this place, and all of them warned me of the long wait. let me tell you.. if you're lucky enough, you can get seated in half an hour even though it's prime dinner time.. so, i'd consider myself lucky. but, i guess smaller party gets seated a little bit faster than bigger parties.. go figure.  service was very prompt and quick. love it.  room is a little bit too dark and too noisy, but perhaps if i was there with a different crowd, it would be just fine. It's a BYOB steakhouse, unfortunately i was there with non-drinkers, so... i missed on the fun there..  ordered Lomo Relleno, and it was amazing. it was huge. mushroom sauce that was poured all over it was a little bit too salty, but with the meat and potatoes on the side, the combination was just too perfect. wished I have a glass of red wine to go with it, but the steak on its own was incredible.  lastly, price isn't bad at all.. you would think you need to spend a fortune here.. unlike other steakhouses, Tango Sur is really on the affordable side. I'll definitely be back !!

I went to Tango Sur last friday and it was absolutely amazing.  The reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that it took forever for our waiter to bring us the check.  I have no idea what our meal was called but it was to die for!!! If you are a meat and potato person...then you have to go here!! And it's BYOB!!!!!
Tango Sur definitely knows how to do meat. Super juicy, succulent, delicious meat.. Great price and portions... Highly recommended!

BYOB Steakhouse! That should sell this place right off the bat! Was here a couple of nights ago when my parents were in town. Had an amazing meal yet again at this Argentinian Steakhouse. Everything I've had here has been great and the people I've gone with have enjoyed their meals as well. But here's the basic recommendation that you need........  El Fillet  Two fillets in a red wine reduction sauce that is amazing over spinach mashed potatoes.  I never usually take steak home but had to the first time I had this dish, it was still great the next day heated up.  The place is always packed on the weekends, so best night to go is Thursday. Make a reservation! Otherwise you could be waiting a while to get a table. Prices are moderate, but you really get the bang for your buck by bringing your own wine or alcohol. The staff is friendly and the restaurant is set in nice neighborhood which makes for an enjoyable dinner experience.  If you live in Chicago and have not been here yet... Shame on you!!!

We went here with a party of 5 on a Sunday night at 7PM. We did have reservations so we were seated within 5 minutes after we arrived. If we hadn't had reservations it would have been at least an hour long wait. It would have been worth it.  As everyone has said it's very dark inside, I think it lends itself to being intimate and romantic. Service was very prompt in opening our wine and getting us menus. There always seemed to be the right amount of time between everything. When we wanted our waiter there he was and when we were enjoying lingering he wasn't.  We started with the empanadas and the antipasto plate. Both were great. Definitely get at least one empanada, they're all delicious. The salad to start the meal is really nothing special but that isn't why anyone goes there. It's for the STEAK!!  Wow!!  My husband and I split the lomo relleno and couldn't have been happier. It was shear bliss. Moist, tender, spicy and covered in the best portabella mushrooms ever. We couldn't stop raving about it. Everyone else had steaks and loved theirs as well. We all had leftovers to take home and the hubs and I enjoyed our leftovers just as much the second day as the first.   The prices were fantastic for the amount and quality of the food and you cannot beat a no charge BYOB.  We can't wait for another excuse to go here.

I will start by pointing out good aspects, BYOB, adorable Bistro like atmosphere.  We were a party of six on a Saturday, late afternoon.  We ordered a sampling of empanadas with chimichurri that were ok. Now the not so great part. We placed our orders, my sis and I ordered the fillet for two,medium.  The rest of the group ordered a steak stuffed with spinach.   The food took 1 1/2 hours to arrive. When our fillet arrived, it was a monstrous piece of meat covered in sauce and served with mushrooms, that's it no side of anything. I wasn't even asked if I wanted to order a side. When I put my knife to cut it I realized I had to use brute strength just to get a slice.  The steak was way way way overcooked. I was very disappointed about this. I showed the steak to the server who said it was just a little over cooked. I told him the meat was completely brown and gray, no pink it was overcooked.  He then said very dismissively, do you want another one? I said, well I really don't want to wait over an hour for it. His response was, "well the food takes as long as it takes to cook". At that point I was more than displeased not only with the food but also with the service.  I asked for a manager, he said there wasn't one.  Hard to believe on a busy Saturday there isn't a manager in the restaurant. He agreed to put an order in for another steak and put a rush on it.  The second attempt of the fillet arrived and this time is was completely rare inside. I told the server it was rare, he took it back to the kitchen and by the time he brought it out the third time I had lost my appetite, the steak was not very flavorful, it was still hard to cut. I think they use a poor quality of meat here. The rest of my group agreed that with the steaks lacking flavor and also being difficult to cut and chew.  I will never go back to this place to give it a second chance, regardless of it's most appealing draw of being BYOB.  Bad service in my opinion is inexcusable.

I called in advance to make a reservation as was told they don't take them - not sure if there was a change or the person answering the phone was incorrect, but instead I showed up with a group of 5 at 6:30 on October 16th to put our name in. We expected to wait, but were given no estimate. After 2 hours we went back to inquire. The maître d' was extremely rude and frankly, is a poor face for the business. I asked if we should expect another 15 minutes? Half hour? He said he had no way of knowing. After watching him flip back through 3 scratched pages in his book, I asked why all of the later groups had been seated and we hadn't. His answer: "You're a table of 5 and we'd have to seat you at a 6 person table, so if there is a party of 6 also waiting, we seat them first." What kind of policy is this!?? Moral of the story - DO NOT go to this restaurant if you have an odd number group. Their interest is on the $$$$ since they want to completely optimize how many people are in the place at a given time. What a terrible approach to customer service.
Best steakhouse for the Money. BYOB. $25 steaks. $2 Empanadas. Can't see why you would want to pay significantly more to go other places in the city.

Secrets out.  Don't forget to make a reservation!  The maître d' was very good with the line.  I was impressed.  Only waited for about 10 minutes for a table but the poor girls next to us had already waited more than 40 minutes without a reservation.  oops. Also don't forget to BYOB!  There's a liquor store by the train station a few blocks away.  No corkage fee! This is very affordable steakhouse and the meat is ridiculously good.  I ALWAYS order the skirt steak when I dine at Argentinian steakhouses and it was really good.  Portions were great too... platter for 2 plus the skirt steak was able to feed 6 ppl.  woot!

Hella romantic.   I went here with my friend Marco, and literally fell in love that night.  It passed as soon as we left. We sat outside, and I honestly believe if we sat inside we'd be married.  Tango would make a killing if they had a live in priest.   Anyways, on to the food.   It was a BYOB which is cool, and we sat outside.  It was kind of rainy, but the service still kicked through.  We ordered a couple empanadas which, to be honest, I could of eaten about 10 they were so good.  He ordered steak something, and wasn't happy about it.  I ordered some chicken and veggies dish - I am horrible with fancy names for dishes, but essentially that's what it was.  It was delicious!  I didn't want to share a desert, and end up a parent so we left.   Overall, the service was great... no complaints.  I know where to bring my husband of the future if he doesn't put a ring on it fast enough.

Oh how I wish I actually LIKED meat. Don't get me wrong, I've tried on numerous occasions. I am not the kind of person that turns my nose up to a particular food group without at least giving it a shot. I have never been an avid meat eater; well, I haven't really eaten meat at all over the past 28 years or so. But, every once and a while, I give it one more try. And that is exactly what I did at Tango Sur. This is obviously an Argentine steak house and most of my friends ordered a steak dish. Each person's fillet looked absolutely scrumptious! So, I tried a bite. It was good, nice and tender, but I still just could not order an entire dish of red meat and eat it. It's not good enough for me. But again, I am an anomaly. Every person that ordered a steak absolutely loved it and as the outsider, I thought they all looked very good, with a very appealing presentation, and some tasty spinach mashed potatoes on the side. The BEST part about Tango Sur, is the BYOB. How many times have you gone out to dinner or brunch and have found your drink bill exceeds your dinner bill? This has happened to me a number of times, and it is disconcerting to say the least, but also a bit comical. Drinks are just expensive. But at Tango Sur, you can bring your own booze and that is just awesome in my mind. So, kudos to them for allowing this. They do have an assortment of poultry and fish. The tilapia looked amazing but after having ran/walked 10 miles that day, I felt like a good hearty pasta dish. So I ordered the fettucine alfredo with a side salad of mozzarella cheese, spinach and roasted red pepper. My alfredo was phenomenal. One would think this is such a simple dish and how could one screw it up? Well, this is true but there were so many interesting and complimentary flavors, that it was quite different than other alfredos I've tried. And my tastebuds where happy.  The ambiance is quite cool as well. It's very dim inside, has a sort of romantic feel to it, and just seems the perfect setting to enjoy a nice juicy steak, or in my case, cream-covered pasta.

how is it possible that I haven't reviewed Tango Sur yet? Oh...yes I know. Probably because of the 770 reviews before me. Because I can't possibly add anything new to the reviews. But you know what?! I've been here about a dozen times. I waited once on valentine's day for over 4 hours for a table. I have drunk countless bottles of wine here, with so many different people. I deserve to have a review go down in history! um...that's pretty much all I can say? Get the mixed grill for two, if you're into 10 pounds of meat shared between two people that is. Try the beef tongue. Definitely leave your number and get a drink. Don't stand around like an idiot for 2 hours thinking they'll miraculously give you a seat early. And enjoy ALL the delicious meats your little carnivorous body can handle before you pass out from a blocked artery.

I was in the market for a romantic restaurant that wouldn't break the bank, that wasn't fancy or pretentious but could still deliver the goods. I was recommended Tango Sur by my friend Cara P. Tango Sur is a quaint little restaurant tucked away in the Southport row, with surrounding restaurants and boutique shops. Tango Sur could easily be missed if you aren't looking out for it, however, what will catch your attention are the mass amounts of people waiting in line for up to 2 hours or more to eat at this Argentinean steakhouse. I've heard lots of good things and read other reviews about Tango Sur that were all consistent and positive. This is one of the few restaurants that don't have a corkage fee, therefore allowing patrons to enjoy their bottles of wine, spirits or beer, free of charge...that's almost unheard of. I came here with the intentions of trying their signature items, their steaks. For starters, I ordered two chicken and two beef empanadas. These are deep fried deliciousness served with a side of the BEST chimichurri sauce I've ever had, hands down. Following came the Provoleta which is Argentine provolone cheese, melted on the grill with olive oil and roasted red peppers. I've never seen a dish disappear as fast as this one. For the main course I ordered the filet cooked medium rare with spinach mashed potatoes, this dish came with two filets and were seasoned and cooked to perfection. I really enjoyed my first experience and look forward to coming back to try more items. The service was friendly and informative but not intrusive. This is definitely a place to take a date as it is dark and candle lit on each table, making it a romantic and intimate experience. If you are looking for something different, delicious, reasonably priced and BYOB with no corkage fee, I would definitely recommend Tango Sur. I can't wait to go back!

I've been here about 4 times in the past 7 years I've lived in Chicago...it's good, moist steak at a great price, plus it's BYOB...it's always packed and they don't take reservations, so be ready to wait!

I've visited this restaurant twice. The first time, I was really disappointed with my Milanesa de Pollo which was really dry and tough. However, my boyfriend loved the Churrasco so I figured why not try them out again? So glad I did! Their steaks are hands down delicious. Lesson learned, do not come to an Argentian Steak House and not order steak.  I will agree with the other posters, come early or come after 8pm to get seated quickly.

The food at Tango Sur is 3-4 stars, but we had such a long, frustrating wait for a table that it knocked the experience down to 2.  I wouldn't have minded the wait if they had given us close to an accurate estimate when we arrived, but first they told us an hour and then kept saying "ten to twenty minutes" for another hour.  It was a very nice Friday night and they are BYOB so we expected a wait - but the guys in charge of seating clearly had no idea which tables just sat down, which tables were getting ready to leave, etc.  Simply put, Tango Sur did a rotten job of managing the wait list. On the plus side, the empanadas were outstanding and my filet (a huge portion) was cooked exactly as I ordered it.  I was a little disappointed in the spinach mashed potatoes because I had heard such great things, but in the end they were, um, mashed potatoes with some spinach.   Go to Tango Sur and bring a bottle of wine or three - but either be prepared to wait for an indeterminate amount of time, or go during the week when it's not so busy.

Get ready for MEAT! We didn't have reservations, arrived on a Sunday evening, and were informed of an hour wait for a table inside. (The decor is very quaint and tempted us mightily.) However, we took a table outside with no wait. (They had heaters; it was cool.) The service was authentic and attentive, the food was straightforward and delicious. TONS OF MEAT! Had a great steak, the Castaleta, while my partner had the filet, which was billed as smaller and more tender. Sure. But he was served 2 of these "smaller, more tender" options! Actually, we were quite satisfied, and everything was VERY reasonably priced. Haven't walked out of a steakhouse with an appetizer and entree in my belly for under $40 ever, but I did on this night.

It's my first yelp review and im so glad that im starting my review with tengo sur! everything was absolutely amazing! =D Loved the fact that its BYOB and that the portions are huge! My boyfriend and I celebrated our 4 year anniversary here and the food was just awesome as it gets. We started with beef empanadas which were so yummy~ and then we split a lomo relleno filet (a good suggestion from our server) and loved it! We both didnt realize that this entree will be so huge lol we ended up eating a half of the filet and took the rest to go =P The only part was that we had to wait over an hour to get seated and extra time for the food to come out, but it was well worth the wait! Cant wait to go back again!

Argentinian steakhouse serving up various cuts of beef, all of which come with some of the BEST chimichurri sauce I've ever had - I mean, I would come back here again just for the chimichurri sauce.  I'm confident you can order whatever you'd like here in terms of beef and it would be decent - I ended up going for their flank steak, which seemed to be broiled in sauce rather than just grilled - going to try and get the grilled steak next time. I liked how they had Inca cola and usually Guarana (Brazillian soda - they were out this time).  I did not like their plate sharing fee - everyone needs to order an entree or they tack an extra $5 per person to share dishes.  A group of us came at 4:00pm and just wanted to try out some meat - not eat a full meal, so that was frustrating. All in all, solid meal, and a great place to get meat.

There is one way to eat steak: rare with your spicy, deep, red vino at Tango Sur.  I love the atmosphere because it is about fun and enjoying your food.  If you plan it right, go an hour before you actually want to eat, and go next door for a drink or two while you wait.  The music is always too loud, but it is all about the energy.   If you make a reservation, realize this place is Argentinian and patiently wait accordingly.  Also, the byob is clutch.  They open it for you if you choose to wait inside, so you can mingle with the other diners too.  This is not a place to go if you expect an annoying server to refill your water a million times. This is the restaurant for delectable steak and a good time.

After being in Chicago 10 years and wanting to try this place, I finally went a couple of weeks ago.  I am still trying to figure out what all the hype is about - they dont take reservations, you can barely see the food its so dark (maybe that is part of the plan) and the food was very average.  My meat was tough and unappealing.  We had a couple of the appetizers which were good and we like the BYOB option but there are so many BYOBs in the city.  Las Tablas down the street is a better option in my book - better food and takes reservations.

This place is wonderful! We had a reservation on Sunday for 7:30 and arrived at 7:15. It looked like there was a long wait with how many people were standing outside. We were seated right away to the great little table for two. It was very busy so the restaurant was kind of loud but that really did not matter. There is no corkage fee and our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu.  ORDER THE EMPANADAS! They are so yummy and you have to eat them with the chimichuri they give you. I had the Tall Grass Sirloin and it was perfectly cooked with the spinach mashed potatoes...deeeelicious! The food was amazing and the price was awesome for what you received. I would say the need better steak knives though.. Overall, excellent service and food for a reasonable price! I highly recommend making a reservation though.

I give Tango Sur 5 stars because every time I've been here, which is a lot, I've experienced consistently good service and food.  The chimichurri is wonderful and can be purchased next door in their small store in a plastic container to take home.  It's served with the filet mignon I order regularly there.  The meals are enormous.  A filet mignon order comes with two pieces of steak, along with potatoes and chimichurri.  In addition Tango Sur is BYOB.  The service is very quick and efficient and the candlelight makes it a romantic place to dine.  Be aware, however, that there are no reservations allowed, but they kindly take your cell phone number and will call you when a table is ready for you.  There is a bar a few doors down where you can sit and wait for your phone call.  Another thing to consider is that it is a very crowded place.  Basically you are within a few feet, on each side, from other diners.  The noise created by conversations around you create some sort of privacy, but basically it's a crowded setting and you are in tight quarters here.  Overall, this place is my favorite place to dine if I'm in the mood for a steak.  They have fancy, spiced steaks as well, but I prefer the simple filet and it's wonderful here.  I always bring a doggie bag home and have another two meals with it, which makes it a very budget-conscious restaurant.  I recommend this restaurant for a night when you just want a good steak on a date or with a few people.  A full table of more than 4 people might make it a little difficult to have a decent conversation because of the noise and close proximity to others dining there.  But this is, after all, only my opinion - I see people here in large groups all the time and I wonder how they are able to hear each other.

All I have to say about this place is awesome! Tango Sur is one of the greatest steak places for the price, and same level as the high name steak houses downtown, with a different feel.  Because of how great this place is, and they do not take reservations here are a few helpful hints to get a table quickly: 1. Dine before 7:00 PM, after 7:15-7:30PM the wait can get as long as 1  1/2- 2 hours longs.  2. It is BYOB, so don't forget the booze. Utilize a screw top as you will be full from dinner. 3. It is loud. 4. If you are a light eater most entries are big enough to share. If you are on the fence, consider different dishes, you can't go wrong.  5. Try and empanada or two.

I had a really great experience here.  The lighting atmosphere was romantic and still lively. The waiter was pleasant and helpful with suggestions.  Extra star for being a steak place that has more than one vegetarian option.

I came here last weekend for a bachelor party. WOW. I actually gave this place six stars but had to take one off because of the long wait and slow service. But when the food finally arrived it was great, portions, price, perfect. However the best part was the BYOW. That's right, bring your own whatever. We brought a mini key, a handle of vodka and a fifth of wine. The vibe was alive all night and would recommend this place to anyone traveling or living in this city.

Food was excellent. We had a dish for two and it was reasonably priced. The food took a while to come out but that's to be expected at a steakhouse. The ambiance was very romantic, very argintinian and fun to experience. I would particularly recommend this to lovers (or soon to be) on a date night. Also, most have already mentioned this but this place is BYOB, really makes for a cheap night overall. They also don't take reservations so show up early before the line forms.
Excellent entrees and appetizers. I ordered the empanadas and the steaks and the two times I have been there I was not disappointed, I would love to go back again.

I have been here many times and always enjoy it.   If there is a long wait, there is a cute wine shop across the street that does free tastings.  Plus you can choose a bottle or two for dinner with zero corkage fee.

K, so you really want stake, but really don't wanna break the bank and go to Ruth's Chris, Morton, Gibson, ....What do you do? well first you make sure that it's mid week. Then you head to Whole Foods and get some yummy wine, and then you head to TangoSur. We've been there for more than five times, and the more we go, the smaller our selection gets. These days, me and gf opt to get the Antipasti ... then we both get the Filet and call it the night. We tried their Argentinian shared dish, and honestly we hated it. So i guess tastes really differ, some people swear by it. Moral of this story, don't go there on weekends.

I was disappointed with my visit to Tango Sur on Saturday, August 29. My recommendation to the owner; 1) Better quality flatware and sharp knives 2) Better quality of beef, more inspection of what you are buying 3) Serve food hot 4) Improve the dining room acoustics  A busy evening and with our reservation we were seated immediately, the table was a little tight but at least the seating behind us were not hitting our chairs.  Waiters were prompt, friendly, and knowledgeable.  Ambience was loud and once the dining area filled you could hardly hear the person across from you, you literally had to shout and by evenings end I was horse from shouting.  It seems the louder became the higher they turned up the music volume.  They definitely need acoustics work in the building. The flatware was of the most inexpensive grade and the knives needed sharpening.  The forks were so cheap that the tines were crooked and bent on many of them.  When you serve beef/meat sharp knives are essential.  If the meat isn't tender a sharp knife is always a great cover. Enjoyed the BYOB which encourages spending a leisurely time for dinner   None of this would matter much if the food had lived up to its reputation.  Our party of eight all ordered a different entrées.  I can only speak for 4 of the items;  1) The eggplant was favorable but came to the table lukewarm, like it had sat too long on the plate. 2) The T-bone was so full of fat to be nearly inedible and could not be cut no matter how hard you worked 3) The short ribs were not favorable and tough 4) The sirloin steak was editable but flavor was totally lacking and also had more fat that you would normally expect. If this is a "meat restaurant" they need to upgrade the quality of the meat they purchase or find a chef that knows high quality beef (the entree cost demands this).  Then they need serve the food HOT, this is beef, and beef should be eaten sizzling coming out of the kitchen and if you can't achieve that you really shouldn't be in this business.

Disclaimer: I am a vegetarian and did not personally partake in steak consumption. Also we forgot to BYOB. However, I am heavily taking into account the feedback of my fiance and his mom, who both had the meat (and enjoyed it)   :)  MEATLOVERS - you really need to try this place! My fiance and his mom both got the El Filet and were impressed with the quality of the meat. And they give you TWO filets, not one. My fiance also loved that they did not overcook his "rare" steak.  Be prepared for crappy service and the snotty host with his hair tied back. Our waiter was nice, but he was MIA for most of the night and he did not understand that I wanted the appetizer with the main course.  We were baffled by the house "salad" which looks like burger fixings. It took us 40 minutes to get our food. I got the smoked provolone cheese which was yummy, as was the house mashed potatoes.  However, the sauteed vegetables were just terrible. They were actually steamed, unseasoned and clearly not fresh.   I also had a bad experience on the phone with the host. I called to make a reservation days in advance for a weeknight, and he said, "We aren't taking any more reservations." I asked him why not, and he said "We have two parties coming in at 7:30."  Tango Sur opens at 5 pm, so I said "OK we'll make reservations at 5 pm, two and a half hours before your parties come in." He replied they had plenty of spots open but just would not take reservations, and that we could "take our chances" to come in before 7:30. He then hung up on me.  Of course when we arrived at 6:15 pm, the front room was only 1/3 full. I don't understand why restaurants like this need to pretend they are more popular than they actually are.

I think I've just about played out my string at Tango Sur.  I was there for a dinner party last night and one of my fellow dinners was treated "less than excellent" by our server.  She just wanted to be sure that she received the correct entree, and as a result was subject to a 5 minute interrogation by our server and the manager.  Not as bad as I'm making it sound, but not OK for one of the best steakhouses on the north side.  Also, while I'm sure there was no malice intended and it might be partly due to a language barrier, when serving a female customer her food, saying "Here's your steak, lady"  sounds pretty derogatory.   Again, my perception of the event probably exaggerates the situation and otherwise service is good and the food is great.  And good for them that they fill the house every night.  I just think I'm ready to move on to other places.  Maybe I'm just getting old.

I've eaten here multiple times and have LOVED every single experience.  First, it's BYOB which always makes things more interesting.  Second, it boasts extremely dim lighting and candles everywhere, which makes for a very romantic date spot.  Third, the steak is incredible (or so I think, as it could very easily be the wine talking at that point in the evening).  Fourth, it's fairly cheap - bringing your own booze always helps lessen the blow of a dinner bill, but this place is still pretty inexpensive in light of the quality of the food and the dining experience.   Although I can hardly stop raving about this place or telling everyone I know that they MUST go there, I do have one complaint: figure out how to take and honor reservations.  The last time I went was with a large group of people for my birthday.  We had made a reservation a week in advance (which took 5 different people to finally confirm that we had actually made one), and were still not sat until 45 minutes after our confirmed reservation time. Other than the staff's inability to figure out how reservations work, this place is amazing - my favorite restaurant in the city!

Perhaps because all the other reviews set me up to thinking this was going to be one of the best BYOBs ever... I was sorely disappointed... and I REALLY wanted to like Tango Sur.  I had been wanting to try it for months.  Now, granted, I am a vegetarian - so I already had a strike against me!  I ordered the eggplant/spinach dish which sounded utterly delightful... until it showed up drowned in a greasy, buttery, tomato sauce.  I could only eat about four bites before I felt completely sick to my stomach.  The service wasn't so hot either - our bottle of white wine was nearly hot before a bucket of ice was brought to our table.  I truly don't understand why there's a four hour wait list for this place on the weekend.

Our own booze is what prevented us from leaving. There is no sharing of loved cuisine but full frontal food mugging. I'd bet the $25 grass fed beef-- rife with tendons was a cheaper piece of a$se cut than the menu admits. So, you love meat but don't touch it or butcher yourself?  Maybe this will pass as high quality since fire licks it.  It's tough my friend. As tough as octopus done wrong. Steak gum with collagen not making things happy and tasty. Aloof servers, hosts that visibly count head money per table and the worst burger garnish passed off as a salad--ever.   No wait. Monday.

Great early Friday evening dinner. Arrived at just before 6:00 w/o reservation. Just in time. Packed by time we left at 7:45. Staff couldn't have been friendlier. Food great for $$. Made me want steak at Don Julio in Buenos Aires. Will be back BEFORE 7:00 or w/reservation.

Delicious and very reasonable priced BYOB. Portions are easily sharable and ambiance is perfect for a date night. If you have a large party you can make a reservation, however if you have a small party it is first come first serve. They are super nice and will take down your cell number and give you a call when your table is ready. With all of the Southport bars nearby, it is easy to grab a drink while you wait!

We came here on a Sunday evening to end my eventful weekend back at home before I head back on the road for work and to have a nice dinner with some friends from Florida staying with us for the weekend. We had a party of 5 and since they do not take reservations for party's of 6 or less, I had my doubts on if we would be able to eat there that night. However, to my delight, the guy taking names said the wait would only be half an hour. Just enough time to walk over to CVS and grab a bottle of wine and head back. Much to our delight, we were seated within 30 minutes. The place was crowded, but not to the point where someones butt would be in your face if they were passing by your table. First off, I do not remember the place being so dark. If the place was any darker I would have to use night vision goggles to get around the place. Even when seated at our table, the candles were so small, I could barely see the person across the table from me or my food which I needed to cut, a little annoying, but I will just have to work around it. The wife and I ordered: Lomo Relleno half slab Argentine filet sliced and filled with a chimichurri, ham sauce then cooked and served on a grill with portabella marsala I never had this, as I always order the T-bone. I was not sure if it would be enough for my wife and I (even though the menu said it is ideal for two), my wife always says that my stomach is a bottomless pit. When it came out, I thought the menu should have read (ideal for three), it was a big portion of meat, which i was praying would not be dry. Much to my pleasure the meat was not dry whatsoever and was absolutely delicious. After cutting each slice, I made sure to dip the slice in the ham sauce the meat came in and then the chimichurri sauce, but some people might want to skip the chimichurri sauce altogether because the meat already so much flavor with the ham sauce.  The portabella mushrooms that came with the dish were veeeeeeeeery good. This is coming from a person who only eats mushrooms with his deep dish pizza, again the mushrooms were very flavorful. I completely forgot about the empanadas, the wife and I had the chicken ones and they were gone before I can blink. I had eaten mine. They were sooooooo good. I will not even try describing it. If you are there, definitely try their empanadas. Lastly, I loved the fact it was byob. This not only cuts down on the check, but it also allows you to drink something that you know you will like. A great, dark place to bring a date or go with a group, it doesn't matter because the food was absolutely delicious and the wait staff is very quick and prompt when you need water or something else to go with your meal! I will definitely be coming back!

Since I have never been to Argentina, I cannot evaluate the food's Argentinian bona fides. I can state emphatically, however, that both times I ate here I left rubbing my belly in satisfaction and making soft mewling sounds. If this is how they eat in Argentina, book me a flight! A word of warning: Tango Sur is not a vegetarian establishment. It is not even flexitarian. In fact, had Scott Pilgrim filmed in Chicago versus Toronto, he would have invited Ramona's 3rd evil ex to dinner here.  I was seriously nervous about going here the first time (it was for my brother's birthday dinner) since I generally do not eat a lot of meat and I refuse to put my lips to factory farmed protein. Imagine my relief when the waiter confirmed that all the beef items (I cannot vouch for the chicken or fish) are sourced organically from a traditional farm. So far, so good. Now, onto the real reason you are reading this: the FOOD. Start with the pressed tongue with roasted peppers. If you have been waiting anxiously to try tongue but it just never seemed like the right time, I have happy news: it is unlikely you will find a better version than what Tango Sur prepares. Next, order the empenadas. One of each flavor should do it. Skip the a la Milanese stuff (I thought we were in Argentina?) and head straight for the Beef Vesuvio, Lomo Relleno, or El Filet. The Lomo is a great candidate for splitting with your fellow diners.  Finally, indulge your craving for a taste of sweetness with the flan. Awesome. A solid 4 stars.

I've been to Tango Sur a couple of times now. I have to say, I am not as impressed with this place as much as some of my other friends are. This last time we went, we found out that they now take reservations. However, we got there and they claimed that they did not have us written down. The worst part about it was, instead of then writing our name down on the list, he forgot, and then was seating people who came in after us before he sat us. The entrees I will say are pretty large in size, I was definitely able to take home some leftovers. The food was pretty good for the price. Another good thing about this place is that it is byob. I will maybe go back if others want to go but it wouldn't be my first choice. There are much better places to go.
MMMMeat! Delicious, reasonably priced huge portions of meat! BYOB with no corkage. Fun atmosphere. Unless you're veg, there is no reason NOT to go here.

BYOB's have a special place in my hear and Tango Sur ranks very near the top in my book.   Pick up a few bottles of Malbec and get on over to Tango Sur.  You'll flipr for the great steaks, great prices and great service.  No matter what you choose, you will be full and very happy with your meal.  THe portions are huge and you can definitely head home with leftovers for a few days.  The meat sampler (Parillada) platter is pretty tasty too and offers a huge variety of meats.   As a starter, you must try the empanadas.  I'm a big fan of the Spinach ones but they are all pretty delish Don't try this place if you're in a hurry since they don't take reservations unelss you're with a large group.  Come hungry!

I've been to Tango Sur four times now and it's usually pretty good. On a Friday or Saturday night, you'll have to wait an hour or so for a table. Your best bet is to put your name down and give them your cell phone number to call when your table is ready. While you wait, I would recommend stopping in and grabbing a drink at Cullen's, this Irish pub a few doors down. One thing you should note about Tango Sur: it's cramped and very noisy inside. Not the type of place to take your grandma who wraps herself in a cardigan and complains about the cold draft when the hostess seats her by the door. If you want to have a conversation, I would recommend sitting outside.  Now for the food. The steaks are good-sized, taste great and are extremely well-priced. When you're finished eating one you'll sit back and wonder how the Hell those places in the Loop get away with charging 40 bucks.  In my experience with Tango Sur, I've only had one problem:  my girlfriend ordered the spinach ravioli (she's vegetarian) and after eating a couple pieces, she realized they messed up her order and gave her the meat ravioli. She immediately lost her appetite and stopped eating. Now to most people, this might be hard to understand, but she was raised vegetarian and mistakingly eating meat causes her to not be hungry anymore. Fine. We politely notify our waiter that she is vegetarian and that he gave her the wrong dish. But instead of apologizing or offering to get her something else, he denies it!  We literally had to open up a piece of ravioli and show it to him. Dude, we're not trying to scam you out of two pieces of 12 dollar ravioli. He proceeds take it back to the kitchen and then returns to blame everything on the cook. But the worst part was, he didn't take it off our bill and instead brought us one plate of flan to split between four people. Weak.  But besides that one mishap, this place is usually pretty good and I'll probably be back

I recently dined here for the first time and will 2nd everything that the reviewer, "Quan L", has stated. It can feel a little crowded, but everyone minds their own business and it's a pretty laid back atmosphere. God knows my group got kind of loud with some very ill-timed joking around, but other tables seem to just giggle about it.  Definitely plan on getting there as early as possible to beat the rush.

Tango, I really wanted to Love you. I was ready to give you a 5 star review. But alas, SALT was your downfall. And I'm not talking about Russian spy, ass kicking action woman Angelina Jolie. Location: Went on a Wednesday and the wait wasn't bad at all. About a 10 minute wait. Heard it was horrendous on the weekends so I avoided that at all cost. Good thing I did. Finding parking was another issue. Took us at least 20 minutes to find paid parking..... Everything else is residential. Inside tip: There is a cemetery about 2 blocks away and there is free parking across the street. If you don't mind walking. It's the perfect spot. Plus, it let's you build up your hunger.  Decor: People say it's dark inside, but I thought it was cozy and mysterious. Since I was siting next to the window, the reflection of the street lamps help illuminate the person siting in front of me.   Food: I felt I was rushed by my particular waiter, like he had other things to do. He ran through the specials and left. Reflecting upon this, I don't even know what he said because he said it so fast. But then again, it was kinda loud in there. I got the Vacio for two and waited about 45 minutes for it. When it came out. It looked perfect with a big chunk of steak and sweet potatoes but unfortunately, when the meat hit my palate, it became a issue of "is there salt on here?" Did they even salt it at all? When I get steak, I expect my steak to be the main attraction in terms of taste and seasonings. There was a lot of sauce and sweet potatoes but I think the sweet potatoes sweetened or milled the flavor of the sauce. Overall, not the best thing I've had. I was sadly disappointed by this great cut of meat. I ended up salting the meat but it didn't help. If you have to salt your meat, clearly there is a problem. And by no means am I a salt lover. Maybe only the Angelina Jolie kind. As people said, the salad was pretty pathetic if pathetic was a word. Lettuce, sliced tomatoes and onions and vinegar and oil on the side. I was thinking to myself, where's my salad dressing? Oy vey! Empanadas were pretty good, both the meat as well as the spinach and cheese. The sauce went perfectly with them. Ahh, the only redeeming quality in this restaurant.  Overall: Not sure if all of their food is like this or was this an off day but I was not impressed. From all the reviews, I was hoping it would blow my socks off but instead it went up like a puff of smoke. I'll come back next time and give it a second chance. Next time, hopefully they'll put some salt on my meat. Btw: It's funny to watch all the drunk people come staggering out!

I feel like such a Debbie downer writing this, but honestly, I just don't get the hype about this place, except to say this:  Have you seen the movie "Alive"? (umm, spoiler alert, I guess) You know the part where they find the other half of the plane with the suitcases and one of the dudes opens it and finds toothpaste? He squeezes the toothpaste into his mouth like it's the best thing he's ever eaten because the only thing he's had to eat in a really long time is his teammates? Well, I think the hype about this food just comes from waiting too long. By the time some of these other reviewers sat down, they'd eat toothpaste and call it the best meal ever. I'm not buying it.  This is one of those places we've been wanting to try forever since it always gets good reviews, but anytime we think of it, the wait is too long. So, my birthday rolled around on a Tuesday night and we figured that it would be a good night to go to try this place. We made a reservation. When we got there, there was only one other table, so we had our pick of tables and had no wait.  To start, we picked the wrong table. We sat outside at a two-top close to the window so we'd be out of the sun. Unfortunately, a leaky air conditioner from a window above had completely saturated the awning, so we were dripped on throughout the entire meal. The place was packed by the time it wasn't really funny anymore, so there was no where for us to go. I know this wasn't necessarily the restaurant's fault, but maybe they should not put a table there? Just a thought.  Our waiter came over to the table, opened our bottle of wine (leaving the foil torn and jagged. Such a small detail, but it was noticed) and left us with empty water glasses for about 10 minutes. Finally, someone came by and gave us some water. They dumped some bad bread rolls on our table and away they went. A few minutes later, the waiter returns and says "are you ready to order?" Now, call me picky, but good service usually includes the waiter introducing himself and asking if we'd ever been there before. The menu was not really self explanatory, but the waiter seemed in too much of a hurry to ask. We took a stab and ordered what looked good.   We ordered 2 empanadas- one con carne and one with spinach and cheese. Both were good. However, the busboy came and swept away our plates before we were finished. Just because I put my fork down does not mean you can take my plate. I hate that!  Next were the salads. I understand this is a steak house, but the salad was pretty disappointing. The lettuce was not fresh at all, and that's pretty much all the salad is: lots of wilted lettuce, 2 slices of tomato, 3 slices of onion, oil and vinegar. It was bad.  Next came our steaks. I had the boneless strip steak. My husband had the short rib. The steaks were good. I ordered mine medium rare, and it came out medium rare. It had a good flavor to it. However, it was really fatty (is that normal for a strip steak? I don't even know), and the knives were really dull so it was difficult to cut. My husband ordered his medium and it came out medium well but he enjoyed it.  Then our bill came, and it was less than we spent at a local pub a week ago, so they have that going for them.  I'd go between 2 and 3 stars for this place, so count this as a 2.5 stars. Decent steaks and good prices, but no frills. I don't understand the wait for this place. I wouldn't wait more than 10 minutes for this meal, and that's just because I know I'd be getting a deal on a steak, which is never really my first choice when eating out anyway.

Make sure you call in a day or two beforehand and make reservations. Be prepared to wait at least 15-45 mins to be seated even if you are on time.  BYOB. 7 of us gals, three bottles of wine, a bottle of dragonberry, a case of beer was given to us by a patron of the restaurant equals a wonderful night filled with laughter and a table spread of excellent tasting food.  My heart just melts for the El filet with spinach mashed potatoes. More like the steak literally melts in your mouth. It's tender and delicious. Their eggplant pasta is hands down the best tasting pasta I have ever had in Chicago.  How about their empanadas? Oooooohhh child, dip that spinach and cheese empanadas in that delicious sauce of theirs and you are in heaven! Love the experience, ambiance, food and service. Definitely not a kid friendly place in the evening. It's a great place to gather with friends/family. Romantic dinner?! As long as you are okay with the noise level. If your date is a bit of a talker this could be the deal breaker restaurant. The talking will be be swallowed up by the noise level in the restaurant. =) FYI: keep an eye on your tab because a server might overcharge you since you are all filled with alcohol by the end of the meal.

We did make reservations. BYOB no corking fee. Beware, we were going to bring a birthday cake but there was a fee for that. I had a wonderful, satisfying meal here. The empanadas are good. The steak came with a salad (simple lettuce tomato onions). I had the El Filet. Which is super super tender and simple, with a side of spinach mashed potatoes. I definitely think it was great value for money.  The place is kind of crowded, though.  Can't wait to try Folklore in Wicker Park.

Tango Sur is definitely worth the wait. The pace betwen courses is perfect to enjoy your BYOB of choice and the good company you go with!  The Antipasto is a perfect start to get you going in your meal and the empanadas con carne were perfectly prepared. I had the Bife Vesuvio which did not let me down. I ordered it cooked medium and it was spot on (despite the reviews I've read of it being over done)! The cheese and spinach combination is to die for.  Oh - the chimuchurri sauce? You need to try it with everything. It's garlicky goodness will smack you in the face. If you don't like to wait, I suggest showing up around 5 - 5:30 as it seemed like no one had to wait. After that, the wait seemed to settle around 30-45 minutes around 6:30. Also, the waitstaff - also yummy. I'm ashamed to say that I've lived in the city for 4 years and this is my first attempt....I'll surely be back!!

Holy mother of meat, Batman. This has been the greatest meal I have had in Chicago - hands down.  Started with empanadas - waiter recommended spinach and cheese. Went with it, probably would go beef next time.  Shared the Vacio which is a half slab of range grown flap meat sliced and filled with olive oil, garlic, parsley sauce, then cooked and served on a grill with mashed sweet potatoes ideal for two. This was probably the greatest thing I have eaten in a long time. Meat was perfectly charred, cooked to perfection, resting in a beautiful sauce that I wanted to slather on anything, and high quality. I could not stop eating. I am still having the meat sweats from this experience. Recommendations - Always busy. Try to get it on non-peak hours (for dinner, get in before 6). Sit outside if you can! Go BYOB because, well, why not? Limited parking on Southport but not impossible. ...And, if nothing else, its next to Dairy Queen. What more in life do you need?

What's more to say when this place is reaching 300 reviews? 1. Excellent steaks. They come a little underdone so if you usually get rare, go for medium rare. Again, excellent steaks. 2. Make a reservation. Prepare to wait. 3. Sweetbread.

Things to know when you go here: A) It is LOUD. B) Order lots of empanadas and dump that sauce all over them. C) BYOB but like Colleen says, drink that red wine and get the heck out and go to the bar down the street to linger. D) It is good for groups. E) It is not good for moving around to do things like go to the bathroom. F) Don't bring a big ass purse (you know who you are). G) Don't plan to go out drinking afterwards because you will have a big ass steak in your belly and will be DUN for the night. Cool place and cool atmosphere, great food but wow.  Came here once and they told us 4 hours wait.  Tried again during the week early and it was much better.  Good luck on weekends during the summer.

I've been to Tango Sur 5 or 6 times, and here's the deal: I give it five stars because I'm combining price and quality.  $22 for almost a full pound of VERY good filet mignon cooked in a simple, delicious juicy sauce, and it includes tasty potatoes.  I take half my steak home each time- it's that big! Don't get me wrong, if you'd like to spend easily 2 or 3 times as much at Gibson's, Joe's, Morton's or any one of the numerous more expensive steak houses in the city, you might get a better steak.  And for $10 extra, your potatoes might be better too.    It's rare that it's not crowded from 6-10pm at least, especially on the weekend- plan accordingly.  It can be loud inside.  I love sitting outside.  I try to go on off nights, or after a Cubs day game.

We just ate here for my friend's birthday on Friday night.  It was great!  We ordered a steak entree for 2, topped with tons of garlic and seasonings...it was fabulous!!!  It was enough for 4.  The chicken empanadas are the best too.  Highly recommend, and sitting outside was great too.

Get the filet and order it medium rare. It won't be as tender as a steakhouse version, but the Argentinean juices and potatoes it comes with are delicious. You will walk out stuffed. The place is very romantic, BYOB. They kind of have strange, small "wine glasses," so bring your own of those too if you want to avoid spilling on yourself.
