The food is fantastic, the staff is amazing, and the setting is great, cramped but great.   Everything positive everyone else has said I concur with, a true gem in the city.

wow, i couldn't believe how crowded it was on a tuesday night. the wait was like 40 minutes but it didn't seem too bad since i was with good company.  the place was crowded and noisy but tolerable. the service was good. the food was good as well. the empanadas were light and tasty. for dinner, my friend got the chicken parmesan... wtf? argentinean steak house. he didnt get it but he's always been strange. me and the other friend got the grill plate for 2, but the portions were more like for 4. it was good. had a variety of meats... beef rib, sweetbreads, blood sausage, some other salty sausage and i think it was strip steak. i particularily like the blood sausage although my other friends looked as if they would yak. 55 bucks for dinner. crazy deal! overall, great value. the steak did seem like it was of a lower caliber but makes it up in price and quantity. no corkage fee makes this a real bargain.

LOVE THIS PLACE!! THe steak is sooo yummy and the portion is huge!! I always have enough left over for breakfast the next day, lol.  I say breakfast because I love it so much I can't wait until lunch or dinner to eat my leftovers.  The sides are also very good, and the portions are generous (to say the least).  Definitely recommend this place!! Oh, and BYOB - you can't beat a steak meal for $25/pp including your own bottle of wine!

And now, ladies and Gentlemen, what you've all been waiting for.... Review # 406.  Yeah, yeah, Tango Sur is the shizzle. We all know that. I am adding this review because I want to testify to ti's authenticity.  I spent winter break from law school in Argentina "studying abroad" - AKA enjoying summer in the southern hemisphere, gawking at the world's most beautiful women (Brazil Schmazil), eating steak almost every night for insane, ridiculous, almost criminally cheap prices, drinking LOTS of good Argentine wine, and not knowing how to communicate (I don't speak Spanish).  But I digress. Tango Sur is EXACTLY like a meal you would get at an upscale Argentine steakhouse. First, the salad (which one reviewer described as "plain jane") is identical to the salads that accompany most dinner entrees- onions, lettuce, tomato, oil & vinegar- that's it.  Second, the empanadas are crispy, flaky, tender, and delicious- just like the best ones I had during my stay. All of the fillings are delish.  Third, the MEAT. Skirt steak, ribeye, filet, blood sausage- all wonderful and all authentic. Chimichurri is exquisite. I want it at the table for every meal from now on.  But if you REALLY want to experience a true Argentine meal, order the Parilla. It's a small grill brought to your table, covered in all sorts of stuff like sweetbreads, intestines/ chitlins, sausage, chicken, beef- not for the faint of heart. You'll experience meat-sweats, your body will hate you in the morning, and you can forget about getting any post-meal action for a few hours, but it's worth it.  If you're reading this you probably already know how amazing Tango Sur is. Bring some wine and a date you want to impress. See you there.

BYOB with no fee!!! The food is amazing and the portions are huge. If you like meat and steak, this is the place to go. The waiters are all friendly, and the service is great. The only problem is getting a table, this place is always packed!!

Do you remember when Homer went to the land of Chocolate and simply couldn't contain himself?  He tip-toes, twists, and twirls through delicacies made of chocolate upon chocolate. and just as his dream is ending, a cute little chocolate dog jumps into his arms and he takes a nice juicy bite out of it's hindquarters.  In my dream I'm Homer, Tango Sur is the Land of Meat, and the ribeye with chimichurri is that cute little obliging pooch.   Tell you what, leave your veg-ina at home and bring an expensive bottle of Napa or South American Cabernet to this restaurant, order that ribeye and some empanadas and you'll be in the Land of Meat.  Hey, I might even see you there - look for the guy lounging in a comfy meat-made Eames lounger gently caressing a doe-eyed tennn-der veal lap calf. Go on a weeknight as soon as you can get there after work for best results.  If you don't bring interesting company that's your own fault, so be prepared to kill some time waiting for your food.  Obviously, it's worth the wait.

The two stars are for the steaks and the cheese that accompanied the salad.   The place is crammed not their fault, but they are over staffed and all the staff are men no women at all! There wasn't any emotion to the place it is calked the Tango for crying out loud where is that Allure? I would maybe go back but would rather spend allot more and go to Gibsons!

I cant believe this place is getting so 4 and 5 stars from everyone. The Dinner for Two was nothing special, decent steak but 3 star at best. The place is crowded, loud and you spend an hour or two waiting. Its great that its BYOB, but the service and food are average at best.

Full of anticipation, I finally made it to Tango Sur. Pros: 1. Delicious food. 2. BYOB! 3. Dark fun atmosphere. 4. Very reasonable prices. 5. Very authentic feeling (went to Arg 3 months ago). 6. Good music in the background (albeit loud). 7. The Candle Cons: 1. A little bit tight (about 3 inches from the next table on each side) 2. It was very loud, almost to the point where we had to yell at each other. 3. This was the biggest con for me: I felt like we were being rushed out the entire time, they were anxious to clear plates through each course.  I would understand if there was a wait or something, but it was a tuesday night at like 9 p.m. No reason for that. Still had an enjoyable time, but that can be attributed to good company and conversation.  I was really looking foward to reliving my Buenos Aires experience, but it wasn't quite the same.  The service in BA was much better and the people were more polite.  This is really a 3.7, because I'm big on service, but I'll round up to a 4, because I really did have a good time.
Great place!   I went on a Monday night and this place was packed.  That tells you how great the food is.  The place is small but that's what makes this spot a must.

Sunday today, took two out-of-town guests to Tango Sur. Nearly didn't go, put off by reviews of slow service and long waits. Here is how long we waited: not at all, although the restaurant was cheerfully full.  Here is how much we paid: $117 for four people, half of what we expected to pay.  Here is what we ate: four empanadas, a stuffed beef tenderloin shared by two, a plateful of prime rib, a plateful of veal Milanesa, two iced teas, two extra orders of potatoes, four big salads, and four huge yummy desserts. Here is what I brought home: enough beef to make gargantuan sandwiches for our guests' plane trip tomorrow, enough food left over to give two of us generous dinners for the next three nights,  and a pint and a half of portobello mushroom sauce for the freezer.  Tango Sur has to be one of the biggest bargains in Chicago. Also we loved the BYOB policy (as did other customers---from our table we could watch them approaching the door  with their their bags of wine).

It seems superfluous to add a review (the 398th to be exact) but after finally dining here after years of lust, I had to join the cheering section. The steaks are fat and tender, the chimichurri piquant and garlicky. The convivial service is charming and drop-dead gorgeous. As the night steps into high gear the noise levels can get deafening, and reservations are a must unless you fancy a 45 minute wait at a restaurant with no bar (BYOB!). The salads arrived promptly, but there was a long wait in store for the entrees... For me it heightened the drama of anticipation, but to be fair, others at my table found their patience waning.

I love this place! While I really want to give them 5 stars, I'm going to give them 4 because the restaurant can get really busy that service can get a little slow. Now I wouldn't say service is nonexistent because that's not the case at all. All I'm saying is that the restaurant gets extremely busy so the waiters don't get the chance to get to your table as often as you may be used to at other restaurants. In all the times I've been, I can honestly say that our waiters have been quite friendly and are attentive when you do get their attention.  As for the food, it is YUMMY! I've gone several times already ranging from weeknight to weekend nights and they are very consistent with serving tasty, solid dishes. My last visit I tried their salmon dish and it was very good. Oh and I just tried their empanadas during my last visit and they are delicious ... I can't believe I've never ordered them before. We ordered one of each ... my favorite was the chicken. My hubby's favorite was the jamon and queso. Oh and every time we go we order the Berenjena which is an eggplant dish with ricotta cheese in a creamy tomato sauce as an appetizer --- it is very tasty and it can also be served as an entree.  Next time we go, I plan on ordering the Medio Pollo al Limon. I'll update my review then with what I think but I'm pretty sure I'm won't be disappointed.  This is a great place for groups or couples. It's vibe is like the cafes and bistros in NYC. THE BYOB is an added bonus!

There is nothing I can say that hasn't been said before about Tango Sur. I loved this place and can't wait to go back!  We went on a Monday at 6:30pm- and were seated right away. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive.  To start off, we had some empanadas de pollo y de carne- delicious! I had the Medio Pollo al Limon- it is perfection! It comes with vesuvio style potatoes.  My husband had the Filet Mignon and they gave him two huge pieces of meat with potatoes.  We had a great time- polishing off a bottle of wine (me) and some beers (the husband)  I love the atmosphere of this place. I know some people complain that it is loud and crowded, but I'm loud myself and crowds don't bother me :)  Oh and the best part? our bill was $48.00 + tip.  unfreakinbeliavable! We left stuffed, happy and without breaking the bank.

Small, cozy place that is BYOB.  Fortunately you can purchsase wine/beer nearby if you were not aware of this.  Great service and great food too.  I loved the empanadas.  I mean loved them.  I couldn't get enough

Probably my favorite restaurant in Chicago. If you are with a group, try getting a few things other than steaks... I frequently get the pechuga de pollo (grilled chicken and vegetables) which is out of this world. The berenjena (an eggplant appetizer) is big enough for a meal.  Try dining during the week, because you will wait over 2 hours on the weekend. Plus, during the week, you will get more attentive service, the portions are more generous, and you may get a free salad or dessert :)

This place is the epitome of fine Chicago neighborhood dining.  No corkage, great ambiance, great service, great meal, great cuts, great flavors. The menu is pretty comprehensive and my vegetrian friends always find something on it - usually a salad or fried appetizer that they can eat. Yes, you will have to wait - but, that is because it is worth it.

Great prices.  BYOB.  Romantic.  Empanadas are delicious.  Vesuvio steak is delicious.  Parrallada (sp?) is basically an entire cow.  The cow is delicious. A little loud...a little cramped...and the wait was 45 minutes...but you know what, if that's the only thing I can say bad about it, then that's a pretty great review, especially for having eaten there only once. Advice for anyone going there for the first time, based on my mistakes:  Remember to eat bread.  If you are drinking your BYOBooze, all that meat will be delicious, but it won't help absorb the alcohol.  Balance it out with some bread.  You can always take home the rest of the cow later.  I walked out of there feeling much "happier" than I had expected to feel, but I basically ate nothing but beef all night long. Viva la sweetbreads - those things were the best.

Table of 7 is Lost in Translation?  Stopped by Tango Sur last night, with a party of 7 @ 7.  When we asked how long it would be for our table of 7, the host very matter-of-factly said, "we don't do 7."  I understand Tango Sur is a small, but popular place - undoubtedly because of the BYOB policy - but at least give us the courtesy of a professional answer.  During an economic time where most restaurants are begging for your business, Tango Sur only wants it, if you keep your groups to parties of 4 or less, wait outside for ridiculous amounts of time, and once seated - ensure you are nearly sitting in the laps of the people at the table next to you.  Sounds like a great deal, huh? Skip Tango Sur and try Las Tablas on Lincoln where a table of 7 or more, is no problem.  Las Tablas is a Columbian Steakhouse with excellent food, friendly and efficient service, spacious tables, a better value, and no reservations needed (last night, they were completely booked and we waited only 40 mins. for a table).

Delicious Food. Great Service. Vibrant Atmosphere. BYOB. Tango Sur did a great job of accommodating our group for a birthday celebration. Our group was well served by the staff and the food was great. We dined on flavorful empanadas, antipasto, and awesome provoleta. (Argentinian cheese with olive oil and roasted red peppers) Then the meatastic feast began. Para Dos is the way to go. ($31 for two people) It is meatful, meatnormous enjoyment for two. Grilled chorizo, short ribs, blood sausage, beef sweetbreads, and my favorite, flap steak. The flap steak was perfectly cooked, well-seasoned, moist and came in a generous portion. Me and my meat buddy could not even finish all of the meatness. And oh yea, the one vegetarian at the table enjoyed a eggplant parmesan-type dish and even she was satisifed. The service was top-notch. Our server made sure all of our needs were taken care of. Whether it was more bread, opening one of our many bottles of wine, taking pictures, retrieving errant balloons, etc. The rest of staff made sure our water glasses were filled and dirty dishes were removed. And we were entertained by a live guitarist. It is BYOB with no corkage fee. It also cuts down on the bill as you can stock up at the nearby CVS. Make a reservation if you're going during the dinner rush, especially during the weekend...and enjoy the food.

Dined here again over the weekend while I was visiting and I am so glad we squeezed it in. I have nothing bad to say about this place, I love everything about it. I actually think it adds to the fun when you have to put your name on the list and wait (and yes the wait can be up to 2 hours long) Once inside the staff is always excellent. You can grab any of the numerous staff around to give you a hand, even if it's not your server. BYOB makes it even more fun, we always seem to bring ample wine and if we can't finish off what we've opened we always share it with a nearby table (this has happened to us before where a table shares the left over alcohol so we happily continue on the tradition) Now for the food...its making my stomach grumble wishing I could have some right now! The empanadas are awesome! I've had all 3 kinds and love them. The salad that comes with the meals is simple but delicious, as is the hot and crusty bread that seems to always be on the table. I've had the Lomo steak and the El Filet and have never been disappointed by either. There is always leftovers to take home and it's always as delicious as the night before. Sweet potatoes and the spinach mashed are excellent! I hope to get here again soon!

Yummy! My boyfriend and I are total carnivores, so this was right up our alley.  Went this past Saturday, thinking it would be slow, with everyone else out drinking.  NOT! Our long wait was rewarded by an awesome Lomo Saltado (?) with a kickass mushroom sauce.  Even though we were sat pretty late 10:30, we were never rushed.  Also thought it was cool that the Host/Manager showed us the indoor waiting area.

One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.  There is always a crazy long wait, but you can go have a few drinks at the bar a few shops down and they will call once they are ready. I usually order the El Filet , which is $24 ( think they raised the price from $20 recently) and it is actually 2 filets so I can split that.  The place is byob , which will save you a ton of money.  And most of the waiters are super friendly.

Lots of great things have been said about Tango Sur.  I'm a definite fan.  Been going there for the last 6 years.  There's always a wait, but if you come just a bit before the traditional dinner time -- say, around 6 -- it pretty much takes care of the problem.  Service is always great, and the food outstanding.  The trick is to get the Argentine steaks, not the American ones -- they do import the beef from Argentina, and you can taste the difference.  My fave cuts are vacio, bife de chorizo (has nothing to do with the Mexican sausage) and churrasco.  My boyfriend loves the lomo relleno laden with chimichurri and grilled portobello mushrooms -- but that is a dish for two. They also have the sausage -- chorizo -- very yummy.  And for appetizers -- nothing beats the beef empanadas (they're much tastier than all the other ones).  For those that have been to Argentina -- mollejas and and morcilla taste the same as there!!!  Pleasant surprise, because the actual steaks in Buenos Aires are still better than anything here... Hint: at the Argentine grocery store (adjacent to the restaurant) you can buy the empanadas... and the raw Argentine meat cuts to grill at home.  Great alternative in case the waiting line at the restaurant is too long and you're craving the Real Meat!  (They sell chimichurri there, too -- it keeps for a long time in the fridge, and I love adding it to various dishes at home). The only thing I don't like about the restaurant: when it's too cold to sit outside, you have to be indoors, and it gets way too loud.  Other than that -- it's perfect.

What can I say that hasn't already been said?  This is by far my favorite restaurant in Chicago. While there are many downfalls to this place, one being the awful wait, it is well worth it. The bread alone is almost orgasmic, but never fear because the meat is out of this world. Like I can't cook this meat at home and really isn't that what you should go to a restaurant for, something you can't make yourself. While it's nice to go out and eat pasta (which I love), ultimately I can make pasta at home. Please note that, I do not recommend this for a first date and here is why: Because this place is crazy popular it's super loud in here. It's in no part the fault of the owners, it's just that crowded. While the dim lights look romantic, shouting at each other in a getting to know you kind of way might diminish your chances of a second date. Take your new lover to Tango Sur once you know they are truly spacial.

I've been there over 5 times and every time its great. Its a BYOB place and they don't charge a fee which is amazing!  I've had the lomo relleno a bunch of times and that is my go-to dish there really flavorful with mushrooms and a side of chimichurri sauce which is to die for. All there food there is overall amazing though i had the short ribs and those came out kinda bland. for apps I am prone to the empenadas though delic!  The servers are attentive and nice some are more knowledgeable then others so if you have questions hope you get someone who is  knowledgeable.  Expect a wait if you're going during prime time dining hours (6:30-8) but there are a few bars around the area that you can wait at and they'll even call you when the table is ready...a stupendous idea!

If you like meat, you have to check out Tango Sur!  My husband and I have gone several times for special occasions.  It's a little bit pricey but not over priced!  Service is great.  Atmosphere is dark and intimate... very intimate!  You may be practically sitting with your neighbors so if privacy is important, this may not be the best choice for you.  BYOB - check out Que Syrah, just steps away on Southport, for a GREAT wine selection.   We haven't ever had a meal we didn't love!  It's been a while so I can't remember the exact name of the dish but I usually get the steak that's stuffed with spinach and cheese! AMAZING!

As others have mentioned, the BYOB here is great!  Even with appetizers and sides, our bill was a nice surprise.  We also brought our own cake because it was someone's birthday, and they charged very little for that.   However, the food was extremely disappointing. Steaks: I tried the Lomo Relleno (half slab argentine filet, served on a grill, serves 2), Vacio (half slab of range grown flap meat, serves 2), and the El Filet.  The Lomo Relleno was extremely bland and wasn't grilled for long enough.  The meat was also really tough and not at all what I expected of an argentine filet.  The Vacio was slightly better, but not by much.  It was still bland, but at least it was slightly more grilled.  The El Filet, which does not come served on a grill, was better but still on the bland side.  In any case, if you are going to get steak, get the individual portions.  Fish: I didn't get to try this, but two of our party got the fish.  Even though they were sitting right next to each other and got the same thing, the girl's fish was half the size of the guy's fish.  They comped us for something because of that, but it seemed a little odd that they were missing some fish.  Appetizers and Sides: We tried the empanadas and the chorizo.  Both were pretty good and come with a sauce made of oil and maybe pesto(?).  We tried all the empanadas, and I would recommend the spinach and cheese ones.

If you live in Chicago and haven't been to Tango Sur - something is wrong with you (unless you are a vegetarian, in which case ignore my review altogether). This place is the jam. I lived in Argentina for a year and Tango Sur brought me right back. The steaks here are fantastic, juicy, delicious and cheap. The proveleta appetizer is the most cheesy goodness I've ever put in my mouth. I could go on about the chicken, but c'mon its really all about the steaks. And the atmosphere. Romantic, and hectic and hectic and romantic. Go here. For sure.

No question that this place is awesome.  Great steaks and byob.  Expect to play anywhere between 15-30 for a big (12 oz) steak.  A little pricey, I guess, but the fact that it is byob makes up for it because that means there are no costs for alcohol. The ambiance is hectic yet romantic like others have mentioned.  It feels like a hip place to go. It definitely gets crowded BUT they will take your phone number and call you when your table is ready.  Since it's right on Southport that means you can go across the street to the bar to have a drink while you wait.  So really, even if you end up waiting for an hour, it's not too bad!  There is no question I would go here again!

My fiancee and I, recently engaged in Argentina, were looking for a nice little BYOB place to enjoy dinner a couple of weeks ago when we stumbled on this gem.  We ended up ordering dishes which we had tried in Argentina, and they were authentic and very tasty.  I highly recommend the empanadas for an appetizer.  I guess my only complaint was that the waiting area was a bit disorganized, and two couples were seated ahead of us even though we arrived first.  But we were enjoying a nice glass of wine in the waiting area and were in no particular hurry anyway!  Total price of a meal for two, which ended up in leftovers aplenty for lunch for each of us the next day:  $38.  As satisfying as a meal in a fancy steakhouse, but a fraction of the price and a much more romantic atmosphere.  Give it a try.

Definitely a great Argentine restaurant.  It is BYOB, but they do not have a corkage fee and they will chill your wine if needed.  It can get really crowded and they do not take reservations (at least not that I have heard of), however the hostess can take your cell phone number and will call you when the table is ready.  While we waited for our table we just went to a local bar until we got the call.   The steaks are very good and you must try the empanadas.  Tango Sur is pretty reasonably priced and definitely worth it!

Okay, of course I have returned to Tango Sur... :) And I had the best experience there that I have EVER had.  It wasn't crowded so the waiters were very attentive, something you normally can't expect from this place (unless they have improved? I am not sure). Anyways, I was able to sit and wait for my friend to arrive by the window as they opened my bottle of wine... Awesome. I don't mind waiting if I'm sipping on some wine in a cozy restaurant. Anyways... we had the empanadas (spinach and cheese and ham and cheese) - awesome as always. We also ordered the provlenta appetizer (hot provolone cheese on the grill with olive oil and red peppers) - eh, I could have done without this one, but I can understand if people love it. To me, it was just too much cheese...  And we split the lemon chicken... I still say this is the best chicken I've ever had. It is SO good, so moist, so flavorful, yum. And comes with vesuvio potatoes - and it's cheap. I think it's $13. So worth it. My only complaint: there is a $5 sharing fee, and I don't really understand why because they didn't even put it on separate plates? They literally put the chicken in front of us and gave us a plate each... so, I do not understand the fee. I mean, we paid it, but it was confusing. Anyways, the most attentive servers I've ever had here, and as always, great food. I was impressed.

Oh beefy coma, what would I do without you?  The portions are huge and tasty.  Service is a bit slow.  Do sample the empanadas.  And don't forget to bring multiple bottles of wine.  Trust me, you'll need them.

There are so many reasons why I love Tango Sur; where should I start???  I am so glad my friend discovered this place and invited me because my life would be a little sadder without it. The first time I ever went to Tango Sur was on a Monday night and the place was slammed! After going there more, I realized that they are always servery night of the week. If you do not like a loud, fast paced restaurant, you will not like Tango Sur. The atmosphere it dark, candlelit, and romantic, with every table so close that you could definitely touch the people at the table next to you; not that you would want to, but for the sake of description...  What adorns the romantic atmosphere are the beautiful people, called waiters that glide around the restaurant. Ladies (and fellas too), this restaurant has some of the most beautiful men working as wait staff that I've seen in the city of Chicago.  So down to business...One of my favorite things about this restaurant is the warm bread they give you as soon as you sit down. The rolls are so fresh. Perfectly crusty on the outside and soft on the inside. I could just eat bread here. For appetizers, I would recommend any of the empinadas. The garlic oil they give you with the empinadas (as well as many entrees) is fabulous! Entrees come with a salad. It's not your run of the mill salad; it's lettuce, two tomatoes and some onions. You get oil and vinegar as a dressing. Simple, classic and perfect because a lot of people tend to get full on salads before the meal.  I always get whatever special fish they have because I don't eat steak, but everyone who I have come with who ordered steak found it to be wonderful. At Tango Sur, you really get your money's worth of steak. A favorite is the Filet mignon, in which you are served TWO filets and it's only $24. It's a steal! I've seen many people order the dinner for two, in which you get a hot plate of a variety of scrumptious meats.  I generally don't order dessert here because for one, I'm not a huge dessert person, and two because i'm so FULL and satisfied that I don't need dessert! But the dessert I have tried has been good. There's a peaches and creme dessert that is heavenly.  Tango Sur is a great restaurant with awesome Argentinian food. The restaurant has a great ambiance that is perfect for a date. The only downsides are that it is ALWAYS busy and the tables are close together. In addition, if you don't have a party of 6 or more to make a reservation, you will probably end up waiting. Try calling ahead to put your name on the list, and if you do have to wait, take a stroll to Jewel or CVS down the street to buy some drinks for dinner...it really makes time go by. However, everything you experience at Tango Sur, makes up for these downsides. This restaurant is a MUST GO!!!

Great date place.  I'm pretty sure I fell in love in this place.  And with it!  Steaks are so so good.  And reasonably priced!  I'd take an out-of-towner here over some of the more famous steakhouses downtown any day.   Be prepared to wait.  I mean a long time.  I usually factor in at least a 2 hour wait.  Browse through all the great wines at Que Syrah down the street (toward Addison) and pick up one (or two) for dinner (BYOB).  There are plenty of great wines for $10-15 and they know a lot of people pick up wines for dinner at Tango, so they have a bunch that go well with the food.  Then I'd grab just one appetizer and a couple beers nearby Tango at Take Five (everything on the menu is $5... but don't over order / overeat because you want to save your appetite for Tango!).   Order the vacio.  It's huge and meant for two.  (Bring some breath mints because it's garlicky).   I love love love this place.  YOU MUST GO.

Tango Sur is where it's at. If you are vegetarian you probably don't want to go here. The steak is moist, flavorful, tender, and comes out to your table in massive quantities. Everything we had was delicious, and you can bring your own wine. The prices are great considering what you get. The only reason I didn't give a five is because it's a little bit crowded and the wait was 2 hours. I will definitely be going back though.

Fabulous ambience, fabulous steaks, fabulous desserts, fabulous, fabulous fabulous.  My boyfriend and I used to bring a bottle of wine every weekend and go here. We loved it! I wish I still lived in Chicago and keep the tradition going.  This restaurant is in my top 3 favorite restaurants in the country.  Don't miss it!

Went here for the first time on Monday night.  I've always wanted to try the place but never had the patience to wait in line.  We went at 6:30 on a Monday night and sat right down.  I will say though, that by 7:30, the place was pretty full.   My husband and I had empanadas which were fabulous.  We also tried the eggplant appetizer which was really good, but large.  It definitely could have been a meal on it's own.  We couldn't finish it because it was very rich.  I had the noqui (b/c I'm not a big meat eater) and I loved it!  The portion was so large that I had it for lunch the next day, too.  My husband got the filet and said it was very good as well.  Service was great...our waters were always full and the waiter was attentive.  I love that there is no corking fee! The only thing I marked off for was that our table was very dirty when we sat down. They cover the tables with brown paper and ours had grease splatters and food all over it.  Overall, I would definitely recommend Tango Sur.

First and foremost, I love Tango Sur just for the fact that it is BYOB. There wasn't even a corkage fee which was amazing! The menu is in Spanish, so luckily I am proficient enough to somewhat know what everything was. The food ended up being amazing. We all split an appetizer of baked goat cheese in a tomato sauce, and the bread was delicious too. I ordered the filet mignon (medium rare) with spinach mashed potatoes as my dinner. The meat came perfectly cooked but instead of one filet, it actually came with two! So one entree of filet mignon is actually enough to feed two (which is amazing because I think the entree was $24, so split two ways is only like $12 which is unheard of for an amazing filet mignon).  I would definitely try to go during the week because the wait can be ridiculously long the weekends (even if you have reservations). I will definitely be back!

I LOVED this place. It was seriously so good! I am not usually a steak person but I was like ok, I wont get the chicken like I usually do and I'll go for it. I have the stripped steak. It was HUGE and just $17!!! I didn't see anyone leave the place without a doggy bag. And to top it off, it is BYOB with no corkage fee! It is a pretty big place but it is so popular that we had to wait an hour on a sunday night! But it is well worth the wait. Plan to get drinks at a nearby bar though.

I went to Tango Sur last night to have dinner with my friend.  The food was FABULOUS!  You cannot beat the price!!!  We shared the eggplant appetizer (it was like eggplant parmesan).  It was delicious.  It was not as hot as I like my food upon delivery to the table but it was still delish!  I also had a chicken empanada.  The empanada was piping hot (I guess to make up for the room temperature eggplant).  The emapnada was tiny but it was quite good.  For an entree I had the Pez (Salmon in a cream sauce) and my friend had the El Filet.  We were both quite pleased with our dishes. So in summary, the food was full of flavor and the price was beyond right!  The place was packed and a little dark to be having dinner with a friend but I'd definitely recommend it!

This quite possibly could be my favorite place in Chicago.  To all the people who hate the long waits and spotty service and any other negatives that are out there.  There is an easy solution to that.  Stop going on the weekends and at peak times!  I go with my girlfriend on a regular basis during the week and it's like night and day!   Grab a bottle of wine or two, a friend or two, and hit the place at like 5:30 or 6pm sometime during the week.  The waiters even remember us now.  The steak is out of this world for the price and the real secret is that everything else is good too.  Give the Pez a try sometime (Fish special) as well as the Pollo Limon.  It's a full half chicken in an amazing lemon butter and spice sauce.  Think chicken oreganato but better.  (I've also noticed it's bigger during the week.) Can't wait for the weather to warm up so we can start sitting outside again.  Nothing better than some wine and people watching out on Southport.

"We're going to steeeeak night We're going to eat it right, We're going to steaaaak night..." (Thank you, Turk and J.D.) That's how I felt coming here last night with my friends for dinner last night.  (Only one cared to join in my singing the "Steak Night Song," that's why he's my favorite.  Obviously.) We figured a way to get around the wait....wait for it...go at 5:30 on a Friday.  Seriously.  No wait.  (They open at 5, so that's pretty common sense, but seriously, for those looking for their meat without a ridonkulous wait, do it this way.) The atmosphere is great: dim with tapered candles on the tables.  Service is fantastic.  They really have the whole thing down to a well-oiled machine.  We never were thirsty, they were prompt with the ice bucket, and ready with the opener when we were ready for a new bottle.  Superb, truly. And the food...ahhh, it was wonderful.  And the price was even better.  The bife vesuvio went down wonderfully (easily split between two girls), my boyfriend and I shared the lomo relleno, which was delicious.  Served on a grill, sauced sufficiently, it was just what the meat doctor ordered. The only thing I wasn't mad about were the empanadas.  They weren't bad, but I've had better.  I think I'll try another appetizer the next time I go back. And yes, BYOB, NO corkage fee, they politely took my huge box of cupcakes into the fridge upon our arrival. I'll definitely be back the next time I need some meat...well, of course, when it's "Steeeeaaaaak night..."

What can I say? BYOB, no corkage fee, Great tender steaks, Reasonable prices??? The excellent recipe for exquisite restaurant! Yes there is usually  a long wait, but its definitely worth it. The "Berenjena" is my favorite appetizer, which can be also a great entree. "Lomo Relleno" is a great to be shared with 2-4 people. On my behalf no complains! =)

I have to start this by saying when I go out, I go ALL OUT.  So when it's the middle of one of the most bitter winters in a long while and 3 of my closest bros call me with the first good news we've all had in a long while, ladies & gentelman, it's time for steak! So being juiced up on testostebrone we set out to find a quality joint that didn't require us to trek all the way to River North, but still get melt-in-your-mouth meat.  In our mouths.  Not to mention you can refer to this place while doing your most accurate impression of lead Top Gun character Maverick.  "Alpha Tango Sur Delta Foxtrot.  I've got two filets on the line and they've been dry-aged!"  All this comraderie without the need for the buzzkill of killing our wingman because our ego's writing checks that our asses can't cash (we paid credit). There were some problems with our afterburners going out for a seond there as we weren't sure if our steaks were cooked as specified.  But everything turned out well with my el Filet.  Hey Tango Sur, you can be my wingman anytime.  BYOB thank goodness because the airspace around here is tight and high flying.

I love, love, love Tango Sur! We went for Valentine's Day last year and were really impressed. I recommend dinner for two. It's more than enough and I love the presentation. They're also really good about substituting sides. I really like the spinach mashed potatos and sub those in everytime. I've heard about long waits on the weekends but we know to go during the week and when we take our friends we call ahead and they have a table ready. Can't get enough of this place!

Great date place (but NOT for a first date).  Dim lighting, lots of candles.  Only major negative - always a long wait.  So obviously it's got something going for it.  On the up side, if you live close by or feel like wandering to a nearby bar for a drink while you wait, they'll take your number and give you a call when your table is ready, then I think you have 5 min to get back.  BYOB; doesn't get any better than that!  The happy, festive, talkative crowd there definitely agrees on that one.  I'm glad I perused yelp before heading there because the provoleta appetizer (aka giant plate of melted cheese) was fabulous!  My boyfriend and I got a meal for two and had plenty of leftovers to take home with us.  I would definitely go back, just make sure you leave yourself plenty of time to wait!

The food and atmosphere once inside is amazing and would be 6 stars if possible.  Simply amazing authentic Argentinian fare. The part that is not fun is leading up to that.  Either go early (like 6pm) or have a big enough party to get reservations (6 or 8) and make them.  Otherwise, especially on weekends, it will be a 2 hour or more wait.  This is TOTALLY a place I would recommend.

We tried to go on Sat night and were told of a 2 hour wait. Unfortunately this is often the case here and why I do not eat here more often. If you have a large group, you can get a reservation. And that is one of the main problems with this place. You have all these large parties lingering for hours drinking their BYO so that tables never seem to open fast enough.  But I digress, the provoletta and empanadas are great. As are the huge steaks. And no they are not "Chicago" quality steaks but what do you want for under $25. Still have had many great evenings here and it is what it is. Oh and the hosts can be really, really rude at times.

Upon entering Tango Sur, I knew I was in the right place for that night!  It has a very dark, intimate, yet animated atmosphere.  It was packed, yet we were able to get a table immediately.  The food was excellent, but the service was a little too slow that evening which prevents me from giving this restaurant five stars.  I had a perfectly cooked, rare filet.  I can't wait to return.

love this place. meat fest! i will start with all the positives: -BYOB(!) and no corkage fee -cheap, good quality steaks -provolone appetizer -romantical atmosphere -will take reservations for large parties -down the street from my house -enormous portions negatives: -disappointing empanadas -no reservations for small parties, specifically date night -non existent waiting area -having to order your meat "doneness" appropriately (usually i like medium rare, but here i need at least medium) for large quantities of meat, this is better than the brazilian steak joints and at half the price.  i never feel like i eat my money's worth when i hit up the churrascarias.  will continue coming here as long as it's open.

El Filet is up to $24.  Better start campaigning for a meat bailout.  This was my third time at Tango Sur, and it's been a steady contender for me personally.  As I've mentioned previously my dish the El Filet (TWO filet mignon steaks) is never the absolute best cut of meat.  But it's 4 star lean, and tasty.  I really don't go there for anything else.  This last visit everyone else had something different, but I really don't remember much about it because I was so fixated on the meat.  The service is always so-so... even on a Thursday night (we were the very first ones there) the food took forever to come out.  But for as much as Chicago would seem like a badass steak town, I have yet to really experience anything phenomenal. Tango Sur is still a solid contender in my book.

This is the most overrated restaurant I have ever had the displeasure of dining at.  Yep, I said it.  I refuse to jump on the Tango Sur bandwagon.  In fact, it was truly and awful experience from start to finish and I will likely never ever go back. I went on a Friday night at 7 pm with my boyfriend and my parents.  I fully expected to wait at least an hour so we had planned to put our name in and go for a cocktail at Cullen's a couple doors down.  The person at Tango Sur taking names told us an hour and a half wait, tops.  Perfect.  We high tailed it down to Cullen's and bellied up at the back bar happily sipping on our drinks and listening to the bartender rave about how good the food was.  Slowly, time started ticking by and before we knew it our hour and a half had passed and our stomachs were starting to growl.  After another half hour passed we decided to go down to Tango Sur and wait inside, thinking surely it was about time.  They have a waiting room in the back area of the place and we mossied on back there.  We opened a bottle of wine and waited.  And waited.  And waited.  Finally 45 minutes later for a grand total of 2 hours and 45 minutes wait I signaled for the man seating people and as pleasantly as possible mentioned that if a table wasn't ready within 5 minutes we were leaving, never to return.  Magically a table appeared, although the 4 of us were barely able to fit into the table because it was so close to the people next to us.  Also, the music was so loud we couldn't hear a word anyone was saying.   I will make the rest of this review quick as I was pretty loaded at this point and just hungry.  The empanada's were absolutely delicious, some other cheese appetizer we had was really tasty.  That is where the goodness ends.  Our meat was terrible.  Really low quality meat that was soaked in seasoning that was good but didn't hide the fact that the meat was so low grade.  Oh, and there was a hair in my food.   Just in case you missed it the first time I said it, I will most likely NEVER go back.  End of story.

Empanadas, great steak, BYOB, reasonable prices, great intimate setting, the list goes on. I highly recommended this place, although be aware that they do not take reservations, so head there and put your name in and go enjoy the Southport area until you are called up. You can expect to wait at least a half hour to 45 minutes, but it is definitely worth it.

The food is not bad, but I've had better.  I came after lots of hype from a couple of friends, so I was expecting the best meat in North America - not quite. I've been to many many Argentinean restaurants, and can honestly say, I've had much better.  The place is too cramped, we were sitting in a table right next to the door - cold air coming in with every patron. The wait staff was nice for the most part, but there was a waiter that didn't like us very much until we started speaking to him in Spanish, before then he seemed annoyed at every request for water we made.  The desserts were also not very impressive.  I will say - I LOVED the spinach mashed potatoes :-) they were delicious - I want more. I'd go there just for that... but given I don't love potatoes that much, there goes that.  With all honesty however - Please take my review with a grain of salt. I've heard many many wonderful things about this restaurant, it is actually too bad they don't take reservations. I am not the person to listen to when deciding to go here, since I don't particularly love meat - I'd rather have fish any day, than cow.  So with that said, do know that the waits are usually super long, they don't take reservations, and don't sit at the table near the door if it's open - it is super uncomfortable.  Try it... most argentineans I know in Chicago love it.... and that's enough for me... but I wont be going again - not really worth it in my book.

I came here expecting to wait a lifetime for a table. I called a week earlier to make reservations for a Friday night but I was told the next two Fridays and Saturdays were full on the reservations. When my boyfriend and I got there we were told it was going to be an hour and a half wait, but someone cancelled at the last minute and the host graciously sat us immediately.  The food was superb. I loved the empanadas!! The portions were out of control!! The left overs were enough to be my lunch and dinner the next day. The fact that you're given so much food at such a low price almost seems like stealing! And because it's BYOB, it's really nice on the wallet, or my boyfriend's wallet rather. The candlelight and extra dim lighting makes it very romantic and cozy. On the contrary, it is extremely loud and busy. There's tango music blaring, and everyone is bumping into each other. The tables are positioned close enough for you to hear very intimate details of the lives of the people sitting at the next table. Definitely heard some interesting things.  But yeah, Tango Sur, a carnivore's paradise.

I am not sure why I am the only person here who does not think that this place is that great. I have visited this establishment at least three times and everytime I feel very sick afterwards. The atmosphere is wonderful very romantic, and I love the music. The men who work here are handsome and nice to look at. The last time I visited the host kind of pissed me off. He was cute and had nice stye, but he was hovering over people trying to get them to leave so he could seat the other guests. I work in the industry and I understand the concept of turning a table. You should however be given enough time after you have finished your entree to digest and possibly order espresso and dessert. The host I am speaking of is the one with the black rimmed glasses. The other guy has worked there forever and he is very friendly. Anyway back to the food. The one thing I do enjoy is the berenjana (sp) a baked eggplant dish. I also like the provoleta, but when I think of what I am eating it kind of makes me sick. It is just a huge plate of melted cheese. The empanadas are good, but a little to greasy for my tastes. The chimichurri despite what everyone says is what I think makes me very sick every single time. Granted the flavor is wonderful but the oil they use is very cheap. It is def not olive oil. The quality of the meat is also kind of poor. It only tastes good because they submerge in gallons of oil. The thought of every piece of meat I have consumed here makes me nauseated.  Overall the atmosphere is pretty amazing, and the byob is a great deal. Maybe next time I will stick to the non meat dishes.

If someone would have told me that I'd have to wait 3.5 hours in the Chicago cold to see what all of the hype on Tango Sur was about, I'd laugh hysterically and then punch him in the stomach. But that's EXACTLY what I did on a blustery November night, contrary to my own impatience and beliefs on waiting. We put our name on the list at 7:30pm . . .and didn't get seated until 11pm. In that time frame, I could have already flown back home to San Francisco and be enjoying my own steak at House of Prime Rib. But there I was, blue in the face, faint from starvation, and staring down anyone who'd dare meet my evil eye in the restaurant. I have never seen a more lazy group of people trying to prolong their stay at a table where all of the plates have already been cleared and the bill's waiting to be paid than at Tango Sur. After we were seated, I realized why the wait is as long as it is- because this is the kind of place where you're having such a great time that you don't want to leave, plus the fact that you've eaten and drank so much that you physically can't get out of the chair. The steaks here are PHENOMENAL, other than Peter Luger's in Brooklyn, Tango Sur is a tough one to beat. I loved the wine selection, because I got to bring my own! And no one knows my tastes in wine better than I do. Everything we had was absolutely amazing, the portions are shareable, the cuts of steak are hearty, tender, and cooked perfectly to order. My friend and I decided to share a steak, but I liked mine bloody and he preferred his medium (which is a crime in 48 states). Before we started throwing knives, the kitchen agreed to accommodate both of our requests on the same piece of steak, and so our friendship was saved. Not only did Tango Sur save our friendship, but they also saved our wallets, because the best part of the night was getting the bill. If all this meal cost me was $28, I would wait 3.5 hours ten times over.
GREAT DATE PLACE!!!! BYOB....you can't beat it! This place has HUGE portions delicious food and so intimate! I recommend it! I had dinner and lunch the next day!

Tango Sur is a staple of the South Port Corridor. The food is very good, and very well portioned, when reading the menu, the description of the items may all read the same, but trust me, what you get is very unique and different.  I have frequented this place enough, to know the Vasio is very good plate, for a dinner for two. The meal is great and comes with Sweet Potatoes on the sides. In many instances am pretty certain you will not eat all the food provided as its so plentiful.  The best time to visit this place is during the spring and summer nights when you can sit outdoors, the inside is very cozy and quaint, but also very, very noisy. You can go there with your significant other for a cozy dinner, but be aware, it's very loud, and tables are close to each other so, be prepare to share your intimate moment with your table neighbors. Best recommendations is to go there with a group of friends, have everyone bring a bottle of wine (BYOB) order different entrees, and appetizer the table can share, and also at the end pick the different desert to allow everyone to try something, the price is reasonable and wont break the bank. Once you have a meal at Tango Sur, be prepare to go back home, get on the couch and veg. Several times I've attempted to eat at Tango Sur and go down to the Bars on Southport and have been unsuccessful, as I am too full from dinner to go anywhere but home.  Things to try: The cheese & spinach empanada, their side salad to me is always lacking and I rarely eat. The Deserter Options are very decadent and Rich.  Things to know: Be prepared to wait for at least 45-60 minutes, during Friday-Sunday in the winter, and summer nights anytime past 6 PM prepare for a long wait. The cost is very reasonable, as you get more than what you pay for. Best Recommendation, go there put your name on the list give your cell number, walk down to the Jewel to get your wine, or stop by a local bar, and have a cocktail as you wait.

We went with a group of 8 and were a little early for our reservation so we had to wait. But that was okay because the waiting room had tables and benches and wine glasses - BYOB!  The lighting was dim so it was kind of hard to see the menu or our food.  We had empanada's to start - very yummy! I had the fillet mignon with spinach mashed potatoes - again, yummy! The rest of the group also had steaks of various sorts and they all said it was very good. We would definitely go back - the price is right and the BYOB is the cherry on top.

The chimichurri at Tango Sur is so effing good, it makes me want to smack YOUR mama! The food here is great, if you're a big steak person. The chicken dishes aren't bad either. But whatever you get, make sure you get a big a$$ bucket of chimmichurri on the side!

Tango Sur has everything you want.  They have a variety of delicious cuts of steak, it's cheap, BYOB, romantic, and well serviced.  Try it out and I can almost guarantee you'll be back.  You can't miss!

Tango Sur is definitely one of the best places I've been in Chicago. The only downfall I can even mention is the wait which of course everyone else has already mentioned as well. We showed up before 8 on a Friday and didn't get seated til maybe 10:30 or so. The good thing is they'll take your cell number and call you when your table's ready, so you can go wait it out in one of the nearby bars. As for the restaurant itself, I thought the food was fantastic, and loved the atmosphere as well. BYOB is always a good thing too and we took full advantage. We actually had a lot of fun in the back waiting room which we transitioned to around 10 from the Irish pub down the street, so we could start drinking our own bottles of wine. It's a small room so we didn't have the option of waiting there earlier in the night. I can't report on the cost because I was treated to my meal, but I think it was pretty reasonable. I had El Filet which would've been enough for 2 people easily! Cooked perfectly though & delicious!

Good Vegetarian dish and BYOB!!!! Well, let me start out by saying that this place is ALL ABOUT MEAT. Being a vegetarian (again), I was a little bit weary that there would nothing for me to eat. While there was only one vegetarian dish available, it was all I needed.  The Eggplant Parmesan was absolutely fabulous! Not only was I impressed with the how the good the dish looked, but the flavor was amazing. I've tasted many failed attempts at Eggplant Parmesan that are just put on the menu to be vegetarian friendly. Tango Sur really put some thought and flavor into this dish. The creamy tomato sauce was what did it for me. It was rich, but not too rich to where I thought I was going be paying for it later :) Vegetarians- please don't be afraid!  Aside from the good Eggplant, the atmosphere was dimly lit by candles and very romantic. I recommend this place a great date spot or a intimate dinner with close friends.

Let's start with dessert--- carrot cake was very good. I went with two other people who love a good steak. I however, do not care for meat. I loved my meal which was the gnocchi. The waiter was fabulous and very attentive without rushing us.  My friends enjoyed their meals also. Great place!

I loved this place. Huge portions, good deal, BYOB, and candlelit. Romantic, good food, and just a great place for a date. I ordered the Filet Mignon and basically got two full Filet Mignons, which I was not expecting. Bring a bottle of red wine and a date, and enjoy!

The service and food is great (most times). I've been here several times, I'm not going to lie though- one time, I really did have a bad experience with the food. It was cold, even after it took a long time to come to the table. And then the waiter, was told that we were going to take the leftovers and he put the dirty dishes on top of the food. Crazy! So good luck! But it is good most of the time.

I LOVE STEAK!  And this place is just to die for.  I swear I go through withdrawals if I don't make it out there within 5 weeks.  The chimichurri sauce is amazing, some places like to add vinegar to it but they serve it without, which is just purely delicious. It gets insanely packed during the weekends and they do not accept reservations.  So bring a bottle of wine and enjoy it in the waiting area while you wait to eat.  Sure your stomach will growl from the aromas around you but it's totally worth the wait! (NO CORKING FEE!)  Or try to head there around 5:30 or 6pm, just as the crowd is forming. Service is a little slow but the wait staff is extremely helpful and friendly.  Portions are huge and you'll have plenty to take home, but make sure to ask for extra chimichurri to take with you.

BYOB that has class and ambiance! I took a friend visiting me here and we were lucky to get a seat outside (while the weather was still warm.)  We both had pasta, but it was perfectly done. The service was great as well.  We did have to wait for a little bit, but we waited inside a room, that looked like more a room from an old Spanish house. Different for sure, but if it would be any dimmer, it would've been completely dark!  I would recommend it for a date night, or to take parents/ family out for a little classier than Potbelly's or a pub.
Add me the the long list of Tango Sur fans. Place is great!

I ordered the fish and it was the most delicate, juicy fish I've ever had. We sat outside and, even though it was raining, the service was excellent and I totally enjoyed the food. Plus, it's BYOB which is a huge plus. The inside looked a little crowded, as it is a very small place. However, if you don't mind getting all up close and personal with your "table neighbors" the food is definitely worth the trip! Great place, good food!

Went here on a Monday evening with my husband and another couple. The place is so cute -- quiet, cozy, candlelit, and much smaller than I thought it would be. It's BYOB which really cuts down the cost, and so our friends brought some red wine. We had a great appetizer plate -- the antipasto, and everyone seemed happy with their entrees. It's really high end food at a very affordable place. Great for a date night! The *only* reason I didn't give it 5 stars is that the menu is really "heavy" and I tend to be a lighter eater. I think they're really known for their red meat options -- and I'm just not a red meat eater. But I would go back anyway, and bring out of town guests for sure!

Very good food!  The atmosphere is a bit loud but plan ahead.  It is intimate still even as crowded as it gets with the noise and all.  The wait is a bit long but well worth it.  I'd say it's definitely a must in the city! BYOB, good.

I would have given this place 4 stars, but for the interminably long wait of well over an hour (they do not allow reservations which makes no sense to me) and the obnoxiously LOUD noise level. It was headache-inducing.  Too bad because the Argentine food is delicious and it's a great concept. The staff is doing their best, but they can't do much about the fact that there are too many people who want to eat here and too few tables.  If you do decide to eat here, expect to have to shout and I mean SHOUT to be heard. Not exactly a place to go for a romantic or relaxing evening out. Sadly, however good the food is, I would not go back due to the unpleasantness of the waits and the excessive noise levels.

I went to this place with a big group and it was totally awesome. My review may be distorted by the fact that it was a great group and we were at various stages of drunk by the time that we got there, but I really had a great experience.  We had ten of us and since it is BYOB we had ten bottles of wine. And since my friends are super classy and some were further along the drunk spectrum, we also had a case of miller lite, a bottle of jager and a six pack of red bull - because that seemed like a good idea to a drunk person in a liquor store on their way to a nice dinner. They get a five partly because the staff was very nice and dealt with us well, considering I can only imagine we were a bit louder and more obnoxious than they would have liked. (Yes, we drank all ten bottles of wine and did serious damage to the case and jager.) [At this point I should probably apologize to anybody else that was there that night trying to enjoy a romantic dinner - sorry!] The food was awesome. Everyone loved their dishes. My friend and I split the fillet, which was plenty for two people because they give you two medallions and tons of mashed potatoes and such. It was cooked perfectly and really not expensive since we split and it was BYOB. I think the meal cost me like $15, unheard of for the quality. The vibe is cool and great atmosphere for a date, a small group of friends, or a large party. For bigger groups you gotta call way in advance, the place isn't that big and it's super popular. I'm pretty sure they don't take day of reservations on Friday or Saturday, so you should plan ahead, or get there early. Or just bring an extra bottle of wine and settle in for the wait, it's part of the experience.

Went there last night with 8 people and had a great time.  It is a BYOB and there is a Jewel Osco right down the street.  We made reservations and got seated right away.  I have heard that there isn't much of a wait M-W.   The best appetizers are the Empanadas and Provoleta.  Most of us had Filets and you get 2 medium sized pieces for only $24.

We went here the other night after seeing a movie.  It had been a long time since I'd had a steak...and I was salivating at the thought of a big juicy steak.  This place did not disappoint.  And to make it even better, its BYOB, fairly cheap, and has a cool vibe/decor. They didn't take reservations so we had to wait 20 min for a table, but it was fine since we needed to get some wine. I dont recall exactly what we had but I do remember that the filet was huge (good enough for 2) The spinach mash potatos were interesting (in a good way) And the Sweet bread is neither sweet nor bread. Great place for a date, or with a small group of friends. S&JNov08

Good food, good service, long wait, loud place.  If you don't want to wait 30 minutes to an hour (and that's even with calling ahead of time), go before 6:30P.  Otherwise, be prepared to sit in the waiting room and rub shoulders with folks who keep making trips to the wine store across the street. I also see that about half the respondents on the survey have said the restaurant doesn't take reservations while half have said it does.  The truth is, they will take reservations if you call in a day ahead of time, especially if you're a large group.  But if you call 5 hours before the rush dinner hour on a Friday or Saturday night, you'll simply be put on a list with no guarantee of a short wait.

um...this may be my new favorite restaurant. I went here for dinner last night and now that my meat coma has ended, I can finally write a review for it.  I went for a friend's birthday party here and we had a reservation, but were told the table wasn't quite ready yet. No problem, they have a waiting room of sorts with tables and benches where we sat and broke into our wine. Good thing we had all brought a bottle because we ended up getting sat an hour after our reservation time. Normally we would have been pissed and stormed out, but since we had a place to sit and chat and drink, we were more than fine. And the hostess was very nice about it, plus they sent over 2 appetizers on the house for our party of ten when we did get seated. We ended up ordering the exact same appetizers so that there was enough for everyone as well. We got the cheese which was pretty good (it's just melted cheese, people, but I do love it) and the eggplant dish which was super delicious. One of our diners HATES eggplant and didn't even know that she was eating it, plus complimented how great it tasted. We also got the empandas which were fabulous as well. Then, onto the entrees. Everyone seemed really pleased with their dishes (this may be biased due to the hour of drinking beforehand, but who cares). I ordered the steak that was stuffed with garlic and other herbs and had sweet potatoes. Thank God I decided to split it with someone as suggested. The thing was HUGE. And tasty.  The girls next to me split the other 'ideal for two' plate, and there's just looked like a giant piece of meat, but was no less tasty. Finally we ordered desserts to share: flan, german chocolate cake, and something else (i'm not sure as it was so good it never made it around to me before being devoured). It was an amazing meal and when our bill came I was shocked: 10 people ate and 9 paid (not the bday girl of course) and our total was 32 bucks including tax and tip. THIRTY-TWO BUCKS! And almost everyone had huge portions as leftovers, except maybe the girls who ordered the talapia. It was amazing. Now, there are a few things that I have to share just so that no one is surprised by them: yes, it is very dark (I had trouble reading the menu but again it could have been all that wine before food), yes, it is VERY noisy (I could barely talk to anyone other than the people directly next to me), and yes, it gets very crowded (one of our party noticed a sign that said it was voted 'most romantic restaurant' one year and it caused us all to scratch our heads), but the service and food is so good, that it more than outweighs these. And yes, the salads were pathetic (we referred to them as 'hamburger toppings' because that is EXACTLY what it looked like ), but if you are going here for their salad, you're just an idiot.

This place can really vary from one of the very top BYOB places in the city to disappointing and frustrating.  But I've had many more good meals over the years than bad so four stars it is.   First the bad: lately they've been undercooking the steaks, this never used to be a problem.  They also sometimes char them excessively on the outside to the point of being burnt without even being done inside.  And the salads are always terrible with the mealy tomatoes that are so common in Chicago.  The service is all over the place from attentive to MIA to rushed to decent...it all depends on the night, how busy they are and who your wait staff team is.  The waits can be horrific.  Finally, the prices have crept up over the years, it is no longer the bargain it once was.  OK, enough of the bad.  The good includes delcious red meat in many forms (mixed grill, el filet and lomo are some of my favorites), killer sweetbreads (not for all), awesome empanadas, above average ambiance (I happen to like dark and noisy myself, some may not), the best chimichuri sauce in the city,  the pineapple cake desert and the BYOB service is usually on top of things, bringing you an ice bucket for your beer, etc.  And when the kitchen is on and you bring the right wine, you simply can't beat it for a good, reasonably priced meal in Chicago.

Tango Sur is a great place to enjoy a great dinner with friends. It' also a great date place. I love the setting and the food is delicious.  Make sure you make a reservation or you will be waiting a long time. I love the BYOB option.

I went here so long ago that I really should go again before I review it. But I remember it being SO GOOD and meaty-licious. And Tango music  . . . what else do you need? To review: Meat + Tango = happy.

Tango Sur is meat-tastic! A meat-gasm of flavors! Meat-o-rific!  I came on a chilly night hoping that the wait wouldn't be too long, and it wasn't. We waited for about an hour, but walked down to Toons and enjoyed a couple beers while we waited. I was starving by the time we were seated and couldn't wait for the food to arrive.  Once I bit into the beef and the ham and cheese empanadas I forgot all about the cold weather outside and the wait for a table. Oh my!! They were the best empanadas that I have ever had! I ordered the Bife Vesuvio entree, which was steak stuffed with cheese and spinach in a garlic wine sauce with potato wedges. It was a perfect combination of my two favorite foods: beef and cheese. Yum!!  The portions are HUGE! I couldn't finish my entree, but I took it home and can't wait to reheat it for dinner tonight! :)  I saw a lot of other things on the menu that I would like to try so I can't wait to go back to Tango Sur again. The next time I will make sure to bring along 5 other people so that I can make a reservation and not have to worry about the wait, even though the wait is totally worth it.

I've been hearing about tango sur since I moved to chicago and I finally made it there this summer for a birthday! It was deeeelicious! The atmosphere is such that it is perfect for a date or dinner with friends. I love that it is BYOB because then you have no problem splurging on delicious meats! We were able to make a reservation and everything was perfect when we got there and we all enjoyed a fantastic meal together!

YUM! I took my friend here for his birthday and I was prepared to wait a little after we did put in our reservation "walk up". I wish you could make a less then 6 person reservation over the phone. But it's ok we put our names in and went over to Toons down the street. We ended up waiting 2 hours and some change. FINALLY when we got seated we had our own little cozy table. Our waiter came over right away and he gave us a few suggestions to try. We started with chicken empanadas...YUM, they were excellent. I'd go back just for those!! We then asked our waiter for his suggestions and he told us Vacio steak would be good for us to share so we went with that. It was HUGE. I couldn't even eat a third of it, my friend polished off the rest. It was delicious and so tender and juicy...we had it done medium! They have excellent pesto sauce there...we were putting it on EVERYTHING haha...even our bread. It was just so sweet with a little kick!  I will definitely come back...hopefully with a group of 6 so we can make reservations but if not the wait is worth it!! Oh and I almost forgot to mention it's SO INEXPENSIVE! I couldn't believe that for two people we had appetizers and a huge dinner it was only around $50. BYOB is so key because you save on liquor costs which would have doubled it!!

Ah Tango Sur... I love you and your Argentine foods. What can I say about you that hasn't already been said? Yes, there's a long wait--every night of the week. Yes, they take reservations for parties of 6 or more. Yes, it's BYOB. Yes, it's worth the wait every single time. Their empanadas are delicious. I'm a huge fan of the Vacio steak. They've got a hot eggplant appetizer right now that is orgasmic. They handmake pastas. Their chimichurri sauce is amazing.  Go. Now. Tonight. Just bring 5 other people with you so you can make a reservation and avoid the wait.

Tango Sur is the best steakhouse in Chicago that no one has heard of.  Problem is, now everyone has heard of it. I have been to Tango Sur many times, although I have only sat inside on one occasion.  The service is generally only okay, but you don't come to Tango Sur for the service.  You come for the steak, and lots of it. Just about every time I go, I get El Filet, a two-filet entree for a mere $25.  That's dinner and lunch for the next day folks.  Tango does not serve drinks, but it's a BYOB.  If you're waiting for a table, I recommend heading over to Que Syrah to grab a bottle of wine, just a half block south of Tango Sur on the opposite site of the street.

Two and a half hours.  Yes.  Two and a half hours we had to wait to get into this place on a Saturday night!  Tango Sur came highly recommended to us by a friend living in Chicago.  We put our name down and the host told us the wait would be two hours so we decided to go to the nearby dessert place (see below review).  We closed down the dessert place and we still didn't get a seat at the restaurant!  At that point, I was going to be really pissed if this place wasn't absolutely delicious. Anyway, we were finally seated around 10:45pm!  Our waiter, Martin, was fabulous.  I told him we waited forever and he comp'd us the provoleta (?) cheese.  It was melted provolone cheese and it was yum!  Between five girls, we ordered the empanadas - one of each.  I actually only tried the spinach one but it was good.  My girlfriends thought that the empanadas here were the best they've ever eaten. We also ordered El Filet and the El Vaccio.  I think El Vaccio was pork (I don't remember...maybe too much wine?) and of course El Filet was steak.  What I do recall is the the filet was very good. We ordered it medium rare and it was grilled to perfection.  The seasoning and sauce they made was amazing.  El Vaccio was huge but I wasn't as big of a fan.  For dessert, our waiter comp'd us yet another item: the flan.  It was a bit on the sweet side for me. We were all so full that it was hard to finish the dessert.  By nights end, we were all happy and thought the restaurant was well worth the wait.  The best part?  The entire meal only cost $80!  We were so impressed with the service and all the comps, we ultimately gave our waiter about a 30% gratuity.   I would highly recommend this place and despite a plethora of restaurants I still have yet to try in Chicago, I actually would come back again!  One final caveat though.  This place is really small, really noisy, really dark, and quite humid when there it's a full house so dress in layers so you can take off your clothes as you eat.

We showed up at 6pm on a Saturday night and we had an hour and a half wait. PERFECT! We wanted to get some beers beforehand anyway so we went up to Toons and waited until Tango called. When they called we came in and sat down right away. We started off with an appetizer of melted/fried cheese. MMMM, Cheese...... After that we ordered dinner and got HUGE portions. My friend got El Filet and- no joke- there were 2 huge chunks o' meat on her plate. The hubby and I got the Vaccio for 2 and are having it again for breakfast. YUM! The ambiance is a little crowded, but it was nice to eavesdrop on others' conversations.  Go early, put your name in, and head to another bar for some drinks. YAY!

mmmm...meat. tango sur is probably the best steak value in chicago.  the filet is $23 and you literally get two filets so it's easy to share.  all the beef is excellent, but don't sleep on the other items.   the suprema a la napolitana is essentially chicken parmesan and as good as the ones they serve on taylor st (almost).  the empanadas and gnocchi are also worth a go.  if you're feeling frisky, try the parillada. it's basically a huge plate full of cow parts grilled up (sweetbread and black sausage included). best of all tango sur is byob, so you can bring some wine for your meal or do it classy like me and bring in the 6 pack.   try to go in a big group if you can (6 or more) since you can make reservations then and not have to wait obscene amounts of time for a table.  luckily the southport area has some fun bars around it if you need to kill time while you wait.   this place would be 5 stars, but the service is a little pushy and a couple 3 hour waits killed off some of the mystique.

We were real lucky when we decided to give this place a try on Halloween.  It was a last minute decision and it turned out to be a good one.  Things started off well with some semi-rockstar parking on Southport.  Next, we stroll up to the restaurant, 2 bottles of wine in tow.  Much to our surprise there is no line and, in fact, they are clearing a table which will be ready in moments.  While waiting for the table, the masses arrived and the wait ballooned up to 30-45 minutes. The interior is a bit cramped, but the lighting adds to the ambiance.  It's got a great low-key/semi romantic, yet festive vibe. Onto the food.  Being a carnivore, I have been looking forward to dining here.  The menu was a nice mix of your standard steaks, as well as some other, lesser-known cuts. Not fully grasping the large quantity of beef heading our way, we ordered the provela appetizer.  This was a molten plate of provolone cheese, olive oil, and red pepper.  So bad, yet soooo good. When it came time to order our entre, we asked our waiter, and he quickly recommended one of the dishes best suited for two.  There was no hesitation even though it shaved .$25+ off our tab.  This was a refreshing change. Out comes a large pan over a flame that contains something that would make Fred Flintstone blush.  It was a generous serving of flank steak with a wonderful chimichurri sauce with sweet potato wedges sprinkled throughout.  It may not be in the same realm as a David Burke's in terms of quality, but it was a damn good steak and an absolute steal for the price.   The two of us ate, enjoyed our wine, and the atmosphere for a solid 2 hours.  The cost?  About $50.  Unbelievable.  I cannot wait to return.

If you don't mind the wait (which is a good sign of a good place) then Tango Sur is it.  Its a BYOB and they have some of the best cuts of meat you'll find.  Their "parillada" for 2 people, could easily be split between 4 and you will still have food to take home.  The best nights to go for "quiet" and less wait are on Tuesdays and Wednesday, but even then, you may encounter a wait.  This is a place to go with bottles of wine, good company, and be ready to just relax and enjoy a delicious meal.   The only thing that I almost always pass on are their salads that come as part of a meal.  All it is is salad, onion, and tomato, but it has no flavor and are pretty bad.  Note:  Don't fill up on their yummy oven-fresh bread because a good meal comes up after that!

BIG MEAT!!!  This place freaking rules.  BYOB rules.  Going on a week night and getting a table right away rules.  And getting three meals worth of delicious steak at a decent price rules.  A word of warning, though:  know when to stop.  You can get sick.   Also, a word to the ladies and boys: hot hot HOT waiters.  I think I drooled more over the boys than my yummy dinner.

I had high expectations after reading the reviews.  I was, unfortunately,  disappointed, and I'm not all that finicky.  Read on: Pro's: 1.  Proximity to where we live. 2.  Dark, romantic, candle-on-table atmosphere. 3.  BYOB. 4.  Thickest steak I've ever encountered. 5.  Attentive server and busser. 6.  Decent price, especially for the area. 7.  Good menu variety. 8.  Able to sit two or large groups. 9.  Bread basket with refills. 10. Large portions of mashed potatoes, yum. 11. Free dessert (patron birthday). 12. We were able to reserve a table for two (but it's not exactly peak season and it was a special occasion). 13. Server offered recommendations and explanations. 14. Filet mignon thick, scrumptious, and done to perfection. 15. Humongo-jumbo portions (plenty for at-home dinner tonight!).
