this is one of my favorite restaurants FOOD is great..one little problem it is pretty crowded and loud here... it wasn't always this way..but i forgive..great food but if you want a romantic night out not so great..though the staff is pretty nice.

The food here is amazing.  Steaks cooked perfectly, everytime (or so it seems).  The candlelit atmosphere coupled with BYOB makes it a steal for a "romantic" dinner.  I would love to eat here more often, if it wasn't for the wait, which is also the reason it looses a star from me. We showed up here at 900, and were told it would be an hour to hour and a half.  we came back at 1030 and they told us it would be another 30 mins.  They never called and we stopped back in at 1130 and finally got a seat.  But, the food was well worth the wait, just wish that they were a little more upfront about the wait til. All in all, a great experience.  I will be back (but probably much earlier in the day this time!)

I have been here a few times now and every time I've gone we've had the vacio - huge delicious steak for two to share with sweet potatoes on the plate. The empanadas are delicious as well (especially the ham and cheese). The salad here leaves something to be desired, but since it's free, I can't take off a star for it.  The first time I came here I was sad and they brought us a free flan for dessert to cheer me up! (It was also delicious) This place is also BYOB which is great and really cuts down on the expense.  Get here early or be prepared to wait - but they will take your cell phone number and you can hang out at one of Southport's many bars and they'll call you when your table is ready.

Oh my god, how did I pass this place by for so long.  I'm not going to repeat what practically every other of the 200+ reviews have said, so I'll simply say GODDAAAAMMMMMNNNNN!  Filet Mignon as good if not better than other more popular steak houses for $10-$15 dollars cheaper.  Spinach mashed potatoes, a chimichurri to die for, and never an empty water glass... what more could you ask for.  You can keep your "Old Boy's" style steak houses, because I just found my new "steak joint."  To Tango Sur, I'd like to personally apologize for not having given you the time of day sooner, If I'd known I'm sure our relationship would be so much deeper by now.  I'd just like to say thank you for that little thing you did, you know what I'm talking about, but we'll keep that between us ; )

This is a great date spot.  I've only been once because I couldn't stand the wait, but all in all, it's worth it!  Fantastic steaks, and nice music.  Make sure to bring a bottle or two (one for dinner, and one for the wait).  If you go back into the "waiting" room, they will set you up with some glasses and a cork screw.  I really can't wait to go back during the summer to sit on the patio.

First off, Tango Sur is BYOB so make sure you bring something along if it's a special occasion. A girlfriend and I just decided to come here for a random Wednesday dinner, and we had a wonderful time. The place is dark and intimate, the service is good, and the food is outstanding. If you like flavorful meat, you will definitely find it here. We tried two steak specials (one of which involved cheese!) and they were delicious. The portions are huge and we couldn't finish it all, but my friend went right ahead and took the leftover steak home for breakfast the next day. Haha. I definitely recommend this place!

A delicious get-your-money's-worth menu.  If you're looking for a great piece of meat without having to pay out the mouth for it, Tango Sur is right up your alley.  That isn't to suggest that the food alone makes the restaurant though:  the candle-lit interior is a great place for a date, and the outside patio is perfect the summer.  Add to all this that it is BYOB and you're set. And if you're not sure what to pick, I have two words for you:  Bife Vesuvio.  Mention it to anyone who has had it:  their eyes will light up and their stomachs will growl.  It is one of the most satisfying meals I've had in a long time.  That garlic sauce... amazing.

I finally went to check this place out last night after hearing about it and reading reviews.  The food was GREAT!  Steaks are pretty big and potatoes are good too. The parking around the area is HORRIBLE.  The wait is also pretty long, but like others mentioned you are in a strip of bars and you can leave your number and they will call you when your table is ready or there is a back waiting area where you drink some wine and hangout. IT being BYOB is also a plus!  It is pretty packed on a Friday night but the atmosphere is pretty nice.  i definitely recommend this place and plan on going back.

Tango Sur is amazing and is worth the wait. I had a filet mignon, and it was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. I would give four stars just for the portions alone! The steaks are very reasonably priced and byob saves you even more.The service isn't stellar, but I was so happy with my steak that I did not really even notice. We were fortunate to get a table outside. The inside was dark crowded and noisy.

The food's great and well priced.  I'm a huge fan of the provolone appetizer and when it's offered, the shrimp app.  Perfect. I know, people complain abut the wait here.  Oh well.  Leave your number and head down the street to a bar and have a few cocktails while you wait.  And yes, the serve seems "spotty" to some, but the evening isn't exactly about how the servers entertain you here.  Bring a few bottles of wine and enjoy some convo with your dinner mates.

If Jesus was around...If Buddha was around...even if a plant or whatever other deity you worship was around they would be dining at Tango Sur.  This is the best restaurant in Chicago in my humble opinion.  The steak are out of this world, I don't know any other place that could make skirt steak taste like filet mignon.  The provelone appetizer is to die for and the crowd is great.  What a romantic place to eat....BYOB and the best deal in the city make this a landmark.  And for the douchebags on here who complain about "corking" their own bottles...IT'S FREE!!

This place is amazing!  This was my second time to Tango Sur.  My best friend from back in the day was visiting and she said she wanted a steak.  It was a Sunday night and I didn't want to do the whole expensive Morton's or Ruth Chris's etc.  I wanted something quick, affordable, with a good atmosphere.  I knew instantly... Tango Sur on Southport. This place was extremely crowded both times... probably because the food is so damn good!  They give generous portions and the filet, spinach mashed and salad is to die for!  I received two filets... perfect if you like leftovers!  In addition, I like that it is BYOB, which keeps the cost down.  I love this place, as did my friend.  I will definitely be back!!!! =)

YUMMM YUMMM YUMMM YUMMM YUMMM I can't say it enough.  Yummy yummy yummy food here!  I absolutely adore Tango Sur.  The meat is fantastic, the vibe is awesome, the prices are dirt cheap, and best of all - BYOB.   Seriously, I freaking love it here.  I don't love the ridiculous wait for a table, but even I (Miss I Don't Do Lines and I Don't Wait) can understand the wait for this place.  Yes, there's even a wait if you've made a rez. I just wish it wasn't so far from River North.  We all know I get nervous leaving my 6-block radius.

outside of its location, and the fact that the space is quite small, this is a pretty good restaurant.  i enjoyed my filet mignon, and the spinach mashed potatoes were pretty great.  i'd go there again if i was looking to feed steak eaters with a moderate budget.

Decent meat, decent value, nice atmosphere.  So a lot of people here say the meat is GREAAATTT.  It Isn't.  It's a good value though, you can't really get two 8ish oz filets for 20 bucks.  The question is the quality and how it tastes.  It is definitely not the best steak I've had, it doesn't even compare to Mastro's or other casual dining restaurants for that matter...  The spinach mashed potatoes were decent though. We also got appetizers, the empanadas were quite tasty.   We went on a Wednesday evening and got there around 6, and there was plenty of space with no wait.   The atmosphere was definitely chill though, dim lighting with candles, not overly loud either. I'm not sure if I would go there again though.  It's a nice restaurant to get together with friends, but the food just isn't that GREAT.

Holy good lord, I'm still dreaming about the platter of meat that covered our table at Tango Sur.  That's right, a warm, 6 inch tall grill was set on the table, filled with the juiciest, most tender, and LARGEST portion of meat I had ever seen presented to me at one sitting.  This Chef's Special, called the Lomo Relleno ("a half slab orgentine filet sliced and filled with chimichurri ham sauce cooked and served on a grill with portabella marsala) was to die for.  My meat-loving companion was excited about the leftovers before he even took his first bite!  It was reeeally good.  Mushrooms were cooked just right, good flavor, and we enjoyed this feast over a BYO bottle of red wine, all for just $32.   If you live nearby (or even far, far, away) go to Tango Sur.  You must.  Grab some wine on the way. Order the Lomo Relleno.  And enjoy.

All the praise you've heard about Tango Sur is true.  Make reservations.  I say again:  MAKE RESERVATIONS.  By 7pm this place has a line up out the door.  What are they lining up for? My guess is the meat.  Being an Argentine steakhouse, Tango Sur has an impressive variety of meats done just differently enough to make steak taste like some magical new food from the Gods.  Benevolent Gods.  Because Tagno Sur doesn't mess around with quantity.  Don't bat an eyelash at the price, you can easily take half your plate home and have an extra full meal out of it. And speaking of price, you can look forward to slightly less damage on the bill due to the no-corkage BYOB factor.  Burgeoning wine snobs are free to make their own selections without the ridiculous markup. ... and if you're looking for a dirt cheap but exciting new appetizer, try the empanada.

one of my favorite restaurants in the city, hands down (what does that mean anyway?) portions are enormous, yet the prices are so low for the city it's almost unsettling... almost. because tango sur is so wonderful, you will wait for a LONG time for a table.  but if you give them your cell #, they'll call you when your table is almost ready, so you can head to any of the numerous bars in the area for a drink while you wait. service is so friendly... just an overall wonderful dining experience. word to the wise: if you are not meatventurous (yes i made up that word) don't order the mixed grill.  sweetbreads are not sweet, or bread-like.

Incredible!  This place is great!  Where else can you get 2, yes I said 2, filets for $20???  Tango Sur is always packed and if I remember correctly, they only take "larger parties" for reservations.  It is also BYOB which is fine by me.   You need to try this place!

Tango Sur is definitely the place to go to hangout with friends and enjoy good food. The most important part its a BYOB so you don't have to be afraid of drink prices. The staff is friendly and attentive, a big surprise considering it was Wednesday and packed.  Your bound to have a great time!

I'm  not sure why I'm even writing a review for Tango Sur, given the atrocious wait, it's clear all of Chicago already knows how great it is!  The empanadas are fantastic and at $2 each I wish I had ordered more. The filet was humungous - and juicy, tender, and perfectly cooked medium rare. We shared it and between the two of us, we only finished one of the two medallions (they were great for dinner the next night too!) For dessert we shared a caramel cake topped with a glob of sugary sweet fresh caramel. It was actually on the small size, thank god, and we were able to share it without me feeling like I had blown my diet for the week.  We also started with the provoleta which was pretty much just a bowl of melted cheese. It was good, but it dind't blow me away enough to justify the calories.  Service was great , the food was awesome and it's BYO which makes it even better. We ended up with a quality, filling, and amazingly delicious meal for $45 for two.  The wait was pretty long, but you can go to Take Five and have some mediocre drinks there while you wait, or if you bring some extra wine, you can grab a wine glass from the table and sit in Tango Sur's wating room (in the back by the bathrooms) and enjoy a drink there while you wait.

Brandon C has been going here for years and he JUST NOW told me about its existence. I'd be mad at him for not telling me sooner, but I was so happy with last night's dinner that all is forgiven.  I took a look at his Yelp review before we went, and was completely confused when he said "The BYOB is tremendous." How does that make sense? Yeah, well, it makes perfect sense when you arrive. There's a wait. Even late on a Sunday night, there's a wait. But while you wait, you're tucked into a cute little room in the back, and they bring you wine glasses and open your bottles for you. So when you realize that you've been waiting for an hour and a half, but it didn't feel nearly that long, that BYOB is, indeed, tremendous. The portions! Oh my. Two filets when you order one, and at 23 bucks, that's pretty damn cheap. They're delicious, too. I have a special place in my heart for restaurants who will make my steak blue. Our waiter asked if I was sure that I wanted blue, and I was worried that I'd just get rare. Nope! I could have brought that cow back to life if I had some paddles. Perfect :) We're going back. Often. I'll probably update this review with more waxing poetic about blue steaks and the Argentine magazine pages plastered to the bathroom walls. Did I mention those? They're spiffy.

I love the empanads here. In the summer it can get really hot since they don't have A/C and it gets pretty crowded. The food is really good, but I actually like Las Tables better.  Also, it's BYOB, which is great for most ppl but I don't really like wine and I like going to a place that has a liquor license and makes great cocktails.

Four stars for excellant group atmosphere (we had a reservation for a party of 8 and were seated right away), prompt service, yummy basic salad with oil and vinegar, plentiful rolls and quick water service.  Just shy of a fifth star because of the meager bathroom situation and the failure to actually get to "medium" on two of my friend's steaks. If you're jonesing for red meat for about $22 per person, this is your place.  I had the outer skirt with yummy chimichurri sauce and it was delish.  Will definitely be back.

The wait is totally worth it!!  Go as early as you can to put your name in then head to one of the cool bars or coffee shops on Southport...or you could go grab a couple bottles of wine if you didn't realize it's a BYOB place.   Tango Sur has a romantic but lively atmosphere...candelight dining at its finest!  The service is pleasant and laidback so don't go if you're in a rush.  And the food...outstanding!  Empanadas is a must try and any of the chef appetizer specials.  Be sure to get dinner for two with steak on a hot plate.  You'll definitely have leftovers!

I love BYOBs and I had been wanting to try this place out for a long time, but was always discouraged by the long wait.  We finally were able to get a reservation with a large group on a Saturday night.  Our steaks were cooked perfectly.  I would strongly recommend sharing dishes since the portions can be intimidating.  The only reason I'm only giving four stars is while the atmosphere is quaint and charming, the restaurant is very small and overcrowded.

Worth the wait.  Put our names in at 6:20 and went down the street to the local tavern.  They called 40 minutes later and we were seated at a table shortly after.  Recommendations: Get there early.  They were turning away tables of 4 for the night starting at 6:20.  Don't sit by the windows, the atmosphere is lost by the street lighting.

If you are looking for a great dining experience that won't burn a hole in your wallet, tango sur is it!  The portions are huge, so you can practically get two meals for the price of one.  When you order the filet for example, you actually get two 8 oz filets for $22.  The sauce and spinach mashed potatoes that accompany the filet are unique and taste amazing.  BYOB makes the experience even more affordable and fun for groups....just remember to get there early given that they don't take reservations, and it can get quite crowded  (at least you can uncork your bottle of wine while you wait...)
Ok. But after all the hype, it was just ok. Loud and cramped inside. Steaks were cooked well but all the red meat tasted salty. Decent/inattentive service. We corked 3/4 bottles on our own.

What's not to love about a BYOB especially when it has great affordable food!  I have lucked out and always been able to get a table with hardly any wait (go before 7pm!).  Service is very fast and friendly - they uncork your wine almost immediately after you sit.  My steaks have always been cooked perfectly to order (medium rare) and the meals are big enough for 2 (2 Filets for less than $25 bucks!).  Empanadas (recommend chicken or spinach) were tasty especially with the accompanying sauce.

Absolutely one of the top places in the city. I wish it was still 3-4 years ago when Southport wasn't such a popular destination so i could keep this place all to myself. I'm selfish that way. The BYOB is tremendous, the portions are enormous, the food is fantastic, the service is top notch...I'm running out of adjectives. This is the perfect date place (as long as the chick isn't a veggie) and I would even recommend going here with a group of friends. The portions are so big that you can even split them with someone or take home an entire meal worth of leftovers.

The portions are huge, the food is wonderful and the setting is very cozy. The empanadas were fantastic, as was my filet mignon (they give you TWO servings of it, omg). The service was great as well. They are very attentive. I am a bit confused as to why I'm reading on here that it is better for groups rather than dates. Every time I have been here it has been very romantic, dimly lit with candles on the tables. The space itself is very intimate. There were more couples than groups of friends when I went as well. To me, this is not where I would go with a group of friends. I am counting down the days until I can go back to this place. I only wish I knew it was BYOB before I had gone the first time. It kinda sucked not having any wine to sip on.

After 3 tries I finally had an opportunity to eat there, and it was well worth the repeated attempts! The food is incredible, and the BYOB helps you order more of their delicious food. The place is cozy, charming, and ALWAYS packed, but it's a great place to eat and hang out with friends and enjoy some good wine. Check it out, but be prepared to wait or go early!

Well, as this is the 177th (were all 177 of you at the restaurant last night?) review for Tango Sur, I am going to take this opportunity to provide the diners of Chicago with brief lesson on BYOB etiquette.  So listen up... If you are seated at a table, and are finished with your meal...it is only appropriate to linger for 15 minutes MAX if there is ANYONE waiting for a table. If you proceed to drink your cheap wine past this period of time, then it is acceptable for the staff or the crowd that has been waiting for 2+ hours to physically remove you, and throw your wine bottles out behind you.  So other than the nearly 3 hour wait last night (which I will not fault the establishment for, as they are too friendly to tell people to get the hell out), the place was obviously...wonderful. Ambiance, food, presentation, service....BYOB! But, OY VEY...the wait.  Just take note, if you wish to drink your wine from home well after the meal has finished...GO HOME, or pick a less busy restaurant. They are not making any money on you taking up space to drink your own wine, and there are others waiting to eat. It's beyond rude and thoughtless...though, the crowd is decidedly "Southport" so I am not entirely surprised. :)

Was here on NYE and I would have to say our food was not great. I do not know if they changed something but it was much better before. I hope this was only because they were very busy. I will give them one more try.

I have yet to enjoy a dining experience more in Chicago than I did at Tango Sur.  To begin with, they openned my BYO wine before I even had a table, which made the considerable wait seem like much less time than it was.  Then as soon as we were seated fresh rolls were brought to our table, and they were delicious.  From there the food only got better.  The Barenjena (sp) was just delicious.  The best way to describe it would be an eggplant lasagna Argentine style.  From there fresh salad was brought out, and it was simple, but the perfect precursor  for the steak that was to come.  The two person steak called the Vaccio was huge and delicious.  There was no way for me and my date to finish the steak, it would have been enough for three I think.  The atmosphere was great, as long as you don't mind being squeezed in a little bit, and the waitstaff was helpful and friendly.  As I said before, a great experience!

I just had dinner here with a friend. The food was good. The service was great - had a really friendly waiter, patient to explain to a first-timer like me.  We had the steak and the empanadas. I've had dozens of empanadas in my lifetime (pretty common food back in my country), but ended up still impressed by the chicken empanada I had. I seem to have smothered all of my food with pesto sauce, which was given generously. The place is great for dates. I like how unpretentious and comfortable the restaurant was. Our bill was $30+ ...not bad, with the fact that we left stuffed.

I've been here three times and every time there has been: -Amazing rare steak. Juicy, bloody, red, but still, you know, cooked (barely... just how I like it). -Lots of noise. A great group atmosphere, not for date night. -Much wine. It's BYOB.  -Small bill. The steak is definitely enough for two. If you're not a pig like me, then maybe even three. Since it's BYOB, you walk out stuffed on steak and wine for $15. Try the empanadas. Best I've had in Chicago.
Food is FANTASTIC. The wait staff tends to be friendly and it is BYOB. I love a good steak with cheap drink.

This place was just mediocre - I would say overrated. Maybe it was because I had such high expectations... We went on the Friday before Christmas.  We got there at about 6:45, no wait.  Excellent.   The space is overly crowded...I think this place is better for large groups, not for date night.  You can hear every conversation going on in the entire restaurant, and if you're not the loudest, then too bad. Service was also very rushed, and they were definitely trying to get us out. Food was also very average.  Skip the sides. I won't be back.

Price: Amazing! Service: Good Atmosphere: Dark, Cool Bathrooms: Clean Food: Great The front of the restaurant is understated! You'd never know your entering a steakhouse! Empanada's were excellent, Filet with the Spinach mash were great.  We had a party of 10 service was smooth! Great for a romantic evening or first date! Rick

Not the best experience, I'm sad to say.  First, the goods: We were underquoted for our wait time--and they DO get major points for taking cell phone numbers and allowing you to go grab a bottle of wine from Que Syrah or drinks from Take Five or Cullen's while you wait--and had a table after 20 minutes. Our service was wonderful. And the prosciutto with melon appetizer was divine. Just as delicious in mid-December as it is in the heat of summer! All the flavors in our entre (Bife Vesuvio) were balanced perfectly. I had a lovely date and a beautiful bottle of wine, and we had a table in the corner where we never felt rushed to finish our meal and get out. The not-so-goods: I burned my thumb striking a match to light our candle. Which they should have done but didn't. (But the burn's my fault.) The tables surrounding us were filled with self-important finance guys shouting over one another to be heard. We could hear them (very clearly) but apparently it wasn't enough for them. The salads that came before our steak were ridiculous: big pieces of lettuce, four slices of mealy, out-of-season tomatoes and a few pieces of sliced white onion. And bottles of oil and vinegar.  Maybe that's Argentinian tradition, but I sure didn't like it. And the bad: Our steak was huge (some people see that as a good thing) but lukewarm at best, and unevenly cooked. The spinach was nearly cold and cheese practically returned to its solid form by the time it came to us, and the potatoes were overcooked and dry. It just didn't live up to all these amazing reviews I've read. Which is why I'll give it another try sometime. Empanadas and some steak that isn't quite so complicated. And dessert. A note on reservations: You can make them if you have more than seven people in your party.

I remember before I even went to this restaurant while I was walking by with my friends, we were so amazed by it.  It was in the summer and they have outside seating, so people were having their meals and they looked AWESOME, all that meat!  When I finally wen to give it a try, it didn't disappoint me.  It was a very nice and intimate restaurant.  Indeed, I had my birthday party there and we all had a great time. One thing to remember is that the steak is a little mixed, by that I meant, it's usually nice and juicy, but last time we went there, it was a little dry.  And also, if you want to medium, you probably have to order it medium well, otherwise you would get a steak dripping with blood. Another thing is that if you ever plan going there during weekends, be prepared to wait for a long time.  Luckily, there's a restaurant/bar right next to it, so you can go there and grab a drink while waiting for your turn to be seated.

This is probably one of the best places to get your bang for the buck.  The meat is absolutely delicious and incredibly filling.  The berenjena- eggplant lasagna, is very rich and flavorful.  The empanadas are tasty as well.  The meat is so tender and picks up flavor very easily.  It's hard to find seating on weekends, but it is a charming byob place.

this is a great south american restaurant.. im not really a red meat eater, but my boyfriend swears by the steak.. when i went with my friend for dinner on a wednesday night, it was still packed to the hilt, but the BYOB rocks because by the time we were seated (about an hour later), we were nice and toasty with the wine bottle we'd just drained.. we had the cheese appetizer and some empanadas.. i had the chicken and she had some steak.. the bird was tasty, juicy and nicely seasoned, just like i like it.. our waiter was quite flirty, and there were a couple of times where i wanted to be like ok dude that is all, be gone with your smiley self.. but ill chalk it up to his latin loverness or something.. all in all, its a lovely place for a group or a date..

i almost had my first overeating experience here.  My friend's parents were visiting and took all the kids out to eat-- 2 adults and like 4 college sophmores, 7 bottles of wine and a steak/whole chicken each. I think I remember the waiter mentioning that the meat is actual Argentinen beef (I can totally remember my childhood, with its bi-weekly rare steak tasting like NOTHING i've had in the states, even the mcdonald's in argentina tastes better). And to affirm that this this probably the best Argentinen Restaurant in the city, my cousin from Mar de Plata visited this past week and confirmed with me that this place is 100% real deal delicious and authentic. We had the weird stuff, intestines and shit!! Still all yumms. BYOBBBBB!!! BOOYAKAAA!

Sure, it's BYO, but places that understand that "medium rare" still involves some blood on the plate are so hard to find. Try their two-person steak dishes with someone you're not afraid to go all pride of lions with over dinner, and you won't regret it. Service is invariably friendly and attentive, even though this place fills up fast, and stays that way any and every given evening.

Thought this place was great.  Expect it to be crowded and if you're going there for dinner on the weekend, bring your patience.  Don't worry, it's worth it.  It was pretty crowded and a tight squeeze - definitely a good date place with dim lighting and candles.  I, of course, was NOT on a date so that made it actually a bit awkward because there seemed to be couples everywhere. The service was prompt and the food was incredibly tasty and a GREAT value for the price.  We had the beef empanadas which were hot and fresh and our steaks were so delicious - perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Nothing too complicated, just great tasting.  You won't miss all the traditional steakhouses and all of their a la carte sides - I was stuffed from some great steak with a good amount of food to take home as leftovers.  May want to consider bringing your fatmanpants.

Based on everything I heard and read I decided to try Tango Sur.  It was a first date and I picked this restaurant because I heard the food was great and it was BYOB which meant we could keep the bill down.  We had to wait an hour. However, they call you when your table is ready so we simply headed a few doors down to a bar and had some beers.   The atmosphere is intimate and romantic, the food was fabulous, and the service impeccable.  Be warned that the portions are HUGE!  We could have easily split something and still both been full.  But we simply took the leftovers home and had a second meal so that was fine.   I had the steak cooked rare and is was mouthwatering good.   THIS PLACE IS WORTH THE LONG WAIT.

Great food.  Easily the best steaks I've had in the city so far.  The size of the entrees are really big so be sure to go with an appetite.  The service can be a little slow so it's good to go there when you aren't in a rush.  The place is usually crowded but after you sit down and try to food you'll know why.

the style of preparation will appeal to some; it might be worth a try given the general reception of this place on yelp: + intimate atmosphere (perhaps to a fault?) + outdoor dining pleasant even as it begins to get colder outside + very interesting and functional presentation of meat dishes involving small grills + no corkage fee - quality of meat itself is average at best - no reservations - often noisy my experiences there have led me to realize that their mode of operation is to take meat cuts of generally very ordinary caliber and deliberately overseason them, *perhaps* in the name of authenticity.  this is no greasy spoon steak, however neither is it one from peter luger's.  my dish during the most recent trip was the vacio, which is typically a tougher cut of meat (flank steak), whose flesh is beneath a couple layers of fat and nerve tissue.  these layers help moisten the flesh during grilling and provide, generally speaking, an impressive crust to the meat.  it can be quite delightful if only seasoned with salt, or perhaps pepper and a bit of ash (!).  what ended up happening at tango sur was a very, very strong melange of chimichurri, garlic, accompanied with a hint of flesh from the vacio itself.  you can scrape the overcoat and stuffing off the meat and end up with a considerable pile of overpowering flavor on the side of your plate--and then you're left with an unfortunately tough cut of meat with unusually bold seasoning.   the portion was big enough for three--reasonably priced to feed two people, but i'd rather spend a little less on something that not only fills, but fulfills one person. tango sur is quite consistent, however:  in the three times i've ordered steak from them, the medium-rare i always ask for was without exception returned to me as medium-well.  it essentially reduces the experience to one i, an absent-minded griller, can faithfully recreate at home at lower cost.  this sort of execution is not worth paying a premium for. the positive things i have to say about this restaurant are valid, but don't make up for a lack of what should really be the most important part of a steakhouse that's trying to make its name on a tradition of excellent meat.

I love this place!  Definitely worth the long wait that you will probably experience if you go there on a weekend night (not quite so bad week nights.)  Service is excellent; friendly, helpful and attentive.  Portions are beyond generous, especially for the price. The BYOB feature is fabulous and can actually make the wait kind of fun!  They'll open your wine and provide glasses while you wait for a table so you can stand along the sidewalk, sip your wine, talk with good friends and just hang out and people watch along Southport... that's not so much fun during the winter though :-( During a recent trip one of my friends was running late and we were starving so on the waiter's recommendation we tried the Berenjena appetizer (eggplant with spinach, provolone, parmesan, ricotta and a tomato cream sauce)... I don't really like eggplant but after tasting that, I think I've changed my mind!  I've tried a few of the different entrees but think I'll be sticking with the 'El Filet'... it is just sooo delicious!

A carnivores paradise!!! Initially, i wasnt impressed by the way this place looked and decided to skip going here... Im am so glad I changed my mind! The food, service, and atmosphere blew me away!  This tiny little place... gets crowded... but its so quant and romantic with the candles and dim lighting. We started with the empanadas... they were good... and it only got better from there. We ordered the Vacio .... tons of spices and a nice garlicy flavor! It was amazing!  The portions are huge... when they say for two, ithey actually mean at least 4! The meat is their specialty... we ordered fries as the side... just cause... and they were OK, but really just go here for the meat!  you wont be disappointed...

Wowee! I went with my wife and a friend on a Sunday night. The places was packed but the 30 minute wait wasn't a problem. We went over to Blue Bayou for a drink and to pass the time.  We were finally seated and after that it was golden! The service was outstanding with great recommendations made by our server, Cristian. My dining companions both had filet mignons that looked fantastic. They were effusive with praise for those filets. I had the backed salmon with penne pasta which was also outstanding. Coffee and dessert rounded out the night. It had a great atmosphere and vibe, despite the close quarters. The food was exceptional, especially considering how quickly it arrived from the kitchen. The staff was superb - attentive without being intrusive. The crowd was good, too, with a nice mix of young and old. It was relaxed and casual environment. Prices were surprisingly affordable - bordering on cheap, really - given the quality of meal.  Complaints? If I had known it was BYOB I would have brought wine. The coffee was a little too weak for my tastes. Um, that's about it. If this  is all that I can take them to task for then they are definitely worth your time and money.  Go. Eat. Enjoy yourself.

es buuuueeennnoo. I took my boyfriend here for his 25th birthday and I cannot wait to go back!  It is a fantastic place to go on a romantic date or fun for a group of people.  The atmosphere is quaint and I love how it is small and cozy - kind of like a small Italian restaurant or something similar.  The vacio is incredible, and could probably be split amongst 4 people, and I loved the empanadas as an appetizer.   Bring your own wine... the bill was surprisingly cheap!!!

After hearing about this place since I moved here....I went for the first time the other week on a Wed. with my girlfriends. It was busy...I thought for a Wed., we waited for about 15 minutes. They have a decent waiting room in the back. Bring your own...is nice.  We had a great table towards the front, by the windows it was nice. (The sidewalk/outdoor seating looked great too, it was cold and rainy when we were there = not an option).  I ordered the Filet, and it was 2!!! (leftovers the next day) Perfect to share, and the spinach mashed potatoes were great, I thought the steak was amazing. Also very reasonably priced.  I will definitely visit again soon, Great dining experience.

I have been wanting to go here for at least and year, and I finally made it last night.  I liked it!  I was nervous because of the so-so reviews, but I thought it was really good.  The appetizers were great, and we were seated immediately.  The service was kind of slow, and next time I'll make sure we don't have somewhere to be after dinner  like we did last night.  When our food came, I had to ask for the check.  Other then the location (no parking) I would definitely go back.

Good not great. I thought that the steak filled with cheese was really good but the other food I had there was disappointing. I had heard so many good things from this place from people that I had imagined more. If you are going to go expect to wait. This place is popular and they don't take reservations so get there early or head down the street to one of the local bars to have a few drinks.

give me meat and potatoes and i'm happy! both times ive gone we ordered the steak, sorry dont recall which one. but its served about 6 girls =) we also ordered the ravioli which was really good, they also have a good cheese appetizer, so greasy and cheesy! but worth it.  The back waiting room is always nice to enjoy a bottle of wine while you wait.  The place gets really crowded so give yourself time or call ahead. the caramel flan is also something worth trying. =)  its byob ;)

What a great place!  I can only hope they don't change.  Keep it BYOB and keep serving the same food at the same prices and it will be a winning formula for years to come.  If you are in the mood for good steak but don't want to break the bank, this is the place to go.  The empanadas were very good, the bread was great, and the ribeye was massive and juicy.  Can't wait to go back!

Hmm.  I am not sure if I was impressed by this place, or not.  I liked the candles and subdued lighting.  Sorta romantic.  I wasn't fond of the generic decorations and uncomfortable chairs, however.  The food was rather good.  Not fabulous, but good.  Solid.  A feast for carnivores!    We asked for our short ribs to be medium well, but they were very well done.  The vesuvio potatoes were divine, however.   The salads were terrible.  Bibb lettuce. Tomatoes. Onion.  That's it.

This by far is my favorite restaurant and of the 20-30 different people that I have taken there, only 1 person did not like it and it was not because of the food.  They have great food for a reasonable price, it is basically a feast of steak!  To add to that, it is byob.  I usually get empanadas and the provaletta for appetizer, the para (meat heaven) for my meal and their tasty flan for dessert.  I also recommend the bife vesuvio, which is beef tenderloin stuffed with spinach and cheese.  The only problems I have run into is the wait and the inconsistency of good service...  Sometimes they seem to have their hands full beyond their capability...  Basically if you can deal with spotty service, the food will speak for itself.

We had an amazing first experience here last Friday for date night.  You can't make reservations - we got there around 830 and the wait was 45 min to 1 hour for 2 people.  We were in no rush, so we went to a nearby bar to grab a couple of drinks.  Just as we ordered our 2nd beer (less than 30 min. later) they called that our table was ready!  We were happy to chug our beers and scoot back to get our table.  Once we arrived we were promptly seated to a quaint table for two outside.  If the weather is nice I highly recommend eating outside - it's more private and relaxing than inside which is loud and very crowded. We brought our own wine (BYOB) which was great; we shared the Argentinean tortilla for appetizer (having studied in Spain, I love tortilla espanola) - it was cooked to perfection and delicious.  We got the filet steak (came with 2) and the steak stuffed with spinach and cheese.  The stuffed one was better, but both dishes were amazing (and huge).  The staff was also very attentive and courteous. The bill ended up being less than $60...for a hot date night and amazing steak, you can't beat it!  Will definitely be back and would love to bring friends or family.

The meat here is fantastic.  They have a lot of choices, and it's reasonably price, considering it's such a steak place.  I had a steak that was stuffed with cheese, spinach, garlic, and white wine.  I could only finish half of the portion, because it was so huge.  And the chimichurri sauce on the side made the dish even better than it is on its own.  I usually like my steak naked (i.e., no sauce), but this really kicked thing up onto another level.  I would like to give this place five stars, but we had to wait an hour for a table, you're sandwiched in like sardines, and it was so hot inside that everyone at my table was sweating!  The plus side to having to wait so long, is that they take your phone number and call you when your table is ready.  That way, you can wander around the neighborhood, have some drinks somewhere, or even go to Dairy Queen to perk up your appetite.  And if you plant to make reservations, make sure you can get six people rounded up to go with you, otherwise, you're stuck waiting with the rest of us.

4.5 stars maybe.... There are a lot of great things about Tango Sur: - outside seating - BYOB - very reasonably priced - massive portions (if you can eat that much) If you are a meat lover, you will probably love this place just for the humongous portions of steak you will get served here at damn good prices.  Since it's BYOB too, you really can get a great deal without breaking the bank.  The "El Filet" is only $23 and you get TWO filet mignons - that's right: 2 of them.  I don't think you can beat the value of this anywhere.  It's not the best steak I've ever had, but it's decent.  However, I always get the feeling that they are more about quantity than quality here.  Dont' get me wrong, it's not bad food at all, but I'd rather they give me a little less and make it a little better instead.  I don't need a plate with 2 whole steaks for dinner.  If you're the kind of person that does, though, you will be in heaven here. My recommendation for two "normal" eaters: bring a bottle of wine (or two), get the "El Filet" with the two steaks and an appetizer and share.  You'll have a great evening and walk out with well under $40 total for steak dinner for two.   Be prepared to wait forever to get a seat.  You definitely want to make reservations ahead of time.

I've been holding off on going to this place for a while, mainly because I don't particularly like the neighborhood it is in and parking there is horrible (yeh yeh, duh CTA but these days I'd rather drive...FU CTA).  As we walked up to this place we could see there was a pretty big line and lots of people around.  We were expecting a pretty big wait for it being labor day weekend and all.  We put our name in and gave them our phone number (pretty cool IMO, they'll call you when your table is ready) and we went down to the local bar and had some drinks.   We waited an hour and half and rarely do I wait this long for food.  We had a party of 5, some had been there before and said the food was worth it, so I obliged. The place was pretty crowded, seating was pretty close together and kind of hard to see with most of the light coming from candles on the tables.  We ordered from the specialties menu and got orders for 2 (the vacio and lomo ren-something, i could barely read the menu because it was so dark).  We also had the grilled provolone type cheese and 5 beef empenadas.  The appetizers were pretty good, the empenadas I've had before and they are awesome.  Then came the main courses that came on these stands.  I could barely see it, but I could totally smell the garlic and mushrooms and the sweet potatoes looked great.  They tasted even better.  I was surprised at how good the food was and I really liked the style they presented the meat.   Steak lovers, you will love this place.  If I had some rice, I would have cleaned the platter the meat came on, the sauce was that good.  The price was very reasonable.  120 for five of us.  Not bad.  I took a star off because I don't like being crowded and I felt like I was being crowded with all of the close seating.   Tango Sur may be my favorite place in Chicago.

I've been here twice.  I don't remember what I ordered, but I remember thinking "I wish I made more money so I could eat here more often." The portions were huge, but that's not a bad thing. The service was also really good.  Fast, polite and professional. I really can't remember anything about it that I didn't like other than that I couldn't afford to go there more frequently.

Earlier this year, I visited Tango Sur and had the Filet (Filetto?). It consisted of two large filets that were VERY average - but you get what you pay for.  For only 22 bucks, there was a LOT of meat, and the sauce was good.  Based on that plate of meat, I was going to give Tango Sur an overrated 3 stars.   However, I was brought back by some out-of-towners who had heard of the Tango Sur legend.  We split a couple of the grilled platters for two.  These things were gi-frickin-normous and seasoned and flavored exquisitely.  The cuts themselves were nothing to write home about, but the flavors and seasonings made it more than worth it.  And I brought home enough for a couple more meals.   Definitely stick with the plates for two!

Last night was my 4th visit to Tango Sur and it was even more impressive than the first 3 visits. Yes, there is a long wait (about 1hr) - even for a Wednesday evening - but it was well worth it. The bread was fresh, of which I definitely ate too much of. The salad was delicious. The Vacio steak my friend and I ordered was splendid! It cost about $35 and is usually for two, but I think could feed more. You honestly can't go wrong with this dish. It comes with this great garlicy, salty sauce. Yum! The service was average for a busy place. Just go expecting to wait and you'll have a great dinner. (It's also BYOB...)

The food at Tango Sur is soooo delicious. The salad was fresh and light, the rolls crispy and well flavored and the steak (Voci..sp?) for two is in my opinion, one of the best flavored in the city.  The sauce that the steak comes in is really delicious and what makes it even better is the oil sauce to dip it in.  I can see how people have claimed Tango Sur is overrated, b/c it does get a lot of Word of Mouth (setting the expectations high) and the wait is a around an hour (weekdays) to 2 hours (weekends). But the price of the steak and the quality and flavor of the food are really pretty fantastc. It's fun to BYO wine too.

Overrated. Big Time. I tried this place a few years ago and was thoroughly unimpressed.  I gave it a second try 2 years ago.  Things had not improved.  But still the lines outside the place were 2 hours long every weekend.  Surely I had missed something.  I tried a final time a year ago since I live close by.  I am sorry, but I do not understand the lines or the reviews of this place at all.  while I understand that the meat is supposed to be a different kind of cut, mine was more like rubberized roadkill.  I seriously could not chew it.  While there was some decent flavor, I wasn't there to chew and spit out every bite like it was some new concoction of Wrigley's gum.  Yes, the price can be all right since it is BYOB but if you can't swallow your food what's the point?

I did not enjoy the food at Tango Sur.  However I only tried the Lomo.  The restaurant could use some help on environment and cleanliness.  Most people I know rave about this place, but I would definately not put it on the same level as Ruth's Chris Steakhouse or Fogo de Chao

Once again...over 100 reviews for this place?  Would normally not review it, but I thought it was so good and rather authentic, that I can't help it.  I'm sorry to read Erin S's review and her disappointing experience.   I have recently had a fabulous trip to Argentina and am completely enamored by it.  And one would think, one would be able to find a fairly authentic Argentine resto in LA.  Unfortunately, that is not the case.  Carlito's Gardel comes close, but Tango Sur is so much better!  OK, Tango Sur is no Cabana Las Lilas in B.A., but TS serves up good quality meat at decent prices AND most of their stuff on the menu is quite authentic for your run-of-the-mill traditional Argentine cuisine.  So, the steak isn't Chicago Chop House or Cabana Las Lilas quality, but for the price and the atmosphere (which is much more inviting and charming) is top-notch! Admittedly, the proveleta was a bit oily, but was so satisfyingly salty and rich and a perfect way to start of a meal with bread and your BYO-wine.  Yes, it did take the waiter a bit of time to get over to us and open up the wine, but it's a beautifully lazy Sunday evening with friends...who the eff cares?  We have to remember that sometimes the American way is not the best or most enjoyable way.  Dude...and the salads?  Not even close to romaine.  I think it was head lettuce, baby!  And that's what I loved about it.  This is an establishment of flesh!  The veggies are there to cut the grease that you either just ingested or are about to ingest.  This is how they serve up most salads (head lettuce or something akin to it, a few slices of tomato, a few rings of onion and just plain ol' oil and vinegar) at mid-level restos in Europe and (westernized) South America.  I was actually hoping that I was going to a get a plain ol' salad (in Italy, they usually serve you the salad LAST just to cut the grease) instead of some fancy frouffy salad (don't get me wrong, I love the frouffy salads as well...but at the right time and place).   We also ordered the eggplant/cheese appetizer which was divine as well.  My friend and I ordered the lomo special which was basically an obscenely large hunk of lomo (filet) with grilled and marinated portobellos and of course, the chimmichurri.  We ordered it medium rare (if up to me, it would have been cold in the center) and they did it perfectly.  Actually, a little more rare than most American medium rares.  I was happy.  And dude...I'm a pig, and my friend and I could NOT finish it.  I can never NOT finish my dinner.  I'm sorry that Erin S. had such a horrible experience, but I had a wonderful dinner with friends that night: fantastic food, laid-back atmosphere, dinner out on the sidewalk wtih good friends, and 2 bottles of BYO-wine...I'm not really sure what else one needs for a perfect night out.
Far from stellar service, unbelievebly long waits, cramped seating but worth it!  Better steaks that the usual suspects (Morton's, Gibson's, Palm) and a refreshing atmosphere.

I went here last night and I had a horrible time.  We arrived around 5:30 and were sat promptly outside, which was nice. We waited 10 minutes to be acknowledged with water and menus. We waited another 10 minutes for the waiter to come by and uncork our bottle of wine. We waited about 15 minutes for the waiter to take our appetizer order (the provoletto, which is essentially a handful of provolone cheese, some cheap-tasting olive oil, a few strips of limp roasted red peppers and a hit of dried oregano, all stuck on a plate under a broiler for a few minutes).  The waiter falls into a black hole. About 20 minutes went by before we got greasy coagulated disc of aforementioned cheese. Said waiter has apparently found his way out of aforementioned black hole and only THEN takes our order for the main course. We ordered a HUGE steak dish for 2 with portobello mushrooms and then we sat.  And sat.  And sat.  Someone brought out our salads, which were the most disappointing and boring salads I have ever eaten in my life; it was cut romaine lettuce, 2 slices of watery tomato, and 2-3 small rings of white onion. It was served with oil and vinegar. I wasn't sure if it was supposed to have been a palate cleanser or what, but it was pretty much useless. I've had better salads everywhere else I've ever eaten. The two tables that had come in 10 and 15 minutes after us (respectively) had already been served and were making good progress on whatever hunk o' meat that was in front of them. Finally, I looked at my watch and figured out that we had already been there for over an hour, and we still hadn't gotten our entree. I flagged down a wary-looking guy who was having trouble opening bottles of wine the next table over and asked him what was up. He fetched our server (there HAS to be a black hole inside the restaurant somewhere) and the server came out, all defensive, saying that HE didn't make a mistake; the dish WE ORDERED has a 35-minute cook time. A 35-minute cook time? For a 16-oz steak, cooked med-rare? OOOkay... Then he proceeds to tell us that that was why he asked us if we wanted an appetizer, because that dish takes so long to cook. Um, he brought out our appetizer before he even took our entree order! So I call bullshit.  Twenty minutes later, we had our dish; an unappetizing hunk of steaming beef set in an oily sauce with a bullet of admittedly good chimichurri on the side. And it was cooked to approaching shoe leather on the outside, and on the inside it was well-done. Nowhere near med-rare. At that point, I was more focused on just getting the fugg outta there...and it was nearly 8:00. I wanted the last 2.5 hours of my life back. I felt like they should have paid me. I really disliked this place. The wait and inattention to service was so distracting. Good thing was, our bill only came out to a little over $50. I thought $4 and the change was reflective of the service, and, as a former waitress, I usually tip anywhere between 15-25%. Everything about this place was bad, from the uninspired menu to the lackadaisical service. Just awful, really. Had the food been outstanding, I can tell you there would be at least 2 or 3 more stars up there, but really? Nothing special. Greasy, oily...just not the right stuff. I would recommend not going here. Consider El Nandu on Fullerton instead; much better service, better-tasting food, and you won't be in a hurry to just leave and be anywhere else but there.  Not going back. Ever.

Overall Review 9 0f 10 Wow, have we ever had a wonderful couple of weeks with regard to gourmet dining. This is a little dive is a BYOB Argentinian Steak House in the heart of Wriglyville. The only reason we reviewed this at less then a perfect ten was the 2 hour wait. However they did take our cell phone number so we could walk around the neighborhood. What We Had 10 of 10 Steak of course. Everything is a la carte here, but comes with the standard bread and house salad. The steak is amazing. I had sirloin, and Cathy had a cheese and spinach stuffed steak. Medium Rare is definitely rare. This was just the best, thick steak I have had in a long time - and all for $15 Atmosphere 9.5 of 10 This is a real little place. There are paper table cloths with candle light. Argentinian music plays and the walls are painted very tastefully with a scene of a small village. It was dark and tight, and very sexy. This place would be perfect for a date, given its romantic atmosphere. Others If you are on or near Southport in Chicago, you have to check this place out. I'd try to call ahead, but I'm not sure they will answer . . . too busy. Get a steak, and be ready to enjoy your evening.

I really like this place.  True, the cuts are not that great, but the seasonings are excellent.  I would not suggest this place if you: don't like meat and/or spices, regularly dine at expensive steakhouses, or want to be treated special.  However, if you want a very tasty, large and meaty meal, it's great. Yes, there is a wait.  It's very good, and people like to go there.   But they take your name and number; just go wander down to a nearby bar.  No problem! And it's byob.  steak tastes much better with good wine, and I won't shell out for good wine if I have to pay 3x retail.

Went here last night on a double date.  So we shared empanadas (spinach and cheese) and cheesy eggplant (it's on the chef's special).  I thought hte empanadas were delish, however, not sure if I liked the sauce that came with it.  The cheezy eggplant would have been good it it weren't so salty.  Kinda disappointing, because it looked delish and it was a good portion for four people.  Then we all had seperate entrees.  I had the el filet, which was also disappointing.  Normally filets are tender and succulent, this was polar opposite.  It was chewy (even when medium rare) and grainy.  The portions are huge as I had two portions of meat.  However, I would have rather had one small delicious portion, than two mediocre, huge portions.   My bf got the T-bone.  That was delicious and flavorful.  Try that, if you are going to go here.  The fat content is higher, but it's def. worth the cholesterol. Then the other couple got one of the specials.  I think it was the el relleno.  It was a dish that is big enough for two people.  Once again, meat was tough and chewy.  It was a HUGE portion, but quality is always better than quantity people! Finally, the ambience was basically darkness with tapered candles.  It was hot and muggy, so I think if the lights were on it would just add on to the heat.  Not the most comfortable dining experience, I've had.   Overall, it was ok.  Not great by any means, but it's not going to break the bank either.  $120 for four people is a reasonable price for steak.  I just don't think I would come here again though.

You have to loooove meat to eat here.  The food was so good and the portions are huge.  The wait staff were super nice and me and my sister got 1 free dessert because we couldn't decide which one we wanted.   I give it 4 stars because when I came here I had a reservation (and only for 2 people) but we still had to wait 15-20 minutes.  But the food and service made up for it.

I'd say this is a 3.5.  After frolicking at the Montrose Beach and getting yelled at by the lifeguard, we were starving and wanted somewhere with outside seating.  We only waited a few minutes for a perfectly intimate table.  We started with an Inka Kola, which tastes like a combo of cream soda and bubble gum and is packed with caffeine.  It's like kiddie crack.  For a starter we enjoyed the empanadas and when they accidentally gave us two beef instead of a beef and a chicken, the waiter brought out a fresh chicken one at no charge.  Our waiter was friendly, but the service was a little bit slow.  My entree was very good, cooked nice and raw (har har) and absolutely huge.  It was like TWO filets instead of one.  It made a great leftover lunch.  However, my companion wasn't impressed with his meal.  He had the Bife Vesuvio and felt that the sauce was so salty it was almost inedible.  A couple of the rolls were also pretty hard.  The place is BYO which is nice and really the best part is embarrassing my companion by telling him I was going to ask the waiter which part of the cow "flap meat" comes from.  For some reason seeing "flap meat" in text form is extremely entertaining.

I have been wanting to go here for awhile but there are always long lines.  So my boyfriend and I went on a Monday night.  It was still packed but we were able to sit down right away- Couple things: 1. I am a meat and potato sort of girl  2. I am not a snob  3. I am pretty sure any meat you order in America will not necessarily taste like it was shipped from Argentina cause last I heard a steak is a steak.  So bottom line BYOB makes this place a fantastic place to go have a great fillet dinner for 2 under $50.  By the way, the empenadas are fantastic.

Tango Sur deserves some balanced reviews.  Let's start with why you go. As a steak lover, you cannot beat their prices for a tasty piece of beef. Not all the cuts are good every night. I would recommend asking your server which cuts are the best that evening. Although the steaks are not exceptional, they are quite good on average and at least $20 cheaper than a steakhouse. Also, the chimmichurra is delicious and, in my personal opinion, a much better compliment to good steak than a soupy-sweet tomato based steak sauce.  Now there are some things they should do better. The bread and dinner salad are stunningly boring. Like something you'd get at a diner along the highway in Oklahoma. The cooking can be inconsistent, particularly when they are busy. The service is inattentive. I give Tango Sur four stars because I love steak and appreciate the low prices. I don't go there for the uninspired dinner salad or crappy dinner rolls, so I don't let them get to me. That being said, if you don't love steak, you probably won't be quite as enthusiastic.

This place is always a sure bet!   I suggest going straight for the $15 steak (sauteed potatoes, bread, and house salad included).  They offer up a cup of dipping jus' of butter, oil, and seasoning that will make your toes curl.   The atmosphere is intimate and the waiters are hot, hot, hot.  Sometimes if you flirt hard enough you a free desert.   The BYOB factor with no corking fee makes it an easy choice and keeps the price for an AMAZING dinner relatively low.  The wait is more than worth it...even at 10 pm.

We (a group of 4) arrived there at 6pm on a Friday and there was no wait. I have been coming here whenever I have out-of-town visitors and I have never been disappointed. Well, the criticisms of this restaurant, if considered in the more appropriate context, are rather trivial. If you pay $15 or $20 per head and you save a bunch of money by bring your own liquors perhaps you cannot expect the decor, service, and food of a five-star restaurant. I am not saying that any of them sucks, they are good, not spectacular. What makes Chicago special for lower income groups (like us students) is restaurant like Tango Sur that offer value, affordability, and a memorable evening. Southport is an interesting neighborhood and Musicbox is right around the corner, but parking is a bit tricky at times. My tip: Order one more appetizer (we shared 5 different dishes and were wowed by every single one of them), and go easy on meat (a mixed grill for two shared by 4 people). The bread IS good, reminds me of the dinner rolls from my childhood.

Yes, there was a 2 hr wait. But, that actually worked out well since we were able to hit a few bars & spend some time taking it easy & decompressing. we all had meat & everything was delicious.  after reading some of the reviews, we were a little worried, but Tango Sur did not dissappoint.

How come I didn't review Tango Sur earlier? It is one of my FAVORITE restaurants in the city! I don't usually eat steak, but I make the exception here. Try the El Fillet- it is amazing. Every time I go with someone new I recommend it and when they don't order it and try mine, they always say its the best! It is 2 HUGE tender pieces of fillet mignon and comes with the most delicious spinach mashed potatoes. Also try the cheese appetizer- its also a winner!  The atmosphere is adorable... very European and romantic. It is it dark and lit by candlelight. It is BYOB which keeps the bill low ( they don't charge a corkage fee!), and the prices are already reasonable. Not to mention that every meal here is so big you can definitely share. They do not take reservations so there is almost always a wait, but they do take reservations for large parties (over 10 I think).

My girlfriends and I came here on Friday and have a great time.  They don't take reservations, so my one friend came early and waited an hour for a table.  How nice of her =)  It basically took one hour and 15 min for a table.   The restaurant is very small and dark.  The servers are very nice and attentive.  Waters were always filled and our waiter answered all of our questions with a smile.  And definite plus- it's BYOB! This is what we ordered:  Media Pollo Al Limon: grilled half chicken, marinated with wine lemon sauce, served with vesuvio potatoes and salad Churrasco: 12 oz, sirloin steak, cooked on the grill, served wtih salad Asado De Tira: short ribs, cooked on the grill, served with salad Milanesa a Caballo: beef, breaded and topped with two fried eggs I loved my chicken, it was super juicy and the portions were HUGE!  It was 2 huge pieces and I barely finished half of it.  My friends loved their meats and potatoes.  Everything was cooked well and tasted great.  We ordered this caramel cake for dessert, they liked it but I didn't eat it since I don't like caramel.   The prices are GREAT- only $14/meal and the portions are HUGE.  I would definetely eat here again.  The only down side is that there are long waits.

I would go 3 1/2 stars if I could... I really like this restaurant so I was surprised by the very mixed reviews.  Perhaps consistency isn't their strong point.   Anyway...I've been here a few times but I will review my most recent visit. Five of us walked in early Sunday evening and were seated right away.  I was concerned that they wouldn't have seating for little people but it turns out they are a very family-friendly place.  I found the staff to be very attentive.  Our waiter explained the difference between the beef offered on the menu (from Canada) and that offered on the specials menu (South American).  He was very helpful in recommending dishes. We skipped the apps. and just ordered entrees.  I was pleased to discover that entrees came with a salad but it did leave a bit to be desired.  It was iceburg lettuce with onion slivers, tomato, served with oil and vinegar.  If they had just chosen a better lettuce I probably wouldn't diss it at all.  But a salad is such a simple thing to improve upon seems an easy way to up their ratings. I ordered the Bif Vesuvio, medium rare.  This is, hands down, one of the tastiest steak dished I have ever had.  However, despite my temperature request, the meat was WAY too rare.  Actually, all of our steaks were significantly more rare than we'd ordered them.  I suppose it's better to undercook than overcook.  Had my son not been with us I would've sent it back for them to cook more.  Instead, I ate the ends (which was actually plenty) and took the rest home.  by the time I reheated the leftovers, it was cooked perfectly! The sauce they serve the steak with is super-garlic-heavenly (they gave me extra to take home with my left-overs), the potatoes were AMAZING.  Other than the undercooked meat, the rest of my family was also quite pleased with the place and have said they will definitely go back.

Honestly, the rave reviews for Tango Sur make me question a lot of my fellow Yelpers. This place reminded me of a place that a clueless high school guy would save up for weeks for to take a girl to.  In short, Tango Sur delivered an experience of: inattentive staff, the crappiest wine glasses I've ever seen at a restaurant, bread that was made with an EZ-Bake oven, and overcooked, poor-quality beef that is barely edible unless lathered with copious amounts of the chimchurra sauce. At 20 bucks for a terrible a steak, I'd far rather walk over to East Bank Club's restaurant (open to the public) and get their delicious delmonico for 8 dollars more. (personally the spread is even more favorable as TS was a 30 dollar round-trip cab ride from River North.) Personally, I try to frequent restaurants that are good values, ie give me a good ratio of food/service/experience to the money. Tango Sur may be relatively inexpensive compared to other steak houses, but, when everything that you're paying for is shitty, the price doesn't matter; it's still a waste.

I do not understand some of the other reviews. Maybe it is because some folks up here have not had a real Argentinian experience. Having moved back to Chicago after living a number of years in Miami, which is where the concept started in the states, this is a really poor example of the true Argentinian concept. They do it perfectly there. Just as I would not order a Chicago style deep dish pizza in Miami, I would really not suggest this place as a great example of this style of dining. I can share with you that, while the ambiance is nice, and the BYOB is not a bad thing, the quality of the meat was very very disappointing.  Please do not confuse just having meat on a skewer as that being a definitive Argentinian experience. Again, I understand the concept and ambiance are very good, but sorry, I have to respectfully disagree,. We found, on BOTH occasions we went, ( we were hoping the first time was an anomaly)  the quality of the meat was very poor.  I really suggest you look at some of the other views of the quality of the food, particularly the meat. Large portions do not equal quality, sorry
There are now 250 reviews of Tango Sur.  I need say no more!  The fillets of meat are enough for 4 people!  Skip the mozzarella appetizer and head straight for the empanadas!  Ciao.

Oh my god, A group of friends and I dined here last week and it was amazing.  We went on a Friday night, so we did have to wait for an hour and a half (which we totally expected), but the host offered to hold our wine (BYOB) so we could have a drink at another bar while we waited...  and he called our cell phone to tell us the table was ready.  Now, I have never had Argentinian food, but I think Empanadas might be my new.favorite.thing. ever.   Besides that, the table ordered tons of meat and we all kind of shared... everything from the El Filet to the Lomo Relleno and it was all delish and came in large portions.  I ate so much meat, I thought I was going to have a steak hangover.  They offer very tempting fish entrees for the  non-meater as well.   The service was awesome, and considering our table was out for a celebration and we consumed copious amounts of wine, they were really hospitable ( We were that  loud, annoying table that probably made other people leave and our server seemed to enjoy us).   I had such a good time at Tango Sur, and the food was out of this world... I cannot wait to share this place with friends.

I enjoyed the food, but I am in no rush to come back.  After eating here I am a little surprised by all of the rave reviews.  Yes, the portions are huge, so its a great value, but the 4 of us agreed that the meat was a little tough.  Plus the service was not that good.  The appetizers came a lot sooner than expected, but then we waited forever for our entrees.  Overall... good, but not great.

One of the great BYOBs out there...very high quality beef dishes that won't break the budget.  The wait on weekends is horrendous though so I usually go on slower weeknights.  Surprisingly, my vegetarian wife really enjoys the food here.   In the summer months, the best place to sit is outside, both for people watching and so your clothes don't smell like a BBQ afterwards.  If you forget to bring a bottle, stop by Que Syrah down the street.  Although they are a small boutique, their selection is top-notch.

First let me start by saying go to Tango Sur with the mindset that you will be waiting, and that it is not a rushed meal, slow down your speedy Chicago lifestyle and enjoy it. It is so worth it.  Tango Sur, is one of the best restaurants on the Northside in my opinion. When we have out of town visitors, or are celebrating something special, we take them to Tango Sur. It is BYOB, there is a CVS that sells alcohol and and a little store next door that does too. It is a long wait on weekends but like another poster said, they will take your cell phone number and you can walk just about anywhere to get a drink on Southport.  The steaks not only taste amazing, but they are very inexpensive. I have no idea what kind of seasoning goes into the cooking process but they are so tender, and and have so much flavor that you just want more. I think the portion sizes are larger than most steak restaurants here in the city and their side dishes are also awesome. My favorite are the Vesuvio Potatoes, and be sure to try the Empanada's too!  Sometimes it seems like service can be a little slow, it reminds me of when I am on vacation some places and you have to actually ask for the check. The perfect time to go here is on a non--Cubs game night midweek.

I'll TANGO with Tango Sur anytime! I am a meat lover and thought this place was too good to be true considering the reviews.  It's not.  We ordered the El Filet and the Lomo.  Both are essentially two LARGER THAN LIFE pieces of Filet Mignon.  The only difference is the potatoes.  El Filet comes with (Green!) Mashed Potatoes and the Lomo includes Potatoes Vesuvio.  We favored the Mashed Potatoes especially dipped in the steak drippings.  Yummmm!  We also tried the Spinach and Cheese Empanada- $2 for 1 empanada.  It was delicious, but not necessary to the meal.  Next time, I will also try to hold back on the bread and olive and garlic spread.  I felt like garlic was oozing out my pours, but it was also delicious.  We skipped dessert and headed to the DQ with enough leftovers to feed us the rest of the weekend.  The only drawback is the wait. Southport Corridor can be pretty chaotic especially on a Cubs gameday.  We felt a little out of place in our dress clothes waiting for our table at  Take Five bar down the street.  It took us about 1.5 hours to get to Meat Euphoria!!!!

The food is delcious, the alcohol is great (because it's BYOB - all your favorites at the right price!) and the atmosphere is fun.  There is often a wait, (no reservations) but they take your phone number so you can explore the Southport Corridor as you wait.
Go for the specials over the basic cuts.  Vacio is probably the best bet.  Pluses are that it's very affordable and BYO.

MY FAVORITE DATE PLACE!! I absolutely adore Tango Sur. A great place for a first date - cozy, dark atmosphere, candle light casting shadows, and some great dishes that are perfect for two. It's BYOB, which is nice - share a bottle together and dine on some great beef. Heck, bring two bottles and stumble out on to Southport after for some people watching or bar-hopping. The wait staff is very accommodating and the music is soft, but fitting for the atmosphere. I try something new each time and have yet to be disappointed. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

The night I came here I can still remember, mainly because it was such a damn bun freezing night. I came with a friend and well we didn't know what to expect and we didn't know that it was a BYOB. Despite this set back we trudged on and made our list of orders. We ordered a bunch of the empanades. I freaking love the empanades here! I could eat them all day and all night here. I had gotten the breaded chicken and my friend had the steak. I wish I had gotten the steak, especially after having a bite of his. Damn.... I really, really wish I had gotten the steak, 'cause it was perfectly cooked and tasty. Great place for dinner, for friends or a date or a group. Service was great, very relaxed atmosphere.

Mmmm, meat. You know the kind of place that you want to write great things about because it's got great food and great value but on some level you don't want too many other people to know because it's only going to make you have to wait longer for a table so you feel really conflicted but ultimately you decide to be honest about it and write something great and figure karma works so it will all be OK in the end?   That's this place.

Delicious...  though I had food envy of Kevin G (see review).  I will definitely get "El Filet" next time.  We got a table within 20 minutes at 6pm on a Saturday and we were prepared for much worse.  I give it five stars for great food, fun atmosphere, and affordability!

As a fan of South American steakhouses and carnivore enthusiast, I had high hopes and expectations from Tango Sur, based on several friend recommendations.  While imperfect, it certainly is now one of my favorite spots in Chicago. Best cab it there because parking is one of the worst I've seen in Chicago, with permit parking only signs everywhere!  We had to eventually settle on parking on Ashland, and walk about 3-4 blocks. Reservations are recommended especially for bigger parties, asyou may be in for a long wait on busy nights.  We were told there was a 45 minute wait for our two party table, and the host offered to call us on our cellphone when the table was ready.    Also, don't forget, it's BYOB!   My biggest complaint was the ambiance.  It was dark, loud and quite cramped, with candlelit tables.  Me and my date were a bit nauseated from some candles that the busboys snuffed out next to us, but luckily it didn't completely spoil our appetite.  If they expanded the restaurant and brought in better lighting and ventilation, I would easily have given this restaurant 5 stars.   The bread rolls were soft and warm, but I was a bit disappointed, expecting traditional South American type breads (can't have it all I guess).  Before our entrees, were were served a simple yet fresh salad plate.   I ordered "El Filete", which was a ~$20 meal with generous and absolutely delicious medallions of fillet mignon, in a red onion type sauce.  The side was a buttery spinach mashed potatoes.  The  Chilean Carmenere wine we brought along went well with the beef. At one point during dinner I speculated that this was one of the best steak dinners I have had in a long time, outside of the other vastly more expensive steakhouses like Ruth Chris.  Cooked to a perfect medium.  Excellent deal and quality.  To note: the menu claims that the beef they serve is Argentine, but I was skeptical about this claim given the ban on Argentine beef imports to the US. The service I suppose was adequate, given the busy night.  We finished the dinner on a higher note with the Dulce de Leche (aka Manjar) flan, which was a dish that tasted exactly as my Chilean aunt would make it.  Authentic Cono Sur flavor! My next round at this restaurant will include samplings of empanadas and a parrillada.  Buen provecho!

Do you want to try something new? new atmosphere? great service? quality argentinean food? BYOB? great price? romantic getaway dining? Come and join the many who have come to enjoy the meals at Tango Sur! I went last nite w/ my BF and had a great salad (mozzarella, spinach, red peppers, and lettuce).  Also, had a chorizo and seafood salad, a bit of my BF HUGE steak and vesuvio potatoes! Don't forget the Flan with Dulce de leche! Candle lighting and just authentic feel. Try the empanadas and also other smaller dishes! Its small and cozy at this restaurant. Be prepared for a line. But we got in at 8:30pm on Sunday!

Prepared for a horribly long wait, we arrived at 6 PM on a Friday.  We asked for a table for 4, and were told it would be a 90 minute wait.  We asked if there was a waiting area, which there was--though stashed away in back.  After only 20 minutes, our table was ready!  We started by ordering all the different types of empanadas--beef, chicken, spinach, ham/cheese.  Although they all were good, stick to the beef--they are killer!
