I ordered El Fillet, which was a ridiculous amount of fillet Mignon for only $20.  The spinach mashed potatoes were good, but the steak was the highlight of the meal    My friends ordered the flank steak entree for 2 people--although it was good, they both agreed the El Fillet was better.  However the presentation on the 2 person entrees was quite impressive. Now on to the best part--the restaurant is BYOB.  The waiting area has glasses and corkscrews.  All the tables seemed to bring tons of wine and beer, which leads to quite a festive atmosphere. Overall---a great meal.  Just come hungry and ready to eat some beef!

I recently gave up eating meat but if you're a carnivore, you will love this place. They serve the best steaks...all imported from Argentina. In my meat eating days I ordered the filet stuffed with cheese and spinach which was fan-tastic. Great ambiance with dimly lit dining area and live music on weekends. Another plus about this place is that it's BYOB and no corkage fee which can save you alot of money if you go there with a group of friends. I went there for my birthday last yearwith a group of 6. We all ordered our own entree, a couple of apps, a side salad and two desserts, basically a 4 course meal, and the toal was a little over $30/person.The only knock about the place is that they don't accept reservations so if you go on a weekend night be prepared to wait a while, but if you have a few bottles of wine with you the time will pass quickly! In summary, great food and ambiance with an excellent value.

Tango sur I have heard much about Tango Sur, the Argentine restaurant in the Southport nieghborhood where I grew up. As a youngin' I would go to the store for the amazing empanadas and leter for other Spanish products. They have also always had a butcher shop there in the store. This same family started Tango sur after I moved away from home.   The restaurant next door was a real disappointment. Tango Sur is a Argentine style steakhouse that is BYO. The restaurant is cramped with the tables really close to eachother, which sometimes makes for an interesting place to go. But these tables are so tight that not even the waiters can get through let alone the people trying to come and go from there table. People were brushing arms (and asses) against me throughout the evening. At one point I found myself tugging on a guys sportcoat that was leaving because his ass was literally on my table. The guy was cool and apologized. Ok no big deal on that, again a crowd sometimes makes a place fun.  On to the food. I started with the empanadas, which were ok, not fabulous. We ordered an equal amount of spinach and of ground beef. They were half as good as the ones sold at the corner store. The chimichurri sauce, a sauce with olive oil, parsley, garlic and other things was pretty bland. I then ordered Berenjena (Eggplant) for another appetizer. The ingredients of prociutto, rio de plata cheese and the tomato cream sauce sounded like a nice marriage ok, scratch good marriage, they sounded good, but this too was not tasty.  Then came the meat dishes. Upon the waiters recommendation for the most tender meat, I ordered something called 'vacio' which served two. The presentation of this looked great, brought out on a platter that keeps cooking on your table it was in a nice sauce and with sweet potatoes in the sauce. But the meat was horrible, like a really big, poor quality cut and really chewy. After a bit or two I left it. The serving could have served many people. Like five or six.  My son and girlfriend ordered the 'parillada variado'(assorted grilled meats) which comes with sausages, a few cuts of different steak, morsillas which are a blood sausage and pork sausages. Morsillas which are I think Spanish, but made in many places in latin america were just ok with each adding their own touch. The steak on the platter contained was really fatty, like unhealthy to eat due to the amount of fat in each bite. When I told the waiter that what I ordered but far from what he described, he removed it and later returned to say he would take it off my account which I didn't expect but which I appreciated. Service I found was better than the food, as waiters were courteous and very attentive. In spite of this, I could never go back.

Vegetarians back away.  The meat is sizzlin at Tango Sur.  Whatever you order, ask for extra garlic olive oil sauce.  I want to dip everything in it!  Bring a couple bottles of wine, get some glasses from the host/hostess and knock a few back while you're waiting for your table.  I really wish they took reservations.

I love this place. Hugely affordable food, BYOB, and great atmosphere for a date. Horrible waiting times on the weekend, though.  But they did accomodate a huge group of us in the back room for my birthday, and there's no corking fee.

great food, great service and I really like that it is BYOB.  You can have a nice meal out and not break the bank.  I liked the atmosphere too....although it did get a little loud as the night went on, but it wasn't a big deal.

I love BYOB places, because you usually get pretty good food for pretty good prices.  Tango Sur didn't disappoint.  I had a HUGE STEAK stuffed with cheese and spinach I believe (Bife Vesuvio) with these really good Argentinian-style potatoes (or at least that's what they claimed - whatever style they were, they were great), for about $20.  They also had really good empanadas, and I like the fact that you can order them individually (instead of having to get a whole plate of them). The wait was a bit long, but the good thing is that they take down your cell phone number and call you when your table is almost up, so you can go home or go to one of the nearby bars while you wait your table.  Also, since it's BYOB, they also have a back room where you can just uncork your wine and drink while you're waiting, although if we had been drinking for the entire hour and a half wait, we wouldn't have been sober enough to eat anything. This place would get five stars, except for the fact that my girlfriend's filet wasn't as good as filets at most places.  The quantity was great, but the quality on her steak was not as good.  Overall though, it was a great, fun dining experience that I'd recommend to everyone who likes meat (and I've heard great things about the vegetarian items too).

If you want Argentina you found it. It's about as close to the real thing as you're going to get in NorthAm. This is a great place to bring a date and have a great steak. It's BYOB so that works, too! ;) And it's not an in-and-out type of place as someone complained about- try McDonald's if that's what you're after. It's a little dark and intimate. It's better they don't take RSVP because then you know you have a shot to get in, or if you don't want to wait, there are always weeknights! Salud!

Yea, its really annoying that they don't take reservations and sometimes the wait is several hours.  This can easily be avoided by coming on a weekday or getting a group of 8 or more.  I never liked steaks until I had one at this restaurant!  Even my vegetarian friends like this place for the atmosphere (they usually get empanadas and an appetizer).  Don't forget  to bring wine.  I suggest Malbec, an Argentinian wine to go with Argentinian steak.

Great food at decent prices and it is BYOB.  I will never suggest to go back though. It is so dark, I have always had to wait a long time, and the waiter once seemed to leave me and my dinner mate for way too long without food.  I would have preferred to be in and out quicker.  And really, do not go here if you have anything private to say as you will be squished between a lot of people.

We came here with a large group for a Christmas party.  FYI, they only take reservations for large groups, otherwise the wait is long on the weekends.   This place is very busy. I like the ambiance, mainly for the lighting.  The service was very good.  The food was just good, but the meal is so reasonable you can't complain.   BYOB is a big plus when you're with a big group.  We all pigged out and it came out to less than $40/person  meal, tax and tip.

This place totally deserves it's rep as one of the greatest date places in the city.  It's small, dark, romantic and BYO.  Most importantly it's totally reasonably priced and you get heaps of food for the money you pay.  And it tastes good.  For non meat eaters, there is this delicious lasagna like dish with eggplant that is mind blowingly good.  They do get really busy and do not take reservations so go on off days or off times to enjoy this place without the hassle of a long wait.

I came here once for a b-day dinner, and our large table was all the way in the back of the restaurant by the restrooms.  I would say there are about 2 main rooms, but the back room was SO DARK (and so was the restroom stall!).  I could hardly see my food.  My bf & I shared this huge hunk of meat that sits cooking on a stone slab.  It was seriously the size of a small log, and it came with no sides.  We ended up making beef sandwiches with the dinner rolls b/c we couldn't handle any more meat by itself.  I don't even remember whether it tasted good, so I guess that isn't a good thing.  It is, however, BYOB, so that's always a plus in my book!
Hands down one of the best restaurants in Chicago.

Sorry to say, but didn't live up to the hype. The BYOB on the front porch was nice, but we were huddled for over 90 minutes after having reservations. If you want to go for the food, shoot for an early dinner (or, bundle up in the winter). The steaks were also good, but not great... the saving grace was a fairly-priced menu for what you get. Nice, dark and cozy atmosphere, but also usually packed shoulder to shoulder while seated. Hopefully you'll like your neighbors :) Perhaps the best advice is that around the corner, the owner runs a butcher shop that has some excellent cuts at great prices. And they're very helpful in making suggestions as well.

Great steak, good appetizers, great BYOB policy - but what kind of asinine place does not take reservations??????  Who wants to spend half of an entire evening waiting for a table, when they don't even provide an adequate waiting area? Sorry but I have better things to do with my time, there are plenty of good places to eat in the area. All the hype around this place has given the people who work there a definite attitude.  Unless you want to eat at 6 or 10 pm, don't bother coming here any time except the beginning of the week - the wait can be over 3 hours long!

W...A...I...T...I...N...G... I don't know about you, but I (heart) cow.  This place has good quality beef at great prices and of course the BYOB policy is fantastic.  Only downsides are the wait (bring extra booze to pass the time), the claustraphobic environment (if there's a fire, there's no way you're getting out alive), and the sometimes difficult waitstaff (wouldn't take back a well-done steak that was ordered rare).  That said, still a solid place to grab dinner with friends and clear out all the oddities from your liquor cabinet (wtf do I do with Frangelico?).

Ambiance is great, steaks are amazing, and BYOB makes it crazy cheap. There's a long line, especially on weekends, because its just that good. Try the El Filet, or a sample plate of all 4 kinds of empanadas. mmm. I want to go back now!!! too bad it's the middle of the night  =(

I absolutely adore this quaint, cozy restaurant.  It gets pretty hectic though because everyone wants in.  It can be a good hour and a half wait on a week night..so get there early.   It's dimly lit, with a candle...sometimes there's a live guitarist who plays romantic music...it's BYOB...servers are always totally swamped...so be prepared to go, sit down, relax, and have a nice meal.. (not the ideal place to go if you're in a rush with the wait to sit and the wait for service).. The food is amazing though!!  Never in my life have I ordered a filet and been so surprised at the portion given!!  It was awesome While you are waiting to be sat, though, there's a room in the back with benches, wine glasses, and a corkscrew to help the time go by a little faster.
Food is great. Big enough portions to share! The layout of the restaurant is really bad. I had to climb over people just to get out.

Everybody knows of this small Argentinean place on Southport. I recently went to Argentina and had a lot of empanadas. I can say for sure that empanadas you get from Tango Sur are better than any I've tried in Argentina. I hate their salad though.. Long waits really bug me too. I've been there many times- weekdays and weekends. One time I went there with a couple of college buddies on a Sunday night. We waited for over an hour. Their meat is pretty good although they tend to undercook their meat. (I actually like this aspect. I like my meat pretty rare) BYOB.. always good.

The first time I was there, I was wowed. It was romantic, the portions were great, the food was good. The second time I went, it was entirely different. When my name was called, and the entire party was 2 minutes away - they wouldn't seat us. We had to wait another hour just to be seated. It was incredibly loud, the steaks were very rubbery, and the service was slow. I've never been there on weekdays, so it might be better. I highly recommend not going there on Friday or Saturday nights.

Tango Sur is a small place, but surprisingly did not feel cramped once we were seated.  Lighting is romantic, overall comfortable feel.  I ordered the filet, which was AMAZING.  The portion size is HUGE (I received around 12-14 oz of filet) and the side dishes were great.  The empanada appetizer was delicious.  BYOB is great too!  Pricing is extremely reasonable.

Some of the best filets I've ever had at a fantastic price.  Great portions, juicy steaks, and BYOB -- what else can you ask for.  Add some empanadas for an appetizer and you've got a great meal.  The place is cozy, so expect to have little room to maneuver.  Go on a week day to avoid huge lines.

Great restaurant in the Argentinian/South American churrascaria vein. Keeping that in mind, focus on the meat and empanadas - don't bother with the salads. It's BYOB so bring yourself a nice bottle of red wine and enjoy.  Ambiance is dark and sleek with candle-lit tables/dark wood, and brick walls. A bit noisy so not a first date spot, but maybe one a little later. Do expect to wait in line if you're looking for a table on a Thursday, Friday or Saturday night - I don't think you can make reservations for two. I went here on my birthday and I was pleased. In fact, I think this place is perfect for birthdays and bachelor parties. We had a large group and got reservations ahead accordingly. We were seated promptly, and the staff was very accomodating, especially with our large group. All in all a great experience.

I have been to Tango Sur on several occasions and I think it is a great place for a cheap dinner.  We had a steak, a salad and brought our own bottle of wine and it was under $50.  I can name at least a hundred places in Chicago that I have been to were that wouldn't even cover the drinks.  The food is good, albeit the steak was a little rare, and I love my steaks rare.  The only problem with the place is that they don't take reservations, and if you are not in the door by 6:45, you will have to wait and sometimes the wait can stretch for two hours or more.

DO NOT GO HERE WITH A GROUP! Whatever you do, DO NOT try to go to TANGO SUR with a group or with anyone you'd really like to impress.  Yes, It is a great place, but horrible for groups. Their reservation and seating system is awful! I argued with them on the phone for 30 minutes last weekened about their reservation policy (each person I talked to in the past told me something differently.) and when our group went up there Friday, there were 8 of us and we were told they would not be able to accomodate us at all the entire weekend. They were completely booked with parties of 6 or more. Not even at 5pm or 10pm.  When I had called earlier they had said they already had 7 large parties for the evening and had to restrict it at that so they could still accomodate walk-ins. They told me to walk-in and wait. We were willing to wait 2+ hours, but they said even then it didn't matter we weren't going to be seated. They desperately need a new system!!

I'd been wanting to try Tango Sur for quite some time now. Every time my girlfriend and I had wanted to go, the wait was at least an hour for a table! But we recently took her parents there on a Thursday night, and the restaurant was more than half empty. The food (especially the Argentine beef steaks) was fantastic. Exceptionally flavorful, and the pricing is excellent for the amount and quality. The total bill for four of us was about $80. Tango Sur is BYOB, so make sure you go accross the street to Que Syrah to pick up a bottle or two of wine to accompany your meal.

Good, but it's no Las Tablas . Very crowded on a weeknight, and the service was just so-so...though I think it was more 'relaxed service' than 'bad service' .  Maybe that's just the way they do it there.  Food was really good, and I like that it's BYOB.  I may or may not go back - it was good, but I've had better.

Let me make mine a little different from the other reviews.  Keyword: Value  They start you off with some tasty bread and butter on the house  I recommend that you order some steak at this time. Although the other food is great as well, the steak is what makes me go at least once a month.  You can get an amazing steak for only $15, I tend to stick to my fave: the $20 rib-eye. The portions rock and are served with delicious potatoes.  Cons: greasy & heavy, so popular that wait-times on weekends are over an hour always.  Tips to avoid the cons: workout earlier in the day and eat some salad or something light during lunch to counteract the feeling of doom later in the evening.  Also here's a tip: if you're looking for a romantic dinner and MUST sit inside - go Mon-Thurs and the wait isn't bad at all for in-door seating.  For those of us that don't care, just sit in the front of the convenience store. Tango Sur has spread their tables all the way down and it seems weird at first but it's definitely worth it.  I skipped many 1+ hour waits with my friends by taking the ghetto-table no one wanted at the corner in front of the convenience store (which you can grab some booze at since it's BYOB).  Tip: Although there aren't reservation, if you show up in person they will tell you the wait-time and take your phone #.  Then they call you when a table is about to be free.  This is good if you have out-of-town guests and you don't want them to wait a long time.

Very good steaks and romantic atmosphere. Small quaint place perfect for the summer and sitting outside bring your own etoh. Once you get over the charm you realize the food is just a little better than average. The price about 30$ per person. You will love it the first time you go here

This is smack your mama good.  Go hungry and get the Lomo.  Hmmm... Lomo.... (Homer Simpson). It can get really noisy on the weekends, but it is still wonderful.  Oh, did I forget to mention, BYOB.  Luv it.  You also have to try the Empanadas, anyone will do, but I recommend trying them all.
Great Steaks!  Though the beef is canadian it is still nice and tender.  Try their Vesio cut of beef to maximize flavor and tenderness.  BYO too.
Great Matambre.  And fantastic South American beef dishes.  One of my favorites.  Go hungry.

GREAT PLACE. I heard that this was not a place for non-meat enthusiasts so I stayed far away until one amazing night. NOT TRUE! I had a great time. We had a late dinner outside and brought two bottles of wine with us (that may have something to do with my love of the place) . You can't beat the outside seating, people watching, BYOB with no corking fee, and a great inexpensive dinner.  The food was fantastic, we had empanadas to start, salad and split two entrees, waaay to much food. It was wonderful my favorite part being the spinach and cheese empanadas.  Our entire bill came to $23.00 TOTAL. Unreal.  They also called my cell phone when our table was ready.  If I could give Tango Sur  10 stars, I would. Going back next week, and that's how I feel about that. Went again last night with my restaurant club. LOVE IT STILL!!!  Out of 11 people every single one loved it.

Be prepared to wait for about an hour to get into this place, it is extremely popular because of the price and the fact that it is BYOB.  I went to Tango Sur during the heat wave a couple of weeks ago and the lack of air conditioning definitely took away from the meal.  On the inside it is very dark, the only light comes from the candles at each table, it also is very loud and hard to have a conversation with the other people at your table.  With that said, the food was very good and the portions were huge.  I shared an entre with my girlfriend and still struggled to finish it all.  I would definitely go back again.

This is NOT a great place for a first date.  It's very busy & loud and the women you take out probably will feel 10 lbs. heavier by the end of the meal.  I highly recommend the Lobo (filet with potatoes).  You get 2 6-8 oz. filets which is pretty much unheard of for just $20.  Entrees come with a house salad, as well.  Service is pretty bad (you may need to be a little proactive).  They don't take reservations, so plan to get there early or wait.

I love bringing out-of-towners to this restaurant. It's amazing food, not too expensive, and BYOB. The wait is enormous on weekends, but I love that they'll give you wine glasses to get started on your wine while you're waiting for a table. As others have said, it's a great date place too. And although it's not a vegetarian's first choice, they do have this eggplant dish my non-meat-eater friends friends really enjoy.

I've only been here once, but loved it.  The empenadas were scrumptious. I especially loved the Ham and Cheese. The Skirt Steak (flank) was excellent.  You can order it with or without the skin.  They will de-skin it for you.  It is tougher with the skin on.  As is a tradition in much of Latin/South America, chimichurri sauce is served with the meats and Tango Sur's is very good. Their patio makes for great people watching on Southport in the summertime.

you have to be a carnivore.  the blood sausage is out of this world.  i would skip most of the appetizers, save the complimentary house salad to eat when you get the main course, and then eat dessert.  they have exceptionally good espresso there also.   the outdoor patio in the summer is fantastic, but people sit for a long time no matter where they are located in the restaurant.  be prepared to wait up to an hour for a table, but they will call you if you want to get a drink down the street if you give them a number at the host stand, which means you can save your wine for dinner.  the do take reservations for groups larger than 6 or 8, but it is usually for later in the evening, around 830 or 9. there is also an argentine butcher shop in the same building if you want a argentinian cut of meat and try lomo out on your own.

Everyone I know loves Tango Sur so I was very excited to try it with a group of friends last night. I thought it was a great atmosphere and a perfect place to dine with a large group. The food was OK, but I'm not a meat and potatoes type of girl so I'm not sure if I'd go back here again. We started with the epenadas and the cheese appetizer...the cheese was definitely my favorite thing of the night! Then I split a chicken dish with one of my friends, which was good as well. The entrees are definitely big enough to split.  My friends who had the steak absolutely loved it It's BYOB, which made the meal pretty cheap...it came out to $19/person and most of us didn't even split our entrees. If you're a meat lover definitely check out Tango Sur because you'll get some good meat for a very good price.

All the members of my immediate family came to town for my birthday and we waited 2 hours to eat at this place!   I know, it was horrible to make everyone wait and they won't let me live it down.  It was totally worth it though.  Every time I have been here, I've never been disappointed with the food.  The steaks are so huge and it looks so good when someone else gets their food, that you'll unconsciously be salivating.  Let me tell you, the Argentinians know how to do it!  It's BYOB, so don't forget the red wine - it's best with meat of this kind!  Oh, and beware of food coma afterwards.

Argentinean  and BYOB - I found out about this place on the show "Check please!"  It was highly recommened so I had to check it out.    I ordered steak and OMG they give you large portions.  The menu is moderately priced for a steak place. It's small but great atmosphere especially if you can sit outside.    Advice - call ahead and ask how crowded they are.  I don't think they accept reservations but at least you know ahead of time how long the wait will be.

If you go during any normal dinner hour you'll probably be waiting, but stick around because it's well worth the wait! The steaks are fantastic, as well as the bread and provolone. When the weather is nice they'll open up the patio out front, it's very enjoyable. It's hard to go wrong at Tango Sur!

Great meats.  We always go back for the stuffed steak dish that's loaded with oil.  My only complaint is that it's loud as hell along with the crazy wait.  Go in groups of 2 though since you can barely hear what the other people at the table are saying.

What can I say about this Argentinian steakhouse?  Well, the place is very relaxed, where tables are crowded together, and people are damn near shouting and laughing all the time.  It's also BYOB, which is frickin' fantastic. Well, our table was tucked away in a corner, so we had a bit more privacy than other tables nearer the center of the room.  Wineglasses were filled with reds, perfectly complementing the meal.  I had the El Filet, in which reduced onion red wine sauce was poured over tender filets and accompanied by spinach mash potatoes.  The price isn't that bad either. The entire atmosphere is pretty fun and relaxed, so it's a great place for friends to come over for dinners, especially if there's plentiful drinks!

I doesn't get much better than Tango Sur when you factor in affordability, ambiance, service, taste, and value.  Food - excellent.  Service - Very good.  Steaks - the best.  The only downside from getting a perfect score - the wait is NEVER what they tell you and no reservations are taken for less than 6 or 8 people.  Big let down when you are hungry.

Had dinner here on a Sunday evening.  There was a big line, and apparently it is worse on Fri/Sat's.  Luckily, they have this dark room lit with a couple of candles in the back where they'll open your wine (no corkage fee) and you can drink/chat while you wait.  The 30-45 minutes I waited passed quickly.  It was a chilly day, so I requested to be seated inside, although patio seating is available.  The waiter explained the menu to us, and we selected a spinach empanada (Argentinian turnover ), chicken empanada (2$ each), bife de chorizo, and an eggplant dish (one of the few vegetarian dishes available).  Atmosphere is loud, and lit with candelight.  It would be perfect place for a first date, if it weren't so loud (unless you have no interest in talking to her).  My biggest gripe about the place is that I was definately the most Argentian person in that restaurant.  I asked about if they could could make the bife de chorizo "a caballo,"  which means to put two eggs on top of the steak.  The waiter said that they offer the eggs on another entree (some fried fish dish with two eggs), people don't usually order the steak like that.  I'm thinking, "why can't you just take those two eggs and put it on my steak?  I'll pay for the two eggs."  And also having two eggs on your steak is a very, very common occurance in Argentina.  The waiter asked how I would like the steak prepared.  I responded with, "a jugoso", which literally means "juicy" and in Argentina it means more-or-less "medium-rare."  The waiter responded with, "Excuse me?"  I then said, "medium-rare."  My second biggest gripe was that I felt I was being rushed, or that they have no timing in their food preparation.  After we had finished our empanadas, they brought us the house salads.  We were about 1/4-1/2 done with our salads when they brought our entrees.  I commented to the waiter in Spanish, "Isn't it a bit quick for the entrees already?  We havn't finished our salads."  The waitor responded with, "I'm sorry, but the food would then get cold."  Oh well.  Food was okay.  I think the empanadas (particularly the spanish/cheese one tasted great).  Steak was okay (yes, I know that I didn't select the greatest cut, but I know I wasn't going to be impressed with the Canadian beef anyways).  Overall, I would return because of the atmosphere and their BYOB policy.  I'm just biased becaused I just returned from 7 days stay in Buenos Aires.

I was so excited to be going back to Tango Sur as I haven't been there in a few years and I remembered the food being amazing.  I was not disappointed at all.  We had a party of 6 so we were able to call ahead and get a table soon after we arrived.  The eggplant and provolone appetizer are great and the steak has so much flavor and melts in your mouth.  We only a few appetizers and 2 entrees and that was more than enough to feed the entire table.  We all brought a bottle of wine which makes the bill very affordable!  Can't forget the flan they brought for my birthday dessert.  I don't usually like flan, but the caramel sauce is to die for.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone!

Good, but not great steaks at Tango.  Loved the atomosphere, byob feature is nice as well.  Overall solid S. Amer menu, good options and tasty, but didn't think the steaks met the hype.  Still good, but not great.

I'm still recovering from my dinner at Tango Sur last night (and not in a bad way), a traditional yet trendy Argentinian eatery on Wrigley's north side.  This was by far one of the most flavorful, plenteous and distinctive meals that I have had here in Chicago.  The mood is right with dim candlelight on each table, and with no liquor license, BYOB is a nice additive for those looking to lighten up without dishing out mucho dinero.  The warm bread basket could have filled me up alone had I let it, but instinctively, I saved room because from the looks of the tables surrounding us, I had a feeling I was in for a feast.   The provolone and eggplant appetizers were exceptional, followed by a steak and mushroom platter that was so luscious and tasty, I took one bite and I was in heaven!  That is, until the last course was served our way --- flan with dulce de leche topping --- a sweet ending to an already decadent evening!

I love..absolutely love this place. I came here about 3 years ago at the urgence of a friend and have been coming back again and again. Where do I begin? A wonderful ambiance...attentive staff...unpretentious attitiude and a great deal for amazing food. It's BYOB, so there is always pleasant acknowledgment when the check comes.

This is probably the one place where I do order a steak.  And with good reason- the steaks are amazing, and they give you so much that you have another dinner for the next night from your meal.  They have great appetizers too- the bread is delicious and we had this cheese appetizer that was out of this world.  Then the steak came and it was two filets!  So much food and it was delicious!  It's also a BYOB place so you can bring in your favorite bottle of wine- what a great night!

Wow what a great restaurant!  They had the best steaks and I left feeling so full because my filet came with two big pieces of steak on the plate.  It was so good and I was impressed with the appetizers as well.  And it's BYOB which I love, so we got to bring my favorite bottle of wine to enjoy.  The food is delicious and it'd be a great place for a date.

Great place! the food is amazing and its BYOB.  I had a steak and it was so cheap. The empanadas and appetizers were also amazing.  It was a little loud and very crowded, but I still enjoyed it. I would definitely go back.  Although they don't take official reservations, you can call ahead and put your name down.

one of the best date place in Chicago.  the steaks are hearty and very tasty appetizers and desserts.  also cannot beat the BYOB.  the only (minor) problem might be the lighting and space in the restaurant.  the staffs aren't the most professional but def fun and friendly (come on, it's not a 5-star hotel).  I would go back again and again.

Tango is an awesome BYOB spot in the very popular Wrigleyville area. The food is awesome. The steaks are huge and the provoleta is amazing. The waiters are hotties...so it is a great place for a girl's night out as well as a cozy place for a date. Make sure you get the flan or the delish Argentine cake. Right next door there is also a South American grocery store.

This Argentine steakhouse packs 'em in for dinnertime, so go early unless you do not mind waiting for a table. It's BYOB here, and the servers scurry about in their frenetic paces. The warm bread is delicious, and so are the steaks. The "bife vesuvio" is juicy and delicious, or a couple can share the substantial mixed grill combo platter that comes with its own special serving tray. The spinach mashed potatoes just look like green colored mashed potatoes. The desserts are good but not great, but I have high expectations from cake featuring dulce de leche and coconut.

I love this restaurant.. not only can you stuff your face until you're tired but you can also bring your own alcohol!  its perfect since the food can get a little pricey .. at least you save on drinks!  The only downside to this place is that even with a reservation you may be looking at a wait of an hour or more.. not good

Great Argentine restaurant. Intimate setting. Great food. BYOB which is great. Wait staff is very nice some are great to look at! Good steaks! I would recommend this place for a first date. The ambience is fantastic.

Best first date restaurant ever.  There's a long wait usually, but it's worth it.  Plus, they let you give them your cell phone and you can leave to go to the southport bars while you wait...When you finally get a table, I recommend the beef vesuvio or get the entree that is fit for two - its fun to share this.  Its a BYOB place, so the bill is still very reasonable.

Unbelievably great steaks!  To begin with, the bread was soft.  I'm not a big bread person, but pairing their delicious bread with their provolone appetizer made for an excellent starter.  My filet in red onion wine was cooked perfectly rare, the prime steak stuffed with provolone & spinach my friend had was tender and excellent.  We were both extremely happy with our food.  The spinach & garlic mashed potatoes were different, but surprisingly tasty.  A nice patio outside seats about 25, the indoor area accomodates about 25 as well.  BYOB, so bring your favorite bottle of wine, beer or liquor and enjoy the evening.

Great SouthAmerican restraunt.  It's an outdoor experience, only open for dinner.  They have some great food.  The portions are really big and the food is delicious and filling.  It's a BYOB place so bring with you whatever you enjoy to drink!
